Reviews.Title: “Could have been better!”
Reviews.Author: MartinB68
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 5 nights at Trump Las Vegas. Got an excellent rate of $80 through hotwire. My experience was just good. I was asked at chck-in if I wanted to upgrade to a larger suite for $50 a night since it was a slower week. I declined, but they missed an opportunity for a strong 1st impression since there was plenty of space available for free upgrades. The Suite: the bathroom was fantastic, the bedroom was very good, but my television had to be fixed 4 times by a technician!!! The other reviews that mention the loud train noise all day...it's real. The spa facility is excellent and surprisingly empty the three times I paid the $12 extra fee to use the steam/sauna (this is not included in the required $25 resort fee). The location is off the strip behind the Fashion Show Mall. You can walk through the mall or walk on a side street to Las Vegas Blvd. in the daytime. I asked the doorman/bellman if it was safe to walk on the side street at night since the mall (Nordstrom) closes at 9pm. He replied that it was sketchy and that it is best to take a cab or the Trump shuttle. Bummer! If I do hotwire again, I am hopeful that I don't get The Trump since I would not put it in the 5 star category.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty great place -”
Reviews.Author: cindirelly
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice property overall - though I have to say it was missing a few things - like the phone in the living room didn't work and the lamp went on and off depending on whether you jiggled it. If you could get past little things like that, it was a very nice room. I read reports about the train whistle, and I do have to say that there were times I heard it faintly, and a couple times when it sounded like it was actually coming through the floor below me, even though I was on the 57th floor. So... light sleepers might not love this. I was on the "city view" side - a.k.a. ugly view of giant demolition zones and pretty hills in the distance, but I'm not sure being on the other side of the building would mask that train whistle. On the bright side, the bed was a dream to sleep on. I upgraded my room to a one-bedroom suite for just $35 a night more than what I paid for a three-night stay on Hotwire - which seemed like a great deal to me. But I had to ask for bathrobes to be brought up - which are definitely worth asking for. One thing I really didn't like was that it seemed really dark in the suite. One thing I really loved was the gigantic bathroom. Huge. But the "plasma TV" embedded in the mirror barely worked and had a terrible signal quality - another one of those misses in what could have been a truly luxury experience. It is just not that far to the strip, but I don't think I would walk it at night because it's dark, and on one side of the road you actually run out of sidewalk because of construction. The shuttle to Caesars Palace was handy, and cutting through the Fashion Mall during the day saved tons of walking. Even not cutting through the mall though, it really was less than five minutes to the bustle of the strip. My hat is off to the staff of this hotel, who I found to be, without exception, extremely polite and helpful. Whatever Trump Towers was missing, being treated so well by the staff certainly made up for it. They made it a very classy experience. The only people I didn't love by the end were the pool staff - I about died of thirst waiting for a drink - and I would have drank more if they ever came back. Service was incredibly slow even though the pool was practically abandoned. And as far as pools go, it was nothing fancy, but it was a comfortable place to soak up a little sun. I'd stay here again if I got a good deal on it - it's not the nicest place I've ever stayed, but it is awfully nice, though it would be better if the stuff in my room worked better.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T USE HOTWIRE - You'll end up at Trump Vegas”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Bid a 5 star hotel for vegas on Hotwire and you will get TRUMP which has NO CASINO, not sure how a square building with a square pool and only a couple small cheezy places to eat qualify's for 5 star... was my own fault for booking via bid process but of all the hotels in Vegas... This hotel shouldn't even be on the list for when you bid or have an option to click "no" casino... very disapointed and Hotwire was no help as expected... anyway won't use them again!

Reviews.Title: “Overall FABULOUS! We will only stay at Trump in the future!”
Reviews.Author: 1MidwestMama
Reviews.Content: In planning a family trip to Vegas with two kids, I wanted a hotel that was accomodating for children where there wouldn't be gambling, smoking, half naked women, etc., and Trump was perfect for us! We stayed 4 nights during spring break (this month) and we hope to go back this summer. The location is great--a long block off the strip but not too far to walk to everything. Realistically, it is a long walk to go between the major hotels anyway so this was a non-issue. Because it is off the strip, there are no people loitering outside, no panhandlers or people handing out the graphic cards, no foot traffic to contend with when accessing the hotel and not much traffic. We discovered that walking through Fashion Show Mall was a fun shortcut to the strip and the entrance to Nordstrom is directly across from Trump's entrance with a marked pedestrian crossing in the street. There is a free shuttle that goes from Trump to Caesar's, and from Trump to Wynn which is down the long block and across the street - we used the shuttle several times and this was also great. The valet is great and included with the daily resort fee. They did get a little busy but we didn't mind waiting a few minutes for the car. The bell desk will store your luggage if you need to check out before you are ready to leave. You can print your boarding passes in the business center. All these little details make a difference! The hotel itself is very clean and the lobby is simple & beautiful! There isn't anything "extra" like an aquarium, rainforest, or circus; but it is functional. The elevators are just through the lobby so unlike at some hotels where you walk 15 minutes through a casino just to get to the elevator, at Trump, you can be in your room within minutes of walking through the front door. The rooms are set up in pairs with a door from the hallway into a small foyer with two doors leading to two different rooms. This would be great if traveling with another family (we weren't). I think there were people in the adjacent room but I never heard them (it is quiet). There is a doorbell in the hallway, and there are switches/lights for "do not disturb" and "housekeeping" which is so much nicer than the door tags. We had a "city view" room and the view is nice - mountains in the distance, buildings, and we could see the Stratosphere and Circus Circus. I see no need to pay more for the strip view! The room was just like in all the photos I had seen. It is large compared to any standard room and simple yet elegant like the lobby. The king bed was comfy though the sofabed was not quite as comfy. There is a TON of storage space. There are two wardrobe closets and there are upper cabinets big enough to put several large suitcases so they are out of your way, plus other storage. There are tons of kitchen cabinets and there were basic cooking pieces. You can request more dishes if needed and they are replaced daily. There is a 2 burner cooktop, large mini-fridge, microwave, blender, toaster and one cup coffee pot. I wish there had been a freezer but we managed. We bought groceries for breakfast and snacks which saved us money over eating out everyday. The bathroom was enjoyed by the whole family! Who would think it would make a difference but it really did. There is a small tv built into the mirror and my kids loved watching tv while soaking in the very large, deep jetted tub. Other times, they pulled chairs in there (yes there is plenty of room for several arm chairs) just to watch tv. We loved the large walk in shower and separate toilet room. There is lots of storage in the vanity cabinets which was nice too. We did not try the on site restaurant but the pool side drink service was nice. The pool was closed a few days because of high winds which was disappointing but for safety. The pool also has limited hours (8am to 7pm when we were there), but I'm not sure if the hours are the same all year or not. The pool itselt was awesome for our kids with a maximum depth of 4 ft (I think). There were lots of kids in the pool with the adults sunning on the super comfy chairs. There is plenty of seating and some nice extra large reserved chairs next to the pool. There are lifeguards despite the "no lifeguards on duty" sign, and there are at least 2 whirlpool spas. Check in/out was easy and quick and there were no surprise charges. This was one of the few hotels I've ever stayed in where I felt at home and truly comfortable. We did not want to leave and considered staying extra days. We will go back and I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else, even if the kids were not with us!

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: mtbarbster
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 3 nights at The Trump in Las Vegas and it was wonderful. There is no casino in this hotel so it was quiet, peaceful and beautiful. Every staff member was very helpful. The restaurant was very nice with delicious food and pleasing atmosphere. Our room was elegant, spacious and filled with every amenity imaginable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: 85er
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 46th floor in a 1-bedroom corner suite. The room was spacious, clean, and very nicely furnished. The kitchen was very convenient, especially being that we had our 10-month old on the trip with us, and we were able to prepare and store many of her meals. A crib (nice quality) was provided free of charge for the duration of our stay. The suite had two bathrooms (two showers), Three TV's (living room, bedroom, bathroom), 270 degree views of Las Vegas and the strip with floor-to-ceiling windows. As some reviewers have mentioned, the bed was somewhat squeaky-- it was comfortable though, not lumpy at all. Bedding was high quality and very clean. There is a set of train tracks SW of the property. I heard the train on occasion, never while we were trying to sleep. The sound is minimal from the 46th floor. We actually found that the helicopters flying by made more noise (helicopter flight path is immediately west of the hotel). Check-in and check-out were efficient, as was room service and concierge. The pool is wonderfully warm, drink service poolside is awesome! This hotel is no more than five minutes walk from the strip (2 blocks). Those who complained about the distance to the strip must be lazy. We walked over to Wynn multiple times, walked to and from Mirage, Bellagio, Paris, you name it. Perhaps we had no issue because we enjoy wandering and checking out the sights. There is a free shuttle to Caesar's Palace or Wynn every 15-20 minutes. Fashion show mall across the street is worth checking out. We had a few meals there at Chipotle and California Pizza Kitchen- both of which were good, economical choices.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Twink38
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here for 40th birthday celebrations in March 2012 so wanted something special and that's what we got. The rooms are very spacious; the bathrooms are huge and spotlessly clean; they are a bit mean with the free coffee & milk, but overall a great hotel. It has no gambling facilities and for us that was a huge bonus! The noise from the train did wake us up occassionally - even though we were assured that we had a room where we were away from the track - you could still here it at about 5am. We loved everything about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay...and get your car damaged...”
Reviews.Author: Maribeluchis
Reviews.Content: First off, let me start by saying that my reason for the 1 star review is based on the fact that their valet service (valet service is not optional at this hotel) scratched my car - it's more of a gouge, really. We reported it to their security department and have been very patient. It's been almost a month and they have not given us an answer (mind you, we have been the ones who have had to call, call, call to get any sort of "update") as to whether they are going to do anything to fix our car. We finally went through our insurance instead. **Had they not effed up our car, this hotel would have merited a 3.5 to 4 star review** The hotel itself is quite nice (no casino, no smoke). The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The bathroom had a whirlpool tub - very nice indeed. The housekeeping department does a nice job of keeping the rooms clean. They are, in fact, cleaner than a lot of other high-end resorts on the strip. Our biggest complaint was the bed. It was not very comfortable at all. My side was a little lopsided and the hubs found it to be lumpy or something...he couldn't quite find the right way to describe it. All in all, they need new mattresses, stat. Good thing we were always too pooped to really care. The location is pretty good as well. While not on the strip, they are right by the Fashion Show Mall and offer shuttle service to other hotels if you don't feel like walking or driving. Valet parking is included with your stay - but, do so at your own peril...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsbownesy
Reviews.Content: We had a brilliant stay with excellent service throughout. Rooms were unbelievable and so spacious - most comfortable bed ever. We liked the fact that it was off the strip and had no gambling facilities as this made it a very relaxing environment with all you need within a few minutes walk or shuttle service. Will definately choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Accommodations Close to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: jkfjd
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this hotel. This was my second stay here and it will be my go to hotel each time I travel to Vegas. It's a non-gaming, non-smoking hotel just off the strip, right by Fashion Show Mall. It's not too big and there's none of the hassle that comes with staying at a mega strip resort. The rooms are well-appointed and the pool is lovely. The staff is so friendly and willing to go above and beyond to help out guests. Truly a 5 star experience at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sunshine823
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, away from the casinos and perfectly located next to Nordstrom and the Shopping mall. The hotel room was spacious, felt like a self catering mini apartment. The mini fridge was huge and can accomodate lots of food. The bathroom was amazing, shower/jazzuzi, twin sinks very spacious! My only disappointment, there were no bath robes included, you had to resquest these. This hotel at the end of the strip turned out to be my ideal location especially if you want to be away from the hustle and bustle :p

Reviews.Title: “Nice Change from staying on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Tara A
Reviews.Content: Excellent experience at the Trump. This was a nice change from the smokey congested hotels on the strip. Easy Check in, easy to get around, quick walk to the room, nice pool and gym and rooms were CLEAN. Really good customer service. Lots of restaurants at the mall to eat at. The only complaint is that the doors to the rooms are really heavy and make a loud noise when the shut, woke us up in the morning. Overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Should've BELIEVED the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Torsten5293
Reviews.Content: I didn't believe the reviews about the beds ... one said "lumpy" and "squeaky," another said she got a backache as a result. But the complaints are TRUE... me bad for not trusting multiple complaints about an issue like this. I find it perplexing - because this is a great hotel otherwise - why put substandard lumpy and squeaky (put a "very" in front of each!) beds in such a great hotel? I can deal with the train, anything and everything else, but lousy mattresses? C'mon management, you should be embarrassed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service.”
Reviews.Author: melissa116
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Expedia it was part of their hidden hotels where you get a discount. At first I was disappointed to read the reviews that there was no casino and it was off the strip. I needn't have bothered worrying. It is a 30 second walk from the entrance of a huge shopping mall and a 10 min walk from Wynn and Venetian which is on the strip and there is a free shuttle. A cab ride to the centre of the strip is circa 5usd which is very cheap. I welcome the fact there is no casino and no smoking. The hotel lobby smells lovely and you haven't got a loud nightclub and 24hour gaming machines like other hotels. The staff welcome you back and you don't get that personal feel at other hotels as three are thousands of people coming and going. I'm a female sole traveller and feel very safe here at this hotel. The hot tub and television In the mirror is the icing on a perfect cake. There is even a mini kitchen and the bed and sofa are very comfortable. It's more like an apartment it's huge. The staff are polite and customer service is number one. My only gripe would be the resort fee they say it covers wifi and the pool. But a resort fee is just an hidden expense. And they should make the computers in the business lounge complimentary if we have to pay a resort fee. It's a stunning relaxing hotel and I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Trump is great if you dislike smoke and/or abnoxiously loud casinos”
Reviews.Author: ilosto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trump for a girls weekend away. The rooms are wonderful and big with mini-fridges and a GREAT bathroom. When we arrived, there were no bath products in the room which was immediately corrected by presenting us with a whole bag of products from the Trump Spa: lotions, scrubs, shampoo's etc. There is no smoking anywhere in the building and there is no casino. The pool is heated, so comfortable even in the chill of early March. The location is about a block from the strip, across from the Wyatt. It is an easy walk through the Fashion Mall to get to the strip but far enought away to get not be in the madness of it all the time. The only drawback was the valet parking: we had to wait sometimes up to 20 minutes to get our car.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Colortravler
Reviews.Content: I don't know how to put this........ Okay L.O.V.E That is it I am in love. It was one of the most wonderful and attentive hotel stays I have had. It smelled like Heaven, when you walk into the lobby the first thing you notice is how wonderful it smells. And everyone mentioned it. I had made a comment in the elevator going to my room and everyone said the same thing. Nice and quiet but close to strip to have fun. FREE Shuttle to Ceasers for shopping and a mall right acrossthe street. And the Staff... The BEST.. And when you go make sure you get Janet Hill to check you in I have no words to express how she was there for me...invaluable . Okay there is a word. I am not really a Las Vegas person ,but my stay at the Trump..I AM NOW. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and the Comforts of Home”
Reviews.Author: ktann50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Trump in late February, 2012. Got a great deal from Hotwire, $128.00/night for a Friday thru Sunday stay. Check in was easy and fast and the room was fantastic, 53rd floor facing away from the Strip. At first I was disappointed that we didn't go for the upgrade that was offered. But I actually preferred to turn away from all the glam at the end of the day and just enjoy the desert view, especially at night, where the city lights end and the darkness begins. We could cook our breakfast in our room and enjoy it in our bathrobes. With the iPod dock we could listen to our music. After a long day exploring we could enjoy snacks and drinks and the view before dinner. The kitchenette had almost everything we needed to cook. We had to call housekkeping for a skillet and a dish towel. We discovered that if you don't want to hassle with the free valet parking you can park across the street in the Fashion Show Mall parking structure. (We did not leave the car over night there.)The only negative was the pool closed at 6:00pm. I complained about this and they removed the resort fee from our bill. Will definitely stay again if I can get the same rate. It is way better than an Embassy Suite style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Eaglesfan333
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific hotel! Staff is very helpful and courteous. Service is prompt and efficient, rooms are very clean and comfortable. Huge bathrooms with a tv in the mirror! It is a little off the strip but if you dont mind to walk that distance from the noise and bustle is nice. Not even a hint of cigarette smoke anywhere. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Model_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I booked the Trump Hotel by chance via Expedia Secret Hotels for a very good price for 3 nights. I travelled to the hotel with my family as part of a touring holiday. On arrival at the hotel our car was parked by the valet (Valet parking is compulsory and included in the resort fee). On checking in I paid a reasonable amount for an upgrade to a 1 bedroom suite with a view of the strip. There was no queing at the elevators, unlike many other Las Vegas Hotels. The room itself was fantastic. It was very large (3 showers/2 toilets/Jacuzzi Hot tub/kitchen with Microwave/dishwasher/cooker and large Fridge Freezer with Ice). The bathrooms were all marble with tasteful fittings. The room itself was one of the best I have stayed in. The main bed was extremely comfortable, the only negative was the sofa bed, it was so uncomfortable the kids didn't want to sleep in it. That said I would still highly recommend the hotel and the room. We ate dinner in the lounge bar and the restaurant. I would highly recommend the restaurant. They did a fixed priced 3 course menu for $29.95 which was superb. The ambience of the restaurant made it feel very exclusive too! As for the train noise - we did hear this on a few occasions, however it wasn't that bad, it wouldn't put me off booking again. I used the swimming pool a few times. It was really good. The sunbeds are charged at $50 which I think is too much. The jacuzzi spa was very good. The location is good - you can either walk through the fashion mall or walk around, either way you can be on the strip in 15 minutes. We had a great stay, the only thing that sadly let things down a bit was the valet returning our car, it took at least 20 minutes, whilst my family were stood with cases on the pavement in the cold wind. Positives:- Really large and luxurious suite Sophisticated hotel Friendly/Professional and helpful staff No Smoking Hotel - All areas smelt fresh - There were fresh lilies in the Lobby No queing to check in Restaurant was a really positive experience and was reasonably priced Main Bed was extremely comfortable Negatives:- The sofa bed was quite uncomfortable - you could feel the springs in your back! No changing area for the swimming pool Sunbeds at the swimming pool cost $50 each - I felt this could have been included in the resort fee. Valet took over 20 minutes to bring my car - We were stood on the pavement for 20 minutes waiting with all our luggage, whilst others appeared to be prioritized over us.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: ace8726872
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty good but not exactly 5 stars. Good: New building with clean and upscale furnishings Great roomy bathroom with whirlpool tub and two separate showers No casino so no crowds and no cigarette smell Full kitchen Bad: Not so great location No self parking (valet only) Lumpy bed and squeaky bed Train noise every night even on the 34th floor Sofa bed is very uncomfortable This place was fancy and all but I was not too thrilled about the train noise several times a night or the lumpy and squeaky bed at all. For families, it would be nice to have the option of two queens beds. Don't think I will be staying at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A great place!!”
Reviews.Author: Marya888
Reviews.Content: I was a little reluctant to stay here because of no casino but didn't miss it at all. I stayed in the studio with city view and was pleasantly surprised. It's All first class. very spacious , with sofa and 2 chairs, flat screen tv's (in main room and bathroom), and a kitchen,plus complimentary daily bottled water The large bathroom had a 7 ft jacuzzi tub, and double shower. Everything is within walking distance. The only negative was their single cup coffee pot (pods) and horrible coffee, but luckily starbucks was around the corner 5 minute walk. This hotel is located directly across the street from Nordstrom of the Fashion Mall. I did not have a pet, but saw others so must be a pet friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favourites”
Reviews.Author: Colleen C
Reviews.Content: This is one of our favourites because - easy and prompt check-in and no waiting for elevators (issue with other large properties) - non-smoking, non-casino so no wafting of smoke and noise issues issues, quiet, very clean (checked on bed bug site and not one issue here - some other larger properties did have issues lately) - one of the best pools with great pool staff and service for towels food drinks etc (reasonably priced - had huge salad for $ 14) (although you have to pay $50 to rent "pool beds" on the weekends) but plenty of loungers, also one of better gyms with both cardio and weights - beautiful rooms - we upgraded to suite for extra $30 per day, free Internet included with resort fee - nicer part of strip (no smut peddlers flicking cards at you every nanosecond) close to good variety of restaurants, right across from Nordstrom's door and fashion show mall, free shuttle every 15 minutes or so to either the Wynn or Caesar's Palace,

Reviews.Title: “Keep every thing lock up”
Reviews.Author: beltopoo
Reviews.Content: Two rings very stolen from my room while I was out of the room on my last day. Because i dont live in the USA I was making telephone calls every week from thecaribbean. After back and fort telephone calls after a month Security came up with nothing. Front office staff is not customer ready. Need training on how to speak to guest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: deruo
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through Hotwire so we didn't really know for sure that it was the Trump until it was paid for. Like most hotels, it has pros and cons, many of which have been mentioned here in other reviews. Cons: It is NOT on the strip, but about a 7 minute walk from Las Vegas Boulevard or about the same through the Fashion Show Mall, when it's open. Yes, there is a shuttle to the Wynn or Caesars, but I never had any luck catching it on the way back to the hotel. The resort fee. Its supposed to include wifi, but I never got any connection worth using in my suite on the 28th floor. It works very fast if you go down to the lobby to use. Otherwise, sending smoke signals could have been faster. I mentioned this to the concierge, and she tried blaming it on the gold in the color of the building. I told her that if it doesn't work, they shouldn't be charging for it.  Train noise in the very early mornings even though we were on the 28th floor facing the strip. Woke me up every time it went by blowing its whistle. It took 3 requests to get the fan in the bathroom working. 1 through housekeeping, 1 through front desk and finally, through the concierge, who I assume, got it fixed. It's not really the hotels fault, but the pool was closed several times due to high winds. It was blowing patio furniture into the pool. Again, this is due in part to the hotels location. Pros: Non-smoking and no casino to walk through to get to your room.  Suite was well equipped with kitchenette, microwave, utensils, toaster, blender, etc. Lots of storage. Summary: A nice hotel but with the "resort" fee and the distance from Las Vegas Boulevard, I think there are many other nicer places to stay. For what it's worth, there were a LOT of kids staying here, I'm not sure if it's because of the pull out couch giving you extra room or the kitchenette allowing you to cook some meals in the suite to save money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CJPNorfolkEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights and could not fault it. Had originally been booked into a City view studio, but on checking in were offered an upgrade to one bedroom corner suite for $50 per night which we opted to take. The suite was fantastic and well worth the price. The staff were very helpfull and with it being no smoking and very well positioned opposite an entrance to Fashion Show Mall the place was spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service and Beautiful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: PWhite79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Trump Hotel Las Vegas as I was there for business. Check in was absolutely stress and hassle free. Lonnie was very polite and helpful when it came to checking in. Once I got to my room I was amazed by how beautiful and clean the rooms are. My one and only complaint was once I was in my room it was very windy that day and the whistling sound of the wind was coming through the window. It was unbearable. I had called front desk to see if there was anything they can do about it. About 5 minutes later one of the Housekeeping Inspectors named Edward was there to assist me and did not stop until my issue was resolved. He called maintenance to take a look at the window and checked in every 15 min to see if my issue was resolved. After the 2nd time he took control of the situation and had them move me to a different room. Same floor and couple rooms down and the best part of it was he was able to get me a strip view for the inconvenience. This was the best customer service I have seen in all my years staying at hotels. The housekeepers were also very polite. I would come back from my meetings to a clean and spotless room where I was able to relax from a long day of business. I recommend this hotel to everyone who is looking for luxury and excellence in customer satisfaction. Way to train your employees Trump!!!

Reviews.Title: “Warning: TRAIN NOISE”
Reviews.Author: product-of-canada
Reviews.Content: The Trump lived up to the reputation of TA reviews. This is an inexpensive 5-star hotel, which makes it a great choice. We stayed here for one full week. Here are some perks of this hotel: -Ample storage space (cupboards; drawers) for all your belongings. -Large suites, and roomy bathroom with two sinks Jacuzzi. -Kitchenette, including bar fridge and coffee maker, came in handy – particularly for breakfasts. -Great exercise room with a good variety of exercise options. There are both weight machines and free weights, and a variety of cardio machines. And the water coolers with fresh orange slices in the water was a nice touch. -We never did make it to the pool, but the outdoor pool is heated which is a nice perk for winter trips. -Free shuttle rides to Caesars came in handy. Some pitfalls of this hotel: -Train noise. Unfortunately this was a major pitfall. I had read about this in the reviews, and even requested a room sheltered from the noise at check-in, but we could still hear it in the middle of the night. So do bring earplugs. We got a room change because of this, and we could still hear it. We could hear the train on the north side; we could hear the train on the south side. I believe some reviews said try to get the east side, which makes sense as this is the furthest away from the train tracks. I did ask for the east side but did not get it. The train noise issue is unfortunately a major pitfall, and would deter me from booking with this hotel again. -Slamming door noise. This hotel seems to have door issues. Each door in the hallway is an entrance to two different suites. So when you open the door, you see two more doors – one is your suite and the other is someone else’s suite. If you’re lucky, no one is staying in the suite next to you. One evening when we went to bed early all I could hear was our neighbour’s doors slamming shut in sets of two – once into the main entrance, and then once again into their suite. And it was loud enough that I thought someone was coming into our room. Also, the glass doors in the washroom (one for the toilet, and one for the shower) naturally slam shut if you don’t ease it when closing – it creates quite the “clang.” I could even hear it in the suite above us. I guess Trump didn’t get the best door engineers/designers. For those of you wondering what services come with the resort fee, here’s the list: -High speed internet -Courtesy shuttle to and from Caesars and Wynn -$25 credit to the SPA at the Trump (conditions apply) -Access to the fitness center -In-room coffee replenished daily -Bottled water replenished daily -Daily newspaper -Shoe shine service -Printing of incoming faxes and boarding passes -Unlimited local and toll free calls

Reviews.Title: “Calm, beautiful but something went bump in the night!”
Reviews.Author: AngelBears
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the end of March in Trump Las Vegas at the back of the hotel (facing away from strip) in a suit on the 34th floor. The rooms were really very nice, well laid out, well sized and the beds were super comfy. The hotel is a bit off strip, a courtesy shuttle is provided to drop you to the Wynn or Ceaser's Palace and are quite regular and run until 2am. We loved the hotel, thought it was a good bargain but we were rudely awoken every morning (4am) by the horn of a passing freight train. Sometimes it sounded off twice and throughout the day also. This would definitely cause me to reconsider future locations if we were to travel back to Vegas again... Other than that, we were happy with all other aspects of the visit, the no smoking, no casino and off strip location makes for a good respite from Vegas madness.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdvisorOntario
Reviews.Content: Each time we come to Vegas we check out a different hotel. Mostly we look for value and sometimes we find a 4 or 5 star hotel at exceptional value. This was the case for Trump. Smoke free was the plus and the staff, right from Lonnie at check in to Darren at the bar in the lobby were all great to deal with and talk to. That is a sign of a good property when the staff are well trained and treat the guests nicely. And that can be a challenge based on some guests I have seen on this trip. The rooms were fresh and clean with huge showers, private enclosed toilettes and large jacuzzi tubs and thick towels with lovely soap and shampoo and conditioner. Flat screen TV's, fridge, stove, sink ..... really, a fully functional kitchen. Comfortable beds and crisp fresh linens. Certainly a hotel we would come back to even if it is a bit off the strip. What is really great is that it is right across the street from Fashion Show Mall so for those folks that like to shop till they drop it is a winner for sure. A car would be an extra I would recommend, even if you are here just for gambling since Trump does not have a casino. It is just a hotel in the true sense of the word and that just works great for us!!!

Reviews.Title: “THis is a real hotel”
Reviews.Author: bhasi g
Reviews.Content: This is a real hotel with marble bathroom, half a mile from the main strip. Enjoy the strip and come back to sleep here. I have stayed in Caesar's palace and Flamingo but nothing can beat Trump International. Go for it folks. Oh! make sure you get a room which isn't bothered by the rail track.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Elvis4vr
Reviews.Content: Room was great, bed not as comfy as expected for a Trump facility. Staff extremely cordial at all times. Prices very reasonable, although did not eat there. The gift shop clothing prices were Trump-sized. Not sure if all rooms have a mini-stove top in them and Cuisinart. Also had large sink with garbage disposal, fridge and microwave. No casino in the hotel, but I'm not a gambler so it didn't matter to me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...But Expected More Because Of Trump Brand”
Reviews.Author: Papanots
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 4 day stay at Trump, Las Vegas. We had a corner suite which was very good. The shower in the master bathroom had had little hot water and the TV mirror was not working. Both were fixed promptly by the staff. In fact, the entire staff was very accomodating and friendly. Top-notch service from everyone. 5 minute walk and you're at the Wynn hotel. Shuttle buses were available but we never used it because we had a car and took a cab when we knew our outings were going to be alcohol fueled...:-)The room itself was great and we had a fantastic view of the strip. Absolutely surreal at night! Now for the bad. First of all train tracks are next to the hotel and the freight train passes 3-5 times at all hours of the day and night. The train has to blow the horn because it crosses a street intersection next to the hotel....and man is it loud! Mid-morning, late afternnon and anywhere between 3am & 6am. I had to wear earplugs at night but I still heard it and felt the rumbling....and we were on the 58th floor!! As for the pool, nothing worth mentioning. While at the pool, great view of the Encore and Wynn hotels (idea for a future trip). Also, when it gets windy, not a good place to be because unlike casino hotels, you are not surrounded by buildings. It's pretty wide open. We wanted to smnoke cigars and a plaza is available for this. But the plaza is absolutely uninspiring. Found many tiles on the top of the retaining wall have come loose of which I advised the front desk. The overall feel of the outside ammenities is that of a strictly corporate hotel. As for the bar and restaurant, I would not be fair to rate it as I did not use either. Not because they are no good. Simply put...they were uninviting. Very drab, dull and quiet. The good - Great staff, clean, modern and spacious room. Great view of the strip, comfortabloe beds. The bad - Train crossing, pool, bar, restaurant and plaza quite a bit on the dull side. Plaza needs some TLC. This is a good place if you don't want to snake through a casino floor to get to your room. But for any type of entertainement and inviting appeal, go to the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: wolfden
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas several times and this was by far the best stay we have ever had. The service level was incredible. No line ups at the desk or the elevators. No smoking ANYWHERE at the Trump. Even people that were with us that smoked loved it. The location was perfect for us. 10 minutes walk to the Wynn casino or 2 minutes to cross the street to the fashion mall. We didn't eat at the Trump but did eat at 5 different places in the mall. All were fantastic! The room was very quiet and clean. They could use a few essentials in the room (a bottle opener and more than 1 fork) and we did find the bed starting to show some age but the quiet and service more than made up for the few short comings. Like always with a high end hotel, if you don't like something you just have to mention it and they will do everything within reason to make it right. I will stay here again for sure (for a good rate of course).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: samisamisami
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, new, had everything u can ask for. Thebroom had a hot tub. The pool was very nice. Service and staff was greate. No smoking. Lobby was clean and excellent. Been to Vegas many times and never been so impressed with a hotel service and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Needs maintenance”
Reviews.Author: WTGOPS
Reviews.Content: Lobby, bar area, and entrance were all very clean and well maintained. The room I had was tired which seemed strange for one of the newer hotels. Air conditioner would not cool sufficiently. I did receive a great price and at checkout they refunded one night of the resort fee. Be aware that a train passes by twice nightly and is VERY loud. I was on an upper floor and it sounded as though it was right beside me. My room did not face strip but an associate who was on the strip side said hedid not hear the train.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: travelingcouple
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights after we started two nights at Aria. The lobby is beautiful with a great bar. We had raspberry lemon drops. One of the best drinks we have ever had. The room was 1,000 sq feet and spacious. The bed was extremely comfortable. Also, the staff was probably the most friendly staff we have ever experienced. Rachel, Morgan and Manager Krista were some of the friendliest staff we have ever encountered. It is about a 7 minute walk to the Wynn and 2 minutes to a great mall with high end shops. It was actually nice not having a casino downstairs. I thought I would miss it but not at all! Thanks for a great stay Trump!

Reviews.Title: “We Didn't Want to Leave !”
Reviews.Author: haztaz69
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visit Las Vegas frequently. This was our 39th trip to Las Vegas so we've stayed at many of the 3, 4, and 5 star hotel/casinos. We'd never stayed at the Trump International because it didn't have a casino. After reading all the good reviews we gave it a try. Checkin was fast and efficient. We upgraded to a large corner suite on the 47th floor (4707). The room was beautiful. It had an awesome view of the entire strip, which was really beautiful at night. Since the room was so nice we spent more time in the room then usual. We tried the restaurant for breakfast one morning and it was OK. The next morning we tried the buffet at the Wynn, which was excellent. The hotel is directly across the street from the mall, which was very convenient. We also walked down to the Wynn and Encore to gamble and drink. Overall we had a great time. One morning we enjoyed the heated pool and hot tub, which was nice. It was acturally refreshing to enjoy the hotel without all the smoke that most casinos have. It was a very relaxing experience. We'll gladly stay at the Trump International again.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite !”
Reviews.Author: Sanfranco
Reviews.Content: Stayed there twice, and would go back every year. No casino. Shuttles to The Wynn and Caesars. Shopping center on the other side of the street with a nice food court. Corner room ... huge. We loved the pool area. Resort fee. Service excellent. I have been to 2 other 5* in LV, and this is the one I prefer by far. I strongly recommend !!!

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute amazing Experience, with stunning views and great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: nathanastbury
Reviews.Content: Myself and My brother stayed here for 5 nights. When we arrived at the hotel, the car was parked by valet, and we were checked in quickly. Our room was overlooking the vegas strip (payed little bit extra) and i have to say it is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The room had a fridge, microwave, and an oven and had an ipod docking station. The staff at the hotel were amazing.Pool area was very nice, with plenty of chairs and good bar service. I don't actually have anything negative i can say about this place, and would definately reccommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Trump Hotel Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Barbara3458
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trump this past weekend. First time in 10 years I did not stay in a casino hotel and no regrets. Best sleep I have ever had in Las Vegas - couldn't hear people talking next door no doors slamming in the hall. The bathroom was plush - giant jacuzzi tub, tv in the mirror, separate toilet area, and giant walk in shower. Bedroom was a comfortable king bed with crisp linens, sitting area and a kitchen area that included a sink, stove, microwave and small refrigerator. Free bottled water was included. The Trump Hotel has one restaurant but there is a free round trip shuttle to either The Wynn or Caesars where you can find all the dining you would ever want. Definitely recommend this hotel and will stay again my next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Breath of Fresh Air”
Reviews.Author: MizzSpider
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay at the Trump becuase it is a non-smoking, non-gaming hotel. The hotel is sits slightly back from the Strip, and opposite the shopping mall. Unlike most hotels on and around the strip, there is no free self-parking. It's valet only, however, this is complimentary for guests and is included in the daily resort fee. Nice, but the valet kept changing the seat/wheel settings on my husband's car everytime they parked it. All rooms have kitchen-type amenities, and we had a basic strip view room which came with a small fridge, micro-wave, and 2-burner stove, and one-cup coffee-maker which came in very handy during our stay. The only issue we had with the room was the outside noise. Planes taking off from McCarren airport make their turn at this area of the strip, so if you're on the upper floors (we were on 54#, you'll really hear them as they make their ascent. It's also near a train line, and every night, the whistle woke us up. We didn't use the pool, but it was open for use (some hotels close there's in the winter). We dined at the in-house restaurant DJT's one night, and it was an excellent choice. The restaurant is beautiful, the food spectacular, and the service, excellent. All in all, we enjoyed out stay and would recommend it, but becuase of the noise and valet-only situation, would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No Casino, No Worries!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel2012
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a friends weekend in Vegas. We stayed at the Trump for the first time and were pleasantly surprised by the overall quality of the property, as well as the friendliness and efficiency of the staff. It's not on the Strip, but it wasn't a problem for us. The casinos, restaurants, shopping that we went to were all within an easy walk or taxi ride. The hotel is across the street from the Fashion Show Mall. Perfect location for hardcore shoppers. The rooms are large and well appointed. The beds are comfortable, too. Only one of us used the kitchenette and she said it was worth having! The workout room is a reasonable size and has most of the equipment you'd need. Overall a great experience. We usually stay at the Aria. It's nice to know that this hotel is a viable alternative if you're looking for a nice property close to the Strip without the casino noise and distractions.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: Tokalosh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with my wife and son. The appeal of a hotel in Vegas without a Casino attracted us to this property as well as a previous excellent experience at Trump Hotel in Chicago. This hotel is great if you are turned off by the crowded hotels in Vegas. It is quiet, in a good location with a short walk to all the attractions. Room and especially bathroom are very spacious. Bed is comfortable with great linens. So whats not to like?? Despite the luxury feel to this place, it somehow lacks the class of other Trump hotels I have stayed at. It feels like the place has been thrown together without much attention to taste and more attention to the glitz of Vegas. More importantly however, when I moved the living room table to prepare the pullout sleeper for our son, I found old food on the carpet under the table. NOT A GOOD FINDING! It gets you wondering how well the rest of the place has been cleaned. This really made us uncomfortable. I would not return. Cleanliness is one of the most important issues for me when staying away from home. Staff are friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great none gaming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JOHRUK
Reviews.Content: Stay at the trump for a wedding and overall a great hotel for the price. Easy walk to the strip and the fashion show mall across the road! Had a room on the 55 th floor with an amazing view right down the strip! (looks better at night!) rooms a great size and ideal for what we wanted and to get away from the ringing of game machines! Would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenGraham
Reviews.Content: The Trump is so much cheaper than other 5 stars in Vegas, we can only assume because it doesn't have a Casino and is off strip. However, the lack of casino is no issue, if anything it meant the hotel was nicer. And you could virtually fall out of the hotel onto the strip, it is a maximum of 5 minutes walk to Treasure Island which is slap bang in the centre of the strip so don't let this put you off. The hotel is smashing, the rooms are lovely and the pool is great. There is a mall directly across the road with one of the cheap ticket booths and a burger bar that sells amazing peanut butter chocolate milkshakes! There's also an off licence in the mall to fill the room fridge with wine to drink in the hot tub!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Oasis”
Reviews.Author: HelloSanDiego
Reviews.Content: In the midst of planning our second guy trip to Las Vegas we booked the Trump International for 8 one bedroom suites. The rooms where super nice, spacious and well appointed with two bathrooms. The master bath had a jacuzzi tub and the mirror had a television so we could watch the games (NCAA). The service was exceptional and the late night room service was delicious, don't miss the club sandwich and waffle fries. The pool was nice! Lastly, the hotel provided a shuttle to the strip which made it convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhh no smokey Casino”
Reviews.Author: gidget_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 6 nights in this lovely property. The south strip view suite was an upgrade offered by KELLY once she found out it was my husbands 50th birthday gift. From the 45th floor we could even see the Bellagio fountains. The room was will kitted out with a kitchenette and plenty of closet room and drawers. The bed was awesome as were the linens/towels and Trump Spa toilettries. Bottled water and wi-fi were provided as part of the resort fee. Coffee, tea, milks and sugar was provided daily. The complimentary shuttle to Caesars was handy in the evening as it was windy and cold during our stay.Yes we did here the noisy train and I doubt there would be a room that wouldnt. I chose this property to avoid the party atmoshere and smokey casino and it was perfect. We did take advantage of casinos in other properties however. We did not use the pool area but noted it had a great position and atmosphere. The staff were all happy, friendly and helpful. There werent any unexpected surprises in the final bill at check out.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Room at a 3 Star Price. Amazing”
Reviews.Author: TravelRobertG
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled with another couple for a seminar. I pricelined 5 stars and bid around $120 and was surprised when I got the Trump International. I was a little concerned at first. I have been to Vegas once before in 2005 and never heard of the Trump. I read the Tripadvisor reviews and learned that the hotel is not directly on the strip and has no casino. I was impressed with the reviews an excited to see what the Donald had to offer. On to the review. ROOM- In a word- amazing. Taking a cue from the Trip Advisor comments we asked for an upgrade for a strip facing room. The cost was laughably low to get in a suite. The room we are is both expansive and luxurious. The bathroom is huge with a two person jacuzzi tub. Everything is top notch from the sub zero fridge in our full kitchen to the wonderful mattress. My wife has exacting standards for a mattress and is usually disappointed. She is in love with this bed. Food- Some of the best I've ever had, and easily the most reasonbly priced room service. You spend the same amount for dinner on the Strip, or have it brought to your room. Service- First class. I was impressed with the prompt attention and hospitality of the staff. My wife and I have stayed at 4 star resorts around this country and the Trump staff and crew ranks up there with the best. Train Noise- I heard the train twice in 4 days and I was listening for it. The tripadvisor reviews recommend a higher floor to minimize the noise. My wife and I never heard the train over our Ipad sound machine app. No Casino- No casino means no smoke filled lobby full of the droning rattle and chimes of slot machines. It makes the Trump feel like an oasis after the crowds, noise, and smoke on the Strip. The Wynn is a short walk away, or you can take the free shuttle to Wynn or Caesars. Not being "on the strip"- My wife and I love to walk. Staying at the trump adds less than 1/2 a mile to your destination. The walk is great, not a lot of traffic. You can go through the mall if it's hot, or head straight to the Wynn. This short distance is worth it, as it keeps the Strip mob of people away from the hotel. Cons- Ok. A good review has to have something critical. Here goes. The wifi is really slow on the higher floors, and often would not work at all in our room. The TV had problems with the images, but most channels worked fine. The gym equipment is second rate. There is a resort fee of $20. The resort fee have become the norm in the last decade. I still feel like it's an underhanded way of generating revenue. If these fees aren't optional, just include them in the price. Value- We paid around $165 a night total (priceline plus upgrade plus resort fee). I've never paid so little for so much luxury, space, comfort, and service. Overall- This is one of the nicest hotels I've stayed (Ritz-Dallas being the other). If you aren't a slot addict or smoker, this is the place for you. My wife and I have already decided that as long we are staying only at the Trump when we go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sherryanderic
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, spacious and gorgeous. Awesome bathroom. I looked forward to relaxing in the wonderful tub after a long day on the strip. Loved the fact that was no casino. The distance from the strip was minimal. We walked it four or five time a day. They do have a shuttle service to the Wynn. Stripburger on the corner had delicious hamburgers.

Reviews.Title: “nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: mnjjjmom
Reviews.Content: we booked this as a mystery suite.. I was pleasantly surprised when i found out which hotel we got..The service was top notch..The bed was perhaps one of the most comfortable hotel beds i have ever slept in. we enjoyed the non smoking policy especially. There were a couple of other nice perks that were not to be had in other 5 star vegas hotels, namely coffee, and a couple of complimentary water bottles daily. The free shuttle was an added bonus also.. i just wish that the weather would have been nicer so we could have checked out the pool. The suite was equipped with a coffeepot, toaster, fridge, and a stovetop and microwave.. . The bathroom was clean and great.. the location was pretty good..We would come back again.. The train noise that others were talking about was no big deal (at least to us).. i heard it a couple of times a day, but then again i was listening for it.. and the helicopters were not an issue either.. i saw a few but it was not constant, like in a few other hotels we have stayed at... Not enough of an issue to keep us from coming back.. all in all, a very pleasant stay.. recommended if you like a quiet non smoking oasis from the hustle of the strip...

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love this Hotel!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LivinLovin121
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely AMAZING hotel. Not like anything else you will find in las vegas. The rooms are beautifully designed and CLEAN, the food is de-lish, the pool is so relaxing.. there is nothing bad I can say about this place. The suite we were in was beautiful (we got a free view upgrade from the girl who made our reservation!!) It was so clean and luxurious. The staff was spectacular! I was celebrating my 10 year wedding anniversary and the staff made us feel so special. Everyone from the girl in their reservations who made sure my picky requests were met and answered a dozen calls from me (thanks a bunch Meghan!) to the lovely man that checked us in (oh i wish i could remember his name!), the bartender, the valet, the bellman, EVERYONE was AWESOME!!! Will 100% be coming back here on our next trip to Vegas. Love Love Love!!! Good job Donald!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay as Great as the first....”
Reviews.Author: Milz99
Reviews.Content: Ended up staying at the Trump again approximately two months after our first stay there July 2011. We had an excellent time, and things actually improved from our first stay! We got upgraded to a strip view on the 51st floor which had an amazing view. There was some train noise during the day, but not enough to complain about (see my previous review-ask to stay on the Wynn side for minimal noise). The pool area was great again and all the servers are friendly, and well dressed if you know what I mean........ :) The fitness Centre has everything u need for a vacation quick workout and there were only two or three other people in there every time I went throghout our 4 night stay. As stated here, the distance to the strip is not a big deal unless you are lazy or have some sort of illness and are unable to walk. It was 100 degrees every day we were in Vegas and the walk takes 10 minutes to the Wynn-no problem. Or, you can cross the street and go through the Fashion Show mall and come out through Treasure Island. My only complaint about Trump-it would be nice if the restaraunt/bar was open later. It would be nice to come back late at night and sit down for a night cap before going to bed. Nice, clean, quiet, resort off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been great, but very poor attention to service”
Reviews.Author: kirby214
Reviews.Content: My initial impression of the Trump was amazing. The valet and bellman staff were excellent. I was greeted by the front desk staff and escorted to a desk immediately upon entering the hotel. I barely said more then my name and the man at the front desk seemed to be instantly knowledgeable about my many room requests and assured me they had been taken care of without me even asking yet. The hotel and the room looked very clean and well kept. These are the reasons my rating is 2 stars instead of 1. The reason I had so many room requests at booking my stay is because myself and my two children are extremely allergic to feathers. My kids get asthma, I however get pneumonia if I breathe them in. I explained this at booking and was assured my room would be clean and removed of any feather products before I got there. This is key, because I can go into a room that has had feathers but I cannot go in one that currently has feathers. Anyone that has squished a feather pillow or comforter knows why, they send hundreds of minute feather pieces into the air. Anyways we get to our room and my husband checks for feathers. He finds a feather comforter and two pillows in the cabinets. He finds one feather pillow on the bed. We call and housekeeping comes up to switch that all out. What we missed and what housekeeping definitely should not have missed now twice is a feather comforter tucked between sheets on the bed. I slept in that bed and was extremely sick in the morning. My husband called the front desk and they were not very accommodating. They gave us the choice of cleaning the room and removing the feathers or putting all of our things in storage and giving us a new room once they dealt with the line of people waiting in the lobby for a room. I was shocked. We didn't have the option of waiting because we had to go to a wedding. In the amount of time they sent that cleaning crew in to clean our room they could have cleaned another one and moved us into it, but they didn't and wouldn't. They didn't offer us any compensation for that one night where they did everything wrong for us. Very disappointing for a hotel that advertises on its high service. If they had cleaned our room right and removed the feathers as promised several times and did not assure us that they were removed and let me enter that room with them in it, I would have given this hotel 5 stars. By the way, upon packing 4 days later we found someones broken belt and some new shirt packaging in the back of a shelf in the clothes cabinet. This is how well they clean this hotel. Since they didn't try to do a thing to make this right for us, I can't see us every staying at a Trump again.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PNieves72
Reviews.Content: The staff are very helpful and each staff member take pride in what they do. Food, drinks, cocktail, and services in every way was phenomenal. I recommend the stay 110%.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit, raised my expectations and they did not disappoint me...”
Reviews.Author: ZeldaGatsby
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to Trump International as I stayed here in 2011 and was very impressed, so my expectations were somewhat increased. I arrived early about 11AM and expected to have to wait for my room. I was greeted at the lobby desk by Camille who was nice enough to upgrade me to a strip view room and also offered me to upgrade to a corner suite for $50. But being solo, and knowing how huge the standard room was, I politley declined. Check-in was swift and the bellman brought up my bag within minutes and Andy offered to get me ice for the bucket. He was very helpfull and engaging. My room was beyond my expectations as the strip view had a great nightime view of the Bellagio fouintians and fireworks from the Treasure Island show. I also enjoyed the shuttle system to the Wynn and Ceasers Palace.One of the drivers stood out.... Louie. I was surprised that Louie actually remembered me from over 10 Months ago! He also went above and beyond the call of duty. I have a slight limp / handicap and Louie was nice enough to drop me close to Margaritaville which I wanted to go for lunch. The last surprise was upon checkout.... I had an early 8am flight and asked the front desk to call me a cab. They were nice enough to offer me the Trump black Escalade to drive me to the airport...door to door, WOW,.. What service! Once again its the people who make the experience and the bricks, glass, and pretty flowers are just window dressing. Bravo Trump employees, Bravo. Bill D / Connecticut

Reviews.Title: “Trump Towers excellent in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: tt03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Trump Towers for 4 nights and were very impressed. The hotel is not right on the strip but is right across the street from Nordstroms at the fashion show mall. If the mall is open you can go through the mall to get to the strip or just walk the 5-10 minutes to the strip. There is no casino but we found this to be a great advantage because you do not get the herds of people wandering through the hotel to use the casino, drunken yahoos and cigarette smoke - there are no "attractions" which again is great because after walking the strip all day this is a real haven of calm and class.the Lobby is beautiful and well maintained - they were shampooing the carpets and took the chandeliers down in the middle of the night to clean them. The staff were super friendly and helpful, the room is gorgeous with a huge jacuzzi tub built for two. The room also had a kitchenette which was a great way to save a few dollars by storing sandwiches etc. in the fridge or keeping or warming up left overs from restaurants.The pool was great, really enjoyed the ambience, not crowded, yummy drinks and good mixture of tunes from several eras, lots of lounge chairs available. the hotel gives you a late check out until 4 free of charge which is unusual in and of itself but unfortunately I contracted food poisoning on our last day and the hotel was kind enough to extend our late checkout until 7! no charge! this was a god send as I was vomiting right up until leaving the hotel to get our shuttle to the airport.Because of the late checkout I could rest right until having to leave for our flight. Overall, I am super impressed with the Trump Tower and would stay there again and recommend it to my friends especially since we booked for about 100 a night taxes in.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Travellingfamily12
Reviews.Content: The hotel reservation manager had a whole list of reasons why their "best rate commitment" did not apply, so we spent much more each night than other guests. Made us feel sick. Our attempts to address this concern were futile. Not good to book in advance. Go last minute with Hotwire. We will not return. Why? So many other better, more reasonable hotels to choose from. If you want a real 5 star--try Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: samix760
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, nice rooms and surprisingly good value. Room service portions are large and ended up being cheaper than some of our meals on the strip. Hotel is a block or two off the strip so the walk is not bad but a shuttle is also provided by the hotel which was a nice perk. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. A little isolated. Not very Vegas-y”
Reviews.Author: YashinAround
Reviews.Content: A couple of my buddies and I stayed here for a long weekend while in town to watch the Las Vegas Sevens (2012). The property is nice, tasteful (hard to believe for a Trump property) and elegant but it doesn't feel at all like you're in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but not a perfect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Alex C
Reviews.Content: Well trained staff. Very friendly. Very courteous. Room was beautiful but nothing worked. The lg tv had audio but not video. The induction stove did not work. No detergent. No blanket for our teenager on the sofa sleeper. The whirlpool was temperamental. We were ignored once by a white glove bellman. Maybe he does the high rollers. We had to call front desk every night as new problems arose. But the cost for the rooms was good. We would go back if they keep that price. No such luck, as on planning our next LV trip, Trump already riser it's prices.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, quiet, and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: LauraLady84
Reviews.Content: I stayed with some girlfriends in early March and loved it. It's a great place to unwind and enjoy great service, gorgeous rooms, and delicious food. The pool area is top notch and since it's pretty high up, you get a great view of the surrounding area. The menu is great, too: smoothies, lunch fare, cocktails, etc. The lounge furniture is super comfy, and you don't have to fight over chairs! If you're looking for a luxurious place to unwind, without all the craziness that comes with some of the hotels right on the strip (think smoky and crowded), then this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “The Buzz of Vegas with Style...”
Reviews.Author: missneha
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Trump International Las Vegas for 8 nights in May 2011. We both felt that it was a classy, relaxed and perfect place to stay while we explored all the fun and excitement of Las Vegas. We enjoyed very second of your stay feeling like we were VIPs the whole time. We checked in at 2:30am and the staff was so friendly and welcoming. Excited to be in Vegas for the first time, but exhausted from our flight, the staff member who checked us was informative and fast. We also got upgraded to a corner suite which had a view that was to die for. It probably ended up really making our trip. The hostess there even suggested an awesome pizza joint that delivered to the hotel 27/7 so we could have some dinner. Our bags were quickly taken up to our room and met the concierge met us there. He showed us around and made sure we were comfortable before bidding us a good night. These little touches made it so much fun. The rooms at the Trump were classy, chic and spacious with everything you need including a big kitchen and a huge bathroom. The rooms are impeccably clean and the coffee and water is always stocked in the room everyday. There is a safe in the room and we had no problems with security at all. The bed is super comfortable and we were lucky enough to have the best view of the strip from our room…with roof to floor glass walls in a corner suite, you never forget you are in Vegas and you truly get to enjoy the Vegas atmosphere all the time. I could see the fountains going at the Bellagio from the window very easily. A lot of the reviews on Trump say that it is way too far from the main strip. But I can now tell you from my experience it is so not far AT ALL. It is literally less than a 5 min walk and you are on the strip. And it is safe. And if you don’t want to do that walk, then there are courtesy buses to take you to two different locations on the strip including Caesars Palace and the Wynn all the time, and they are so friendly and helpful, nothing is too much for them. Some other reviews also mention hearing the goods train in the middle of the night. I think I heard it twice during our 8 night stay, but I never heard it at night. It totally wasn’t an issue. The pool / gym are lovely and well equipped. The concierge desk was very helpful with booking a show and a Grand Canyon tour for us. They were quick and knew all the options and sorted thing out without any fuss. I would definitely recommend Trump International as being the stylish, impeccable, and elegant way to stay in Vegas and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Burak E
Reviews.Content: very high quality and luxury rooms. Hotel is very quiet. I prefer the lack of a casino. therefore, the hotel is more calm and relaxed. Excellent food and service. A must to stay in the hotel. The only thing a bit far from the center. but I can get 15 minutes on foot. I have requested the service tool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, fantastic rooms!”
Reviews.Author: trina008
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for 4 nights in december. The service was great, the rooms were fantastic... very roomy, great view of vegas, cooking facilities, spa bath, tv in the bathroom, huge shower & the most comfortable bed ever!! The only down side is the location... it is just off the strip and in winter especially, it is freezing cold and way too far to walk. They had shuttles running through out the day however we found this to be a hassle as they only had two destinations that you could choose to be dropped at and you had to be picked up from those destinations too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Leika44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in January, and enjoyed it. The lobby is very grand and is scented by huge vases of gorgeous lilies. Our room was large, with a lounge and kitchen area. Lovely view of the mountains. The bathroom was luxurious. Everything was spotlessly clean and fresh. The beds were extremely comfortable. Fashion Show Mall just a few steps away.The hotel is a short walk from the strip, and they provide frequent free shuttles to the Wynn and Caesars. Staff are helpful. Check in & out was smooth and fast. There are some drawbacks worth mentioning, but they did not detract from our holiday.Trains pass close by every few hours, and the horns sound loud even from the 54th floor.We were able to get straight back to sleep again, but some people may not be able to.The restaurant is not very good, but this hardly matters as there are lots of good places nearby; We particularly loved the breakfast buffets at the Bellagio and the Wynn. There is no casino, but this was a plus for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant, Let Down by Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: bernardharte
Reviews.Content: Our arrival at the Trump had been somewhat soured by a rip-off cab taking us on a tour of the desert on the way from the airport. Beware: if a cab driver sounds interested in whether you are off the London flight, he's likely not showing interest in anything but your gullibility! We chose the hotel because of its affiliation with the Preferred Hotels marketing group. The supposed upgrade afforded was to a Strip view room, but it was too low to see the Strip. (Given this was on the 36th floor, I would guess only the very top floors really have the view.) The greeting was warm and professional, and the room was well decorated (in more muted style than we expected). It had a large bathroom with whirlpool bath, separate walk-in shower, WC, and two wash basins. Everything was spotlessly clean. The kitchenette was adequately provisioned with place settings and cutlery for two, and had a cooker, microwave, and fridge. Unfortunately on the single day of our trip that we had time to use the pool deck a cold wind was blowing - so we only took a look at what was available - but it all looked very nice. The exercise room, though small, contained an adequate selection of equipment / CV machines. As others have mentioned, the hotel is off Strip but we found the Forum Shops and Wynn shuttles very useful. The Wynn is actually pretty close so we often walked, but on one occasion the friendly driver stopped and picked us up en-route. Both shuttles run frequently throughout the day and the longest wait was 10 minutes or so. I can see that the over-enthusiastic use of the train whistle would upset some, but although I am a light sleeper I was aware of it but not actually woken fully. The biggest disappointment was DJT restaurant. I would think that Mr Trump would be disappointed too if he ate here - especially with his initials attached! The service was adequate, although it tried a little too hard (to the point of obsequiousness) but the food was over-salted in the extreme and otherwise of not too good quality. (I thought a previous reviewer was exaggerating, but I swear it screwed-up my mouth and sense of taste for days.) There was a weird (in my opinion) gap between the approx $30 prix fixe menu and entrées of $40 and up. If I were running this place, I'd either sack the chef or seriously reeducate his palate (most likely the former as it was so WRONG)! A different chef did the breakfast and we found it to be of better quality and reasonably value with charmingly natural waiting staff. We were in Las Vegas for a short trip and - whilst it would have been convenient for us to dine at the hotel on more than the single occasion that we tried - we were afraid we'd get more over-priced and over-seasoned rubbish and so made the effort to go out. We're glad we did. In summary: stay for the comfort, eat breakfast, but avoid dinner at all costs (and I suspect this goes for room service also).

Reviews.Title: “Great service, fabulous hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Stormins
Reviews.Content: I booked a group reservation through Hotwire and ended up getting this hotel. Initially, I was worried that it would be too far from the Strip. Upon arriving I saw that they run a shuttle every 5 min to the Wynn and every 20-30 min to Caesar's. Everyone on staff was extremely friendly and attentive and I would have to say everything about the place was first class all the way. We were upgraded to a Strip view, and I have to say everyone in the group loved the view. The exercise room had what seemed like brand new equipment, and the pool was very nice, although I didn't use it myself. Parking is valet only, but for the times we were stopping back at the hotel for a few minutes, we just parked across the street at the mall. We took advantage of happy hour at the lounge and were happy with it. The only issue I had is that there are train tracks near the hotel, and you can hear the train whistle from the rooms, and they did seem to run late at night. Personally, this didn't bother me, but if you're a light sleeper, you might want to plan accordingly. Overall I have to say that I was very impressed, and would definitely consider staying here again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly oasis in vegas”
Reviews.Author: evaotterbaf
Reviews.Content: I visited LV on several occasions and stayed at many of its fantastic hotels. The Trump International had been on my list for a while before I finally managed to stay there for a week in August 2011. I wanted peace and luxury and I found it at Trump, along with an impeccable service provided by very friendly and very competent staff. Unlike any other hotel in magical Vegas, the Trump gives you the option of not being surrounded by cheering crowds and overcrowded pools. Right next door to the Fashion Show Mall, and efficiently connected with the Forum Shops by shuttle, it is an oasis right at the doorsteps of the most exciting city in the world. It is my hotel of choice in LV. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Colleen B
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the Trump. Folks here were very nice and we got upgraded to a HUGE suite with full kitchen and lounge area. Because it's right off the strip and not attached to a casino, it is not full of loud, drunk people and happy hour at the bar downstairs was laid back. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Already booked a 2nd stay. Amazing experience!!”
Reviews.Author: jlucca33
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in most of the hotels in Vegas due to business, I was quite interested when my girlfriend booked us at Trump a few weeks ago. Color me impressed!!! From the smiles we received when we checked in, to hand shake/come back soon I got when we left, I definitely received the treatment fit for the Trump name. The rooms were spacious, and left us with a romantic vibe"for our "friskyness!! Coming back to Vegas this Thursday for work, and cancelled my current reservation to return to Trump. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not too far off the strip.”
Reviews.Author: fcorletto
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience Vegas without the crazy lunatics, loud obnoxious bachelor/ette parties. This is the spot. The view was amazing. The price was great both restaurants were awesome and the pool was beautiful and peaceful. Staff was very accommodating. There is no smoking, no casino and it is about a New York City Avenue away from the strip. The mall is right across the street. Definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel:”
Reviews.Author: cabrarcdry
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed there from March 3rd till March 8th 2012(One bedroom Suite: 58th floor). Very clean hotel, great staff . The hotel does not have a casino: so it was way less crowded than the ones on the strip. Plus we checked online with http://bedbugregistry.com/ and there were no reports of bedbugs. They also have free shuttle service to BELLAGIO and CAESARS PALACE which is a plus if you dont want to rent a car or get a cab. Only complain: we told them repeatedly that we need foam/synthetic pillows as we are allegic to down pillows: they refused to provide more than 2 pillows per suite. Also the hotel restaurant is way overpriced: be ready to spend $80 minimum for a ok lunch for 2. I would definitely stay there again. I checked their other hotels in Chicago/Toronto before . I would denitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Girlz Weekend N Vegas”
