Reviews.Author: JA C
Reviews.Content: Spent a well deserved "Girls Weekend" in Vegas at Trump Intl Hotel. This property is truly a "high roller - top of the line" property. My girlfriends and I were welcomed with a warm reception. The lobby was immaculate with fresh flowers daily. The marble, crystal, gold detail and masterful craftsmanship throughout the property, was breath taking. Our suite was clean, fresh, and spacious. The master bath was large enough to house a small village. The smaller bath was just as nice. Perfect shower water pressure and the jet tub was soothing after our workout in the spectacular gym. My only suggestion would be to replace the 1 cup coffee maker with a "real" coffee maker. Room service was prompt and special with white table cloths, shiny silverware and polite staff. We may have stayed at two other places we'd consider "top notch" which places this one in the top 3!! Thanks uncle Trump for taking such special attention to our needs. We'll be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel, just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: teacherandteacher
Reviews.Content: We booked through expedia, getting a really cheap deal. On arriving we were met by the valet parking attendant (this is included in the resort fee) and we were shown into reception. After a very short wait we were checked in by a very helpful member of staff. Our room was on the 30th floor, which is a very short lift ride. We had a view of the strip and the mountains which was very nice, especially at night. The rooms are huge with a kitchenette built in, but don't bet on cooking in it (no grocery stores near by). The room was immaculate, with all of the amenities which we required. The only thing that we would have liked was some hotel information in the room (there is some available on the TV, but we found this limited). The bathroom is amazing, almost the same size as the room, with a jacuzzi tub that you could almost swim in! The shower and toilet are in their own glass cubicles, which we would imagine would be very useful for a family sharing the room. Another nice touch is the inner and outer bedroom doors, which eliminate noise from the corridor, you just share with the room next to you. Room service was very efficient and the prices were not stupid. We paid $16 for a pizza which was delicious and less than the cost of a delivered pizza. We purchased wine from Walgreens which is on the strip and housekeeping brought us a corkscrew within 5 minutes of our request. When collecting the car from the valet, it might help to call down as the wait is around 5 minutes for the car. The attendant always asked if we needed directions and appeared knowledgeable. A little tip - you can make a shortcut through Nordstrom and the Fashion Show Mall to get to the strip without walking along the main road. If you are looking for a strip hotel with a casino this is definitely not it! However we wanted somewhere to relax and get away from the madness. And it certainly provided that! We would fully recommend this hotel to anyone for any purpose.

Reviews.Title: “I now know how wonderful a Trump hotel is!!”
Reviews.Author: BudgetLuxuryTraveler
Reviews.Content: I didnt stay at this hotel, my friends did. I went through Travelocity and ended up at The Wynn. The only thing I liked better about my hotel is there is a casino and that makes it feel like a Vegas hotel. However, I liked their rooms better! The TV in the mirror in the bathroom, the decor, and the sunset view! One friend had a suite. Her room ended up being the meeting/hang out spot for the trip! Every room had a kitchen/kitchenette. That was soo wonderful!!! Her living room area had a table and a very comfortable seating area. Their were huge flower displays that kept the whole lobby area smelling wonderful. The staff was exceptional. I had to stay the afternoon with my friends because I was refused late check out at the Wynn. The doorman even provided one of the hotel vehicles to take me to the airport!!! I cant wait for my stay at the Trump Waikiki next week!!

Reviews.Title: “No, your dog is too big”
Reviews.Author: Nomad_adventure
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a group friends trip. It is fantastic. Views are amazing, room spacous with great ammenities. Bathroom is out of site. I love that there isn't a casino, no smoking to deal with anywhere. The staff is extremely efficient and friendly. It's a bit out of the way to walk from the strip but they do have shuttles to get you started. Now the bad new..........we wanted to return for my husbands birthday and called to make a reservation because they are "pet friendly". This part I DO NOT get.......they discriminate against dogs bigger than 25lbs. I love all dogs and I surely know my dog is less intrusive than some smaller dogs. Grantite he is 80lbs. but he is a part of our family big or small. Needless to say we can't stay there and bring our whole family. Really wish they would rethink that pet policy or at least be able to explain why the "size" of the dog matters.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great staff”
Reviews.Author: lmagnum
Reviews.Content: The rooms were large and comfortable, attractive, but the best part was the staff. Check in was great, They accommodated our early arrival. We asked many questions and they were always very helpful. It would have been nice to be closer to the other hotels, but they did have a shuttle and once again the staff was always nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelbee5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week while touring the canyons in Arizona and Utah. The hotel was beautifully decorated and the rooms were spacious and luxurious. The staff were very friendly and upgraded us to a strip view room. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"outstanding room with a view”
Reviews.Author: DanielO2
Reviews.Content: Booked the Trump on a website where the name of the hotel was not disclosed. Advertised as five star and many amenities. So I took a chance and booked it for an incredibly low price. It turned out to be the Trump after the online travel agency ran by credit card. We we very happy with the hotel. The room was large with a huge bathroom, walk in shower for two, whirlpool tub etc. The whirlpool easily fits two and my wife loved it. Nice bed and TV, sitting area overlooking the city. Had a fridge, microwave and ice buckets. Since it was so slow in July, the check in gal put us higher up on the tower, and gave us a strip view. She said that was an upgrade. The pool was nice and had bar service. One afternoon it was windy and the warm wind made waves in the pool. The hotel provided a shuttle to Cesears and the Wynn. We took advantage of that as it was July and hot. Our car was in the garage with valet parking. This became annoying after a while because you have to keep small bills on hand for tips. Same for the shuttle. The drivers were great, answering questions etc. The valet boys were helpful too, wanting to give directions to wherever you were going. Overall very nice room and nice stay in Vegas for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Oasis from Hectic Casinos”
Reviews.Author: DulceVida-TX
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights at the Trump Las Vegas in January 2012. We found it to be extremely nice, and a very pleasant change of pace from casino hotels (that's right-they have no casino!). Check-In went very smoothly, I checked in very early, but a room was available. I was able to upgrade to a corner suite for a very reasonable up charge per night. The Corner Suite was HUGE, big living room, large kitchenette with full size fridge and range. Dining room table for 4, barstools at the bar, and a sectional couch with a large flat screen. Bedroom was as big, with two large closets, and the bathroom was bigger than most hotel rooms on the strip. Full tub, separate huge free-standing glass shower, private commode with door, double sinks, it was outstanding. Amenities Only one bar and restaurant in the hotel. Bar service was great, but pricey. Didn't try the restaurant other than coffee and a croissant in the morning, which was great, but more pricey! Trump didn't get rich by undercharging folks, that's for sure! Ambiance This is a very classy establishment, it feels much like Bellagio did when it opened, on 1/100th of the scale. Bell and Concierge service staff was great. Downsides Spendy Extras: Not cheap, room was actually quite reasonable, everything else from the $3 cokes in the giftshop to the $14 bourbon's at the bar was pricey. Cell Service: Not sure if I blame the hotel for this or not, but it's a factor to keep in mind. Your Cell Phone (we're both on AT&T so keep that in mind) WILL NOT WORK inside the hotel. I think it's the cool looking gold film on the windows, but whatever it is, don't expect to use your cell phone inside the room. HUGE inconvenience. Overall: I'd stay there again for a Vegas trip where I wanted some quiet time. It's not a place to go to party, but if you need to do business in Vegas, it's the best.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful venue...quiet and close to shopping”
Reviews.Author: wwtraveller101
Reviews.Content: we stayed here one night before we left for home. I wish we had longer. it was superb. quiet, close to shopping (beside a large mall). great breakfast in house. absolutely amazing room. large, clean, had small kitchen. the entry was shared with another room which could only be accessed by your key...which means that it would be a great place to share two rooms with a family. the venue is smaller than most on the Strip...no getting lost or walking miles to find the lobby. no casino filled with cigarette smoke...great place for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great change of pace whilst being right by the action”
Reviews.Author: codeyf
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Friday evening, and there was no line. We were immediately impressed by the lobby area and the amazing smell coming from HUGE vases full of lillies throughout. Check in took only a few minutes, and the person helping us was very friendly, made sure to ask if we had any other questions or concerns, then proceeded to walk us to the elevator. We were on th 41st floor, room 4118. The hallways seemed standard for any hotel, nothing fancy, but clean. We were however impressed at how there was 1 set of doors for two rooms, sort of a little foyer to provide an additional noise barrier from anything going on in the hallway. Our room was standard, booked through priceline at an EXCELLENT rate. We were quite happy with the decor, amenities, and cleanliness of our room. The sub zero fridge, wolf range, and bosch microwave were pleasant surprises. Our view was looking north unfortunately, so not of the strip. But it was excellent none the less. The service staff we interacted with were extremely friendly and helpful. Doormen were always there to get the door for us, the bell desk was super friendly when we checked our bags on our last day. Best of all, the shuttle drivers were very friendly and comical at times as well. The free shuttle service to the Forum Shops or the Wynn were excellent, and saved us a good chunk of cab fare money. They're nice coaches and come every few minutes. So if you're worried about not being in the center of the action, don't be, as the shuttle gets you right to Cesar's in a couple minutes for free! After a night of partying, going from casino to club to casino, coming back to the Trump was always nice. No groups of 20-somethings gathered around the lobby, no smoke to walk through, etc. It really just put you in to an immediate recovery mode from the nights events. We'd highly recommend the Trump hotel to anyone looking to be right in on the action, but also wanting to be able to relax when it's time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: APRO
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel. Great staff, the room was immaculate. Comfortable bed and linens, incredible bath. The jacuzzi is huge and great for two people. Wonderful views. I don't understand the negative comments, you couldn't ask for better

Reviews.Title: “Three nights in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LatinDrummer
Reviews.Content: For those of you wanting to "not" wade through a casino impacted experience, Trump International Hotel is a great alternative. Through Hotels.com I got a $130 a night rate for a junior suite. More than enough room for a couple. Look for a room above the 52nd floor, recommend strip view. Except for a little neglect by the staff on the pool deck, my experience at this hotel was stellar. Parking attendants, bellmen, registration desk, room service, housekeeping, all top notch. I needed assistance from all of them at one time or another and they all went above and beyond to help. I was very impressed. I stay in 30 or more hotels a year including Vegas and I highly recommend Trump International Hotel. You'll be tempted to take home one of the great robes provided, if you have an extra $125.00.

Reviews.Title: “Trump Hotel in Las Vegas SUCKS”
Reviews.Author: S S
Reviews.Content: Stay away from Trump Hotel in Las Vegas. My wife and I went there for our anniversary recently and were very upset about the whole experience. Will never go back again. Service sucks. Took 30 min to check in without any line up, even though I am a trump card holder and I booked ahead of time. STAY AWAY UNLESS YOU WANT STRESS!!!! SERVICE WAS TERRIBLE. SUITES WERE AVERAGE. LOCATION WAS TERRIBLE. Best rate Commitment was not honored even though it was advertised on thier website, first they agreed, then when we got there, they wouldn't give us the rate. We stood there arguing with them for half an hour. Would never go back again. Beware of Amber from reservations...

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great stay”
Reviews.Author: A A
Reviews.Content: We had 3 large suite rooms and had a great time. The rooms were excellent, the service was excellent. No complaints at all. I'll stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “KEEP YOUR ITEMS AND MONEY SAFE FROM HOUSEKEEPERS!”
Reviews.Author: richieh777
Reviews.Content: The rooms and suites were nice. In addition, there are tvs in the bathrooms. So why I am giving this hotel one star? Because the hotel staff stole money from my girlfriend's wallet. I reported this to Trump security one month ago, and the Trump security has not gone back to me. I was in Vegas for a wedding, so I did not gamble. Very disappointed in the Trump.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Security”
Reviews.Author: Lilly C
Reviews.Content: I am writing this to alert any and all people planning to stay at this hotel that the security department in this hotel is horrible. If you want to feel safe and want to know that your belongings are safe, I highly suggest you stay in a different hotel. My belongings were stolen, after I filed a claim, it took over 5 five phone calls to get a phone call back only to be advised that my claim was 99.9% going to be denied since the hotel is not responsible for items left in the room. Be careful, if you leave something behind, apparently, it is okay for housekeeping to take them instead of turning them in.

Reviews.Title: “Postive Feedback”
Reviews.Author: awong99124
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas as a couple the weekend of 24-Feb for 4 nights. The hotel staff upon checkin were extremely friendly, and the lobby smelled nice like flowers, but not too overwhelming. We stayed on the 51st floor strip view which was great and experienced no issues with train noises as mentioned in previous reviews. I have been to Vegas many times, and it is refreshing not to come back to a smoke filled lobby and hotel corridors. Room: room was nice with more than enough room. The drawer was missing a handle (#5101) but not a big deal. (In case you are reading this Trump Hotel, we did not break it !) Bottled water was nice everyday as we did not have to go down to Walgreens at the Venetian or at the mall and haul it back. Coffee was nice too everyday. On occasion, we got more than 2 waters and coffee packets. Its nice to be able to drink an item in your hotel and not worry about weight sensors that automatically bill your room that exist in other hotels (ex: Caesar's) The jet-tub in bathroom is huge and although I usually just shower, I had to try out the tub that very easily fits two. Shuttle service was offered to the Wynn and Caesar's and wait time was minimal. The only suggestion I might make here is to eliminate the Wynn shuttle and replace it with one that takes you down to the other end of the strip (MGM, Aria, etc) We did not try the restaurant but prices looked reasonable for Las Vegas. The outdoor pool is heated but I didnt know this prior to booking or I would have brought my bathing suit. I was not bothered by the ~$20 resort fee daily as I was made aware of this upon checkin and reading prevous reviews. Overall, I think this is a good hotel where you can be removed at the end of the day from the gambling noises and smoke clouds. I do gamble but its nice to keep that separate. I would stay here again as I believe it is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Quality + Excellence”
Reviews.Author: traveltraveltravel32
Reviews.Content: I flew into Vegas on a Friday morning and my reservation was for Friday and Saturday. I got there early...9am and my check in time was 3pm. I was so tired coming from a long flight and all I wanted to do was sleep before I went out for another meeting at 2pm. Josh was able to check me in early and upgrade me to a city view at no charge. The manager was also very pleasant and the staff...what can I say about the staff.... from the guy who helped me open the floor outlet so I could charge my phone in the lobby, to the swimming pool attendants, to the maids, to the shuttle guy, to the attache who answered questions about where to go, to the Trump vehicle that took me to the airport....everybody was world class, helpful and friendly! Yes there is no casino...but its a short shuttle bus ride away to Caesars or the Wynn where you can gamble and deal with the crowds all you want. Overall it was a great stay....had some trouble with the TV...called downstairs and the maintanence guy was there in 5 mins and fixed it right away! Would I return....yes! did I have a great time in Vegas...yes! Amazing stay...very clean and beautiful property.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheetahtraveler
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. The fact that its off the strip and has no casino was a plus for us, as it is quieter than other Vegas hotels and is cheap! The suites were spectacular with great views of the Strip. It's a decent 5 minute walk to the strip, but they offer a shuttle to Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tgropp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights after our cruise and LA visit. We picked this hotel for its location and it being a no smoking hotel. The rooms were very large and the view of the strip was nice. Not having a casino did not bother us as I had previously mentioned there was no smoking! It was just a short walk through the mall to the strip or they had a quick shuttle to Caesars Palace. When I go to Vegas again. I will probally stay here. Great expeirence!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: barryozed
Reviews.Content: Great room in a quit hotel. No casino and a smaller more personal hotel...less crowded and less noise. No lines in checking in or out. Great service, nice pool area and again not crowded. One block off the strip, but short walk through the fashion mall or shuttle bus available

Reviews.Title: “Best service in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Meredith36
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights to celebrate my birthday and had my best experience in Vegas yet. I think I will be staying at this hotel from now on. The service was fantastic. I've been to Vegas several times and never had such amazing service from hotel staff. They seem to treat everyone like they are their top priority. It's also great to come back to a smoke free, gambling free establishment for a good night sleep after your fun filled day/night on the strip. The location is great as well in my opinion. There are non stop shuttles running from the hotel to ceasars and the wynn and the strip is only a 5 min walk max. If your sole purpose in coming to Vegas isn't to gamble I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could ask for....”
Reviews.Author: Dbirkwood
Reviews.Content: I first came to the Trump a couple of years ago and was impressed with their studio room but this time I found myself in a one bedroom suite and it was FABULOUS! A large sitting/dining room with a good sized kitchen with everything you could need if you decided to cater for yourselves, plus a massive fridge and a freezer too. Just off the sitting room was a separate wc and shower so you could easily have that room separate and make use of the sofa bed too. The large separate bedroom had the marvellous Trump bed and mattress, that is just perfection! The largest bathroom I've ever seen too with a lovely jacuzzi tub and huge double shower cubicle. A large TV in both sitting room and bedroom meant it was great to come in after a long day and just crash and dream that this really was your home!! I was impressed to see that following so many comments on this site about the problem of crossing the road to the mall, Trump has now put in a pedestrian crossing making it even easier to get anywhere. Great service all round and the housekeeping staff brought me fresh coffee supplies without any quibbles, which is always nice. Can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Trump: What's not to love?”
Reviews.Author: HavanaDreams1959
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a five night stay at The Trump. The experience was superb, and I will stay here again as soon as I have the opportunity. The staff I encountered, to a person, were pleasant, professional and personable. They all went out of their way to make sure my needs were addressed and my expectations exceeded. I ordered room service a few times during my stay, and it arrived promptly every time, ahead of the time they estimated, and the orders were always correct. Housekeeping for my room was convenient and very thorough throughout my stay. The rooms are very spacious and well equipped, the bathroom is palatial including a deep jacuzzi that you simply must try out. The bed was extremely comfortable. The sweeping view from my room, 4908, was breathtaking. Ask for a Strip view room on an upper floor. My room was very quiet overall. I did not hear the train once. While the hotel has no casino, only two restaurants, and yes it is located a ten minute walk from the strip, the location is still very convenient and serene. I prefer not to have to contend with swarms of boisterous partiers to navigate around in the lobby and avoid in the hallways outside my door when I want to relax and get some rest before another full day of activities in Vegas. You can walk from the hotel to the Strip in 10 minutes, either through the adjacent and upscale Fashion Show Mall or around the outside corner of the mall, OR simply take the complimentary shuttle from the Trump to the Wynn or Caesar's Forum Shops that runs every 10 to 15 minutes each way. Now, before you decide this is too far and mark the hotel off your list of properties to consider booking in Vegas, just keep in mind that you will walk longer than 10 minutes through any of the hotels on the Strip to get from the guest rooms through their casinos to the front of the hotels. It is easy to underestimate walking time/distances in the large Vegas properties, but having walked through the Bellagio, the Palazzo, the Venetian, and Caesar's, I can assure you the walk from the Trump to the strip is brief to equivalent in comparison. I for one really enjoyed have the room elevators only steps away from the hotel lobby, when I returned to the Trump after a long enjoyable day in Vegas. As for not having a casino - bravo! Casinos = crowds = smoke = noise. It is wonderful to not have to inhale or reek of smoke from a walk through the lobby of the Bellagio or Venetian, for example, to reach their shopping areas or to the Strip. The hotel itself is so clean it sparkles, and the fresh scent piped through the ventilation system that greets you every time you enter the lobby is very welcoming and a unique feature. Just walk into any other Vegas strip hotel, and see how you would describe the first scent you enounter. Smoke? Stale air from hordes of tourists? Take your pick. In any case, trust me: you will appreciate this feature of the hotel more than you think. There are so many restaurants in Vegas, you are not going to want to eat in your hotel every night. Many dining options are located close to the Trump, in Fashion Show Mall, in the nearby Wynn, Encore, TI, Palazzo, Venetian...you will want to explore your options and it is nice to have DJT as an option for times you don't want to dine outside the Trump. I really can't say enough good things about this hotel. I hope to enjoy a repeat stay very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Average place for vegas”
Reviews.Author: judi c
Reviews.Content: I was reading some of the other reviews and thought I'd share my 2 cents. I stayed at the Trump with my wife because neither one of us are big gamblers. We found the staff top notch and excellent but this is to be expected in all Vegas 5* hotels. To me the staff being excellent was not a huge selling point because I honestly think the staff at the other hotels are just as awesome. The reason why I gave this place an average rating only is mainly because of Location, location, location! 1) I hate having to plan my times around the shuttle bus and waiting and wasting time. To me time is money. There are no cabs just waiting around here either so it's kind of hard to get around having to wait for a cab or shuttle bus. 2) It is far away from the shows and restaurants so it was again annoying being far away. 3) There are no side walks connecting all the way to the strip either. You have to kind of take your chances walking on the road on a few occasions (I haven't been back since early 2011 so I don't know if this has been fixed. The pool was very tame and usual. Nothing really special about it. What I would recommend is that a monorail be built to the strip casinos to improve the situation. When I goto Vegas I basically have the choice of a zillion 5 star hotels. The hotels with the casinos, clubs, and top notch restaurants are just as quiet in the rooms as the Trump so it's just not worth the inconvenient location for me. I would recommend this for families who want to keep kids away from smokers though.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas No Smoke, No Casino, and Easy Access”
Reviews.Author: Antimagellan
Reviews.Content: Thanks to UnitedVacations we got a fabulous deal on one of the handicap access City View rooms for three nights in February 2012. I will stay here again without hesitation. The Great: The staff was amazingly professional and friendly. Everyone introduced themselves by name and asked if I needed anything. When a request was made, they made a sincere effort to satisfy that request. I never once got the sense that the staff was anything but pleased to be of assistance. Our City View Room was huge with its comfortable king sized bed, large sitting area, massive bathroom (this was a handicap access room and those typically are more roomy). The Good: The facility is nonsmoking so there is no running the smoke filled gauntlet wherever you go. Because there is no casino at this location, there is no effort to trap you in its confines. As a result, from the time you walk into the front door to the time you are sitting in your room tops out at 5 minutes (if you walk slowly). The room has a nice kitchenette including a cooktop with 2 burners, a microwave, the cursed fridge (see later), and a one cup at a time coffee maker. There were dishes and silverware for 2 available. Useable pots/pans in the drawers, there was even a salad spinner for use. Preparing a Gourmet meal might be a challenge (no Souffles), but most meals are do-able. There was LOTS of storage and 2 closets with low hangers; I never figured out how a long dress would have been hung - fortunately I did not bring one. Downstairs, the DJT Restaurant has, in addition to a la cart dining, a $29 fixed price menu that provides salad, main course, and desert. The Scallops in lobster bisque was amazing. I also recommend the Caprese Salad. There is a shuttle that runs from the Trump to the Wynn then back to the Trump and off to Caesar's Palace. I heard it was 20 minutes round trip but never waited even 5 minutes for it so I guess I was lucky. You can walk to the strip by taking a left from the front of the hotel and walking about 15 minutes to the Wynn. It is also possible to reach the strip by cutting through the Fashion Mall which is across the street from the Trump entrance. The shuttle doesn't run 24 hours a day so, for convenience or necessity, taxis to/from the strip seemed to cost $7-8 with tip although a trip to the Cosmopolitan cost $15. From the airport it was $18 with tip, but this could vary with traffic. Check out was a snap on the large TV in the room. Needs Work: While everything looked wonderful and everyone was wonderful, our room had a few issues: the safe was broken, one of the lights was burned out, there were no coffee supplies in the kitchenette, there was dust in the radio's iPhone jack. The staff never could get the fridge set to the correct temperature - regardless of the setting, the fridge either froze everything or didn't cool at all. In most hotels I would have chalked this up to neglect but my impression of the Trump is they are obsessive in their attention to detail so I was surprised that they overlooked so many things in this one room. The H2(Eau) is a pool side cafe that needs work. They tell you up front that your meal may take 30 minutes to arrive. If you are over 10, don't order the Hot Chocolate. The Shuttle stop at Caesar's is not at the valet drop off. I was told it was at the Planet Hollywood sign but never found where. This is a potential safety issue since the Planet Hollywood sign area was not well populated at midnight. In summary, The Trump Las Vegas is a nonsmoking hotel with wonderful service and a shuttle to the strip. If you need a casino in the Lobby, this isn’t the place; but if you want something close to but not within the maddening crowd, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Still love this non-gaming hotel near the Las Vegas Strip, but...”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixWestin
Reviews.Content: ...this favorite hotel is starting to show it's wear. Lobby and common areas are still quiet, clean, beautiful attention to detail, with fragrant air pumped into Lobby. However rooms are starting to show wear and tear. Disappointed in the suite we stayed in last trip (we stay regularly for business) and furniture was in need of some attention. Bed was creaky, carpets in need of cleaning, hair in tub, dents and small nicks in furniture show some lack of attention. Will I stay again? Sure, but hope we see these uncommonly lovely and large rooms back to their original elegance.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and sparkly”
Reviews.Author: Sophie W
Reviews.Content: I loved it here. The suite was incredible with a massive jacuzzi and large power showers. It's a lot quieter than other hotels on the Strip as there's no casino, but I didn't mind that. It's only a a 5-minute walk to the first hotel on the Strip (Wynn) or there's a free shuttle that will take you to either The Wynn or Caesar's Palace. There is only one bar/restaurant in the hotel and that was pretty expensive ($14 for a glass of wine). The lobby is great - exactly what you'd expect from Donald Trump - gold, sparkly and over the top! There were a few tiny niggles, for example no big white fluffy towels or robes in the room. The towels were a bit Premier Inn-esque! And they're a bit stingy with the tea/coffee facilities in the room. The food from room service wasn't great either. Other than that - it was great. One thing i'd mention though is that some of the hotel booking websites in the UK haven't got the room descriptions right. We booked through hotels.com and their description of the Deluxe City Suite described a proper suite with separate living room, two bathrooms etc. When we checked in though, we had a regular junior suite (one big room). When we brought this to the attention of reception, they upgraded us to honour our booking but made it clear that it was the website that had made a mistake. Also, their Spa prices were extortionate!!

Reviews.Title: “What's with the negative reviews????”
Reviews.Author: reynards
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel despite the negative views expressed on the forum. To us it was a real pleasure to return at the end of the day to a quiet smoke free environment, especially as we had children with us. Service was very good, place is clean and rooms are large and well appointed. Valet parking is included in the resort fee and the return of the cars is quick and efficient. I suspect the walk to the strip is less than from many "strip" hotels and the trump has the advantage of a shuttle bus to Caesars. If we ever return to Vegas we will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “There's a reason it's gold”
Reviews.Author: 27sam27
Reviews.Content: The Trump is a nice oasis in Vegas. There's no casino, there are no nightclubs, and there's not really much going on after 8pm. The rooms are very nice, the bathrooms are terrific, and the room service and the lobby restaurant are very solid. The staff is extremely helpful, and they're more than happy to go the extra mile (for a nice tip). There's so much to do in Vegas, so it's nice to come back to a nice quiet hotel at night. If you need to sweat a little, the gym and pool are big and often empty.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas - Off Strip Delight”
Reviews.Author: shymer1810
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trump International for 10 days Sep 2011. We picked this Hotel because it has no gambling and is smoke free ( That way we could have a break from the hustle and bustle of the strip as needed). We had a studio suite strip view. Trump Hotel is absolute value for money, and pure luxury. The hotel was clean we had a Strip View Room, which had a spectacular view, as well as a kitchenette and microwave. The internet was great, worked with IPad and laptop, and we received bottled water and newspapers daily, as well as access to a fitness centre. Do not be concerned about the Hotel being off the strip, as there is a complimentary bus from the Trump which takes you and picks up at Caesar’s Palace, Forum Shops. Fashion Show mall is directly across the road and the Deuce Bus picks up in front of Fashion Show Mall on the strip side. It was our first time in Vegas so initially we walked everywhere our first day, but things are further than they look so I highly recommend the 24 hour Deuce Bus pass. Overall this was a fabulous stay and worth the money. Partcularly if you are looking for a good night sleep to prepare you for your hectic Las Vegas day.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but very quiet”
Reviews.Author: Mexicangreekgirl
Reviews.Content: I had to extend my stay in Las Vegas from Feb. 13 to the 16th, and the hotel I was staying at was sold out for the first night, so I had to switch. I went with the cheapest 5 star hotel I could find, since my trip was work-related, didn't really care where I stayed as long as it was nice. The service was great, very friendly staff. The rooms were very nicely appointed, with a kitchenette, a great bed, and a very large bathroom. I was about to place a complaint at the front desk because I had pressed the "do not disturb" button and was woken up by housekeeping twice anyway, when I realized that the button was not working, so housekeeping was not at fault. This is a great hotel to get work done, but if you're in Vegas for fun, I would stay at one of my regular, strip located hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Super Bowl Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Brandon F
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trump with a pretty big group for Super Bowl Weekend and it was a great experience. It was very refreshing to come back from the craziness of the strip to a very calm hotel. The staff was excellent and went above and beyond to make sure that we got everything that we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, and elegant accommodations In Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Lkup
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business and found the rooms to be well appointed and spacious. My room had it all- from a mini Sub Zero fridge to a Wolf mini stove. The bathroom is very large with a nice size shower and a big Jacuzzi bathtub and the entire area is beautifully tiled throughout. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Definitely would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Personal Message from Donald Trump, It Felt Like!”
Reviews.Author: LLFauntleroy
Reviews.Content: My view of The Donald, after his media mania, is restored! The Trump empire understands the luxury hotel business, if this place is any indication. A casino enhances guest comfort-- not-- and that was my favorite aspect of walking through the expansive lobby after a week in Vegas with my ears numb from incessant casino ringings. At Trump, my walk to the elevator was to the sound of jazz piano near the lobby bar. The hallways are wide with each two rooms sharing a grand double-door entry alcove shielding you from any hallway noise. Your room has fine wood cabinetry, vases and art, chic furnishings, and glass stovetop in the inset deco kitchenette. A train sounds in the concrete valley below, it reminded me of the one coming up the river valley in Harper's Ferry, comforting not disturbing. This is where I would stay the next trip if I can afford it, this time it was a good rate from Priceline. The Donald apparently knows how to make you feel good about yourself as a guest in this spectacular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: MurmaidPrensus
Reviews.Content: The Trump was by far the most beautiful place I've stayed. We upgraded to a suite and had our own mini condo. Loved being off the strip. Loved not having a casino in our lobby! Staff was superior.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5-star facilities”
Reviews.Author: kes2009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Trump LV first week in February for 4 nights. We have noted the following: Good points: Friendly, professional and efficient service Good value for money Very clean room/bathroom Non-smoking, quiet and casino - free resort Good decor throughout the hotel Bad points: Location - although not far from the Strip access is a bit a awkward There is only one bar at the hotel which closes at 11pm, when tried to order cocktail as a room service staff did not know how to make one (Pinacolada) Breakfast bar could not cope with number of guests on Saturday morning- had to wait for 30mins to be seated for breakfast There were no slippers or bathrobes provided in the room- had to call housekeeping service (although their response was very quick- items were delivered within 10mins) There is fixed shower which was extremely temperamental changing water temperature randomly from hot to cold No shower in the Jacuzzi so impossible to rinse your body after taking a bath Bath towel sizes are for Lilliputians- never seen such small bath towels in any hotels Hotel does not provide shower gel- instead guest get body soap which is not very nice (maybe something to do with preventing guests to use bath/shower gels in Jacuzzi) Train noise is very loud- I am a very heavy sleeper (especially after long-haul flights) but the train hooting was so loud- definitely much louder than any traffic noise you might experience in busy cities such as NY- and we were based on 51st floor in city view room

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: Abbie G
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend went to Vegas for my birthday in January and I was amazed by the quality of the service, the incredibly friendly staff, and of course the gorgeous hotel itself!! We had one of their basic studio rooms, which don't get me wrong, it was not cheap, however, the room was spotless and we had a view right down the strip through our huge window in the rooms lounge area. The room also included catering facilities and the bathroom was more than OK. It had a huge walk in shower and a hot tub. The mirror in the bathroom even had a TV built into it which was brilliant whilst brushing my teeth :-D the fact the hotel doesnt have a casino did not phase me, in fact I certainly appreciated it. It meant the hotel was peaceful yet a 2 minutes walk away from the action, with free transfers from the hotel to the nearest casino 'Wynn' and another, but not entirely sure which. My boyfriend and I are already looking at booking our next trip to Vegas, and it will certainly be back to Trump!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: ukiebride
Reviews.Content: Having been to Vegas multiple times, we tend to prefer staying on the North Strip. One huge plus for us is Fashion Mall (well, myself, not so much my husband!). Besides shopping close by, it's nice having some wallet-friendly eats close by: Starbucks, food court, Stripburger etc. However, two fantastic restaurants: El Segundo (Mexican) and Maggianos (Italian) really make our stay. Location: That preamble sets up the location that Trump is just across the street from Fashion Mall, and that going through the mall is easiest access to the Strip. The hotel is quite a walk away from the nearest Casino (Wynn-15mins), however, the hotel makes up for this with free and frequent shuttle service to Wynn and Caesars Palace (more central). Otherwise, taxis are your best bet. If you intend on walking the strip frequently, perhaps not the place for you... Rooms: The top room we've stayed in Vegas, even slightly above our corner room at Wynn! We also booked a corner strip view room at Trump, but in terms of 'bang for the buck', it came with a small kitchenette (full fridge and comped coffee, stove, sink, freezer), dining room table, living room area, large kingsize bedroom, two toilets, and a huge main bathroom with one of the highlights of the stay - a jacuzzi tub with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the strip (yes, I could even partially see the Bellagio fountain show from the tub!). Small tip: the tub needs to be filled to near overflowing for the jets to work. Just covering the jets isn't enough. It appears the room was intended as a private condo...Small issue with hearing the train, but knew that from TA reviews, and got used to it by the second night. The hotel itself is quiet. Pool area/gym: Free loungers sofas all around. Husband used the gym and was impressed with the range of equipment, from free weights to machines. Food: Did not eat here, but loved our room so much (and the view) we would often use 'take out' from Fashion Mall, buy some wine from the ABC store in the mall, and go from there... Overall, loved it and would stay here again. Would recommend it for those who don't need a Casino, and have been to Vegas before.

Reviews.Title: “Considering the money we saved by having a kitchen, it was great”
Reviews.Author: Lynda S
Reviews.Content: The main reason we stayed at the Trump was because it had a kitchen and refridgerator as we have seen and heard about the outrageous prices for food in Las Vegas. We figured that if we cooked at least one to two meals a day, we would save over $100 per day in food costs for our family of four. This paid off for us, we took a grand canyon trip the first day and bought food at the grocery store when we returned. The rooms at the Trump are very nice, top notch. My only complaint is that the Trump is in a rather poor location, there is a nice shopping mall adjacent to it but there is nothing on the other side. It is situated across from the Wynn/Encore but you really have to walk to get to where most of the attractions are. If you have a car to drive in Vegas, it's a perfect location as you can easily drive to where you want to go. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, quite hotel with no casino”
Reviews.Author: Abelardof
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and our 2 teenager daughters in a suite on Trump Tower. Vey spacious, confortable and luxurous rooms. Service was fast and efficient. The great point for me i sthat there is no casino in the hotel, so we don't need to see the gambling all the time we're entering or leaving the hotel. We can take the hotel shutle to the Caesars Palace or to the Winn, and being in a Casino. The breakfast was just ok, not every days thet have the buffet for breakfast. The bed for the kis are horrible, not suitable for a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So In Love”
Reviews.Author: DaJoneses
Reviews.Content: The first time we visited the Trump was July 2009 and I was 8 months pregnant and it was the best experience ever that we came back July 2011 and plan on going back July 2012. This hotel is awesome. The room is beautiful the views whether your in a city view or strip view is awesome. The beds are so relaxing that we just slept our first day in Vegas away. The tub and shower so both so great you do not want to get out. Room service is great everything we ordered was delicious. There are so many places to choose from in Vegas but our heart is at the Trump.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing and a nice respite from the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: IndyMex
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference headquartered at the Trump International Hotel in Las Vegas - room was quite ample for our needs and included a microwave oven, quite large refrigerator and a cook top (a bit odd - never used - primarily for tea as a teapot was also included). Room was comfortable and well maintained as is the property in general. We stayed at a particularly unbusy time and so there was never any waiting and service was exceptional. If you are seeking a nice hotel without a casino in Sin City, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous trip”
Reviews.Author: jonesy2901
Reviews.Content: my wife and I have just returned from our 2 week visit at the Trump. Before we visited, I emailed ahead to say my wife and I were celebrating our Silver wedding anniversary. Within an hour or so, I had an email back giving us a free upgrade to a south facing suite, overlooking the strip, on the 43rd floor. So, where do we start? firstly, the previous viewers who had complained about the nearby train making too much noise, spoiling their holiday, need to get a life and get out more!! From the moment we arrived to the time we left, we were treated like 5 star guests. From check in, to concierge, to valet parking to housekeeping, nobody could do too much for you. We found the complimentory shuttle a great help, dropping us at the Wynn or Caesars whenever we wanted, always with a smile. As we were there for 2 weeks, we had the odd day where we would lie in, and go out later in the day. Never once did housekeeping moan, just kept saying "let us know when you want your room cleaning". One night it was 10pm, we came home to fing our room un-made? A quick call and it was sorted. The beds and linnen are fantastic, the spa-bath incredible and even the tv in the bathroom mirror a great touch. As for the resort fee. Well, as we are non smokers and seldom gamblers, we had no problem paying the 20 odd dollars fee per night. Sometimes, it's really nice to return to a quiet smoke free environment, after a night on the town. Worth every penny !!!!!!! As a well travelled couple, we really loved our visit, 5 star, Mr Trump! S&R Jones, S.Wales, UK

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Suite!”
Reviews.Author: ordersjp
Reviews.Content: Quiet, clean, comfortable..........quick response by housekeeping & other services. Pool fabulous for February. Was able to sleep thru train. NO SMOKING!!!! YEAH!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I won't even go in the casinos anymore because of the smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Simply beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Talent1014
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with an exceptional staff. The rooms were clean and spacious. The view from my room was spectacular. I stayed on the 53rd floor over looking the Las Vegas strip. Also down in the lounge the bartenders were very entertaining. Our bartender Marvin made some incredible drinks and offered us his opinions on Vegas hot spots.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Thursdaygb
Reviews.Content: Trump Hotel was luxurious, clean and offered good service. I had read the reviews on this site about the train noise so I asked for a room on the other side however I did still hear the train during the night. I think that was only because I was awake already. The following night I slept through it. The pool was a real highlight - as warm as bathwater when it was only 15C outside. The staff were friendly and helpful and room service was top quality. The proximity to the strip was perfect. We walked across one day through the mall and another day we caught the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Ok...but not after The Encore”
Reviews.Author: SophsterBath_England
Reviews.Content: We decided to extend our Las Vegas trip by 2 nights so that we could see Duran Duran play. We had previously spent 4 nights at The Encore, and decided to try The Trump due to an excellent rate we had found on lowcostusa dot com. Whilst it is a good hotel, and I cannot find any faults with it at all, I couldn't help staring whistfully out of the window, wishing we were still at The Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ttommy9999
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on this hotel on Hotwire. When I arrived, they offered me a suite for an additional $50 a night, which I took. The room was outstanding! Large suite with a kitchenette and a view down the strip. Two bathrooms, one of them huge with a great spa tub. The room was well furnished and the kitchenette had top end appliances. The hotel is non-smoking and has no casino, so it's a nice change from the usual strip hotels. It's a great hotel to stay at for a convention. I've been to Vegas many times for conventions and company events and I've stayed at most of the major hotel/casinos. Frankly, Vegas is not my favorite place but this hotel really made my stay a pleasure and it is by far the best I've stayed at in Vegas. Particularly if you're not in town to gamble, this place is unbeatable. Restful, quiet and very well appointed--I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Karen F
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel. On our first visit 2 years ago, we took the upgrade to the suite. That was amazing. This time we chose the studio. Having a kitchen area is important to us. The suite had an incredible full-size kitchen. The studio kitchen was not nearly as well appointed. We would definitely stay here again, but in the suite. The rates are reasonable for the quality and amenities, no casino is a plus. I don't remember that they had a shuttle to the Wynn before, but we used it this time and it is quick way to get to the strip. This place has good energy and it is a pleasure to be here!! We are on the 51st floor, facing the strip. Great views and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: vacationjunkie030
Reviews.Content: We recently spent an evening at the Trump and it did not disappoint. We stayed in a one bedroom which was beautifully appointed. It had a full kitchen with high quality stainless steal appliances. Two full bathrooms a living room, dining area and bedroom. The master bath was amazing with a TV in the mirror. The spa was upscale and relaxing. I would definitely recommend this hotel it is slightly off the strip but it has a shuttle to the Wynn and Caesars Palace running every 20 mins. It is also directly across from Nordstrom at the Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Wynn!”
Reviews.Author: kingofsling
Reviews.Content: Rooms were amazing, we were honored to have Mr. Trump visit during our buying trip! Also it is refreshing to stay in Vegas without the casino action everywhere. The food was excellent though somewhat expensive. The upgraded room at only $150 a night was a bargain. Better than the room we paid $400 for at the Wynn. Congratulations to Mitt Romney who was there for Trump's endorsement. The massage was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, but LOUD”
Reviews.Author: uclabruin75
Reviews.Content: I thought Trump and that hottie Bill Rancic knew what they were doing. NOPE! This hotel really reminds me of a 25 year old bimbo, very pretty on the outside, but things not quite working right on the inside (sorry, no offense bimbos, it was the best I could think of). Yes the lobby and rooms are clean and pretty. But the floor to ceiling windows are made of cheap, thin glass. I was on on the 56th floor and could literally hear every car that went by. I asked for a quiet room having read reviews from people complaining about the noise, and this was the best they could do. You hear planes beginning at 6 am and trains at 7:30 am. So much for a relaxing weekend away! Odd that I have NEVER heard a plane in a Vegas hotel room and I've been here hundreds of times. The bartender downstairs also refused to sell me their turkey burger which is supposed to be good. He said I'd have to get room service to get it. Uhhhh...aren't you people all using the same kitchen???? Also note that the burger isn't listed on the room service menu. All in all, save your money. Even if you get a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Paul A
Reviews.Content: January 2012 We were thouroghly impressed with the Trump International in Las Vegas. The Studio King suite that we had was spacious, luxuriuos and well appointed. The bathroom was huge with european glass doors seperating the large walk in shower and toilet from the rest of the bath which included dual sinks and a two person whirlpool tub as well. Ample drawers and cabinet space provided room for toiletries. The king size bed was very comfortable as were the couches and easy chairs in the sitting area. A kitchenette with stove top, microwave, coffee maker and refrigerator were more than we needed. Closet and drawer space were far more than ample. The pool area was large and comfortable and the pool service outstanding. The bar and restaurant were also very good. Although just a block off the strip easy connections were made through the Fashion Show Mall right across the street which provided many dining choices. Highly recommended for business travelers to Vegas that are tired of the noise and commotion that a casino hotel brings. Also they were very competive on price and their direct reservations staff matched the discounted rates offered on hotels.com which were comparable to the discounted hotel rates offered by the conventions travel service.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Miree61
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in the Trump New York so was interested to see how this would compare. Very nice, great value considering the value. Also nice not to have to navigate a casino on the way back to the room!! Meals pretty expensive, especially breakfast but high quality. Would definitely recommend. VERY comfortable bed and spacious bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a business traveler”
Reviews.Author: getmetherenow
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Vegas and the Trump Hotel. Although this hotel isn't the huge sprawling themed casino hotels that you'll find embedded along the Strip in Vegas, for a business trip with little time for the chaos that the strip can be, it was perfect. I appreciated not having to hoof it a half a mile to get to the elevator to go to my room, as the other large name brands force you to do. I don't find the noise of the casinos to be music to my ears after long hours at a trade show or at the Market. Without having to trek through casinos and endless shops, it was very convenient and easy to get to our rooms. At night, there is staff checking for room keys so that uninvited non-guests can't venture beyond the lobby area. Greatly appreciated by us. The Trump Hotel is upscale, has service down to perfection (as you would expect) and had very comfortable, appealing rooms. The lobby was ornate, but tasteful. Gold pillars and crystal chandeliers as you would expect from Trump. The staff, attentive, polite, and accommodating. Many reviewers made comments about the noisy side of the hotel and the quiet side. Our room was on the city side, which is considered to be the noisy side. We did not, however, experience any of the disruption from the trains that some of the other rooms suggested. We appreciated the subzero refrigerator in the kitchen area of the room, but did not use any of the other kitchen appliance options. The bathroom was wonderfully large adorned in marble with a very large 2 person walk in shower. The mirror had a television embedded in the screen which was enjoyed daily. Maid service was good. When I went into my room at one point when the maid was cleaning it, she was very apologetic and offered to leave the room while I was in it and come back. This wasn't necessary as I was only there to pick something up, but the gesture was appreciated. The beds were very comfortable and slept well every night. I would definitely consider staying here again on my next trip back on business. As stated, this is not your typical noisy, huge, sprawling Vegas hotel. It is more of a boutique style, smaller, but not lacking in style or service. (Unlike the larger strip hotels where service can be a challenge sometimes) If you are looking for a buffet, you won't find that at the Trump either. The Trump does offer free shuttle service to the very close WYNN Hotel, so if you are craving the true Vegas strip atmosphere, it's only moments away. If you are traveling to Vegas with kids and don't want them exposed to some of the typical strip activities, this is the hotel for you. Also note, the staff did transport me to the airport when I was ready to go, so I don't know what other comments about no shuttle is about. I could always find transportation when needed. (And no, I'm not a young sexy thing. I'm mid 50's with that middle aged spread that most of us acquire! ) Maybe it was just timing on my part, but the when they took my suitcases and loaded them into the back of the hotel suburban, it seemed that this was quite the norm. Also transported my associate in the same manner today. I'd say, if you need transportation, just ask the doorman!!

Reviews.Title: “Trumped by Trump”
Reviews.Author: Judy K
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to be staying at the Trump for my working visit to Vegas. What was really appealing was that it's a non-gaming hotel. First, there is no shuttle to and from the hotel, you have to take a cab or rent a car. Second the dining flows out to the lobby area so when you are sitting at breakfast every time the doors open...the cold air hits you in the face and cooled off our $50 breakfast pretty quick...suggest you insist to eating in the separate dining room beyond the foyer. My daughter flew in to get her bridal portaits done by a photographer that was traveling with her she immediately got off the plane and went directly to the salon..after getting the bags settled into the room; I went to meet her at the salon...the place was empty and the hairdresser was WASHING her hair. The result was curls that did not stay...so I returned to the salon and they didn't have any hairspray for me to buy so I could do her hair on our own. I did get some from the concierge (she had some of everything)..I was very grateful for the hotel for that ability. We had adjoining suites with the photographers and they were very nice. Full kitchens (pot and pan provided) but with only one place setting...thought their should be two. The elevator is the second fastest in the city...never had to wait more than a minute. Would I book there again? No.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Spacious and exquisite decor”
Reviews.Author: prozerran
Reviews.Content: 2 nights city view suite - $95+resort fee approx $24/ night Pros - Location is ok. Just a short 3min walk to the Las Vegas Blvd (at the same level as Wynn). Opposite the hotel is the fashion mall. - Large room and great decor. Bed is great not too hard or soft perfect! Marble benches, fridge, stove top, blender and even TV in the bathroom. My wife tells me that for a room with a top of the range Cuisine Art blender the hairdryer was below a Kmart quality. - Wifi and 2 bottles of water replenished daily. - Complementary Shuttle to Caesars Forum Shops (stops downstairs) provided - runs continuously till 12pm on 15-20min round trip. - No casino in hotel which I think is a good thing, not as crowded and smoky Cons - Stupid resort fee. Another reason to charge the guests - just include it in the total fee. The resort fee provides you with amenities which are normally included in the hotel price anyway! - Slightly off the central strip, but very easy to walk to get Express strip bus (stops outside Wynn, Paris/Bellagio, MGM, Mandalay Bay). Express bus also takes you to Discount Outlet shops north and south. Overall a great hotel. Location is ok, but could be better. Not a fan of the stupid resort fee (but then again they would add it to the hotel price). Other trip advisor members mentioned the train. I stayed on the 29th floor facing the fashion mall. Heard the train once but at around 7-8am for 5seconds - not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Classy place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Clare P
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying at Trump. Not having a casino located in it made it feel much less Vegasy and of course didn't have the foot traffic of other places - which alos means no smoke and no riff raff. It is located off the strip but is within easy walking distance of pretty much everything. The only down side was the resort fee which we felt was overpriced and pretty much for basically internet access, the other items included wih the resort fee where of no value. Staff were extremely helpful and attentive. Rooms were lovely with beautiful decor. As we were staying over the New Year the place was pretty busy but again having no casino and not being directly on the strip made this place a great location. Overall (excluding the resort fee) we really enjoyed the stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. A little out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: Engineer5011
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend getaway. Was off the strip but I like walking and it was not too far away. Was easy enough to walk through the nearby shopping mall to get onto the strip. Rooms were very large and nice as was the lobby. Lots of staff who were very friendly. My only complaint would be the train that would toot its horn every few hours. It was quite loud and woke me up constantly.

Reviews.Title: “The Suite was Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Richy1708
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite and it was fabulous. I'm a very frequent traveller, but this was one of the best hotel rooms I've ever stayed in - with a great view! A well equipped kitchen, dining and lounge area, with a guest bathroom. The bedroom itself was very spacious with a huge en-suite with a hot-tub and TV in! It was decorated and finished to a high standard. The outdoor pool was fun, with good music and great service whilst on your sunbeds. The bucket of beer was quite refreshing under the very warm sun!! Bit of a shame that it doesn't have its own casino - but on the other hand it feels a bit nicer as a result! It's a bit off the strip and the surrounding area was "awaiting development". We booked the rooms through an on-line agent and had a fantastic price. Luxury at a very affordable price! Next time I go back to Vegas, I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Off Strip Beauty”
Reviews.Author: Kittykattastic
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place to stay if you want peice and quite away from the strip. Its a non-smoking hotel, no casino and a classic suntrapped pool. Even though it is 'off-strip' its really walkable, if thats how you get around Vegas, and since its smaller and hotel only there is never a long wait for a cab. There is a free shuttle to Wynn & Ceasers. I have stayed here a few times now, most recently over the new years celebrations. The standard room is delightful and the one bedroom (1.75 bathroom) is very spacious. Totally resonably priced also. DJT knows how to give good Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Grannajan
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in the Trump over the New Year before flying to LA to start a cruise. What a fantastic start to our holiday this hotel was. We arrived in the evening & were very tired after a long flight from the UK, but determined to stay up & see the fireworks. To our delight we were upgraded to a fantastic one bedroomed suite on the 34th floor, on the corner of the building. From our wall-to-wall & floor to ceiling double aspect windows we overlooked the Strip in both directions, and had a fantastic view of the fireworks going off all around us. The apartment was beautiful - one of the two bathrooms was bigger than my bedroom at home ! I could very easily have moved in permanently ! The staff were all very friendly & efficient. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,top quality and classy.”
Reviews.Author: Micmac85
Reviews.Content: Located off the strip so not in the thick of it all but just down the road from the fashion something shopping mall. Great mall with all the great designer shops. It was too cold to use the pool but it looked gorgeous. Loved the gold exterior and the decor inside matched the grandeur of the outside. Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - needs some finishing touches”
Reviews.Author: Howard Y
Reviews.Content: It's great to stay in a luxury hotel in Vegas that isn't also a casino. No smoke in the lobby. It was a more refined feel - not Vegas at all. The area surrounding the hotel is probably under development, which was slowed down by the economic slow-down. Rooms are very nice and I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “just 3 words: In Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Tyrone B
Reviews.Content: Guys, i know it sounds like las vegas is incredibly expensive, but i was able to have a great accommodation with just an hundred bucks in the City View Suite. The room was clean and comfortable. an AMAZING panorama. If you will evere consider the idea to make a trip to Las Vegas, i Suggest this place. I would like to underline guys that i had a Jacuzzi in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Classy!”
Reviews.Author: mother15
Reviews.Content: JMJ Stayed at the Trump in Las Vegas and was totally impressed! The service was the best part . It was refreshing to be in a hotel where everyone knew what their job was! Constantly one of the staff was making sure that the visitors needs were being met-even before you asked. I had meant to ask for a late check out and forgot, but before I was done checking in, I was offered a late check out. It is much quieter than most of Las Vegas hotels so be prepared for that.You are apart from the hustle and bustle of the Strip but not too far, by taxi or a little hike. If shopping is your thing-the Fashion Mall is right across the street . If the gambling bug bites you, the shuttle will take you quickly to the neighboring Wynn. Because we came in late we did not dine at the restaurant so I can not comment on that, but the bar was busy in the spaceous lobby. The resort fee is the current way for the hotels to recoup some funds, and I didn't feel it was fair since we didn't use the pool (limited hours this time of season), the Wi-Fi (free at McDonalds?) and the water and coffee (even cheap end hotels give you water and coffee now). More customers need to complain about this fee! Trump Hotel is not alone in this matter..The room was huge and we were upgraded to a room with a view of the Strip from the 55th Fl! The bathroom was 1st class all the way and so was the kitchen area with refrig., stove top, and micro, etc... The seating area was very well done and the artwork in many areas of the suite was a classy touch. Treat yourself if you can get a reasonable price (we used travel points) to this very classy and clean hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: ellen9
Reviews.Content: Vegas with your loved one is quite a different experience than Vegas with your girlfriends. I absolutely loved my experience at the Trump. The rooms are huge. All are equiped with a mini kitchen. The bathrooms are remarkable - TV in the mirror!?! In addition to the great rooms, there is complimentary valet parking and a shuttle that goes regularly to the Wynn and Caesers. I also loved the fact that it is a smoke-free hotel. This hotel does not have a casino so if gambling is your thing then maybe you do not want to stay here. The only thing I wish they had in the room was a bathrobe.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean – excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: swcaoh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the recent CES convention. I chose Trump because I was there for business with limited time and wanted to be able to get in and out of the hotel quickly (avoiding the long taxi lines and hoards of people at the hotels with casinos). That choice turned out to be perfect. When I arrived I was completely checked in within 5 minutes – no long lines like I have experienced at other hotels in Las Vegas. When I need to leave the hotel to go to meetings, I was able to easily and quickly get a taxi – which is very difficult at other hotels during big conventions (average wait times can run 20 to 30 minutes). Upon check-in I was given a handicap accessible room in which everything was lower to the ground – nice for those who need it- but not for someone over 6 ft. I called the front desk and asked if they could give me a regular room – they immediately sent a bellman with a key to a new room- and upgraded me from a standard room to a one bedroom suite. I didn’t have to argue or complain – they realized the error and without any discussion upgraded me – that is the way top notch establishments are supposed to operate. The furnishings and finishes in the room are top notch (both in the standard room and in the suite) – comfortable, stylish and appropriate furniture - marble floors and tile in the bathroom and shower- granite countertops and stainless appliances in the mini –kitchen - high quality towels and bedding. Bottled water is free as is WiFi service. Best of all, this was THE CLEANIST hotel I’ve ever stayed at in Las Vegas (and I’ve been in most the major high end hotels in that city). Actually – this might have been the cleanest hotel room I’ve ever seen – yes, it was that clean. I ordered room service twice – the food was average for a higher end hotel (as good as you would expect, but not opulent which frankly I appreciated). The delivery was expeditious and the “waiter” set up my meals with white linen table cloths and a level of service and care that you would expect in the restaurant – again what I would expect from a nicer hotel – but not usually available in Las Vegas. Over all, I would definitely choose this hotel again - especially for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: SarahC100
Reviews.Content: Great hotel just off the strip. Will definitely be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: KP1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trump for 3 nights and really liked it. The Check in was quick and easy (pre-booked) and really helpful. Asked for a room away from the train noise having read some reviews and this was not a problem. My parents were also due to stay and the check in girl said she was able to allocate a room near us when they did arrive to check in. The rooms are a great size, great little touch with reception ringing to check if everything is ok after 10 minutes, these rooms have a little kitchen and fridge so we were able to go out to stock up on beer. There is plenty of wardrobe space a little sitting area with a table and the bathroom has a Bathtub big enough for two!! I knew we were going to have to pay a resort fee and this was made clear to me when I booked. I was also advised at check in what this resort fee included Water, coffee, Daily paper, Wi-Fi, shuttle services to Wynn and Caesars all of which I either used or received. (I didn’t use the Spa but my mum booked a massage which she said was excellent and my Dad used the fitness centre and the machines were all in working order) The Pool was open and people were swimming?? But it was a bit too cold for me. The Bar was also a good place to meet in the evening and I loved the happy hour cheap drinks and lovely service again, and got addicted to the Raspberry lemon drop cocktail mmmmmmmmm. We didn’t find the location to be a problem either when going out we strolled though the mall or walked in the “fresh air” to the strip (made a change to walking though a smoky casino). We also made use of the shuttle buses. Trump has even got a couple of cars so when needing a taxi a couple of times we were given the choice of been driven in the trump car which was the same price as the taxi and a lot cleaner and more comfortable. We also ate at the restaurant one lunch I had the Club sandwich which was massive, yummy waffle fries though. Overall I thought Trump was excellent. Excellent service great food and drinks and if I’m ever in Vegas again I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: cool t
Reviews.Content: It was beautiful, really big rooms with jacuzzi. Really comfortable beds. Amazing service. The pool was beautiful and we loved the chips there. Right across the mall so you can easily get some food and shop there. Very close to the strip and everything. The strange but I guess good thing is that it doesn't have a casino in it. So it is less crowded and more relaxing. It also has a shuttle service to the ceasar palace. It is one of the best hotels i've stayed at!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Top quality”
Reviews.Author: beachbum-44thfloor
Reviews.Content: Well maintained and spotless. Decorated and furnished with highest quality furniture and appliances. 1 bed room suite is hugh. Enough room and cabinets to live there. 2 large plasma TV's with many cable choices. Very comfortable and quiet apartment like suites. We wil be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: James_in_MT
Reviews.Content: Trump tower is a great 5-star to stay on the strip. We have stayed at everything from the Gold Nugget to the Encore and lots in-between to use for reference in the review. The location is ok, at the upper end of the strip, but close enough to walk to the Encore/Wynn and the Fashion Mall is right across the street. Trump shuttle runs to the Wynn and Caesars approx. every 15 minutes if you want to get closer to a lot of the action. It took us maybe 10 minutes to walk to Wynn. There is no self parking, you have to valet. It's not too bad to tip and let them do the work anyway. Bellhops were very courteous and attentive. Check-in was a breeze. We asked about not staying within earshot of the train noise, as other reviewers have expressed some problems with it. We upgraded our studio to a one-bedroom suite, as we had a business meeting right in the room. The clerk assured us a room that was away from the noise. The good: 1. Nice kitchen, has a coffee maker. A luxury in Vegas. Most 5-star hotels and others either make you go to the lobby to buy a $6 cup. Would prefer a larger size maker though, it is only a single cup maker, but still better than nothing! 2. Size. Suite was large and spacious. Room for lots of your clothes, food, etc. 3. Bathroom. Huge bathroom, marble, double shower, jacuzzi tub, huge mirrors. I think the bathroom is nicer than Encore/Wynn. 4. Bed. Nice and soft. 5. Service. Exceptional service from all the personnel. Very impressed. Concierge was knowledgeable and helpful. BEST SERVICE SO FAR IN VEGAS. That says a lot. 6. Pool was open in January and its heated to 85F. A lot of other hotels close down the pool in the winter. 7. Fastest elevator in Vegas. Made our ears pop, that's fast. 8. Value. For the price, it is a good value. The bad: Since this is a 5-star, I am going to be a little more critical than a normal 3-4 star hotel. 1. The carpet had a stain in the room. Notable, because it was just staring at you when you walked in. 2. Hard water stain on fixtures. Lime-away needed to remove hard water stains on faucet and showerheads. 3. Drink stain on table in living area. A really bad water stain on the table, looked like it peeled the polyurethane right off the table. 4. Doors are heavy and closed heavy. Pretty loud. 5. Train noise. Heard the train, but only a couple times, didn't really rouse us from sleeping, but I would hate to be on the side with the train... 6. Television in living room did not work. The tv was on, but you could not turn it off nor switch any channels, not matter which buttons you pushed, you couldn't even unplug it! It just had a "input" floating around a blue screen all week. Finally said the heck with it. I did use the treadmill in the exercise/weight room. It was busy, seemed to have a variety of machines. I usually run outdoors, so rooms like this make me queasy anyways. The treadmill froze my ipod. I had to wait until the battery to die to restore it. All is well now. Used the business center to do a little business. Internet seemed a little slow, but they had iMacs, yay! Overall, this is a nice hotel with great service to stay at a reasonable price for a 5-star. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wow factor”
Reviews.Author: thommac
Reviews.Content: place is just awesome. the staff are great and really friendly. every room is fantastic and comes with a jet tub. we unfortunately or fortunately had a "jacuzzi attack" and were upgraded to the 52nd floor strip view, jaw dropping. would most definitely stay here again. Mr Trump has pulled out all the stops and the place is just remarkable. no bad comments!!

Reviews.Title: “Great high end hotel if you want peace and quiet but stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: IVsystem
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Trump Vegas for a show and wasn't planning on gambling but wanted to stay on or right off the strip for convenience, and I appreciate extra space so Ive decided to give this hotel a try. (I usually stay at the Venetian/Pallazzo when in Vegas) Location was a little it of disappointing sine the area around the hotel is pretty newly developed, not very easy to go anywhere on foot. They have a free shuttle to the Forum shop often but during peak hours, wait can be long. Nordstroms is right across the street but there is no cross walk (at least not yet when I was there) so you have to jaywalk like everyone who wishes to go to the mall did which can be dangerous depending on traffic conditions. Rooms are spacious, nicely done in classy way but nothing over the top. It feels like you're at a nice hotel anywhere, not necessarily Vegas. No casino, no giant buffet, no loud parties, and I this is a big charm of this hotel. I still don't like the 'Trump' name just because I don't want to be associated with the image that comes with mr Trump, but based on my past stays at Trump hotels, I think I appreciate their hotels quite a bit. Good restaurants with nice casual ambiance, great staffs, comfy rooms made me feel I'd stay again. This probably would be my first choice if I were to have a family Vegas trip with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
