Reviews.Author: DavoWhytee7
Reviews.Content: During a family holiday in July 2011 we went to Las Vegas for 5 days. We were ranging in age from 14-57. Overall absolutely fantastic hotel and I would definitely go back. Good Points: Very clean Lovely rooms Very close to strip Fantastic Pool No casino in hotel so very quiet Good service from staff Bad Points: Pull out bed for children is a disgrace (ok for a few nights stay but any longer would be a struggle!) Did not get paper every that I paid for (however this was refunded) Bar closed at 12am Would recommend this highly and would stay there again. Lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: brillfrogs1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the nicest we have stayed at anywhere. It offers reasonable rates (we got a great price on line) and the condition, cleanliness, appointments and decor of our room were outstanding! We would definitely consider staying here again should we return to Las Vegas. It was the perfect compromise for my husband and I because he does not gamble (no casino in this hotel) and it offers a shuttle to two casino's for those who like to play the slots, cards, etc. Those who have visited LV know walking along the main strip is an overload for the senses and coming back to this hotel was such a pleasure after taking in the sights. We would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Las Vegas - great rooms”
Reviews.Author: SusieRussell
Reviews.Content: The Trump Hotel in Las Vegas is gorgeous and classy - just what you would expect from Mr. Trump. The ambiance of the entire facility is first class. Starting with the Valet staff and the Door Men --- you feel first class when you enter the Trump Hotel. The one bedroom suite is absolutely wonderful. It has everything you need to stay for one night or a week. Mini kitchen area, lots of closets, even a television right in the bathroom mirror. It is amazing. And, of course, the view from the 18th floor is incredible. You can't go wrong staying at the Trump Hotel. And for me...it was wonderful that there was no gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Let down by the small things”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: Rooms are amazing, hotel is finest quality, and in general staff were very friendly. bathroom was amazing, bed exceptional, ultra clean rooms, very generous size pool area is lovely too, and good location a short walk to the strip we were let down in a few small areas that have meant we reviewed as very good not excellent 1. late night issues are slow to respond. Night 1 we realized there was no remote control for our tv, took almost an hour and three phone calls to get one brought up 2. We added an extra night which created some problems with housekeeping, meaning our room got missed, when we made management aware, we had some free drinks in the bar while our room was serviced at 10pm 3. reservations we found to be arrogant and unaccomodating. We found much cheaper rates on price line.com, and were told by reservations when we called to enquire about their policy of lowest price on their website, that if we could get it cheaper on price line, book it. When we added an extra night, they were condescending when I asked them to price match price line as it was cheaper. 4. We needed to print a couple of things, but at 80c for an A4 page we found this to be excessive given most other hotels offer basic business services for free. 5. Hotel has extremely poor cell phone reception, so we used the in room phone to make a few calls. a 5 minute call to LA was $17 on our bill. I would stay here again, as the good outweighed the bad, but with a little more attention to detail this hotel could be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here 3 times in the past 3 years. We don't gamble or smoke, so this place is perfect for us. The pool area is really nice, and the spa has great deals on massages if you are a repeat client of the hotel. The resort fees are a little much, but factoring everything in, its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were excellent but a couple of issues.”
Reviews.Author: Kiez70
Reviews.Content: We booked two studio rooms as we have 3 children however we were encouraged to upgrade to two one bedroon suites. The girl at reception was lovely and very helpful so we agreed. We got to our rooms to find they were not adjoining as were the intial booking which meant my husband and I had to sleep in seperate rooms with the children. We rang within minutes of arriving however they said our initial rooms were already booked out??? Regardless, the rooms were brilliant. Very luxurious. Definately 5* The television in the bathroom mirror could not get my 7 yr old son out of the bath. The views were great and the non smoking and no casino was an absolute plus for us. Its not an issue the distance from the strip, just walk through Fashion Show Mall (which we loved). The main negative I could comment on was the shower. We had to leave the water running for alteast 10-15 minutes before it would warm up. I hated watching the water run down the drain. ( dont get room number 3210) My sister was only a few doors down and hers was fine. Maintenance said it ws a black spot in the hotel. Had a slight issue with a house keeping woman. I rang after housekeeping took my daughter's travel blanket, that appeared slightly similar to the rooms. She was quite rude and said "Go to Security" and made no effort to assist when it was only recently taken.Didn't bother, lost the blanket. Overall though, best rooms we stayed in on our one month trip of the U.S and some lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing, and well-equipped hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tess S
Reviews.Content: Lovely lobby, very helpful staff, gorgeous lilies in the hallways, and the best hotel rooms I've seen in a while. All rooms have insanely comfortable king beds and a sofa bed. My mom slept on the sofa bed, which the maid had done up , complete with a feather bed to top the mattress. She said she never slept better. The bathroom are the size of small bedrooms. They include two sinks, a separate toilet stall, an oversize marble shower, and a jacuzzi style bathtub big enough for two average-adults with room to spare. I am packing lots of extra weight, and even I felt like I was in a mini swimming pool with jets. It was heaven. There is also a tv built into the bathroom mirror, which is a nice perk. The best feature of the rooms is the mini kitchen, which includes a stove, a fridge, a microwave, a toaster, a coffee maker, and a sink. We bought groceries, and made hot breakfast every morning. Ask the front desk, and hotel staff will bring pots, pans, plates, silverware, etc to stock your kitchen. It allows to take leftovers home from Las Vegas's great restaurants, and really makes the hotel feel like home. It's little bit of a walk to Las Vegas Boulevard, but very doable. Also, a free shuttle takes guests to the Wynn and Caesar's Palace, and you can get around easily from there. Or, you can get a cab if you prefer. Over all, my five nights here were fantastic. I'd recommend Trump to anyone looking for a peaceful and welcoming alternative to the bustling casino hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: jpark10
Reviews.Content: Quite nice, especially if you can get a good rate, which you often can. Close to the Wynn and is very peaceful since it doesnt have a casino. The rooms are nice and clean. It's not quite as swanky as wynn or cosmo/aria but overall still a great place especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “What a mistake!”
Reviews.Author: bill n
Reviews.Content: Avoid Trump at all costs! Gee, where to start! For $265 a night, I had the pleasure of having a sink that would not drain, an iron with a cord that would not stay detracted and music channels on the TV that didnt work. I ordered room service and was told it would arrive in less than 30 minutes, After an hour and a half I called to find out when the meal would arrive (mind you I placed the order at 2:00 PM, not exactly a busy time for the kitchen) and I was told "they are putting the finishing touches on it." When it arrived, I ask the servant what took so long, and was told it had been prepared on time, but "got lost" during the shift change. I wasn't charged for the meal.....but then again I shouldn't have been when the BLT contained a whopping ONE slice of tomato.........I am NOT kidding! The noise of the trains that run at night is deafening. I used to live in a suburban town that had 3 seperate train tracks within 2 miles and it was JUST like a homecoming. DO NOT ACCEPT a room facing south. Doors in the hallway are entrances into 2 adjacent rooms. When ANY door within 50 feet is closed, the sound is so loud that it muzzles the trains!!! The decor is good and the staff pleasant, but if you want value for your dollar, this is NOT the hotel for you! If you have no desire to get a decent nights sleep or a meal when you are hungary, then this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Very Mixed”
Reviews.Author: pablot
Reviews.Content: This hotel falls a little short of being a 5 star hotel but overall its quite nice. Good facilities, no casino and the staff are OK. Room layout and size are great. Two BIG issues. [1] Almost no mobile phone signal inside the hotel which make it really difficult to lead a normal business life if you are staying here. [2] THE NOISE. The noise was a the real issue and I hardly slept for the 4 nights I stayed. There are 2 noises. The first is clear the Train and other road noises. For some reason this thing blows its warning horn at around 12am, 2.30PM and 3.30PM. Why it has to do this is beyond me, does it cross some roads? There were also some other noises which I think were something to do with the high speed lifts. You can even hear police sirens and car horns and that was from the 31st floor. The hotel were great and moved me from the back of the hotel to the front. When I complained about the noise their response was instant (they must be used to it) and they put me on the 51st floor. Although this was better you can still hear the noises. I am really surprsied that building of this quality has such poor sound insulation. Not good at all. Sadly I would not stay there again and the noise is the only reason.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AussieinCHC
Reviews.Content: Very, very large well appointed rooms. I was very concerned about staying here after reading TA reviews, however my experience was a most positive one. Staff friendly, and the hotel was very nice. Location is a little isolated but only a 10 minute walk to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “"Lovely Calm and Classy Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: pbowler4
Reviews.Content: In September 2011 I visited Las Vegas with my daughter for a 'special birthday'. Having stayed previously at what is considered the 'Top Hotels' ie; Wynn, Encore, Bellagio and Ceasars.Palace. and many more!! - we stayed at Trump International Hotel for 6-days - and cannot praise it enough - especially with no casino - just a very enjoyable pianist, The Hotel Staff were very welcoming and helpful, the accommodation was excellent, with the furnished kitchen and large bathroom - especially the white fluffy towels. The pool and foodbar were lovely. Our room partly overlooked the shopping mall and the pool. Everything was definitely 5-star. A unexpected plus - was the 'courtesy shuttle bus' to the 'strip' and the shopping mall opposite was a bonus. Have already recommended to family and friends back home in the UK Patricia Cheshire UK

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, But 5 Star???”
Reviews.Author: Sugarsht
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are nice, but with couch cushions missing (nowhere to be found!), floor having stains, and no extra blankets in the room, I question how it remains a 5 star. The room was clean and the hotel staff was courteous. We ordered room service and the food was good, not exceptional, but good. The location is off the strip, so you do have to walk, but it's not too bad. To me, when I'm in Vegas, I expect to walk a bit. As a 5 star hotel, I expect that rating to be upheld in all areas. Staff should ensure that when staying at a 5 star hotel, I'm getting what I pay for. If I wanted couch cushions missing, I can go down the street to a dump and get what I pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, so so location.”
Reviews.Author: Jeck L
Reviews.Content: The Trump hotel is one of the cheapest 5-star hotels you can find closest to the strip, but don't let the price fool you, this hotel is worth it! We arrived around 10:00am in the morning and luckily we were able to check in that early. Everyone was very polite and I felt very welcomed. This is also one of the few hotels that don't have a casino on the floor, which can be good or bad, depending on your needs. There is a train that is on one of the sides of the hotel, but we asked for a room farthest away from the train and the check-in person was happy to help us with that. Needless to say we didn't hear any train from our room. The rooms are nice and clean. There's a jet-tub in the bathroom and it was an experience! We went to the Wynn hotel later and even that didn't have these tubs! The only thing I didn't like about this hotel is that it's pretty far off from the strip if you decide to walk that is. It's about a 5 minutes walk across to the mall and 10 minutes walk to the strip. Although that sounds short, if you're going to walk on the strip, you will get tired fast. Bring walking shoes! If I had a choice again, I would probably choose this hotel again, depending on what I will be doing at Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “You're Fired, Donald!”
Reviews.Author: Jhoge123
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Trump greeted me with a cryptic, sleazy form containing a "resort fee" and refused to give me accommodation without paying this fee. Since I paid for my room in advance I was not impressed with the Donald's business ethics. Otherwise, it's not a terrible hotel. It's just very hard to get over that awful first impression.

Reviews.Title: “If Donald Did Hotel's They Would Be Like Ths One, oh...He Does!”
Reviews.Author: OleDunk
Reviews.Content: The Trump makes some big claims, and for the high room rate I had to pay (as Vegas hotels busy), I hoped it would meet it's claims! Unfortunately it did not.  The positives -  It is an impressive and grand style hotel with pleasant staff and large room with kitchen area and comfy bed.  Away from the hectic non stop strip,  yet close enough to not be "out of it". No casino, so more relaxed than the big strip hotels, It was nice to not have the constant pressure to tip everyone for everything,  that goes with these hotels. The let downs - Given an ease of access room without needing it or being advised. Shower much too low for me to use. Wardrobe too short to hang trousers etc. This was not a great issue but I was never asked if this ok and my request to relocate was not managed well, so I didn't bother in the end.  Great room for Warwick Davies to use if he is ever in town. Hotel could not cope with breakfast queues, people hanging around lobby waiting for tables all very disorganised and a long wait. When seated food and service was good. The hotel is noisy, not from within, but outside street and train (yes you can hear trains in the night - I also heard other people discussing this at breakfast) noises seem loud. It's as though the windows are not sound proof. I asked for at check in, and was assured my room was a quite one, so I can only presume the whole hotel suffers from this noise penetration.  The whole reception area has the smell of cheap air fresheners. I presume some kind of automatic aromatic system is used. I don't think it is needed, it smells like they are covering a bad smell. All in all not a bad hotel,  just not in the league it try's to position itself in. For my stay, it did not justify the rate paid. $200 per night less and I would not be so critical. Oh, and not to forget the dreaded resort fee! Hoteliers, If a charge is not discretionary, then include it in the room rate. Customers will appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SLC1622
Reviews.Content: Love to stay at the Trump. It is so refreshing in the Las Vegas world to have a hotel without the gaming part. It always looks and smells so clean and the employees always have a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Good five star hotel, but the service?”
Reviews.Author: nonabidut
Reviews.Content: Almost everything at this hotel screamed five star... well... almost. The modern and simplistic design with touch of luxury was accomplished by comfy leather sofa, spacious living room, decorative figure of a horse head (nice touch really! it kind of embodies pride and ego, which fit the owner's taste), gold accented mirror in the bathroom - complete with tv (see pictures). Overall, the room was lovely and made me reluctant to go out.. Service wise... I imagine hotel like Trump must not disappoint. However, there were few unfavourable things that happened. When I first arrived with luggage, I noticed that there were not any bellman to be seen, in fact, no one to open the door for the guests (which in four stars hotels, there usually are). While the check-in process went smoothly, They did check me into a dirty room first time. Furthermore, the staffs did not appear to be very friendly, but again it could be the las vegas hospitality.. The hotel is located at the end of the strip and to walk to the centre is probably taking 10 minute. So for people looking for exclusivity, this is the right choice. I myself, prefer a hotel that is right at the centre since the walking took forever for me (im a slow walker) and any other hotels at the centre is mostly sky scrapper anyway, so staying in high floor wont trouble would eliminate noise issue. Another thing to mention is that, the electricity shut off automatically at check out time (11.00), which I think is very cool and a good way to discourage people to stay past check out time! Overall, good five star hotel, but the service?

Reviews.Title: “Great Place. One little flaw”
Reviews.Author: Jayda L
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, stayed for 4 nights and cannot fault the quality of the hotel and the room was amazing, and i loved being able to watch tv in the mirror of the bathroom. The only small annoyance with this hotel is its location. Its not on the main strip, its about a 5 minute walk to the strip where you meet treasure island. Other than that we would return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pure class and sophistication, would be a pleasure to return.”
Reviews.Author: mrsclairemackay2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our Honeymoon. We have not one bad word to say about this hotel. It's an oasis of calm to return to after leaving the strip and just a short 5 minute walk away. I would recommend the strip view rooms as the view is beautiful. Every single member of staff there are helpful and friendly and Kelly in reservations was incredibly helpful to us. The rooms are big and spacious, well designed and spotless. The bathroom is amazing, the tub in particular! The bed gave us the best night's sleep ever. We appreciated the hotel not having a casino and we would return here or go to any other Tump hotel in a heartbeat. You can get cheaper hotels on the strip but for the price you pay at the Trump you are getting a true 5* at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for a long stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: barrypr
Reviews.Content: Anytime I travel to Las Vegas it is usually for 5 or more days. While most if not all the name Strip hotels are more than nice and many very nice I find them noisy, large, and much too busy for a longer stay making them uncomfortable IMHO. The Trump is truly a high end luxurious and economic indulgence. The rooms are huge, comfortable and give you the feel of a luxury apartment. The studio is larger than most hotel suites even in Vegas and is appointed with all you need for a long stay. Each room is outfitted with a small kitchen area and SubZero fridge. The bathrooms have a TV integrated in the mirror and have a truly fabulous bathtub and walkin shower. The furnishings are well appointed and the decorations and artwork are not glued down. The location is perfect as it is a block off the strip but directly across the street from the Fashion Show mall which also provides close parking if needed and close to several eateries. The staff is extremely accommodating and friendly. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning suite... One small problem.”
Reviews.Author: barbadiantraveler
Reviews.Content: For couples looking for an amazing aesthetic stay- calm, upscale, convenient for a reasonable price during Las Vegas slow times-this is it. Smartphone signals (a problem in much of Vegas) are not to be found at the Trump. Concierge confirmed that people tell them all day, every day about it. Evidently the gold- colored metallic coating on the building has something to do with it. We hope they figure it out. WiFi is very good around the hotel and included in the resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to say”
Reviews.Author: Marsupial23
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights and would recommend highly. Huge room and bathroom with everything you need. No casino, so very quiet! we had flown in from Australia, so were very tired, we had no trouble sleeping at all, very comfy bed and no noise at all. Shuttle very good to either Wynn Casino or Caesars palace. Opposite huge shopping mall. Easy to get around from here. Easy access to cabs also. Only complaint was that we returned to our room late one night after being out all day to discover our room had not been serviced. A call to housekeeping brought someone to our room very quickly and presto it was all done for us. Apparently it was a computer glitch. SUV ride to the airport was offerred to us upon checkout, for less than the cab fare, and much cleaner too. Good place to stay if you want to get away from all the action for a short while. would stay here again, definately

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel 5 mins walk to strip!”
Reviews.Author: boyo1927
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect as there is no casino like most top hotels in Vegas! A high quality 5 star hotel with superb suite rooms that I huge in size offering working kitchen and a bathroom to dream of! Included massive spa bath and like the tv in mirror touch too! $7 dollars for a 24 hour bus pass is good value as the strip is pretty big and those who struggle to walk can simply hope on and off the "deuce" double decker buses that run frequently 24 hours! Also take the bus to downtown freemont street where its cheaper gift shops, food and drink showing old school vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Starting to Get Over My Anti-The Donald Bias”
Reviews.Author: mudandlumber
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and loved it. Gorgeous hotel with great service. Lack of a casino is no big deal with Wynn within walking distance and shuttle available. Shopping mall directly across the street is a plus. Stopped at the lobby bar for a late night drink and stayed for four. Highly recommend it for the drinks and lovely servers. Room was up to Trump standards. Nicely appointed with a comfortable bed and great view of strip and mountains. Late checkout and SUV ride to airport was an unexpected plus.

Reviews.Title: “Best of our trip.”
Reviews.Author: adw
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, immaculate suite with an amazing view across the city. Pool was great with large comfy double beds and 2 hot tubs. Bar was the only disappointing thing in that we went for a meal out then returned to the peace and tranquility of the hotel away from the madness of the strip for a night cap - only to be told the bar was closed at 12! We could've ordered room service but that added 20% plus $3 per drink so decided to go without. Would recommend if you want a bit of luxury away from the noise and crowds - they're walking distance (or a free shuttle ride) away!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: trailertrashsandy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trump international Las Vegas in Oct. of 2011. Great place! Friendly staff who were willing to assist you however they could (offered more free water, directions...just about anything you asked for) When we arrived we asked for the highest room in our catergorie and where given a room on the 56th floor strip view....what a view! This is a non gaming hotel, but short walk or shuttle to casinos. It was very nice to get away from all the action for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay..Big rooms, clean smoke free air!”
Reviews.Author: Hippo888
Reviews.Content: Short stay at las vegas after Hawaii cruise. Lovely hotel. Rooms are big and spacious, clean with excellent amenities. Can't fault the trump. Enjoyed the jacuzzi bath tub and tv in the bathroom mirror. Did order breakfast room service once and was very pricey as expected. Used the shuttle bus to get to hotels on strip but never took it back to hotel as we was not sure where the pick up point was. Just took taxi back. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManxieP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trump from 22nd December to 30th December. Room was lovely and more like a suite. The staff were professional, friendly and very helpful. The reception staff, doormen and the shuttle bus drivers could not do enough for us. They did not have a casino, which was good when you had had a long day and you did not want the hustle and bustle of casino noise. The Trump was a no smoking hotel, and although myself and my partner smoked, it was no hardship taking the lift down in the morning and last thing at night. I would highly recommend this hotel and we will definately be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Trump never dissapoints!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelChic
Reviews.Content: The Trump experience... is always incredible! From the moment you walk into the lobby... the fabulous scent, carries you in.. The service is impeccable! The rooms will make you feel like royalty! There is no casino in this hotel, but don't let that keep you from the experience! There's free shuttle to casinos. And the mall, is across the street! The pool is wonderful, and so is the poolside service! The rooms are Luxurious! And you should definately take the private car, to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rogelia426
Reviews.Content: The Trump International has great views either of the mountains or the strip, a good bar with happy hour nighly, shuttle service to the Wynn and Caesars Palace. Fantastic spa and large pool. All round a great hotel with excellent service and a shopping center opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you are not looking or trying to avoid a casino in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Allen T
Reviews.Content: First off the rooms are amazingly HUGE. There is a full kitchen. Basically a suite. The bathrooms are lush and even have a tv inside the mirrors. This is my 3ed stay at this hotel and everytime it has been the same. The staff is very professional. There is always water in the rooms. No casino but the wynn and TI are 5 min away. Across the street from the massive mall. The price is amazingly affordable. Great hotel in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just moments off the strip”
Reviews.Author: AussieMandM
Reviews.Content: A great hotel thats just 1 block off the strip. We were checked in promptly and found the hotel staff extremely helpful and friendly. We were walked to our lift and really felt at home. We stayed in one of the standard king rooms but to be honest, it was a really nice room. Massive in fact. Kitchen facilities included a microwave, fridge, coffee machine, hotplates to cook on, sink, cutlery, glasses, champagne buckets and more. It really was like an apartment than just a hotel room. The bathroom was fantastic, huge. The spa bath easily fit two in and the bathroom mirror has a built in television to watch as well. Very fancy! The was an ice machine on our floor as well which was very convenient. Both bell desk and concierge were very helpful and friendly! The property in in a great location and is right opposite fashion show mall... It also provides shuttle buses every 15 minutes between Wynn and Ceasar's which was also super convenient. Very convenient after a long days shopping or partying. The wi-fi was very fast compared to other hotels we have stayed at. We chose this hotel because it was just off the strip so a little quieter than the others. It also was no smoking inside which we preferred. I am staying at the Bellagio currently and will be reviewing it shortly but lets just say the rooms at the Trump win hands down! No doubt about it! Hope that helps you all.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted...”
Reviews.Author: khillz28
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel because they were the only place that would guarrantee us a 2 bedroom STRIP view penthouse...we were not disappointed! Wonderful staff..worked with us through a small mishap. First day we came back to our penthouse after being gone all day to find we had no maid service. Called front desk; they offered us a bar credit; if we wanted to leave room so maid service could take care of room. No problem...always up for free drinks & apps. Through the whole stay I was very impressed with the level of service; even through NYE with all the drunks. Room was beautiful; the only thing I wished for was a large coffee pot. 2 huge bedrooms, living room, dinning room/kitchen, with 3 bathrooms, floor to ceiling windows in both bedrooms and living room..beautiful! And the NYE fireworks were awesome from the 60th floor, we had a great show, which is what we had planned for. thank you for a wonderful NYE!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry Mr. Trump, your fired!”
Reviews.Author: hilliardtx
Reviews.Content: My best friend choose our lodging this trip, she watches and enjoys The Apprentice. So she was excited to stay at the Trump Hotel for our trip to Las Vegas. I thought it would be a great experience and would enjoy it. I was left feeling a little disappointed. I expected the Trump Hotel to give me the overwhelming WOW factor. I can honestly say, it did not. It's a nice hotel, don't get me wrong, it just didn't WOW me. The little details that you expect from the Trump Hotel were what was missing. The jacuzzi tub was able to be filled to the brim with as much hot water as I could fill it with; the next day I was lucky to get enough hot water (luke warm water) to wash my hair.

Reviews.Title: “For <$100/night (incl $20 resort fee), can't go wrong.”
Reviews.Author: medset
Reviews.Content: Trump is a nice, non-gaming hotel right across the street from the Fashion Show mall with Nordstrom literally across the street. A short walk to the Wynn/Encore. Rooms are nice (some furniture a little worn) but no big deal. Check for great deals during the winter months. You won't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “golden glitzy and good value”
Reviews.Author: londongirl05
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just off the strip, only a 2-3 minute walk away from the Wynn and Treasure Island. The hotel is well maintained and clean and modern. The rooms were huge and they offered a great view over the strip. The best thing about this hotel (for me) was that it didnt have a casino, so the lobby area remained peaceful and relaxed. I dont plan on going back to Vegas, but if I did find myself here in the future, I would consider staying at the Trump again.

Reviews.Title: “Trump Las Vegas poor security and poor service”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: The accommodation was ok, however we had a never ending saga regarding a stolen Ipad and believe it or not we still have not received a return phone call in 6 months after logging a security report. We pulled up at the motel and handed our keys to a trump parking attendant who parks the car for you. As we lined up in reception my wife realised she had left our iPad on the back seat, I looked out and our car was still sitting outside, when I walked outside to get the ipad i realised they had not locked the car. I asked them to move and lock the car. When I checked the car our iPad which we had left on the back seat accidentally was already gone in the space of less then 5 minutes. Well, while its not ideal, the worst is still to come. We logged a security report, and have contacted the motel about 6-7 times both from the US and then back in Australia (at a cost), each time they promise to get the head of security to call us back regarding our report and feedback. While they are apologetic we still have not received a call in 6 months and still no feedback. Not good enough service and security given you pay the money for this service. If they at least called us back even if we could get no compensation we would have appreciated it. Sorry guys but I'd be staying somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “is trump lacking?”
Reviews.Author: Exploration-2day
Reviews.Content: i visited this property twice before my recent stay: nice size suites, no casinos = "quiet" lobby and super friendly staff. staff is stil friendly but the room... well, by entering there was this nasty smell, that would not go away. we flushed the zink to make sure, no smell was coming from there. later it turned out, the kitchen has not been cleaned after the last guest, so maybe the smell was from the old food in the trash can. that cleaned up - the smell was still there all the way the staff and front desk were notified about the process, but all they had to say was; "i'll make a note of that" (!!!) it wasn't until next day, when checking out, a man who has not been involved in the process credited the resort fee ($20). i think, they should have offered a clean, not smelling room from the very beginning. the hotel was not sold out.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: islandhopper09
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here just after Christmas 2011 for a little R&R after the holidays. OK...a few things you need to know about this place prior to staying here. Make sure you ask for a quiet room. I read some reviews about guests being upset due to the sound of the train. We asked for a quiet room in advance and were very pleased. The hotel is smoke free which is perfect since we don't smoke. It was so great to have nice towels that didn't smell like smoke and bleach like some of the other resorts on the strip. Main lobby is decked out and very pretty. Wanted to get a Trump shirt at the gift shop, but they didn't have my size available. Had lunch at DJTs, nothing to write home to mom about. Pool was heated during winter months which was nice. You will be charged a resort fee of around $20 a night. Now the bad stuff...for some reason our bed leaned to the left side like it was broken. I asked someone in housekeeping to come look at it and nothing was done about it. Instead of signs that you would hang on the door, they have a little button you push from the inside of your room that lights up when you want your room cleaned. Ours was lit up and we didn't get our room cleaned once while we were there. We still left a tip though. When I made the reservation I was told that the resort had a 24 hour shuttle to the Wynn since there is no casino at Trump. This was confirmed again a second time upon check in. When we got into the shuttle van, the driver told us to make sure we meet him at the Wynn location by 11:50pm. I asked him if the shuttle ran 24 hours. He said no. We walked back to the resort at 1:00am. Also, there is a TV in the mirror of the bathroom which is kinda neat. The only problem was that we couldn't turn it off and it stayed on the whole time we were there. All the other buttons on the TV remote worked except the On/Off button. It worked well as a nightlight. The spa tub was great which we used. The bathroom lights had a layer of dust on them that anyone would notice right away. They must not have been cleaned since the hotel first opened. I cleaned them myself (wait...I'm on vacation remember?) The elevators here are the fastest rides in all of Vegas. We were on the 22nd floor and it took maybe 5 seconds to get there. Bathrobes should also have been in our room, but those were missing too. Overall, not too bad, but don't think we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, calm, luxurious and non-smoking hotel”
Reviews.Author: tcake1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a non-smoking, non-gambling and luxurious with attentive service. It is a refuge of quiet from the smokey and noisy gambling hotels. The basic room is a suite with a sitting area, very large marble bathroom and complete with a small kitchen. We had our breakfast in the hotel and while one might find cheaper food, the quality and service here is excellent. This is a dog-friendly hotel with size restrictions. While we didn`t have a pet with us, those we saw in the hotel were well behaved.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and Peace”
Reviews.Author: AnnKat_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights at the end of November beginning of December.We chose the hotel because it was off the strip and also because it had no casino and was non smoking. After visiting other hotels it confirmed my decision. Having to drag yourself through smoky casinos with people mindlessly feeding money into slot machines to just check in would have been dreadful. The Trump is luxury, class and peace in Las vegas. I hope that it does not change because there is a section of the community that like this style of hotel ....EVEN in Las Vegas The check in was quick and efficient no queue at all. The room was large, quiet and with more facilities than we needed ( Blender microwave etc). Lovely big bathroom. The bed was comfortable. We used room service which was okay and had good breakfasts in the dining room. Food was pretty good......certainly much better than the frequently recommended "Buffets" at other hotels that were quite frankly were expensive overworked dishes that are picked over by hundreds of people. The free shuttle over to the strip was great and made it easy to get over to the strip when you wanted to. All the staff were polite friendly and respectful. Yes I paid a resort fee but the room rate was very inexpensive so it all balances out. I stay here ANYTIME it was great. If you want smoke, queues, casinos and buffets don't stay here leave it for people who appreciate the calm and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Would return to the Trump”
Reviews.Author: ChloesMomBetsey
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in suite (room) 5712 for 3 nights over Christmas for a girls' getaway after using Hotwire to book a $95 room there. The only other place that I have stayed in LV is the Cosmopolitan. The Cosmo is a trendy property to people watch. The Trump is an old school place to purse dog watch.I have never seen so many. The hotel is service oriented. We only had one snag in ordering non-feather pillows. They arrived for the second night of our stay, not the first, which resulted in a terrible night's sleep and mass consumption of benadryl. (in full disclosure, it was Christmas eve.) Other than that, service was impeccable. If you are looking for trendy, this isn't the place. It has an understated elegance.. yeah.. who would expect that of The Donald? It is more "NY" than it is "Vegas." Negatives? The train- upgrade to the non train side is $25- consider it. The shower tiles are slippery. No in room safe- big omission, imo. They have only King beds and sofabeds.) It would be nice to have other configurations. Dogs, if you don't like them. Positives? (long list) Comfortable room. A mini-kitchen, if you wish to cook. A serene lobby. It is a pleasant place to sit with a morning paper and coffee to purse dog watch. Convenient shuttles to center strip- decent location. Reasonably priced breakfast. Across from Fashion Show Mall. Very quiet room (aside from the train.) No minibar. Complimentary bottled water and in room coffee. Service oriented staff that exceeded the Cosmo's in the first minute and a half that we were there.. Dogs, if you like them. Yes, it is off strip. However, rooms are probably still a closer walk to the strip than if you were to stay at one of the big on strip properties. Even though they offered a shuttle to the Wynn, it is a comfortable walk either on the sidewalk (during the day) or through the mall (business hours.) I liked the non-smoking non-gaming atmosphere. It was a get away from the Vegas insanity. Also, yes.. there is a resort fee. It was not out of line for the amenities it provided- shuttle transportation, wi-fi and work out room. We did not use the spa, work out room or pool.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: Machilus
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to Vegas and Trump gave me a nice impression. Everyone knows that the hotels in strips are very luxury so is Trump. After a short waiting, I was taken care of by a nice gentleman. He upgraded me to a nice suite when he knew that I was first time here and wanted me to be happy. The room was extremely nice, floor to roof windows, nice sofa, especially the restroom, it was amazing!! The bed was very nice!! The bad part is the the room service was really slow. I complained that the room had some smell and the agent said he would ask the house keeper to see. However, until I left an hour later, no one came. The location of hotel was not very good, compared with others and no casino there. They provide courtesy bus to Wynn Casino and Center of strip. It seems there was no buffet in the hotel, but I am not sure. About the resort fee, yes. It is 19.95+tax per day and mandatory . To me it is a little bit expensive. The fee covers the internet, courtesy bus, fitness access, 25 off 150 at SPA, 2 waters and daily newspaper. If you could use first 3 well, it is worth.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Trump Tower Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: EvelynSinenengSmith
Reviews.Content: just spectacular! by Evelyn Sineneng-Smith -------------

Reviews.Title: “Golden Delicious”
Reviews.Author: faye k
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our Honeymoon to America in October and as we stayed here first ,no other hotel was going to stand a chance! No, this was not right in the middle of the strip and no it did not have a casino (if that's what you want stay at the Bellagio or MGM) but there is no getting away from the fact that this hotel is made with luxury in mind. We were upgraded to a suite which was just like having your own apartment and the perfect place to come back to. If you like modern, chic, glamorous and exceptionaly clean hotels then this is the one for you. 5* all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Trump your average hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: pip207
Reviews.Content: It was our last night in Las Vegas we had just returned from a visit to the Giant Redwoods which was fantastic, we were going to fly home the next evening, we arrived at about nine am booked in while the bags were taken from the hire car and put in our room. Its a very glitzy place everything is golda nice foyer with seating on the right side if you fancy a drink or coffee etc, the room was palacial large king size bed comfy chairs dressing table with chair wardrobe, robe inside etc, fridge drinks etc, coffee tea making facility and seperate bathroom and shower which you could have parked a car in spar bath, wc and built in tv in the huge mirror over the twin washbasins all marble bathroom very nice. The bed was very good we sleept very well, we used the roof top pool area the next morning which had palm trees around the outer walls and in beds beneth the palms, we had a king size wicker lounger with a thick mattress very nice all towels were provided and sunshades if required, a waiter service for drinks or food was provided or you could go into the bar area and get your own if prefered. The staff could not do enough for you and were very friendly, the pool was a good size and plenty of sun beds etc, the only down side was at approx ten am the disco man appeared and played loud music till six pm, we paid a small supliment to extend our room hire untill four pm and then had a bus to the airport. All in all it was a very nice stay we even met Mr Donald Trump by the pool area. You will find hotel rates ok mid week but weekends they can rocket.

Reviews.Title: “amazing room”
Reviews.Author: may0529
Reviews.Content: i'm a fanatic when it comes to rooms. even if i dont spend much time in there. i wanna know i can come back to a nice room.i liked that they had an outer door that led to the foyer that led to your door. i didnt have to worry about those pizza ads making their way under my door. the bed was extremely comfy and the bathroom was amazing.i love the spa style tub we had in our room! house keeping did an amazing job cleaning and didn't even get mad when we asked for extra towels. only downfall is valet parking only. its best if you call down ahead of time to get your car out

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: leinie731
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Trump hotel. We have to say it was beautiful. We've stayed at quite a few hotels in Vegas. The lobby was a very understated yet posh. The check in was quick and friendly. We opted for the up grade to a suite. The room was gorgeous!!!! The bathroom alone was jaw dropping. We appreciated the 2nd bathroom, as we were traveling as a family of 5. Speaking of traveling with children, we really liked the "no casino" and no smoking aspect of this hotel. It was wonderful not to have to worry about security ushering us from certain areas or about lung cancer and stuffy noses. Oh train noise... I made sure to ask for a room away from the train noise. The young lady checking me in was very gracious and didn't deny at all the noise that others so frequently speak about. We only heard the train once during our stay, and it was hardly noticeable. My husband and I both kept our ears open, waiting for it the entire stay because we were wondering what all the fuss was about. As far as walking distance to the strip... eh we wouldn't do it, kids and all. But we did trek across the street to the mall, that was pretty easy even with the stroller. My husband said the bar was nice, he did bring me a couple of drinks and they didn't skimp on the liquor. What else? Well if you've already been to Vegas and have experienced the "Strip" hotels and aren't wanting to gamble in the hotel you are staying at, then I'd say you'll enjoy the Trump as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Trump knows Luxe”
Reviews.Author: OCdesigner
Reviews.Content: We love Vegas for the accommodations. Vegas resorts have set the bar high with the competition. Trump tops them all! Pool is great...try the spa...DJT Restaurant is delicious Spend some time in your suite- the kitchens and baths are incredible!

Reviews.Title: “we enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: tesa_jones
Reviews.Content: we got a 50th floor city view room. the room was clean in general, and i did appreciate their attentive service. if there is something i want to make a suggestion about, it has to be a more detail-oriented housekeeping habit. our shower head was covered with hard water deposits, which is kinda gross to touch when i wanted to change the water-jet mode. we did hear the train going by once, but since we were so tired, it didn't really bother us that much.

Reviews.Title: “Truly the best hotel - not a bad word to say!”
Reviews.Author: MILLAR86
Reviews.Content: An amazing experience, the best staff, truly helpfull and good at their job. Knew everything we needed and nothing was out of there way. Room was amazingly clean and lovely. Cleaned perfectly every day. Such comfortable beds, the best bathroom I've ever seen anywhere! Great pool and pool area- with a dj. Great location so close to everything and nice to go back to, as no noisey casino, which means no smoking. After busy days out it was nice to go back to a peacfull and lovely hotel. Food also very nice! I would LOVE to visit again some day.

Reviews.Title: “Trump International Las Vegas Rocks!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MickyEssex
Reviews.Content: My Wife , Myself and our Son Jason stayed at the Trump International Las Vegas recently and what a stay!! The service from all the staff was second to none. The room was huge and you had everything you needed. The food was great and all the staff were so helpfull. There was a special Lady that helped us with our reservation, as our Son is mentally and physically handicapped. Her name is Barbara Blue and she made our stay a very special one!! Donald if you are reading this please make her employee of the year. If you want to stay in a luxurious hotel, with no casino, and be looked after 100% go stay at the Trump Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury all the way.....”
Reviews.Author: GreyNomadsBendigo
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Trump International in Las Vegas, it was off the strip and very quiet with a magnificient strip view from our room....Highly recommend for a touch of luxury

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Olga N
Reviews.Content: The good news was that we booked through priceline and got a good deal on Trump International; otherwise it would have been a total downer. If I rate the hotel compared to all hotels, it gets 3 points, if compared to 5-star hotels, it gets 2. Good things: + Rooms look nice and we thought the decor was well done + No casino + No smoking + Excellent service at check-in: professional and nice, even appropriately funny + Room service was very discrete: we never ran into them, even though we left at different times of the day, and they came every day + Nice outdoor heated pool and hot tub, which we used even though it was rather cold out Bad things: + Having booked and paid on priceline, we were surprised that a $19/night resort fee was slapped on. We inquired with the manager and got an answer that basically amounted to "here is a copy of the form you signed at check-in (they bothered to actually attach the form!), and in it it says that you agree to the fee; you could have chosen to go elsewhere at that time." Right. Here we are with our bags, tired after the flight from New York, we come to the esteemed Trump International, having paid for 3 nights through priceline, we see the small print, and off we go looking for a different hotel. Not funny. + The bed was way too soft; we had to take off a special mattress that was on top of other two mattresses - helped a little + The water in the shower would be too cold for a while, then too hot for a while - while you were freezing - every time + The food in the restaurant was not good (meaning, not bad for the stomach, but just not tasty at all) - overcooked pasta and burger; we were one of two couples in the restaurant at lunch time; one of the forks on the table was dirty - do yourself a favor and walk over to the Wynn + The advertised shuttle bus that runs to the Wynn and to Caesar's wanted to go to the Wynn all the time (we needed Caesar's), so we had to stage a mini revolution for it to do what was promised to us by the concierge + It was dusty, but maybe that's just Vegas: even though they dusted every morning, I could see dust on all surfaces by the end of the night

Reviews.Title: “Trump Is Greedy”
Reviews.Author: ConstanceSLC
Reviews.Content: Brian, the manager of the Trump International responded to my review. Of course, he is paid to that. But that is the thing, Mr. Brian. Your hotel is a HOTEL not a RESORT. Why do you charge a resort fee everyday? The whole point of my review is that amenities such as internet connection, newspaper even the shuttle you are writing about is included in most high-tier hotels I know like the Marriott. But the Trump is greedy and wants more and more. The internet and newspaper is standard in most hotels without paying extra. It was just the two things that I happened to mention. And then you posted a litany of things that the $20/day resort fee pays for. First of all, unfortunately, except for the internet and newspaper (which I hardly read). I did not use the shuttle because we had a rental car. I did not use the Spa, I did not use or buy at the Shop. I did not use ANYTHING that you claim is included in the $20/day. That makes it a rip-off for me! Okay, I don't get this. You ask me to pay so I could get a discount to go to your shop to buy things at the Trump shop, that give you more revenue. Now, tell me. Why would I do that? And all those things that you wrote down on your post as a reply to my review should be included in your exorbitantly priced room rate. That is why we paid for almost $350/night. The litany of things you wrote should be included in the cost of the room, hence the high cost of the room. My point is that, it isn't enough for Trump to charge $350/per/night. You had to throw in the $20 resort fee on top of the exorbitantly priced room. Just imagine this Brian. I paid $350/per night per room. That is more than $1,500 just for my stay. You're telling me $1,500 is not enough to pay for internet, newspaper, bottled water?The shuttle I never used, the Spa I never used, the swimming pool I never used, the shop I never bought from? Really? That is not enough for the Trump? That is why my review is such! It is exorbitant and a waste of hard earned dollars. And the Trump thinks he can do this and get away with it. I personally do not like the guy Trump either because he is sleazy. And this stay at his hotel just proves it. Imagine that Brian, multiply that by the number of people staying at the hotel every night, 24/7, 365 a year? Imagine these people staying at your high priced hotel each and every day. That isn't enough to pay for the internet? And how about the economies of scale of your hotel? Isn't that enough? From the look of it, IT IS NOT. The Trump, wants more, more, more, more, more, more, more, more and more, more, more, more and more. It is simply greed. C'mon Brian just look at it this way, if you weren't employed by the Trump do you really think this is ethical?

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: c0mpassi0nate
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to Vegas 10 plus times and have chosen to stay in many different hotels with all different ratings. My expectation for the Trump was high, however I was sadly disappointed. The location is fairly central but there is limited other services around. We do not gamble so it was a bonus that there was no smoky casino. On several mornings we were woken up at 9am by staff. Once by maid (we had the do not disturbed button pressed) and once by window washers.(It's Vegas.....we hadn't been in bed long) The rooms were average, and the shower system needs to be upgraded. This is not on the strip, however but you heard an unusual amount street noise. We were on the 37th floor. Water was either extremely cold or extremely hot ~ even after running for several minutes. We traveled with several other couples and the front desk continued to get us mixed up even though we were in separate rooms. To check in online for am flights we would have had to purchase time online in business center to print off boarding passes. We went to front desk to get done, however they lacked the skill to do online checkin so took a very long time for this simple task. We were very pleased with the staff who did assist and the night manager that helped get boarding passes. We also were very impressed with the limo/transportation services offered. Some rooms were already showing signs of wear and they are not very old. Towels were dirty/stained and had holes. We did call for new ones however some days we didn't receive towels/bathmats. We called for items such as an ice bucket and menu. We never did receive them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family stay in Vegas. Great location!”
Reviews.Author: DenverREO
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay off the strip and at a hotel without a casino and it was one of the best. Room was like a cozy high end studio suite. Room and bathroom was large and beautiful. Bed was comfortable. Small kitchen with mini fridge, microwave and 2 burner cook top. NOTE: If you plan to cook a decent meal upgrade to the one bedroom suite with larger kitchen. This one works well for a quick bite but lacked a few items... Such as skillet but no spatula, and only partial place settings. We ordered groceries and wine online at Von's and delivery was smooth to the hotel. Loved the quiet hotel without a casino. No smoke to choke on! Yippie but close enough to get to the action. Shuttle service rocked! Very quick and friendly. Easy shuttle to Ceasars. Or walk right across to the Fashion Show mall. Easy to get to a few restaurants inside the mall. Our kids loved that the pool was heated and open during November. Staff was friendly with smiles at ever turn. Thank you for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with no casino”
Reviews.Author: MiguelfromtheGC
Reviews.Content: This is a one of the most immaculate hotels to walk into and for me the fact that it does not have a casino that you have to walk through when you get back adds to its appeal. When I go back to Vegas I will definitely be saying at Trump. There is one down side and that is the km long trains that go past during the night and sound there horn which will wake anyone no matter how much they may have consumed the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations Exceeded!”
Reviews.Author: mishixoxo
Reviews.Content: It was a crazy last minute decision to stay at this hotel. We really wanted a hotel within our budget that would give us the "WOW" factor but since we didn't have time to do research we had limited choices as many hotels were booked or way beyond our budget. We chose this hotel because of the rate and the fact that the staff were extremely polite and helpful on the phone. I can't tell you how many times this hotel has exceeded my expectations. We were stunned upon entering the lobby. I actually asked the guy at the front desk if I should be wearing an elegant gown...crystal chandeliers and gold is all you see. When paired with the lovely fragrance its mesmerizing. Oh and the staff were so well dressed and friendly. They actually go out of their way to help you - didn't even have to ask! We were welcomed by a private double door entry that automatically sparks curiosity as to what lies behind.... Wow! was all I could say when I entered...I actually felt like we hit the jackpot. Although I know most people will tell you the room doesn't matter since you won't be spending all your time in there, it definitely sets the tone for your stay. Contemporary design, stainless steel kitchenette, elegant bathroom, you name it. We were completely stoked. The photos do no justice. The room was so clean and comfy, it felt like we were the first ones to stay in there. I liked that the hotel had a great location. It is right across the fashion mall which I found very convenient especially since we did not bring much clothes and needed to find something and get ready before we went out. The hotel is also right off the main strip far enough from the commotion and noise but close enough to walk. When it was time to leave they gave us a complimentary late check out which was another plus. Now, I am a reasonably picky person and I can honestly say we were completely pleased. This hotel was absolutely perfect and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe Stay”
Reviews.Author: redmud
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trump during the Las Vegas Marathon - as runners who were looking for a really good sleep and the feeling of luxury, we certainly got it here. I didn’t have high expectations for the hotel, and certainly not a lot of respect for Trump himself, but his hotel really delivered. Pros: The rooms were spacious and luxurious and the bathroom was awesome. The pool is beautiful and very large, not to mention efficient as it’s both a lap pool + hang-out pool. The pool deck provides lots of space, and the two hidden hot tubs are great after a long day in Vegas during the cooler months. All staff that we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful. The ‘off-strip’ location some people claim was not accurate to our group. With an ‘on-strip’ hotel, the amount of time it takes you to walk through the lobbies/casinos/past the mobs of people to make it to the Strip is ridiculous. At Trump you can simply walk out of the hotel directly, plus a 3 min walk down the road to the Strip. You go from room to strip in less than 5 minutes, no fuss. Not to mention it’s the North end of the Strip, which I find more appealing as it’s the newer end with great hotels like the Wynn, Palazzo, Venetian…. and the Fashion Show Mall. The ‘off strip’ location is not an issue at all. Cons: Yes, you do hear the train. We upgraded to a strip side room after hearing the train getting out at the valet. On the strip side we heard it only once during our stay. I can’t say how loud it is on the other side. It’s almost as if Trump did not install proper windows for the location. As other reviews have mentioned, some of the furniture is showing a wear and tear, and the carpet is looking worn. The most important part though, the bed, does not indicate that. I asked myself if I was Donald Trump staying in this room, would it be acceptable – and the answer was no, there were too many dings and dents that didn’t add up to 5 star perfection. Little things like – not all dishes/appliances etc are available in the room, you have to call down and request them. Same thing with bathrobes and slippers. The pool and gym, believe it or not, does not have a change room, so you have to either walk down to the restaurant and use a washroom there, or go back up to your room. Overall - Trump is a great value in Vegas. Luxurious, great rooms, great staff, good location. We had 6 people in our party and 4 rooms, all very different requirements – and we all agreed it was a great hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Palce to Stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: zme-ken
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose to stay at this property for 15 nights in October to visit our daughter, son-in-law and new grandson. They have a five bedroom home in Red Rock Canyon, but we did not want to infringe so we stayed in a 1 bedroom suite with two bathrooms on the 57th floor facing the West. This is one impressive property. We don't smoke and love the fact that a location like this without the cumbersome casino and smells actually exist. The location, a small step across the street to the Nordstrom’s entrance at the Fashion Show Mall leads one to some of the best mall shopping in the country. Next, the convenience to the strip. While we had a car, the hotel offers free shuttle service to the Wynn (about a 2 block walk on the street or through the mall) and to the Forum Shoppes at Caesar’s. Everything about the hotel exudes luxury. While we did not officially dine at the DJT restaurant, we and our guests enjoyed the happy hour products in the afternoon. The five dollar specials were a great bargain. We can't wait to return and will for a Christmas holiday in two weeks. This trip they will put us strip-side in the same style room. Thank you Mr. Trump.

Reviews.Title: “A good non-gaming hotel option in Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: TFUltimate
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trump for four nights in early December 2011 for the Las Vegas Rock and Roll Marathon. Got a decent deal on Hotwire, otherwise it wouldn't have occurred to me to try the place. To me, there were pros and cons, but the biggest thing... This is a NON-GAMING property. There is no casino in this facility. I was sort of neutral about this personally, as there are plenty of other places to ply my blackjack trade nearby. It definitely creates a different atmosphere. Also is located off the Strip about a five-minute walk; it is adjacent to the Fashion Show Mall which can be used as an access portal. It also is a bit far from any of the Monorail stops. They do offer a complimentary shuttle to the Wynn and also to Caesars Palace. PROS - Great service. Attentive doormen, taxis readily available. Easy check in and check out process with short lines. Beautiful lobby with clean scent. Security watching elevators to guest rooms during evening hours to prevent non-guests from entering. Good gift shop in lobby. Excellent room, including a mini-fridge, cooktop stove, and microwave. Well-appointed bath, including whirlpool tub and TV in mirror. CONS - blackout curtains not very good at holding out sunlight. VERY dry heating (I understand it's a desert, but we're talking wake-up-with-your-nasal-passages-stuck-together dry). Even though the pool was closed below the window, they continued to play loud music outside through the day, which was clearly audible in the room. DID NOT GET TO CHECK OUT - the pool, fitness room, or the DJT Restaurant in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Trumptastic!”
Reviews.Author: Kibber L
Reviews.Content: My Hubby and I stayed for 8 blissful nights at the Trump International in Las Vegas. As you enter the lobby you are enveloped in lavish style and the most wonderful scent I've ever smelled in my lifetime! Check-in was extremely painless, no long lines to wait in and you are offered an ICE cold bottled water while the check-in process is completed. We arrived at our corner suite located on the 38th floor after the fastest elevator ride. The living area in the suite was gorgeous with the high end appliances in the full kitchen, the "L" shaped velour couch, dining table with four chairs and marble half bath. The master bedroom had a king size bed, down pillows and comforter. The bathroom was HUGE, jacuzzi tub was wonderful to soak in while watching the fireworks from T.I.or watching the t.v. in the vanity mirror. The shower was so spacious and it was great to have the toilet in it's own separate enclosure. The complimentary toiletries were large and scented just like the lobby. We did hear the train before we went to sleep but it never woke us. The pool was just the right temperature for a cool down after soaking in the sun on one of the loungers. It was a joy to ride the shuttle to the Encore or Ceasers, the drivers had awesome pesonalities and were very informative. All of the staff were professional but warm also. The Trump was truely a haven to come back to after walking around the strip in the vast crush of people and sounds. Just amazing and we WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is good, but top management rude and not responsive”
Reviews.Author: eTurboNews
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the view from my 52nd floor studio. The studio was spacious, beds were very comfortable and well equipped. The bathroom with the jacuzzi was fantastic. I would have loved to see an expresso maker and a minibar in the studio. The pool is large and well heated (80F). The gym is good for a hotel gym, but I didn't understand why it was closed between 10pm to 6am ? The hotel bar had some fantastic cocktail creations. The signature restaurant looked more like an average coffee shop, but I was told food was excellent. I had breakfast - and the salmon egg benedict was good, but expensive. The expresso was not acceptable (had no taste and was watered down) and the charge of $7.00 plus tax and service was outrageous. The hotel location across from the Fashion Mall is excellent. I enjoyed to be away from the casinos, but close enough to all the fun by complimentary shuttle or a walk through the shopping mall. I had tried to contact the PR person for the hotel on several occasions before making a reservation. Not once did I receiv a return e-mail or return phone call. I was however put on their solicitation list. On another occasion the hotel switchboard connected me without asking to the director of sales. He accused me of calling some secret phone number and didn't want to be disturbed. I was also told the hotel was sold out, and I should not call him again . The hotel was available on the Trump.com website and many of the hotel websites, including Tripadvisor, hotels.com , Orbitz, Expedia. I tried to bring this up to the GM during my stay. He also not once returned my messages I left with the hotel staff. As of today I have no apology from the director of sales. I tried to complain to the Trump HQ in New York - also no return e-mails or phone calls. It appears customer service is not much on Trump's agenda. Even though I enjoyed the hotel, I did not feel welcome. I don't think I would stay at this property again. The front desk and hotel staff otherwise was very professional and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Another enjoyable stay at the Trump hotel”
Reviews.Author: michaeljames101
Reviews.Content: Having enjoyed the Trump International Hotel Las Vegas very much the previous year, we decided to stay at this property again this time around. We arrived on December the 4th for four nights and stayed in a standard room facing the strip on the 47th floor. We arrived at the hotel about three hours prior to the standard 3 PM check-in time and were delighted that the hotel staff were able to accommodate us immediately. The check-in process was smooth and our luggage was brought to our room within minutes of our arrival. As in the previous year, all of the staff we encountered during our stay were friendly and professional. Once again, it was great to stay at a property that was smoke-free and absent of a noisy casino. And having the kitchenette facilities in the room simply made our visit that much more convenient and enjoyable. We did hear the infamous train horn from time-to-time, but as in the past year, staying on a higher floor facing the strip and away from the train tracks made this a non-issue. Simply put, we had another enjoyable stay at this hotel. We would like single out one Trump staff member who we encountered while checking out at 3 AM. His name is Durrell (hope that my spelling is correct) and he was the door man on duty. He was impressively polite, helpful with our luggage, and cheerful, making our departure in the wee hours of the morning a pleasant experience! Thank you Durrell for allowing us to end our stay at Trump on such a positive note!

Reviews.Title: “The package...”
Reviews.Author: jsaul
Reviews.Content: Our Room Suite...private entry...view of Encore, Wynn, Palazzo, Fremont St., Spring Mountains...mini-kitchen for home cooking...jacuzzi tub separate from shower, both comfortable enough for 2...2 closets...robes in closets...2 built-in dressers...living room...quiet ambiance. The Hotel...modern decor, pleasing smell, spacious lobby...full length lap pool...spacious workout area, with free weights & various machines...free valet parking(but you should tip something)...conveniently located across from the Fashion Show Mall...full service restaurant. The Service...from check-in to departure...friendly, attentive, & responsive. Not for...those wanting the smoke filled, loud, yet sometimes exciting casino experience. Will return...

Reviews.Title: “Trump Hotel LV - Classy & Upscale, Unique LV Stay”
Reviews.Author: MarkBeres
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Trump hotel and give it a thumbs-up. I will list the good and the bad, but in my opinion this Las Vegas hotel is a definite winner. First the good stuff. The hotel is amazingly classy - everything is first class, from the arrival & stylishly-adorned entry foyer to the high speed elevators. The interior is clearly- made with class and distinction in mind. This continues to the rooms. There is absolutely no need to pay extra money for a "strip view" room ... the less expensive mountain view rooms are identically-apportioned and provide a stunning display of not only the mountains but downtown Vegas, too. The rooms are large with first-class contemporary furnishings and thick, down-filled bedspreads. There is a relaxing sitting area near the large windows. Strangely - the rooms have a small kitchenette. It's simply weird, but they come equipped with a small range and some seriously-excellent cabinetry with fancy self-closing drawers. If you can figure out why Mr. Trump put these in, you're better than I. They're utterly useless, even if you wanted to "cook in your room". But, the utensils are pure awesome, right down to the Le Creuset tea kettle. These rooms even have an imbedded TV in the bath mirror. The bathrooms are made with a large, uh umm "2-person" shower, and the tile work was stunning. The bath was huge, deep and had whirlpool jets. Trump hotel in Vegas is not a casino - it's best described as a classy place to crash when you're spending time in Vegas. While the rooms and decor are amazing, the Trump hotel is not a place to hang out during your stay. It has a nice restaurant, though the place was literally deserted when we dined there in early December ... a full course dinner and good bottle of wine will run you $130. The bar is quiet and comfortable, too. I had absolutely no problems whatsoever with the service here or anywhere at Trump. The hotel staff was courteous, prompt and helpful.Lets talk negatives. Trump hotel is not conveniently-located for walking to other resorts. It looks like it is, because the Wynn & Encore seem to literally loom over Trump's hotel. But Trump is tucked away on a busy commercial street on the backside of a Nordstrom's department store, and the lofty height of the surrounding resorts deceptively-masks the true distance from Trump to these other properties. For example, walking to Wynn will take you an easy 15-20 minutes, and add 5 more for Ceasars front entrance. Donald has tried to accommodate this by offering free shuttle service to both Wynn & Caesars, but it's not a timely ride and there's just one van, so you're either packed into the thing like a sardine with other guests, or you're standing around waiting for what seems like way too long for the shuttle to show up. It is free, though, so I'm not complaining - just stating the facts. We followed the example of a lot of other guests and took a cab instead. The cab fare for a 1-way ride to Caesars front entrance is $10, and since you get to go promptly on your own schedule, I recommend you shell out the money for cabs instead of dealing with the shuttle.Here is a tip! A cab ride from Trump hotel to McCarran airport should cost no more than $20 (including tip), as long as you make sure to tell the cab driver NOT to take the interstate (taking the interstate route is not faster and only adds to the cab fare). Instead - tell your driver to take "Paradise Blvd.", as it's quicker and there are fewer delays. Our ride took us 15 minutes. By the way, I got this tip from a cab driver who took us from Ceasars back to Trump, and he was totally correct. The reason this trip is quicker & cheaper is that there's a shortcut for "taxis only" that cuts through Encore. It shaves 10 minutes off of your airport trip.So there's my summary of Trump Hotel. Its a wonderful, quiet and relaxing place to stay, nicely unique in that it's absent the usual Vegas sleaze, noise & putrid smoke-filled air (by the way - that's a very good thing). But, it's not a place to gamble or watch strippers ... If you want to physically be where you can play, shop or absorb the Hangover sin-city stuff, then you'll have the at-times irritating chore of dealing with the free shuttle or shelling out $10 for a cab ride to the nearest strip resort (Wynn or Ceasars). But, I would definitely stay at Trump hotel again, as I personally prefer the former for accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: time_to_relax
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at Trump Las Vegas. It is slightly offstrip however it takes just as long to walk to Las Vegas Blvd as some of the mega resorts along the strips do. It is very nice to return to the Trump after a long day sight seeing and playing on the strip - very warm and relaxing atmosphere! And wow...does it ever smell fantastic in the lobby! Pros: -I can't say enough about the team that works at the Trump. They were among the best I have ever encountered. Very friendly and helpful!! The doormen and valet staff are very welcoming and they even take the time to remember your name! -We were about to call a cab one night and the valet team actually offered to take us to our destination in one of the hotel vehicles. Very nice touch! -The bathrooms are fantastic! They're very well designed and are luxurious compared to my bathroom at home. -The bed is very comfortable. -It is a non-smoking hotel, (oh-so refreshing after being in some of the other hotels). Con: -The rooms are starting to show a little wear and tear, (ie, nicks in the furniture). Things to be aware of: -Yes, you can hear a train but I didn't find it that bad...we slept through it. -There is a resort fee $20 plus tax. -Ask if there are upgrades upon your check in - we were provided a strip view room. -Call down to the valet desk about ten minutes before you pick up your vehicle. We didn't have to wait for our car at any point in time. -This hotel does not have a casino, (pro for some folks, con for others).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice- but lots of room for improvement"”
Reviews.Author: Carson D
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Trump while on business in Vegas for 5 nights. Also had some free time for pleasure. Stayed in December, so the pool was closed. Pro's: Beautiful rooms, with kitchenettes, clean, comfortable, jacuzzi tub, gym Con's: limited options for food and drinks, no entertainment, off the strip If you will be confined to your room and don't care about everything else Vegas has to offer, stay here. If you want to experience Vegas entertainment, restaurants, casino's, without the hassle of driving, then stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this classy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LSMorales
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vegas for a week around the New Year and loved this location. We weren't in the large crowds of young people in Las Vegas, but we were close enough we could walk there if we wanted. This hotel is complete class and the rooms were fabulous. The bathroom was fantastic and the large room and amenities were worth it. Next time we visit Vegas, we will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice; doesn't quite trump the other 5-star competion”
Reviews.Author: KittyChan
Reviews.Content: I ended up with the Trump as my "mystery 5-star" hotel on Expedia for a four-day Thanksgiving Weekend stay (Nov. 23-27). While I have no interest in lining Mr. Trump's pockets, I was curious about his hotel property in Sin City. The just-off-the-Strip location, valet-only parking, and casino- and smoke-free environs all appealed to me, as did the prospect of staying in a spacious 5-star condo studio. My prepaid booking was for a regular ("city view") studio suite, which seemed more than adequate as a base for weekend vacation operations in Vegas and southern Utah. I read some of the TA reviews of the Trump before booking and, as always, found most to be helpful. I particularly appreciated fellow reviewers' comments on the rooms' amenities and possible noise from the nearby train. I was impressed with the Trump as soon as I arrived: efficient, friendly valet service; and a welcoming, lovely, fragrant lobby/reception area. The Trump certainly looked the part of a new 5-star Vegas hotel. I was the only guest checking in at 8 p.m. on Wednesday evening, and the front-desk clerk was friendly and helpful. She asked my preference re higher or lower floor (I said the former), and I asked for a room, if possible, facing away from the train tracks.
