She not only accommodated that request but also upgraded me to a Strip-view studio suite. Good start. My room was lovely and very comfortable. I imagine that the standard studio layout (main room a bit narrow but still very spacious and attractive; with a huge bathroom seemingly almost half the size of the living area) would be more than adequate for almost all guests traveling either alone or as a couple. Contrary to a few reviewers' gripes about the view of the Strip from their rooms, I found the view from my 58th-floor room to be one of the best I've seen in many Vegas stays. And I've had lovely strip-view rooms at the Wynn Encore, Vdara, Treasure Island, Mirage, and Mandarin Oriental. The Strip-view rooms look right over the Strip heading south, with the airport to the left and mountains behind -- particularly beautiful at night. Oh, I did hear the train whistle a few times, but it never woke me up. I rather liked, as did my brother and sister-in-law, the plaintive sound in an urban setting. The windows in the room were perfect: huge but well insulated, giving the Strip its due view while keeping undue noise out. I liked the look of -- but hardly used -- the fully equipped kitchen, and appreciated the free good-quality coffee and bottles of water. As for the $20/day resort fee, so many hotels in Vegas charge something similar or more -- while often offering fewer amenities for the tacked-on additional cost -- that I didn't (and don't) really have any beef with the Trump re this. The internet alone is almost worth the fee: as in the Encore, it's 20 MBPS, which is 10 to 40 times faster than the "free" internet that many other Vegas hotels have. And I appreciated the valet-only parking; with one exception, service was fast and friendly. The bathroom in the suite deserves special mention; it's very luxurious, with marble everywhere, two sinks, and a huge stand-alone walk-in shower. I didn't try the equally huge jetted bathtub. I called down on two of my four days for the optional evening turn down service, and I'm glad I did. The maids freshened the room and left more water and some great chocolate bonbons. I ate at the DJT restaurant twice, once for breakfast and once for lunch. The food and service were very good -- expensive, but not inordinately so. DJT wasn't a culinary blowout, but it was good as a convenient come-as-you-are dining fallback. Why am I giving the Trump just 4 rather than 5 points, despite my mostly glowing review? If I could give a 4.5, I would. I suppose I'm withholding the 5th point for subjective reasons; while very nice, I liked the 5-star competition I've tried in Vegas a bit better than I did the Trump -- although I'd rate it higher than the Venetian. I particularly liked the Encore and Vdara (although I also gave the Vdara 4 points). The Trump, while lovely, feels a bit generic, and the furniture and trim in my room was already showing some wear and tear. Overall, I'd highly recommend the Trump to most travelers. I saw a few guests with children -- and more with pets -- although most seemed to be well heeled singles and couples. The hushed, luxurious feeling at the Trump is a pleasant contrast to the constant bling, bustle, and smoke of Strip hotels. Give the Trump a try, especially if you can get a weekend rate close to -- or perhaps even less than -- $100/night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, a little far from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: OnSpeed
Reviews.Content: Went to Trump Las Vegas the weekend of November 3, 2011. Booked on hotwire for 5 star on North Strip. After booking I learned you can distinguish the Trump and Venetian on hotwire because one has a casino and the other doesn't. Price was good and room was pretty big. Bathrooms are huge. There is a mini-fridge and microwave. Place was very nice and new. Downsides are it is a hike from the strip along an industial road. There is no self-park you you have to rely on the valet. And there is no weekend buffet anymore. Bottom line - if you want a new hotel with a nice size room for a low price with no casino, this is your place. If you want a place that is happening that is close to the action, then book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Overall we loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sanuk555
Reviews.Content: Understated quality hotel without the Vegas razzamatazz but within easy walking distance of the Strip. Beautiful rooms with wonderful views (try to get as high as possible) Staff especially shuttle drivers and car jockeys were really friendly, Had some issues with housekeeping , these were sorted but o)nly after complaining to the highest level, Hotel was let down by this. Would definately return but only at the right price. (We booked several months in advance and got a good rate)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but”
Reviews.Author: thankyouta
Reviews.Content: I included the Trump as one of the hotels in a recent visit to las Vegas. I had read the reviews etc on tripadvisor beforehand and overall it seemed worth the effort. I had prebooked and prepaid with one of the hotel booking websites and when I went to check in it was very busy. Good sign with a great buzz and nice feeling about the place. My very first impression was the receptionist just saw me as an oppurtunity to upsell. Without as much as a greeting I was offered a booklet showing me the upgrade room options. I couldnt but help notice that this was going on all around me. I have no problem with this but a greeting would have been nice beforehand. I stayed with my original choice of rooms and I have to say both the rooms were very nice. The second room I had booked has a sofa bed pull out which was going to be used. Advised at time of booking and at check in. We checked in around 4.00pm and called down requesting bedding for the sofa bed. We were assured it would arrive within a short period of time. After the check in we went for a little walk about returning to the room at 6.00pm. Still no sign of the sofa bed bedding. I called down to housekeeping again and was assured it would be up straight away. We went our for dinner and a show and returned around midnight.... you guessed no bedding... A further call to housekeeping and reception and eventually the guy who answered my call said sorry and that he could see from the log my calls. He assured me he would personally look after it and true to his word he did. Its a great pity that trump hasnt more guys like that working. Hats off to him. Its a good 4 star property but lacks the personal touch that true 5 star hotels always have regardless of how busy they are. Food at the cocktail bar was okay and well priced during happy hour. Overall a good experience and the noise from the trains which some reported on was no bother at all. Cannot see how this would keep one awake all night. Room was located in back of hotel and I could see the rail crossroads.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, But not for a 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: DRCMAD
Reviews.Content: Its a very good hotel, but I don´t think that It worth the fifth star. I also had a bad experiance with the check out. When i checked in, and I leave a debit card in case of incidentals that I don´t usually use because there machine didn´t want to accept my other credit card, I told to the front desk lady that I didn´t want to pay with this card, they told me that It was ok, she only took a preauthorisation, that was ok for me. And in the last day, I receive a text message from my bank saying that they charge me for the stay, I was very upset because they use some money that I wasn´t ready to use in this moment, they told me that It was nothing to do in the check out. Note: If you want to go to the Strip, you have to take a Shuttle or walk for a not very nice area If i go to Vegas again I would not choose this hotel again, and I wouln´t recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Trump good if you don't have a car”
Reviews.Author: Travelizgood
Reviews.Content: Located across the street from Nordstorm's in the Fashion Shipow Mall, we stayed (me, hubby, both late 40s, teenage son) at the Trump over Veteran's Day weekend to attend the wedding of a family member. We arrived very late, around 12:30am to a very attentive front desk staff. The lobby was open and decorated in grand style, meaning everything, from flowers to vases to chandeliers were larger than life. Security checked each person for a room key as they entered the elevator bay. The room, 2823, was down a long hallway. A door concealed the foyer which was the entryway to 2 rooms. The doors were very large and noisy when someone left, The Trump was originally built as a condo-hotel and that shows in some of the room details: double closets, shelving, furniture. The room came fully equipped with dishes, pots, pans, coffee maker, toaster, refrigerator (but no freezer compartment), microwave and stovetop. The bathroom was very large with a huge shower, separate toilet and a large soaking tub from which you could watch the TV which was somehow fixed in the mirror. The shelving and drawers were not deep. The towels were average and despite the floor being marble like, no anti-slip devices were used. The attention to detail was lacking in the room. No pillows, aside from the bed were available for the 3rd person sleeping on the sofa bed (which was sufficiently uncomfortable that teen slept on the sofa on nights 2 and 3 rather than making it into a bed). The iron was missing, only 1 robe was provided and only 6 hangers were in the closet. Even at 1am, a pillow was quickly delivered by housekeeping. Extra hangers and an iron were delivered the next morning. The valet parking situation was horrible. A lane for taxis, a lane for dropping people and a lane for valets were almost always full, particularly during the evening. We frequently left the car while my husband sat and waited for the valets and or a lane to become available, up to 20 minutes on one occasion. Valet parking is the only option. One other issue, for those allergic to perfumes or flowers, the lobby had an odd aroma. The night we checked in, we thought it was from the stargazer lilies in the huge arrangement. However, in the next couple of days, each time we arrived in the lobby, this slightly sweet and cloying smell was overpowering. Hubby though it might be a Trump fragrance. Whatever it was, I didn't like it. Also, with no coffee shop in the building, breakfast was difficult. We ended up going across the street to the Fashion Show Mall which has coffee shops as well as a food court. With no stop lights close by, we jay walked and had to dodge the traffic. We weren't the only ones and it appears a crosswalk may be installed. Overall, it was a good place to stay, clean, mostly quiiet. If you need your car often, you might consider a different place.

Reviews.Title: “The Trump Does It Again”
Reviews.Author: travelrob
Reviews.Content: Nov. 22-26, 2011. We did have a problem when we first arrived in our room. There were practically no kitchen utensils (plates, forks, spoons, etc.) in our first room. We went to the desk and told them and they immediately moved us to another room. That is what I like when there is a problem......it is solved with no delay. Very, very nice. This was not our first time at the Trump and this is the way they do business. Every guest truly is a VIP. The "resort fee" brings very fine internet service, bottles of water, a daily newspaper, and very friendly valet parking attendants. It is worth the extra money. Our view was superb and the jacuzzi tub is exceptional. We didn't hear a sound from any of the adjoining rooms. Plus, the room had 3 TV's, two showers, and a full kitchen (as mentioned above). Overall, the Trump is not only an exceptional hotel but also an exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Start to the Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Wynn07
Reviews.Content: For a very special birthday, my husband took me to The Trump International. The hotel is just off the Strip but not too far to walk from on to the Strip. An easy walk through the Fashion Show Mall. Excellent staff and lovely suites with lots of room. We were upgraded to a suite with a view straight down the strip on the 54th floor. Our only problem was that the Internet which was included in the resort fee didn't work. But Trump refunded our fees so we could'nt complain really. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best place ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: manrick777
Reviews.Content: Now after my second visit to the Trump in Las Vegas, I must admit that it was my best experience ever in a hotel. I do travel a lot, I mean a lot and they have this special thing that make you feel very special and important to them. Very small details were looked after to make sure that my experience was perfect. Also a special thanks to Nicole Kulik, she is the executive coordinator at the trump. She made the difference while I was there. She carefully looked after every single things to ensure I had a pleasant stay at the Trump. Even little things like printing a Google map for my short trip to LA and more... All I have to say is again Thank you so much Nicole and thanks to the Trump, its now the only place I will ever go when I am in Vegas...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent no-smoking, non-casino hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amelietravels
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a luxury, non-smoking hotel without a noisy, smoky tacky casino we had to pass through every time we entered or departed our hotel. The Trump was it! We also were hoping to be near, but not right on the Strip and the Trump answered that need as well. The stunning lobby was an oasis of calm and luxury, check-in smooth and efficient, the elevators, hallways were elegantly designed and finished. Our suite, on a high floor, was beautifully furnished in a sleek modern style. Very luxurious bathroom with marble finishing, in-mirror TV , double sinks (handy for getting ready efficiently), multiple drawers and nooks in the vanity for makeup and hair essentials, walk-in shower and separate toilet enclosure. Room service was speedy, very friendly and professional, quite delicious and not extravagantly expensive. I say this to contrast with the 'dining room' which in design and function looks like an afterthought. It's located off the beautiful lobby with a promising entrance, but inside is a sad cavern of a room, weirdly dark without being romantic or the dimness intentionally being a part of the 'ambiance', oddly glaring lights, strangely bereft of decor and the staff, also somewhat lacking the professionalism and pleasantness obvious everywhere else in the hotel. It was almost like walking into a completely different 1 or 2 star hotel with its attached restaurant. We made the mistake of trying to have breakfast here once, one morning. That was enough. The train noise was only noticeable occasionally and I don't think it ever disturbed our sleep. I can't remember our exact floor, but we were quite high and perhaps that's a factor in the noise. A big plus for me, location wise, was that it was right across the street from the Fashion Mall, with Nordstrom's anchoring the near end. The disappointing 'restaurant' is my reason for not giving the full 5 stars, otherwise a truly excellent choice. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Capitaine_Haddock
Reviews.Content: After travelling all over California and staying in motels this was paradise. The jacuzzi bath was superb and the room as a whole was wonderful. Staff were very friendly and helpful but be aware this is at the north end of the strip and a bit of a distance from the action. The hotel does provide you with a free shuttle to and from Caesars palace but if you really want to gamble it would worthwhile choosing a hotel with a casino such as the Bellagio. Another word of warning- when we booked we weren't aware of the horrid resort fee! I understand some hotels don't charge this. Look into this. However overall a superb stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, expect the horrible noise from the train”
Reviews.Author: kanoptik
Reviews.Content: The Rooms are big and very confortable, hotel is well situated not far from the strip, 5 mn walk from the Wynn. It will be perfect if at around 3am there wasn't this big noise from the train, apparently it's happen every day as i can read on others comments...

Reviews.Title: “Horrible noice from the trains, poor service”
Reviews.Author: esa a
Reviews.Content: Must say that rating this as a 5 star hotel is a scam. Starting however from the positive side: the room was rather large, modernly equipped and stylish. Bathroom was even luxuriously large and well equipped. The location is also pretty good, stating that the hotel is on strip is not really true, but it's close enough to conveniently walk to strip and there's also free shuttle service to strip. Then on the negative issues: we had made the reservation for 4 people (2 adults and 2 kids). When we got into our room around 11 p.m. we noticed that there were bedsheets, towels etc only for 2. We called housekeeping and they brought extra bedsheets and made the bed for kids. No towels however, so we requested them again from the housekeepers. They promised to bring those. At 1.30 a.m. we were woke up by housekeeping bringing another set of bedsheets (?), still no towels... Next day we asked from the reception if we could get two additional towels as well as bathrobes which there had been none. We also complained having the room prepared only for 2 even though the reservation was made for 4. They replied that according to their systems the reservation was only made for 2. I double checked the reservation and in my confirmation e-mail it says the reservation was in fact made for 4. During our 3 night stay we never received the promised bathrobes. Towels we did receive after the first night. This in itself is not acceptable for a 5 star hotel. But the worst thing, and the reason why I will never ever go back, is the noise from the nearby going trains. For some reason the trains use their horns when passing by and in practice that meant waking up every night every couple of hours... Talk about relaxing vacation and sleeping well... Afterwards I read some other complaints of the noise and recommendation to get the room as high as possible to avoid the noise. Wish I had read this before. We were staying on floor 34 and that obviously was not high enough. Also one minor thing, but something that should be in order in a 5 star hotel, is cleaning. Even though the rooms were rather clean all the bathroom lamps were covered in dust. As a summary, I would definitely not recommend this hotel when there are plenty of other good (cheaper with better quality) options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay away from Vegas hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: Lo0ps
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September based on our experience staying at the Trump in Waikiki. From the reviews we read we were looking at a place that was quiet, away from the hustle and bustle of the Vegas strip and also a place that was non smoking. And it was great that there wasn't a casino in the hotel - kinda keeps the hotel just for hotel guests. Check in was a breeze and we were offered a choice to upgrade our room at an additional price, it was worth it, the view of the strip was amazing, especially at night - gorgeous! We were also given complimentary bubbles and fruit as we had let them know we were celebrating an engagement. The room was huge! So much room, felt like a home away from home - with a full kitchen and two bathrooms. Rooms were cleaned daily and staff were very friendly. As for the train - yes you do hear it, but for me I just fell back asleep after it so wasn't that much of an issue. The shuttle which goes to Caesar's Palace does get a little full especially when people are wanting to go back to the hotel at about 11pm. Be prepared to wait a little bit to get a ride back to the hotel in the evening - some hotel guests even push their way onto the shuttle just to get on it - one evening we had to wait for 3 shuttles to pass because people kept pushing in. (Would be handy if the shuttle at night was a bit bigger or they had some sort of area where people could line up so other people wouldn't jump the queue). The location is good for people who love to shop as it is opposite the Fashion Show Mall. Great place to stay, highly recommend it. Looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and even better customer service”
Reviews.Author: DieBroccoli
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the value when compared to any other 5 star property in Vegas Services and Customer Care - This is where they truly shined bright. Special kudos to Lawanna at the concierge desk. She personally took care of all of our dinner reservations, including a killer recommendation of B&B in the Venetian. Then, to top it all off she got us VIP access to one of the biggest clubs in town. She even remembered us the next day and asked specifically if we enjoyed the restaurant Location - Yes, it's just slightly out of the way and not truly on the strip. But they make up for this with complimentary shuttle service to the heart of the strip Rooms - LOVE the kitchentte. Also has large closets, gorgeous bathrooms, big beds, a sitting area, and great views Cost - I did book through an online discounter, but they were still well below other 5 star properties Room Service - Quick, delicious, and surprisingly not too expensive. Most 5 star properties kill you on the room service menu. But i got Breakfast every day for under $20. Improvements - Every business can improve no matter how stellar their performance or amenities, so here is the nit-pick list: - bath robe would be a nice-to-have - airport shuttle - no one seems to do this...but once 5 star resorts figure out it's a big want, offering a comped shuttle service could be a great marketing tool - website - a flash splash page with auto play sound? really? in 2011? - The shower drain is in the wrong spot. It's right in the middle of the shower so you can't help but to stand on it. With a stand up shower that large, it could easily have been offset so you didnt have to constantly scrape your toes on it

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: raymond v
Reviews.Content: The rooms are big and very comfortable, about 1/4 of a mile from the wynn and Las Vegas blvd. the employees are great too, from the front desk, to the doorman, and the valet. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, especially if you get a special deal”
Reviews.Author: ugm6hr
Reviews.Content: Got this on a "hidden" special offer - so was very cheap. Then upgraded to a 2 room suite on arrival for $50/day extra. As people have said, the sofa-bed isn't great, but tolerable for 2 nights. Otherwise the room and hotel is as I would expect for a top-end place. It's important to note this is a non-smoking hotel, and there is no casino. Unfortunately, the location is at the very end of the strip, so it's not great from that point of view. And the strip is sufficiently long that walking up and down is uncomfortable in the summer. Overall, this hotel is amazing, as long as you get a special deal, but if not, I suspect there may be more central options.

Reviews.Title: “Never again this is not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sinatra1969
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a lot of 5 star hotels before , but this one doesn't deserve this at all. They did not offer normal parking you had to use the valet. Waiting time when you need your car was average 30 minutes. The checkin process was also very surprising since I ended up meeting somebody else with keys for the same room in front of the door also want to getbin his room. The checkin counter tried to explain us that the person who was a stranger seem to be in my booking and we have a room together , which we found very funny. Finally they found the reservation and the other person also got his room. The rooms feel a bit ran down and the furniture seems aged and hot some less good looking white spots on it which let you fantasize what might have happened on that couch. The restaurant in the hotel aren't great either, there was a very limited menu card for lunch and the whole atmosphere at the bar was more comparable to a train way station . Definitely a place you should avoid if you can in case you want to have a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent alternative to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: sharbotlake
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews for the Trump before going, so in a sense we were expecting good things from an attentive staff and we weren't disappointed. The delightful attractive front desk clerk cleverly upgraded us to a suite (this was slow season) showing initiative, and we were delighted with the enormous quarters that we ended up with. Well worth the extra few bucks (and what's a few extra bucks in the town that never sleeps?) with a marble bathroom larger than our living room at home. We yearned to show it off (but no one to show it off to!). Throughout our stay the hotel staff were pleasant and helpful. Clearly well trained. Whatever one might think of the namesake of this chain, one must admit he has figured out the formula to keep his guests happy. A good brisk walk over to the Wynn for gambling or for a jump on transit to explore the town, the location was perfect for those (like us) who can take the noise and activity for only so long . . . and right across the street from the major shopping mall. You decide whether this is a plus or a minus . . . We recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edith G
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived until the end of our stay, the service was amazing. Staff is friendly, helpful and really on top of things. It was wonderful to be able to prepare breakfast in our room (fridge, toaster, coffee maker and M/W made it easy). No need to get dressed and look for a place for a quick breakfast. Housekeeping did a fabulous job of keeping things neat and tidy. All requests were handled quickly, with a follow up call to see if we were satisfied. I would highly recomend this hotel to friends, family and those wanting a nice place to stay while in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in, ever!”
Reviews.Author: SquirePew
Reviews.Content: Headed out to Vegas for a work conference and decided to stay in a none casino hotel after previous years of having to walk miles between locations and my room. Well what A hotel, VIP treatment as soon as you get out of the car at the lobby entrance. THE most professional and curtious check in I have ever experienced anywhere in the world. Next visit will be a leisure trip and no hesitation on booking the trump.

Reviews.Title: “what a relief”
Reviews.Author: gail w
Reviews.Content: the trump is a lovely hotel a few minutes off the strip. It provides a calm,soothing, sophisticated atmosphere. The lobby is large, marble, quiet and plush. A great place to sit and have a drink and conversation. The restuarant, is fine, perhaps not as good as some of the best, but if you are tired a beautiful atmosphere with good food. i enjoyed the spa for a massage, facial and unexpected hair cut. one of the best facials i have had. the pool at the right times was a wonderful time to swim and sun. but it can get crowded with families with young children. when we wanted to go to the strip we simply hopped on the free shuttle and arrived at the ceasar. my only complaint was that i had great difficulty finding the pick up spot for the return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Bedazzling!”
Reviews.Author: Sheba31
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Our family of five (myself, husband, 2 toddlers and my mom) stayed for 3 nights in this non casino hotel. We appreciated it for the quiet but if you're here in Vegas to party then maybe it's it for you. We found it good value for our family of five where we needed a kitchenette to prepare meals for our little ones and the extra room for kids to play. The hotels entrance and lobby is highlighted in the Trump's signature gold but they manage to marry this with more muted tones and tasteful furnishings in the rest of the hotel's decor. We booked a studio and 1 bedroom suite/apartment. The one bedroom was so large that we really didn't need the studio for my mum. We only took the studio on advisement from reservations when we booked over the phone. A rollaway bed for her would have been suffice. Rooms are super clean and tastefully furnished. View were amazing! I was really happy with the huge cot they sent for our 2+yo toddler who is a bit tall for his age and at most hotels, the cots were a squeeze for him. It had a brand new mattress as well which was nice. The luxurious bathroom was massive with a spa bath and large shower, double vanity. It had a fabulous view to boot. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in - even tops Westin's Heavenly bed if that's anything to go by. Complimentary wifi and bottled water. In fact, when I called to request some extra bottles of water, the staff showed up with a whole bag - some 6-8 bottles. Our kids had the best fun in the pool - nice size, good cabanas, not over crowded. Serviced by really nice staff at the pools snack bar. Lifeguard on duty. I found the staff really down to earth and friendly. I expected snooty but was pleasantly surprised and impressed. Front desk was super efficient and welcoming. On the day we left, we were so behind time and in a frantic rush to get to the airport. We had so much luggage that getting a large cab was going to be a slow process so they quickly arranged for a private car to take us and it wasn't even expensive. Despite the hotel being off the strip, they offer complimentary shuttles to and from the Wynn and Caesar Palace. I think this service ended at mid night during the week and a little later on weekends of course.  The Trump Spa was great too. A little expensive but I took advantage of a special and came across a fantastic massage therapist there. I wish I could remember her name so I can recommend her here. She had me wishing I had her for 2 hours rather than just 40mins. Room service/ food and beverage was on the expensive side some chose to eat out or prepare simple meals in the kitchen. Across the street is Fashion Mall housing an edited Saks Fifth Avenue, Macy's, Nordstrom and other chain boutiques. No groceries. Closest is Walgreens (open 24 hours)at the Venician for basic needs. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Cinciikid
Reviews.Content: If you want to avoid the smoke, noise and the general hustle and bustle of a Vegas Casino this is the place for you. Although this is a non-casino hotel there are shuttles that run till midnight to both Ceasar's and Wynn every 15 mins. Additionally the rooms themselves were spacious, clean and modern with an updated look. The bathroom had a seperate shower and a hottub with jets along with a TV in the mirror!! There was ample closet space and drawers with bathrobes provided. The mini kitchen had a stove top and a mini refrigerator with cooking and dining utensils provided. There was a large screen LCD tv and a very comfortable bed in the room with room service every day that was exceptional. The value this hotel represents in terms of price and what it delivers in amenities is probably scarce in Vegas. The only minus I could say about this place was the limited dining options within the hotel Even though there are several restaurants and room service available the fare offered was rather unappealing, but then again there hundreds of places within a 10 min shuttle trip or a short cab ride. The Vegas Fashion Mall is also across the street for those who feel the urge. Finally, there are some reviews here that state this is a 5 Star Hotel and how it falls short. Let me assert that no where does this Hotel represent itself as a 5 Star facility and the price they charge is on par with what a 3 star place or what many generic national chains charge. I would highly recommend this for a small family or value conscious travellers who demand something extra.

Reviews.Title: “the train kept a rollin'”
Reviews.Author: David26
Reviews.Content: Initial impression was great: nice lobby, friendly service, lovely room. Then the train noise..... First night I was woken up by the sound of a train sounding its horn 5 times through the night. Not a quick short burst, but a long NOOOOISY horn. We had been given a room facing the train track, on the 29th floor, and the noise was genuinely unbearable. To give you an idea how loud it was, I heard it clearly whilst walking on the strip between the bellagio and ceasars palace the following night. On requesting a room change the following morning, we were promptly changed to another identical room - but facing another side of the hotel, 30 levels higher. From here, you could still occasionally hear the train but was far far more bearable, and slept well from then on. The hotel is itself is fine; only just off the strip, no more than 5 minutes walk, so no problems at all. Happy hours(s) at the bar every night, 5 dollars for cocktails. I generally enjoyed my stay, but unsure as to whether Id recommend due to the noise. Please please make sure you request a room away from the tracks if you do stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy Hotel for Wife's 30th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyDadd
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice to celebrate my wife's 30th birthday this past week. I had never been to Vegas so I did a little homework before I booked with Trump. From the moment we arrived we were treated very well. The hotel was very classy and smelled great, especially after returning from the casinos where smoking is all around (no smoking at the Trump). We were upgraded to a strip view on the 51st floor, which was absolutely great. Having a kitchenette was a great touch and I even made a nice breakfast one morning. The gym was great and the pool was beautiful (too chilly outside to use, but the water was heated for those who didn't mind the air temp). Lunch by the poolside cafe was just what we needed (try the wraps). On Thursday night the shuttles to the Wynn and Caesars were very busy, so as we were waiting one of the staff offered us a ride in one of their house cars (very nice black Yukon), which we gladly accepted - again the treatment was great! I highly recommend this beautiful hotel to anyone was loves luxury, hates smoke, and wants a little more peace right outside the main strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would recommend staying here”
Reviews.Author: Johnski99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights 3rd to 7th November and loved it. Room was great - views are amazing. We would echo all the positive comments made about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great room and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jen z
Reviews.Content: the trump is more at the end of the strip but with the free shuttle bus it was perfect to go to the bellagio/ceasars palace. our room was great, very big, modern and clean. the room service was very friendly and also the electrician who helped us with a lost earing was very nice. there is no casino in the hotel so its quiet and relaxed. there is a pool outside and a little gym. we enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “First class accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Greens13
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a week's stay at the Trump in Las Vegas and all I can say is wow!!!! The hotel is absolutely beautiful and the greatest thing is that there is no casino in there!! All of the other casino hotels we visited directed you through the casino to get out onto the road, whereas Trump is a standard hotel lobby that you walk straight out onto the road. The rooms in the hotel are amazing - we upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite (room 5925) and the room and the view were out of this world!! The beds are soooo comfy and there are loads of pillows and sheets if you like to have the air con on high and then snuggle up!! The location of the hotel was ideal - it is slightly off the strip and opposite the Nordstrum entrance to the Fashion Show Mall. There are courtesy buses that run from the hotel every 10-15 minutes to the Wynn and Caesars Palace. To walk to the strip takes approximately 4 minutes so we didn't really bother with the Wynn bus!!The pool area is spotless and a really lovely place to relax - beware of the drink prices though!! Now onto Vegas - what a place!! There is so much to do besides gambling and it would take all day to go through it all so I though i'd give you a run down of my favourites: * Stratosphere - go and see the sunset from the 107 bar. If you go between 4 and 7 it is happy hour with all martini's on 241. If you purchase 2 drinks you can go up to the observation deck for free (standard cost $16 per person). As the martini's work out at $12 for 2 it only costs $24 for 2 martini's and a fantastic view! * Coyote Ugly Bar in New York New York - what a fantastic place!!! It is exactly like the film and is so much fun. * Freemont Street - this is another fun place to go and has a laser show on the ceiling every hour from dusk. It is really something to go and watch and the casino's in general pay more than the ones on the strip * Wynn breakfast buffet - $19.95 each for all you can eat and the quality and variety of the food is amazing!!! We ate here twice we loved it that much and we also paid $10 each for unlimited champagne - get there for about 9.30 and take your time!!! * Treasure Island show - this was great fun and of really high quality and best of all it's free!! * Bellagio Fountains - everthing you would expect and more. We watched this over 6 times and every time I filled up!! * Mon Ami Gabi restaurant at the Paris hotel - this is right opposite the Bellagio Fountains and if you can get a table outside you can watch the fountains whilst you eat!! * Deuce and Downtown Strip bus - $7 for 24 hours and it takes you all the way from the Southern shopping mall to the Northern shopping mall with all of the stops in between. You can hop on and hop off when you like and it is a must for getting to Freemont Street! There is obviously so much more than this to do - I have just put some of my favourites down! If you want to know anything else please message me and I'll give my honest opinion!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great way to start our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Andy H
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and even better when we got a great price on Hotwire. You have to use the valet at this hotel which wasn't a problem. We were quickly checked in and received an upgrade to a strip view room. This hotel is very clean and smells great. There is no smoking and there isn't a casino. The bathroom at the Trump is amazing, jacuzzi tub, tv in the mirror, we thought it was great. As others have mentioned you do get here a lot of noise, especially the trains passing by. We had a great time here and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Jerry U
Reviews.Content: Our first time to Vegas. Wanted a non-gaming, non-smoking hotel, and this was the perfect fit! Away from the busyness of the strip. Elevators were "sonic" as we were on the 45th floor and it took only seconds to get there! The room was huge, with a great view of the strip. And the bathroom was awesome with a flatscreen tv in the mirror that you could watch from the jet tub, which was huge, too. We ended up staying 2 nights, so we enjoyed the pool the second day before going the short walk to the strip. Everyone who worked there was extremely friendly and helpful. I even had a maintenance man in the elevator who gave some very helpful advice. We booked this on bookit.com as the mystery hotel, so we got it for a great price. We were less than impressed with Las Vegas, but were VERY impressed with the Trump!

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping needs a lot of work”
Reviews.Author: tanya h
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel and make it our 'favorite' as we travel to Vegas often. However, after three separate visits and issues with housekeeping each time, we have decided to try the Wynn in future. Here's a brief summary: 1st visit: Snot on the pillows. I could see dark marks through the pillowcases. When I pulled them off to investigate there were large mucous stains on both sides. Housekeeping could not fail to see them but figured I wouldn't and put the pillowcases on anyway. 2nd visit: Loved the idea of a kitchenette, just not a dirty one and what are two people going to do with one glass and one fork? 3rd visit: Contents of bedside table: Torn condom wrapper, 3 more unopened ones, empty gum package, used chapstick and used food wrapper. So as nice as the wonderful and friendly customer service is (valets, front desk), what good is that if you cannot enjoy a clean room? 3rd times a charm and we won't be back nor will we recommend the Trump Las Vegas. Tanya and Richard Haight

Reviews.Title: “trump international superb accomodation”
Reviews.Author: hiltonpark70
Reviews.Content: we stayed here to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary with friends who had travelled over from canada for 6 nights what a wonderful hotel this is rooms are massive views out of your apartments looking over the city are superb very friendly staff,

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Terri1960
Reviews.Content: Totally agree with others ow nice to not have to travel through a casino to get to your room! we stayed in a one bedroom suite, absolutley lovely suite. Will for sure stay here again. Worth the walk or shuttle or taxi to go further own the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Will return”
Reviews.Author: Joseph R
Reviews.Content: I booked a king suite only a week in advance and found it to be a great value. The room was almost 900 sq ft and had two closets, 3 televisions, a beautiful, comfortable bed, and the bathroom was as big as the master bedroom. I am 5'11" 210lbs and I could have fully submerged my wife and myself in the tub...it was that big. The shower had dual heads and the toilet was in its own little glass room. There was even a TV in the bathroom mirror! I visited on Veteran's day weekend and I was attending a Marine Corps Birthday Ball. My wife was in a Beautiful Ball gown and I was in my evening dress uniform and the bellman quickly grabbed my attention and led my wife and I to a black Chevy Tahoe and we were given a complimentary drive to the hotel where the ball was taking place. We did not ask for this in anyway and we were actually a little confused because it came as a complete surprise, but it really went a long way to make us feel special. We also requested and was given a DVD player for FREE, but you have to sign an agreement that you will turn it in or be charged $50. I have very few, small complaints. We did find a cigarette butt in the bathroom. We had to call for linen for the pull out because there was none in the room. And I was not prepared for the $100 dollar incidental they put on your card when you check in. Lastly Cell phone coverage is bad, even up on the 39th floor. The hotel was VERY accommodating for out checkout. We called them from the Caesar because we knew we would not make it back by check out time (which they gladly delayed until 1pm) They checked us out over the phone and immediately emailed me a receipt so I could review it. They even held my vehicle in valet and our luggage until 5pm even though we checked out and they did not charge us for it. This service also DID NOT require 20 dollar tips to make happen, it was just good customer service. No staff member was out to make money off of us just to give good service. Everybody was friendly. Doors were always opened, valet and transportation was very accommodating and efficient. Although some may complain about it not being on the strip and not having clubs and casinos, we like that because it keeps the hotel a little calmer and quieter and it attracts a more mature crowd. Las Vegas Blvd is a five minute walk away. And the hotel offers a FREE shuttle to the Wynn and Caesar's palace and the driver was funny and more than willing to help with our stroller, and did not expect a tip for it. The train noise was there, but it never bothered my sleep. (I was on the 39th floor, strip view). We did not eat at DJT, nor did we use the spa, but we were given a few coupons for both, including a $25 dollar spa credit. I definitely recommend it and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “No ridiculous casino funneling maze. Whole family loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ANRR
Reviews.Content: I admittedly jumped to conclusions first about the name on the hotel (not a Donald fan), and second when we drove up to the valet only entrance, no one offered to help with our bags. We're a family of 4 and didn't drive up in a luxury model similar to the others I saw parked for valet. Check in was also a little slow with only 2 people working at the desk which is unfortunate when you have two small children waiting with you :). The Bellman who eventually did come to us was super nice, not pushy or lagging for a tip, and was waiting for us at our door when we got up to our room. I wish I had gotten his name. He was very helpful once in the room, he knew his stuff. The strip view one bedroom suite was plush, more than sufficient, and surprisingly exactly as described. Plenty of room, I didn't feel gross about letting my 1 yr old on the floor to play. The kitchen is perfect. Even has an oven, toaster, and ice in the freezer. It was superbly clean. I wouldnt exactly call the pullout couch luxury. The mattress was thin but worked fine for a night. We also had to call down for extra linens for the pullout and it took a little while to get them. I assumed they would be provided already. We also requested a DVD player for the kids and they had someone there quickly and efficiently. The view was great from the 39th floor. Huge windows my kids loved looking out of. The trains ARE very close and can be seen and heard from the strip view but it wasn't an issue at all. The bedroom was roomy and the bed very comfy. Plenty of room for me my husband and our 3 yr old. The bathrooms are also very nice. Yes bathroomSSS. There is one in the main room with a shower and the one in the bedroom? Wow. It's enormous. The tub is large enough for a couple, the double shower is more than enough room, and the toilet is behind it's own door. It was quiet, fashion show is right across the street and has anything you need or want, there is no loud, sad, smokey casino to walk through which is pleasant when you have children with you. True, it's not on the strip but there is also no casino attached that is designed to funnel you around to keep you from leaving. If there was a casino, attached it would take the 10 mins it does require to get to the strip, just to get through it. They won't nickel and dime you and seem to welcome the person and not just their money. My one complaint is that the room could use a touch of TLC. Furnishings were scratched and dented. Wear and tear galore. Carpet under table and chairs was frayed and the vanity in the bathroom just needed to be replaced. The worst of it was that the toilet needed a good scrub and we found a cigarette butt sitting on the bathroom sconce. Apparently, housekeeping needs a little more attention to detail. This was a nonsmoking room although I did pick up on a faint smoke smell upon entering. I thought it was just me (Vegas in general is pretty smelly) until my husband found the cigarette butt hanging out. All that said I'd absolutely stay again. For romance, family, or business it's a great hotel. If you're a gambler,probably not your place. We booked the Trump because we needed a suite to accommodate our traveling babysitter and found a deal on Vegas.com. It was worth what we paid and more!

Reviews.Title: “Trump International Las Vegas... great service, but bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Stephen d
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit to Vegas (this time with the family) and we were all looking forward to staying at such a well known quality hotel. The friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff was brilliant. Very courteous. Very warm and friendly. excellent. The pool area was superb and the poolside bar & restaraunts were really good. The Gym was very well fitted out and all the machines worked. The efficiency of the lifts were very quick & reliable, so we did not have to stand around for ages waiting for a lift (unlike many other hotels we've stayed in) The rooms, however, were disappointing. We booked two rooms, one twin and one double. The twin only had a normal bed (extremely comfortable) & a sofa bed (very uncomfortable). Both rooms were very poorly sound proofed from the noisy roads and railway lines outside. Each night, we would be repeatedly woken up by the freight train's horns and the constant noise from passing traffic. Given the quality of this hotel, we had hoped Mr T would have spent more on the double glazing!. We stayed for 7 days & so you should take plently of your own coat hangars, as they were not enough supplied by the hotel. Not sure if we would stay here again, as the constant hubbub from outside was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Stay HERE! You won't regret it.”
Reviews.Author: HabsFan21
Reviews.Content: The best hotel experience I've had. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The desk staff and door staff were incredible. Very accommodating. The room was spectacular. Beautiful fixtures and furniture. Bed was extremely comfortable. It was so nice to come back to a clean and fresh hotel at the end of the day after walking through one smoky casino after another. I had one small issue with housekeeping. The housekeeper didn't show-up until after 17:00 one day and didn't come at all the next day. I spoke to the front desk staff and they were very helpful and ensured that room was cleaned the next day. The door staff even drove us to the airport in a Trump SUV ($25) and WAY better than a taxi. There is a $19/day resort fee, but that includes blazing fast WiFi internet and use of the fitness club.

Reviews.Title: “Refuge in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lsloanew
Reviews.Content: Trump was a great spot just slightly off strip for a fabulous girls' weekend. We were thrilled to find a hotel without a casino (= quiet!) that was non-smoking. It is very convenient to the strip, either a short walk or they run two free shuttles. While the shuttles don't go far on the strip (to the Wynn across the way and centrally located Caesar's), walking the strip was half the fun, and a $10 cab did the trick at night when we didn't want to walk as much. The Strip View Studio room we had on the 37th floor was perfect. Very comfortable and quiet. Great tub. Plenty of space for 2-4 people to hang out. The train never woke us up (though we heard it if we were already awake at 2 and 6AM). The pool was very nice and also pretty quiet. Staff all very friendly and helpful, especially Danny the doorman - a great source of advice and assistance! The only complaints we had were the readiness of the room - some of our party arrived early and were told our adjoining rooms would be ready at 100 (usually 300). One room was ready by 300 but the other was not ready until 500, which was annoying for weary travelers who wanted to get ready for the evening out. Apparently housekeeping's work had to be checked by a manager. While we appreciated this, it would have been nice to have the room ready on time. And even with the manager's check, bathrobes and some toiletries were missing so we had to ask for them. Otherwise a great stay overall!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value-Close to the Strip- Hotel w/o Casino”
Reviews.Author: gatortail
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel a lot. It is a high quality hotel. It does not have a casino, which I don't like and need. I stayed in a studio room facing the highway side. The room was big with a big bathroom. Bathroom had a tub and a separate shower. Room had a kitchenette with empty fridge and stove. It had also a desk, a few sofas and chairs. The room was a little noisy (highway traffic noise), but I got used to it. There is a railroad passing not too far, if you are not facing the strip but facing the road side, you will hear the train once in a while. Tried fitness center, concierge, breakfast bar and breakfast restaurant. Everything was great. Room rate was reasonable. I paid thru agency before I arrived, but I still had to pay a small fee (daily resort fee) after I arrived, there was no way to opt out. I guess it is a Vegas thing, but it is not pleasant. It is less than half a mile walk to the Wynn-Encore end of the strip. There is a shuttle, but there is no need to use it, unless you have special needs. And maybe it is necesssary in the heat of the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: christine l
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel because it doesn't have a casino, you don't have to fight for a spot at the pool, no one was in the gym, the staff was pleasant. The room is great too!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TKEVancouver
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Trump a couple of times and it is often the best value on the strip. It is quiet, smoke-free and the fastest elevator I have ever been on in my life. If you don't mind walking a bit and you want to spend your time at the north end of the strip it is great. If you want to be in the middle of things and have an issue with walking...I would suggest somewhere closer to mid strip....but you will pay more and it will be much busier.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: AndrewJH
Reviews.Content: Myself & my partner stayed at the Trump in October as part of our round-the-world trip and we thoroughly enjoyed it. We've been to Las Vegas three times before and love it. This is the first time we have stayed at the Trump and we wouldn't hesitate in booking it again on a future visit. The hotel is ideal if you want a more laid back environment, as there are no gaming machines here. The staff are very helpful and will make up your room later for you if you like to sleep on in the mornings after those hectic nights out like we did! Our room was on the 59th floor overlooking the rear of the strip. It was more of a suite than a room, with a huge bathroom featuring a jacuzzi tub (big enough for two), tv and separate shower. The room had a lovely Queen size bed which was so comfortable we didn't want to get out of it! There is also a full kitchen with fridge, coffee maker etc. Excellent shuttle service that runs between the Forum Shops at Caesars & Wynns throughout the day & into the evenings. Brilliant valet service too. Overall a great value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on your expectations!”
Reviews.Author: LovedToronto
Reviews.Content: We just had a very nice stay at Trump, thanks to Priceline. I confess we got this hotel due to an error in bidding on my part. I accidentally added in the North Condo zone, and had an absolute hissy fit when I realized what I had done. That being said there are some real pluses to staying here, and the price for a 5-star was pretty darn good, especially since it included a Saturday night. Plus 1: Much easier for a cab driver to get there and drop you off than a strip hotel. We arrived on a very busy Saturday and the cab line looked like a popular Disney World ride queue. Traffic was busy, yet we arrived quickly. Plus 2: Fast fast fast check-in. NO wait at a prime afternoon check-in time. Friendly too, with no snooty attitude that one can sometimes encounter when checking in prepaid via Priceline. Plus 3: EASY, SHORT walk to your room. A rarity in Vegas. Save the miles for strip-walking. (we sure did plenty of that, so being able to quickly get to our room when we got back each day was nice!) Plus 4: Rooms are two per suite area, so you have the added security of an extra door. Plus 5: JACUZZI. Not just a boring big tub. (let bubble bath search commence...but remember to only use a TEENY bit). Plus 6: Fridge (and other kitchen things that would only be a plus imho if we were staying longer than 3 nights). Plus7: Buttons by door that you can use to indicate privacy or housekeeping. Very classy and worked like a charm. Plus 8: Room service. Top-notch. Friendly. Quick. And surprisingly less expensive than I've seen in hotels in Vegas and other cities. We ordered a burger one night and it was good, with waffle fries, came with cute little bottles of mustard, ketchup and a teeny tiny Tabasco! We had them bring up a corkscrew also, which we were surprised wasn't already in the room. Plus 9: Courtesy Shuttle. We NEVER had to wait more than 2 minutes for it. Drivers were very friendly. Took us to either the Encore or a very convenient location at the Forum Shoppes. (underground, with an escalator that comes out right in front of Spago). Never ever had such quick, friendly shuttle service at a hotel anywhere before! Plus 10: Location isn't bad anyway. Cross the street (be careful) and you are in the Fashion Mall and on your way to wherever you want to go. Note that there is an ABC store in the mall that has wine, munchies, sparkling water...pretty much anything you might need. Also note that when you come out of the mall on Las Vegas Blvd, that is where the Tix 4 Tonite booth is so you can see if you want any discount tix or meal discounts. We bought Absinthe tix there, saved money on it, and the show was very entertaining! Plus 11: Housekeeping...excellent! Bless their hearts (see minuses 2-10 below) Minus 1: No robes in room. (easily rectified by a call to the front desk, also had extra towels brought up in anticipation of jacuzzi usage). Minus 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10: The TOILET. We HATED this toilet. You can't tell me that Donald Trump or anyone in his family have ever used this toilet or one like it. Heck our old ones here at home are considerably better. It was the WORST toilet we have EVER had to deal with. Now even though it was supposed to be Trump opulence, we didn't expect a golden throne or anything, but this porcelain puny had a plastic lid (no big deal, but unexpected in a 5-star).... the PROBLEM was that it would barely flush. I realize the idea is to save energy, water, etc., but how much of a savings is it when you have to flush 3 times (waiting in between each time for the tank to fill up)? Not only was the suckage power non-existent, but there was no water that would go around the basin, making flushing fairly useless, beyond frustrating and flat-out embarrassing at times. God help Housekeeping here! (Hope everyone believes in tipping Housekeeping like we do). Minus 11: The view. If you get "city view" like we did, it means a view of the Erotic Heritage Museum (which doesn't seem to get any traffic), and other such lovely landmarks. Not a biggie to us as we didn't spend much time in the room, but if it's important to you ask for a different view. Minus 12: The train. I'm only putting this as a minus because I know it would bother a lot of folks. To us having spent a year and a half dealing with downtown DC noises, it was no big deal. But yes it would wake us up several times each night. Overall impressions...this hotel feels more like 4 stars than 5. Whereas service was definitely 5-star in all regards (front desk, housekeeping, shuttle drivers, room service, security guard in lobby)... furniture, bedding, etc. was more 4-star than 5. Toilet alone makes it impossible to rate it a 5. It feels like a 4-star hotel that could be in any city anywhere. There's nothing that cries out VEGAS RESORT. And THAT is a plus or minus depending on how you look at it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and room.”
Reviews.Author: Bmoron
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights in October. The rooms were excellent, the service was very good and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Top Trump!!”
Reviews.Author: nick c
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to vegas, we will be going back same time next year in october, and definantly staying at the trump again, alhtough we did have to change rooms due to faulty showers this did not put me off writing this review. The service is excellent, rooms huge (or ours was, it was a delux suite) location for us was great just off the strip, and away from the hussle and bussle of the main drag, the hotel is non gambling, but wynn is only a short bus ride away, or even a short walk away. The weather was great 30's everyday just incase you were wondering what october was like All in all a fantastic hotel, and vegas its self is out of this world well worth a visit at least once in your life

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be far from the mess but really close to it! :)”
Reviews.Author: caito_cunha
Reviews.Content: First vital info: there is no cassino in the Trump. That said, it means that there is no cigarrete smell, less croud coming in and out. It´s a place to be relaxed in the Strip. Awesome experience, great service, nice ammendities and the rooms are great. Complete kitchenete. Nice hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: CRobinson28
Reviews.Content: If you are not looking to stay in a themed or casino hotel, then this is a fabulous choice. Spectacular and simple to look at from the outside, this hotel stands out at the top end of the strip and can be seen most of the way up, if walking/driving from Mandalay upto Fashion Show Mall. We arrived on 24/10 and stayed for 8 nights for a special anniversary - not realising at the time of booking that it was also Halloween weekend. The hotel did not seem to be full, from what we could see and hear, but like all Vegas weekends, it did get considerably busier from the Friday night, ready for the Haloween parties in various hotel nightclubs, and the spectacle of people dressed up all day long for 3 solid days walking/posing up and down the strip (most fun Halloween we've ever had!!) We booked a city view studio, but as we had e-mailed previously asking for a high room due to the train noise we had read about on Trip Advisor, the hotel upgraded us for our anniversary to a Strip View studio on the 57th floor (room 5707) which had the most amazing view we could have hoped for. I do not believe that there could be any better view of the strip from any hotel - so much so, that I did not close my curtains throughout he whole stay, to make sure that I could see the lights at all times (if I just sat up in bed, I had a perfect view of the Bellagio fountains). I counted 23 hotels in view from the room, from the Wynn at the West, to Mandalay at the South and Rio/Palms at the East. The room itself is very good, and is very similar to a Studio in The Signature at MGM (I gave Signature 1 extra point for having a small dining table which was missing from Trump - it was nice to have breakfast in the room and sit at a table rather than on a sofa). It is open plan with a very comfortable bed, 3 seater sofa and 2 armchairs, small writing desk and chair, plus kitchenette, with fridge, (stock up on milk/bagels etc in Walgreens over at Palazzo for a cheap breakfast in room) hob, microwave, toaster, blender and coffee maker (coffee provided in room as part of resort fee. This also includes 2 bottled water per day, plus daily newspaper. We did not use the free wireless as we were on holiday, so did NOT want to be contacting the outside world!!! but we did use the business centre to check in on-line and print off boarding cards, which is also part of the fee). The room also had the most storage space I have ever seen in any style room/suite, including 2 full wardrobes, drawers and at least 6 other cupboard spaces. The bathroom was lovely with double jacuzzi bath, double marble vanity sink (with the fun tv in the mirror), double shower, and toilet behind a heavy frosted glass door that did slam hard if you forgot to close it all the way. Did I mention the view.............? I do have to mention the train noise. Yes, we could hear it, very clearly, all the way up on the 57th floor, and could see it clearly on the East side of the room (counted a train with 92 containers at one time. No passenger trains use the line, just cargo). To be honest, it could be a problem if you are on lower floors as it is noisy when they sound their horn.....for long periods of time....at 3am!!! but we actually got used to it and didn't seem to notice it after a while. It didn't ruin my stay in any way, as i'm sure that not may Vegas hotels are quiet - after all, this is the city that absolutely never goes to bed, and there is constant noise one way or the other!! Also, I am certain that this noise could also be heard if staying on the "wrong side" of the hotel in TI, Mirage, Rio and Palms, plus Palazzo and Wynn to a degree. While checking in, the employee noted that we were celebrating our anniversary, and asked if we had plans to see any shows. As we had previously seen Ka, and fallen under the Cirque spell, we had planned to see Mystere and told her so. She then pointed out that Trump had a promotion with TI for "2 for 1" tickets, for Mystere specifically, so this was a great saving for us. I can not really comment on any other aspects of service, as it was not needed, except for housekeeping. When we got back to our room from dinner out on our first night, I noticed that we had no robes. I called housekeeping, and within 2 minutes, they arrived. At that very moment, I was also unpacking, and found only 4-5 hangers in the wardrobe. I asked the staff member with the robes for 3-4 more hangers, and he came back within another 2 minutes with 10 more. I was impressed as this was after 11pm, and normally housekeeping is not so efficient at this time of day. To be honest, when we are in Vegas, we walk the Strip and eat out at every opportunity, so we did not use any further facilities of the hotel, eg pool, Spa or restaurants. The location of the hotel is set back off the Strip without it being too far away, but it makes it much quieter and also easier to walk back to your room, rather than jostling the crowds and cigarette smoke (non smoking hotel with a permanent spa style fragrance, makes it a literal breath of fresh air from the majority of other hotels). It is incrediby easy to walk to the strip by either walking 3 minutes on the road (prefectly safe at all times of day/night, with pavement and lighting) which brings you out at the crossroads by Wynn/Palazzo and Fashion Show Mall, or from 10am-8pm, you can walk straight over the road from the lobby area, directly into Nordstrom, which is part of the Fashion Show Mall. If you can not walk far, or plan to visit the far top or bottom end of the Strip, you can take the Deuce bus from outside the Fashion Show or Wynn for 7$ per person for 24hours, which is a a real bargain and leg saver!! We used it to visit the Premium Outlets South, which is the last stop on the route before turning around (also can recommend Town Square for a different feel to Vegas shopping). Lastly, I will mention the great complimentary shuttle service that runs every 10-15 minutes (not sure what time it starts as we always liked to walk in the morining) until approx midnight to Wynn (very lazy to take this unless have a problem walking) or Ceasars. The drivers were excellent with great personalities. You can always get a taxi from outside the hotel as they are always queuing up on the road to the side for potential customers. It is approx 20$ to the airport. We would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone, and will look at staying here again on our next Vegas trip in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property! Amazing Service~!”
Reviews.Author: trevdeb111
Reviews.Content: I may be a near expert on these hotels. I have stayed at 7 MAJOR hotels, including the Bellagio, Mirage, Mandalay, Paris, etc. For those who are tired of smokey, noisy Las Vegas Cassino hotels, this place is for you. What you are actually renting is a CONDO/TIME Share styled unit. The smallest 1 bed is like a KING suite, over 1000 SF, with amazing quality fixtures, Bosch fridge that actually can freeze your water, plush bed, mini sound system and LARGE bath with sep shower, jacuzzi tub and TV in the mirror! The service from the moment you walk in is the best I have received in LAS. Great pool good food, with live music in the afternoon. Did not have to fight for 4 chairs! If you want to gamble, you are a 2 min shuttle to the WYNN running every 7 min! My only gripe is the breakfast buffet was not up to the TRUMP name and fell way short of what I would have expected. This will be my new home in LAS, which I travel to 2 times a year for business.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, shame about the trains”
Reviews.Author: SteveW13
Reviews.Content: We both really loved this hotel from the moment we pulled up outside. Just a quick note for people using a Sat Nav, they're changing the roads around a bit and our Sat Nav seemed to be a bit out of date which meant that it got us a bit lost! If you've got some other maps handy then it shouldn't be a problem! We were staying in a cityview studio suite, which was a good size. There was plenty of storage space for us to unpack as we were staying there for a few days. We really liked that it was a suite, and we made full use of the fridge for keeping water and other bits cool. I liked that there was a sofa and chairs which were really good for putting your feet up after a long day of exploring and gambling on the strip. The bathroom was a big, with shower and jacuzzi bath. After seeing some of the other hotels we were glad that the hotel didn't have a casino and was smoke free. It's only a 5 - 10 minute walk down to the strip, or for during the heat of the day you can cross straight over from the hotel into the air conditioned Fashion Show Mall. We used the free shuttle bus to the Forum shops which saved a bit of walking went we went to explore the lower end of the strip. All the staff we encountered, from reception staff to the valets were always very helpful and polite and we were never kept waiting very long for anything. The only negative for us was the trains using their horns at various times through the night, waking us up. We're not sure if you can hear them in the stripview suites, but we could still hear them in the morning outside the front of the hotel! As this was the only negative we would definitely consider staying here again to get away from the smoke and constant noise of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, fabulous,fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Annabel S
Reviews.Content: We booked the trump hotel as we had read good reviews-they were certainly accurate. The rooms are amazing-all suites including a massive bed and a separate seating area. The fully equipped kitchen area means you can prepare any food or drinks you want. The pool area is lovely-but be aware there is a daily resort fee ( alot of Vegas hotels have these). The hotel has no casino -we were happy with this but others may not be. It is a short walk to the strip alternatively the hotel provides a shuttle to caesars palace.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Fabbycasado
Reviews.Content: If you are on a budget and don't want to stay in a newer hotel I would def recommend the trump, hide your valuables though because my iPad got stolen from my room and the security team did nothing to help me out. They never offered to check the security cameras and when I asked them to do so they refused. We decided to stay here because we found a discount rate on a website, overall the hotel is nice, the rooms are ok - the bathroom is big, however we were stuck with a room that had views to the highway and had to deal with the annoying train horn every hour. The hotel location isn't bad and they have a free shuttle to the Wynn and Caesars Palace.

Reviews.Title: “an oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: mitsy58
Reviews.Content: If staying in Vegas for any other reason than gambling, clubbing, shopping this is the perfect place. We stayed 1 night so we could catch a flight back to UK after our road trip which finished with Grand Canyon & Hoover Dam. We chose the Trump Tower as it has no gambling, no club, no shops (except the Trump signature shop) no smoking & were delighted with our choice. The room was sumptuous with everything of top quality - beautifully appointed bathroom, spacious bed sitting room with kitchenette, very comfy bed (our best sleep of the whole trip) & a surprisingly good restaurant offering a prix fixe menu of 29.95 for 3 courses. All the staff we encountered were very professional, helpful & accomodating. The shuttle service to & from the strip is regular & all the drivers were friendly but professional. We had free WiFi in the room & were offered a late check out for no extra charge - as our flight was an evening one this was an added bonus & meant we could have a relaxed day not having to check out till 4pm. You can do an automatic checkout directly from the room & the business centre offers a free service to print out the flight boarding pass - bearing in mind the chaos that is LV airport this was a welcome feature. We were there during halloween weekend - OK many guests staying there were party goers, but we were not aware of any problems, the room was well sound proofed so we were not disturbed at all. The train was not a problem for us - we had encountered similar on other stops during our vacation & found it rather evocative......,..... After experiencing all the horrific tackiness that is Vegas, we found Trump Tower to be a welcome haven of tranquillity. We wish them continued success & would not hesitate to recommend as the perfect place to stay if you have to go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Was skeptical...but loved it”
Reviews.Author: pukeycow
Reviews.Content: Girlfriends and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. What we liked: -luxurious look and feel -large room with sink, large king bed -large bathroom with double sinks, soaker tub and shower -directly cross the street from Nordstrom, which leads into Fashion Show Mall (there's a tix3tonight booth at the mall for cheap show tickets and dinners, we got tix to Blueman Group) -5 minute walk to the Wynn (really, it's not that far) -shuttle service every 15 minutes to Caesars Palace (We booked a spa appointment at Spa Qua in CP, sooooo nice!) and to the Wynn...if the shuttle isn't there you might as well walk to the Wynn! -no casino so the lobby is relaxing - it's a quick navigation through the lobby to our suite -no smoking, a literal breath of fresh air throughout the building -business centre, we printed off our boarding passes -well equipped gym area -pool terrace area, lots of lounge chairs, jacuzzi, a cafe and palm trees -wifi (caveat, comes with the resort fee though!) What we didn't like: -the bed and pillows were a little soft -you can hear the train at night, but we only heard it once, didn't really bother us -resort fee Not the hotel's fault, but what we also didn't like: -Fashion Show Dr. (the road from the Trump to Wynn) had one side of the sidewalk closed, you either had to walk directly on the road (dangerous) or jaywalk to the other side of the street to get to the strip/Wynn. -To get to Nordstrom you had to jaywalk, we felt like Frogger at times!

Reviews.Title: “The staff at the Trump are the best!”
Reviews.Author: excpair
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt every staff member we dealt with at the Trump were courteous, well trained, polite and friendly which made our visit to the Trump very enjoyable. The stay was not without a couple of minor problems but those have been discussed in a letter directly to the hotel. One of the only negatives would be that the hide a bed is very uncomfortable even with the extra padding which was supplied. Possibly this type of accommodation should only be used for a couple who share the one king size bed, I was traveling with a friend so there was no sharing!! The pool was lovely and especially enjoyable because the background music was relaxing and not loud. We did enjoy a lovely lunch by the poolside and the set dinner at the DJT dining room. Both meals were excellent and good value. The complimentary valet parking was convenient and the car was usually delivered quickly. We used the shuttle to the Wynn and Caesar's mostly at night and it was so nice to leave the busy strip area and return to the quiet, clean air of the hotel, we appreciated the no smoking policy. I would agree with other reviewers who mentioned that the furniture is chipped and should be repaired to meet the criteria of a "Five Star" hotel. Overall the stay was wonderful and we look forward to another visit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: scott r
Reviews.Content: Put aside your views of the arrogant Mr Trump and enjoy this excellent hotel. Close to the Wynn and other great hotels. Make sure you get a room that faces the west side of the strip. There is a train on the east side that goes off every 4 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: CSailor71
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay this year. It was even better than the first. Beautiful rooms and the largest we have stayed in for the money. Terrific service and staff. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “NOT GOOD”
Reviews.Author: honest-traveler-4-u
Reviews.Content: The Trump International Hotel was a sheer disappointment. This place left a bad taste in my mouth and I'm not sure if I will ever stay at a Trump hotel again. This was the first time, to my knowledge, that I have stayed at a Trump Hotel and I had high expectations. They claim to be a five star establishment and I strongly disagree. If you are in Las Vegas for the sole purpose of business, then maybe it will satisfy you. If you are coming to Vegas for Vegas, then stay away from this place. There is no casino, no night club, and no smoking. TRANSLATION: The place is dead and boring! The room was okay, I would compare it to one of the better hotel chains like the Doubletree or Hilton. In comparison to most high-end Casino/Hotel rooms like the Palazzo, the room accomodations here look like a cheap Motel 6 room. Their standard rooms only come with one king bed, and a very uncomfortable sofa pullout bed. We asked the front desk if we could get an upgraded room with two beds, since I am male and I don't like sleeping with my male friend. Hotwire books you the room without a bed preference. They said the only rooms that had more than one bed were their penthouses and they are reserved. They were really snobby about it too. THIS PLACE IS NOT ON THE STRIP, ALTHOUGH HOTWIRE WILL SELL YOU A ROOM THERE AND SAY ITS ON THE NORTH END OF THE STRIP. IF YOU WANT TO VISIT THE STRIP, EXPECT TO DRIVE, , TAKE A LONG WALK, PAY FOR A CAB, OR ATTEMPT TO GET ON THEIR RIDICULOUS SHUTTLE. There is one pool and one jacuzzi for the entire hotel. The pool/jacuzzi is open from something like 8am-5pm which is utterly ridiculous. The service, from the housekeeping to the front desk, was terrible! There was no bedding for the pull out bed and we had to make repeated phone calls for about 45 minutes (seriously) to get the bedding. This happened at the end of the night when we were ready to sleep. We had to make a few other calls regarding problems with the room and went through the same thing. There is no self parking, therefore forcing you to valet your vehicle and pay every time you get it in or out. The resort fee is crazy! How is this a resort? Maybe because they give you two complimentary bottled waters and they have an expensive spa?
