There is a complimentary shuttle, which is actually a mini-van, that will transport you to The Wynn or the Forum Shops at Caesars Palace. This "shuttle" runs from 9am-midnight. The line is always long and you will never know how long you will have to wait. If the shuttle fills up, you have to wait for the next one. Also, keep in mind, the Forum Shops entrance is all the way at the back of Caesars Palace and the Wynn is not on the strip either. SO ANNOYING! I WILL NEVER, NEVER, NEVER, GO BACK TO THIS HOTEL AGAIN. I visit Las Vegas on a regular basis and I will actually be afraid to use Hotwire again for fear I will get this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Home”
Reviews.Author: TeamSweetpea
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay for my 40th birthday. We did a lot of research before booking to stay at Trump for 6 nights. We read a lot about the train horn noise and yes it was loud and regular and audible through ear plugs! However, that said, as we knew this in advance, this came as no surprise and did not negatively impact on our stay. The hotel staff were very polite, well mannered and doorman always gave a friendly 'welcome home' when we returned to the hotel. The shuttle service to Caesars or Wynn was great too. Some people have complained about the distance from the Strip, we did not find this an issue at all as it really is only about a 10 min walk - it can take you longer to walk through a casino from one end to the other!! We found that a taxi ride from Mandalay Bay at the other end of strip to Trump cost us between $10-15 (incl. tip), which we thought was very reasonable. There is also an RTC bus stop right outside the Fashion Show mall, which is very handy to go up and down the Strip or carry on to Downtown. (tickets $5 for 2hrs or $7 for 24hrs, buy before boarding from ticket vending machine). Worth checking out Tix4Tonight booth in Fashion Show mall, we saved approx $150 in total on tickets for Lion King and Phantom. Totally recommend the Trump Happy hour cocktails each night from 5-7pm ($5) and if you are hungry the sliders served at the bar were awesome!! We are already looking to return to Vegas and will definately be staying at Trump again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect... especially if you don't care about gambling”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveler_SoCal
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a great deal on a luxury hotel close to the Strip - and if you don't care about gambling at your own hotel - this is the perfect pick. Not exactly on the Strip, but worth the extra walk. The hotel is very well maintained and very clean. The staff is really great too. The rooms are very spacious and there's a lot of attention to detail. There are rooms with mini kitchens if you're interested in doing some cooking, but if you don't, room service is always a great choice. Oh, and there's a pool... the pool is very nice too! Downsides I'd say there's only valet parking (I guess Mr Trump didn't think people would want to park themselves) and it's pretty hefty. Otherwise, great option!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for dog charges”
Reviews.Author: FreedomBus
Reviews.Content: Hotel & room are great. When I went to check out they had charged me $200 for dog charge instead of $100 we had agreed upon at time of reservation & check in. It took 1/2 hour of arguing to get the charge reduced to $100. Service at breakfast was not good; however, food was very good. Bed is very soft. All parking is valet which can mean you will have a substantial wait time to get your vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you want luxury away from the crowds and noise, loved it.”
Reviews.Author: cheshirecaz59
Reviews.Content: We had one night here before we flew home at the end of a long trip. It was brilliant, not cheap but sometimes you get better value paying a little more for a hotel that suits your needs , and this was the case with us. If you want a qiuet luxurious hotel away from the crowds were you feel exclusive and special this is the place.I think Mr Trump has played a blinder (as we say in England ) with this hotel. He has filled a niche here that was really neededin Vegas. Not everyone comes to Vegas to gamble and walk miles through crowds just to get to and from thier room and basic hotel amenities like the lobby pool etc. The design of this hotel makes a stay here relaxing and easy and importantly makes you feel exlusive and appreciated. He knows that the big brash and OTT Casino hotel has been done to death and he went for a different market, very clever, but I guess thats why the guy is so successful. . After a desastrous stay at the Mirage which we hated, this hotel was like a fragrant breeze in a peaceful oasis. We had a small suite with city view on the 33 floor. We liked the size of this hotel. short walks to everything , super fast lifts and very friendly staff. It was luxurious in a classy way, like the best of European hotels, stylish but not outlandish and OTT. When we arrived we were checked in quickly by a lovely friendly and proffesional young lady who would be an asset in any of the worlds top hotels and we have been lucky to have stayed in some over the years. Our room was spacious and comfortable with a little lobby shared with another room which was super peaceful and felt safe.We loved the extra space the level of decor and the great bathroom with spa tub. We had been on a long road trip and had stayed in some hotel rooms smaller than this bathroom. We liked the smaller intimate pool area, it felt exclusive and the wall and planting hid the madness of Vegas with a glimpse of the mountains, just beautiful and relaxing. All the staff were exceptional and we truly felt like VIP's during our stay. We ate the set dinner and it offered good value for money and normal size tasty portions , sorry USA but generally the portions in your restaurants are WAY TOO BIG! Only criticism of this gem of an hotel was that our bed had a pillow top that kept working loose and so our bed was not as comfortable as the one at the Mirage which was actually the only thing we liked about that hotel. About the location, I think a lot of tosh is talked about being on the strip and its convenience. It has been my expeience that even staying on the central strip you will have to do a LOT OF WALKING wherever you stay. We stayed central last time and found it very incovenient and noisy and crowded and you still have to walk. If your off strip hotel offers transport that is the perfect solution for anyone who finds trudging through crowds of people in the heat as they will take you were you want to go. This hotel was great for us as I could just walk across a qiueter street into Nordstroms and access the Fashion Show Mall and then Las vegas Boulavade.. Shuttles run to Wynn and Ceasars so is shopping is your thing then this is a great location. Would definately stay here if I return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A calm oasis in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: tampaRPh
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas celebrating my parent's 50th anniversary with family. We all agreed that the Trump was a great place to stay. It was just 2 blocks off the strip but offered a luxurious oasis of calm after the hectic pace of the Strip. Not having a casino was a plus - no smoke and you didn't have to walk a mile through the hotel to get to your room. Service was friendly and the concierge helped us out with show tickets . Breakfast was yummy, a little pricey but you got alot and it was presented beautifully. Only a few negatives...some rooms had a problem with water temperature ( either too hot or too cold ) and we really couldn't utilize all the amenities to justify the resort fee. All in all, we had a great experience and would stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “Lucky Number 7”
Reviews.Author: FraserB
Reviews.Content: Trump was the 7th hotel I had stayed in Vegas, it was one of the best. I had been trekking the Grand Canyon with a group, I fancied staying somewhere comfy for a couple of nights before heading back to the UK. Check in was quick, and I was up to my studio suite in no time. In order to keep noise from the corridor down, rooms have a small hall shared with your neighbour. The room was pretty spacious with decent sitting area, small kitchen. All very clean and pretty comfortable. Bathroom was an excellent size and very clean. Staff were great, the guy at the bar recommended the chicken for lunch and he was bang on! Breakfast the following day was great value, as good as anywhere else on the strip. The pool did get very busy, but the staff were pretty good here too. If you need a book to read poolside, there are plenty of Mr Trumps books for sale in the shop, I counted 8. The hotel is located right across from the Mall, very easy access and just a short walk through the mall to the strip. They also have a couple of shuttle buses which run to the Wynn and Caesars. The bus to the Wynn is never busy. Overall very good, my only two gripes would be the mattress in the room, it was past its best. I was on the 37th floor at the back of the hotel. Both days I was woken at 6am by the train running past. Not the hotels fault but avoid the rooms at the back!

Reviews.Title: “So glad we stayed at Trump, wish we stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: mellani_g
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trump Hotel in September. It is a smaller hotel than most of the other major hotels so the service was really noticeably better and more personal that you would get at the bigger resorts. Someone mentioned there was no casino….that's because it's a non smoking non gaming hotel.....its like the whole point of the hotel. It is off of the strip but there is a FREE shuttle from the hotel to the strip and back every 10/15 minutes until 2AM. The rooms were absolutely HUGE. We were really happy about the kitchen and the free coffee/tea in the room too. The bathroom was also really big with a huge bath and shower and flat screen TV in the bathroom. We locked ourselves out of our room once and somebody came up within 3/4 minutes to let us in; they were all really very nice and helpful. The pool area was also lovely. We had pre-booked to only spend 2 nights and then a further 3 nights at the Venetian so we had to leave and we were very disappointed with what we received at the Venetian compared to Trump! Would DEFINITELY stay again. Oh and the bed? Without doubt the most comfortable bed i have ever slept in!!

Reviews.Title: “Trump elegance”
Reviews.Author: gsoncnative
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Trump for two nights before moving on to the JWmarriott for a convention. We requested an upper level and were put on the 62nd floor.We loved everything about it. The view from our room was amazing! Floor to ceiling windows add elegance to an already beautiful room. The bathroom was huge, all marble, with a giant jetted tub and a 13 inch tv in the mirror.There were double sinks and plenty of bathroom storage, which is rare. One of the best things about this hotel is the service. All of the staff that we talked to were super nice and helpful.My least favorite thing was the pool area. It's a rooftop pool, so landscaping isn't so good, and the pool is very ordinary. But we only spent about an hour there, so it was fine. The location is perfect, a short walk to the Wen and Fashion mall, or you can take the free shuttle. We had a wonderful stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of luxury in the madness of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Babaduck71
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we needed for our stay - somewhere calm, fragrant and non-smoking with superb service and staff who went out of their way to make sure we had a lovely stay. We had a problem with our initial room and were upgraded to a 1-bedroomed suite without hesitation by the front desk. I can't call it a room when it's as big as our home... it was huge, beautifully appointed and very quiet with no noise leaking in from the corridor thanks to the entrance lobby shared with the adjoining room. We availed of the $5 happy hour at the bar where the very charming bar staff made great cocktail recommendations and then dined at DJT, choosing from the $29 set menu. Service was speedy and the food was superb. The concierge was instrumental in arranging our wedding vow renewal and nothing was too much trouble for her The hotel is directly opposite the Fashion Show mall where we spent a few $ on essentials like clothes and shoes - there's also a Tix4Tonight store there so you don't have to make your way down the strip to buy show tickets. In summary, a non-smoking, non-casino, beautifully appointed hotel which we both loved.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: SFW_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trump from 10/13 to 10/18/2011. It was a great intimate experience away from the noise and smoke of the casinos. However, everything is close and easily accessible. The free shuttles are helpful and run all day until the late evening hours. The staff is curteous and helpful. The suites are clean, housekeeping is quick. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not worth it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Paez-Nuno
Reviews.Content: Sorry Donald ..I wasn't impressed!!! Front desk service was ok, concierge lady was great!! I waited pool side for a drink ...no one came! Hall ways weren't very clean. My room restroom wasn't to clean either. Scum on the shower door. Toothpaste on the crevasses on the mirror Ewwwww! The walk to the hotel from the strip wasn't easy. No Shuttle back from the Wynn, after certain hours. Not to mention no casino. Sorry I expected so much more from the "TRUMP"!!

Reviews.Title: “Trump was lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Luxury
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon we arrived at 9pm at night we had dinner at the trump restraunt wasn't all that and too pricey!!! Our stay was good breakfast was expensive we were only told on the last day that there was a buffet for breakfast we could have saved alot if we knew that before hand! the hotel staff were lovely pool was nice and clean! Gym was useful we were charged resort fee on days we wernt even able to use resorts overall if you want luxury then do staff here, only downfall is it's too far from all the outlets n cab fare is too high but yeah was lovley

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience, thanks Trump!!”
Reviews.Author: Bronson W
Reviews.Content: My wife Bec and I were on our honeymoon from Australia and had booked a room at the Trump from the 5th of October til the 19th. Our experience from Check-In to Check-Out was fantastic. The lady at Check-In, Elayna, was making small talk with us and asked the purpose of our trip and we told her we were on our honeymoon, we asked if she could look after us and give us a room with a view. She happily obliged and we had the most amazing view of the strip overlooking the fashion show mall and Treasure Island. Much to our surprise we got a knock on our door about 20 minutes into our stay and were delivered a complimentary bottle of champagne from a friendly guy by the name of Rofoldo (I think I remembered it right) who gave us some great tips about what to see in Vegas as well. Almost forgot the bell boy Jeff was great as well and gave us some great tips on where to eat in Vegas. Though I didn't get names, all of the staff driving the shuttles to the Wynn & Caesars were very friendly, make sure you tip them they deserve it!! We made use of the in-room dining a few times while we were there and we could barely finish the meals because the servings were quite generous, and they tasted great too. The room itself was a corner suite on the 49th floor with a full kitchenette, fridge and spa. The bed was luxurious and the room itself was clean and well maintained. The only fault was one that we were well aware of before booking the room and that was cell phone reception is very very poor in the hotel. I read a lot of reviews about the distance from the strip. I think people are just lazy, my wife and I had no problem walking to and from the strip from the hotel and if we were drunk or tired we just caught the complimentary shuttle. I can't wait to visit Vegas again and stay at the Trump, my wife and I had a great time and the experience was unmatched in any of the other cities we visited. Thanks Trump!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: dick_pops
Reviews.Content: Trump is superb with staff to match. We booked one night as a treat at the end of a three week drive round the National Parks. Despite arriving in shorts and T shirts in a car full of bags and cases etc we were treated with the utmost respect and courtesy and Vincent on reception was absolutely charming. During check-in he mentioned that we were being upgraded and the suite we walked into was out of this world. How we wished we'd booked for more than one night and didn't have a flight to catch next morning! Word of warning - the view from the window is SO magical after dark you'll get very little sleep as you won't want to close your eyes! One niggle was trying to get the shuttle back from Caesar's Palace. There is no sign to tell you where to stand, Caesar personnel are uphelpful and even a call back to Trump to find out more information didn't help and in the end we walked back. If you intend using the shuttle let it take you there so you are aware where it will pick you up.

Reviews.Title: “If That's 5 Star We'll Take It”
Reviews.Author: Theresa R
Reviews.Content: Trump Vegas is very, very nice. The staff pleasant and the room oh the room - nice, nice, nice. Spacious and nicely decorated. The bed was super comfortable and as good as that was that was not the best thing. The bathroom was. Huge jacuzzi tub, the toilet was enclosed with rain glass as the shower was and the mirror over the double sinks had a TV in it. Our view was not of the Strip and we did hear the much complained about train whistle. None of that was a problem for us. We would stay there again in a New York minute. The only 'problem' we encountered was we requested online and at the front desk the 4:30PM late check-out. The maid showed up repeatedly starting around 10AM and kept coming back. THAT was annoying, but not enough to ruin what was a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “shame about the train”
Reviews.Author: gillaandarren
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a week in the middle of october .the hotel is beautiful and the staff very friendly especially Richard in the pool bar and the guys driving the shuttle bus. stayed on the 38th floor but had to be moved because of the bad smell.the next room we had was a corner one bedroom suite this room was beautiful but the noise from the trains hooter was terrible .we then moved to 43rd floor .This room was lovely ,the bathrooms are the biggest weve stayed in and weve stayed in a few 5 star hotels in vegas.the view from the jaccuzi bath was great.the rooms are first class.The only snag is you have to ask for the bathrobes as they dont just provide them.They dont provide shower gel either which i found very strange as im sure they used to.The shuttle bus is a great idea though

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but there are better in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Flighty31
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Trump for 4 nights. It has no casino and is much more like a typical high end hotel rather than the usual Vegas style. Its very slightly off the strip, but that’s not a problem as the strip can be accessed via an air conditioned shopping centre or via free shuttle buses which run to the Wynn and Caesars Palace. The rooms were well equipped complete with fridge and cooking facilities. The bathroom is the best I have experienced in Vegas, the whirl pool bath is superb. However, even though we were on the 48th floor at the back of the hotel you could still hear substantial traffic noise and the train. The standard of glazing did not seem very good and certainly not what you would expect at a 5 star property. There was also considerable noise from the doors of the other rooms. I also found the bed to be relatively lumpy and so slightly uncomfortable. If you can get a good rate then the Trump would be worth a stay but there are better 5 star properties in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “This set the bar high”
Reviews.Author: Tootie84
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the Trump, it was my first time in Vegas, and was there for a trade show. Our entire group stayed here. I was in a standard suite on the 50th floor and had a view of the strip. It was one of the best views I have ever had in a hotel. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the over-sized jacuzzi tub was definitely an added bonus. I also loved the mirror in the bathroom, was great when I was getting ready. I had some light bulbs out, and the TV was not working initially when I arrived, but one phone call and it was fixed within 20 minutes. One thing I noticed different about the Trump was that the smell was clean and fresh, it didn't smell like an overkill of fragrance like many in Vegas do to cover up smoke. They also had a happy hour which was nice, and the room service food was great as well. Highly recommend the tuna melt for a lunch item! The shuttle service was also a nice amenity that I utilized to Caesars and The Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but do not stay in a room on the North/West side.”
Reviews.Author: travelnaps
Reviews.Content: The Trump hotel is a wonderful hotel. The staff is incredibly courteous and really takes the extra time to ensure you are enjoying your stay. The gym equipment is of the highest quality and some of the equipment has televisions built into them. The gym looks out on the pool deck. The pool is very nice as well. The rooms are great. All rooms are suites, with a Jacuzzi tub and full kitchen. When you stay at the Trump you are really staying away from most of the action of the strip. You can either have the hotel transport you to two different hotels for free or you will need to find some other form of transportation to get around. I really only have one major complaint, but it is a big deal. If your room is on the west or north/west side of the building, there is a train station just across the street. If you enjoy staying out late and having fun in the Vegas night life, make sure you are prepared for the 6am early morning wake-up calls of the train horns. Trust me when I tell you that you hear them and they are loud. They seem to blow their horns every 20 or 30 minutes. Besides the trains, I have zero complaints about the facility. Book your room on the south/east side of the hotel and you will really enjoy your time in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Not everthing that glitters is gold”
Reviews.Author: Trotter83
Reviews.Content: If I paid full price for my stay at this hotel, this would be a much worse review. First off, we had to call the front desk to have our toilet seat attached to the toilet. The first night we had the appropriate amount of towels. From then we always had to call for towels. I assume housekeeping cleaned up dirty towels, but would not replace those taken. Since I am on towels, I would suggest bringing your own. I think the towels may have removed some flesh they were so rough. Then the ones we got had holes in them. Does the staff not inspect towels as they fold them? If you travel during the week cabanas by the pool are free. Weekends are not- be prepared. We were also supposed have robes in the room, we didnt. The resort fee includes a number of things you don't need. It gives you "access" to high speed internet. You still have to pay for it. I still havent figured out the benefit of the resort fee. All I got were bottles of water. So the good. The staff was awesome. The concierge desk was staffed by really friendly people. They had great suggestions and were helpful with tickets to shows and reservations to restaurants. The outside staff was great as well. The doormen were friendly and helpful with suggestions, too. There is also a complimentary shuttle that takes you to the strip, but it stops at midnight on certain nights, so be prepared. Overall, it if were a cheaper hotel with lower expectaions, it wouldn't have as far to fall.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel if you value some peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: landmantx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here since we were traveling with a small child and the place was a perfect, just minutes from the Strip but no smokey casino attached down stairs. The place is built high end and looks nice but you can see that they are skimping on maintenance and there are some broken fixtures and scuffed paint that detracts from the look. We booked a regular room and got a free upgrade to a 1 bedroom on check-in. I liked everything about the room except the mattress on the bed kind of slopped away to the sides which was a little disconcerting. We ate the first night at the hotel restaurant since it was so late and the food was good but it took forever to arrive and was very pricey. Staff was all great.

Reviews.Title: “I miss you a star”
Reviews.Author: myabe
Reviews.Content: Was on 15 October, the clean, quiet, , good bed, but the fridge empty (you could add a few amenities but were to be paid separately, are on notice jakuzzi teach a couple playing with foam not put foam in the room, they charge 19.95 a day for 2 bottles of water, say for spa service? Newspaper (I never took him) suggestion adds to the price of the room because it received at the end you feel cheated; otherwise well

Reviews.Title: “worth the extra bucks!!!”
Reviews.Author: Genia2011
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth the extra $$ compared to other hotels. If you're in the party mode you might want to stay in the strip. Our group was looking for a nice hotel where we could relax during the day in a nice pool and then go enjoy Vegas at night. We didn't want a hotel with a Casino inside. To me, it's just depressing getting out of the pool and seeing stressed people gambling their life savings instead of enjoying the sun. Talking about the pool, the pool is amazing and it has a lot of beds and chairs to seat. There's also a cabana you can rent for those who really want to avoid the sun. We had dinner and breakfast at the DJT restaurant and we were very happy. The breakfast includes fresh squeezed orange juice, your choice of omelette, waffles, chocolate croissants for $20:-) Pretty good right. And the bed, pillows and jacuzzi makes you almost not feel like leaving your room:-)

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: meghanaoconnor
Reviews.Content: I've been visiting Vegas for 6 years now. I average 3 trips per year and I'm not much of a gambler. I just booked anther trip for FEB 2012 and guess where I'm staying? That's right, the only place worth it. If you want the best hotel room in the City? The Trump easily has it. It's by far more modern than the Wynn and it even blows the Venetian room/bed away. Robes, wonderful. I cannot stress how modern modern modern it is. They have a fridge you can actually USE as in not charge you like at the Wynn to put waters in it if you buy water in Vegas along with free water they do provide. The rooms come equipped with kitchens/stove/glassware – this is a standard room at the Trump. A standard room at the Trump blows Wynn out of the water. I can only imagine what a higher priced room is like. Since I first stayed here, I’ve only stayed here except for the last time, I foolishly stayed at the Wynn and what a MISTAKE. I was sobbing gazing at the Trump from the Wynn lobbying waiting on the ridiculous staff to get me a room before 4pm. (sigh) never again! If you get a discounted price you do not get discounted service. The Trump staff is awesome. The rooms are what really keeps me coming back. The location is wonderful for those who like to shop or like to visit other parts of Vegas while there. It's really the best hotel. You don't walk through any casino to get there. I could go on and on. Just check it out for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with many drawbacks.”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in October, when we booked the travel agent did not mention that there was no casino, some will like this, we would have preferred the opportunity to go down when jet lag called and have a coffee and a play but could not. We had to walk to the Wynne about ten minutes away for this luxury. There is a regular shuttle bus there up to midnight and 2am at the weekends. There is also one to Caesars Palace and Forum Shops but this is a bit of a pain. If you want to stay on the strip without a casino and the accompanying stink of smoke, then this is the place. There is a token kitchen in the rooms and that is all it is, we could have done without it, the place seems to have been built as a condo hotel. The bathroom is big with huge glass doors that bang loudly if you are not careful (and catch your feet). There is a TV in the mirror that we had to request controls for. The kettle uses the stove and this would not work until the maintenance man came and fixed it. But a beautiful building with attentive staff and big rooms, pity about the lack of a casino. As for Las Vegas, the US is painfully behind the rest of the civilised world in that they allow smoking in most public places. A complete pain on the casino floor where people seem to light up next to you as they try to destroy their lungs - and yours if you don't get up and move away. There are filthy ashtrays everywhere - Come on America, join the rest of us and ban smoking. Therein lies the benefit of the Trump, no smoking, although when you just go in, sleep and come out you don't notice! We did not eat there and used the pool once, the view from the window was superb and we did not get sucked into the upgrade thing but still got a good room. Another nasty surprise is that here you have to pay the iniquitous Resort Fee, some hotels do not charge it and another thing that our agents forgot to mention. Why do they charge it? a Las Vegas newspaper that we did not even take in, coffee that should be available anyway, two tiny bottles of water and a pool. Check before you book as a bill for $150 after five days is a bit nasty and a fee that should not be applied to anyone - anywhere, come on Donald, get real! I suppose we should have complained about the duff stove, no TV controls and I forgot to mention, we never saw any dressing gowns as promised. The shuttle busses, probably charged for in the stupid charge but I bet The Wynne and Caesars Palace contributed to that for the punters that were delivered to them!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Excellent service!!”
Reviews.Author: Gully2011
Reviews.Content: Elegance, luxury, and the best part, the service is 10 of 10. Shuttle service to the C.Palace and Wynn makes you save a couple of dollars when going to the Strip. We got a room in the 40th floor, the view was spectacular ! The bed was one of the best I've ever used. they will charge you 19.95 per day for internet,still water,newspaper, but who cares, the hotel is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Joker1412
Reviews.Content: I read in before we left, some reviews where mad that it is too far from the strip and that soe where mad about the resort fee. Well, I want to dispel them rumors. The hotel is perfect, out of the way but still a block away from the strip and the Wynn. If u cant walk the 4 minutes it takes then Vegas is not for you. Almost every hotel or resort charges something, and it does include wireless and access to a big gym, and great pool. The rooms are nicely equipped, all the amenities are in there, the bathroom is huge, a great big 2 person tub and shower. Very lovely, will defiently stay here on our next trip. Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you can get a good deal - This place is great!”
Reviews.Author: briandveeTeesside_UK
Reviews.Content: If you look at the standard rack rates for a room at the Trump you may well be put off. Don't be! Just look around for special offers. We booked a room for 3 nights for about $380. At check-in we were offered an upgrade to a Strip-view room in a high floor for $25 a night. We took it. As other people have mentioned the hotel is about a five min walk from the strip / you can hear trains in the distance / cell phone reception is patchy at best. If you can overlook these things you get a proper 5 star casino-free Vegas hotel for 3 star money. Lovely rooms, big bathroom with jacuzzi tub and in-mirror TV friendly staff and a regular free shutte to the Wynn or Caesars to take the sting out of the less than perfect location. Next time you're in Vegas - give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the mountains, very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mink34
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trump from Oct 2nd thru Oct 4th, 2011. When we arrived, they door is held open and you are greeted. There was no long line waiting for check in and the lobby is fabulous. The desk associate was very polite and inviting. Our bags were brought directly to our room from the car. The room was absolutely beautiful and it looked exactly the same way it did on the website, down to the tic-tac-toe board on the coffee table. We had the city view, which was nice because we had the view of the mountains. The only thing that was missing out of the room was the robes, I called for them and they never arrived and then one day we had no water for an hour, which was a bit of a inconvenience. The trains that past by also put alil damper on the stay as well. But those are the most negative comments I could make about our stay. The in-suite room dining was great! It was nice to not have to go out and buy food if it was wanted. All around it was a great stay at the Trump and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: elninomagico
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights and found it to be amazing. The hotel lobby is stunning and we were welcomed in a friendly manner by the attentive and helpful staff. I loved the fact there was no casino in this hotel, henceforth there was no smoke. I stayed in a suite room on the 47th floor; it was huge! Massive bathroom with jacuzzi bath and walk in shower. The room also had the kitchenette area with the requisites for cooking etc. Happy hour between 1600-1900 in the hotel bar is great: it's $5 a drink. Amazing deal! We ate food from the bar and that equally was good. Loved the hotel and would definitely be back. PS- I heard none of this noise from the trains, so perhaps I was too high up. Didn't even realise a train ran under the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm - until the trains pass by!”
Reviews.Author: BoratHi5
Reviews.Content: Having read the various reviews we had a good idea what to expect from this hotel and mostly they didn't let us down. Check in was quick, the staff were excellent and the smoke free atmosphere was very welcome after our previous smoke filled experience at the Flamingo last year. We booked what we thought was a 1 bed strip view suite through Expedia and contacted the hotel in advance to request a suite away from the train tracks. The room we were given was indeed a South strip view on the 54th floor but no separate bedroom. We took this up with the hotel who claimed that the original booking was for a city view standard room and they had upgraded us to a strip view. Despite showing the Expedia receipt with strip view already paid for, we were left with a slightly larger than average hotel room with a few cooking facilities and not a one bedroom suite as booked. Expedia are looking into this but it was slightly disappointing after seeing photos of the one bed suite. The bed wasn't anything special and the pillows might as well not have been there at all but the room was clean, well looked after served it's purpose. For a 5 star property it was just OK but not a patch on most 4 stars in the Asia Pacific region or the Marriot Grand in Moscow. Location is fine, an extra few minutes walk and you're on the strip. The Wynn Casino Hotels are very close, Fashion show mall has a reasonable food court and is ideal to cut through on a hot day. Treasure Island and many of the larger hotels are also within easy walking distance. The pool is fine, great staff who will bring drinks and take food orders while you get over the jet lag and we can recommend the salads - enough for 2 people! The real downer was the noise from the trains who's drivers obviously get a kick out of sounding their claxtons from 3am onwards. These are not your average Inter-city trains either but huge rolling stock that can take a full five minutes to pass through. Despite being on the 54th floor we could hear them loud and clear! The breakfast express buffet was just average and for the only time during our stay, we were not impressed with the staff who seemed very keen to remove plates and rush us out so that they could re-set the table. At $20 per head it wasn't great value compared to most of the l breakfast buffets at any of the nearby hotels. We used Harrahs and the Rialto at around $12 each and were really spoiled for choice. Try the Rio hotel for a very lavish dinner buffet at around $25. To sum up, we were happy with the location, most of the staff were great but we wouldn't stay there again - unless they added extra sound-proofing to every room!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PGtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when we were in LV to get married in April and feel it is the best hotel in Vegas and very reasonably priced considering the luxurious accomodations. We spent the first two nights in LV at the Bellagio and moved here on the third night in the one bedroom suite. We wished we had booked the hotel for the entire stay.No smoking or busy casinos to plow through in order to reach our room. The strip view can't be beat!The hotel restaurant was excellent and we were also very happy with the food served by the pool. We had no problem with walking to the strip. It was a plus to walk through the shopping center across the street from the hotel. Family came to visit us in our room and were shocked at how nice it was. We could have had a party in the bathroom :)

Reviews.Title: “not vey welcoming”
Reviews.Author: andy f
Reviews.Content: arrived at hotel to find they had no knowledge of our booking .staff couldn't have cared less and told us we would have to pay and sort booking out ourselves . first room not clean , broken glass on the floor ,bathroom and room floors all marked bad smells in room and furniture not clean or dusted ,got room changed and this was not any better . moved to the bellagio the next day for the rest of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good But....”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Trump International in Las Vegas, the hotel was very clean and showed luxury and comfort and the staff were very friendly and pleasant from the maid to the restaurant manager. However my only problem with it was that at the point of checking in i was asked for $800 Resort Fees which covered in room coffee,water,newspapers being delivered and a courtesy bus that took you from The Trump to The Wynn resort which is across the road.I complained about this and after 3 chats with her faceless manager the charge came down to $90 which i still didnt want to pay as i had already paid for the room, she told me to pay the $90 or i would not get the room. I wasnt happy with that. So beware of these resort fees, i think they are some sort of scam. The room itself was very nice, the outer doors were a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jas0n03
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and splashed out for a top floor, 2 bedroom penthouse. The penthouse was simply amazing-by far the most impressive hotel room I have had the pleasure of staying in. If you can afford it, then I highly recommend the experience. We had room service one night and thought both the meals and service were first class. The bathroom amenities were the best by some distance over the other 2 5 star hotels we stayed at during our US trip. Marcus, made the best coffee during our entire 2 week stay (sorry, the US can't do decent coffee), and the doormen were always friendly and often greeted us with a "welcome home". Not having a casino and the non-smoking policy were big attractions, and our Strip view on the 64th floor is probably the best in the Town. The location is not a negative in my view and access to the Strip via Fashion Mall was easy. I had read the other reviews on the train noise, and unfortunately it is unnecessarily loud but I don't have a comparison as to whether other hotels experience noise any better or worse. It would not deter me from staying again. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. No casino to walk through to get to your room”
Reviews.Author: BiznPleasure
Reviews.Content: Good pool area. Great staff who enhance the experience. We're a bit sick of smokey casinos ( not the casinos) that you have to walk through. The Trump wasn't designed to be a hotel but it is fits the bill very nicely. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Should have been 5-star except for one awful experience...”
Reviews.Author: lani721
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Trump this past weekend and had a total of 4 rooms for 6 people (2 of them wanted to have their own rooms). I really want to rate this hotel 5 stars, but a couple of things really bothered me. I booked my hotel room through priceline, but I don't think that just because I did that, I deserve less than a 5-star service. In this economy, I know I'd find the best deal there is! I called the hotel a couple of days before our arrival and explained to them that I would be sharing my room with a friend. The reception explained to me that we would have to call priceline to have them fax the name of the other guest. No problem. Priceline told me it was done. I arrive hours later than my friend, and the first thing she asked me is why she wasn't able to check-in smoothly without any hassle as the hotel promised that as long as there was a fax from priceline of the 2nd guest's name it wouldn't be a problem. Long story short, my friend was given the run around, stating that they did not receive the fax so she had to call priceline again. It turns out they had the fax confirmation from priceline after all!!! Needless to say, I called for the manager and complained. I spoke to a Caroline (or was it Catherine) and explained the situation. She said that because of our inconvenience, she would comped us the resort fees ($50 for both of us). It's a nice gesture, but not to be ungrateful, I would've rather that this never happened in the first place. Guess what? Came time to check out and the front desk told us there was no note from the manager that we shouldn't be charged for the resort fee!!! Are you kidding me??? Here we go again, telling them our story. They said they are willing to comped us for ONE, but not both!!! You don't know me, but I don't back out that quickly when I know I'm right! I asked for the manager Caroline/Catherine and of course, she's conveniently not there. By this time, they could probably tell I am ready for a fight and finally they said it's ok. It had better be ok!!! In short, other than one nightmarish experience, the Trump is a really great place to stay especially for NON-SMOKERS! It's so nice to come "home" to a place that doesn't smell like ashtray, ugh! Plus, I like to gamble and the fact that they don't have gambling, it was nice not to be "tempted" 24/7. :-) I would like to add though that the doormen and valet guys there are the best!!! I wish I could remember their names, but all of them were really nice and treated us like the princesses that we are, ha! ha! Anyway, I'm planning on going back to Vegas for my "special" birthday next July and even with that one major complaint, I am actually considering going back to the Trump. I just hope that the GM makes sure to let his staff know that us priceline or any other travel site buyers deserve just as much respect as the ones who book their rooms directly with the hotel. BTW, there is another "very minor" thing that all of my friends and I noticed from all the 4 rooms. There is a bit of a "funky" smell that we can't figure out. I asked one of the workers there and he said it was "probably" the cleansers they use. Hmmm... Overall though, this hotel is in my opinion, a really good choice for Vegas - classy, convenient, great bloody marys (that's important in the morning after partying all night long!) and again, non-smoking!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Property”
Reviews.Author: castaways01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trump on a Friday night in October after staying on the strip for three nights. The hotel is beautiful and first class all the way. I selected Trump mainly due to the 4 p.m. check out time since I was taking a red eye flight to the east coast. I booked the suite on bookit.com for $118 plus tax and fees - a real bargain for a Friday night in Vegas. I requested a quiet room away from the train noise and was on the 56th floor. I didn't hear the train, but the cleaning staff were noisy out in the hallways early in the morning and the outer doors slam loudly, as some reviewers had mentioned. I have no complaints about the mini suite itself. The jacuzzi tub was awesome -- big and deep. I also went to the spa to use the steam room for an additional $12. I took the shuttle to the Forum Shops at Ceasar's Palace and took a taxi back from the Venetian. I can see where this location would not be suitable for some gamblers, but it was fine for the one night. All personnel I came in contact with were pleasant and helpful. After I checked out I had the bellman store luggage until around midnight. Retrieving the suitcase was easy and fast. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The Trump International Hotel in Vegas is a Quiet Non-Casino Secret”
Reviews.Author: CommentatorC
Reviews.Content: When I travel to visit Las Vegas, I almost always stay at the Trump International Hotel. This is a non-casino hotel so it's extremely quiet. The pool area is trnedy but also non-pretentious. The pool is olympic sized and the lounge chairs are quite comfy. They have a DJ that plays outdoors on the weekends poolside and their pool cafe menu is healthy and light. While this hotel only has the pool cafe and main floor restaurant, I enjoy staying here because the rooms are appointed with a stove, sink and refrigerator. I also like the fact that it is siuated across the street from the Fashion Mall and also right off the strip within walking distance to the Wynn Resort. If you're looking for a quiet non-smoking, non-casino place to stay, this hotel will not dissappoint you at all! I would rate the room a 10 out of 10 and the amenities an 8 out of 10!

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Elegent”
Reviews.Author: tjm0831
Reviews.Content: If you want to escape from the Casino scene and the Mass amount of people, then this is the place to stay. The hotel does not seem as wide as the other five-star hotels, but when it comes to the service and quality of the decor, rooms, and ammenties, it definitly hits the label of Five-star. The simplicity of the hotel is what makes it great and factor everything else, makes this is a great place to stay and the for the price for each night makes it even better. I got a deal on a weekday (Thurday) for $110 including the resort fee. I hope that will entice you enough to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “October 9-13, 2011”
Reviews.Author: D K
Reviews.Content: Just spent four nites at Trump for NBAA Convention. Beautiful rooms, beautiful lobby but what a NOISE from trains at 2.10am, 3.10am every morning - felt like they were coming into the room!!. Accepted rooms on 35th floor (with upgrade charges) but would probably have been better off taking basics. Very little "double glazing" - could hear every emergency vehicle passing. Be very wary of Resort Charge, USD95 - no way of getting out of it, even if you don't use pool etc. Overall, wouldn't stay here again and couldn''t reccommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Minor problems”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeW1111
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Trump Hotel was a beautiful, elegant property with spacious accomodations. Although we stayed in a standard room, the furnishings were very nice, the room was large, and the bathroom was gorgeous! The staff could not have been nicer, and they went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We had 2 minor issues- 1) There were no washcloths in the bathroom when we arrived and it took 2 phone calls and 40 minutes to have some delivered. 2) It would have been nice to have a make-up mirror in the bathroom. Other than that, we appreciated staying in a non-casino hotel. We will be sure to book the Trump on our next visit to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok...”
Reviews.Author: tamrn1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location 10/11-10/15. Impressive lobby. Upgraded to strip view to avoid much train noise. Since we were on 57th floor, doubt that would have been an issue, though. The Positives: Room itself was spacious and well nicely decorated. Comfortable bed. Ample closet and drawer space. Amenities in the room included a small refrigerator, cooktop, and microwave. A few dishes and silverware were provided. The bathroom was huge. All usual toiletries were provided. Wonderful plush robes are available. The robes were not in our room at check in but were promptly sent after calling the front desk. Friendly staff. Tasty breakfast buffet. The Negatives: Nightstand shabby and scratched. Spots on furniture and floor. Hot water was inconsistent in the shower. Kept getting cold. Finally let the hot run for about 10 minutes before getting in to have hot water all through the shower. Room smelled like it had once been a smoking room. Not bad enough to warrant a room change, but noticeable. No self parking. Valet only. Self park in the mall parking garage across the street. Location quiet since the hotel is sits off the strip, behind Fashion Show mall. Quick walk to the strip. Good hotel as a home base for day trips to surrounding areas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: copper2839
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights here, just a block off the strip and enjoyed being away from the madness! The room was beautiful, with marble everything in the bathroom, and a tv screen in the bathroom mirror! The pool area is beautiful, with huge day beds to lay on and great service from the restaurant and bar. This was a beautiful, immaculate hotel that I would definitely stay at again. I read the post on the noise from the trains, so asked for a room away from the tracks, and never heard them at night. I did hear them during the day, so appreciated that tip, as the noise wouldve kept me awake.

Reviews.Title: “Trump International an "Oasis" in the desert.”
Reviews.Author: gillian1963
Reviews.Content: PLEASE READ THIS REVIEW AND ALL THE REST WITH AN OPEN MIND,EACH HOTEL HAS GOOD AND BAD PONITS. ALL I CAN SAY:- This was my fifth trip to Las Vegas and this hotel in a hidden gem! Trump international is totally non smoking and casino free and how refreshing is that.There are plenty of Hotels on the strip with Casino's and smoke. Rooms are excellant with all amentities you need, even for us Brits a kettle! so just bring your tea bags and pick up the milk from Wallgreens at the Venetian. Understated ellegance in the reception with fast efficient,friendly service. Magnificant views of the strip day and night, get a room with a strip view and as high as possible. It took us 5 mins to walk to the Wynn or longer if we went through the shopping Mall but what is the rush! Vegas is open 24/7.Take advantage of the free shuttle too if you do not want to walk!! We did hear the trains but not enough to let it spoil our holiday. We had no compliants at all about the hotel or service, to have room service you had to press a button near the door. "Outback" australian resaurant is the best place for a steak on the strip. If you want european roulette tables, visit MGM, Venetian and Mirage. Enjoy your trip to Las Vegas we did and we will be coming back to Trump International.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay! The only place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: lorsyb
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the Trump International Hotel and our stay was out of this World! We arrived and were offered a one bedroom suite for an extra $50 per night and were so glad we took up the offer! We were blown away when we entered our suite! It was on the 58th floor, huge, lovely and bright with floor to ceiling windows all the way round! Our lounge had views of the mountains and city and our bedroom and bathroom had fantastic strip views. We had two bathrooms, one with a shower and toilet and the other with a two person jacuzzi tub, toilet, huge shower and double sink with large mirrors and marble floors! Fluffy towels, robes and wonderful smelling toiletries were provided! We had a fully equipped kitchen, three TV's inluding one in the bathroom mirror, CD player and just about everything you could possibly need during your stay including iron and ironing board and room safe! We just loved being in our suite at night either sitting in the jacuzzi tub looking out at the fantastic view of the strip or gazing out at the same view from our bedroom! Coffee and bottled water were provided every day along with a daily newspaper (included in the resort fee). The room was spotlessly clean and cleaned daily. I am a light sleeper and did hear the train late on a couple of occasions during our stay but it did not bother me at all and I have to say that we slept really well whilst staying there! The bed was so comfortable and everything so relaxing! The hotel is great because it doesn't have a casino and so is easy to get to your room. The reception area is lovely and always smelt great. The staff were always courteous and helpful and it was great that security always checked you were a hotel guest when you came back late at night! The gym is high tech, fully equipped, lemon water and chilled towels also provided! The swimming pool is great and sunbeds and towels provided. There are also two spa tubs! The area was never crowded whilst we were there and we enjoyed lunch and a few drinks there too! We ate an evening meal in the restaurant on two of the nights and breakfast one morning and on all occasions the food was excellent and service great! The decor of the restaurant was lovely and very intimate. I could go on and on about how wonderful this hotel is! We just loved returning to our wonderful suite every night and our friends were so envious of us. They preferred to stay in a hotel on the strip and their rooms were small and dark with a long walk through the casino to get to the lifts to their room! Staying just off the strip was not a problem to us as it is only a 5-10 minute walk to the Wynn Hotel and a courtesy shuttle is provided by the hotel to the Wynn or Caesars Palace Forum Shops although we never used it as we loved the walk in the evening! We were so sad when we checked out as our stay was really a wonderful experience for us. We cannot rate the hotel highly enough and wouldn't stay anywhere else in Vegas and we are already planning a return trip! Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Deb620_11
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas for 3 days for my son's wedding andstayed at the Trump. The service was excellent and everyone was more than accommadating and very friendly. My room was clean, ( except I noticed the furniture needed dusting), but overall the room was beautiful. The bed was very comfortable and I loved the fact that it had a small kitchenette with coffee so I didn't have to order some when I woke up. It was a smoke free hotel, quiet with no casino, however, if you wanted to get to the action you could take a free shuttle to the Wynn, which ran about every 10 minutes or less. The Wynn is where the wedding took place and it is so big that you can easily get lost; although it is a beautiful hotel also. I loved to sit outside and watch the people and the view of the hotel was beautiful. It was all in gold with beautiful chandeliers hanging down at the entry. It was easy to find my way around the hotel and the ammenities were numerous. They had a breakfast buffet each morning from 9a-11a with plenty of food, and it was very reasonable. I loved the in-bathroom TV which was in the mirror, so I could catch the news or my favorite program while getting ready for the events which I needed to attend. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone going to Vegas. It's right next to the strip, but far enough off that you didn't have such an influx of people. I enjoyed my stay very much and it's a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room was not cleaned”
Reviews.Author: Chen-san H
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights at the hotel. We were awaken by the train in the morning. Left the room at 9 am and did not return till midnight. To our surprise, our room was untouched for 15 hours, bed was not made and towels were not changed. We were not impressed by the service at this hotel and will not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you don't want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: 98travels2go
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 6 night stay at the Trump Hotel Las Vegas while attending a convention. The hotel is very easy to find and doormen and front desk staff was very friendly upon my arrival. While checking in, I was offered an opportunity to upgrade my room from a city view to a strip view for an extra charge, but since this was a business trip I declined this option. Upon arriving at my room, I was very impressed. Everything was first class. King size bed, flat screen TV, a sitting area with a sofa, two chairs, and a coffee table. The room also had a little stove, microwave, and a great little fridge. The evening view was spectacular even though it was a view of the city and not the strip. I ate dinner at the hotel which was very good. They had a $29 special that included an appetizer, main course, and a dessert. The smoked salmon appetizer was excellent and the portion was so plentiful, it could have been served as the meal. After dinner, I visited the Wynn Casino which is about a 10 minute walk. I returned to my room for a good nights sleep, or so I thought. I was awoken 3 times that night, and every other night of my stay by the passing train. Even though I was on the 44th floor, the horn from the train was so loud, I might as well have been on the ground floor. I've stayed at airport hotels that are right next to runways that were insulated better than the Trump hotel. I can not believe they did not take this into consideration when designing and building the hotel. After a very long day of being on my feet all day working at the convention, I needed more than 2 to 3 hour intervals of sleep. Our company had 5 rooms in the hotel, and all of my colleagues said they were also awoken by the train. Upon checkout, when I was asked how everything was, I told him about the train and the staff member showed no concern and just said "next time, tell us you want a room away from the train." Are you kidding? If the hotel is aware of a noise issue, they should make every effort to correct it or at least move their guests away from that area and not charge them extra by offering it as an "upgrade". What should have been an excellent hotel is now one of the worst hotel experiences I ever had. Unless you are a very heavy sleeper, avoid the Trump Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Peace in a crazy city.”
Reviews.Author: deelovnco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Trump International October 6 through October 9, 2011 for my sister-in-law's wedding. The entire week was amazing! A huge reason why is due to our stay at Trump. I used to be in hospitality and know service standards inside and out. This hotel has a very high standard from the bellman/doorman, to the bartender, pool staff and housekeeping. Everyone was eager to assist and did it with a smile. As for the rooms…WOW is all I can say. We were in a 1 bedroom suite which was very large, full kitchen, great King bed, built in closets and shelving units, large living area with big couch and the bathroom…. AMAZING! Jacuzzi tub, his/her sinks, TV in the mirror, two headed showers, table with a makeup mirror and large mirror for the ladies and marble everything. The bride and grooms families rented out the penthouse for their stay as well as for the rehearsal dinner and breakfast after the wedding. The room was amazing! There was a problem in the beginning during the set up for the rehearsal dinner but the staff did everything they could to remedy the situation. We did have lunch at the restaurant which was very good with just ok services. We hung out at the pool for an afternoon and experience amazing services as well as a great ambiance. The number one thing I appreciated about the hotel is there is no casino in the lobby. When you were done with the strip and the craziness of your day, you walked into the hotel and had peace. A huge plus in Vegas! I will certainly return to Trump!

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Stay in a Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Frank H
Reviews.Content: What a great idea it was to build a hotel almost on the strip in Vegas that doesnt have a casino and is non-smoking! My wife and i stayed here for two nights (wish we could have stayed for more!) and it was one of the finest hotels we have ever been fortunate enough to stay in! As there is no casino, when you walk in there is no two mile trek past slot machines to get to reception like other hotels on the strip, the reception is there when you get through the doors! Inside the hotel is magnificent and opulent, maybe it would put some people off by its new style grandeur but we loved it! The staff were friendly and very professional and we were upgraded to probably the finest hotel room/suite we have ever stayed in! ( i told them we had travelled from Ireland to stay there). The bed was the biggest, softest and cosiest we have ever laid down on. The bathroom was huge and the bath was fit for royalty! We used the pool which was great to get away from the (brilliant) madness of Vegas and the restaurant is excellent. Overall if you want to experience the non stop action of vegas but be able to relax in bliss back at your hotel ,then you wont get better than the Trump!

Reviews.Title: “Good.. but could be better considering it is Trump”
Reviews.Author: S99
Reviews.Content: I recently had a 4 night stay at the Trump Hotel Las Vegas. I chose this hotel because I was getting a very good price and was willing to overlook the inconvenience of being off-strip. I also thought that the courtesy shuttle to and from the Wynn and Casesars would make up for this as well. So, let's start with the good points. I loved the fact that it was a non-casino hotel and totally smoke free. It was quick and easy to get up to your room once walking through the front door. Most casinos make you walk through a long maze of a smokey casino before getting to the guest rooms. Service from everyone I encountered at the Trump was top notch and what I would expect from a Trump hotel. Lobby was very classy and the hotel smelled so nice when you walked in. Rooms were very large. We had a studio suite and I liked the fact that there was a kitchenette (stovetop, microwave, dishes, and fridge). It was a quick walk across the street into Nordstroms or via the mall parking garage right into the mall itself. The mall has lots of options for good priced food. We grabbed quick breakfasts at Starbucks or the eBar at Nordstroms. You could also walk through the mall to the strip easily. As for food, we didn't eat at the hotel but we did order room service once. It wasn't that expensive and was very quickly delivered at 1:30 am. Veggie wrap was way too salty considering it should be a healthier option. Other points to note was that I also loved the live music on evenings at the pool level and the lobby. Nice touch! So: here are the not so great things: We were told upon check in that our room was in a really noisy location and that if we wanted to upgrade to a higher floor, with a strip view, that was less noisy, it would be $25 a night. So, we decided to pay for the upgrade. The view was great, we were on the 45th floor, but that train horn was SO LOUD!! It sounded like it was right outside my room. It was infrequent, but was loud enough to wake me up out of my sleep. There is nothing that can be done about the train horn, but I think that the hotel should make every effort to keep people away from the noise without having to pay extra. I could only imagine how much more noisy it would have been had we not been facing the strip. My second complaint was that the room needed some maintenance work. The sofa and sitting chairs looked really worn out and they looked dirty. Also, the bathroom shower head needed cleaning as it was laden with water deposits/scum. Also, the same was true for part of the sink. I was surprised to see these things in this hotel, and you don't even see these things in the most basic Holiday Inn Express. My third and biggest complaint is the courtesy shuttle to the Wynn and Caesars. First of all, let me say that the drivers are excellent. They do their best given the limited resources and handle the complaining passengers in a most positive manner. Why do the passengers complain? The fact is that a 9 person shuttle it totally INSUFFICIENT for a hotel with 1232 suites, and 50 penthouse suites. Most times, people were left behind to wait for the shuttle to return again since it got filled up with only 9 people. Also, at certain times only one of the 2 shuttles were running, alternating between the Wynn and Caesars. The worst time for getting onto a shuttle is during the evenings, especially from Caesars. Be prepared to wait...and wait. We were not able to get on a shuttle after waiting one evening at Caesars, since there were more than 9 people ahead of us. Since we were pressed for time we just decided to take a cab. It was $10 with tip and I want to say to Mr.Trump, you owe me $10. My thoughts are: If you are going to offer a service to your hotel guests, DO IT RIGHT, or don't bother at all. How hard would it be to lease/buy bigger shuttles? or get a couple more shuttles and drivers? It won't break the bank, and would keep people happy. The shuttle issues created more negative feelings with guests than anything else. Therefore, we will not be returning to Trump and will just pay the extra money and stay on strip next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great views of the strip!”
Reviews.Author: The_Traveller954
Reviews.Content: What a room! Very comfortable bed and living area. We had a one bedroom suite with two full bathrooms, one being a huge master bathroom with a TV in the mirror. Awesome! We thoroughly enjoyed the hotel, and would recommend it to others. Something to note - there are no casinos in the hotel. Two minor inconveniences: - Feathers poked through the feathertop bed. - The room safe was not open upon check in. When trying to have it opened for us, we had some challenges. The only downside to the hotel that we found is the walkable distance from the center of the strip if that is important to you (it was to us). On a positive note, the views of the strip are fantastic and you are perfectly aligned looking straight down the middle of the neon excitement.

Reviews.Title: “Understaffed, overpriced dining”
Reviews.Author: sirspeedy
Reviews.Content: I suspect that because of the low occupancy, staffing has been cut "to the bone". Only 2 front desk attendants for a 52 floor hotel? Insufficient wait staff in the dining area, room not cleaned until dinner time. Only 1 soap bar,no luggage stand, no decaf coffee in the room but $ 13 for a decaf cappuccino or a glass of house wine, plz. There is a quote of Donald's in the pool bar area that if you're going to think, think big. At this location, the plusses are big but... The rooms are clean, big and modern with jacuzzis (guess there is no water shortage here), but the shortcomings are too many. Also, some complained about the train whistle noise at night,but though I am a light sleeper, I wasn't bothered .

Reviews.Title: “Excellence at The Trump”
Reviews.Author: Coco3000
Reviews.Content: Amazing!very classy,great location,cannot say enough about it...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: misskaty44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September for 5 nights. Straight away having people greet you, the white gloves, the doors opened, the friendliness of the reception team were fantastic. Then onto our room, beautiful, the place was very clean, we were on the 40th floor. The rooms are just amazing, even the little hallway away from the corridor before you get to your room. The hotel is off the strip however, the shuttle bus was efficient and the drivers were very friendly and helpful, also if your not adverse to walking it really is not that long a long to the strip anyway. All the staff were attentive, it was lovely to come back to each night, and I have already booked our next trip to Vegas already and we are also staying at the Trump again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again and again”
Reviews.Author: BobZAtlanta_Ga
Reviews.Content: Being off-strip, I was not excited about this hotel stay. Well, I take it back. The distance to the strip was never an issue. The hotel itself is lovely. Trumpish, but not LV over-the top. Check-in was smooth, we were upgraded and our rooms were wonderful. This was the nicest hotel room I have ever stayed in. It was set up more like a residence, with thoughtfully placed books and nick nacks. The bathroom was gigantic, but the bath towels were cheap, cheap, cheap. C'mon, Donald, upgrade your towels! The pool was beautiful and had really comfortable loungers. One complaint, which prevents me from giving this hotel an excellent, was the restaurant choices. The only options are the pool grill and DJT. DJT is supposed to be the restaurant. It just seemed to be some cordoned off tables in a part of the lobby. We ate breakfast there once (three night stay). It was 19.99 and equivalent to a free buffet at a Hampton Inn. Ugh..Once was enough.of that bad food. We got this on Hotwire for $113. Deal! Stay here if you don't care about being on the strip - it's great!

Reviews.Title: “Repeat visit - can't get enough of this place!!”
Reviews.Author: vickster1971
Reviews.Content: Returned to Vegas for our 4th visit and our 2nd stay at the Trump - this time for 7 nights at the end of September 2011. Won't stay anywhere else as absolutely love this hotel. This time we were allocated a junior suite on the 38th floor overlooking the mountains/downtown - wasn't that bothered about not having a Strip view; who actually spends time in their room to look out the window!! Spent every morning by the pool - the loungers have been upgraded and all towels now have a "T" embrodiered on them (nice touch!). Had lunch in the Pool bar one day - huge salads and lovely Mojitos. Also enjoyed happy hour in the bar lobby a couple of evenings. Have to shout out to the lovely Nathalie who served us on both nights and remembered what we had ordered the night before!! Great to see the shuttle has had its times increased - we did make use of it to Caesars a couple of times; the rest of the time we walked or took a cab to the top end of the Strip. Cannot fault this hotel and will be returning to the Trump next year to celebrate our 10th Wedding Anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Wyc0mbe
Reviews.Content: Having been to Vegas a few times before and staying in various quality hotels from the Tropicana to the Encore, I read with interest some of the previous reviews. There were 4 of us travelling to Vegas from the UK and we had booked 2 Strip View rooms. On arrival the first thing we noticed was that it was Valet parking only, but this wasn't an issue as it was included in the resort fee, as was WiFi which was excellent seeing as last time I stayed in the Encore the resort fee was comparable but the WiFi was expensive! We were allocated 2 rooms next to each other on the 40th floor, which shared an entrance. This was perfect as we could leave the internal entrance doors unlocked whilst still being secure inside the main door. We had read the reviews on here about the sofa beds and the lack of plates etc, and sure enough our sofabeds weren't made up and there was a lack of culinary utensils etc. We rang down and within 10 minutes this was all sorted by some very friendly staff who were very apologetic. This was potentially the only thing that I could fault throughout my entire week long stay. We chose the Trump just to try something different having always stayed in Strip hotels with Casinos before. It makes a massive difference in entering and leaving the hotel literally coming out the lifts and onto the road outside - I think even given it's off strip location it's still quicker to get to the strip from the Trump than it is from a guest room in the Encore as there's no casino or shops with hoards of people to struggle through. The pool was most impressive as although it's small it gets the sun the whole day which is more than some I've been in e.g. PH. We didn't use the bar or room service etc as we'd stocked up on things from Wal Mart and having a full size fridge and cooking facilities meant we could have beer / snacks whenever we wanted and obviously being from the UK we could make the obligatory cup of tea using the kettle / hob etc! The infamous train seemed no louder here than it did from a strip view room at the Encore to me - it woke me up on 1 out of 7 nights and that was my 1st night. Speaking of sleep the bed in the room offered an amazingly comfortable sleep and the sofabed was far better than some of the reviews on here had led us to believe. I didn't use it but the person that did slept soundly every night with no complaints the next morning. Overall I was most impressed with the Trump, excellent service, lovely rooms and great location. Not having the casino I think is all down to personal preference and although I don't gamble, I do like the atmosphere and buzz of the casino hotels like the Wynn/Encore, but for practicality the lack of it certainly offers a benefit too. It depends what you're after I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but railroad is too close”
Reviews.Author: nasbr
Reviews.Content: When we first walked into this Hotel we loved it. It is a few hundred feet from the strip, mall across the street, nice lobby and rooms. But after our first night we forgot about all that because it is impossible to get a good night sleep. A train woke us up at different hours until dawn. If you come to Las Vegas for business or pleasure eventually you need a good nights sleep so you can wake up rested and do it all over again. With the trains it is impossible to get a solid eight hours. Also housekeeping needs to be more attentive, we saw some used condoms under the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest non-casino hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: IntegrityTravel
Reviews.Content: Mr. Trump did a fantastic job with this hotel. Some minor flaws, such as suite furniture that's scuffed and walls that need a painting, other than that he gets most of it right. You can find this resort for pretty decent rates online, the hotel also offers buy-up upgrades which is nice. I scored a two room suite with two bathrooms, two showers, and a refrigerator. My room had a beautiful view of the Strip, but there was significant noise from railroad tracks to the west of the hotel near Industrial Rd. I was unaffected by them, but even from the 55th floor you could routinely hear the train. Light sleepers beware. The hotel only offers valet parking. A huge negative, but they're relatively quick and pleasant to deal with. What makes up for all the negatives is the plush accommodations, spacious master bathroom, HDTV and great service.

Reviews.Title: “TRAINS!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DebP407
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the beautiful Trump Plaza. Staff was wonderful. The room was to die for. We were on the 51st floor over looking the train staition. We had no idea as we didn't arrive until late P.M. We were woken up several times in the evening by the blowwing of the loud train whistle. Too bad. I would reccomend any wanting to stay at this beautiful place to please be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and room”
Reviews.Author: HornetBrad
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we were getting married in Vegas and needed a good value room and weren't too worried about a casino as we have experienced all the sights and sounds of Vegas on previous trips. This hotel was excellent value and when we got there, my best man had paid to upgrade us to a corner suite. However the manager told us that he would have upgraded us to a strip view room anyway without charge, a lovely present to us. As we were getting married, he also sent up a bottle of champagne on our wedding day, most thoughtful. The room was excellent - wonderful views of the strip. Two large bathrooms, three TVs, large corner sofa, full kitchen, there really was nothing more we could have asked for. :) As for the comments about being far from the strip... We stayed in the MGM last year and from room to strip, it was quicker from the Trump than the MGM. It's no good being on the strip if you have to spend 15 minutes walking through the hotel to get outside. ;) We usually walked through the Fashion Show Mall but there was also a sidealk which took 3-4 minutes to get to the strip and also a free shuttle to Caesar's and the Wynn. Thoroughly recommended and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but I was woken by a train”
Reviews.Author: rogersgrac
Reviews.Content: Gold, gold every where. I even managed to see donald trumps older son while staying here. Nice room with large fridge which was nice as many barfridges have sensors so you have no chance storing food or drinks not at trump though. Quick check in and friendly staff nice but not obtrusive. A bit of a walk to the main street which was annoying. However get the duece bus pass and you can elleviate the pain of walking from casino to casino. Free shuttle to bellagio on the half hour stops at 11pm which is a little annoying. Amazing lobby with lots of space and nice places to sit. Non smoking which is a god send in vegas also no casino so a higher class atmosphere as a result. Note I actually went here in April 2010 but cant list places you have stayed this late.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maysie25
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend in September for 5 nights. We booked the city view suite which was really big and spacious with a nice big bathroom with a jacuzzi bath and a really big shower. The pool was nice and never crowded which was good and the staff at the pool were very nice and helpful. I found the location of the hotel really good. It was literally a 2 minute walk to the strip and if you were heading for the strip before 9 you could just head across the road and go through the air conditioned shopping mall. It was a nice, realxed hotel which was sometimes a welcome break from the madness that is the strip in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “So Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Mary W
Reviews.Content: This is my first time to Vegas and my husband's second. Was really concerned after booking the vacation that we would be too far away from everything but oh what a delightful surprise this hotel turned out to be. First, it is beautiful, very, very clean and a remarkable staff.
