Second, every night we have come home we are delighted to be away from the noise, love the smoke free clean smell of the hotel, love being across the street from the mall and the shuttle service is awesome. We upgraded to 1000 sq. ft room with mountain views and I haven't regretted the decision once. I just wish I had been offered a corner room as I read they are exceptional. I could never imagine staying anywhere else. I am pretty fussy about my surroundings and have not been disappointed here. We absolutely loved everything about this hotel! Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: cyndeej58
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay! No complaints. We were worried after we read some of the reviews about it being a little off the strip.The shuttles ran like clockwork, absolutely no complaints! , And we had no idea when we booked it that it did not have a casino , but it turned out to be awesome! When you come back from all the frenzy of the strip and walk into the hotel and smell the wonderful scent they put out through the vents, you feel like you have come back to a retreat!! No noise, no cigarette smoke and not temptation to put $20 more in a machine on the way to your room!! Just request a room on the opposite side of the train, we did and they were very willling to do that.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous view”
Reviews.Author: Carla W
Reviews.Content: We were located on the 59th floor view a view up the strip and it was fantastic. It was lovely to come back to the hotel after being in the casinos to such a calm atmosphere! The staff were very helpful. The jacuzzi bath was massive! Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great place!”
Reviews.Author: Agrego
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights over Christmas and it was the best accommodation on our USA honeymoon. The hotel at the end of the strip and has no casino- this means it is quiet and peaceful. Also the city views are amazing. We stayed on the 42nd floor and could see right up to the other end of the strip! The rooms are spacious and luxurious with a TV in bathroom mirror! The concierges were always very friendly and helpful. The hotel offers free wi-fi but at the time iPads struggled to pick it up. They brought an IT person to our room but he unfortunately couldn't fix it. We discovered we could pick it up in the lobby however so we skyped home there. We visited lots of casinos with accommodation and TRUMP certainly showed them up every time. I can't wait to get back there some day!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation from the Children!!”
Reviews.Author: Kristal C
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The staff was extremely friendly and accomodating. The people at the door greeted you each time you left and returned. It felt like they were happy to see you. We loved the fact that there was no casino on site. After hearing all the noise from all of the other casinos you visit on the strip it was nice to come back to your hotel to some peace and quite. The rooms were huge and we loved the kitchenette. It allowed you eat breakfast in your room before you went out which saved money. The pool was large and very clean. Exercise room was small but it really was all you needed. Besides, when you're on vacation who really wants to focus on exercise!! Hotel is right across the street from the Fashion Show Mall and a short walk to the strip. I would stay again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: mopowe
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal when we booked. We upgraded on-site to a one bedroom apartment. Big difference!! We LOVED IT!!! I had often said that I would like to try a different hotel each time we visit. However, after staying there, I don't want to go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Recommended for non-smokers, family with kids, and individuals on biz trip.”
Reviews.Author: Lilmcnugget
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Vegas in Sept. Brought a 2 night stay here for the 1st time as a Expedia "Mystery" Hotel. Actually we already knew we are going to get Trump, coz there isn't any 5 star, smoke-free, casino-free on the North end of the strip. Location is 1/2 a block off N end of the strip, right next to the Fashion Show Mall. If you are young or fit enough, you can get take a short walk thru the mall (while enjoying the air cond and shops) to get the strip in just 5mins for a brisk walk, or 8mins for a casual walk. Free complimentary air cond shuttles are available (actually it is covered under your mandatory daily resort fee) every 15mins to & from Trump, Caesar Palace and Wynn. The last shuttle is at 12 midnight, but even a 10min walk from the LV blvd (strip) was not nearly as bad. Pros: - For a starter, your body and your clothes won't come back smoke-infused (unless you have submerged yourself in other smoky hotels for the whole day). At the lobby, you will greeted with fresh air and be free from the noise of drunk youngsters and gamblers, and from the in-famous slot machines. - Checkout is easy and fast. They call your room the day before to remind you the 3 ways to checkout: front desk, by phone or by TV. We checked out via TV. Took less than a minute. - Energy saving: they replace almost all spot & flood light with CFL, which I don't mind for the sake of conserving for the planet and becoz they use warm colored CFL (not cool white thanks god) without making you look like a ghost. Just press the Home Service button on daily before you leave, the maid will service the room. - Our room is a Basic room on the 50th floor. Not sure if Trump has changed their doors, but we hadn't experienced any noise from our neighbor closing the doors. - Clean room. Comfy bed. Even basic rooms are well equipped. Floor to ceiling window, built-in stove, microwave, mini sink, fridge (great for biz trip & family. Just heat up a hot breakfast in the morning on the go; call room service to get utensils and coffee pot for free), coffee maker, daily refill coffee, tea & 2 bottled waters for free, bathrobes, jacuzzi, walkin shower, builtin tv washroom mirror, reasonably large rm LCD, vanity mirror, hair dryer, shutout light blinds, spacious washroom. The toilet is partially enclosed off so any particular smell won't be spread to the rest of the washroom. Cons: - An expensive stay, even at discount. - Contemporary décor & interior design. Expecting a 5 star hotel basic room to be have impressive decors & interior design. Not a single interior design element in the entire hotel is extraordinary IMHO. But would say their design is shooting for a clean, elegant, executive, contemporary look as supposed to over the top vegas extravaganza. - Not a big property compared to other hotels on the strip. Relatively small pool by Vegas standard. "Restaurants" in the lobby area are pretty much for people watching (or for ppl watching you eating your food). - Check in: don't know if it was Expedia's or Trump's fault. For some reasons they had our booking reference # but not our names on file, which caused kink in the ID verification at checkin. Ended up waiting for 20mins until they sorted out the deal and apologized again for our inconvenience. But overall I would say their front desk staff are polite, friendly and representable. - Weak shower pressure even on the 50th floor. Water was not HOT HOT at max setting but good enough to generate ample steam. May be it is 1 of their ways to preserve and be cost-effective. - Weakness in maintenance: given the young age of the hotel, it has already started to show some signs of premature wear & tear. Trump will not be too pleased. The shower temp control had pieces falling off. The showerhead was broken for other pressure settings. Broken light bulb in the vanity mirror had not been replaced. Toilet cover was loosen. We had to screw it back to make it stay. - Heavy glass door inside the washroom: walkin shower and the toilet are thoughtfully individually enclosed, but the doors are too heavy that it bang too hard if you don't close them carefully enough. Nice hotel. Would stay here again, at a discount of course.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Kelli K
Reviews.Content: My brother-in-law lives in Vegas so I have been there several times, however I seldom stay directly on the strip. I had been to Vegas in this past May on business and stayed at the Palazzo. Everything about our stay was phenomenal. When booking this trip for my brother-in-law's wedding we found a great deal at Bookit.com by searching for 5 star hotels. This hotel is not worth 5 stars. The location is nice - not a far walk from shopping and close to some major casinos (i.e. Treasure Island) with free shuttle service to others (i.e. the Wynn). We rented a car and never had a problem with valet service. In fact, all of the service personnel (front desk, doormen, bell hops, etc.) were first class. But that's where it ended. We had booked adjacent suites for our stay, which included a kitchenette. The suites were joined by a private "foyer" - which for us was nice because my mother-in-law stayed in the adjoining room - but I think would be very strange if you shared this with someone you didn't know. The rooms were very small and although the view was nice, it didn't say "5 star" to me. Everything was dingy looking - table tops were marred with scrapes and cup rings, dust collected on top of shelves and in corners and the furniture looked old and worn out. The tv in the bathroom mirror didn't work when we arrived - it was fixed a few hours later with a call to the front desk. We stayed for 5 nights and our tv quit working on the last day, as well as the jets in the jacuzzi tub (which was the only thing that I enjoyed in the room). The microwave and mini fridge were of suitable size, but there was 3 of us in our room and we only had silverware for one. Service for four would have been more expected. The coffee maker was fast but only brewed one cup at a time so I had to request several extra packets of coffee (which the housekeeping staff complied with). The drapes were missing a pull rod which made them a pain to close at night, and the sound of the train was very distracting. The air conditioning (a must in Vegas!) did not seem to cool the room down until the end of the 2nd day. Overall, our stay was satisfactory but it was NOWHERE NEAR worth 5 stars - I've stayed at better Holiday Inns. The price and the added "fees" is just not worth it. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice off strip choice”
Reviews.Author: aplnet
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a strip view room in June 2011. Room was very spacious and view of strip was pretty good. Was pretty loud at night from strip noise, even on 36th floor, but usually quieted down after 2 am. Didn't like the fact that you couldn't self park, and that only valet was available. Also, housekeeping completely missed my room on one of the 3 days I stayed there. It was a bit of walk off the strip, but not really too far. I did like the fact that the hotel had no casino in it, and so you didn't have the smell, traffic, etc. associated with that. Overall would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for couples not for families”
Reviews.Author: CMAR2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice but the rooms were 4 people can sleep have a wonderful King bed and a not so confortable sofa bed for the kids. At the pool they have very good looking waitresses but not even one good looking male waiter (isn't that sexual discrimination ??)

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Anon621
Reviews.Content: What a Hotel, Everything superb! We had a Studio room with a Strip view, the room was beautifully furnished. The staff were friendly attentive and very efficient. The hotel is just off the Strip and has no Casino which we found a benefit.However it does run a shuttle service to Ceasars palace

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: There is no self-park option which is annoying. One day we dropped the car with average gas mileage of 27+ mpg (after 300 miles road trip) and next day the car was showing 21mpg and was missing some gas in the tank. Did they leave it running for few hours or someone took it for a small test drive? We had a problem with room cleaning crew. If you don’t leave you room by 9.00 AM your room won’t be cleaned that day. Customer service will leave you a voicemail (around 6PM) saying that they didn’t clean the room since you were there and you can call them to bring you clean towels if you need them. It happened to us twice during our stay. Other days we were leaving around 8AM and those days the room was clean after we were back in the evening. One more thing – noise from the freight trains passing through in the middle of the night!!! In my opinion, all of the above completely unacceptable in 5* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxery thats affordable!”
Reviews.Author: MegAndTony
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights in the Trump to celebrate our anniversary. We had done some research and looked at other hotels on the strip, but this one we felt we got the most for our money. Our room had a kitchen and livingroom in the main room and a jacuzzi tub, huge stand up shower and a TV in the bathroom. We got breakfast room service every morning and really felt pampered while there. They have late checkout available and their staff was super helpful. Some people have complained about the distance from the strip, but we felt that it really wasnt that far. We are both in good shape for extensive walking however, so this may be more walking than required for someone that isnt used to or able to walk very far. We would stay there again if or when we return to Las Vegas in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but train keeps you awake at night”
Reviews.Author: BritRN
Reviews.Content: Stayed a Friday and Saturday night at the Trump. Loved that it did not have a casino and is smoke free. Nice suites.Restaurant and bar prices very reasonable. However, a major minus was that the hotel sits right by train tracks and the first night I was woken 7 times by freight trains passing through and 2 times the following night.Even using ear plugs the trains are very loud! So returning home the first place I went was to my bed to have a nap! Sorry, won't be back due to poor location!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time is not the charm”
Reviews.Author: MaxnKel
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed at The Trump in January 2011 we had a 1 bdrm corner suite, and it was awesome. We had people over for drinks and appetizers, it was easy as we had cocktail glasses, martini shaker, plates, flatware, and other items in the very nice kitchen. There were robes in the closet, and everything was top notch. Well, went back this weekend and things have gone downhill. No robes, even though their literature states that they are in the room, in the kitchen there were hardly any utensils, we had two forks, one butter knife, and one spoon which we discovered when we brought gelato back to snack on late one night. We had to share the spoon. We had one salad plate and one dinner plate, thank goodness we didn't plan on having anyone over or to eat anything in the room. We called down to housekeeping and asked for extra pillows, they came with no pillowcases. We had to chase down the guy and he then brought us the cases. There was a nice holder next to the phone for paper and pen, it was empty. Never did get filled. We had washcloths the 1st day then they took them and didn't replace them the 2nd day, we never did get any again. Bizarre. No napkins with the coffee fixings, which made the washcloth deficit even more noticeable as we could have at least used them as napkins in a pinch. The concierge couldn't have seemed more bothered when I stopped by to tell her that things just weren't up to snuff in our room. She said "So, what? Do you want some robes?" Then she asked if I wanted to have the day manager call me. I told her that I was leaving for the morning but he could call me in the afternoon. Guess who never called? Overall it was a big letdown compared to my first stay, and I'm not sure if I will come back. I do have to say the the valets and the doormen are AWESOME - they are so friendly and couldn't be nicer. It's nice to have a non casino lobby, it is very serene and smells great when you walk in. They need to work on the housekeepers and the female concierege.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury that lives up to the 5 Star rating”
Reviews.Author: Richard T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon trip to the USA. We could not have picked a better place to stay. We had a one bedroom suite with strip view on the 63rd floor. The room was amazing! The best I have ever stayed in. Huge, modern and a really comfortable bed. It even had two bathrooms with a huge Jacuzzi tub. The view from the room was also amazing. We found the staff to be professional and attentive. It is valet parking only, but this is included in the resort fee. There is a happy hour between 5 and 7pm where its two for one drinks in the lounge, which we utilised by having a few of the superb cocktails. This hotel is quite different from the other big casino hotels in vegas. First off it does not have a casino! Second its very peaceful and tranquil which makes a nice change from the rest of the strip. The buffet breakfast is also excellent. Furthermore there is a free shuttle bus to Wyn and Ceasers Palace for when you want to venture out for the evening. Fashion show mall is located right next to the hotel, so this is a perfect place to stay if you are planning on shopping there. In summary an excellent hotel in all departments. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Really wanted to love the Trump, but.....”
Reviews.Author: wader
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trump for 3 nights and I would return. But it wasnt 100% all positive, so heres the lowdown..... Pros.- Loved the fact the hotel did NOT have a casino, and it didnt cater to the party crowd. For vegas, it was very quiet. Room was spectacular, we upgraded to a strip view for $25 and it was worth it. We looked right over the strip on the 48th floor. Wow factor for sure! The pool was fantastic (for me at least) We have stayed at several hotels in Vegas and one of my pet peeves is the constant blaring of music. I wish hotels would actually pay attention and see that most people either have their own music they listen to on ipods and such, or they have a book or magazine and want some down time at the pool....not a party atmosphere. The trump pool was understated, but the music was bearable and pool staff was outstanding. The shuttle was also fantastic, it was quick and easy, and took you to Caesars in about 5 minutes. The Luxor end of the strip wasnt as easy to get to, but one day we took the shuttle to Caesars and just grabbed a cab from there and headed to the opposite end of the strip. The trump is an easy walk to the Wynn or the Venetian, I thought it would be further off the strip, but it wasnt too bad at all. Any staff member I dealt with during my three day stay was truly outstanding and friendly, cudos to all the staff! The cons- My biggest con, was the housekeeping (surprisingly!!) I thought for a five star hotel, a couple things were just unacceptable. When we checked in, I discovered the sofa bed wasnt made. This was no problem, as I understand it may or may not be used. But it took two separate calls to get it made. After the first call I was told they would send someone right up, but 3 hours later I had to call back and make a second request. Not a big deal really, but just one instance. Worse was the second day we were there, we had no housekeeping at all! We went out in the morning and came back around 1 to discover housekeeping hadnt been to our room yet. Not an issue however, so we stayed in the room for a couple hours and went out for the evening around 3 or 4. When we came back to the room at the end of the evening we were suprised to see housekeeping never did come to our room. The next day we went out in the morning again, and came back around 1 again, still to discover no housekeeping. By this time we had been checked in for 48 hours without a single visit from housekeeping. We had no clean towels and had run out of water and coffee etc. I called down again and let them know we hadnt had housekeeping for 48 hours and could they please come to our room. We left for the evening and by the time we came back it had been done. In my opinion, for a 5 star hotel this is most unacceptable. I understand mistakes happen and I hope this was just an isolated incident and if we visited the hotel again, this would not be the case. The only other thing was the shower flooded after 2 mintues of taking a shower. By then end of my shower, I would be ankle deep in water. All in all, I would stay here again if the price was right. If it were priced the same as the Wynn or Venetian, I may look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Trump does it right, off the strip”
Reviews.Author: tdornber
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Trump Hotel in Las Vegas and I was quite impressed (as expected, being a Trump property). The hotel has good points and bad points, but more good than bad. First, if you are going to this hotel, you have to realize that there is no casino, which is unusual for Vegas since there are slot machines in the airport. You also have to realize that this hotel is not on the strip....it's about a block back. Now, this could be something you are looking for if you want to get away from the craziness that is the strip but if you like being right there in the heart of the action, then this hotel may not be what you're looking for. This is just a hotel, no bells and whistles like the other Vegas hotels, no casino, no shows, no fountains, no volcanoes erupting, but also none of the hustle and crowds either. And it's smoke-free. Plus, no "porn" vendors outside the hotel either. On the strip, you can't spit without hitting one of these sleaze-peddlers. Trump offers you solace from that. However, don't despair, the hotel has shuttle buses that will take you right to Caesar's Palace and the Wynn, so you are only moments away. If you don't want to wait for the shuttle, the strip is only a 2 or 3 minute walk away. The hotel itself is beautiful. Marble floors, brass (gold) light fixtures, the woodwork around the walls and in the elevator reminded me of the boardroom on The Apprentice. The pool was great with lots of seats, warm water, clean towels, a bar nearby. This hotel also has a wonderful aroma. I have no idea what flowery smell it is but I have never commented on how a hotel smells unless it's bad. But this smell was great. It greets you immediately as you enter the lobby. At check-in, we were also offered the chance to upgrade our room for $50 more a night, which we declined. Quite frankly, it really didn't matter because the room we did get was one of the largest and best laid out hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. We were a bit confused as we approached our room when we saw two room numbers on one door (are we sharing a room with someone?). However, the first simply opens to an entryway. The two separate room doors were on the inside. Quick note here......your room has a doorbell!! Seriously. The bathroom I can only describe as huge. Standing in the door, the tub was on our left and was big enough for my girlfriend and myself to both fit in. A double sink on the far wall with a giant mirror, featuring a TV in the mirror. Several nights, we "bubbled" in the tub with the water jets going and watched TV. To the right behind glass doors was the shower....a shower big enough for both of us to walk around in. The toilet was also behind another glass door. Out in the room, we had a nice view of the Rio hotel and we could see the Mirage off to the left. However, right down below us we could also see Industrial Blvd featuring the Love Boutique. I won't comment on that......you can fill in your own blanks. King size bed was fantastic, plenty of closet space, counter space, we even had a stove, sink, refridgerator, utensils, in case we felt like cooking anything (we didn't). In front of the large window on the far wall was a couch which opened into another bed. Desk space was great and we had free internet (well, not really free....Trump hits you with something called a "resort fee" for $19.95 a day. Your internet is included in that fee). We did not eat in the DJT restaurant in the hotel, as it seemed a bit pricey. Now for some bad things, one other reviewer mentioned a train whistle. I would second that notion. We could see the train tracks from our room and a train did come by a couple times a day and was loud. 19th floor and we could hear it. However, growing up in a big city, I'm used to trains so it didn't bother me. Just be aware, you WILL hear the train. The earliest it came through was about 8am, the latest was about 11:30pm. We moved one of the chairs in the room and found a stain under the chair. Again, really didn't care.....I wasn't planning on eating off the floor anyway and afterall it was under a chair. However one point did bother me.....emphasis on the word "point". I was standing at the window one morning looking out over Vegas and I stepped on a carpet nail that was poking up through the rug. It did draw blood. Trump might want to get that fixed. I also noticed another carpet nail poking up near the entrance to the bathroom. So, be careful if you're walking around in bare feet. With that aside, I would still say this was one of the better hotels I have ever stayed in. I would highly recommend it and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cat0407
Reviews.Content: Loved it, loved it all...We walked into Trump International after a hetic trip across the USA and fell in love instantly with this hotel and we were only in the lobby...We were invited to upgrade for only another $50 dollars a night which we accepted and our king room turned into a master king room..When we entered our room, I was laughing hysterically as I have never ever had a room as luxourious as this one nor have I ever had a view as beautiful as the one I had....My partner was blown away even though he did tell me to stop with the laughter but I couldn't...We had a large lounge area, kitcnenette, two bathrooms with the master bathroom bigger than places I have stayed in previously and the bedroom and bed were bliss.... We heard the train at 3am but this did not worry us at all as after all, this was Las Vegas and a train passing through is far better than having a rowdy bachelor party next door which I have previoulsy experienced in Vegas. If you want quiet, a retirement village might be a better option as Vegas is about lights, noise and people....Loved it so much, we are planning our next trip back next year....Thankyou to the wonderful staff and the lovely young lady at the buffet making omlettes to order ( all included in the $20 buffet price ) I have told all who will listen since we came back home to Australia and I just wish I could be back there right now...At least I will no longer need to look around for accomodation as this one is locked into my favourites....

Reviews.Title: “relaxing haven away from the madness of the strip”
Reviews.Author: hatsie204
Reviews.Content: we have just got back from vegas and absolutely love this hotel.it was mine and my now fiance's first time in vegas and we knew that we were going to a hotel with no casino and we're so glad we did!!!vegas is just as crazy as everyone tell's you before you go although nothing quite prepares you for what to expect. we are not gamblers-which is one reason we chose this hotel,it is definately one of the more classy hotels in my opinion yet is close enough to the strip if you are.the hotel offers a courtousy shuttle to the wynn (5mins walk) and to the forum shops at ceasars palace(20mins)which are really helpful at all times of day.its good that you can go in and out of the hotels in vegas just for some food or to have a look round,put a bet on-whatever but it was so nice to be able to go back to the quiet hotel bar after a hectic day on the strip and have a drink before going to get ready to party all night and come back and not have to fight your way thorough the smoke and crazy gamblers to get to your room!!!!the rooms are lovely,we had just the basic studio suite and it was more than what we expected(we have stopped in many 5* hotels and this one knocked spots off most of them.bathrooms are huge,all marble with separate toilet and shower rooms,jetted tub-amazing!fills up really quickly and is a must to soak your tired feet after a hard day walking down the strip.big in room safe,(big enough for a laptop). kitchen with all the amenities we needed at least but they only thing we used was the coffee and cups!!we didn't eat in the room but it had everything needed if you would like to have cooked.we had room service one night and a lovely lady brought it into the room and offered to set the table up for us-silverware and all!!! we said no as we were only eating pizza and meatballs but it was lovely for her to offer!!!nice touch we thought.don't worry there is nicer food on the room service menu-it was just what we fancied!! the doormen here are really helpful too!anything you need they can help you,you are barely at the door and they have already opened it for you-makes you feel special. DJT restaurant is the best,my fiance had a steak and it was to die for!amazing food and nice waiting on staff about the train noise.........it is unfortunate but we were on the 34th floor and heard it every morning at about 6.30 and it is really loud,only last 5mins or so.so if your a light sleeper-bring some ear plugs!!other than that AWESOME!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, nice staff, but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: So_CalGirlsMom
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Trump in Las Vegas. The property is very nice and in a great location. I also like that it doesn't have a casino. We visited the spa and the pool and both were great. The only problem we had was that you could hear the train very well from the North side of the hotel and we were on the 56th floor. Also, the coffee maker had a plastic insert to put your coffee in, so the coffee came out tasting like plastic. We moved the next night to the other side around the 28th floor and it was better, but you could still hear the train. A friend of mine is planning a trip and called the hotel to talk about the train. They said it is best to stay on the South side on 35th floor or above. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Expected”
Reviews.Author: myakkalady
Reviews.Content: We made this reservation March, 2011 for our anniversary and my hubby's birthday thru Expedia. Bought voucher for Bell Transportation to shuttle you to/from hotel..worked out perfectly. Check in at hotel was just as we expected and we were upgraded to next level suite. We live in rural AZ with trains passing thru city so train horns don't bother us (ha). Room was excellent and the mattress does need to be replaced. Housekeeping was right up to par...I always bring little items (nail polish, lipstick) to leave with a few dollars each morning for housekeeper. Nice gesture. Bathroom TV was great. We ate at DJT Restaurant twice. Food and service was excellent. Prices and variety of entrees were very reasonable for Vegas. Had breakfast each day there - buffet if you wanted it - we ate off menu and again food was perfect. The lobby bar has some great bartenders...from 5-7PM daily happy hour...best deal in town...well drinks, wine, beer and nice selection of finger food available for $5. After that the prices go up and a very poor pour - we always stopped for a night cap. We understand new bar mgt. has instituted pour changes and that's why no one is at the bar after 7PM. The hotel shuttle is great....runs every 15 mins. to Wynn and Caesar's and returns you back to Trump...disappointing how many folks on shuttle stiff the driver. These folks depend on tips...come on folks. We had a minor problem with room and hotel manager handled it immediately. We had a wonderful five days at Trump. Will be returning Thanksgiving Week.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the Trump Train Hotel Experiance”
Reviews.Author: r m
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, but unfortunately they failed to inform me and the wife of the very annoying train that sounds its horn through the early hours. When I complained they tried to make the excuse that it effects all the strip hotels. NOPE don't think it does Mr Manager! Been going to Vegas for many years had no trouble with the others. So please don't make these poor excuses up. You may be sorry to hear about our stay and all the 100s of $$s we spent on sleepiness nights at the hotel, but I see no refund, no warning about placing the hotel on the side of the train crossing on your website. I have read the negative comments on here and the Managers replies. So no need to respond to this review, already read the standard comments your making with the others and the very weak excuses. You know if you actually held your hands up and said yes it was a mistake to build next to here because most out guest complain about the noise, I would have made the review more positive! Regards

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you are a sound sleeper”
Reviews.Author: Sapmomma
Reviews.Content: Well appointed hotel. Service is great, rooms are clean and spacious. Luxury abounds. However, train tracks are very close and trains blow their horns as they pass; even at 3 am. We have stayed three nights and a train has woken us up a couple of times each night. This is the only negative! Free bottled water from the front desk is a definite plus and almost makes up for the train... Almost. Make sure your room is on the south side of the building... May help...

Reviews.Title: “Nice property......but...”
Reviews.Author: becky47
Reviews.Content: The Trump towers are a very well mantained property..from the lobby to the pool there is attention to detail. Which is why our experience was so confusing. Our king sized bed had a huge divot in it. It was as if I was laying in a valley. The bed was mushy..not just soft..mushy. We asked for a change of mattress...the first time we have ever had to do that. The staff responded professionally and quickly. They also removed the resort fee by request. All in all our stay was peasant but given that we prefer beds with a bit of substance we may hesitate to return. If you prefer a firm mattress you may want to request one.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: EmsCardiff
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights during a recent visit to Vegas. It was nice to stay in a hotel that was just a hotel and where there was no smoking allowed. The suite we stayed in was huge, the pool and gym facilities were great. Although the hotel isnt on the strip the free shuttle bus ensured that it was easy to get around. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Lynn45916
Reviews.Content: "This was the nicest room I've ever stayed in. The bed and pillows were awesome. Slept like a baby. Everything was High End... even the drawers were self closing. I loved that it was non gaming. A nice quiet escape from the casinos. Just a walk across the street would get you into the fashion Mall. The valet parking was great and the staff was wonderful. The only con would be that they were completely booked and ran out of extra towels. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Trump does it right”
Reviews.Author: g1wzwnd
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a smoke and gambling free hotel also child friendly Trump is the place for you. The rooms are huge with very comfortable beds and pillows, big bathrooms with tub, shower and great toiletries, coffee makers, plasma, stove and great internet access. The staff was amazingly friendly and helpful and the shuttle takes you to Wynn and Ceasars all day long. Pool is also great with nice chairs, towels and natural shade in some areas. The only bad thing about this hotel is that you can not make phone calls on your cell phone from your room because there is no reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pjcoop
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great value for money. New/clean/ tidy and no gambling in the hotel. A little safe haven from the madness of the Strip...

Reviews.Title: “People and Process ruining Product”
Reviews.Author: TravelingJoe23
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the front desk....we were told our reservation was not in the system...after about a :15 minute wait that issue was resolved and we were given a room with a better view to make up for the issue....upon arrival at our room the housekeeping was not completed...sheets were off the bed and piled on the floor and chairs....upon calling the front desk they said to stay where we were and they would 'run' keys to a new room up to us....after 15 minutes and no new keys we went to the front desk....we would consider this to be 'three strikes'...and we relayed our experience to a manager named 'Kelvin' who assured us he would rectify the issues. He called our room within 5 minutes and offered to not charge us their $20 per day resort fee in lieu of the issues...which we accepted and thought this was a nice gesture for the issues....until we checked out and were told there we no notes on our account and the resort fees were charged!! (the desk agent took them off...but more hassle). The rooms and amenities were very nice...if we did not have to deal with operations and management...the entire experience would have been better. It is a shame to have a nice product and have people and processes fail so badly.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel”
Reviews.Author: twosheds
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights last week with another couple to celebrate their 40th birthday, we really loved the hotel, the pool was great and we thought the food and drinks were fairly priced, as for other reviewers comments about it being too far from the strip all I can say is WOW you guys must be seriously out of shape, we timed it and it was an 8 minute walk, I mean seriously!!!!! The room was great and so was the service, it was also lovely not having to walk through a busy casino to get to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ernest B
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel mainly because it had no casino and no smoking. It proved to be an excellent choice as it was even better than we expected. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is right across the road from the Fashion Show Mall. This mall is more than I had expected which was a mall filled with only designer shops. It had everything you could want and more. I have heard people complaining about the walk to the strip. These must be Americans who are incapable of walking any distance. It is at most 10 minutes to the strip, if you walk slowly that is. The hotel runs a shuttle to the Wynn and I was amazed at the number of people using it. The walk was 15 minutes!! There is also a shuttle running all day and up to midnight to Caesars Palace which is useful. We were celebrating our 30th anniversary and let the hotel know this. They very kindly upgraded us to a suite which was fantastic. A big thank you to them. I would have no hesitation if I return to LV staying in this hotel and would strongly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Tip top Trump”
Reviews.Author: Etherlycc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights the last week in August 2011. The hotel is first class and well worthy of its 5 star rating. Upon arrival after a10 hour flight we were greeted by very nice receptionist who informed us that our room had been upgraded to a strip view. The rooms are very spacious and the bathroom had a walk in shower and jacuasi and 2 wash basin. It even had a TV in the mirror!! The hotel runs a free shuttle bus to Ceasars Palace which take about 10 mins and runs about every 15 mins. This was a great service which ran from 9am until midnight. We had a meal in the hotel restaurant one evening and the food was excellent. The do a 3 course special for $30 per person which was very good. The staff, from the doormen to the cleaners and receptionists were all friendly and helpful. I would reccomend this hotel to one and all. Some must do's in Vegas Do visit the Grand Canyon (unbelievable experience) Do visit the Hoover dam (Awesome peice of engineering) Do visit Margarittaville (Jimmy Buffet bar opposite Ceasars) Do visit the Freemont Street experience (light show is on every hour after dark) Do go to a show (we saw Rod Stewart and also Matt Goss, both were brilliant and not expensive) Don'ts Cannot think of any

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: kev1438
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is not in the class of even the Venetian across the way. The rooms are large but the carpets really are stained and dirty. The bathrooms do not have hand towels, there is only one glass, the bathtub is plastic, the hot water sparse and so on. It is close to the Interstate so you pick up that noise, and then throw in the trains that clank by in the middle of the night and expect to wake up if you are a light sleeper. The so-called Business Center only has two computers, no pens, and no paper and is busy with people on Facebook. I've stayed in Hilton Garden's with better Business Centers. The work out room is average at best. For the price, definitely stay elsewhere. If you do stay, be prepared for a 3 or 4 star experience. Trump should be fired for putting his name on this middle of the road place.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you like trains blasting their horns through the night!”
Reviews.Author: RussMcC
Reviews.Content: Well just returned from Vegas after staying at this Hotel. I'll keep this very simple. Great hotel, 5 star standards. Bar shuts at midnight that's ok Bit later Fri/Sat/Sun Pool nice! No Casino, which makes more peaceful BUT!!! For the life of me!! Why put this hotel next to the Train crossing where the train driver blasts the horn at all hours? 2am - 3am - 3:30am and so??? EVEN MORE!!! WHY DON'T YOU WARN YOUR CUSTOMERS ON THE WEBSITE BEFORE BOOKING? Hold don't answer that last question no need to! All in all if you like quality and train horns through the night, then stay here. Even the cab driver who picked us up from here asked how the train noise was! P.S I did bring this problem to the reception on check out, there answer was 'there is nothing they can to to control the trains'. I replied ' You could warn your customers before booking'. No answer! Just handed me the invoice!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the trump”
Reviews.Author: ickle25uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the trump in July 2011 and it was brilliant. It does not have a casino but that I felt made it better as it's not rammed all the time. The staff are so helpful and it's spotless. The pool is the best ever. At each end there is a shall area to sit or lie in which means you can keep cool whilst catching the rays. The waitress's serve for drinks was brilliant. The food is great value for money and so tasty. It's only just round the corner from treasure island and opposite a brilliant shopping centre. The only thing to watch out for is the resort fee... It's on there website but we booked through tripez and they never mentioned it however if u state that they dropped it ;-)

Reviews.Title: “This Trump is not up to par”
Reviews.Author: Rob--RK
Reviews.Content: We got in very late. Went to our room and found maid supplies by our door. Walking in, we encountered a small garbage bag. The restroom had a couple of dirty towels. Could this be how the Trump is being maintained? I called the front desk. After waiting for about 5 minutes, which felt like an eternity, being to tired after the delayed flight, someone finally came on and upgraded our room after many apologies. Now our upgraded room was better but the quality of the room was mixed with good and poor materials. Whoever is maintaining these rooms are missing details: like a handle on a bathroom door. Being a Trump brand, we expected better quality. The employees were great and helpful when they did help.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NicoleKidd1422
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here mid September 2011 and we LOVED it! We brought our 8 month old to Vegas with us so I did lots of research on family friendly hotels. I was surprised when Trump International came up on the list of "Most Family Friendly Hotels". When we checked in we were automatically upgraded to a strip view (we originally booked a studio suite with a city view). I asked how much it would be to upgrade to a 1 bedroom and they said $50 a night. A little more than we wanted to spend but we decided to take the upgrade anyway...and I sure am glad we did! The room was HUGE! The bathroom was as big as my bedroom at home! Everything was just so clean and immaculate. It was so nice having a kitchen available to warm up our baby's food and make his bottles. Also, we requested to have a crib in the room and it came up not even 10 minutes after we checked in. I was surprised by how nice the crib was and it even came with linens and a crib bumper. All this at NO charge! When I called other hotels like the Mirage and MGM, both said they charged $20 A NIGHT for crib use. At Trump, its free! As far as the location of the hotel, I read LOTS of reviews saying "it's way to far off the strip, too long of a walk, etc." People must be out of shape because it's a 5 minute walk. Plus, if you don't want to walk in the heat then you can just cut right through the Fashion Show Mall (the entrance to Nordstrom is literally right across the street). We found the location no problem at all. Actually, it was kind of nice to be a little set back where it's not so crazy. We also thoroughly enjoyed the fact that this was a non-gaming hotel. It was SO nice to come back after a long day of walking around the strip and all the smokey hotels to a clean, fresh, hotel! It was great! The only (and I do mean ONLY) downfall was the pool area. It was very small and a little boring. But I also understand the fact that Trump is a different kind of hotel than say Mirage or MGM. It was a little awkward being the only family with a baby in the pool...we almost felt a little out of place for having a splashing baby. But our son still had fun and that's really all that mattered. We would DEFINITELY come back to Trump the next time we are in Vegas. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is SO welcoming and friendly! We loved that we were greeted by a smiling face at the entrance every time we came back. Good job Trump!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent service, some issues with location”
Reviews.Author: Mini_Zilla
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with fabulous luxury rooms and excellent customer service. We stayed with our toddler in a studio room with a strip view and found the room large and stylish with a handy kitchenette. We were also provided with a lovely crib that was much nicer than the usual pack 'n' play cots that you get in hotels. The hotel is non smoking and doesn't have a casino, which was ideal for us. Every member of staff that we dealt with during our stay was professional, helpful and polite. I felt that the hotel was excellent value for money. The only issue for us was the location of the hotel. It is just a short walk to the strip but you either have to run across a busy road to get to the Fashion Show Mall - there is no crosswalk here, or walk along Fashion Show Drive - here the sidewalk is incomplete and you have to walk on the road. The shuttle bus that the hotel provides is good, but if it's busy with a lengthy queue then navigating the roads mentioned above with a lively toddler is a little difficult! I appreciate however that there isn't much the hotel can do about this and visitors without small children probably wouldn't have any problems at all. I would definitely stay at the Trump again if the problems we encountered walking to the strip from the hotel were fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Only for couples they won't accommodate 4 adults”
Reviews.Author: jgcl73
Reviews.Content: Hated the fact that they will tell you they acomodate 4 adults and they only offer rooms with a king bed and a very uncomfortable sofabed. iI was very embarrassing for me and I ended up paying for the whole thing instead of splitting the bill with my friends. Five star my a**.

Reviews.Title: “wow great view”
Reviews.Author: littlechef7
Reviews.Content: this hotel is fantastic the room we had was amazing good location right across from fashion mall walk through it to get to the strip great shops.walking back from strip when mall was closed was fine no problems about 5/10mins from strip recommend this hotel staff very friendly and helpfull(thanks to the valet that helped with directions when we checked out to long beach thanks very much).

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaArizona
Reviews.Content: Great Service!!! No pretentious attitude, which can be common in Vegas. All of the staff were helpful, approachable, with great attitudes. The room has lots of space which was good for 2 couples, would also be great for a group of girls. The seperate living room area /bedroom was nice and each couple having their own bathroom, of course one couple has the nicer bed/bath. The valet included was nice, also the shuttle service!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: loveshack14
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as my daughter was getting married in Vegas. When we checked in the receptionist asked if we would like to upgrade our room to a full suite with a view of the strip. We asked how much it would cost and she said $50 for the week so we said yes. The room was beautiful with everything you could want, I even made breakfast for all the family (8) in the spacious kitchen. After two days my husband checked his bill on the television and they were charging us $50 per night plus tax. Since we weren't going to benefit from the extra space as we were tied up with the wedding we complained, but they just told us that we had an hour to move our belongings to a smaller room. It was a lot of hassle but on a lighter note I would stay here again as we still had tea and coffee making facilities in our room which most of the other hotels don't. The buffet breakfast for $20 was excellent in the main lobby area. The lifts were quick when you called them and all in all the rooms were lovely. A great place for breakfast as well is The Peppermill. If you turn left out of the hotel or get the free Trump shuttle down to the Wynn and then walk past the Encore and some shops, you will see "Ross dress for less" the Peppermill is next door and is worth experiencing.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: barbturtlo73
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the one bedroom suite which was stunning. Rooms were huge, apt size with kitchens, two splendid bathrooms, jacuzzi, etc. Most beautiful suite we've ever stayed in. Staff was very nice and helpful. Love that it was a non smoking, no casino hotel off the strip. Lovely pool. Only complaint was the train nearby that blew it's whistle several times during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy 40th”
Reviews.Author: digirolz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in sept 2011. Beautiful hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Location was great and the NO Casino on site. Full kitchen facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel - dissapointing housekeeping/service”
Reviews.Author: famezzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a couple of nights during our honeymoon trip in USA. The hotel is not on the strip, but it is really close. Less than a 10minutes walking you are in the Strip. The hotel is luxury. We booked a studio with a city view. The room was big enough with a king bed, a living room area and a small kitchenette. The best part of the room was the bathroom. The tub had a really nice jacuzzi!!!In the bathroom also, a part of the mirror was becoming a tv!!! We had also a nice view from the room of the city of Las Vegas. We were on the 31st floor so we could se from our room Rio Hotel and Mirage Hotel. The bad part of the story began when we were searching for our bathrobes we found a pair of dirty socks....... We call the housekeeping to tell them that, and to bring us a bathrobe (because there was only one in the room insted of two) , and they did 20-25 minutes to get to the room. The next day, we swich on the electroning sign of "Housekeeping", and when we came back to the room at 6pm, nobody had cleaned our room, so we had to call again Housekeeping to tell them to come. Then the hairdryer wasn't working and we had to wait another 20 minutes so somebody come to the room to bring a new one. When we came back at the room after the midnight , we find our room tidy and clean, but the bathrobes were missing and not replaced...I didn't expect that from a 5 star hotel. For our last day in Vegas, the front desk told us that we could have a free late check out at 4pm, but they didn't told us that after 12pm our key cards wouldn't work, so after our last shopping we were locked out of the room for about 20 minutes until the security come. From the other side their shuttle servise to Whynn and Cesars hotel was very good. Every 15 minutes there was a shuttle until midnight. They also have a good transportation to the airport in reasonable prices. Fortunately on our check out the front desk after our complain about all the housekeping problems did not charge us the resort fees. If we ever go again in Vegas I beleve, we will not choose Trump again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mich64
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The room was perfect with an extraordinary bathroom! The view was boring, but how much time do you spend looking out? I loved the reserved elevator for rooms 52 and above, so we never waited more than 30 seconds. The pool area was very ordinary, not the main attraction, that's for sure. Only had breakfast at the restaurant, and very expensive ...But, isn't everything else in Vegas? Can't get a cocktail under $12.50, witch is a rip off if you ask me. Even a beer will cost you $8.50. The shopping center accross the street, the fashion show, is the perfect place to buy some beer at a normal price, or a nice bottle of rum...So you can enjoy in your beautiful suite at the Trump hotel! The only downside of this hotel is the walking distance to all the action...Get in shape people, because lots of walking in Vegas. Taxi's are a rip off, so be prepared. But all in all, I don't regret this hotel. Very friendly staff working, and very comfortable rooms. The price is good and the pillows are perfect! Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: csissy22
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel from begining to end was great! This is a piece of heaven after you have spent some time gambling in the other hotels with casinos. You don't have that noise or hectic feel to it. Customer service is excellent, and I would like to be the first to nominate Janet, front desk, for a raise or promotion. She is a great assest to this hotel! The whole Trump staff in my opinion is superior in the area of customer service. Cudos to the attention to training in this area. In reading other reviews some have had complaints, but in my experience of staying in hotels I rarely leave without there being something to complain about. The difference with Trump Hotel is that complaints were dealt with in a timely manner, staff was professional in addressing the complaint, and to our surprise my husband and I were upgraded to a wonderful one bedroom suite for the remainder of our stay. Some have complained about the cost of the stay, but when you look at the fact that in every standard room there is a refrigerator, microwave, stove, toaster, whirlpool, and a small television cleverly placed in the mirror of the bathroom mirror I don't find the price unreasonable. When you research the cost of the other hotels on the strip, and research what they offer they are just as costly and don't offer anything. My husband and I were happy with our stay at Trump and do plan on staying here when we return for a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Low Key Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelite24
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the 16th floor and on the city side, so our view was of highways and desolate construction sites. We were asked if we wanted to pay extra for an upgrade, but we were fine with the less than spectacular view. We definitely could hear the trains when they went by, but again, the rest of the property is quiet and peaceful compared to the rest of the strip, so we were okay with that as well. A few minor problems in room like lights burnt out in closet, hooks broken off of bathroom door, but nothing major. The room had a large bathroom with a nice spa tub and separate shower. And yes, we loved the TV in the mirror. Robes are provided (very comfy). There is a nice kitchenette if you need something like that (we didn't). We were provided with 2 free bottled waters each day, if you want more, you must pay for them, but they were brought up very quickly. We enjoyed room service one night upon a late return and it was actually excellent. The food was fresh and hot, and was set up nicely for us and removed at our request. It arrived in about 15 minutes. We also dined at DJT and it was very nice and relaxing. Required valet service was fine unless you needed your car at a busy time. This was only a problem for us once on a late Sunday morning, we actually waited a full 20 minutes for our car. In the future, they said we could call ahead for our car...but by then it was too late. We used the van service to The Wynn and Caesar's which was helpful. Just be warned that all the smokers come out and sit on the nice couches provided for the guests who are waiting for the vans to do their smoking. We could barely breathe! Maybe the Trump could remove the giant ashtray so the smokers will go elsewhere! The pool was quiet and super hot as the sun reflects off the gold building onto the pool area, bring your sunscreen! Most of the staff were professional and kind. Only problem we had was with the concierge not answering phone calls. No voice mail either. Just rang and rang.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be on the strip, stay on the strip not here”
Reviews.Author: Fredndust
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly, room was a little disappointing. While it was clean and tidy we upgraded to larger room at cost and found the room key/card reader would not work at times so door would not lock behind us when we left room, had to open and close several times to get it to work. Was reported to front desk but couldn't be faulted when they looked at it. Bed was noisy and every time I rolled over in sleep it made a loud creaking noise waking up the wife, also Some lights didn't work. Shuttle to the strip was great but next time in Vegas we will book something on the strip. Oh and the train is noticeable even on the strip side.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great!”
Reviews.Author: CsquaredColorado
Reviews.Content: Big name, big price, elegant rooms. Staff is very nice. Yes, this place was built for residents but the economy tanked so they had to do something. The rooms are very nice. But...... valet parking only. You can not have access to your car except through a valet. Not the best. The pool is terrible. Very small and crowded. Not a good time. No casino which is a plus and located right across from the Fashion Mall. Shuttles to Wynn and Caesars. With so many places to chose in Vegas, I will not stay at the Trump again. Just not my cup of tea. Oh, we did not have any maid service the last day. If you pay that kind of money you expect service. Will not be back and do not recommend the Trump.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Kez02
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Trump for the last four nights and loved it. It was bliss to be away from the casinos but still close enough to visit easily. The staff were amazing....all of them, but especially Janet on reception, Ricca, a concierge and Donna in the bar. Simply wonderful. Great music from the jazz trio last night too. Our room was fabulous.....as you can see no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for non-gamblers.”
Reviews.Author: blacktop_gypsy
Reviews.Content: Since this hotel doesn't have a casino, it is quieter, and there isn't the ever-present smell of stale cigarette smoke that you find in most Vegas hotels. The resort is quite new, and the staff are awesome! The outdoor pool is very nice with large padded loungers, and the pool-side cafe serves up good food at reasonable prices. The gym, located on the same level is also very nice with a good selection of equipment. The location is just a 5 minute walk from the Strip, and the hotel provides a free shuttle bus to the shops at either the Wynn or Ceasar's Palace. The Fashion Mall is just across the street from the hotel. The lack of a cross walk in front of the hotel is a bit of a problem as you have to be careful crossing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: PHLCornwall
Reviews.Content: Our plans changed so we booked 1 night here before staying at Caesars. Paid an extra $50 dollars upon check in to be upgraded to a corner suite on the 55th floor. An excellent stay all round, only slight downside was the sofa bed, uncomfortable mattress. would recommend this hotel over Caesars for service and standards any day. would like to mention young lady at check in, Kristina I think, absolutely fantastic customer service. Gave us free 4pm late checkout so we did not have to hang around before checking into next hotel. Will definately stay here again ! Thank you for such a wonderful stay

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Daydreamer222
Reviews.Content: We decided to upgrade when we arrived to the hotel to a strip view suite for only $50 more a night. So glad we did! The room was massive. 2 bathrooms, living room, full kitchen and bedroom. The bathroom had a jacuzzi tub and you could see the strip from sitting in the tub from the giant windows. Yes, it was off the strip but there was a shuttle to bring you to the wynn or a quick 5 min walk if it wasnt there. We would take a taxi at night but it was so worth being in such a nice hotel. It was clean and the lobby smelled wonderful. I went with my husband, so we liked being away from the chaos in our hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. We ordered room service one night and it arrived quickly. Room was always cleaned and amenities were always stocked. We ate at DJT one night in the hotel. Service was amazing. Very attentive waiter and tasty food. We would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Love at first site.......”
Reviews.Author: Cblevins81
Reviews.Content: I normally write reviews on TripAdvisor since I use it so much, but do it after we leave a place. With this hotel I can't wait. We checked in yesterday for our second honeymoon and fell in love right away. The staff is so friendly and helpful and they actually upgraded our room to a corner suite and it is FABULOUS! We are pretty hard to impress because we travel so much, but this hotel did it. There is plenty of space in the room, all the fixtures and appliances are top notch, and they actually have a hair dryer that is powerful enough to dry my hair. :-) We ate at DJT last night and it was wonderful as well. I am sure I will have nothing but fantastic things to say once we do actually leave next week.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, just far enough off the strip”
Reviews.Author: tgt0123
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, far enough off the strip to get away from the chaos, but close enough to be part of all the action - and there is a shuttle if it's too hot to walk. The best thing is there is no casino as part of the Trump, which means when you're there, you really are away from the crazy Vegas action. The Spa is amazing - highly recommend forlking out some cash for a massage! And... drinks by the pool. Overall very impressed with hotel - only let down was 1) room wasn't finishing being serviced when we entered and 2) taxes were not clearly explained on website at time of booking (i believed the only additional charges outstanding was the resort charges, but was slogged with a lot more!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mom2my4
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant after booking this on hotwire and then reading the reviews but I have to say the Hotel was gorgeous and the room was amzing. The service was a little if-y when we needed extra things like a light in the closet fixed and extra hangers but the staff was super nice, the shuttle was great, and the room service yummy and quick. I wouldn't pay full price here but a really nice stay for the discounted/hotwire price!

Reviews.Title: “Not thrilled with our experience at the Trump Vegas”
Reviews.Author: squierwire
Reviews.Content: We had a room on 40th floor in Sept. 2011. The room is exceedingly large compared to, say, The Bellagio's, with sink, stove, refrig, closet, bookcase, etc. and one king bed and a pull-out sofa. The bathroom is equally large with huge shower and "john" areas. BUT, the carpets are stained...both in room and in halls. Mattress left much to be desired. It has user-unfriendly doors, i.e., each room is partioned off with another room and one has to enter two heavy doors before entering their rooms. This resulted in late-nighters slamming the doors twice when they returned to sleep. Additionally, we heard "boom-boom" music all night. Another guest? We never knew where it came from. Then we were "hit" with their $22.35 "resort fee" on check out but only used one bottle of water that falls under that category. The dining rooms are far from "friendly" in atmosphere and the lobby is just a large "cold" area. A plus might be that one can jaywalk across to the large shopping mall. For $50 more, we'd select The Bellagio any time we revisit Vegas. There you get a clean room/floor with no noise, and it's gorgeous. The Trump is a mistake we will not make twice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place for our first trip to las vegas”
Reviews.Author: Skins014
Reviews.Content: The Trump is a great hotel. It is on the north edge of the main strip bit they do run some shuttle buses. It is easy to walk to the 'main' casinos but maybe not in the summer heat. The room we had (city view suite) was amazing. It was also cheap maybe because it was during the weak. The room was massive and so was the bathroom and bath and shower. The hotel was good because it had no casino and therefore offered a relaxing alternative from the Manic strip itself. The staff were great and the pool was nice and chilled out. Overall a great experience

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rutger L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night only, but what an experience it was! The rooms are large, bathroom superb (tv in mirror is nice after all). Staff is really helpful and friendly. Our WiFi did not work at first, we asked the front desk and the IT guy called us back to explain what was wrong and that it was fixed. The hotel is quite far from the actual strip, but they do have a shuttle going to Caesars Palace every 20 minutes till 11PM! For the $90 we payed we expected a lot less! This is a top hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad!”
Reviews.Author: osaka2010
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel from hotwire and didn't know which hotel I am getting. I was hoping to get Venetian for the Labor Day weekend stay. After I found out that Trump international hotel is the one I got from hotwire, I quickly searched the reviews on tripadvisor. I was so worry after I read about the noise of the train track. Since I am going with my mother in law and she usually has trouble sleeping, I was worried that she will have a hard time in the middle of the night. I make sure I called ahead of time before I arrived and tell them I would like to have a room on a higher floor and also away from the track side. They did give me a room on a higher floor and away from the track side. Well, surely you can hear the train passing by at night while you are awake but I can tell you, I can't even hear it once I fall asleep and my mother in law did not say anything about the noise the next morning. So, I guess it's really not that bad. The bed is comfortable to my surprise. Both the mattress and the pillows are comfortable. The hot tub is quite good and big! The TV in the bathroom mirror is quite interesting. The sofa bed mattress is quite soft, so, if you have a bad back then it might not be something that you want to sleep on. So, I would suggest to get another room for that other person. The room is really design for two people. The other guest who can sleep on the sofa bed might have a hard time! Anyway, Trump Las Vegas is not bad!

Reviews.Title: “Glitzy hotel, huge room”
Reviews.Author: michelle_moo
Reviews.Content: We got a great price for Trump on Hotwire. We liked: The size of the room Non-smoking Glitzy decor Bathroom, separate toilet, shower and bath (and gimmick tv in mirror) Quick delivery of towels and water upon request Things that could use improvement: Our room was quite dusty Our room had damage to a number of furniture items - starting to feel quite "lived in" Brown stain on one of the towels Train noise at night .. Seriously, what is that about!?! Probably a little further out of the way than I would've ideally liked, but I did appreciate the peace and quiet Daily resort fee. We drove, so used the valet. Had we not had the car, we definitely would have felt that the resort fee was for nothing. Overall we were very happy with our stay but due to the minor issues noted above, couldn't warrant a full 5 score

Reviews.Title: “Trump Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: UncleCrap
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, Although no casino. The shuttle service only goes to Winn or Cesars Palace. You will need to pay for a cab to go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: thatsmydawg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in February 2011 and were most impressed by this hotel. We got a brilliant rate through Expedia of roughly £60 per room per night, which was amazing value. The room was huge, the bathroom was the size of some European hotel rooms and the jetted tub was wonderful after a long day sightseeing on the strip. We moved on to the Vdara afterwards and I really missed that tub! The bed was also super comfortable. We ate in DJT one night and had the prix fix menu which was delicious and fantastic value, I can thoroughly recommend giving it a try. If I returned to Vegas I would consider this hotel again, the only small downside is the location but there is a shuttle bus to Caesars Palace (we preferred to walk).

Reviews.Title: “Trump International - Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: ConstanceSLC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trump International in LV from July 14 to the 17th 2011. To me it seemed over-rated just because of the name Trump.The hotel is the same as any other hotel. There is no difference. The room rates are too exorbitant.They charge you a $20 resort fee even though it is not a resort. They say the resort fee is for the internet, the paper, etc. Internet is standard for many, many hotels and so is the morning paper. Internet and a morning paper should not be a "resort fee". Internet is paid on a monthly basis and is used by employees of the hotel as well. It is a collective charge. It is just another way for Mr. Trump to nickel and dime you to make his "cup run over" and fill his already bulging coffers. Save your money and stay at a Marriott for example, for the same amenities and service

Reviews.Title: “Deserves 6 stars”
Reviews.Author: Itha
Reviews.Content: The room is really nice and big. I am a returning guest and this is the 2nd year. Apart from no casino... i love this hotel for its elegant presentation. Beautiful bathtub with Jacuzzi on every room. This time, the have given a high rise floor with all facilities included and you can see Las Vegas at night. Value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmj12
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas for a wedding last weekend. The wedding was held at the Flamingo but we stayed at the Trump. Coming back to the hotel was great, no smoke, no casino, just calm. Would stay here again if I was returning to Vegas. The train noise was loud. I requested a room away from the train noise and received a room on the 52nd floor but with a city view and could still hear it several times a night. Location was not bad, it was just a little hot to do a lot of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Fun elegance!”
Reviews.Author: AlfaJudy
Reviews.Content: The Trump hotel in Vegas was a great way to experience Vegas without the usual hassles of casino-land -- no mazes of casinos to deal with, no parking miles away, no big lines at check-in, no sell-sell-sell feeling -- just a relaxed, friendly, and elegant atmosphere. Such a gorgeous hotel - the lowest end rooms are nicer than places I've lived! Many nice touches, it's just something you have to experience for yourself. If you aren't "all about" casinos, but are "all about" really feeling comfortable and at home - this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Classy1004
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and unlike gambling hotels, it was a quiet haven at the end of the day. A cafe or some other eating facility should remain open for the guests to get a snack or nightcap at the end of the evening. Rental car available for any excursion. They were great in making the arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel near the strip”
Reviews.Author: Jeff N
Reviews.Content: We'd booked the Trump via the "hidden name" deals on Expedia. So it wasn't by choice that we stayed here, but it was a great stay overall. I was a little disappointed to learn that this was just a hotel and not a hotel/casino. But liked the fact that it is a smoke free facility, including the pool area (there is one small smoking section on the back patio). We checked in very late at night - around 1am, so there was no line. The clerk was courteous and friendly and remembered me when I checked out 2 days later. The lobby is exquisite, though sorta small compared to many other hotel/casinos in Vegas. They have a bar/lounge in the lobby and an adjacent restaurant. The service one of the best I've had in Vegas. Housekeeping was quick with orders for extra towels and water bottles. The doormen always had a smile and were attentive, and the shuttle drivers, were courteous and friendly (asked questions about our time in Vegas). PS - there is a free shuttle to the Wynn or to the Caesar's Forum Shops that runs very frequently throughout the day and into the night and also picks up from these locations. We stayed in a King Suite on the "strip view" side of the hotel. It did not disappoint. Great view of the strip including the Bellagio Fountains (though I don't think every room will have this same view). Kitchenette which includes a microwave, small stove (electric) and a fridge (bigger than a mini-fridge, but not full size). The suite also had a nice couch and two chairs along with a coffee table. Included in the suite was coffee (quick brew coffee maker) and bottled water (unlimited refills). The bed was a little firm, but I slept well. My girlfriend claimed that she didn't sleep as well, which is strange since she prefers a firmer bed than I do typically. There was a couple water spots on the ceiling in the bathroom that were questionable for a 5 Star hotel, and the toilet seat seemed to have a "hinge" problem, but fairly minor issues. The bathroom amenities were fantastic - large stand up shower, along with a huge spa bath, two sinks and a toilet that was partitioned off; it also included a t.v. in the mirror. The pool is great. Plenty of seating (at least in early September) on both Saturday and Sunday. It is large enough that you can actually swim laps (not quite olympic length, but long enough). There a about 10 cabanas for rent along with large round couch chairs for rent, or the free seating. The free seats are obviously first come first served, and don't come with umbrellas by default, but if available the life guards/pool attendants will bring one over for you. There is a bar and light restaurant right next to the pool. Drinks are typically overpriced, but you can order a tropical smoothie for $6-8 and add a shot of rum for $3 and have a very tasty drink. They also had a "bucket of beers" special - so ask. We didn't use the spa or the gym, but they looked nice. As stated in the beginning of this review, we booked this hotel via an "unpublished rate" deal, so we got the room at a discount. I would say that it was worth what we paid and generally speaking, this hotel is worth it if you are looking for a place where you can get first class service and a nice place to stay. As well, it's not so far off the strip and is right next to the fashion show mall (the entrance to Nordstrom is right across the street from the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: messersa
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Trump hotel Las Vegas could not have been more accommodating. The hotel is beautiful, rooms are large and meeting staff was excellent to work with. Will definitely go back. They offer a shuttle to the Wynn and Caesars Palace, but it is a short walk to Fashion Show Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Mr. Trump Does NOT Dissappoint”
Reviews.Author: mwaite04
Reviews.Content: Keep in mind that I hate Las Vegas. HATE. I have some very personal reasons for not wanting to be around Vegas but my boyfriend really wanted me to come with him for this weekend event that he had to attend. He told me I could pick the place. I started doing some research. I had minimal criteria. I don't want to be anywhere near the "strip", I don't want a casino or smoking in the hotel. Pretty easy. One place to stay. The Trump Hotel. It was absolutely amazing. Every single person in the hotel was extremely nice and willing to go out of their way to help. My goal in going to this hotel was that I didn't want to leave it, so I wanted to make sure everything was good, from the room, to the dining, to the spa and they FAR exceeded my expectations. The Spa was unbelievable. They really made me forget all about why I hate Vegas. The pool wasn't a party atmosphere which was nice because we were actually able to relax. And lastly the DJT restaurant. By far the best food and service I've ever gotten, ANYWHERE. Our server's name was Nick, if he's still working there ask for him, tell him we sent you, he is THE MAN! For being someone that hates Vegas if I do ever have to go back again this is the ONLY place I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good not Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: la310la
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel as I hate long walks from parking lots to your room (Venetian!), am generally annoyed by large groups of drunk 21 year-olds (Planet Hollywood!) and can't afford $300+ a night (Wynn/Bellagio) It was my first time here and maybe I'd stay again if I were in a better room. As others have said - if you find a promotion, you seem to get an obviously substandard room. For example, I used hotwire and got the Jr. Suite facing the street (not strip). The room was fine for two people and was very clean.
