However, the train woke me up with its loud honking every few hours, our TV power and volume didn't work and we had to call twice to have it fixed. Also, the vanity mirror light didn't work. If you can deal with the issues above then it is a DEAL. If not, pay a couple hundred extra to stay at the Wynn. PROS: - Across from Fashion Mall and you can take the bridge to Wynn from there. - Friendly valet - Comfy beds - Spacious rooms - Pool was nice and not too crowded - Pretty calm group of guests (no loud music, non-smoking, lack of large, drunk groups...) - Complimentary water bottles in-room CONS: - Valet only and line gets long at peak hours - pay-to-use business center - weak wireless signal - sometimes no one answered the front desk

Reviews.Title: “Casino not missed”
Reviews.Author: ZETA333
Reviews.Content: When I had to stay in Las Vegas for a business trip, I decided to try this Trump Property. It is located towards the end of the strip, across the street from the fashion mall. If you like to go to the mall during your stay as I do, this convenience is great! The mall has a food court and all of the familiar stores, a break from spending in the high end boutiques. My room was the most amazing of all, a large suite with 2 bathrooms. The master bathroom had a television in the large bathroom mirror. There was a kitchen with an oven, microwave, refrigerator and a bar area., ideal for a family stay. The sheets were 500 thread count and luxurious and the bed made for the most comfortable sleep. The pool had large luxurious 2- person chaise lounges with a live DJ providing the sounds. The only drawbacks are the lack of a casino, which did not bother us because we were travelling with an underage child, and there is not an abundance of shopping and restaurants in the hotel. This did not matter much since th mall was across the street.This hotel is a definately a great choice for families with young children

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,close to strip and great service”
Reviews.Author: mexicowasfun
Reviews.Content: Our trip started off shaky(4 girls) but with each problem that arose the manager upgraded us as a courtesy to a better suite. You definitely want to get separate rooms if there are more than 2 ppl. the sofa bed is not good and all of us had problems in our back the next morning. the rooms are good for 2 ppl with one bed. the service was great i have to say. any request we had (from baking sheets, to more hangers, and making our sofabed) the staff were responsiveness and quick. the room service food was great. the location and property itself is really good. it is less than a 10min walk to the strip(right at wynn is where it will lead you and fashion show mall). I would recommend this hotel again and stay here as well. the shuttle service was frequent and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed, very luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Americanincognito
Reviews.Content: After being in hotels all around the world I was surprised at the level of luxury in the rooms. Beautiful marble bathrooms with spectacular shower and jacuzzi and top of the line linens. However, pool was very small and the "spa" and exercised room had no steam room (without charge) and the lobby area was not very inviting. Needs some more character and rest areas in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe I expected to much....”
Reviews.Author: ChiquitaJ
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in what is called a "5 Star" Hotel.....so hear we go. The good: From the moment you get out of the car, the STAFF is 5 Star!!! Super Super Friendly and Helpful in everyway. And not standing around for a tip, I actually had to chase a few people down to give them tips. Check in smooth and simple. The entry and bar area was very clean an smelled good. Large enough not to be crowded. A little too much gold and glitter for my taste. Room was very clean. Clean carpets, clean furniture, clean sheets, clean shower, clean floor, clean clean clean. I did not feel the need to spray with Lysol like I usually do. Great location if you like "off the strip". I enjoyed security making sure "strange" people were not roaming the halls. The Bad: The Business Center. Are you kidding me? I need to pay to check my email or print off ticket stubs for shows. Even Super 8's have free business centers. Maybe put a time limit of 30 minutes, but drop the fee. The Shuttle: Useless. The TWO drop off points suck. The one at Wynn you could have walked to, and the one at Ceaser's is impossible to find where you get picked up. And the shuttle stops running at MIDNIGHT? Even on weekends, MIDNIGHT? Lame. Add better shuttle stops farther down the strip and run at least until 2am on weekends. The phone line was bad in my room so my phone did not ring. Missed alot of calls, and my wakeup calls did not come thru. Thank you to the lady that came and knocked on my door. The gift shop prices. I forgot my black belt. I did not notice until I was heading out the door to a taxi. Went to the gift shop. $45.00!!!!!!!! If a manager reads this I would be willing to return the belt for a credit of $20.00. I wore it to a dinner for one hour. Lets just call it a rental fee of $25.00 Bartendars at bar were not AT ALL friendly, my wanting to order a drink was interupting the personal conversations they where having. RUDE. Kitchens don't provide provide pots and pans, unless you call and wait 30 minutes for them. And no microwaves.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cameo1963
Reviews.Content: I will first mention that I took advantage of a promotion that the Trump was running at the time I booked this (back in February, for the September stay) and it is almost as if I was punished for booking a good deal by being put in a substandard room. If you do not want people to book at a promotional rate, then do not offer it! If you do offer a promotion, then one should get the same experience as someone else booking at a higher rate. I have been to Las Vegas many times and decided to give the Trump a chance, even after reading about there being no casino and located a couple blocks off-strip. There were three of us traveling together and the reservation indicated this. Check in was fairly smooth. I had asked for a higher floor away from the side the train was on, based on several reviews, but was told I was already assigned a room on the 18th floor, but it was pool side (away from the train.) I was concerned to find our room was right off the elevators, and indeed the elevator noise was problematic when trying to sleep. Also, if you want to nap during the day, the pool noise is horrendous. Upon getting inside, we discovered our room had only one plate and two coffee mugs, two forks, knives, spoons, one sauce pan and not much else in the way of kitchen supplies (they boast a full kitchen/kitchenette depending on the room, supposedly with all necessary items and since we booked for three, you'd think they would stock the kitchen for three!). The sofa bed was not made up, nor were there any sheets in the room to make up the bed our selves (again, with three people, the sofa bed was going to be used!). So the first call down was to the front desk to get the bed made up and the necessary kitchen items. Then we realized the suit case stand was broken and would not stand, nor were there any robes in the room, as advertised. So I called again to get a replacement stand and the robes sent up. Also the $20 per day resort fee supposedly included bottled water but of course, there was no bottled water in the room so we called again (call number 3). (We got our TWO per day...great for the three of us....NOT!) When the gentleman arrived to bring us dishes, we told him there was no ironing board in the room either (basically notification #4). All of these items are clearly mentioned in the room description, but they were not in our our room for some reason. What was humerous is that there was a call from the front desk shortly after arriving and she left a message, but was clearly oblivious to the issues we were having; she was just conducting the routine post check-in courtesy call. On top of this, the room we were assigned was a handicapped room, (which we did not ask for, nor want) and the closet railings were so low my dressess dragged the bottom. I could not take a shower, as the "adjustable" shower head did not go higher than my chest. There were some other minor issues, like a broken handle on one of the drawers, not enough towels being left in the room on the last day, along with no floor mats or wash cloths at all the last day....etc. There was enough to know housekeeping has no attention to detail, which one would expect in this hotel. For the record, I did go to the front desk to speak to the manager, but the front desk person "ran interference" and I never got to speak to a manager directly, so am not even aware if anyone knows of all these issues. I do know that no one followed up with us after the numerous complaints. (I had stayed at another hotel once where there was a minor parking issue that I didn't even mention, but "somehow" the manager became aware, sent a personal note of apology and asked me to contact him directly if I had any other issues during my stay. Nothing remotely like this at the Trump.) It seems to be a common response to be asked to give them another opportunity to make the next visit a more memorable one, but I will not do that. I feel that I was there for three nights (I should've checked out after one, but was hoping they would redeem themselves), and given the circumstances you think they would have gone out of their way to make the remainder of our trip "memorable", but they did not, so I feel they missed the opportunity to change my mind. They did waive the resort fees, however, which was the least (literally the least) they could do. I make 2 to 3 Vegas trips per year, but will not be spending any of them at the Trump.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great if you bring little kids.”
Reviews.Author: TorranceFamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Labor Day weekend, with wife and 3 kids between 5 and 8 yrs. old. Room was booked for us as we were there for a wedding reception dinner that was to be at the Palazzo. Room had a layer of dust. Microwave and decent size fridge were awesome. Kitchen overall though lacked plates, dishes, utensils. Two wine glasses, two plates, a small bowl, and a teapot was all that was there. Sleeper sofa was positioned directly under the AC vent so that the draft constantly blew onto the children with no way to adjust the angle of the vents. Walking across the street to the mall is a dangerous endeavour, especially with small children since there is no streetlight only a crosswalk over about 5 fast traffic lanes. Not many dining options in the hotel: poolside bar/restaurant, Trump restaurant, and room service. Ala carte breakfast for family at Trump restaurant: about $100 w/tip, nothing special; omlette for me; bacon/eggs for wife; chocolate pancakes for kids; hot chocolate and coffee for drinks. Got room service second day because didn't want to run-for-life with 3 kids to mall across the street, about $85, not including tip. 3 12"pizzas, buffalo wings, cheese sticks. Pizza was really good though! The pool was not really great for kids. It is mainly for adults that want to lounge, drink, read, and check out other people. I didn't feel comfortable having my kids playing in the water because there were so many people with drinks or books in hand in and around the pool that didn't want my kids disturbing. System for "connecting" rooms for 1 bedroom suites at the end of the hallway was a pain if you only have one of the rooms...basically you are required to go through two keycard doors to get into your room since there is an outer door to the mini-waiting room/access area that is shared by both rooms. The doorbell which is on the other side of two doors, to our room did not work. We could not hear people knocking on the outer door so we would have to coordinate with phone calls before hand if someone wanted to come to our room. Jacuzzi was very nice. TV in bathroom mirror was neat but remote would not work from the distance of the bathtub. No audio/video inputs to room TV. Clock radio ipod dock a plus. King bed very comfortable, sofa sleeper incredibly uncomfortable but thankfully kids are able to sleep on rocks if tired enough. I would not stay here again if making the choice myself. The Palazzo and Wynn had a nice system of walkways to go between hotels...the Trump seemed to be a little too removed from everything with not much to offer itself and what it did offer was over-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: xptn
Reviews.Content: The Trump was really wonderful. It is uncomplicated, sophisticated luxury, and you don't need map to find the pool or hiking shoes to get there. The staff was excellent but unobtrusive. The amenities were lovely, and the housekeeping was fastidious. My advice - pay for the upgrade to the one bedroom corner-suite. It is worth every penny. We won't stay anywhere else now.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: MissBinksUk
Reviews.Content: The room was a studio and beautifully furnished. The kitchen area might have been useful if we'd been staying longer. The bed is simply the most comfortable I have ever slept in - anywhere! The bathroom with the TV in the mirror and massive spa bath was fun and the pool area was a great spot to spend the last morning before flying home - get there early and you can have one of the wicker cocoon beds to stretch out on. We benefited from a late check out and the hotel's excellent boarding card printing facilities. A great non-casino hotel although it's location makes it at first a less obvious choice. Actually this is not an issue and works out well for taxis to the airport as the route i shorter than from some hotels on the strip. Well worth a stay..

Reviews.Title: “top notch”
Reviews.Author: luxbrain
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel; stayed there for 4 nights and don't regret it. the hotel is well located, doesn't have all the hassle and overcrowdedness of a casino hotel and thus offers you a safe haven close to the classical strip... the rooms are spacious, of high quality and very very clean, the service and friendliness of the staff is among the best I have encountered in my life... I would definitely go back and my opinion of the Trump hotel brand is now very high, after my first stay in one of it's hotels.... 5 out of 5

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, not quite 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Aussiej36
Reviews.Content: Like many other reviewers, I did not have bathrobes in my room, I didn't realise that I could've requested them from front desk. I thought it was just one of the little things missing from the hotel, which is strange as most 5 star hotels have them. It would've been nice to have one after getting out of the jaccuzi. The bathroom was by far my fave thing about the hotel. I loved the jaccuzi and the giant shower, plus having a tv in the mirror was great when relaxing in the bath. It was very clean and housekeeping kept it cleaned and stocked everyday. My room was not perfect, there were some marks on the floor and walls (obviously so) and the mattress did not seem to fit the bed frame as there was an obvious gap between the end of the mattress and end of the bed head, i kept dropping things in the gap! I did like that at check in I could choose a high or low floor, I chose high due to previous reviews about train noise. When just relaxing in bed/watching tv, I head the horns clearly, when in the bath or sleeping I was not bothered by the noise at all. The bed was comfortable, I liked that the pillows on the bed were varying types so you had a choice and could find one that was comfortable. Room service was reasonably priced (I was surprised at how affordable it was!) and I liked that they came up and set the coffee table for you with tablecloth and cutlery and then came and cleaned it all up. That gave you the feel that you were in a 5 star hotel. I loved that the hotel was smoke and casino free. Its well advertised and its a bonus as far as I am concerned. As for being off the strip, it clearly depends on how far you consider 'a walk'. From the previous reviews I was half expecting to need hiking shoes! Couldn't be further from the truth. I'm not a fast walker at all, but from my room to walking out of the fashion show mall onto the strip was not even a 10min walk in air conditioned comfort. I also took the shuttle to the Wynn on one occassion. In August heat you would have to be very brave to walk the entire length of the strip, I highly reccomend getting the 'Duece' bus ($7 for 24hour ticket), which has frequent stops along both sides of the strip at the majority of hotels. Factor this in and the very short walk, or shuttle to the Wynn and the location slightly off the Strip really doesn't matter! I loved not being on the strip on weekend nights due to the sheer number of people out on the strip, being loud/drunk. It was nice escaping the madness! If each room has robes without asking, and the floors/walls are cleaned up and the mattress are a better fit in the frames, this hotel would be worthy of its 5 star rating, but its the small things letting it down right now. I would not hesitate to stay here again, and have reccomended it to family/friends who are planning trips to Vegas and are concerned by being on the Strip/smoky casinos. I felt the hotel was more secure as there were not lots of non-guests walking around, and my room had an entry that required a key before i got to my own door.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: TCARBONNEL
Reviews.Content: Trump Hotel is 10 minutes walk from the Strip : hotel is quiet. Room were very clean and very comfortable. Breaksfast buffet was excellent but not avalaible every day due to limited hotel occupation according to the statff. Then, we were forced to order on the breakfast menu : expensive and 45 minutes waiting time. Very disappointing. Fitness center is good. Business center was not free, except for printing bording pass : a bit irritating. Overall is was good, except breakfast and business center.

Reviews.Title: “Pristine, quiet oasis off the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: samanthaonstyle
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Las Vegas in August for a week, part business for a trade show + a weekend of fun with my boyfriend. I had been booked in the Trump by my company, so I decided to stay there for the weekend too so I wouldn't need to switch rooms. It was my first trip to Vegas, so I was hesitant to stay off the Strip, but I'm so glad I did. The Trump is a sparkling oasis away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip -- no casino, no thumping clubs, no cigarette smoke, and the pool is never too crowded. This means the hotel is relaxing if you're having a romantic weekend and also feels safe when you're traveling alone on business as a woman. The rooms are fantastic - they are all suites/condos and even the "cheapest" room is very spacious with a huge bathroom and ample closet and living space for two. Though you might find some odd things about the room, like a missing safe or no glasses for water or no hangers, housekeeping is incredibly helpful with bringing anything you'd need. (You also get daily water bottles and decent toiletries, which are pluses.) If you really want to party in Vegas, you may be disappointed since there is no club and the pool is rather quiet with families and couples. You can walk to the Wynn and the Fashion Show Mall, but it's a bit of a hike to the main hotels on the Strip or the closest monorail stop. Even in August, we walked quite a bit--it's definitely possible--but you'll probably want to take taxis to your destinations. The hotel has a shuttle to both the Wynn and Caesar's Palace, and if you walk THROUGH the mall, you can get to the middle of the Strip fairly quickly. I'd definitely stay at the Trump again, especially if I can get the amazing rate I got for work. It'd be fun to stay on the Strip, sure, but if you're looking for a hotel that's a little less overwhelming, the Trump is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic facilities and suite”
Reviews.Author: VickyandZak
Reviews.Content: Room: lovely suite, kitchen area with basic utensils, cooker, microwave and large fridge, living area with TV, sofas, bathroom with shower and toilet. Separate room for bedroom with another TV and ensuite. Huge ensuite with large spa bath, double shower and toilet room. All very comfortable and clean. Welcome message on TV, had to pay to watch though, think there were a few free channels. iron, safe in room, dressing gown provided as well as complimentary water (replenished daily) and shampoo etc. Air conditioned. complimentary newspaper delivered daily, housekeeping on request (button by entrance) Facilities: Pool area was nice, closed early though at about 7pm. Jacuzzi was very hot but not bubbly. Staff were excellent and helpful, expected to be tipped. Valet service to park car. Didn't use any of the restaurants etc., so not sure about them Complimentary shuttle to Ceasar shopping area and Wynn hotel Overall: A lovely place to stay, very luxurious and comfortable, was nice not to have the casino in the hotel compared to all the other hotels in Las Vegas, made it a lot more peaceful and a break from the busy Strip. Some bits of the room need updating, cushion covers grubby etc., but hotel was so nice it didnt really matter.

Reviews.Title: “Was adequate but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: talya4513
Reviews.Content: Let me say that I chose to stay at this hotel because I had a fabulous time at another trump properly recently at the Trump Soho NY. The reviews on TA are right on about the TRAIN noise. It is no joke. We were " upgraded" when we checked in and stayed in a 1 bed studio room facing the strip. It was suppose to be on the quieter side of the hotel but trust me - the train noise will wake you up at night. I am usually a heavy sleeper and don't mind hall noise etc but if you are a light sleeper do not stay here! Other things that the hotel was lacking: The room was not as clean as it should have been. The bathroom particularly had signs of mold and "pink orange" water scum in all the corners. The carpet was worn and heavily stained ( please get some Resolve on this!) The furnishings ( ie night table had watermarks scratches from glasses being set down etc) were beat up looking. Bath robes were not in the room when we looked and so I called downstairs so someone could bring them up- Front desk reception was like " Did you look in the closet?!" I wanted to honestly say " Are you kidding me?!" Of course I looked I am not a complete idiot! Overall service from front desk was really average. If the concierge was out no one could really give a meal recommendation. Frederic from the concierge was GREAT! They need to pay him more- he was the only one who truly professional and courteous. Overall, first glance of the room is nice but not until you actually use the room like the shower which made me wish I brought shower shoes. The train noise is significant. The pool was nice and relaxing and those poolside waitresses are working hard in all that heat. I would probably never stay here again. This was my first trip to Vegas and had no idea what " off the strip" meant and my concept of a casino hotel vs. non casino hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: shawny78
Reviews.Content: We were in vegas to get married so we really didn't want to stay on the strip. This hotel is across from the mall and they have shuttles to Caesars and the Fashion show mall. Our room was great we were on the 59th floor with a view of the strip. I'm not a big gambler nor is my husband so not having a casino didnt matter. The lobby is very peaceful and just beautiful. Check in was smooth and the lady who checked us in was so nice, she asked what we were in town for and I told her we were getting married and she sent us some strawberries and champage to our room with a note wishing us well. We were treated like royalty!! The pool was cool. The only thing I didnt like was the rental fee for an umbrella, but as we visited the other hotel pools our family members were staying I noticed they all have fees for umbrellas or vip seating whatever that is. Overall if you want a nice, quite, relaxing place to stay after all the walking and party... This is it!! Oh the bathroom is great too, you really could just stay in there all day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place except for allowing dogs”
Reviews.Author: mikenchris
Reviews.Content: Stayed here August 28-30..Valet Service and Bell Hop were quick and polite...Lobby was very clean and nice....Check-in was a breeze, we paid for a studio but we were given an upgrade to a one bedroom suite on 29th floor. Bedroom s big, two bathrooms with large showers in each room..A bathtub in master bath big enough for two comfortably.Only downsides to my room was hearing the train blowing it's horn early in the AM, and the pull-out sofa bed in living room had a mattress where the coils felt like they were in your back.. We had room service the first night as we got into Vegas real late..Service was pretty fast and delivery of food was excellent..Servers were very polite..The pool was fine, alot of umbrellas to shade you from the hot sun..My only real complaint which unfortunately will prevent me an my wife from staying here again is their pet policy..As much as I know people love their dogs, I don't need to sleep in a bed, or take a bath where someones dog may have been and possibly have gone to the bathroom..Pet Lovers may think I'm nuts but I think it's gross..So Donald Trump get rid of the pet policy and we'll come back on our visits to Vegas, otherwise I'll stick to The Vdara Hotel which I've stayed previously and is another beautiful and clean non-gaming hotel, except no pets..

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Charlestonfamily
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention in May. The suite was enormous and very clean. You could live here! The suite had a full kitchen, marble countertops, a full living area with big screen TV and nice views; queen bed with luxurious bedding and another flat screen TV; large bathroom with full jacuzzi. Very comfortable lodgings. I got tied up and had to order room service which was very good too. Taxis were very easy to snag and the staff was very helpful and friendly. I was very pleased to stay here and will stay here again. T

Reviews.Title: “SERVICE ISN'T EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: alanico
Reviews.Content: Everyone from valet to front desk and room service were all very professional and kind. We were on the 51st floor.The fold out couch mattress was pathetically old and soft and had no support. House keeping added a comforter to the mattress but to no avail. overall room was well appointed. The hinges to the armoir were exposed when opening the door. Unexpected. I bent down to put my luggage in the closet and hit the hinge full force with my head which caused my scalp to bleed. I should have asked for an upgrade! Maintenance repaired the hinges. Otherwise, the room was fine. Someone should go through and make repairs. Also, the Train whistle blew at least 4 times throughout the late night and morning (not the hotels control).Pool area had a large boisterous group in the pool that made for us not hanging out longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great for gettin away from hustle and bustle if the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Jolie618
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend. We used BookIt's "mystery 5 star off the strip" hotel deal to get a great rate. The rooms were nice and spacious. They have everything you need - living area with sofa and kitchen with microwave, stove, fridge, and cooking utensils. The bathroom was a good size with shower and separate tub. The toilet and shower doors are see-through which may make it a little awkward if you're sharing the room. The pool is pretty low-key compared to other pools in Vegas. They offer poolside food and drink service. :) Great place to stay cool. Overall, it was a great experience. It's a generally quiet hotel compared to most hotels in Vegas. No casino and no big bar/club scene. The walk to the strip is not bad if you walk through Fashion Mall.

Reviews.Title: “If you are not so interested in Casinos, this is your place!”
Reviews.Author: GuilhermeML
Reviews.Content: Very good location, cleanliness and noise control. Nice view from the Strip. And the best thing: Smoke Free! There is only Valet. No Self-Parking.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraLA
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel really quick walk through mall to Vegas strip. Always ask for room away from railway track because the train does blow its horn very loud. We were on 40th floor facing side of strip was really quiet . Suite was super bathroom to dream for with spa big enough for 2. Went to nearby wallgreens next to Venitian Hotel and stocked up food for breakfast so could have breakfast in room each day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but service lacking”
Reviews.Author: kateb18
Reviews.Content: I really loved the look of the hotel and the room was fab - loved the actual size of the room and gadgets. The pool is a nice size and you get a cool breeze from the roof top. The hotel was a short walk to the strip, which on a hot day is a pain and there is no way of easily crossing quite a busy road in front. My only problem with the room is there were a few little details lacking - we had to ask for robes and an ironing board, there were little holes in the bed sheets and there was a large tear in one of our towels. The pros of this hotel far outweighed the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and beautiful rooms!”
Reviews.Author: nyskygirl
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! It's a little off the the strip, but there are shuttles that run every 10-15 minutes to the Wynn and another that runs every 15-20 minutes to Caesar's/forum shops. These shuttles often run till midnight or 2 am on the weekends. It is also right across the street from the mall. I would also suggest bidding for this hotel on priceline--they often will accommodate early arrivals and late departures more than some of the other 5 star hotels. Tip #1: Bring lots of 1's to tip the van drivers for going back and forth. It isn't a necessary, but I usually gave them a 1-2 bucks per trip and they seemed to really appreciate that. Tip #2: Its worth the upgrade to have a suite if you are traveling with more than 2 people. We had a group of 3 and it was very comfortable: separate kitchen/dining area, 2 bathrooms and 2 showers. Tip #3: Buy or bring from home some snacks, champagne, or fruit because there is a kitchen area with a fridge. I bought chocolate and strawberries and heated up the chocolate in the microwave and then my husband and I dipped the strawberries--very fun and romantic. Great hotel and outstanding customer service--I will defiantly come here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: str8foward
Reviews.Content: This hotel is impeccable and I found a great deal on price from cheaphotels.com. Great sized king bedroom with kitchenette and sitting area. Wonderful bathroom with television screen in mirror. Comfortable bed. They even have your name on the television welcome screen in your hotel room. This hotel was just awesome. Just walking in, you smell the different fragrances sold here, and the air just smells great. Loved the soft bathroom robes they let you use during your stay. The van that takes you to different places on the strip was VERY helpful. This hotel is not directly on the strip, so utilizing the van is a must, unless you dont mind walking longer than normal blocks. I would also suggest purchasing a multi-day bus pass, because there is allllooooottttt of walking in Vegas, so if you can save a few steps I would suggest the bus pass. The Trump does not have a casino so there is not very much traffic in the hotel and its quieter than the others on the strip which I liked. I was able to mingle and hustle and bustle, then go to sleep in my nice, quiet, clean hotel room. Overall great experience. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: scottie22in2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Trump Hotel in L.V. for four nights in June 2011. The valet will spoil you. The service was excellent! No smoking in the hotel was a PLUS! PLUS! No Casino in the hotel was a PLUS! PLUS! While we stayed in L.V we went into several hotels and almost every one you had to walk through a smoke fill casino to get to the rooms. This Hotel was supper quiet. The entry way to the rooms is great! No hallway noise what so ever! We had the king suite with a strip view. The view was great! The elevators are supper quick and are almost always available to get right on. Room service was excellent! When I go back to Vegas this will be my home for that time. Great Job Trump Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Love!”
Reviews.Author: SLC1622
Reviews.Content: Truly the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at - Will definately go back! The staff was wonderful, everything was so clean and nice and the non-gaming part was excellent. It was so refreshing to return to the hotel after being out and about at Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Service not so great.”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal678
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel still is working out some kinks!? At least I hope so. I returned to our room after a full day of attending a conference at another hotel to find that the door was propped open and a housekeeping sign on the door- but housekeeping was nowhere to be found and no indication that they had been there any time recently....meaning our door could have been propped open all day. I submitted a formal written complaint, but receive no apology from anyone. On the third day, I returned at 5:00 PM and found that my room hadn't been cleaned. When I called and asked for service ASAP, no one came for an hour. This hotel is clean and nice, but if you are a stickler for service, like me, I wouldn't stay here. The other problem- we stayed on the 57th floor and the noise from the train outside woke us up every night. So, if you choose a high floor, just note that you will not be isolated from the sounds below.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: teachersms
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights at the Trump - we upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite ($50 a night) from our original price of $100/night. The room was 900 sq feet and our view from the corner was phenomenal. It provided the perfect respite from the crazy strip. If you can upgrade, it is a must-do. This hotel is so beautiful! Staying in a non-smoking hotel was very important to me as I have gotten sick at other smoking hotels (my throat gets raw when I am around smoke too much). We used the kitchen for breakfast daily, and as some other reviewers mentioned, a few things were missing so I called housekeeping and asked for everything I wanted (another wine glass, dish soap, etc.) which was delivered in 30 minutes. Train noise - Some reviews mention the noise from train - I was sure to ask to get a room away from the train and did not hear it once. Check in service was top notch. Parking - we used the parking because we rented a car. It could be a long wait sometimes, so we started calling valet from the room to make sure it was ready. Gym - excellent gym overlooking the pool. Lots of cardio (many treadmills) and it was just too hot to run outside for me. Location - we enjoyed taking the shuttle to Ceasars and walking back. That walk is about 1.25 miles. Most hotels in Vegas, including the big Casinos, involve a long walk. Mandalay Bay and Luxor are farther from the action (Venetion/Ceasars etc.) than the Trump. Day trip - we went to Red Rock Canyon, the concierge will give you directions if you have a car, and it was a great day. I highly recommend visiting if you have the time (30 min drive).

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury option for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Steve32343323
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in a 1 bedroom corner suite at the Trump Las Vegas. Overall we were very happy with the room. It was nicely decorated and clean. The staff was very friendly. Since there is no casino at the Trump, the overall feel is a little quieter than other Vegas hotels. The only negative we saw was it's a block off the Strip. During the day, you can walk through the Fashion Center Mall, but at night you have to walk down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Rocky Start”
Reviews.Author: keishadowner
Reviews.Content: The one bed room strip view was amazing, however upon entering our safe was locked, the bathroom and living room phones did not work and there were no spoons. However after speaking to Krista she was apologetic and made the rest of our stay pleasant and comfortable. One last comment be prepared to be startled by a loud train that passes by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, will certainly make this our base for next Las Vegas trip.”
Reviews.Author: Seedling17
Reviews.Content: I had read many reviews of this property prior to our visit. I cant honestly say anything negative about our stay whatsoever, it was perfect. I was a bit nervous about the fact it was off the strip however we only took the 10 min walk once, it was not a problem at all, the other occasions we made use of the courtesy bus to/from the Wynn & Caesars Palace, (although the latter was difficult to find. Its downstairs from the Forum Shops at the other Valet parking area, we had to ask several people for directions, so best check first). The valet parking was great, the staff couldnt do enough for you and always opened the doors for you when they saw you coming. We had booked a studio suite and on checking in was asked if we would like to upgrade for a further charge. We were given a corner suite which was approx double the size. It was absolutely perfect, from the kitchen appliances to the size of the bathroom, it was enourmous. The plasma Tv in the mirror was a novelty too. We had a strip view which was great. I have to also say there was a lovely smell in the air throughout the hotel, must be something they put in the aircon. I wouldnt consider staying anywhere else in Las Vegas on our next trip. Well done for making our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “'FANTASTIC' we wanted to stay here for ever”
Reviews.Author: jandlhixxy
Reviews.Content: ooh what a wonderful place.stayed here for 3 nights when we got married.soooo much better than some of the hotels on the strip.no casino so all about the hotel and there guests.free upgrade and had a wonderful room with an amazing view.very near the top and looked straight down the strip.the rooms have everything you need and more.sitting in the tub made for 2, watching tv, sipping champers with my new hubby only in vegas. had breakfast in our room and the room service made us feel like royalty.had a 3 course meal in restaurant for $30 was'nt expecting much for that price but it was lovely and i'm fussy.very near the strip just a walk though the fashion mall.best kept secret in vegas you wont be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “quiet elegant perfect location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: napervilletraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night and booked with iprefer 139 per nite. Hotel is just off the strip and has a complimentary shuttle to the wynn and caesars. Fashion mall is literally a stone's throw from the lobby. NO CASINO which is a plus if you don't gamble and hate smoke. Pool is small and well maintained and not very crowded. Snack area is nice. Note that there is very little shade on the deck unless you want to splurge for a private cabana 200 for the day. Rooms are spacious and immaculate. Furnishing are modern and elegant. Kitchenette is a nice plus with stove top microwave and subzero mini fridge. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Only stayed at the hotel for approx 12 to 15 hours and found service acceptable but was hoping for that WOW factor in customer service. The service at chicago trump tower seemed more impressive. I would certainly return to this fine establishment.

Reviews.Title: “You know I liked it!"”
Reviews.Author: DCHOTELGUY01
Reviews.Content: My wife traveled to this hotel solo. She loved it! The rooms where large, well maintained and the service was fantastic. The staff refers to you by name, and many of the members remember you by face and greet you during your stay. She stay in room 5903 facing the strip. It had a fabulous view. The rooms are very quiet, because of the way they set up the double door entry. The bar is nice, as is the pool and spa. There is very good security at the hotel, and they ask for rooms keys at night before entering the elevator. The entire hotel is strictly non smoking, and there is no gambling! They are pet friendly, but zero tolerance for barking dogs. This is a great hotel, and we were able to get a good price. There is a shuttle to the Winn every 8 min until 2AM. The hotel is across the street from the mall for great shopping. She would recommend this hotel to anyone. Trump is all about service! Some other reviewers complain about the service fee, but they make you aware of it when you check in, and they don't nickel and dime you during your stay. You get a lot for this fee including the newspaper, free internet, pool, fitness center, many waters in your room, and other services!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: MrsQP
Reviews.Content: Nice interior, excellent service. Simply perfect! If I ever come back to Vegas I will stay here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: EmNaM
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Trump and didnt want to check out!! Fabulous hotel, very attentive staff, rooms cleaned every day, big rooms! One downside was our room had a city view and every morning you could hear the trains below and we were on the 36th floor! So i would recommend upgrading to strip view room! But its not a big deal as you dont go to Vegas to sit in your room!! Had a ball! Love the Trump!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, some bad service.”
Reviews.Author: Vonnanega
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trump for four days. The rooms were really nice and clean. A major issue for me was the pool. It closes at eight pm. This wouldn't be so bad but the hotel rents out the deck for parties so they start trying to run guests out of the pool deck at six. The party isn't untill nine. I understand that a set up is needed but I payed the resort fee too, and would really would like to lounge around and enjoy the pool without pissant pool boys telling me to get off the chairs so they can set up for a party.

Reviews.Title: “The Highlight of Our Holiday”
Reviews.Author: JAC10937
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel after much searching on the internet. This was without doubt the most beautiful and well run hotel we have ever stayed in. Travelling with 3 children - 14,12,10 we opted for a room and a suit. Both rooms were excellent in size and standard. We loved all aspects of this hotel from the moment we arrived we were treated so well (but not over-the-top). All the staff are so professional and friendly. We ate in the restaurant one night during our 4 day stay - both the food and the service was excellent (the wine a little more than we are used to paying in the UK). The pool area was wonderful - and it was nice to see it lifeguarded at all times during our stay. We used the pool bar area both for drinks and food and we were very pleased with the facilities. We loved the hotel so much we decided to go back for our final night of our holidays after travelling the West Coast - we couldn't wait to go back. The only negative(s) we have would be my husband's $60 new swimming shorts were stolen from the pool area - we were the only guests sunbathing at the time! This was a bit disappointing! an yes you can hear trains - ask for a room away from track.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you want to get away”
Reviews.Author: Chace_Murphy
Reviews.Content: I have nothing negative to say about the Trump LV. The room was the best my wife and I have ever had in Vegas. If you are looking for a place that is quick to check in, offers immaculate accomodations, and above-and-beyond customer service, this is your place. The Trump in any other city would be a bar-none hit. Its biggest negative would be a tie between: 1, being a non-gaming facility and, 2, being slightly off the Strip. The latter is a minor concern because you will walk much more along LV Blvd in general than from the Wynn to Trump. All rooms are (at-least) efficiency suites. You can save money by staying here and keeping snacks in the room. It's best to be at the Trump and either rent a car, or take a cab to outlying areas. Yes, it is walkable from The Strip, but be prepared for about a 10-15 minute walk away from other people. If you are safety first, this may be a negative. Regardless, the Trump is an excellent property: coffee in the room, immaculate accomodations, and excellent customer service. It is best for business travelers, as well as those who may consider retiring early for the evening...at least according to Vegas standards. :-) BTW...the people complaining about trains are light sleepers. If you are too, keep this in mind. It is a legitimate concern for you.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: brad b
Reviews.Content: WOW What a hotel. From the moment i arrvied for 3 days. Simply the best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 5 star hotel but definitely not a 5 star service and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Naj T
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for 3 night via Hotwire.com. Upon arrival, we noticed that our vehicle has to be vallet only and no self parking. So we had to tip the driver when we leave AND come back to the hotel. When we checked in, we were not greeted. Front desk lady wasn't cheerful but looked sad. After driving for almost 6 hours, would be nice to be greeted with a smiling face in stead of a sad depressed face. She offered for an upgrade but we refused. We went to check the room, didn't like the view so we decided to go back downstairs and upgrade to a one bedroom suite. Got the same lady to help us, still no personality! Room were absolutely gorgous, no complaint. We had to pay for a daily resort fee for the stay. Resort fee? Pool is as simple as can be, just because there were palm trees, I don't think a resort fee should be charged. It's not even closed to look like a resort let alone the server just walk around the pool and did not greet or ask any guest if we would like to order anything. Hotel has no casino, only one shop and the restaurant not even 5 star. It is more like a lounge. Pool closed at 8 pm. Don't understand why it closes so early when there isn't anything else to do in this hotel. When we had to leave the hotel and get our car from the vallet parking, we were not greeted. Only got a Thank You when we hand them the tips. Knowing how Trump is and how wealthy and fancy he can be, would be nice if he can provide better training to staff on hospitalily, courteous and a better service. When one stays in a 5 star hotel, we should feel like we are getting a high class service as well but sadly, we didn't experience it. We have been to a 4 star or even 3 star hotel and many provide much better service than the Trump could. Will I stay here again? Definitely NOT. With the amount of money we spent in this hotel, we coulda stayed in Bellagio or other 5 star hotel on the STRIP!

Reviews.Title: “In a way, probably the best hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: eugeneeugeneuk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in 17 hotels in Las Vegas of all price ranges and usually do not bother with a review. This one however needs a mention. Stayed for 10 days between 5 and 15 August. On the first night, we were in a room facing the railway track and was woken up 4 times at all hours by a loud freight train blowing its horn (far more than necessarily I thought). The kind hotel management moved us to the other side of the hotel and from then on, it was the best sleep one could find in Las Vegas. Each room only has one neighbour with a shared second door so you can sleep well at night without hearing many doors slam. The rooms are well sound proofed. The bed is the most comfortable I have ever slept in (better than the Wynn and Encore beds, which used to be my choice as best). So a great bed and silence...best sleep you will find in Las Vegas. The bathroom is the best too- with a spa bath! (better than the bathroom I had in the suite in Ceasar's Palace, which used to be my top choice). Add to this a kitchen- no hotel in Las Vegas can beat this. The management always responded immediately to any request and were always most helpful. We had dinner once at the hotel restaurant- the alcohol was a bit pricey but again, it was the best meal I have had in Las Vegas and the bill for two (with quite a lot of alcohol) came to about $130 which is good if the food is good and it was! The hotel has unique selling points which is why you should go there, if you are thinking about it.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay here, and ready to return!”
Reviews.Author: Katsong
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Trump. Our first visit, we had the one bedroom suite which was remarkable and nice to have for a week long stay. This trip we stayed in the studio suite which was equally comfortable and lovely, but on a smaller scale. Checked in on Friday very smoothly, even arrived 2hours prior to check in. I asked for the highest floor available with a strip view, and with no problem was accommodated with the 56th floor and a great view! We could see straight down the strip, and many times enjoyed a glimpse of the Belligio fountains during their show off in the distance. The pool was crowded, but very nice and relaxing. I loved the fact that the new Resort fee included : the workout facility, Internet , and parking. Last time we stayed here, it did not include all of the above. Nice improvement. Also, having a coffee maker in the room as well as bottled water and a mini refrigerator is a rarity in most Vegas hotels. Very nice touch, and much appreciated! The deep and powerful jacuzzi tub in the bathroom makes this hotel my favorite in Vegas, as well as the smoke free environment! Returning from a long night of walking on the strip to a peaceful and pleasant hotel is very comforting! We will return, and I look forward to another great stay at Trump Tower!

Reviews.Title: “A surprisingly lovely time!”
Reviews.Author: Laurasita
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Vegas to visit his family. Because the house was going to be full, we decided to get a hotel and let Priceline pick. We were at first somewhat dismayed that it picked the Trump, but once we stayed there, our opinion made a complete 180 degree turn! The service was so good. Everyone was friendly but not too overbearing. Even though it was busy, the valets were always hustling and brought our car promptly. Check in folks were nice, and though we never saw the maids, they did a nice job cleaning and did not forget to bring us water and new coffee every day. We used the shuttle to Caesar's and it worked great! We loved that there wasn't a casino because it made for a very relaxing atmosphere overall, and there was no smoky smell. Our room was absolutely wonderful! It was huge, and the bathroom was amazing! We loved the jacuzzi tub so much! Also, the bed was the most comfortable I've ever had in a hotel. We had a strip view on the 59th floor and it was really worth it - we could see the fountains at Bellagio! The one big drawback is the doors on the rooms. They are very heavy and they go BLAM! every time someone shuts one. You can hear every door close around you. This is bad at night, so earplugs are kind of necessary, sad to say. It's a pity, because everything else was so very nice. If you're aware and prepared for it, this is totally something you can deal with if you bring some ear protection. Overall, we loved our stay at Trump, and will definitely stay again. We really like the pet-friendliness of the hotel, and will bring our dog next time.

Reviews.Title: “It was G-R-E-A-T! Very Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: SunshineSims
Reviews.Content: Although, I can be very skeptical, this was a great hotel! The staff was very kind and friendly! Everyone that I spoke with was a joy! They provide a very welcoming environment. The only draw back here was the "valet" OMG! One time they forget about me and I waited 20 minutes, UGH! Although, they apologized this was quite the pain. Nice and convenient location off the strip and no casino, so you don't have to walk through the "smokey" environment! Very nice workout room and overall just a beautiful hotel. One of the best experiences I have had in Vegas and I have been many times! Very Comparable to the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: jeremy78Maine
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through hotwire.com & felt I was mislead by hotwire about the location of the hotel. I called hotwire in an attempt to get a refund & they were rude, arrogant, and unhelpful. It was the first & last time I book through hotwire. Its not worth saving a couple of dollars. I called Trump International Hotel Las Vegas & they were extremely friendly & helpful. They walked me through how to get a refund from hotwire. The experience with their customer service was refreshing and greatly appreciated. It makes me want to stay at the hotel but I just won't book through hotwire. ***Please Note I did NOT stay at the hotel but I had to select a time frame in order to submit my review. The only purpose was to commend the customer service over the telephone.***

Reviews.Title: ““Amazing stay!! Absolutely perfect!””
Reviews.Author: vista40
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Trump Tower Las Vegas from august 3th to the 10th. We travelled to Las Vegas with my parent who also stayed at Trump and loved it as well. My dad is in a wheelchair and everything was perfect for him too. If you are looking for a Las Vegas gambling and wild experience at your hotel, don't stay at Trump Tower as it is not your typical mega-hotel on the strip which we had plenty of opportunity to experience while we were in Las Vegas. Crowded lobbies, pushy people and loud, smokey casinos are not our idea of a good time. We wanted to go somewhere that would provide nice surroundings and a good pool in a location that is accessible to the entertainment and shows that we wanted to see. Trump Tower is a non-smoking hotel (not just the rooms, but everywhere - even the bar area). Every other hotel that we visited (Wynn, Treasure Island, Luxor, MGM, Bellagio, etc.) all had a strong odour of cigarettes in their lobbies. Generally, the air was not smokey (due to the high volume of air exchange) but never the less, the places were permeated with cigarette smoke which is less than desireable for non-smokers like ourselves. I have to say that the room at Trump was one of the most luxuriously appointed rooms I have stayed in. Some examples: - Extremely high quality bed, bedding, pillows & linens - The nicest bathrobe I've ever seen (wanted to keep it!) - Sub-zero bar fridge, Wolf cooktop / warming plate, - Marble and glass door shower (room for two) and countertops - in-mirror television in the bathroom - Huge jetted tub, top-end faucets and hardware Given that the hotel had only been open for about a week, I was expecting some issues. While there were minor things, there was nothing that I have not had happen at any other hotel so I really can not complain (for example, my cordless phone didn't work - fixed with a call to the front desk). The pool was incredible and barely used by anyone. We spent several hours at the pool and there was never more than 10 people at the pool despite the 100 degree, sunny weather! Thankfully, the front desk staff helped us out and walked us through the check in at their computers. Staff were very helpful and polite at all times. We would not hesitate to stay at the Trump Tower again and liked the location - a two minute walk to the strip, very close to the Wynn hotel. Travel With Kids:None Yes! I would recommend this hotel to a friend....

Reviews.Title: “Hotel..your fired”
Reviews.Author: Pike513
Reviews.Content: Ok so Mr. Trump.. yes your rooms are beautiful that is a 5 star for sure....Tv in the bathroom mirror, jacuzzi, room atmosphere. But here is what stinks no casino in the hotel, walls are paper thin(train goes by twice a night) hotel pool is basic and music is boring, no restaurants except the lame one In the lobby, no shows, no shops. Closest hotel is the wynn about 5 min walking. So to sum it up I don't plan to stay here again this is Vegas man step it up.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay!! Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Afton A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here (myself and my close friend) from August 7th to the 12th and we both were beyond pleased with our stay. From the moment we walked into the gorgeous lobby we knew we would be satisfied. The lighting fixtures in the lobby are breathtaking! And it was a nice change to have a quiet relaxing hotel with out the noise of slot machines or the stench of smoke. All of the staff were very friendly and professional and made you feel very good about staying there. We arrived fairly early, around 10 am and we went to see if we can check in and we were susprised to find that our room was ready! We just had a standard city room view on the 53rd floor. The view was still nice nonetheless. We had a good view of the stratosphere and downtown. The room itself was perfect. Nicely decorated, modern, and the bathroom was just amazing. It was handy having a kitchen too. Our tv didn't work though... we never called to have it looked at because we were probably not going to have enought time to watch it. That was basically the only fault in the place. After staying here we both are interested in purchasing one of these rooms as a nice getaway. Overall, our stay was truly magical and we will definitely stay here again. The price was really nice too, 89/night. Can't beat that for a 5 star hotel on the strip! Excellent stay and definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in person, mediocre phone”
Reviews.Author: LAmom_11
Reviews.Content: I was there last year for a business meeting and took my family there stayed at a 1 bedroom suite. I loved the front desk staff, door man (who greeted me and welcomed me "home" every time), and the housekeeping. The bathrooms were clean that my toddler and I actually used the bath tub and not just the shower. The kitchen was new, clean, carpet spotless. There was crown molding in the ceilings/wall, and the windows had little vents to allow fresh air inside. The only thing is the people who answer the phone at reservation do not seem professional. I called to ask about any promotions/discounts about their 2 bedroom and they told me no because those penthouses are "very exclusive." This gave me the feeling that I'm not good enough for their penthouse. This year will be trying the Four Seasons instead.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Missy5807
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really nice and the people that worked there were so curteious and helpful. The hotel did not have a casino but that was just fine with me it was directly across the street from the mall which was my favorite attration lol. The trump also provided free transportation to the wynn and ceaser so a casino was not far away. i plan on taking a trip to vegas every year and i can almost gaurentee i will be staying at the trump. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: Sandra_61_11
Reviews.Content: The first room we were given had totally wet carpet from being cleaned. We were given another room exactly the same. We were there for four nights and were quite high up so view was ok. We had our 9 year old son with us and he slept on a sofa bed. The sofa bed was just terrible. You could feel every spring in the thing and when we complained they bought up a topper pad which didn't help at all. The air con and fridge were so noisy, plus we were on the side right next to the railway line and heard trains about every 15 minutes all night. We had virtually no sleep the entire time we were there. No matter how often we complained they would not upgrade us nor could they shift us the a quieter room. The bathroom was huge and luxurious, even a tv in the mirror. It was the best bit about the whole room. Would never stay there again, and I would never reccomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Trip acosss USA”
Reviews.Author: Helen S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights in this hotel and we wished we had planned to stay for longer. LV is great, this hotel has a excellent gym and first class pool, and our room was first class. A great hotel and we will certainly stay in the Trump International Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a quiet oasis in Vegas, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: socal4na
Reviews.Content: Beautiful decor, gracious staff, well appointed rooms. Super comfy beds and love the tv in the bathroom mirror. Spent a great couple of days by the pool, low key relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Quite possibly the loudest hotel in America”
Reviews.Author: theamericannomad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trump in August 2011, but would not stay there again. Though the hotel has some definite pros (see below), they are far outweighed by the cons. Pros: Fantastic service and very friendly staff. Lovely, clean rooms, nice pool, fluffy towels. The spa is fantastic--I had a wonderful, wonderful massage with Wally. There is no casino in the hotel, and, therefore, no nasty smoke smell in the lobby. Cons: the hotel is located slightly off the strip, so is a little inconvenient (there is a shuttle that takes you to the strip, but it stops running at midnight). The biggest con of all (and why we would not recommend or stay at this hotel again) is that it is incredibly noisy because, due to a serious design flaw, the room and suite doors slam shut (very loudly). During the day, it is merely annoying--at night, it is unbearable. The constant sound of doors slamming (at all hours of the night--after all, it is Vegas) repeatedly woke both me and my husband up both nights that we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Fanrastic Stay !! Loved it”
Reviews.Author: NeeR_RG
Reviews.Content: I and my husband stayed at The trump for a night on 5th Aug. I reallllly loved my stay here, had an awesome time !! We had studio room, it was large, comfortable and very modern. The bathroom was luxurious, spatub, seperate shower everything spotlessly clean. The in mirror plasma TV in the bathroom was also great. The bed was soft with execellent sleepworthiness. Everything that is promised in terms of the ammenities is present , no surprises there !! the room is just like it's shown in the pictures. Staff was very professional and polite. The best part was there was no crowd it was just like a good hotel should be, if you do not care much about not staying in a hotel with a casino. The only thing is that it's off the strip a little, my husband wanted to stay on the strip so we changed the next day but I wish we had continued staying there and I wish even more that it was in the middle of the action. This might infact make it more suitable for some people. We wanted to stay on the strip but I didn't like the other hotel half as much, except for the location. It has a huge mall right next to it which is a great plus. Would loveeeeee to be back, I guess they have a free shuttle operating to the strip, so maybe next time !!

Reviews.Title: “amazing room”
Reviews.Author: Katie2381
Reviews.Content: amazing room, corner suite view down strip from bathroom.. wow what a suite! Fantastic, son had comfortable sofa bed in sitting area, our bedroom was great. Staff fantastic, pool ok, nice non smoking hotel.. shops across road, good location. Felt safe. Great start to my trip. Nothing can beat views of Vegas from my jacuzzi bath!

Reviews.Title: “Swanky!!”
Reviews.Author: Cassie-Oscar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Trump Towers May 2009 as we were getting married in vegas and got a super deal to stay here! it was our first time in vegas so i didnt know location of anything, now that i have been a few times trump wouldnt be my first choice location wise as it is a bit far out and at the end of the strip heading towards the stratmosphere hotel, in saying that if you are looking for luxury this is the place for you! The decor of the hotel is stunning, gold & diamonds just amazing, it was that swanky that my parents actually felt out of place & uncomfortable!! the rooms are huge, we even had a plasma tv inside out bathroom mirror! the bathroom was more like a wetroom with a huge walk in shower & jacuzzi bath. The bed was the comfiest bed ever, and the view out onto the strip was great to look out onto! The pool was a bit small for the size of the hotel but the loungers were more like beds 7 super comfy. sadly we didnt get much time at the pool as we only had 4 nights! its a non smoking hotel & no casino which again suited us as we dont smoke and dont gamble much, but for my parents again this was a pain so you might want to factor that in to your choice. it was perfect for us at the time as we just got married and wanted a bit of luxury & we really did enjoy it, but as a Vegas junkie i would rather pay less for another hotel & enjoy a better strip location.

Reviews.Title: “Best room ever”
Reviews.Author: mkk1
Reviews.Content: We had a two bedroom suite and it was the most amazing hotel room. Huge. Well decorated. Well stocked kitchen (even had a salad spinner!). Giant sparkling clean bathrooms. Fabulous view. The fact that it had no casino and no smoking was a plus for us although I could see it being a problem for others. The pool was small and uninteresting but clean and food/drink service was fast and fairly priced. The spa was wonderful and accomodating as far as last minute appointments. We did not eat in the restaurant but ordered room service instead and it was great. The only down side may be the location as it is a bit far from the strip. Not that big of deal if you are open to some extra walking, taking the shuttle or a cab. Definately worth the trade offs in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “A true 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: AR_Traveler05
Reviews.Content: A true 5 star experience. All you can expect form a 5 star hotel and more, from the moment you check in (in our case, even before we arrived as I contacted them by email for a special request) until you check out. All staff we interacted with (front desk, pool attendants, waiters, etc) are just waiting to make your stay even more enjoyable. Property is 5 stars in all aspects. Rooms are exactly as shown in the hotel's pictures (compare the ones I uploaded to the ones at the hotel's website and you will find no difference). We rented a basic Studio and got an upgrade which put us in a higher floor room viewing the strip: All of Vegas right there in your window. Rooms are big, very comfortable, with a small kitchenette that allowed us to prepare some basic meals for our 1,5 year old boy. The bathroom is unbelievable, with a TV embedded in the mirror, separate shower area and a jacuzzi big enough to fit 2 adults. Good thing: No casino in the premises, which makes it great for a relaxed stay. Very well located with convenient shuttle services to and from the Caesars Palace (in case you are not in the mood for a walk). A true Vegas stile experience without the typical buzz of the lobby casinos that you find in the other 5 star properties. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A awesome and sophisticated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barry3110
Reviews.Content: Okay, so the outside of the hotel is gold, but inside the décor is stylish and fairly understated for Vegas. Booked a studio for 6 nights and when we got there, got offered an upgrade to a one bed suite for $30 a night, so took it. The suite was lovely with a nice bedroom and a vast main bathroom with a jacuzzi tub and separate shower and toilet stall. The staff were much more attentive than any other hotel I have stayed in Vegas( and I'vestayed in quite a few), greeting you pretty much every time you walked into the hotel. Its a couple of minutes walk tops on to the strip and as far as I could see perfectly safe, and the Fashion Show Mall was right across the street. It maybe lacks a few of the facilities of the larger casinos but they are so easy to get to anyway its not really a problem. My only slight moan is the pool, while very nice, seemed to channel the wind and it was often quite windy. Apart from that, I loved the place

Reviews.Title: “If you want a non gambling hotel, chose this one”
Reviews.Author: Sharkdive1
Reviews.Content: Very nice and large rooms, also in light of what you pay. Make sure you book the strip view, as high up as possible, worthwhile. Located opposite shopping mall, however, not directly at the strip. If you don't mind walking for 10 minutes to get to the strip, you're all fine. Shopping mall by the way is one of the nicest we've seen so far in the US. Nice pool area as well, 2 whirlpools, totally sufficient if you want to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, lives up to the Trump name, Exceptional Value”
Reviews.Author: GW666
Reviews.Content: We arrived mid afternoon and expected a wait for check-in (as some other Vegas hotels we have used in the past), found no queue for check-in, lobby was very impressive and classy, valet and doorman were very welcoming and efficent. Approached the check-in desk and was welcome by a very professional young lady, who quickly checked us in and not only pointed to the lifts, she walked us over to them. Luggage arrived in room within 5 minutes. We had a Strip view 1 bedroom suite, again very impressive. Quality fitting and fixtures, very clean and great views from both Lounge room and bedroom. Main bathroom was to die for, it was way bigger than many rooms we have had at other hotels, again all quality fittings and felt very stylish. Room also had a second bathroom (shower and toilet but no bath), again good size and nicely fitted and very clean. Kitchen area was large and had a full size fridge, sink, Micowave and breakfast bar, plenty of dishes and utensils, again spotlessly clean. Even the over sized noughts and cross's game on the table in the lounge had been placed so they were in a "T" shape (eg trump), nice touch and attention to detail. Lobby was huge and welcoming and as it's a non smoking hotel it even smelt good. The couple of times we used the valet they were very fast (less than a couple of minutes each time) and very polite. Found location to be great, across the road from major shopping centre and can walk thru air conditioned shopping centre onto main Vegas strip. could not want better. We walked back from main strip after shopping centre closed on a couple of nights with our 11 year old and found the streets to be well lit and we never felt unsafe at any time, we did not use the free shuttle as we found the walk to the main street was only 5 minutes anyway. No hotels either side of Trump which makes it look a bit isolated. Loved the pool area, not over crowded and very large pool with plenty of lounges while we were there. We never he a noise at night or morning from the trains however we were on the strip side, and I gather the train is on the other side, so I would highly recommend the strip view. We wanted a late check out and room guide states it's 11am, but if you phone down on the morning they allow late check-out for no charge (we checked out at about 2pm but they were happy for us to check out even later if we wanted). If you have children this is the place to stay, no casino, no smoke, great location, but having said this there were not many kids there as we only sighted 2 other kids during our stay. next time we go back to vegas Trump is were we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice classy establishment away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Bananz
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was really impressed with my stay. The check-in and customer service was bar none. The staff was attentive and helpful. The rooms were lovely and well appointed. The size of their lowest price room was spacious and the kitchenette was a wonderful amenity. We ate breakfast and that was really nice and quiet. I liked that this hotel was close to shopping, away from the "seen to be seen" wanna-be's that flock to Vegas these days. I liked being away from the flashing lights and cigarette butts on the Strip. If you want to enjoy Vegas a step away from the madness; this place is for you. Thanks for a great stay! p.s. beware of the train noise - nothing the hotel can do about it, I had earplugs!!!

Reviews.Title: “We'll never stay anywhere else in Vegas again!”
Reviews.Author: nrh
Reviews.Content: The night before we headed into Vegas, we hit up TA for reviews. All of the top rated hotels that we were familiar with had room rates running in the $300 range, so when we saw that we could get a suite at Trump for a little over $100, we were ALL IN! The idea of getting to stay in a totally non-smoking hotel with no casino was icing on the cake. Check in was a breeze and when we asked for a "very quiet room," the girl at the front desk put us in a corner room on the 46th floor. The room was gorgeous and my husband and I totally NEED a television in the bathroom mirror now. Room service was yummy and a surprisingly good value. We ended up staying an extra night and, like the title of the review says, we'll never stay anywhere else in Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: realdiehl57
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed ourselves on this 2 night stay at the Trump International Hotel in Las Vegas. It is located off the strip and near the north end of it. We could see down the strip from our room. The room was fabulous, huge bathroom with a TV, Jacuzzi tub, separate shower and a phone, along with a great living area. It was more than we expected especially for the price. Room service was excellent and so was the food they served. This hotel meets the high standards set by many of the resorts in Las Vegas. We also enjoyed the fact that we could get away from all the hustle bustle of the Blvd. I think a bus pass is a good idea. There is a shuttle service to Caesars and you can get up and down the strip from there on the bus. This hotel meets the high standards set by many of the resorts in Las Vegas. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and service, terrible parking, location and logistics”
Reviews.Author: juls33
Reviews.Content: The service- Par excellence. The room- perfectly fine , not my style but fine, lots of amenities in there, a kitchen, cutlery. The size of the room was huge to say the least. The room service was excellent. Very fast and responsive. Their staff were all very good and professional. The cons---and this is big -- it is very cramped (public areas). There is no self parking, so valet takes 20-30 minutes to get your car everytime you need it. It is located off the strip, not on the strip directly so walking is a pain. The vehicle circulation space in front of hotel is a joke. If they maintain low prices, its great value for the comfort. If you dont mind the styling of this hotel, its ok. Not my thing, but you will get you good room and service. Their Trump Stearns and Fosters bed was brilliantly comfortable as well.

Reviews.Title: “5 class hotel with 1st class service”
Reviews.Author: norwichlulu
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the evening to a smooth check-in to be taken to our rooms to find a fabulous studio room with fabulous views to the mountains, we were offered an upgrade but declined but we were more than happy with our view as it was on the 33rd floor and watching the sun rise and set was priceless. We used the pool on a few of the days and found the staff to all be very helpful and friendly.The pool area was adequate as we never seen anyone being turned away, there were always plenty of seats and sun shades available. The shuttle bus was fabulous too as it stops at the Wynn hotel at the beginning of the strip or you could catch the one going to Ceasars Palace hotel in the centre of the strip, beware there is quite a walk from Ceasars drop off point to the main strip road, we opted to catch the Wynn shuttle and buy the deuce (bus) ticket for $7 each for 24 hr use (it gets really busy so be prepared to stand when on this bus) and you can jump on and off to go into whatever hotel you want to look inside. Regular travellers to Vegas have told us that the cost of food and entertainment has went up a lot in the last few years but if you look about you can find cheap food, especially for meat eaters (we are fish eating couple) we resorted to finding an out of town supermarket where we stocked up on fruit, veg and yoghurt along with pasta and fresh juices, eggs and bread. this did us for the majority of our trip although we still ate out a few times, once at China Town, once at a noodles bar in Ceasars palace both of which were nice. Taxi drivers were pleasant and took us to whatever destinations on the quickest route possible. All in all a super holiday, we will return to Vegas and definately stay at this hotel as the non gaming and non smoking atmosphere suited us perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but... choooo choooooooooooooo!!!”
Reviews.Author: nreitter
Reviews.Content: Let me get the bad out of the way first... the train noise is TERRIBLE (or was, at least, in our room - #5423). Perhaps we were put in a room directly above the train crossing/intersection because we booked via Priceline but, regardless, be SURE to request a room away from the train tracks!! I was awoken at 2:30 am, 3:30 am, 5 am, 6:30 am.... I called the front desk tearfully requesting ear plugs & they said they had none but that the gift shop did. My next question: "is the gift shop open now" -- answer: "no" which meant/translation "you are S.O.L.". I am not joking when I say I considered sleeping on the bathroom floor to get some quiet rest. The friendly & helpful staff did, however, move our room the next afternoon & I purchased ear plugs & then slept fine (but you don't really anticipate having to wear ear plugs in a 5 star hotel). Anyhow, the train noise is bad. You have been warned. Otherwise, this is a fine hotel. I breathed a sigh of relief (literally) at it being smoke-free. I thought the hotel being casino-free might be a bit of a bummer but it wasn't. Trump offers shuttle service to Wynn & Cesar's throughout the day so if you need to get your gambling fix in it's just an air-conditioned van ride away. The rooms are big & comfortable with great views. They include a microwave, toaster, coffee maker, mini-fridge & flat-screen TV as well as two wardrobes (great for us as we were 2 friends traveling together). The bathroom was HUGE with granite & marble & a large soaker tub. The staff was incredibly friendly & they even do this nice touch of coming around the desk to hand you your check-in receipt & walk you toward the elevator. Very thoughtful when they were clearly busy & had other folks waiting to be helped. The on-site restaurant was fine. Pretty good food but expensive (breakfast buffet is $20 & $5 for a cappuccino or fresh-squeezed orange juice).
