Trump International is, literally, right across the street from the Fashion Show Mall so it was fun to do four hours of shopping & then stumble back to the hotel. All in all, this is a very good hotel with an exceptionally friendly, courteous & helpful staff. I'd recommend it for others but being that i'm an extremely light sleeper & have battled insomnia I don't think I'd stay there again- the train noise was just too much for me.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale rooms, quiet setting”
Reviews.Author: CalHusker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with three friends before switching to the hotel on the strip that was hosting our event. Booked through hotwire and got a great rate. Check-in was a bit slow with only one person working the front desk. Granted we arrived at midnight, but the wait was a bit annoying. However, the check-in person was very service oriented and helpful. Lobby is cavernous and leaves you feeling kind of cold. Our room was gorgeous and big. Enormous bathroom with walk in shower, jacuzzi tub, separate toilet area. Nicely appointed room and clean. I wouldn't recommend sleeping 4 to a room. They only have rooms with a king and a pullout sofa. The real bed was incredibly comfortable; the pullout sofa was incredibly uncomfortable. I normally stay on the strip in Vegas, but I would recommend Trump to anyone who wants a quiet retreat to return to after a day on the strip. No casino craziness and a free shuttle to Wynn and Caesar's throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not for family...”
Reviews.Author: Prtof5hive
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of July. Our last hoorah for summer break before the kids went back to school. The rooms were beautiful and swanky, just what you would expect from Mr. Trump. The view was amazing and the service was excellent. I do have a few complaints though. The pool was in need of a little repair. Not that it was awful, it just needed some tile work. Also, the location was right next to a railroad so me and my children were woken up several times throughout the night to the horns blaring. But my biggest complaint would be the pull out beds from the couches. Not what you would expect for the price you're paying. The matresses were thin and lumpy. My kids had a hard time getting comfortable. All in all this is a very nice hotel for young couples or a ritzy little getaway for married couples who want to pamper themselves for a few days. The service made up for it. It was beyond excellent :)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, not amazing location”
Reviews.Author: EmNGav
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here in July 2011 for 4 nights and really enjoyed our stay. There are loads of positives. Firstly, the rooms are really good. We had a king bed room without much of a view but it was more than adequate. The bathrooms are huge, there is a separate shower cubicle and a whirlpool bath with enough room for two. There is a kitchen area that was well equipped. The lobby area is lovely, if very quiet. We only ate in the hotel restuarant once for breakfast but it was very good. Everything was very clean. My hubby used the gym area and was pleased with it. The pool area, although not huge, was lovely. The only negative I have is that the hotel is out of the way of all of the goings on. There are shuttle buses to other hotels but I felt that the hotel was quiet and removed from all the action of the strip. Some might think this was a good thing, as my hubby did!!! I would have liked to be more direct on the strip to get a bit more of the atmosphere. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay but, if we were returning to Vegas, we would probably stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY GREAT”
Reviews.Author: danlisa015
Reviews.Content: We drove to Las Vegas from LA so we were quite tired but as we arrived at the hotel, the valet greet us, and the doormen opened the gold doors into the clean, peacefully and beautifully decorated lobby. Check in was very quick, we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite and were swiftly moved into our room. However we heard the train run pass and called down. They were very gracious and kind in allowing us to change rooms even though it was on a lower floor. The rooms were very nice and good for families to stay in if you don't mind sleeping on the sofa bed which was actually kinda comfortable. The service and housekeeping were excellent and so kind. The pool though small was nice and had a great view. It was a nice change from the cigarette smelling lobbies and entrances of other hotels on the strip however got quite boring at night. The walk is not quite long though after walking up and down the strip does get quite tiring. Overall, a great hotel, would love to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to anyone wanting a great hotel!"”
Reviews.Author: Drywave
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Trump in May 2011 and I have to say, what a great hotel! from the moment you get out of your taxi to the moment you leave you are treated like royalty! The lobby is fantastic and the staff are very pleasant and polite. we stayed on the 44th floor and the view was amazing! At first we didn't think we wanted to stay off strip but the trump is good value for your money. We got a suite which included a fridge, hotplate stove top, microwave, and toaster. the bed was so comfortable and the over sized jacuzzi tub was inviting after long days of walking the strip! We were never more then a 10min walk from where we wanted to be. it was a very short walk to the strip and right across the road from the fashion mall. you could cut through the mall and be at treasure island and cut through the under ground parking and be at the mirage. The fitness facilities was great. everytday you could get ice cold water with lemon, or oranges in it, very refreshing! the pool deck was amazing and had a great view. I have no complaints about this extravagant hotel, I would recommend it to anyone wanting to have a good time. the best part was it was a none gambling no smoking hotel. It was nice at the end of the day to return to solitude and escape the hussel and bussel of the strip. Also, the smoking hotels smelled of smoke so it was nice to leave that outside. They have a suttle that will take you to the Wynn and to and from Ceasars Palace, the driver is very polite and very accomadating! If you have breakfast there, the buffet is worth the price and if you order breakfast, the eggs benedict are to die for! If you are looking for a nice place to eat try the "El Segundo" restaurant just at the corner, it's the best mexican food ever!

Reviews.Title: “Best in vegas”
Reviews.Author: EzHassan
Reviews.Content: go to venetian, cesears palace and wynn then come back at night to sleep here....really all the other 5 * on las vegas do not stand up to this one. why: because here it is quiet and staff is very attentive they dont have long check in line or crazy vegas casino. But they have amazing rooms. amazing service.. they will do anything for you... You call the valet to have your car ready and it will be there in a sec , they call and make sure everything is going well with your stay. really you will get the 5 * feeling here.. we did not get that at the venetian

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel,............but it did have one glaring omission !”
Reviews.Author: 8Busby
Reviews.Content: Yep, this Hotel is definitely what you would imagine from the Trump brand,..............well almost ! First the good;- Fabulous room with loads of stuff that you may not get as standard in the competition. A pleasant upgrade to a Strip View on arrival which we were extremely grateful for. A fridge that we could use as our own, ie, none of those nasty censors that trigger another addition to your bill if you happen to move a drink. Very handy as my wife's insulin had to be stored somewhere cool. Great TVs, ( the one in the bathroom was amazing!). Great kitchen area with a cooker and microwave. A very decent size room with very comfortable bed and a lovely sofa which we turned round to face out onto the amazing Strip view. The pool as someone has said already, was a bit small in comparison to other hotels and could be considered fairly bland. However, it was always spotlessly clean and there was never a problem with getting a sun bed or parasol. As far as we were concerned, it was all we really needed but may have been a let down for the pool party brigade. Reception was small, but again spotless, and very "gold", in true Trump style. So what could be the blemish on this fine establishment ?? Sadly it seems to lack atmosphere of any kind at all, especially during the evening. There is one shop, ( Trump's own branded goods ), one bar which is in the lobby and from what we saw was very rarely used. We so much wanted to return each night to a hotel where we could sit in our hotel bar with a couple of night caps, but I think they must have given the feng shui guy the day off when they plumped the bar in the lobby. It also had only one restaurant, which to be fair was excellent. But that was it, DT's Signature Restaurant, take it or leave it. The irony is, old Donald seems to have thrown the towel in a little by acknowledging this. Shuttles are regular to The Wynn and to Planet Hollywood. On the face of it, these courtesy trips may seem just a little added extra laid on by the Hotel. To me they were a sad admission that there wasn't enough entertainment on site, the alternative being to ferry the Hotel guests to it's competitors. You didn't after all see any of the other hotels laying on shuttles to the Trump ! We did in fact spend a few nights in the nearby Wynn making use of their facilities, but I couldn't help thinking that the Trump organisation would have much preferred me to have been spending my dollars with them instead. Opportunity missed I'm afraid ! The lack of a Casino was neither here nor there for us. I just wished though that whoever had planned this Hotel had some ideas to keep their guests on site with at least something entertaining going on during the evening. Even a cosy, secluded, but very upmarket Bar area would have done. Having said all that, we booked the Hotel for the value it presented, even allowing for the $20 per day Resort Fee. For us it was the spotless and fabulously appointed Room, the accommodating pool, the Trump brand, and the staff who were as excellent as we expected. Will we go back ?......................in a heartbeat ! , and that's why the Hotel still deserves 5 stars. However I doubt the Hotel would hold the same attraction for younger adults who want to experience the more traditional Las Vegas sights and sounds. They may not agree with my 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mags088
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Trumph Hotel in Vegas. Hotel Staff very courtious and helpful, breakfast each morning were terrific. Reception staff the most helpful we have seen for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: k9mother
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because of one salient feature we ADORE: their check-out time is 4 p.m.! It's so wonderful to be able to get up late and not have to worry about packing suitcases the night before, it's like having an extra vacation day- awesome! From now on, this is my favorite hotel in Vegas! Their service is nothing short of excellent. Upon arrival, there were only a couple of people in line waiting to check in, versus the typical long wait elsewhere. Every single time we encountered an employee in the elevator, they politely asked if we were enjoying our stay and if we needed anything else. The accomodations themselves are beautiful and spacious ( see pictures ).They have a nice kitchen with a Sub-zero mini-fridge, a microwave, a sink and cutlery and dishes, but if you decide to eat-in with room service you are in for a real treat : they come in with the white tablecloth and napkins and set you up with your meal with actual butter on an actual plate ( no foil-wrapped airline packages here, baby!) and make you feel like you're in a Hollywood movie. The gratuity is included on the bill, but we liked our server so much, we gave him an extra tip. We usually buy our show tickets before coming to Vegas and arrange our stay around them. This time we hadn't , but our delightful concièrge, Frederic , obtained our tickets for LOVE for us and got us the prices for Le Rêve, so we could see if it was worth getting them at the discounted ticket kiosk accross the street at the Fashion Show mall. As to the train noise, we were facing the railroad and it didn't bother us in the least. It is audible, but sort of like hearing it on TV, a background noise of sorts.

Reviews.Title: “As close to a decent business hotel as you're going to find in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: global_trash
Reviews.Content: Personally, I find Trump a little cheesy; the faux hair thing has never done it for me. So, I was a touch concerned when a colleague insisted that we stay at the Trump for a business trip. But the rate was good ($104 for mid week), the location ideal (opposite a large mall, one block from the Strip and next to the Wynn), and my colleague generally has good taste. He was right. This is a standard business hotel (small business center, couple of restaurants, bar that closes at midnight, small pool) not a Las Vegas extravaganza, which suited us just fine. My one bed suite had a huge velvet sofa, two full bathrooms (one of which was huge), a kitchen (full size 'fridge, oven, microwave, enough pots & pans) and three TVs (no HBO). Toiletries are some weird Trump Spa brand, that really wasn't great. The furniture is definitely scuffed up, and the bed had a good 6" gap between the headboard and the mattress. The $20 resort fee includes WiFi (passable speed), bottled water (you shouldn't really be drinking Las Vegas tap water), coffee & valet parking, so it's not that horrible of a deal. The poolside restaurant is fine, the waitresses were attentive, though it was bizarre trying to discuss business while my middle aged colleague tried to look anywhere but at the bikini clad waitresses! Finally, it's mercifully Trump light; there was a forgettable Trump quote on the mirror in the poolside restaurant, but that was about it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Mirggus
Reviews.Content: We had a complimetary upgrade to a beautiful suite. Loved it! Housekeeping was not perfect, did not clean the room on one day, but other days, ok. Did not dine in the hotel. Valet parking was a bit annoying, had no choise to park by ourselves. Sometimes very slow. We did wake up every night twice because of the trains. Not nice. Overall a good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Niko88_11
Reviews.Content: Having read some reviews prior to booking here about the train noise, I booked our stay here regardless, and I"m glad I did. This is one terrific hotel, with beautiful rooms, non smoking, non casino. You won't find the "20" something crowd staying here which was perfect. The pool although smallish by Vegas standards is quite nice, no blaring music. The staff during our stay was very helpful and nice. The only downside to our stay was room service, which for whatever reason we had trouble getting through to, and had to phone the front desk in order to place an order, definitely something they should look into., but once the order was in, the food was fast, and service good. I'll definitely stay here again for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...but you won't spend much time there”
Reviews.Author: buzzkook
Reviews.Content: The hotel room itself was terrific. We stayed at an executive suite and it was beautiful. The jacuzzi in the rooms was large and much needed after each day exploring in Vegas. The tv imbedded into the bathroom mirror makes sure you want to spend your entire day in your room. I have nothing bad to say about the room BUT the hotel itself offered very little entertainment. The lobby, pool area, and fitness area are nice but I saw very few people who spent time there. It is definitely not in the thick of the action but that might be a plus to many people. The hotel is sort of Pet Friendly which is the reason we stayed there in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but a nice room and an excellent value”
Reviews.Author: amy17NewJersey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Trump International for 4 nights in July. We arrived in the early evening and the check-in process was quick and easy. I had read other reviews that talked about the nearby train that goes by so I asked if that was really a problem. The desk clerk acknowledged that some people are bothered by the train but she assured me that that our room would "be away from all that". Ultimately, we were given Room 2308 and while it may have been farther from the train than other rooms, you could definitely still hear it. Furthermore, the room was above the pool and because it was not that high up, the pool music could be heard quite clearly. While this was not a problem in the afternoon or evening, it was pretty annoying in the morning at 8:00 a.m. when the pool opened. After checking in, my husband and I wanted to have a glass of wine. We assumed that wine glasses would be included as part of the kitchen set-up but they weren't. In the process of looking for them though, we found a half-eaten bag of potato chips in the cabinet which concerned me as to the overall cleanliness of the room. We ended up calling the front desk for glasses and while they were gracious about bringing then, it took more than half an hour. Despite these issues, there was a lot that is good about Trump Hotel. The rooms are large and attractive with comfortable beds and luxurious bathrooms. The pool has plenty of chairs and if an umbrella isn't available, one of the attendants will bring you one. We used the shuttle to Caesar's a couple times and it was pretty convenient. (The shuttle to Wynn kind of seemed like a waste since it's right up the street). We also had a car and the valet service was prompt and polite. The location is a bit of an issue unless you are already familiar with Vegas. My husband and I have been there quite a few times so we knew exactly where Trump was in relation to other hotels and how to get places efficiently using short-cuts and free trams when available. Even so, there is a lot of walking and if the mall is closed, you have to walk down a fairly isolated bit of the road for the last stretch to get to the hotel. But, given the price we paid, the location was worth it. Finally, and I would assume most people reading this would know this, but there is no casino at Trump. There was one guy at the check-in counter who wasn't aware of this and was rather dismayed!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: hmseminole
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Vegas at many hotels, but if you are looking for a 5 star hotel, do not stay here. The bathrooms are 5 star, but the rooms remind me of a cheap extended stay hotel. What were they thinking when they put kitchens and gold carpeting in a room in Vegas? It took me 3 rooms to get one where the carpet was not stained and I am afraid to take my socks off in this one. Rachel at the front desk was great, but I booked a 5 star hotel and got a 3 1/2 star hotel. If you want a great 5 star experience in Vegas, stay at the Encore, the Palazzo, the Bellagio or the Four seasons.

Reviews.Title: “First time visitors to Vegas - loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carol155021
Reviews.Content: We actually went in Sept. 2009 for my husband's 50th birthday. Liked the fact that there isn't a casino on site, quieter and no smoke. Pool was a little too busy for our taste on the weekend evening, loud, but first thing in the morning was incredible, thanks in part to the fact that it was 100 degrees. Great mini kitchen, found bagels and cream cheese in a store nearby on the strip. Liked the short cut to the strip through Fashion Show Mall, air-conditioning helpful. Faced the Red Rock Mountains, great view from the 52nd flood,but not so picturesque if on a lower floor. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great for luxury not the party”
Reviews.Author: nuggetshow
Reviews.Content: The hotel/condo inside looks a bit out of place in LV. That said if you want a New York City type of decor this fit's the bill. The pool is nice, however not a resort style pool you get at other properties in town. If your goal is to hang-out at the pool don't stay here. Rooms are well appointed, with a huge jet tub & shower. It's a 5 minute walk to the strip or they offer a free shuttle to Wynn & CP ( not really free since you get hit with a $20 a day resort fee). Nice place to stay if you are visiting with your spouse and looking for privacy. If you want the full Vegas exp you would be better served staying at a casino resort.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel I will stay at in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LoriJM
Reviews.Content: After a horrible travel day, filled with mixed up hotel rooms and someone getting a hold of our credit card information we found a room at the Trump on line. Talk about turning a bad day around., from the moment we pulled up to the port we knew we made the right choice. This hotel is non smoking/non gaming. I waited only a minute or so for my turn to check in. The front desk clerk was kind and gave us a upgrade to a strip view. The rooms are lovely, they are large and have kitchenettes. The bathroom is the size of many Las Vegas hotel rooms. I will stay here next time that I travel to Vegas, if I want night life the Wynn is at the end of the block. Nordstrom is directly across the street. It is a wonderful oasis in the desert.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Great”
Reviews.Author: prkittysd
Reviews.Content: It is a lovely hotel; nonsmoking, family friendly, nice pool, close to restaurants and shopping, free shuttle to the Wynn and Caesars, free valet parking! But half the time it really felt like they *just* opened their doors and are getting used to serving the public. Housekeeping was disorganized, the restaurant staff was disorganized, valet was disorganized. The one major complaint every member of our party had (four different rooms) was the quality of the beds. All were very uncomfortable, and two were broken (one bad bed frame and one bad mattress). We reported to the front desk and they didn't really seem to care much. No notes taken, no gestures toward making repairs at all. But the rooms are clean and the rates are good... so you can't really complain too much, right? Just don't expect a "five star" stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Crystalwaters123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trump Las Vegas in a 1 bedroom suite for 3 nights. Had got a great deal on Travelzoo and after reading reviews on tripadvisor decided to book it. The goods - The thing that stands out most is the wonderful service culture of this hotel. The staff is very efficient and always willing to please. - We had our 2 year old son with us, and felt this hotel was a great choice being just off the strip (not too far from the action), with no walking through smoky casinos etc. At the restaurants, the staff would rush to help us with high chairs and crayons for him to stay entertained. - The lobby area is immaculate. - The shuttles to Caesar's palace were helpful getting us to the strip The not so good - The rooms were not as well kept or clean as the rest of the hotel. The furniture also felt a bit shabby and had stains. But net net, for me the positives outweigh these negatives and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Trump does it right!”
Reviews.Author: Cooper1200
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May on a business trip and it was one of the best hotels I've stayed at in Vegas! If you don't mind not having a casino at the hotel, then this is the place! The service is excellent! From the front desk to the maid service, they make you feel like a special guest. The hotel has a free shuttle that goes to the Wynn and to Caesars Palace which saves on cab fares. The room is great and the bed is so comfortable. Great place if you want to experience Vegas without staying at a casino.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel with relaxed atmosphere, would return here”
Reviews.Author: Diesel77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Trump for 5 nights. The rooms are lovely and spacious, all rooms are suites as far as know. Large jacuzzi bath, his 'n hers wash basins, large walk in shower and TV in bathroom mirror. The room also had a fully equipped kitchenette which is modern and clean. We had a coffee machine with filter coffee supplied every day which is a bonus as the other hotels don't have any coffee/tea making facilities in the bedrooms (I know cause we had friends staying in other Vegas hotels nearby and they did not have any such facilities, they had to pay $9 a coffee if they wanted one in their room). The lobby area is beautiful and without all the hustle and bustle of the gambling machines. This hotel doesn't have a casino which is great but they do have a shuttle that does to the Wynn and one that goes to Caesars Palace. It is not exactly on the strip but about 200m off a sideroad on the strip, this was no problem and everything was still in walking distance. Hotel also has a large swimming pool. This hotel is ideal if you do not want to be in the mad crowds all the time, you can go onto the strip and enjoy the madness for the day, but return to the Trump with a very relaxed atmosphere and excellent service. i think someone commented in a previous review about train noise, yes you can hear a train occasionally but it is really not that bad. We visited friend's bedrooms who stayed in other hotels on the strip which are supposed to be some of the nicest new hotels and the noise coming from the road and the crowds there was much louder than the occasional train noise at the Trump.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Nara0910
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trump International Hotel for 6 days and had a great time!!They really treat you like royalty at this hotel. The staff all deliver great service and are always prepared to assist you if you ever need anything. We were truly amazed by how all the employees are very friendly and will go out of their way to help you with anything. As for the hotel itself, it is so clean! Our room was beautiful and you gotta love that huge bathroom with the tv screen embedded in the mirror! I miss having that! As for all the people saying this hotel is far off the strip, it really isn't that bad because we actually enjoyed walking and the free shuttles to Wynn and Ceasers were very helpful. I was also worried about that train I heard so much about and we were not bothered by it at all. I don't know why people are complaining about it so much, it isn't a big deal. I think I heard it three times while I was there and that is only because I was awake. All in all, we had a great experience at Trump and when we go back to Vegas we will be going back to Trump!

Reviews.Title: “Service second to none”
Reviews.Author: traveling_gal801
Reviews.Content: Simply amazing. Beds and linens are the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Hotel was immaculate. When visiting Vegas, we were leery about staying in a hotel with no casino. But the service provided erased any skepticism we has. Check in: extremely fast. From drop off to being in my room took about 10 minutes. This is a no smoking hotel, but the idiots in the next room must have not got the message. When I made a quick call, I was immediately moved to another room. Room: This hotel was originally built as a condo complex, but was converted to a hotel. Room was spacious ( I had a one bedroom suite) with a nice wet bar fridge and microwave. Bath room was luxurious with a Jacuzzi tub, double sinks, and tv in the vanity mirror. Soaps were from the Trump spa and smell wonderful. Robe provided was very soft. Room TV was a 38"or larger HD screen with a great picture. Location: For me I am fine with the location. Those who want an on strip may not care for the location. This hotel is at the north end a bit off the strip. They provide free shuttle service to the Wynn and Caesars palace. So you can get to just about anywhere you want to go and never move your car. The shuttle leaves about every 10 minutes. The front door of the hotel faces the Nordstrom entrance of the Fashion Show mall. Other that was provided at no charge: Wireless internet had an extremely strong signal. Newspapers delivered every morning. Bottled water placed in room daily. Gym has top notch equipment. I only saw the pool but did not use. It looked very nice but small. Food: All food and beverage we experiences was very good a little pricey, but not over the top. Overall: we loved the lobby that smelled clean and smoke free. Also appreciated not having to maneuver through a casino to get around the hotel. The ease of getting to a casino outside the hotel was enough for our casino needs. Only downside: There were a few of us staying at the hotel on various floors. The elevators are in banks, so to get from a floor in the 40's to a floor in the 60's you had to go down to to up. Elevators were extremely fast, so I almost hesitate to mention this hiccup.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, very clean, very friendly staff, close(ish) to the strip”
Reviews.Author: Audifanatic
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Trump for the very first time last weekend. We took the Bel-Trans shuttle to the hotel for $8 per person, excellent deal. Do this and save money on transportation costs, it’s worth it!!! Back to the review…I booked a city view suite on Priceline two weeks prior to this trip @ $120 USD per night. At check-in (which went very fast) we were actually upgraded free of charge to a suite w/ strip view, since this was our inaugural trip to Vegas after all. The Hotel: The hotel itself is done up nicely. The lobby has a lot of gold and glitter. There’s a small bar to the right and check-in directly to the left of when you walk in the main entrance. The hotel sits about 1 block (1/4 of a mile since the blocks are huge) off the strip. It’ still very close the Wynn, Encore and other activities. For all you Fashionistas, it’s right across the street from a huge shopping center, including Nordstrom. The hotel does not have a casino, but Trump has a shuttle to Caesar’s Palace and Wynn hotel, which leaves the trump valet every 8-10 minutes. The staff: I cannot say enough good things about the staff. All the employees were friendly, professional and very classy. The shuttle drivers were great and went above and beyond their jobs to ensure we got to where we needed to go…To be expected from a Trump Hotel IMHO. The rooms: The rooms are all very nice and despite the bad reviews, I absolutely loved the beds. Being in Vegas for the first time, we absolutely shut it down both nights, so it was nice to get a good quite sleep during the daytime. When you walk down the hallway toward your room, you’ll notice double doors with suite numbers 4718/4719. The double doors open to the entrance door for your suite. Again, this keeps the room very quiet. An added bonus and random factoid, instead of hanging a do not disturb sign outside your door, there are two buttons inside your suite (Housekeeping please) or (do not disturb). We didn’t use the pool, but heard it was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MieMieMieMie
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - just as much glitter, "diamonds" and gold as one would expect in Las Vegas. There's no casino at the hotel, which in my opinion is a big plus. They upgraded us to a much better room with strip view, and we loved the hotel room. It even had a small kitchen, which is convenient if you don't feel like eating out. Note that they have a $20 resort fee per day, and that you have to pay this in addition to the hotel rate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kjay88
Reviews.Content: The Trump Hotel in Vegas is technically on the strip but it's enough off of it that you can actually walk outside without being accosted by crowds. There's no casino and no nightclub in the hotel, so this hotel was a litle haven in my little 48 hour vacation. The pool area was nice and not overcrowded. I was able to snag a lounge chair in the middle of the afternoon on a Saturday. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous. This is where Trump rises above the rest. High end appliances in the kitchen (the hotel is all suites) and the bathroom has a TV in the mirror. Amazing! The bathroom was huge and the shower was incredible. Even the pull-out sofa was comfortable enough to sleep on all night. The hotel offers a free shuttle to the Wynn and there's a huge mall right across the street. And like any hotel in Vegas, there are always cabs lined up to take you anywhere, anytime. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “The Trump As Your Las Vegas HQ”
Reviews.Author: ShoelessJeff
Reviews.Content: I took a one-night business stay at the Trump last month. As this was a brief work trip there were functions and services at the hotel I did not use but . . . I did see enough of this property and have stayed at other LV hotels beyond count to offer a good review / comparison. As always, I am breaking down my review to the Great, Good, Bad, and Ugly with some bottom line type comments. Ready? Here goes . . . GREAT * Space: Regardless of where you are at this hotel - hallways, your room, lobby, etc. - you will feel abundant personal space. This is especially true in the beautiful hotel lobby (see pic), even though it has an ironically small footprint for an upper-tier Vegas property. If you don't know what I'm talking about, take a walk through the NY NY or Ceasar's which are jam-packed with noisy humanity. I really liked the spacious 'feel' of the Trump. * Casino-less: Some will see this as a DETRACTION but I think it is great to have a relatively central upper-tier hotel option in Vegas that does not force you to take a 5K walk through a small city sized casino. The 'bing bing bing' sound can be a little mind-numbing after a few days. Trump is a nice respite. It's great to just walk out of an elevator and across the lobby to the entrance / exit. And, you won't be confronted by the sight of the nickel slot 'playing for rent' crowd. GOOD * Room Size / Design: I stayed at the entry-level room and I found it to be extremely impressive for what I paid for it. The room I stayed in held it's own with other teir one Vegas properties. It even included some things standard rooms in many nicer Vegas properties do not: a small kitcheonette and a very neat in-mirror bathroom tv screen. The room itself had that 'everything is new' feel. * Temperature control / quietness: I loved the room's built in temp control system - just enter your desired temp and the system does the rest. I thought the room was far more quiet than the typical hotel room - why? In almost ALL hotels you walk out of your room and you are in a big corridor. At the Trump, your door will empty into a small 'alcove' that will contain your door and only a few neighboring doors - from there, you have to open the alcove door to get into the main hallway. For me, this really seemed to cut down on hallway noise. However . . . end up with the wrong neighbor and it could probably INCREASE the background noise you'll have to hear. This 'alcove' concept would also seem to pose a security threat as it would seem easier for some predator to jump someone out of the view of a long hallway - so some good / some bad here. * Property: While your Vegas fun will be had elsewhere, just because there is no casino does not mean you can't hang at the Trump. There appears to be a nice spa and pool area - and a very relaxing lounge in the lobby (lounge entertainment does not appear to be an option though - of course this can be a good thing too). BAD (Room for Improvement) * Mobility: I will not go as far as to say a car is a NECESSITY at the Trump but if you don't have one you'll be feeling it a little more than many other Vegas properties. Even Mandalay at the very end of the strip is co-joined with a few other hotels via train. You can of course walk to the fashion show plaza which will put you on the strip but, unless you bring adequate taxi budget, you'll wish you had a car. * Pool Closing Time: I understand why all of the other Vegas properties with casinos close their swimming pools early but . . . I'm not sure why the Trump does. Bottom Line * In a comparison with other vegas properties the Trump is upscale and spacious. If you are willing to part with a casino at the hotel you stay in, this elegence can be had for a very competitive price that will check in about the same with far lesser properties like The Riviera or Circus Circus (anyone else afraid of clowns?). * View the Trump as an ideal Vegas HQ but . . . your fun will likely have to be had somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: SujoyMumbai
Reviews.Content: Visited Vegas with Family in May 2011. The Trump is just off the strip but connected by shuttle bus to the strip - every half hourly. The hotel price of roughly USD 180 did not include breakfast. Airport - Hotel cab fare is roughly 25-30 USD. The hotel is beautifully done up with an excellent lobby. Staff are exceptional and offer good service. Airport transfer was arranged in an SUV at a reasonable rate. It is at a short distance from the outlet malls that offer excellent shopping.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jeanette611
Reviews.Content: I had to call housekeeping 3 times the 1st day of arrival. There was a bunch of trash under the sink, no flatware and no bedding for the pullout sofa. The female shuttle driver gave us incorrect information about the time the last shuttle leaves from Ceasars (they will tell you midnight which is incorrect) and as a result I was stuck there with a person with autism until we could finally find an available cab. I called the hotel and spoke to a very rude operator who pretty much told me too bad about my situation. I asked to speak to a manager and was hung up on. Of course the hotel has a vehicle but cutomer service obviously is not their priority. I will never stay at another Trump property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MREL7
Reviews.Content: If you are wanting to stay at a hotel in Vegas without the poker machines and dazzling casino lights and themes, this is the place to be! The Trump hotel is classy, elegant and simply beautiful. Everyone that works at the Trump provides you with excellent service - you feel quite special being at the establishment. The hotel is not on the strip but you can easily walk to the strip from it. The hotel also provides a free shuttle service to Caesers Palace so if you don't want to walk to the strip, you just hop on one. Taxi's are readily available too if shuttle services have ceased. The 'Fashion Show Mall' is across the road - it has Macy's, Gap and a number of other stores. The rooms at Trump are spacious and very clean. They are serviced daily. The main bathroom was HUGE. It included a very large shower, spa bath and mirror with a tv built into the glass. The second bathroom was of a good size too (no bath but also had a shower). The couch rolls out into a comfortable bed which was made up at our request. The kitchen is great if you are staying for a few days and want to make your own breakfast, lunch or dinner. The restaurant downstairs in also lovely, you can choose from a buffet breakfast or you can order off the menu. The pool area is simple but fantastic. There are a number of recliner chairs, towels are provided as you enter the area and you can also get something to eat or a snack whilst relaxing in the sun. The pool accomodated for a large number of guests. We had trouble with our wireless internet in our room but no problems with it in the pool area or lobby. I would stay at the Trump Internation Hotel again with no hesitation if returning to Vegas. We got an amazing deal - we paid a total of 244AUD for the 3 nights. There is a resort tax at the Trump which you pay at the end of your stay. We received water bottles each day. You get the perfect balance when staying at the Trump : you can enjoy all Vegas has to offer but then return to a stylish, peaceful setting. I would personally return to Vegas simply for the hotel - you really do feel spoilt there! I have attached picutures of the studio strip suite we stayed in. .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time!!”
Reviews.Author: NotaHotelSnob
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! We arrived at the Trump on June 27, 2011 for 5 nights. Lots of people said, "Trump is far off the strip". One block off is not far! It was an easy walk, maybe 10 minutes and there you were, right on the strip. The hotel was very nice. Felt special from the time we drove up to the front doors. Lots of shiny brass and beautiful chandeliers, and that was outside! The inside was nice and bright, tons more of beautiful chandeliers, and the smell was amazing from the fresh cut flower arrangements all over the lobby. Staff very polite and friendly. Rooms were amazingly large with an entire wall of closets, book shelves, kitchen area. Beautiful view looking at the Treasure Island and all the strip lites. Bathroom was fantastic with separate shower area and toilet separated by huge pebbled glass doors. Double bathroom sinks and a wonderful and huge jacuzzi tub. We loved the integrated tv in the bathroom mirror. Neat for when you were getting ready in the morning. Mr. Trump knows how to luxury it up!! Bed was pretty good, but I think the mattress needed replacing. Room itself was VERY quiet. Heard the occassional blow of the train, but nothing to get angry about. Room was exceptionally clean and smelled very nice as well as the hallways. Valets were always very fast at retrieving our car and happy to help you out of it too. Trump was a very beautiful hotel. The five of us had nothing but good things to say about it. We are already talking about going back to Vegas ASAP, and hoping to stay at this great hotel again!!!! 5* all the way!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: LuxoTravelGal
Reviews.Content: I am writing this from my hotel as I am really in awe of how well run this hotel is. Everyone, from the room service, to the pool staff, to the front desk, to the cleaner is a true professional, and very friendly to boot. The resort fee of $20 a day is actually not bad since it includes unlimited cold bottled water, in the room, by the pool etc. (the most important commodity in the desert), free wi-fi and coffee in your room. Usually at a 5 star hotel, I end up spending $6 x 5 bottles of water a day, which alone would be $30 so I'm coming up trumps (bad pun). The rooms are gorgeous, very sleek, contemporary with a full kitchen and view of the strip, I love that there is no casino so I do not have to walk 5 miles through smoky, noisy, slot machines to get to my room. The elevator just shoots me up to the 34th floor in less than 2 seconds - straight from the very sparkly chandeliers in the marble lobby - what more could a girl ask for!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Stellamarisachill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a total of 6 days and loved it. The staff were friendly and attentive, the decor was tasteful and the rooms were very spacious. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel, the only gripe I have is the $20 a night resort fee! Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Alternative to being on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: WVFoodFan
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas for three days for a event with my 18 year old daughter and wanted to find a place close to the Strip but away from casinos. The Trump is a great alternative - huge rooms, very clean and nice amenities and no casino to deal with. The rooms are very quiet because of the way they are layed out and it is across the street from the Fashion Show mall so you are on the strip in a 5-10 minute walk. Overall, we were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms!!!!”
Reviews.Author: duemilaetre
Reviews.Content: the rooms where great!!50 square metres room!!super clean and ith all confort!! Only think..it's not on the strip(main road in Las vegas, just 5 minutes walk off) If you want to be in a thematic hotel..do not choose this one.

Reviews.Title: “Non-smokers Heaven”
Reviews.Author: wellrested2
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful week we spent at this condo-style, full service hotel. We enjoyed the full kitchen, swimming pool, and the most comfortable bed we have ever been in! The staff is eager to wait on you hand and foot, whether it is to bring you an umbrella or a meal pool-side or tend to any details in your room. It was deliciously quiet and relaxing - how they make it seem that way with so many rooms is beyond me! Valet service was a dream! I only wish we could have stayed longer - and we will be back again! Thank you staff at the Trump! Perfect getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our break at this facility”
Reviews.Author: Tessa01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this 'Trump' and enjoyed the whole stay. Staff were accomodating and friendly. This must reflect on an excellent staff training program as every one functioned to a high standard. Our room (studio suite), was more than adequate. Housekeeping got the job done without being obstrusive. The dining room was very nice and initially we thought expensive but after eating at the Wynn we changed our minds. Vegas has turned out to be very expensive to dine out. The Capital Grill just down the road proved to be a plesant place for dinner. All in all the Trump met our needs and we would return, if in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the room”
Reviews.Author: Jude052
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in a Trump Hotel and we were looking forward to experiencing the service and quality that Trump represents vs. the four and five star hotels we typically stay in. Front desk, concierge, lobby bar, housekeeping and maintenance were all excellent and the finishes used throughout the hotel were beautiful. The valet service left a lot to be desired. We used the valet at least six times during our stay and experienced a sluggish response in retrieving our car, non-acknowledgment of the customer when we either pulled up or stepped up to the valet desk, and no answer when dialing the valet twice from our room. We had a corner studio room. Nicely decorated, quiet and clean but every time we entered the room we detected an odd odor like standing water. The bathroom sink wasn't draining on the first night, but a quick call to maintenance and it was resolved immediately. The location of the hotel is ideal if you are looking for quiet time away from the casinos and strip traffic. The City Center shops are directly opposite the hotel but negotiating the crosswalk on a busy street with cabs and limos can be challenging. A nice enough experience but not a wow, and no sense of being pampered.

Reviews.Title: “On the fence about returning”
Reviews.Author: TikiTravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel from June 25-28th. There were some good things about our stay and then some things that we wish would have been taken care of. Here is what we really liked. The spa and their staff were very professional. I had a facial and an hour long massage. The waitstaff at the pool was very attentive. The hotel is nice to walk into without having the smoke of a regular casino resort. It is very convenient to the fashion show mall. You simply cross the street and you are right there. The hotels complimentary shuttle was great for going over to the Wynn or Caesars. The rooms have big windows with great views. The beds are very comfortable. Here is what was disappointing. The rooms were not very clean, not well maintained and the housekeeping staff was not attentive to requests. There is a long list I could go into but this is where I felt the hotel really fell short. I did complain to the front desk manager and we were upgraded to another room only to find similar problems with cleanliness and items not working in the room. We were overcharged by $100 at the cabana and put in a cabana that was being refurbished and charged full price. The waitstaff fixed the problem with the overcharge and apologized. I did complain to the front desk manager and she ended up offering to comp part of another day at the pool. I did end up writing a letter to the general manager who called me live to discuss our experience which I appreciated. He offered to have us come back and we are not sure if we will. There are so many choices in Las Vegas and we could not believe the amount of issues with the rooms etc.

Reviews.Title: “We won't be back”
Reviews.Author: JetSet35
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very cute and functional but the BEDS are ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE...we tried seven different beds and everyone of them sunk to the middle!!!..furthermore, because the beds are so soft (worn out) every time the other person rolls over it makes a ton of noise...we were here for an entire week and didn't get one good night sleep...to top things off - on the mountain side - there's an annoying train that blows its horns about 3 times a night...I definitely would not recommend this property till at a minimum all of their mattresses are replaced!...one last things there was mold in the shower area which completely turned my wife off...she asked that it be cleaned, which they tried to, but the stench was still there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dbirkwood
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on Tripadvisor before booking direct with the hotel and I'm glad to report that the glowing reviews were well deserved. On arrival I was offered the choice of two rooms (no extra fee) so I chose the quiet one...after reading about the train noise. I faced north so had an amazing view out over the mountains so don't worry if you can't pay the pricier Strip view! The train was only noisy because it insisted on blasting its horn for a few seconds as it came along by the hotel, this only happened a few times but once I realised what it was, I slept through it anyway. Although there is the short walk from the Strip to the entrance of the hotel, it is then only a few seconds across the lobby to reach the lifts for the rooms. So this compares well with the other hotels that although are on the Strip their entrance is set back from the actual road and once inside you have to wander through the smoky casinos en route, eventually, to the lifts. So compared to that, it actually compares pretty favourably! It's bliss that it's no smoking and especially round the pool, nothing worse than smoke wafting over you! My only slight gripe about the whole place is the music at the pool. At 8am on a Monday (jet lag!) I really could've done without pounding rock music. Everyone has an ipod now, so why do we have to listen to music that is not of our own choice or heaven forbid, listen to nothing at all if we choose to? I thought the Trump touch may be rather OTT in the room decor but I have to say that compared to a few other hotels the lovely wood finish with neutrals was a sure winner...not a sign of over the top gold in site! THe kitchen was great and it was a treat to have a coffee before heading out...that's a first for me in Vegas. I will definitly be back.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Firework Strip View-could even hear the crowd roar”
Reviews.Author: moniqe2011
Reviews.Content: Our first major holiday trip to Vegas a few years back and on New Years Eve-wow! The Trump has exceptional rooms and views even from the particularly nice bathrooms and jaquzzi tub. Wake up and brush your teeth to the news as flat screens are built into the mirrors. We had a kitchen, living area with sectional sofa, extremely comfortable bed, and we even got dinner served in our room right before the fireworks show. The value of this place is incredible-We bid on Priceline, and admit we were disappointed as we thought the area on the map we chose would put us in the Wynn or Venetian, but it ended up impressing us. If you want more of a quiet, away from the Casinos atmoshphere, this is it. It is convenient by Taxi to the Strip and large resorts, as well as lots of shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Best luxury value for money in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: PerfectStay
Reviews.Content: For some reason the phrase “Best value for money” makes me think about cheap motel rooms. In this case it is relevant for a 5 stars high class experience. Having been multiple times to Vegas and stayed at a number of different hotels there I can without doubt say that this is where I have gotten the most bang for the buck. The building was first built with the thought in mind that it should be sold as apartments. The timing was not perfect when it stood finished in the very beginning of the financial crisis. It was there for decided to create a hotel instead. As a result, all the rooms are quite large, have a fully working kitchen and a more apartment feel to it than a regular hotel room. Service was personal, prompt and precise. I had some smaller issues with my room and this was immediately handled and addressed in a very professional manner by the management in the reception. Some people complaint about the hotel not being on the strip. For me, the 5 minutes to walk to the strip really don’t make a difference. There is also a shuttle-bus to Wynn and Caesars and the Fashion Show Mall (huge shopping center and food court) is located right across the street. I also enjoyed the pool and the service there. There is a HUGE selection of fancy and different hotels in Vegas. The Wynn or Encore might be more luxurious, but way more expensive. I would argue that Trump is more up-scale and up-to-date than both Paris, Venetian and Bellagio and way cheaper. It makes Treasure Island look like something from the 70’s and even if I love Caesars to bits I found that I was able to relax more at the Trump – at a much lower price. The Trump will definitely be my top pick the next time I visit Vegas – If they don’t increase the prices too much and by doing that position themselves to close to places like the Wynn. PS: I did not hear the train once – and there is nothing wrong with my hearing PPS: I recommend the burger from room service.. Fantastic! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute”
Reviews.Author: blueberry047
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay 5 star for my husbands business trip, and we were very pleased with this decision. The valet were very nice and efficient, the rooms were impeccably clean. The bathroom was amazing with the jet tub and the large shower and double sinks. The tv in the mirror was a nice touch. We had the mountain view, which wasn't the best, but it was still nice - the view of the mountains were nice, but not of the adult museum and strip club that was across the street. We were on the 52nd floor and found the elevators to be extremely fast and always available within seconds, no waiting. The pool was great, comfy pool chairs, and enough space to still feel comfortable, not alot of people were out at the pool. Business center charges for internet time, but you are given free internet on your laptop in your room. The housekeeping staff were great at respecting privacy in the in suite do not disturb/house keeping buttons. Leaving messages on your voice mail should you need them to give you fresh towels etc, they were available 24 hours a day and they meant it. Room service was fast and delicious. Didn't eat at the restaurant downstairs though. It is at the end of the strip to the side, but very close to treasure island, and it was nice to stay out away from all the madness going on with the traffic on the strip. It was close and very convenient to the strip but close enough to feel relaxing. No smoking casino to walk through before getting to your rooms. There is a parking lot a very short walk beside the hotel that you can park during the day that is not affiliated with the hotel (free) but I wouldn't park there overnight as there was a lot of broken glass in the parking lot and i'm sure there are alot of break-ins. Definitely valet the car at night, but for short trips in and out of the hotel, the lot was convenient without having to tip the valet 5 times a day. Photos were exactly what was on the website. Toaster, microwave, hair dryer, coffee pot, fridge, burners and ample storage. The staff even washed our dishes in the sink. All in all, the stay was PERFECT.

Reviews.Title: “poor”
Reviews.Author: alex6076
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the trump. nice room (or would have been had the staff bothered to empty the bin full of half eaten pizza and bananas that we were greated to on opening the door) no crockery, no cutlery no way to make coffee, no robes, no toiletries no nothing really! i phoned down to reception who promised to 'correct this immediately sir' it took 24 (thats TWENTY FOUR MR TRUMP ) hours and at least they had shifted the trash (i learned the staff do not understand 'bin' only 'trash can' sorry for being a retard MR TRUMP) we managed without the rest of the refinements, at the end of the day the trump hotel is a travelodge style motel, nice view and nice bath but no personal care and really nothing special. staff are obviously completely lacking motivation, organisation, and direction. for heavens sake donald get a grip on this place! and the internet which you are forced to pay approx 20 bucks a day for is virtually unusable and the tv in the bathroom didnt work neither. all in all a pretty poor show! in essence.. rip off!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: jc2626
Reviews.Content: Having been to Las Vegas several times before, I decided to give the Trump a go this time, as when I booked, the price was so unbelievably cheap for a 5 star, and also there was no smoky, crowded casino to pass through to get to my room. Well, I still can't believe the great deal we received for the price we paid. Yes there is a resort fee, but even including that in the cost per night, it was extremely good value. The rooms are very large, with huge windows to take in the view (we had a strip view on the 56th floor). Walking into the foyer was like a breath of fresh air after being out and about down on the strip. There is this lovely aroma when you walk in (not sure what it is, but would love to find out!), and a sense of calm after having all your senses blown away by the Las Vegas nightlife! The only negative about staying here rather than in the middle of the strip, is the shuttle. As there was 7 of us travelling together, we found that our group alone would almost fill the shuttle, so it was a bit of a scramble to try and get on it, especially as there are quite a number of people who use it! They did run one extra shuttle on one occasion, but I feel it would be advantageous to run more shuttles. We used taxis in the end, as they are plentiful and cheap in Las Vegas. The distance from the strip is the only thing that would be of disadvantage to some people. That being said, if we are lucky enough to visit Las Vegas in the future, I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “loved hotel hated location”
Reviews.Author: tibbyclarke
Reviews.Content: arrived after 10hour flight from UK and was put in a high city view room as requested , was very impressed , jaccuzi , his n her sinks , seperate shower and separate toilet , plenty of storage , kitchenette with fridge , big bed and seating area . imagine my horror as a freight train pulling 30 plus wagons of coal ,sounding its ear pearcing horn as it crossed a level crossing less than 0.5 miles away . This we could have put up with considering the time of day (4.30pm) but this continued through the night and for the 7 nights that we were there. We were moved twice and even given a strip view room upgrade for free but could still hear the train. dont get me wrong this is a great hotel but be aware of the train or take ear plugs !

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: IrvingLevy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days at the Trump. The room was in very good taste. We had a clear view from our window of the city and we were high enough up that we did not need to close the curtains in the evening. The hotel is accross the street from a large shopping mall which was convenient during the day since there is no easy method to walk to the strip (the side walk is torn up because of work so there is a need to cross the street and there is no pedestrian crossing to do so) The mall provides a safe and airconditioned passage to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Motorcycle riders beware”
Reviews.Author: Martin_Hildreth
Reviews.Content: Impression? Understated luxury, friendly staff, and priced a little high when you consider there is no casino. As to no casino, no problem, you can walk to one nearby. Where the experience fell down sharply for me is that it is not motorcycle rider convenient. You and your motorcycle must be escorted by a valet in order to enter the garage. Leave something on the machine that you want to retrieve? Oops, cajole one of the valets to go with you to the garage where your every move will be observed; they are taking no chance that you might make off with someone's rental car. When I checked in I was told there was no parking fee; however, I had to pay in addition to the room charge a $22.34 resort fee which apparently includes parking.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel at Reasonable Rates”
Reviews.Author: Marlou82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at the Trump in Las Vegas. First opened in 2008, everything is so new and modern and they keep the place immaculate. It does not have a casino, but that didn't matter to us since we're not gamblers. It's a quiet hotel which is just what we wanted. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the rooms were beautiful. Beds very comfortable, bathroom was so luxurious....all marble, 2 sinks, private toilet, shower stall and a jacuzzi which my husband loved. And it has a TV installed in the mirror so you could watch while sitting in the jacuzzi. The pool was very nice with plenty of comfortable lounge chairs available. To get to the strip you had to walk through the Fashion Show Mall (about 5 min. walk). We didn't mind it because its a beautiful mall and nice and cool to walk through in the Vegas heat. When you come out of the front of the mall, you're right on the strip and right there is one of the half price ticket booths, Tix4Tonight. Not only can you get discounted tickets for most shows, but you can also get coupons for dinner. Don't go to any restaurant until you stop at the Tix4tonight booths because they have tons of restaurant coupons. My husband and I travel alot, and we're from the NYC area so we have a good amount of experience in traveling and what's acceptable. I highly recommend the Trump Hotel if you don't care about not having a casino in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good on all fronts”
Reviews.Author: Milz99
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in June 2011. I was a little skeptical after reading reviews about the distance to the strip and the famous train that passes by at all hours. Needless to say, I didnt experience any of these problems personally! Free shuttle service to Wynn/Encore every 15 minutes till 11:000pm (5 minute walk). And then theres a second shuttle that goes to Caesars/Forum shops every 30mins-1 hour (27 minute walk). The service from the bell boys, to the front desk, to the restraunt and pool staff was excellent. For u single guys, the pool servers were all beautiful and tanned when I was there, and they walk around in bikini tops and short shorts, and flirt it up big time. Fashion Show Mall is across the street, literally, and has all the services u need, including an ABC Store, which if u are not from the States, is an all service convenience store with alcohol. We stocked the fridge and cupboards up the first day and were good to go for snacks for the entire stay. The room itself is well-laid out, huge bathroom and floor-ceiling window. We had the basic room, 39th floor, facing the Wynn. Like I said, didnt hear any train noise (train is on the other side) but did hear sirens, semis and motorcycles off of major roadway, but hey-its vegas, its noisy no matter where u are!! Resort fee-yes, but this fee does cover wifi, pool access, newspaper, and bottled water. Lots of hotels now charge a separate fee for the pool and gym, so this wasnt too bad. My only two minor complaints?? The property was extemly clean, but for some strange reason dust seemed to accumulate everywhere throughout the day. On the cupboards, lobby, in the bathrooms, and on the counter tops. Weird I know, but other guests mentioned it too in passing. Secondly, each room shares a separate entrance way with another room. When ur neighbors open and close their door it is very loud and u can feel the door shake ur room. This would only be a problem if ur neighbors were in and out of their room all day and night, for us it was ok. I am returning to the Trump at the end of July and will report back, hopefully with a positive experience like my first one was.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view good service”
Reviews.Author: thatkiwijoker
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on Price line then upgraded on arrival, 56th floor with, strip view, easy walk to the Fashion Show Mall and used the shuttle to get to the Wynn or Ceasars, only a little thing but cleaners would sometimes not leave flannels or hand towels, staff friendly and with the help of Ronnny the doorman we got a limo ride for the price of a taxi

Reviews.Title: “Great non gaming hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeamMurph
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, upgraded to one room suite on arrival - it was huge. Nice pool area. Friendly staff. Walk to centre of strip a little far in 40 degree heat, in cooler weather no problem at all. Meal in DJT restaurant excellent value - 3 courses $29.95.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Giggles21
Reviews.Content: The experience we had was great. Location wise, its not awful but it is a little walk to the main strip, but right in front of you is the fashion show mall. But honestly, staying any way on the strip, you have to walk to get around, nothing is that close by, you have to cross the streets to get around. It was nice not having a casino and getting away from such a huge crowd when coming into the hotel. They have a nice staff. The shuttle service goes to Wynn hotel and Caesar's so that was awesome as well. The pool area didn't look as great like the other hotels but we didn't go there to swim. The only two problems with our room was the AC wasn't that great, felt pretty warm even when we turned it all the way down and if you have AT&T, the service absolutely sucks. Other than that, the bathroom was beautiful and huge with a jet jacuzzi and two sinks. The kitchen area had a stove, microwave, fridge, and toaster. Overall, great experience.

Reviews.Title: “near perfection”
Reviews.Author: britoldgit
Reviews.Content: we stay five nights,could not fault hotel or staff,no casino,and just of the strip.we crossed the road,and went through the shopping mall and your on the strip,so very quite and peaceful.if we was to nit pick,it would be train whistles,maybe twice a night .but we would surely stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service and Treatment!”
Reviews.Author: Eugene_OregonJesbal
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay here, but came for a spa day to celebrate my 40th Birthday. Based on the AMAZING treatment we received from everyone at the hotel, from the doorman to the massage therapist, I wish we had been staying at the Trump. We were greeted so kindly and catered to in the Spa all day and at the pool. Loved it here and was totally impressed. I have stayed at many hotels in Vegas and will be sure to come back to the Trump! Thank you for an amazing day of relaxation and treatment. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Sadie7833
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, and I wish we could have stayed more! It's not our first time in Vegas, so we were very familiar with all of the "themed" hotels, of which we will more than likely never stay at again. We chose Trump because it is non smoking and has no casino. Within 5 minutes either walking or on the free shuttle, you can be in a casino. it's the best of both worlds (the grown up quiet vacation one at "home", and the have fun and lose money while drinking one with just a short walk or shuttle ride) On a previous trip I had to wash my hair after just walking through the lobby of our hotel because of the smoke, but not at the Trump. The food in the restaraunt was incredible (and enough for 2 meals), and when we wanted a cheaper more fast food option, we just walked across the street to the Fashion Mall which had endless food options, and was open very late. The service is unbelievably joyous - from the check in, to the pool attendants, to the shuttle driver who seriously made our shuttle rides some of the most fun times we had. He was full of information, and like every employee, was so eager to help. Thank you to this incredible place for such a marvelous stay. We will definately be back, and I have already recommdended the Trump to several friends who will be visiting Vegas soon. P.S. Someone else mentioned the addictive smell of the hotel in their review, and I would have to agree. I'm not sure how the "air" can possibly smell so good as it's not a perfumey smell, but it does. Hard to explain until you experience it!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel0202
Reviews.Content: The Trump hotel was amazing! It was well maintained and stunningly decorated. We were upgraded to a nicer suite upon check in. Our bed was soooo comfy that I didn't want to leave my room. The hotel is right across the street from the Fashion Show Mall, which which had tons of amazing stores. It is off the strip, but that's the best part of it. It's not your typical smokey Vegas hotel.....Its an oasis from that! They have 1 restaurant on sight which is very expensive, my only suggestion is that more restaurants be onsite. They offer free shuttle to Caesars Palace, every half n hour and the pool onsite is GORGEOUS! We enjoyed our stay, we got an amazing deal on booking.com.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: sw_toluca
Reviews.Content: We really liked the Trump and after doing the rounds of all the themed hotels on the strip were pleased that we had opted for what is a much quieter and more classy hotel. There is no Casino and it is right at the end of the strip, they do however run a complimentary shuttle to the Wynn and Cesars Palace and it is not like there is not enough choice when it comes to Casinos in Vegas! Our room was fantastic, huge with a mini kitchen, sofa and table and fabulous bathroom with whirl pool tub and walk in shower, twin sinks and even a tv built into the mirror. Valet parking was complimentary and although they charge a $19 a night 'resort fee' which gives access to wi-fi we were aware of that when we booked so it was not a surprise to us. We didnt have a great view as we overlooked a half finished hotel but we could watch the strip light up at night. We got a fantastic rate for this hotel which made it great value for money, if you were paying the full advertised rate you would expect everything we experienced and probably more.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: wal4d Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: stayed one night as a stopover before flying home to uk. excellent accommodation with a very spacious room and well equipped kitchen area - though some items of cutlery and crockery were missing. lovely to stay in a hotel in Las Vegas which does not have a casino or slot machines! breakfast and dinner were delicious and the special dinner deal is very good value at about £20 per person excluding drinks. overall we were very impressed and recommend it to anyone. did not use the spa or pool but looked good.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: abc025
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 nights and i can say the room was top class, bed was so comfy, jacuzzi was great. The service was incredible, everyone was so helpful. I also have to mention the outdoor pool which was the greatest thing ever. And all around a great hotel. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and service, perfect alertnative to smokey casinos if only no train noise at night”
Reviews.Author: wrigleynorth
Reviews.Content: Fantastic big rooms and great service less than 5 minute walk to strip. Only negative was loud train noise at night. Nice break from smoky casinos and for extended stay

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: sysweetstuff
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Vegas and I am so glad that I booked at this hotel, as soon as I arrived I was treated like a queen.It feels so great to go somewhere and no matter what color you are you will be treated like royalty.This hotel is a 5 star hotel no doubt.It feels so good to come back to the hotel that is peaceful and do not not have to smell smoke.Trump keep up the good business and to all the staff, keep up the good job that you are all doing.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: nuernest
Reviews.Content: Free valet parking, fast elevators, huge room and bathroom with fully equipped kitchen, prompt and courteous service. Clean and good bed. No kitschy decorations and no casino - a real hotel. The breakfast so and so (food-vise) but prompt and courteous service Missed a handheld shower head in the bathroom or bidet but we realized that all hotels we have been in do not have these in the U.S. We were surprised to realize that the hotel address and the hotel itself did not appear in our GPS (June 2010 IGO 8) - if you are having the same problem, use junction of Las Vegas Blvrd. with Fashion Show Drive. A little walk from the strip on hot days (if you do not want to use the car or courtesy shuttle) - we found the use of the Nordstrom entrance to the Fashion Show Mall located right in front of the hotel as a convenient access to the strip during business hours.

Reviews.Title: “Everything i expected and more!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fassionista
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this facility last July. I was attending a conference and looking for a place that did not have casinos or smoking. Trumps advertised both AND was cheaper than the conference hotel, so we booked. Once there, we were blown away by the ambience -it smells great- and the hotel staff. We were upgraded (for a fee- still less than conference hotel) to an amazing corner suite with glorious views of the strip. We ran in to a few celebs ( one musician and one NBA star) and enjoyed the sounds of the pianist in the lobby. The only downside was the overly aggressive security that checked to make sure we were guests almost every time we went up to the elevators. I am sure it was because of the celebrities staying there. I prefer thinking that was the reason (although my husband pointed out to one of security guys that they were not asking anyone else and he hoped that it was not because we were black) and they never asked us again after that:)

Reviews.Title: “Vegas' hidden gem!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cockney1234
Reviews.Content: What an absolute pleasure it was to pull up outside and be treated to the sight of this beautiful hotel!!! Just five minutes walk from the hustle of the strip, this hotel has no casino and is like a haven of tranquility amongst the most beautiful setting. We got the most fantastic deal and then upgraded for just $50 per night to a stunning 4 room suite on the 56 floor with amazing views of the strip and jacuzzi bath in the world biggest ever bathroom! The room was spotless and immaculate and room serve and housekeeping impeccable!!! Lovely pool area with friendly servers and a smokers area away from the pool. Every area of the hotel is luxurious, the staff amazing and its heaven to come back to without the casino in the lobby and feel that you are being welcomed in as an individual rather than another 'punter'!!! Would highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Trump, Beatles LOVE, City Center Shopping, Lounging around the pool in Vegas~Got to go back!”
Reviews.Author: gail034
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, sophisticated elegance with professional and gentle service. The food was excellent in the restaurant and the drinks at the bar were fun and inventive. We enjoyed the ambiance and the room and view was fantastic. Great location, just off the Vegas Strip, where you can relax and recharge for an invigorating night on the Strip. Loved the pool area. Really beautiful. I could spend every morning there to start my day.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SpikeyMikey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights with friends. The style/grandeur/service is all excellent and the rooms are huge. it is a bit pricey but you get what you pay for. After returning from Vegas i also realised that of all the hotels we saw (and you will see a lot!) I preferred the Trump because it didnt have the Casino/Rollercoaster/Theatre/Slots etc. It was a traditional hotel with great staffa nd service and was actually a peaceful haven not too far off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: nykathy
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, clean, great location and great service, from the front desk to the bell boy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice if You Don't Mind Being Slightly Off Strip”
Reviews.Author: Lee_Sloan
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed as I walked through the doors was the wonderful smell...a very light fruity/floral scent. The very friendly reservation attendant told me what it was, but I don't remember what she said. Nevertheless, you won't be bombarded with the sound of slot machines or the smell of unsuccessfully covered-up smoke because the Trump is a casino-free hotel. I've stayed at the Venetian, Nugget, and Mirage on my trips to Vegas, and this ranks right up there with the Venetian in my point of view. The room and the hotel don't have the benefit of an theme or kitchy furnishings, but it is modern and luxurious, with a wonderful bathroom. The tub was an ultra-deep jacuzzi affair that worked wonders on my tired back and feet. The staff was super friendly and the cleaning staff was competent. I received a special rate through Book-It, as a mystery property hotel-79.99 (plus 19.95/day resort fee). When I asked for an upgrade to a strip view room due to other Trip Advisor reviews mentioning loud trains on the mountain view side, I received the upgrade free of charge. Despite this, I did hear a train pass through one early morning, but it hardly bothered me. The view from our window was amazing and the walk to the strip was very short. You can be at the Wynn within 10 minutes, or walk across the street to Nordstrom at the Fashion Show mall and take advantage of an air-conditioned stroll to get to the strip. Parking is valet only, with no set charge. I tipped $5. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel to Vegas visitors who don't mind being slightly off-strip and who don't mind the lack of a casino.

Reviews.Title: “Trump Fails”
Reviews.Author: mjh4634
Reviews.Content: Our family and friends booked the Trump for our son's 21st birthday. From the moment we arrived things went wrong. We had booked our rooms (3) directly with the hotel and one week prior to arrival we called and canceled ONE NIGHT of our reservation. Upon arrival the hotel had no record.
