After about an hour they finally found the reservation (they claimed they were changing booking systems) and finally cleared us for our rooms. We checked our bags curbside (we had all driven in) and went to our rooms. After waiting an hour we started to call the front desk to find out where out bags were. No one knew. We called several times and could not get a decent explaination. Our bags finally arrived after almost 2 hours and with no appology or explaination. The afternoon of our second day our 21 year old son called to say his key wasn't working and when he went to the front desk they explained that the reservation was only for one night. We then discovered that all 3 rooms were "turned over" as the wonderful front desk staff had only corrected THEIR reservation mistake for one day. After a visit to the manager the hotel did solve the problem but I would never stay at another Trump property. It is not worth the frustration! If this is the common Trump experience I would watch for a bankrupcy notification.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: kellkat2
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely property. I felt like I was really on vacation. This hotel is beautiful and the employee's are very professional and accommodating. The Trump deserves 5 stars in my book. I found the location to be a plus. It is convenient to the strip and the mall across the street is an added bonus. I don't mind walking so it wasn't so bad walking to all locations. At night we took a cab back to the hotel if the mall was closed. I say this because the hotel is located on an isolated street and we felt better being dropped off at the front door if we couldn't cut through the mall. The shuttles do run until 11:00 during the week but if you're seeing a show or staying out late then I recommend taking a cab. I loved the no smoking and no casino onsite. I also appreciated the fact that there wasn't a night club on the premises. All of this is readily available close by if wanted but for those who do not want to be around this or need to escape this property provides the ability to do so. The pool was not crowded so chairs were plentiful. It is a beautiful area and it felt like a tropical setting. We found the room to be in great shape and well maintained. The bathroom was awesome. The whole room was spacious. We were upgraded to a strip view room on the 55th floor at no charge, which was an added plus.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: bgonner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trump Hotel for a week in mid-April. It was the second time I've stayed there, and it didn't disappoint. In fact, compared to my previous stay, I saw several improvements. That's not to say I had a lot of problems during my previous visit, just that some of the attention to detail had improved. During this visit, I don't recall hearing the train at all. When some family members staying at a different hotel came to visit, they commented on how quiet it was in the room. I never heard anyone in the hallways; the only time I heard other guests was if the "neighbors" sharing our doorway went into or left their room. The doors are quite heavy, and they make some noise, but the heaviness of the doors makes me feel secure, so it doesn't bother me. And I really like the in-room control that allows you to alert the housekeeping staff about whether or not you want to be disturbed. It's a high tech way of eliminating those door cards that always seem to fall off or be turned the wrong way. As a woman travelling alone (girls week with my sisters), I always feel safe and secure at the Trump Hotel. I never waited more than five minutes for my car (valet only), even over a busy weekend when they had several weddings at the hotel. The door staff makes me feel like royalty, always holding the door and opening my car door upon arrival and departure. They always asked if I needed directions or assistance in any way. And the inside staff always checks for a room key before allowing anyone to get to the elevators. One evening, I was going to the business center to print a boarding pass for my sister. I couldn't get any access, so I went to the bell staff desk since there were a few people in line at the check-in counter. They said they were having a problem with a power outage to parts of the hotel. I would have had no idea there was a power outage if I hadn't tried to use the computer (it worked fine all the other times I used it). The generator apparently didn't cover the business center. In any event, the bell desk personnel simply printed my sister's boarding pass for me, even asking if I wanted to make the seat selection by coming around the counter. Most places would say "come back later", but they never hesitated to assist. The concierge desk was similarly outstanding in their efforts to assist. When I gave them a sketchy description of a Korean restaurant I heard someone talk about, the attendant immediately knew what I was talking about and made some other suggestions based on restaurants she had frequented. My sisters and I went to the restaurant she recommended, Honey Pig, and were not disappointed. I can't say enough about the staff. Having working in a customer service field for over 13 years, they are clearly well trained and understand the positive impact outstanding customer service can make on an organization and their clients. The rooms are beautiful. All of the furniture is attractive and well maintained. The room decor, from the pictures on the wall to the art and reading material is first rate. The beds are great; I always sleep well and wake up without any aches. There are so many pillows on the bed, you have no problem combining them for any level of comfort you need. One of my favorite things about the rooms is the amount of storage. There is plenty of closet and cabinet space. Since I'm going to be there a week, I unpack as soon as I arrive and stow away my luggage in the closets. I also stow away food and beverages as I buy them and use them. Everything looks so clean and neat it makes me feel like I am in a luxury apartment. I forget about the day-to-day needs of being at home because I'm not seeing laundry, mail, kid and husband stuff, etc. The only minor issue I had during this trip, which was a repeat from the last trip, is that I had to call two or three days out of seven to get USA Today instead of the local paper, even though I put it in my profile when I checked in. The bathroom, as many others have commented, is huge. The tub is deep and large, the double sinks and storage are great, and the separated shower and commode areas add to the luxurious feel of the room. The TV in the mirror is great while getting dressed and ready for a day of gambling and playing. The room staff did a great job every day; an improvement from my last visit when they forgot to empty the kitchen area trash a few times and didn't always clean the wine or drink glasses. Lastly, I feel like I have to comment on the location off the strip and subsequent walking people seem to mention a lot in these reviews. I have been going to Vegas once a year for over 10 years to meet my four sisters. We have sometimes all stayed at the same hotel and sometimes split up among two hotels. In that time, we have sometimes rented a car and more often did not. There is always construction going on in Vegas, especially around the strip. We've walked among street scaffolding almost every year, and often walk from one end of the strip to the other, in total, during our stay. The walk from the strip to the Trump Hotel is nothing. In fact, with the exception of a short span where there is no sidewalk, it's the least congested walk you will have in Vegas. I actually look forward to making the turn off the strip toward the Trump Hotel, because I know there won't be crowds. It's all relative; I didn't measure it, but I feel certain it takes longer to walk from the Fashion Show Mall to Harrah's than from the Fashion Show Mall to the Trump Hotel. And it will be a less congested walk to the hotel. So if you come to Vegas and do it without walking, you must be wasting a lot of time in cabs, cars, buses, etc. The Trump Hotel has two shuttles which run regularly, and can be used late at night if it makes you feel more secure. But for me, the walk is nothing. As I walk toward the hotel, I look forward to entering it and not hearing crying children, slot machines, or crowds. It's tranquil and adds to the feeling of relaxation after a day of lights, sounds, and the craziness that is Las Vegas. Additionally, the hotel is smoke free and smells wonderful. The smell is imbedded in my memory as a positive one that brings a feeling of calm to me. I can't wait for our next trip and my next opportunity to stay at the Trump Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT!”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterDutch
Reviews.Content: The Trump International Hotel Las Vegas is the best hotel I ever visited. Great room, great views, great service, great amenities, great everything. Bathtub is spacious enough to fit several people. How great is it to look television fitted within the mirror in the bathroom from the bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “5* relaxation in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Linzalin
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect for our holiday in Vegas. The hotel is Valet only but the staff are friendly and there is usually a 5 minute wait. We thought the hotel and rooms were fantastic. The luxurious theme throughout the hotel was smart and kept very clean. Our room was a standard room (nonstrip view) and was perfect. Unless you get a fantastic deal, this was more than adequate for a couple. It was a quieter hotel as there is no casino but its a nice getaway from all the strip mayhem. A short walk 2 minutes and your on the strip but a the very end. The hotel provide shuttle buses but we enjoyed walking. We split the stay by staying two nights at Caesars but it was terrible! The themed hotels are run down unless they are new or newly renovated. Hotel staff are smart and professional. The check in staff were lovely and helped us with a few enquiries. I would definately return and would look for Trump hotels for other holidays.

Reviews.Title: “We like it very much!”
Reviews.Author: HapyyJoy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best hotel I have stay. It is not first time I stay at 5 start hotel, but I really like this one. The room size is big, and with full kitchen , big bath room (one shower room and one message bathtub) . I like the bed very much! Not too soft. The best thing of this hotel is really nice service! I call them at 8:30 AM and ask to when to check in, and they said you can check in now, and we went there, no waiting line to check in. Since I have sleep problem, I told them and they give us a room with strip view and very high lever for free! They have very cool shuttle service to Wynn and another casino. When we want to check out but we still need time, they offer us two more hour for free.Cons: This hotel has $19.99 resort fee per day, with valet parking and internet and free bottle water.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Place”
Reviews.Author: ges757
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Trump Hotel. We have visited LV many times and wanted to stay somewhere different than we usually stay (south strip). We were very pleased with our accomodations. The room was huge! It was more than adequate for the 2 of us. The bed was very comfortable as comfortable as any other hotel I have stayed at. I do not understand a previous review stating otherwise. The bathroom was very clean and also large. All of the staff were very friendly. From checkin to cafe staff everyone was very cheerful and helpful. We did not eat at the dining room so we cannot rate it.. The pool area was brite and very sunny our entire stay. Also very hot but this is Vegas in June. The only complaint we have is that a certain client next to our room continued to smoke even when we complained to management. The antiroom reeked every day and night of cigarette smoke as we were entering or leaving our room. Yes, the rest of Vegas smokes but when we booked a non smoking hotel, we thought that was what we were getting. We did complain but some people do whatever they want regardless of the rules. We did not let it affect our fun and we would stay here again. Although the hotel is a few steps away from the strip, we did not think it was that far. After all exercise is a good thing when you tend to drink and eat out. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and highly recommend the Trump Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfecrt trıp and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: doğaduru
Reviews.Content: Very very frıendly stuff,comfortable and safely rooms specıally lovely valet servıce...prıce ıs so good

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel -- but not convenient for Strip”
Reviews.Author: sheilaDallas
Reviews.Content: Our room was great. One room suite had quality linens, a well appointed bathroom and enough equipment in the kitchen area to make tea, coffee and snacks. The restaurant (prix fixe) was great value and nicely prepared and presented. The pool area disappointed--very boring concrete though the snack bar was very handy. Our room rate was a special and good value but the resort fee doesn't seem to get you much--a newspaper? Because the hubby and I do different things during the day--this hotel didn't work too well for us logistically. Shuttle is every half hour there is more frequent service to the Wynn which is the closest casino. Sounds great-- but mini buses are tiny and there were always more people than seats --and the hotel was not busy at this time at all and so I can't imagine what it's like when things are busy. All in all a well appointed, comfortable hotel but the access issue was a problem for us. I was not comfortable walking the 3 blocks up a deserted street (mall is an option until it shuts at 9-or 10 pm.) by myself at night. Valet was reasonably efficient but who wants to take a car onto the strip 1 0r 2 times a day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Classy, Quiet, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: AndreaD068
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Our suite was absolutely beautiful, one of the nicest we've stayed in. Beautifully appointed and equipped. Gorgeous kitchen/dining/living/bathrooms. Everything so nice. Doors are behind another set of doors so you don't hear any slamming doors. All staff absolutely excellent, a step above any other hotel. No casino here, there is a shuttle to the casino hotels regularly (free). The lack of casino makes it smoke free and quiet. Beautiful pool areas. Enjoyable dining. Right across the street from the FAshion show mall. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Quite”
Reviews.Author: Anasicat
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days in Las Vegas and choose the Trump for various reasons. One - kitchennette, Two - sofa sleeper... my son was with us. The hotel was extremely nice but the bed was not what I expected for a hotel of this caliber. I travel a lot and the bed was not as comfortable as the "Hampton Inn". The sofa sleeper was worst. My son actually slept on it one day only. He choose to just sleep on the sofa and did not want to move to another room because we had a spectacular view of the strip. The hotel's staff was excellent, friendly and accomondating.. Because the Trump is a little off the strip there are two shuttles that take you to the strip with stops at the Wynn or Caesars Palace. This is a plus, but during the week they don't run very late (10PM & 11PM) and since things don't really get started in Vegas until sunset, this can really dampen your plans if you want to use the shuttle and not take a taxi. Most shows start at 9-10PM so you will be taking a taxi back to the hotel often. On the weekend they run until 12MN & 2AM. A little better, but not great for a 24 hour town. TIP - If you stay at the Trump, learn to ride the deuce ( public bus) to the Trump shuttle stops or walk through the mall across the street. It will save you a lot of time. I will not stay here again, because for the money I know I can get convenience and better sleep.. IF the beds were better this hotel would get a better rating..

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, lobby, bedrooms and bathrooms--service needs some help.”
Reviews.Author: laabis
Reviews.Content: My headline says it all. The public rooms are beautiful. We loved our bedroom with beautiful furnishings, lovely beds, great pillows and sheets and stunning bathrooms. Our suite had two bathrooms with perfect bathtubs and showers. The service was friendly and professional. It's just that we had a few glitches. I don't want to make a big deal of this because it was a friendly place. It isn't like some hotels where the service is unfriendly and downright bad. Our problems were that the our bedroom didn't get a cleanup the first day until we called and they couldn't find our car. Both problems were rectified. I get the impression that these glitches will get solved as it seems that the management of the hotel is competent.

Reviews.Title: “bad reputation in the city”
Reviews.Author: bambue
Reviews.Content: when we checked in, they told us that they have no strip view rooms available even we had booked two months ago. they actually tried to sell us a larger room with no view by an extra charge! how is that? we had to complain several times until they gave us the strip view rooms (there were still plenty available)... Beds are poor, she shift down on the head's side of the bad. the beds are shorter than the frame. the rooms are large and nice. it's also not at the strip (what you can see an the map as well but just to mention). staff is quite rude and unfriendly (specially the check in clerk. strip view you can forget. they charge extra money but you see nothing. it's fully behind the treasury island. The first room we got smelled strongly like smoke. hotel has a bad reputation in Las Vegas. Is known as arrogant and rude staff!! funny, this was also our impression we got of the hotel. finally, you only can do valet parking and always have to wait. if you're waiting for a taxi being organized, it could happen that they just to skip you because there's a other customer behind you they like more. if you finally try to catch your own taxi (after seeing two leaving empty), these odd hotel guys start to tell you off. how cheeky! I tell you... we took our own cab and I told this guy to show more respect. we have several gold cards too but we probably do not wave them around all the time...! this hotel should think about this. Only go there if you get a special rate. it’s far away from the strip and really offers a nice room only. venetian is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Best hidden secret in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sheshe90
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an oasis in the madness that is Vegas. Everything about are stay was top class. The rooms are luxurious and the beds to die for. All of the staff were excellent and obviously hand picked to work in this superb hotel. We had dinner in the Trump restaurant which again was top class. I would love to return to this hotel. "Well done to all the staff for making our stay so memorial.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Sin City..... We will be back and we will stay at Trump everytime!”
Reviews.Author: acmaxwell
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 days at Trump Las Vegas and it was everything I expect a 5 star hotel to be. From the friendly staff, to the relaxing, clean rooms, to the sophisticated decor. My trip was origionally for a conference, but I ended having some girlfriends fly out to finish the week with a girls weekend get-a-way. We loved it and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel away from the "Madness of the Strip "”
Reviews.Author: wroughtironron
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are quality - huge jacuzzi baths, twin wash hand basins, large seperate shower and nice soaps etc. The beds are superb and although I have difficulty finding hotels with soft pillows - this one provides them. One tip for Donald - replace your in-room coffee sachet supplier - the sachets were disappointingly weak ! Our room was pretty enormous and had a large settee plus two lounge chairs as well as a work desk. There is a problem with a train line on the mountain view side of the hotel - it gives out several long noisy horn blasts at various times of the day including around 4-00am -if you're a light sleeper, ask for a room on the strip side. Wi-fi is included in the resort fee, along with valet parking, newspaper and bottled water, so we didn't feel like we were being robbed. In the three years since I was last in Vegas, it was noticeable how many beggars/vagrants/panhandlers appear to have taken up residency along the Strip -there are hundreds of them,- it gets rather wearing to be accosted every few yards and it does detract from the enjoyment of the city. The Hotel staff were all lovely, and we wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Some good and bad; suprised no response from customer service”
Reviews.Author: NatAtl
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay and with the exception of a single staff member the employees were really wonderful to us. Even in that one case they were very nice, they just did not follow through on what they had said they would do and it was a minor thing (we needed a few more hangers and some bowls for cereal). The rooms are plenty big, though you can find bigger. There is not anything right there really but the mall, however it is a easy, quick walk to the strip. Parking only valet and is free though we always tipped the valet. The view is nice in both directions. The reports of the train with the horn blasting that passes on the non-strip side are also true. I am a heavy sleeper so it did not bother me much, but my wife was awoken by it. However my major issue is my concern about some itchy spots I noticed a few days into the stay. I did not think much about it but more appeared. I showed them to a dermatologist friend who thought they might well be bed bugs. I say most likely of course because I did not see any actual bed bugs or I would have let someone know while we were there. Another member of our party in a different room developed a similar thing. I sent an e-mail to customer service about 2 weeks ago, not to threaten or ask for anything, but to let them know they might have a problem. The most suprising thing to me was that I have recieved no reply at all.

Reviews.Title: “We come to Vegas about 4x a year - this WILL be our go-to hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: rjung10
Reviews.Content: I am so ecstatic about the Trump Int'l in Las Vegas that I am writing this review sitting on their bed, staring out at the Strip, using their wifi. I couldn't wait until I got home, I had to bear the good news now. The focus of my excitement lies mostly in the room quality and the service. The Room: It is above average for a Las Vegas 5 Start "Hotel" Room because it is a Studio Suite. Perhaps the Venetian is larger, but this place shouldn't feel like little brother in terms of size. The cleanliness and warmth of the room is great. The bed is comfortable (we just took a really long nap - longer than my normal nighttime sleep). The furniture and decor is perfect. It is not over-the-top and gaudy as one would expect if all one did was watch Trump's "The Apprentice" and based our judgement of the man on that. It is just right. Opulent but not stiff is how I would call it. I did find a chocolate chip morsel with my barefoot - for a moment I thought it was dog poo - and I told my wife that I was going to get us their best room for free because I just stepped in it - but after smelling it (why I took that chance I don't know) and knowing it was just chocolate, I decided not to tell management about it. The best part of the room was the bathroom though - the marble bathroom. Not that we did this, but I think 5 ppl can fit in the shower and 3 in the hot tub (w/jets). It was that feeling you get when you're getting ready to go out for the night - you feel like a million bucks in this bathroom. Overall, the room was great. If it was in the heart of the strip, I could see them justifiably charging 3x what they charge per night. The service is 5 star all the way. They say Mr. ____ everytime they see me. They are quick to serve us because we are their guests. You feel important here; they achieve this without being stuffy. I wish I remembered the name of the check-in desk lady who was VERY professional and warm. All of the valet guys were great. The door man didn't miss a beat. I called at 1pm to ask for a later check out (check out was originally planned for 4pm!!!). The phone operator put me on hold, talked to the manager and gave us 5pm. This is a full 5 hours LATER than what any other hotel on the strip would have done. This alone makes this place the best. We left our two young kids at home (not by themselves, of course). But we could easily have been comfortable with them here because there is no smoking here, no gambling here and here is what they do have: rooms with FULLY appointed kitchenettes - perfect for kids. My wife's favorite part - the front door of the hotel is about a 25second walk from the front door of Nordstrom - she about died when she saw that. Thank you Trump for making our wedding anniversary (4th) so wonderful. Management, if you're reading this, find out who was helping us and give them all raises because they treated us (small fish) like kings and queens.

Reviews.Title: “Idea place for shoppers”
Reviews.Author: SybilHongKong
Reviews.Content: Comparing to all the other establishments on the Strip and mind you most haven't got great reviews, this was my first choice. I'd say it's good value for money because it's a suite and the hotel is only 3 years old. However, after been walking up and down the Strip for a whole day, I wish I had picked somewhere 'central' like Paris (much cheaper than Trump I think) or a new hotel called Cosmopolitan. Check-in/out was efficient, staff members were helpful. Room service ....what is it?? Nothing to write home about. I have tasted the yukkiest buffalo wings in my life! We had a room with a city view on a high floor. The bed is something worth mentioning.....It's sooo comfortable and we had good sleep there. The swimming pool was nice but it would have been even nicer if they didn't charge US$50 for the cabana. You can imagine that's the reason why they aren't used. Most of the patrons were young party-goers but generally they behaved themselves. If you love shopping, this is the place to be in as the mega mall is just few steps across the road. I think it's worth 3.5 stars but I won't give it 4.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: SharonandRoss
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at Trump over the recent long weekend and although very busy, there was still plenty of room to move around and relax. Our room , 3400 , was outstanding and just what we needed to end our week at Vegas. Loved the shuttle bus to and from the strip with very helpful drivers to help with our questions. All the staff were of great assistance and would always greet you with a smile and a hello. Will return next time for longer as this is a fantastic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Amazing, AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: KarenLN75
Reviews.Content: Transferred here from the Bellagio after 3 nights enduring the latter. What an instant uplift walking into the calm, cool, airy, stylish lobby of the Trump after leaving the over-crowded, gaudy, noisy lobby at the Bellagio. We were upgraded to a corner suite on the 42nd floor and I must say, it was one of the most incredible hotel rooms I have ever seen (and I am a self-confessed Luxury Hotel Addict). It was vast, immaculate, stylish - and the marble bathroom with jacuzzi bath overlooking The Strip was just to die for. The bed was firm underneath but had thick mattress covers that made you feel so cosy and snug; could barely leave it each day. The pool area is the real coup of this hotel - coming from the Bellagio (over-looked by buildings on all sides; rows and rows of sun beds) it was a breath of fresh air. Since the Trump is a little way out of the main Strip (absolutely no problem; the free shuttle gets you into the centre of the madness in 10 mins maximum), and the pool is up on (I believe) the 10th floor, you are simply not over-looked at all. There are palm trees lining the wall, music played at a non-intrusive level, and the staff are absolutely great. Absolutely loved this hotel. Myself, my other half, and another couple with whom we had gone to Vegas with, simply did not want to leave the Trump. I would happily return to Vegas simply to stay there. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms great value. Loved the strip view.”
Reviews.Author: skyfriendbrighton
Reviews.Content: We were in a strip view on th 48th floor - the view is great and really helps to orient yourself in Vegas. The room was spotlessly clean and well appointed and decorated. Very spacious, bathroom huge with enormous tub. There is a SubZero refrigerator, coffee machine and 2 ring hob burner too. Each room has a queen size sofa bed - but it took 3 requests before we could get it made up. Lobby area impressive. Only valet parking, but there is elf aprking at the mall opposite which is 30 yards away. Small but trendy pool area. Smallish gym next to it. Check in/out friendly and quick. Mandatory resort fee includes valet and internet. Internet reliable and fast. Free shuttle to Wynn (5 mins walk anyway) and hourly to Caesars. Noise from trains tooting is audible but did not bother us. Property non-gaming and non-smoking which for us were huge advantages. Did not try food and beverage services. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “opulent!!”
Reviews.Author: dawnj27
Reviews.Content: From being greeted by valet staff on arrival through to departure could not fault the friendly and professional staff. Suite was fantastic, pool, breakfast, courtesy bus all great. Vegas an amazing place loved every minute of our stay, price very reasonable given the standard of facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: dvhtbm
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel since they allow dogs and we wanted to be near the strip. Sorry Donald. This hotel is a major disappointment. The lobby is disorganized. The room had no soap. We had to ask for it. The carpeting was worn and stained in the room and in the elevators. The mattress was old and kind of creaky. The furniture is getting worn and really needs replacement. This is NOT a five star hotel. We will Never stay again. I think we will go back to the Palazzo and leave the dog at home.

Reviews.Title: “Never, ever again!”
Reviews.Author: Canteena
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Trump Hotel Sunday night. Staff was terrible. The doorman didn’t acknowledge me. No bellhop offered to help us with our bags. We had to hunt down the Valet driver. I gave my debit card for incidentals and they put a $600.00 hold on my account. They said $100.00 a day per person. The housekeeping light was stuck on even before our arrival. The front entry light bulb was out in our room. The scale in the bathroom was broken. There was a tampon wrapper on the bathroom floor and body hair on the bed comforter. We were missing our robes – and we were afraid the hotel would charge us for them. You are charged a daily resort fee, but according to the hotel services book in our room, it would cost us an additional $22.00 to use the pool. What a scam this place was. I gave a written list to the girl at the check out desk when we departed a day early. She didn’t even apologize. A brighter note, the hotel maids were very concerned about the housekeeping light. They continued to ask us if we needed help or services. I did think that was nice. The hotel did have the following amenities Business center – for additional charge Fitness Center - for additional charge Swimming Pool - for additional charge

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: TrumpLasVegasNV
Reviews.Content: Yet another fantastic stay in Trump, Las Vegas, NV. Donald really has got his hotel set up spot on! Can't wait to return next year for one of our annual holidays. Room upgraded, early check-in, late check-out. Fantastic dining, valet parking, concierge. Amazing in every respect of the word.

Reviews.Title: “well looked after, unobtrusive, quiet stay. just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: amunda7
Reviews.Content: It was 16 years since we'd been to Vegas and I must admit I was pretty horrified driving down the strip - especially after a cramped 10+ hours in Virgin's 31" pitch x 18" wide seats in a packed economy section - everything looked so tacky and overbuilt but what a relief to get to the Trump and feel immediately looked after. we were booked in for 15 nights and settled in pretty quickly. As long as you got there before 10 the pool was just busy but then it would fill up. Staff were always polite and helpful. Recommend the buffet breakfast, not too much but just right for us. Compared to UK American TV is dreadful with all the ads and there was no alternative to watch if you didn't rent a movie. If I was speaking to Doanld Trump I would suggest a library type area with guests' donated books and a 'clubby' atmosphere for guests to retire to. Thanks to all the staff

Reviews.Title: “The best service, gorgeous rooms, and everything and more you could expect from a hotel”
Reviews.Author: joyreneehauben
Reviews.Content: We just wrapped up a three night stay in this hotel. 6 girls, friends from all over the country catching up and in need of a break from busy lives. We had a 2 bedroom penthouse and a 1 bedroom penthouse that were situated side by side. Melissa in guest services worked dilligently to get this room situation and was the definition of professionalism and warmth. Valet was amazing, prompt and extremely helpful with transportation arrangements. Sergio was so warm and helpful, and went out of his way on several occasions when arriving guests had delays at the airport. Our bellman was so helpful, placing each item exactly where we desired in closets, kitchens, rooms and bathrooms. He then showed us how to operate every individual feature of the room. Immediately activated the ice maker in the sub-zero fridge and walked us through the sound system and IPOD hook up so we could listen to our favorite songs through the stereo as we got ready. The staff at the pool was beyond helpful and fantastic. They gladly set up an area for us to gather and relax in the sun and carefully arranged umbrellas to provide relief from the heat. The wait staff was dilligent in making sure we had full glasses and an ample supply of free bottled water. The spa was exceptional and I had one of the best massages ever! I have stayed at countless hotels and have NEVER experienced customer service of this magnitude. My guests and I were treated like royalty, and there was always a smile from everyone working there. Housekeeping was top notch, room service was perfect. In a heartbeat I would stay here again! This hotel could serve as the example to all others as to how to treat guests. Thank you expecially to Cory and Sergio in Valet, Melissa in guest services and Ryan our bellman for making this a trip of a lifetime. The general manager at this hotel can rest assured that his staff is doing an impeccable job, and Mr. Trump is fortunate to have his hotel in such capable hands. Not one single complaint, and my only regret is that we eventually had to return to every day life! Thank you all for such an amazing, warm and relaxing weekend and for doing your job with such enthusiasm and kindness. I will be telling everyone to stay here. This hotel sets the bar and no others come close to the standard of customer service, cleanliness, and comfort they provide. I can only say that my expectations were met and surpassed and I can't thank you enough!!! Joy Hauben

Reviews.Title: “Trump Hotel in Vegas was awesome.”
Reviews.Author: Alison2107
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Trump Hotel in Las Vegas and was so happy with the whole package. Staff were friendly, rooms and views were amazing, bathrooms gorgeous and beds sooooo comfy. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who is heading to Vegas, it's slightly off the strip but there are shuttles to the strip and it has the added bonus of no casino or nightclub in the hotel so when you want to sleep there is no noise like some of the hotels on the strip. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diana_maxsouth
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Las Vegas and we stayed at The Trump in Las Vegas. What a great hotel that was. Very very secure. Clean Environment unlike other hotels ih The Strip with casinos full of smoke. In additon we felt very very welcome by their staff and they are very service oriented always attentive of our presence and needs. Coming to the hotel felt just like coming home a very good bed and clean environment all around the place. We will surely stay there again. Thank You Paul & Diana Chiavetta

Reviews.Title: “Watch our for hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: MattieG75
Reviews.Content: The location is set off the Vegas strip slightly, but it's right behind a fashion mall. There are a lot of hidden taxes and fees that are not brought to your attention until you check in. Very nice complex though. There is no casino in the lobby, it's just a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if you want off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Sandinmyveins
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay, the room was large but lacked attention to detail (for example, clear glass doors in the bathroom were excessive and intrusive and downright dangerous in low light). Service was great as expected. Pool was nice, a bit loud, but its Vegas. Room service food was good, not great. Location was great, just a short walk or shuttle ride to the strip. Overall I would stay for business, but look for other deals if wanted 5 star luxury. Warning: I did come across a used needle in the lobby bathroom - but this is not specific to the Trump, and unfortunately not Vegas. Vegas is and should be for adults looking to party, the sight of kids in strollers may be good for business / image but with an underlying stash of used needles and seediness, please leave the kids at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: HAeBA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in in Trump for 5 days in June. Hotel was all we expected, classy, comfortable, great location and price was very reasonable. It is just off the Strip which makes it quieter and not so busy like the ones on the Strip. Staff was very helpful, except very rude concierge. I would recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to have comfort and class with easy accessible all attractions on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Trump has our vote!”
Reviews.Author: Julie_laing
Reviews.Content: 5 star experience all the way around! We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite upon arrival. The view was great and thr room was AWESOME!!!!! We LOVED the breakfast buffet! The food in general was excellent and reasonably priced. We liked that the hotel was non-smoking and didn't have a casino. The walk to the Strip was very do-able...even enjoyable! The poolside service was great too and the fitness center was top notch for a hotel. We would definitely stay here again and even vote for Trump if he runs for president because his hotel ROCKED!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room, lovely hotel, good location, clean”
Reviews.Author: daisykitten
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and really enjoyed it, the reception area is stunning, the rooms are massive and you have a juzzi tub. The bed was really comfy and the veiw to the strip was fab. Only one moan was we had a package delivered to the hotel and they charged us for receiving it!! You have to pay the resort fee, which I think is norm for all the big hotels. Deft recommend staying here though :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely! Clean, big rooms, nice staff, quieter than the casino hotels.”
Reviews.Author: tripmyadvice
Reviews.Content: I was impressed! I wasn't sure when we booked it if it was in a good enough location, but it's a 1 min walk to the main strip, and it's actually nice to get away from the Vegas hustle and bustle. I also liked there is no casino - made the hotel a bit quiter and classier i think! Lovely reception and friendly staff. Free shuttle bus to ceasars palace was fab - saved walking or getting taxis. Think they should communicate this more on their site. Pool area was really nice. Towels given to you as you go. Breakfast really good, and pool lunches are fab. Didnt have dinner there but bet that would have been nice too. Roooms really big and clean. Has everything in it - even a little kitchen and i think we were in a standard room. Overall really impressed. Alot nicer than some of the other main hotels we went to! We had friends in the mandalay bay and the bellagio and there rooms weren't any nicer. They must have paid extra for the location and having the casino in their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandTravels
Reviews.Content: The Trump Hotel, while slightly behind the Strip, was still a great choice. In just a block or so, you come into the Fashion Place Mall, which you can cut through to emerge next to Treasure Island. From there, you can go from place to place with brief detours outside. The hotel also had a shuttle service to the Wynn. We stayed in the studio, and I found our room to be extremely quiet and comfortable. We slept great. It had a lot of eclectic touches in decor, such as art books and a set of coasters that looked like a tic tac toe game. The kitchen area also had a lot of amenities that would be great for a longer stay, such as a number of different types of glasses, utensils and appliances. The bathroom had an enormous bathtub and shower, and there were two very plush bathrobes for us. The valet situation downstairs was very cramped as we came into the hotel, but the wait to retrieve the car can easily be avoided by calling down just before you intend to leave. They gladly accepted our requests by phone, and the car was waiting. One thing that I will say is that no assistance was really forthcoming with loading or unloading our baggage; I would have expected it at a five-star hotel. The hotel required a $19.99 resort fee, which, while annoying, appears to be standard among Vegas hotels. The fee allowed access to the gym and pool and included bottled water, internet, and valet parking. The pool looked nice enough, but on a 95 degree day with the sun beating down, there was not one spot of shade to be found. They said that the umbrellas were not out because of wind, but it really was not windy. The hotel does not include a casino, which we viewed as a plus because of the lack of smoke and noise. Some of the people noted railroad noise as an issue--- I did hear this a couple of times, but it did not disturb my sleep. I imagine there are several hotels in the area where it must be audible. The rooms have a small atrium between two rooms before leading out to the hallway, which I think helped eliminate any noise from fellow guests. Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great getaway”
Reviews.Author: dummie1
Reviews.Content: everything we read positive was true, truly courteous, accommodating. got in at 830am and we were sent right up to our suite how nice is that lots of hotels will make you wait even though they have rooms open. what a treat no smoking no casino but handy to everywhere. will return for sure beds to die for

Reviews.Title: “NO CASINO”
Reviews.Author: anaya
Reviews.Content: We went to the Trump because he had no casino.Much quieter and peaceful! Located at the end of the srtip so we had to walk to visit. Very nice hotel. Only one complain;the bed's matress started to be a little bit tired.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Excellent service. Comfy bed. No smoke.”
Reviews.Author: Beth040508
Reviews.Content: We chose the Trump as it had no casino. We do not smoke so we wanted to stay someplace with no smoking, no perfumey smells to try to cover up smoke, no noisy casino, comfy beds, nice jacuzzi tub, nice view of the city, a little kitchen, good service, a good price and within walking distance of the strip. We found all of this at this hotel. I would recommend it and if I ever go to Las Vegas again, I would stay here again. We were on the 59th floor, but you could still hear the sirens from the emergency vehicles and you could still hear the train horn blowing. However, being up that high, the noise was minimal and I was so tired from having a great time and doing so much walking, it did not bother me and I am a pretty light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Spacious and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMuppet
Reviews.Content: We had a Studio Suite and loved it. Just make sure you get a room away from the railroad tracks if you want a quiet room. The 8 and 9 numbered rooms are on the end of the hotel facing Las Vegas Blvd. with views of the Wynn and Encore. The 23 and 24 numbered rooms face Industrial Road and are very, very close to the train tracks and noisy. The rooms are big, with a small gourmet kitchen, small cooktop, fridge, microwave, toaster, blender and coffee maker. The bed/pillows were probably the most comfortable we've slept on in ages and we had a terrific night's sleep. We didn't hear anyone next door or down the corridor because of the good soundproofing. There are double entry doors into your room to minimize noise. A really nice room with lots of artwork on the walls and in the floor to ceiling cabinets lining one wall. Bathroom was huge, all marble with huge jacuzzi tub, separate glass enclosed shower and glass enclosed toilet. Very nice non-casino hotel so no walking through acres of slot machines with your luggage to get to the reception desk. Very relaxing place. Only drawback was it was valet parking only but you can get creative and park across the street in the Fashion Mall during the day. We'd stayed at the Four Seasons last August and while that was more palatial in its public areas the Trump has bigger rooms and more amenities with the kitchen - even if you never use it. Not great views of the Strip but plenty of room to spread out and relax in the Studio Suite. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We'll definitely come back to the Trump.

Reviews.Title: “excellent...”
Reviews.Author: crazyserb
Reviews.Content: From day first, until the end, everything was spot on.Fast check in, and valet boys, room huge and clean with excellent strip view,quiet during the night, super fast internet...No problems, at all...Across the street is huge shopping mall, and couple hundreds meters away, best burgers in town...So, if you want, good, not overpriced, place to stay in Vegas, without cigarette smell all around, go straight there...Excellent job, Mr.Trump...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: monster77
Reviews.Content: We've been to Trump International in October 2010. The Hotel, the staff, the room everything was perfect, quit and clean. Staff were super-friendly. The Strip is not that close to walk but it takes just some minutes by taxi to get there. We would recommend Trump International and hope to get back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: joscam
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at Trump Las Vegas. Had a strip view room and paid a small amount to upgrade to the 1 bedroom. The room was nice but we had lots of trouble with housekeeping. The room was not cleaned properly even when we first checked in. They kept removing the glasses from the kitchen until we had none and then it took 5 calls and 1.5 hours to get them to return some glasses to the room. The friends we travelled with also had a bottle of scotch stolen from there room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome rooms and quiet. Not party-central”
Reviews.Author: quesochica
Reviews.Content: Awesome: This room was so nice and I got a great deal on it. Huuuge. Seating area with coach and chairs, gigantic bathroom with a soaking tub and separate shower. Nice kitchenette space. The front desk was nice enough to upgrade us to a strip view. The pool area was small-ish by some Vegas standards but was very nice. It has all-day sun which is not a guarantee at other properties. The service was fine- I had a mis-charge at the pool bar but the front desk took care of it. Less awesome: They don't offer self-park. The valet is included in the resort fee. But the valet area gets really jammed up with cars and taxis- so be prepared to be patient. They are one block off-strip, but in Las Vegas, one block is really 100 miles. So be prepared to hike over to the Venetian/Wynn or take their complimentary shuttle. The nut of it: If you want party-central, go to the Mirage. If you want a quieter place, an opportunity to take care of your own breakfast and a great room, go to the Trump.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Alisarvh
Reviews.Content: I have never written a negative hotel review in my life but my recent experience at the Trump hotel Las Vegas was hands down the absolute worst hotel experience I've ever had. We checked in late Friday night after driving from Southern California. Upon arrival we received great service and the check in was quick. However, once I returned later that night, I found that I was locked out of my room. I returned to the front desk and was told I was locked out because we had brought our dogs. I said I posted that I wanted a dog room on my Expedia reservations as I had on prior occasions (we always travel with our two small well-behaved dogs). I asked to speak to a manager as locking patrons out of their room in the middle of the night is completely unacceptable. Apparently the extremely rude front desk associate was the manager. I told the management that I wanted to get back into my room but she literally would not reactivate my key. I was upset so walked out of the hotel to call my brother/lawyer who had just dropped me off to come help me get into my room because she wouldn't allow me in. Needless to say, after about 45 minutes of negotiating at 5 in the morning, we were finally begrudgingly allowed back in.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it- would definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: sugarrain73
Reviews.Content: Amazing lobby, friendly and helpful check-in staff. Loved the room; clean, comfortable and massive. The bathroom was amazing, we loved the TV in the mirror! Our room was overlooking the strip which was such a surreal view when you arrive after a ten hour flight and eight ours behind your natural time zone! Could have sat and looked at it for hours. We were woken by the train noise from outside once on the first night but that was it. We used the free shuttle to the Wynn in the evening- the walk to it is only five minutes but seemed a rather lonely stretch of road after dark. The Stripburger was great for a cheap dinner one night and we enjoyed the Wynn buffet. Overall we loved it here and would stay here again if we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “FIve Start Experience for Bargain Price”
Reviews.Author: RoadieNZ
Reviews.Content: A near faultless performance by the Trump Hotel. Opulent surroundings and excellent service. Double lobby means there is no noise from within the hotel so you can sleep in till midday if you like. My partner went looking for a firm pillow but to no avail despite some reasonable efforts from staff. Room service provided the best burger and fries ever. And did so at 2am - check out the Trump Burger. A few minutes walk from the strip but not a big deal best to go straght into Fashion Show Mall directly across the road and walk through to the strip. Good gymnasium and real pool you can swim laps in if you like. The standard room included a real fridge so you can stock up from Walgreens so you don't blow cash on incidentals.

Reviews.Title: “feel like a film star”
Reviews.Author: colettefellows
Reviews.Content: My 14 year old daughter and I recently stayed in this hotel for a week, it was April and the weather was almost perfect in the 80s, there was one windy day but that didnt matter. Both my daughter and I loved it, we felt from the moment we arrived like we were multi millionaires!! This hotel is the definition of luxury. The hotel staff are beautiful and it felt like being on a film set, they are helpful and really seem like they are happy to be there, kind and friendly. The first night we decided to upgrade to a corner suite, this had amazing views and had more room than some apartments I have been to! But I wanted to have enough money for lots of shopping, (which is brilliant, I will take empty suitcases next time!) so we went back to original studio for the rest of the holiday. The studio was massive and had everything we needed so this was perfect, beautiful bathroom with jacuzzi bath, double sink, huge shower and pure comfort.....did not want to get out of the bed it was so lovely. The food in DJT is delicious and a fixed prix menu at $29 for 3 courses a real bargain, wine is a little more expensive but worth it. I really wanted this holiday to be perfect for me and my daughter. Its hard sometimes with teenagers to find something that interests parents and kids, but with Vegas and its shows, sharks, lions, rollercosters, shopping and great weather, plus the pure beautiful luxury of the Trump....its the perfect holiday. Few things to know..resort fees $22 a night, plus they take $100 dollars per night stay for incidentals but you get this back, in actual fact as we were staying for 7 nights she only took $50 per night off the card which was helpful. If I did it again I would get a cab to a supermarket to stock up on essentials for the room, as there is microwave, toaster, hob etc but on the strip I found nowhere to buy food, you can also order this from the hotel, but I don't know the cost. My daughter and I walked to the Welcome to Las Vegas sign which was a long walk as it is very far up the other end of the strip so a cab would have been a good idea for that essential photo opportunity. The books that you see everywhere, the little red ones for free are brilliant as you not only get a map of the strip but details of restaurants and how much they charge, as well as attractions, shows and other helpful information. I will return to Vegas one day soon, and the Trump is the only place I would want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and definetly 5 star”
Reviews.Author: SpringfieldTraveller
Reviews.Content: An excellent property and truly 5 star. You can start noticing it right when you walk in. The lobby is well lit and spacious. It is spanking clean everywhere. Greeted by very friendly staff who not only honored my request for high floor with a strip view but also personally escorted to the elevator. Now I booked via hotwire and although it was expensive by all means at around $250 on Hotwire, the folks at Trump appear to make sure it was worth it. I was only disappointed by the fact that it is NOT ON THE STRIP as advertised but rather by the side of the strip. They do provide a shuttle to the strip every half hour to a hour but it is never the same as being on the strip. The rooms are VERY spacious and well equipped with microwave, fridge and a nice seating area in the room. Bed is very comfy and the BR is truly luxurious and spacious, The Jacuzzi tub was quite a complementary addition. The hotel charges $20 resort fee which is always very annoying esp when you have already payed big bucks and it is not even on the strip and has all the standard amenities only. Anyway it covers wi-fi water coffee etc, Overall a fine place to stay and would not mind staying here again,

Reviews.Title: “hotel for shopping”
Reviews.Author: TaherAlbaghliJulian
Reviews.Content: I stay 5 days in this hotel, the hotel luxury, beautiful room and fantastic bath, we and my wife like the hottub. it very clean hotel nice for honey moon & near fashon mall. helpful stuff great for family i do not like it far 200 meter from strip street & i do not like rresturant menu. i mis the show in this hotel but it near Wynn hotel & offer shuttle to some casino. it near some shops & supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Mg3-11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are staying at the hotel at this moment for business and pleasure and I have to say this is the worst hotel in this star class in Las Vegas. We took along my daughter for the trip and decided to stay here being it is non smoking and no casino but we would have been better with the both then this! The room is worn! It has a funny odor, the couches need to be cleaned...it just is not in this star class. Obviously corners were cut in the building of this hotel/time share whatever the original intention of this property because the windows are HORRIBLE and why so few outlets. We have a one bedroom suite and my husband and I are fighting for outlets for 2 laptops and 2 cell phone chargers...ridiculous! Laying down last night I could hear clear as day the traffic and trains going by. Our room over looks the pool and at 8 am my room was filled with the music from the pool area.....seriously what star rating is this hotel. I called down to the front desk who should have said let me take of it but no she sends me to security who then sends me to engineering. I did go to the pool yesterday and I have to say that the girls assisting at the pool with chairs and the waitresses are great. However, again the pool is dirty! There were straws and crap on the bottom of the pool that were never cleaned up from the time I got there at 11 am until I left at 4:30. My husband comes every six weeks for business from Florida and I join him on this trip quite often and the star rating for this hotel is crazy! Do Not Waste Your Money On This Hotel, You WILL Be Disappoined!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but at the end of the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Alenka77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazing, the rooms and the service was perfect. The hotel is at the end of the strip and it's not a very pleasant walk ones you get closer to the end of the stip. Other than that everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel - fantastic rooms - cheap!!!”
Reviews.Author: DavoandLoz
Reviews.Content: Such a great hotel. The rooms are wonderful and extremely large. Bathroom is amazing. Staff were very friendly and there is a free shuttle to Caesars palace which was very handy. Location is a little off the main strip but the shuttle takes you back and forth when required. Fantastic price for what you get!!! I would stay there anytime when I visit Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: llup
Reviews.Content: We stayed. Recently and found it so so for the price. Plus they insisted I send a birth certificate before check in

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel--but cannot recommend for one simple, extremely annoying reason.”
Reviews.Author: pcclark59
Reviews.Content: My cell phone was blocked. I had a room to myself and it was very nice and had the biggest bathtub I've ever seen. But I was one of a group of about six who were in different hotels, and no one could ever get ahold of me once I retired to the hotel. It was very inefficient for me. Everyone else could talk. Why so difficult, Trump?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay...a few little problems which could so easily be solved!!”
Reviews.Author: mellieha1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trump for 8 days to celebrate my partner's 40th Birthday. I called ahead and told them that we were celebrating and they upgraded us to a strip view room. Check in was efficient and the lobby impressive and clean. We were on the 55th floor with a fantastic view which would rival most Vegas hotels. The room had a very comfy bed and large sitting area and kitchen and the bathroom was massive with a large shower and jetted tub...with a tv in the mirror. Now for a few minus points...after settling in we noticed that quite a few things were missing:- 1) bath robes & slippers 2) plates for the kitchen 3) hairdryer 4) remote for tv You may think that this is quite petty to mention but for a 5* hotel...I would expect this to be in my room without having to ask!! We called housekeeping and this was all rectified very quickly..so thumbs up for promptness!! The shower in the room was luke warm at best, however the bath was lovely. We did not use the shuttle as we walked everywhere...the hotel IS in a fantastic location...5 mins to the corner where Stripburger is opposite the Wynn. The pool area was nice with attentive staff and lifeguards. Pool beds were also comfy and pool water the right temp. When we arrived the large sofa type sunbeds were free..however during and after a fashion show event at the hotel...they started charging $50 a day to use them! Also at the fashion show we were asked 4 times for our room card...as if they did not trust that we were hotel guests...also at the fashion show, a lot of emphasis was on promoting the trump and adhering to the needs and whims of the non hotel guests, and the hotel guests were neglected quite alot and made to feel, in my opinion quite insignificant... Ok, some more positives.. 1) Breakfast was lovely - cooked to perfection 2) A special mention must be given to the staff on the front door...every time we approached the door they were there ready to open the door for you with a friendly greeting Just a few other minor details... 1) Yes you can hear the train noise but to be honest...it does not affect you sleeping 2) This hotel was lovely to come back to after the hustle and bustle of Vegas...it was lovely not having a casino, and hoards of holidaymakers coming to see the hotel..it was also lovely that it was non smoking! 3) The fitness center was also good and it was good that you could print your boarding cards off for free...our resort fee was included and for this we got high speed internet, water, and valet

Reviews.Title: “Trump hotel is the most comfortable and spacious hotel in town.”
Reviews.Author: fifimar
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff and the courtesy bus into town in great. Trump could do with a courtesy airport transfer bus too. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable beds and luxurious bathrooms which include a generous jacuzzi bath and wetroom/shower.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: coconut_000
Reviews.Content: Trump is a beautiful hotel. There is no casino in this hotel however, so you don't get the crazy crowds like everywhere else. The main lobby was fairly quiet even on the weekend. The DJT restaurant in the Trump was amazing! Our waiter Justin was fabulous...recommended a very good red wine called "Justin" as well! The service was great from check-in to check-out. You can really tell the difference in the mannerisms from the hotels on the main strip when it comes to customer service! Trump is a short walk away from the Wynn hotel & casino, so we walked there at night. Trump is also located right across the street from Nordstrom (the Fashion mall)...perfect for all your shopping needs! The rooms in Trump were fabulous...the bathrooms were amazing! Beds were very comfortable as well. The pool area seems to need a bit of updating (ie gardening and landscaping), but overall this hotel was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, shame about the train.”
Reviews.Author: Artyabi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Trump, very impressive rooms and view. The bathroom was massive with a spa bath, huge shower and a tv in the mirror. The staff were friendly and polite, the shuttle service to the Wynn was useful. The only down side was on two of he three nights a train woke us both us at 3 am. We saw this on trip advisor before we booked and thought we'd sleep through as we are normally heavy sleepers but not the case. Didn't spoil the stay but be aware if that kind of thing annoys you.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific non gambling hotel - smart as they come”
Reviews.Author: shergy
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeds Vegas standards for non gambling hotels - spot on décor with elegant and respectful staff, meticulous detail (typically trump). Good local - you can walk through the mall opposite right on through to the strip or get the free shuttle to the Wynn (Best breakfast buffet in Vegas). We had two rooms on 49th floor so nice and quiet and great views. 3pm checkout was Very useful. Pool small, smart & comfortable - no half hour treks to and from your room. Lifts always available and fast as you like. Beds are softest we've had in Vegas, just brilliant all round experience. Questioning my Hilton Diamond Membership now!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel and NOT far from the strip!”
Reviews.Author: timmne
Reviews.Content: You need to put anyone who says this hotel is too far from the strip, to the back of your mind - they must be Americans who are known for getting a cab to the next room. It's a ten minute walk MAXIMUM - but it's not down some stricken path; the whole walk, you have the Wynn & Encore in front of you, Riviera's lights to the left and Fashion Show Mall (and all the other south strip resorts) to the right. Besides, if you're too lazy to walk a few hundred yards, get a taxi with the money you saved by staying at the Trump! Anyway - about the hotel. I stayed there in April and October 2010. The reason for returning to the US in October, was the Trump itself - it was our final stop on a roadtrip across the west coast. The suites are incredible. We've stayed in a studio on the 53rd (ish) floor and a 1 bed on the 57th floor, both facing the strip. The view is probably the best you can get from a hotel in Vegas, especially at that height. I would recommend getting the slightly more expensive strip side rooms, for this reason alone. I spent what seemed like hours, just watching Vegas go about its business from those rooms! Check in is great, the cleanliness is brill and the kitchens in the rooms are just what you need. A word of warning though; don't try and cook anything smelly in the room unless you have some sort of air freshener. We cooked a fried breakfast on morning 3/4 and we could still smell the results on day 9! The valet parking can be a touch slow but the service is not a problem - it's just the time it takes to find your car I think! The fact that it's compulsory valet parking means there's no extra charge; it's paid for by the $15-20 daily resort fee. I will always return to this hotel in the future and it's made me quite keen to see other Trump hotels - not least the one in Scotland when it arrives!

Reviews.Title: “A Hit and Miss Experience”
Reviews.Author: bubbag054
Reviews.Content: Went from April 15-19 . Nice hotel , nice staff but I would not consider this a 5 star hotel! Lots of little things add up and put a damper on your stay. Great rooms awesome beds, but the train horn is REALLY LOUD!! and you can really hear the traffic even on the 55th floor. No one offered to up grade our room but the people who looked well off got their room up grade for free. We were there for 5 days no one cleaned our room , we had to run after staff for clean towels and we still had to pay the resort fee even though we never received our water or coffee and there was never room on the shuttle. The walk to the strip is not that bad though. If you can get a deal on this hotel do it ,if not pay the extra and stay at the Wynn or Encore .

Reviews.Title: “Good value - clean, large - Excellent Staff - location a bit far from strip - Quiet”
Reviews.Author: redmond_wa_traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is relatively inexpensive for the quality. Our room was extremely clean and large. The bathroom was oversized - marble - large shower stall - 2 person jacuzzi tub. We had a large King Bed - sitting area - flat panel TV and an amazing view for the 42 floor. This was the smallest unit - and cost $115 a night. I stayed here for an entire week for a conference. It was quiet with an oversized room - and I stayed in the smallest studio rooms. On our 2 previous trips to Vegas we stayed at the Venetian and the MGM Grand. This hotel doesn't have the attached casinos, clubs, nightlife -- so go here if you want a nice quiet room at a great price. The largeest drawback is the location. It's a bit of a walk to the strip. The sidewalk is under construction. Expect to utilze the shuttles to the shops at Caesars or take a taxi. The restaurant is very good. The staff was excellent. It's obvious that they are very well trained. If you need something ask - once they forgot to respond to bring extra shampoo - I called back and they went "over the top" bringing about a dozen extra. That's just one of many examples. My wife used the spa and was happy with their service. The pool is nice but not extraordinary. The DJT restaurant is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Trump did alright...but still can use some improvements”
Reviews.Author: sandman77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Trump the weekend of April 15th - 18th. The location is great because you are directly across the street from Fashion Show Mall. Some people were whining about the the walk to the strip, However, it really is a short walk to the strip from the hotel, and it is safe and well-lit also. I know Vegas pretty well, and I can show you a thousand more dangerous spots in Vegas. The hotel lobby was magnificent and the people they had working the desk and door were helpful and polite at all times. Our room was great and everything was clean. My only complaint about the rooms were the pillows. I still have a cramp in my neck!!! We had room service which was on time, and everything was good. We ate at the breakfast buffet on Saturday, and spent over $50.00. We had a couple of "ok" egg-white omlettes, but I don't think they were worth the price. The gym equipment was pretty good, so we got a good workout Saturday morning. My last thing to mention would be the valet area, because we did not use the pool at all. We always rent a car when we come to Vegas, because I have relatives there that I go and see. I have never had an issue with Valet or self parking in Vegas. I have been visiting Vegas for twenty-five years, and partying here for nearly fifteen of those years. I have NEVER seen a valet situation this screwed up ever in Vegas! Their drive thru area in my opinion is rather small, so you had taxis flying everywhere, and the valet guys did not seem to have any control over the situation. My wife and I were almost got hit a couple of times trying to get across the driveway to wait on our vehicle. There were cars parked too close together. That whole area is screaming for an overhaul. They also need to make self parking more obvious to those that just want to park their car and come inside. Also there were times the valet guys brought us our car, and they did not get the passenger side door for my wife, and I tipped them. I believe the valet area needs to be somewhere else, or they get this under control immediately. We got a pretty good deal on our stay, so I really can't complain too much. But if I don't get the same deal offered this summer, I will return to the Mandarin, or consider the Cosmo for our summer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Far and away my best Vegas hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: rcc_travels
Reviews.Content: vegas is just a 5-hour drive from where i live, so i try to make it out at least twice a year and i try to stay somewhere different every time just to sample everything. well, no more. i was blown away by trump international and plan to stay there from now on. i arrived early in the day and was greeted by a very friendly (and sharply dressed, might i add) valet attendant. i walked in and lobby smelled heavenly. the front desk agent (god i wish i had written down her name) was such a sweetheart and was kind enough to extend a complimentary upgrade to a one-bedroom suite on the 59th floor (yay!). then we got to the room and... wow. it's huge. it's beautiful. it's got everything (seriously, that bathroom is unbelievable!!!) and the view (i was on the city side, not strip view) was great (especially at night). throughout the stay, any time we had any interaction with the staff, they were beyond friendly and happy to help. and i felt the resort fee was fair-- the shuttles were prompt, the bottled water comes in veeeeery handy while in a dry, hot, boozy place like vegas, and their internet is fast. the spa jets in the tub were so nice and relaxing, the double shower heads in the shower were a fun touch, the bed was comfortable, requests for more water and bath amenities (which are high quality and smell wonderful) were fulfilled within minutes, room service was prompt, and we were granted a 4 PM check-out (which is good because i didn't get to bed until 6 am that morning). the ONLY thing that didn't go perfectly was lunch @ the poolside cafe-- the service there was slow (albeit very friendly) and they got our order wrong. other than that, i can only congratulate the staff for being so attentive and gosh darn welcoming. i cannot wait to go back this september!

Reviews.Title: “stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: revrend23
Reviews.Content: nothing good to say here coffee maker did not work, had to ask three times to get a replacement Pool was closed for no apparent reason waited in line to check in, waited in line to check out and was then overcharged with some sort of b.s. resort fee profoundly poor service at a $22 breakfast buffet, below average food crappy location surrounded by derelict vacant lots yuk

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed!!”
Reviews.Author: BevyPoo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this particular hotel multiple times, and despite the many choices in Vegas, this is our favorite. The rooms are large and very comfortable, with the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. Most of all I really enjoy the fact there is not a casino in the lobby, as I am not much of a gambler and hate all the cigarette smoke in other hotels. We are always pleased with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Check9
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent two nights at the Trump on Wednesday, April 6th & Thursday, the 7th. We started our stay at the Cosmo for two nights in a wrap around suite so it was a little hard to go to a smaller room. We stayed in a one bedroom corner suite on the 26th floor facing the strip and Wynn. The room itself is lovely and the decor is very nice. The problems we had were with the pull out couch. The mattress on the couch which someone mentioned in an earlier review stated that it was pretty flimsy. It was the worse we have ever encountered as you could feel every spring in it. I was surprised that a 5 star hotel would even consider placing a mattress like that in their rooms. The couch itself was very nice and looked expensive but the mattress looked like it came from Walmart. I called to see if they had a mattress topper. They said sure they would bring it right up. I was shocked when they brought up what looked to be a worn out mattress cover (not what I would call a topper) that was about 1/4 inch thick. You could still feel the springs through that. I then decided to take the comforter they provided and place that on top of the mattress and then use the sheets to cover up and blanket they also provided. I was so cold I ended up wearing one of their bathrobes to bed. The room was nice as I mentioned before but they could do with some kind of fold-up/down table in the guest bathroom as there is no where to sit stuff and we ended up placing all our stuff mainly on the floor. It has a pedestal sink with just a slight edge to it. The valet service was fine. We would call down before we went down to pick it up as it took a good 10 to15 minutes every time to get the car. The shuttle service everyone talks about was also good. The walk to the Wynn is long but the shuttle gets you their in just a few minutes. It was also nice to have the mall right across the street. As others have said you can walk directly across from the Trump entrance into the mall. We took our car when we were out late as we knew the shuttle only runs till around midnight. My daughter did have a salad at the hotel and it was very good. The free coffee they provide in the room is also very good. It is a very quiet hotel and the no smoking is nice. I'm not sure if we would stay there again as we enjoy staying somewhere with a little more action going on. The price is good though for what you get as far as the room goes.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT BATHROOM!”
Reviews.Author: YoungMom3
Reviews.Content: Went for a one night trip, a bunch of young moms, to Las Vegas. We chose Trump because a girlfriend of mine had stayed there before and they had upgraded her for free. Well, they didn't upgrade us, but they did waive the resort fee, which was nice. We got to our one bedroom suite which had a kitchenette, living room area with pullout couch, powder room with shower, a large bedroom with two closets, amazing amazing views (43rd floor) and a HUGE GORGEOUS master bathroom. Large shower, jetted tub, big vanity with tv in the mirror, big toilet room and huge picture window above the tub with a gorgeous view. Needless to say, when I returned to my room at 4 in the morning, I sank into the tub while enjoying the quiet and the beautiful nighttime view. I really loved the hotel, but there were two minor glitches; the tv in the bedroom didn't work, (but I wasn't there to watch tv, so that didn't bother me) and the jets on the tub didn't work. Either they didn't work, or it takes a super genius to figure that out. But I still very much enjoyed my tub time!

Reviews.Title: “Not Five Star”
Reviews.Author: RickNewOrleans_La
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice Hotel. It's beautiful, but it's not Five Star. First, Trump should have built on the strip or in City Center. The location is next to a seedy area (Erotic Sex museum) and railroad tracks. Five Star means the little things are taken care of. Well, one day when they cleaned the room, they forgot to pick up the breakfast room service setup. When we came to the room at midnight, we had to call to have someone come pick it up. Light bulbs burned out, toilet seat loose to the point it was dangerous to sit on, I had to tighten the screws myself. Room service delivered without salt and pepper nor napkins. No menu in the room. We asked for it twice, never delivered. Just stuff like this. Lobby staff very nice though. Won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Trump Las Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: cos2traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary (during March Madness) and had a fabulous time. We booked our room with a complimentary upgrade and upgraded to a corner suite for a small fee. Our suite was incredible and quiet. Everything was in working order. Absolutely no complaints and really enjoyed the non smoking policy. I did call housekeeping for additional place settings and a blanket and they were Johnny on the spot! Gerardo came twice and was fast and friendly. The hotel is right across the street from Nordstrom which I found very convenient. No problems with the area. We used the shuttles to Caeser's Palace and the Wynn several times and the drivers and bell staff were helpful and friendly. We did hear the train horn and airplanes but neither one was loud enough to be annoying or bothersome. We've stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels and would definitely stay at the Trump Las Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Check Out Without Verifying Your Bill!!”
Reviews.Author: hamletjay
