Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, and there is definitely some benefit to staying at a place with No Casino (no smoking, no indigents, classier environment). Our suite was lovely; but they only have King Sized Beds (according to their front desk). Many nice amenities; free internet, really really fast elevators, great morning brunch, free valet parking. Watch out for drunks at the pool-for a lovely quiet place, the pool staff doesn't care who's been "overserved"--this isn't the partying type of place. Mainly---Be Careful!!! We usually just do 'express check-out', but since we were waiting for our car anyway, we stopped in front to check out in person. They tacked on an additional $560.00 charge!!!!!!! If we hadn't read our bill carefully, we would have gotten stuck--as it was we asked the receptionist for an explanation, and after a few minutes of hesitation, he agreed to speak with the manager---and they took off the unknown charges. With No Explanation. Our impression is--they probably pull this on business travelers all the time; so make sure to pay attention to your bill!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, set up of room is great.”
Reviews.Author: Foodie4lifeiam
Reviews.Content: We have never had a big issue with this hotel. This was our 2nd visit. During our 1st visit we had our room at a high floor and the room was perfect except for a missing 2nd robe. On our 2nd visit the room smelled a little like pee. We didn't spend much time in the room so it wasn't too overbearing. The room service is excellent (food and service). The spa had a great esthetician & a decent spa. The front desk at spa seemed unhappy. The location is great if you like to shop. Fashion show mall and the wynn sops being steps away from the hotel. If you are a light sleeper, I suggest taking a sound machine since it's close to the rail road tracks.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxuous hotel for the business traveler or anyone willing to stay in a top notch hotel that does not have a casino or multi”
Reviews.Author: TravChief
Reviews.Content: First off, the rooms are very nice, even compared to other luxury resorts in Vegas. Very nice bathrooms with very nice size Jacuzzi, comfortable bed, and luxious appliances made my time there comfortable. The pool, gym, spa, etc. were all up to par with a hotel in this category. Another bonus with this Hotel is that it is non-smoking. I paid around $100 per night so it was also reasonable. It's not in a bad area and right across the road is a mall. I recommend staying here if you don't want or need a casino in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A TRUE REVIEW OF THE TRUMP”
Reviews.Author: ccfceuropesNO1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Trump. The hotel is a very nice place with fantastic rooms and great staff however there are a few things that stops me giving the hotel a 5 star rating. Firstly the location isnt "ideal" and its a good eight/ten min walk to vegas blvd(the strip) and the walk isnt really a pleasant one either (especially in the dark) with a vast stretch of barren land on one side and the back enterances to the shopping mall on the other.However taxis are esily avaliable from the hotel but obviously this adds considerably to the cost of your trip if you take cabs everytime you leave the hotel.We walked in daylight hours and got taxis back in the evening. Secondly even thou the pool area is lovely and the staff great,i found the actual size of the pool area very small for such a large hotel.When we were there it was very early season and the pool coped quite easily but one can only begin to imagine what would happen if the hotel was full?? it was 90 degrees and only EIGHT umberellas/shades were actually avaliable for the whole area,this definatly needs looking at as no doubt this will cause problems in the summer months. On saying that we enjoyed the pool everyday and the ambience and atmosphere around there was just right.Music is played on weekends and we even had a DJ set on the saturday which was fab and lifted the whole atmosphere around the pool. Drinks were slightly too expensive we felt and maybe the hotel can look at an "happy hour" or drinks reduction of some sort because to spend a few days around the pool enjoying a few drinks/snacks will soon have you checking your bank balance lol.(12 dollars for some nanchos???) Even though some of the above may sound negative we certainly had a fantastic stay at the Trump,

Reviews.Title: “Perfect everything except the AM valet and the service poolside”
Reviews.Author: Aimaen
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveller, I felt like I had walked into hotel heaven. Cute kitchenette fully stocked with all of the necessities, HUGE bathroom with a TV, amazing wireless Internet, super friendly staff, superior housekeeping service, wonderful food at the main restaurant, and if you are an iPrefer member, extra perks. Cons: Morning valet service was not very timely and actually caused me to be late to the office a couple of times. The wait staff poolside seemed to simply ignore me one time and the second time, it wasn't until I grabbed another server did the initial server finally came back to take me order. She was friendly and attentive to other customers surrounding me but essentially passed me over multiple times. I stayed here for nearly 2 weeks and enjoyed the majority of my stay. I would recommend this hotel overall unless you ABSOLUTELY have to be somewhere in the morning. Everything was beautiful and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible LOCATION but Great STAFF/ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: LESERLEE23
Reviews.Content: Wow was it a walk everywhere! This hotel is soooooo far from everything! It sucked, especially if you're drunk!! The staff was amazing, especially the bell boys who helped us get a cab almost each night since we couldn't stand walking anymore. Although, it is seriously right across the street from the mall which was pretty cool. The room was sublime. I would stay here again, I just wish it were closer to everything else...

Reviews.Title: “Hands down, THE BEST service standards in the industry .............”
Reviews.Author: ZeldaGatsby
Reviews.Content: I was in Las Vegas for 5 days, thats the good part. The bad part is, I only stayed at Trump International for 2 of those days. I arrived from Connecticut on a 5AM flight direct to Vegas and after renting a car arrived @ Trump about 11:45AM. I was expecting to have to drop my bags and come back in the afternoon to check in. I was greeted at the front desk by Victor. Not only was my room ready, but Victor upgraded me to a suite with a strip view for no charge! After explaining all the hotels perks including a local newspaper, bottled water, and wireless internet, workout room, included for the resort fee. When Victor told me that the local paper, Las Vegas Review was delivered, I casualy mentioned that I prefer the USA Today. Wouln't you know it, the next morning, I had a copy of the Vegas paper along with a USA Today on my doorstep. I was blown away!!!! This is the type of service that will make me return again and again. The pool, which others have said is small, was actually (by my stepping it off calculations) is 40' wide X 150' long, large enough by any standard. They also offer free iced bottled water at the pool, along with big comfy towels, as many as you need. I have been to some places, where they ration out towels like ingots of gold. And not the entire time there, did I feel that anyone had there hand out for a tip. The waitress service at the pool was also excellent. I also liked the big sofa like lounges available free of charge. Oh, and did I mention, a 4 O'clock check-out time? Who does that? Fantastic for me considering had to change hotels mid-trip. Had I not pre-paid for my other choice, I would have stayed my entire trip at Trump. My last example of supurb customer service came about when I left a few articles of clothing in a drawer in my room and did not realize it until 48 hours later. Now, I chose his Hotel because, its about the only place where the manager responds to each and every comment left here on Trip Advisor, either good or bad. So, the only contact information I had was to contact Mr. Brian Baudreau be email to ask if my clothing could be found. Mr. Baudreau forwarded my request to the security department and Erinn Hamilton. She offered to ship my shirts out Fed-Ex at no charge to me. Wow! Once again, going above and beyond in customer service! I can't help but think whom ever trained these staff members should be commended. Also, the valet crew, who knew my name after the very first time I picked up my car. My ONLY complaint was that at the wee hours of the morning, you can hear the train blow it horn...... was awakened but fell back to sleep. Guess I can only blame Burlington Northern railroad for that one. The staff has made me a Trump fan for life! Keep up the great work.......BillD / Connecticut

Reviews.Title: “WOW , now thats a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Klaus1870
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in juli , perfect . We were on the 35th floor with a nice view of the city Super room with anything you could wish for a hotel room Going back to Vegas march 2012 and would like to stay here again Very friendly staff , we felt very welcome No casino , which we find was a plus

Reviews.Title: “Restful room and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Wearywriter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trump for a tiring weeklong business trip, and really appreciated the serenity of my room. I could not hear anything at all from the adjoining rooms or from the hallway, and I liked staying in a hotel without a casino. The staff members I dealt with were extremely efficient and helpful; the concierge was incredibly attentive in the lobby. The valet parking attendants were quite fast and very polite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: FN_Madball
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with excellent rooms and service, located at the end of the strip. Great view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ive Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: amandamayden
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Trump last week. We stayed 5 nights and felt like royalty. Even for travelers on a budget, this place is worth the splurge. If we get to go back to our new favorite city, we hope to get to stay here again. We really liked the spa tub and the comfy beds. We slept like we were at home! Huge bathrooms and an amazing view made it seem luxurious. The rooms are so quiet, we never heard a neighbor. We werent sure why people complained about the location, we thought being next to a rockin' mall and california pizza kitchen was pretty darn handy. The only buffet that we allowed our taste buds to hit was Trump's breakfast. No regrets. Great variety (we loved the coffee and grapefruit juice). Please Trump Hotel, keep the great prices so we can come back soon. Thanks for a perfect vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price, housekeeping needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: lhall85917
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay in a Studio suite booked through BookIt.com advertised as a "mystery suite" so we learned the hotel's name after booking. This is a very nice hotel, but not a resort as the resort fee would imply. The bathroom is amazing and makes the room. There were several housekeeping issues - the drawer with the safe didn't roll smoothly and the safe couldn't be used, the handle on the ice bucket came off, and there was a used coffee filter packet left in the coffeemaker. We notified the front desk and the issues were addressed; however, after cleaning the coffee pot a plastic bag full of creamers, coffee, etc was left sitting on the counter for the remainder of our stay. Our biggest problem was the quality of Internet service - it kept cutting in and out and wasn't at all dependable. The hotel is at one end of the strip and provides a shuttle to the nearby Wynn and to the Forum Shops at Ceasar's Palace. We didn't use the shuttle so can't comment on the timeliness. We found it very easy to get to the strip and back to the hotel on our own. Overall, very nice hotel for the price we paid ($99/ night) but certainly not a resort hotel if that is what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Should have been better - poor follow through on details”
Reviews.Author: traildawgz
Reviews.Content: My business colleague and I were pleased to get this hotel at a fair price about $150/night while in Vegas on business. The hotel room and amenities were spacious and upscale. However on a closer look The Trump International began to fall apart. The room had broken drawer pulls, burnt out light bulbs, broken door stop etc. I requested the hotel manger so that he/she would be aware to let housekeeping know to address such issues...as it has to be obvious to a maid that these things were out of order. No big deal after a few phone calls they did come up and make the repairs while I was out. After a conference call the next morning we left for meetings...with our room service coffee and trays in the room...on my return the coffee cups half full were still there...but the rest was cleaned up. That evening I noticed that the TV was working intermittently as well...I did not call as I did not want to wait for maintenance. With some small attention to detail this would have been a much classier hotel. Upon check out the standard question "How was your stay?" When I responded that the issues took a little doing and that the cleaning service left something to be desired it was clear that the desk manager either did not have the ability or inclination to note the issue...not a good sign as well as no follow up from management. My fourth stay at a Trump hotel...the others were in NYC...I gave the SoHo one a pass because it was so new...but this seems to be a pattern. Definitely not a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We got a deal and felt like celebrities”
Reviews.Author: MsFlyy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is across the street from Fashion Show mall and around the corner from Las Vegas Blvd. I enjoyed being in a clean, quiet, luxurious hotel that was close enough to all the action. I paid an average of 111.00 per night for the week and it was well worth it, I will say that it is not a party hotel and does not have casinos. I think you can go out and party and gamble if you really want that, and still be able to come back to peace and quiet. It is pet friendly, the rooms have a stove top, toaster, microwave and oven. The Bathroom is something out of a movie with a 2-3 person hot tub and a TV in the bathroom mirror. Trump has a new fan in me.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: epb1023
Reviews.Content: I seldom if ever write reviews, but this hotel deserves one. Great hotel for business, for kids and anyone else who wants Las Vegas but not the smoke, long walks to the elevator and massively drunk people. The Trump is spotless, the people are amazing and accommodating and I will make this my hotel of choice when I visit again and every time there after.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, quality, quality”
Reviews.Author: Nads82
Reviews.Content: This property truly deserves 5 full stars. The service was excellent - staff was abundant and incredibly willing to help. I loved that there there was no casino in the facility. The rooms was unbelievable. The attention to high quality finishes and in room amenities was amazing. Various other subtle details made my stay here perfect. Feel free to reach out to me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Luxury, Not too Close to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Joanna T
Reviews.Content: i don't usually go for hotels in this price range, but I found a sweet deal through Jetsetter. The room was spectacular, and for the most part the service was as well (only exception being the pool wait staff, they seemed less than attentive). The pool cafe and drinks are overpriced, but this is par for the course for Vegas. It's best not to walk to the strip, although its definitely close enough (no continuous sidewalk). I recommend cutting thought the Fashion Show (mall across the street) or taking one of the two shuttles- one goes to the Wynn and another to Ceasar's Palace.

Reviews.Title: “My New Spot When I Come to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jclark702
Reviews.Content: Up until a year ago I lived in Vegas for about 12 years, I now live in the Phoenix area and thought it was high time I take a vacation and visit my friends. When I was looking to book my stay I had a few requirements: I wanted something with a residential aspect (mixed use property), a jacuzzi tub in the bathroom, *if* a suite then a second bathroom, and the price had to be reasonable. Location wasn't really an issue because I would be with friends who would be driving. It came down to Vdara, Signature, Palms Place, and Trump. In the end I spent one night at Palms Place and six at Trump. I arrived right around 330pm on March 6th (check out the 12th) and in my mind I had decided I would not upgrade unless I could negotiate a lower cost per night. I think I drove my best friend nuts constantly saying, "yeah, I read about this on trip advisor..." First time I used that sentence was when we walked into the lobby! It smelled WONDERFUL!! She agreed. We both, however, also could see how some may find it overpowering. I know my mom cannot handle strong perfume scents and would have had an instant migraine, but luckily I wasn't on vacation with mom, so it was welcome! Check in was a breeze. I had read some people say they were able to upgrade to a one bedroom for $30 a night. I figured that would be a reasonable starting point to negotiate seeing as though 5 of my six nights were not weekend nights. It was kind of funny when I said $30 and the desk clerk said, "well, let me see what I can do..." Literally, she walked 10 paces until she was out of sight, then must have counted to 5, and came back and said she could do it for $35. I accepted, but asked for as high up as possible. She said she had me on the 59th floor and gave me a great room. We headed up stairs, the elevators were VERY quick, and found the room at the end of the hall (5922). When we walked in and I saw the bedroom, I realized she really did take care of me. I had a corner suite!! It was awesome! I loved my room, my views were of the north strip and The Palms/Rio (as well as mountains). The train didn't bother me at all, but I can see how others would find it to be a problem, especially if they are a light sleeper. One little quirk I noticed with having a corner suite is that at night, before I would go to bed, I would have to close my bathroom door. The window above the bathtub does not have a shade to it. Very minor. Television channels were a bit lacking. I didn't care that there were not any movie channels, but it would have been nice to have E! and MTV. Before I arrived, my friends and I discussed doing a little MTV Real World Viewing Party for the Wednesday night premier, but we ended up scrapping the idea when we found I didn't have MTV in the bedroom or living room... The tv in the bathroom DOES have MTV, but we weren't that hard up to watch. I didn't get a chance to try DJT or H2Eu, but I did order room service twice. The Trump burgers are pretty good, and I ordered a Trump Sundae one night at like 2am, and it was to die for!! Housekeeping was exceptional! I have read other reviews that make me question if it is even the same property. I did have my do not disturb sign on the majority of the day (I might be 30, but I am still a night owl), and around 330pm everyday, there was a voice-mail left on the phone (they NEVER called the room, just accessed the voice-mail) that said they respected my privacy and therefore did not service the room; however housekeeping is 24 hours and to call should I decide to have the room serviced. I always called to have my room serviced, was never once made to feel I was a bother, and when I came back everything had been taken care of. Now, I did mention I was a night owl... The double doors into the vestibules were very heavy, and loud, and I tried to be mindful of my neighbors when I would come home in the middle of the night. I noticed some nights they too came in quite late. Other than those doors, I never heard any noise from the room next door. Some people mention the helicopters... I was at first baffled by that as a complaint, but then realized that Trump is seriously on the path of the strip helicopter tours! I actually liked it! Being so high up, I got a kick at how close they seemed to fly by my room!! It was also wonderful to have a full kitchen. There is a Von's grocery store not too far (Decatur and Desert Inn) and they will deliver groceries on orders over $50. Trump also has the attache service, which you can use to have your fridge stocked for arrival, but I am not sure what the cost is on that. I like that the freezer had an ice maker, I don't even know if the floors have ice makers or not because the freezer was stocked with plenty. The furniture in the room was very nice as well. I loved sitting in the chair in the bedroom area while putting on my shoes and getting distracted from the view. The couch, though nice, was a bit awkward for me, being 6'1". I felt like I had to lie on it, or slouch and prop my neck with a cushion. The back on it was kind of low. Some of my friends made similar comments. It was also weird that the room doesn't have a work space. I wasn't here for work, so this didn't bother me either. Also, I thought this was odd... Both times I ordered room service the staff that came to my room made a comment that gave me the impression they aren't too familiar with the product... The first night I ordered,while the gentleman set the table, he was amazed when he was able to see I had windows on two sides in the bedroom. The second time the server I had told me I could move, or swivel, the tv so I could see it better from the table. When I tried to move it he said, oh, maybe that's just in some rooms. My guess is that would be in the studios so people could watch more comfortably from bed. Having a second bathroom was very nice. There were a couple of times I had to excuse myself from friends that were visiting so I could get ready to go out. I didn't have to worry about anyone needing to use the bathroom. It was also good because if anyone had to spend the night (the sofa does pull out, bedding is in the drawer beneath the tv in the living room) they wouldn't have to come through my room to go to the bathroom. I never did check out the Trump Store, but I did like that there are ATM's by the elevators, and the fees were reasonable. I really could just go on and on about how wonderful my stay was here. Valet was very quick. To me, location was PERFECT! I was able to be anywhere on the strip within 10 minutes. The back roads (Industrial, Highland, Dean Martin) are great for getting around. Having lived in Las Vegas and worked in hospitality, I used to love doing little staycations. I would always indulge and get a suite. I love the tower suites and penthouses at Mirage, the tower suites at Treasure Islands, marquis suites and terrace suites at MGM, ziggaraut suite at NYNY (I could go on...), but that was when I LIVED in Vegas. I mentioned my criteria earlier, and I will definitely be back. Signature has the worst valet I have EVER experienced, it is a pain in the butt if you have company coming to visit (which for me was EVERY day), Palms Place was okay, but I didn't like having a balcony that didn't unlock, and Vdara just has "large soaking tubs." Trump had fast valet, my friends had no problems in stopping by to say hi, and the jacuzzi tub has three speeds, and must be the best I have ever had in Vegas! I am planning on coming back to Vegas in September and have every intention of booking at Trump International.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Jaunt411
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed a 6 night stay here in March, 2011. Given my usual requirements are nothing more than a good 2-star, I have had little experience with 5-star hotels other than Turnberry and Gleneagles in Scotland on a golfing tour years ago. Based on that limited experience, I'm not sure this place would rate as a true 5-star on a worldwide scale, but for the money (especially given a very favourable Aussie dollar exchange rate at the time) I'd rate it as outstanding value. I chose it for the "no casino, no smoking" factor, and I'm glad I did for two reasons ... 1) Nice to come back to that environment after a night out in Las Vegas. 2) During the day, it's a lovely, classy, relaxing atmosphere to enjoy. Gym and Pool area especially are nice & relaxing. Staff were very friendly & helpful, and the white bikinis came out at the pool while I was there! Rooms are very nice, and I'd go for the Strip view option - from the 55th floor, the view straight down the Strip is a highlight on its own. The shuttle to CP is very handy, although I'd like to see it run later - it's Vegas after all. The much-talked-of trains certainly can be heard at all hours, and while it didn't really bother me, if you are sensitive to that kind of thing then you'd best not stay here (bearing in mind LV gives off a buzz no matter where you stay). And, at the northern end of the Strip, just to the west there is the start of the "adult entertainment" zone - but, for some of us, being walking distance from the Spearmint Rhino is a plus ;) Overall, a very enjoyable stay, and I'd choose to go back whenever I next visit Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay....relaxing and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: jacqui85
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good service, not too far out of the way....nothing is far away in Vegas! 2 courtesy shuttles to the Wynn and Caesars Palace....right across the road from the Fashion Show Mall. The others who complained about having to walk too much are a tad lazy. The trains people talk about are there and do go off at various times of the day and night but after walking around for hours and soaking up Vegas you konk out and don't even notice them. We had a room on the side of the trains and weren't bothered by it at all. The only thing I would be wary about that they don't mention on the hotel site is the $100USD fee a night they freeze on your credit card for room service fees and anything you might like to charge to your room. For me it was too pre emptive and as a result I didn't end up using room service at all because I didn't like the way they went about it...too sneaky in my opinion. Usually I use room service a lot because I can't be bothered but this time I didn't because of that charge, so Trump missed out on extra money from me this time.I would definitely go back and stay again....but would definitely keep that extra room charge in mind and take more money. On the whole, a very nice, clean, friendly, non gaming, quiet and relaxing environment which I wouldn't heistate to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: jdur9232
Reviews.Content: Everything from the time we checked in to the time we left was amazing. The Room was amongst the best I have ever stayed in, the luxury of the hotel was terrific. It was so nice to come to a nice, quiet, classy hotel after a long day on the strip. Best part...no smoking. The service from the shuttle drivers, to the bell staff, to check in, to room service was top notch. Well done Mr. Trump! Would stay again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “You must treat yourself to the Spa!”
Reviews.Author: mmc0408
Reviews.Content: Of course the room was lovely -- large, airy with a kitchenette and a beautiful bathroom. We even had a gorgeous view of The Strip. And lunch at DJT in the lobby was delicious -- DH had the fish and chips and is still talking about it! But if you have the opportunity to stay here, you MUST treat yourself to the Spa! I had the 90-minute hot stone massage and thought I'd died and gone to heaven! Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Trump Hotel for a Pleasant, Noise-Free, Smoke-Free Environment”
Reviews.Author: SimplyHoney
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the Trump Hotel in Las Vegas in November with my mum. Overall, the hotel was clean, classy, modern, elegant and well-maintained. I booked a studio room, it was very luxurious and spacious. Nice big puffy bed with big puffy pillows. Luxurious bathroom. Not in the center of all the action, but is not far waking distance to the center of the strip. I like this hotel as it is a a non- smoking hotel, no casino, have the elegant vibe to it. The only downside of this hotel during my stay was, the toilet was not cleaned properly by the housekeeper, it had a bit of smell to it. However, I have informed the management and they were very good in fixing the problem. Also some staff needs more training as they lack professionalism. Again, the management acknowledged this problem which I'm hoping will be improved. Although many other staff are very polite, professional and efficient. Overall, I would stay at Trump Hotel in Las Vegas again. (Hoping the Service improves on my second stay)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rambotrader
Reviews.Content: Thumbs up for the Trump. To actually be in Vegas and sleep is unbelievable. And then there was not a smoke filled gambling casino in the basement. I congratulate the management on providing an establishment which caters for people who need a hotel to stay in and not a bar to pass through. If we are in Vegas again we will without doubt stay at the Trump if we can afford it. I mean why would you stay in one of the run down old dumps which were great 20 years ago but which have not been revamped since then!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Trumpster!”
Reviews.Author: HarmonyGirl88
Reviews.Content: If you are into partying and lots of noise, don't come here. But if you are looking for a great time in Vegas but also a relaxing get away, come here. We liked this hotel because it was slightly off the strip and quiet. However, it wasn't that far of a distance from the strip either. The Fashion Show Mall is across the street, you can walk through to get to the strip. The Trump is also a 5 minute walk to the Wynn and 15 minute walk to the Palazzo & Venetian. Anything else is a cab ride away. There are cabs everywhere. We also enjoyed relaxing by the pool and working out at the gym which are included with your stay. The rooms are fantastic, very clean and comfortable. My comments on other reviews re: loud train- I only noticed the train once and probably only noticed it because people made comments on it. I find the police cars louder but you will hear noise from the street wherever you stay in Vegas! Overall, we loved it for the value we paid. Cons: NO casino but it didn't bother us too much, we just played at the Wynn or the other casinos, then went home when tired. Wasn't a big deal for us. Just try it! Hidden Gem, Cozy, Comfortable, Charming...

Reviews.Title: “Trump is truly the best, we had an excellent visit”
Reviews.Author: Andrews111
Reviews.Content: I could not say enough. The service was unbelievable, I never waited to check in, for a door to be opened, I mean absolutely unbelievable service. The room was huge, high ceilings, full kitchen amenities, a half fridge a 2 burner stove, you name it they have it. Flat screen tv, tv in the mirror in the bathroom, deep sunken tub, marble throughout. Huge pool, good food, shuttle to the wynn or caesars palace. Shopping across the road, some high end and some not, as well as some restaurants and an ABC store. If you sign up for a casino card at the wynn within a very short time you will be offered a free buffet for 2, which is outstanding! Trumps restaurant is very dark and romantic. Theres a gift store in the hotel opened till 10 or 11. We were always greeted entering or leaving the hotel. It felt very safe because it was off the strip, and it was very bright. The best part of the hotel was that there was no smoking on site, which is terrific if you`ve been around the smokey casinos and then all the sudden you go back and have a smoke-free hotel...it was wonderful,,,my hisband and I both loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice....for the most part”
Reviews.Author: KMH999
Reviews.Content: Got a nice upgrade for little money midweek. Hotel very clean. No casino but nice quiet break from the strip. Stay away from rooming on the side with trains...their are several during the night. Staff super friendly no matter who helps you. Little things are amiss....one is restaurant that opens late and closes early. Lobby bar a poor excuse for a nice lounging area....conference room chairs with small cloth draped tables like they can't make up their mind if they want to spend the money for a lobby bar or not. Sometimes call for service didn't get followed up on....took 3 calls to get room service tray picked up, but then they called 3 times to confim my check out time...each time saying I wouldn't be interrupted again. It's nice to have Fashion Show mall right across the street for shopping and other places to eat. Take the free shuttle to The Forum to save walking 1.5 miles. It leaves every half or on the hour depending on day of the week. Would likely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “DONT EVER STAY IN THIS HOTEL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: YUBRICK
Reviews.Content: I made this reservation two month in advance. The room was not ready. Then the team manager put me in the room, which was not cleaned after the previous guest. Then somebody knock at the door about 2 am. Service was delivering the extra towels which I never ordered. Rooms are dusty and not cleaned properly. MY WORTH EXPERIENCE IN VEGAS! PLEASE STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: frogfan
Reviews.Content: I dont know why people grumble about the Trump Hotel we found it to be excellent in all areas. I am quite a fussy person and I could not find fault with anything. We booked through booking.com and got a fantastic deal. We were also upgraded to the 49th floor with a superb view of the strip. Yes you could hear the train going by every now and then but you are in Vegas a city that never sleeps. I would suggest to the people who have over sensitive hearing buy yourself a pair of earpugs. The hotel has a free shuttle bus that takes you to Wynn and Ceasars. However the Wynn is less than a 5 minute walk from the Trump. I really don't know why people compain about the location of this hotel! We also found room service to be excellent especially the portion sizes and prices excellent. All I can say to anyone thinking of staying in Las Vegas. DONT HESITATE IN BOOKING THE TRUMP IF;- You like a non-smoking environement You like a more relaxed atmosphere (non gaming) You like good service You like good value for money You like luxurious rooms and the most amazing beds Thank you for a wonderful stay and will recommend you to anyone who is going to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Jm707
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in Trump on March 13-15, 2011 and one of the best hotels we've ever been in vegas. Pros- Very clean, beautiful and spacious room, service was awesome, non smoking, very comfortable bed, huge Jetted tub, perfect kitchenette with toaster and coffee maker, 2 free water bottle a day, very friendly staff, valet was ok sometimes slow and the pool is very nice. Cons- No casino, we can hear the train and siren from emergency vehicles, the shuttle service going to the strip is a long wait and we had a hard time setting the hot or cold in the shower because if you put it in the middle its either very hot or very cold. Overall, its one of the best hotels in Vegas, very friendly, and we will definitely come back to stay in TRUMP...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic smoke/casino free resort in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: cattynet
Reviews.Content: We'd been to Vegas a couple of times before and stayed at the famous resorts. One thing I didn't like about them is having to walk through smoky casinos to get to your hotel rooms... so when we went back this time we chose to stay at Trump International - the only smoke and casino free resort in Vegas. It is AMAZING. The staff are great, the rooms are HUGE (all suites with small kitchenettes) and service is amazing. We still gambled and clubbed etc, but went to other resorts to do that - it's all about getting out and about!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice near strip”
Reviews.Author: DrkRoast
Reviews.Content: We wanted to try a newer property this time around on our 3rd trip to Vegas. Used bookit.com and matched the room description to the Trump with Google (gives you a PRETTY good idea which hotel you are actually getting). The Trump is non-smoking, and we got an excellent room on the 55th floor (Strip view). Staff were gracious, and helpful. Free valet parking was great too and paying tips only was a pretty good deal. Business center is nothing to write home about (only 2 computers and one was broken) and the other was continuously occupied. However, since it was a boarding pass to print, the concierge helped out and all was good. However, if I actually wanted a computer to use, i'd be out of luck. Excellent room service and the espresso maker in-room was a good touch. Only issue is of noise, despite being on the 55th floor, we could hear emergency vehicles on the street below and the vegas-by-night helicopters. Struck us as a bit unusual.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.....off their game”
Reviews.Author: RonRoadman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Trump Las Vegas in August 2010.....excellent. Returned in March 2011 for 4 nights....disappointed! Bed was NOT Trump quality. After first night asked to have bed inspected. Nothing was done. Checked out 4 days later after sleeping on the sofa in the room, it slept better than the bed, but not great. I was asked at check out how the stay was and I told them. She responded...."you should have told us , housekeeping can change the bed out" maybe they CAN but they didn't. Next time, if there is one, the bed will be checked first. Not sure there will be a next time, not sure they really cared.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms...but service did not hold up to promises”
Reviews.Author: prodigiouswizard
Reviews.Content: First, the rooms here are gorgeous. Very spacious with jacuzzis. They are relatively quiet but the windows dont block out sound too well and I could hear the morning train from the 30th floor. Now, the service. They make you pay a $20 resort fee daily and in exchange promise you wi-fi access, 2 bottles of water, and newspaper. For me, they didnt replenish my water & paper the 2nd day. I called them, and in 20mins someone brought me a paper, but no water, but he went and got some. Last day, again no replenishment of water or newspaper, and I called them, except this time nobody came by before I checked out. I wanted to complain at checkout, but our shuttle came and there were only 2 ppl working on the front desk at night... You may wonder why I'm making a big deal out of water, but we were sooo thirsty and tired after walking back home from the strip (so location is a big disadvantage for this hotel) from a long day, and for a 5* hotel that is supposed to give you good service, they didnt do the little things well, and the water did matter to us at least in showing us the attitude of Trump. I'll let you decide if you want to stay here, but we won't be

Reviews.Title: “The Trump experience was perfect - would recommend it to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: sugdens
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 6 nights at the Trump Hotel which was faultless. Las Vegas is lively, glitzy and everything you expect and want it to be and staying in the Trump was a peaceful oasis of calm minutes walk away from the hustle and bustle. We had a fantastic day out at the Grand Canyon - a natural wonder of the world and it was a perfect end to the day to come back and relax in the huge jacuzzi in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Trump hits the mark with great service and relaxed atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: degrace26
Reviews.Content: We checked in from March 1st to the 8th, 2011. We had a marvelous experience at the Trump Las Vegas. It’s situated very close to the strip, 5 minute walk. Coming to think of it, it took us as long to get street side while visiting from some of the major resorts that are right on the strip. As a plus, the hotel offered continual shuttle services to the Wynn and Caesars Palace (Forum Shops, to be specific) complexes – so casino’s where never more than a short ride away. Yes, the Trump does not have a casino on site. To us, this was a major plus because it offered a much friendlier and slower pace to the Las Vegas experience. We were able to enjoy the nightlife and casinos like anyone else, but, as mentioned, we were able to retreat to our rooms without going through loud smoke filled casinos. Yes, the Trump is also smoke free. One very neat feature was having access to the Fashion Show Mall right across the street. It’s a complete shopping experience if you enjoy shopping and you can get practically anything you may have forgotten at home, and then some! There’s even a Tix4tonight booth where you can score some good prices on shows. The building itself is quite impressive. Without inquiring, it’s probably the tallest hotel on the strip – we had quite the impressive view, especially at night, of the central and southern parts of the strip on our 58th floor studio (I was granted an upgrade to a higher floor and strip view). Upon entering the hotel, the lobby is quite spacious and very well decorated with elegant tapestry, columns of sparkling crystal and gold trimming – very elegant and modern all at once. Of course, this is to be expected from such a name as Trump. There were more than enough elevators to accommodate us. As a matter of fact, we’ve barely ever waited more than 30 seconnds to have one service us to our floor. The room we had was more conservative in styling when compared to the lobby, but it was very nicely appointed, it had great furniture and the kitchenette was perfect to prepare basic breakfasts to get early morning starts. The bathroom is probably the best part – it had 2 sinks, separate and enclosed toilet and shower (very large) and a very deep jetted tub. There’s room enough for all your stuff, and this includes cabinetry for clothes. It was nice to have access to a safe to store our valuables. The pool area was very nice. Although not a free form as I usually prefer, it was quite large enough and well suited for laps. The deck chairs were quite comfortable and there was more than enough for all the patrons. Pool service was great, they offered towels and bottled water on arrival and the waitresses were always close by to offer food or cocktails. As for restaurants, there are two: the H2eau and the DJT. The DJT offers a complete dining experience in a chic and very well appointed dining room. We had the table d’hôte for diner once and ate twice for breakfast. The H2eau was more of a café/bar next to the pool. It offered a decent selection for lunch. Prices were very reasonable for a strip hotel. We would definitely not hesitate to recommend eating at the hotel. I was able to use the spa using a 25$ gift certificate included with our stay. I chose a hot stone massage and it was great to relieve stress from work and traveling. I felt great and refreshed as I came out. Upon entering and leaving the hotel I don’t think I’ve touched the door handles once. Bell and valet services were quick, courteous and efficient. This absolutely includes the guys who provided the shuttle services. Some of the friendliest people I’ve met; always having a smile and striking up conversations without hesitation. As a whole, this general feeling was how we felt about every single employee we met at the hotel. Everyone from the check-in desk to the concierge, from the maids to the waiters/waitresses felt like they were there to serve us and make sure our stay was as enjoyable as possible. For our first time in Vegas we did not expect that and we were totally amazed by this level of service. We have no problem rating this hotel a 5 star and recommend this to anyone visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Comfort!”
Reviews.Author: Twigthew0nderkid
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay and I cannot say one negative thing. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. Our room was a studio city view changed to a strip view without hesitation upon request. We were offered an upgrade to a larger suite for only $40/night but we were not interested or planning to stay in our room for any great length of time so the larger suite didn't matter to us. The room was beautiful with an amazing view!!!! The studio was roomy and had a seating area and a long wall with everything you would possibly need. All top of the line appliances: Bosch, Sub Zero and Wolfe. The bathroom roomy and done with the best finishes!!!! T.V in the bathroom mirror kept me abreast of world happenings while getting ready every morning and night....in fact, saw a piece on Trump possibly making a presidential run....how ironic. Go for it Mr. Trump!!!! My favorite: The Bed. So, so comfortable, I miss it already. Is there temperpedic in the mattress along with down? I never felt my husband move in bed! My only request was to ask for a later shuttle service since cabs are needed between places and can quickly deplete even a modest budget. Loved the location now that we know what we want in a location, especally love the fact it is devoid of having the public trampsing through your hotel! Thanks we will definitely be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay at Trump Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: VoyageVoyage11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Trump hotel for 3 nights and it was perfect. It is a real 5 stars. The pool is amazing and we were lucky enough to have a nice weather. The room was also perfect. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Cocobean8
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time during our five night stay at the Trump. We were there over Superbowl Weekend and The Strip was insane, it was nice to come back to a quiet hotel away from the madness. Location The hotel is across the road from the Fashion Show Mall which was very convenient. It is just off the strip but it is only a couple of minutes walk to the Wynn. The only inconvenience is that the sidewalk on the Trump side of the road was closed about 2/3 of the way to the strip and the road could really do with better lighting (not that the hotel has any say over that). But once you know that you need to cross the road while you are at the hotel end of Fashion Mall Drive there is no problem getting to the strip. The Room I stayed in a city view studio and it was in excellent condition. The bathroom is massive and has everything you could possibly need. The bed was comfortable and the in room wireless was quick and the connection never dropped out. The only thing the room was missing was dishwashing liquid and a sponge- I guess they don't actually expect anyone to use the kitchen. The Staff All of the staff we encountered were polite, friendly and courteous. We had one strange encounter with a housekeeper (she was outside our room leaving a note as we had set our room to 'do not disturb' as we didn't want any service, we then couldn't get across that we didn't need anything from her) but that was only due to the language barrier. I had read reviews saying that guests were not given the water or newspaper included in the resort fee. Housekeeping replaced our water everyday and the only time we didn't have a newspaper waiting for us outside our door was when we got up so late that they had already been cleaned up (thank you, jet lag). I also booked the room through Priceline and was certainly not treated any differently because of this (unlike other reviewers have felt). Overall, it was a flawless stay and everyone from the doorman to the concierge was wonderful. I will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: enelym1978
Reviews.Content: My one night stay at the Trump was enjoyable, from check-in to check-out and room service. Everything you would expect from a 5 stars hotel, even though I would expect a bit more of luxury and service from a true 5 stars. Well sized room, big bathroom with a tv in the mirror, bath tub. I had a view on the back, on the desert and the train tracks and the Stardust. I was surprised to hear the trains pretty well, considering I was pretty up high in the building. Light sleepers might find it annoying... The Suite has a mini kitchen with a microwave (no stoves, but that's normal) to allow you to reheat some ready-to-eat meals. Great pool as well. It's just a bit off the Strip but really, it's not a big problem. The FashionShow Mall is right across the street. Just go through there to be in a fresh and cool place, do some shopping and eventually come out on the main Strip. It's easy, really. I would definitely stay there again, since I'm not a big gambler, this non-casino hotel is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Mr. Trump, your fired.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (family of five with three teenage boys) checked in Friday Feb 18/2011. We had two rooms next to each other. Check in was smooth and professional. #1 room had robes, #2 didn't. A phone call to the front desk and robes were provided promptly. Sat morning tried to make coffee in room # 2 with provided coffee maker. Didn't work, discovered that power outlet at coffee maker area did not work. Worked fine in room # 1. Needed to use iron. Iron did not work in room # 1, iron from room # 2 worked fine. As you can see so far is was very helpfull having two rooms. These were minor inconveniences. Went out for the day Saturday, making sure that we turned on the housekeeping required lights. Upon our return at 5:30, we discovered that that neither of our rooms had been cleaned. I called the frt desk which transferred me to housekeeping. The lady at housekeeping was very apologetic, and ensured me that our rooms would be cleaned immediately. We left for the evening, and returned at 10:30. Guess what? Neither room had been cleaned. I called The frt desk which transferred me to housekeeping, nobody answered at housekeeping, so it rang back to the frt desk which transferred me back to housekeeping , nobody answered at house keeping so I was transferred back to the frt desk, which transferred me to housekeeping. Finally somebody answered. I explained that rooms still had not been cleaned. She apologized and offered to send somebody u immediately. I declined her offer as we were all tired and wanted to sleep. She said fine and asked if I would like to speak to a Mgr. I said yes pleas have a Mgr call me. I did not receive a call from a Mgr. About 20 minutes later, a lady (housekeeping???) entered room # 2 and upon realizing that people were in bed she immediately left. Why somebody was entering the room i have no idea. Sunday morning we left for the day, again ensuring that our housekeeping lights were turned on. Upon our return at aprox 5pm, again neither room had been cleaned. As we about to call housekeeping at 6 pm as we were leaving. A knock at the door. Finally housekeeping. Great. We went to see a show. Upon our return. We were shocked to find that only one room had been cleaned. Room #2 had not been touched. Now I'm not very happy. I call the front desk and explain what has happened over the past couple of days and that this would trigger a response of " let me get a Mgr for you" No I got " let me transfer you to housekeeping". I spoke with a lady who promised that the housekeeping mgr would come to see me. A short time later the housekeeping Mgr came. She apologized and offered to get the room cleaned immediately. I declined this as the boys were already in bed and we had to leave early in the morning to catch a Flight to L.A. For the next stage of our vacation. I told we needed clean towels. She returned with the towels and a bag containing about 20 bottles of shampoo and conditioner etc. What I was supposed to with 20 bottles of shampoo? She again apologized and promised to have our resort fees taken off our bill and that she would talk to the Mgr. Next morning upon checkout, the resort fees were still on our bill. The gentleman a the front desk said that there were no notes on our account to indicate that there had been a problem. So I then explained what had happened and what had been promised. He took the resort fees off. I thought that this would have prompted a " would you like to speak to a Mgr" But no, i was told that I would be receiving an email survey,and that I should address any concerns through the survey. I received the survey, which does not allow enough space to make much of a comment. I did express my disappointment in my stay through this survey. Thus far I have not had any response from Trump Hotels. By the way I left the 20 bottles of shampoo behind.

Reviews.Title: “Total relaxation in a frantic town!”
Reviews.Author: Mags059
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Trump having read some mixed reviews. Have to say we were really impressed. Hotel, while slightly removed from the 'Strip' ,was an absolute haven of sophistication. Lobby peaceful and quiet, rooms spacious and luxurious. Coming in at night from a night on the town was like coming home. Staff friendly and very helpful. Only negative note would be on arrival receptionist enquired as to whether this was a special occasion. We said we were 30 years married and were offered a special upgrade to one bedroomed suite at a reduced cost of $150 per night! I checked price differential on our return and this offer was more expensive than if it had been booked originally. All in all though, a really great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out to your stuff in case it get stolen”
Reviews.Author: manrick777
Reviews.Content: Overall the room was great, but when I checked out I forgot my $250 jacket in the room, it was around 10:30 AM when I left, then I got back after the room was cleaned by the cleaning lady and the jacket was not there anymore, then I went to lost and found, and it was not there, I spoke with Glen the manager on duty that day, and I explained my story but all I had was a hey we are sorry about this and you can buy another one there is a store across the street that sells jackets. I was very upset to hear such thing form a high end 5 stars hotel. I cannot officially accuse the cleaning lady but it is also hard not to make your own idea about what could have happened. They clean each room and do not leave anyhting behind after each checkout, so there is no way this would have been left in the room. Also there is no way I could have lost it somewhere in vegas because this was a winter jacket that you wear when its very cold, so it stayed in the rooom the whole time I was in vegas, I didn't wear it the whole time I was there. So I want to mention it just in case the Trump reads this and decide to reply to my message. Bottom line this is a nice and luxury hotel I will not complain at everything just because I am upset with what happened, but the way Glen the manager on duty handled the issue was not what I expected, if I was them I would have at least offer the Client a jacket to go back home. Again I cannot officially acuse the cleaning lady since I didn't see her with my jacket, but I just made my conclusions, so do your own and make sure you check all your things. Have fun in Vegas...

Reviews.Title: “Completely disgusted and freaked out!”
Reviews.Author: Bustraveuro
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying, I have frequented many resorts in Vegas and this is by far the worst. First, I check in and am fairly impressed by the entry and first glances. I wanted to get some gaming in, so I went across the street to the Wynn where I played poker, roulette, and blackjack till around 2am. I came back to unpack and get my wardrobe ready for some morning meetings. I opened the closet to find a dildo, leather chaps, and some type of whip hanging neatly in the closet! Completely freaked out, I went to the bathroom to see if someone was in this room. Luckily, no one was there. It appeared housekeeping had cleaned the area and perhaps left the closet alone out of disgust. Completely repulsed, I decided to grab the phonebook to find another hotel. When I opened the drawer, I found a used condom, dirty rubber glove, and ky staring me in the face! I was so freaked out and too embarrassed to call the front desk, I threw out all the perverse gear, slept on a chair and checked out the following morning. I claimed the train was too noisy and had my company put me up at the Aria. I can't believe housekeeping overlooked this/ ignored, but I suppose it is Vegas but not something I would expect from a 5* hotel. Stay Away!

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Nice Hotel 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: amorace
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. I stayed in the basic room. Super nice.. huge bathroom, jacuzzi bath, 6 x 6 shower, TV behind the mirror. Very nice bed, kitchen, basically a living room in the room. I read about train noise, I heard one on one of the nights, but no big deal. I was on the 58th floor, Ask for a room as high up as possible. 5 star all the way. They do charge a $20 per night fee for the pool, paper, wireless internet.. No Casino, No Smoking.... Free Rides to the Wynn and Ceasars. I would catch the bus to go up and down the strip. You can not beat the price of the rooms for what you are getting. I did not even want to leave the room.. very relaxing place to be.

Reviews.Title: “My new home when I'm in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Jermsworld
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the reason I finally decided to become an official member of TripAdvisor. Reading the reviews on here, I wasn't sure what to expect. After my wonderful experience however, I decided it was time to stand up for the Trump Las Vegas and inform people of this "hidden gem" We arrived at 11am on a Saturday after an early morning flight to check the place out before 4PM check in. From the minute I walked in the lobby, I knew we had chosen the right hotel. Everything was spotlessly clean, and the employees actually seemed HAPPY. I then went to ask the front desk employee what the earliest check in time would be, and to my surprise she offered to check me right then and there. Not only was she great, but the entire staff was gracious and accomodating. A perfect example was after I checked in and noticed there weren't any robes in the room (things happen, i understand). They immediately sent 2 robes up to the room, and then informed me of all the services included with the resort fee. I've paid resort fees at other Las Vegas hotels that only included WIFI. For the same cost here, I got to use the gym, WIFI, spa discounts, and we even received free shoeshines, which really came in handy after scuffing my shoes dancing at Vanity and Tryst. If I needed extra towels, I'd simply call housekeeping and within 10 minutes they would bring them up. The pool was stunning, and the drinks were awesome. The gym had functioning state of the art equipment, and even the elevators were efficient with little wait time. Overall this hotel was an excellent value, with a beautiful kitchenette room and jacuzzi tub. It was right across from Nordstrom and only a 2 short block walk to the strip. The valet parking got busy at times, but compared to Chicago or New York it was very quick to get my car. I suppose if I was coming from a small rural town, a 5 minute wait for a car might seem like an etermity, but in reality this is a smoothly ran operation. After staying at other properties where customers are treated as a number versus a valued client, it's refreshing to see that the Trump staff cares about it's guests. I can't say enough good things about this property, and I can't wait to return to my new home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Had a fine stay”
Reviews.Author: WebBrown
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and rooms are nicely appointed. The hotel is not on the strip but only a 1 block walk to the Wynn and the rest of the strip. We found it to be a good location for navigating the rest of the strip and I loved the fact that there was no casino. The studio rooms are 500 square feet which is plenty of room for two people. So don't bother upgrading to a larger 900 sq. feet room when they offer it at check in. The bathroom was large, luxurious, and beautiful. My wife loved the t.v. built into the bathroom mirror. The only two concerns I had were minor. There were three towels in the bathroom but only one was a large, fluffy, high quality one. The other two were standard, course motel 6 variety. Also when the cleaning lady cleaned our room she took the wash clthes from the previous day without leaving new ones, so I had to take a shower using a hand towel on my 2nd night. But even with these minor inconveniences, I would stay at the Trump again, especially for the $135/night price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “The Devil's in the Details”
Reviews.Author: Stacdawg
Reviews.Content: I had very high expectations for the Trump Las Vegas; unfortunately my expectations were not met. The issues I had mostly involved my room. My girl friend and I shared a studio room which has a king bed and a sleeper sofa. I realized too late that this hotel was suppose to be condo's therefore none of the studios have two nice beds in the them. I completely blame myself for this oversight. I still feel strongly that no hotel that calls itself 5-star or 4-diamonds or premier should have a pull out bed as a primary area for sleeping, but again the bed issue was my oversight. The king bed slept very well. Before you enter your room you enter a quiet entrance which is nice. The hotel itself is very quiet and beautiful. A paper was waiting for us each morning. We had to request additional toiletries and toilet paper. We checked in on a Monday and were out of toilet paper on Wednesday. We requested robes and they took hours to get. Someone called to verify we got them and when we told them we did not have them the person apologized, but it still took hours to get. Soap scum/calcium was also built up on the shower head. I tried cleaning it, but it would not come off. The soap scum/calcium was still there when we checked out. The remote for the tv in the bathroom did not work (it was eventually replaced). The light up mirror in the bathroom did not work; we let the cleaning staff and manager know, but nothing was done about it. We also had to put towels on the floor Monday, because no rugs were left. The rugs showed up Tuesday. Their was a stain on the floor as soon as you walked into the room. Trash was left on the floor when the cleaning staff was emptying a trash can. The floor was not vacuumed (we knew this b/c lint was evident of the floor). My friend slept on the pull out bed and had to wrap her pillow in a sheet b/c no pillow cases were available. We eventually spoke to a manager about the issues in our room and he apologized and removed our resort fees and gave us a $50 breakfast credit. Unfortunately the hotel messed up my friend's breakfast order and that also was comped. The food was good. The hotel itself is beautiful and smells wonderful. Their is no casino and is smoke free, which I really liked. The hotel is off the strip, but across from the Fashion Mall. The hotel has a shuttle to the Wynn and Caesar's Palace. The bathroom also had a jacuzzi tub which was wonderful. I would suggest staying at a hotel on the strip. In conclusion, I will not be staying at the Trump again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury At It's Finest!”
Reviews.Author: flyn2lo
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Vegas for some much deserved R&R and booked the Trump thru bookit.com. I was a little concerned, not having been there before, but know the name is associated with luxury so why not. Our first big surprise was an upgrade we received to strip view for celebrating our anniversary! First time ever got something for nothing. The room was very nicely furnished and the bathroom was huge! It was a plus to have a mini kitchenette although with all the glorious food in Vegas, we didn't use it as much as we expected. We found every single one of their employees to be friendly and informative and that is amazing with as many as they employ. From the valet to the pool attendant, the maid service to the reception desk clerk, all were over the top kind. We've stayed at 8 other hotels/resorts in Vegas over the years and this was by far the best experience yet. Kudos to Mr. T and his staff. Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “It TRUMPS all the other hotels”
Reviews.Author: Muslee
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Trump was amazing. From the moment I walked in everyone was so pleasant. And I got a really good upgrade since it was my birthday weekend. I had a strip view studio. I was right underneath the Penthouses. The room was a nice size, the bathroom was great, the beds were very comfortable. Room service was excellent, my friends and I (5) total usually left the room late in the afternoon but we still came back with our rooms cleaned. One time, we were to tired to leave the room, after coming back from the nightclubs at like 5am, we came back to a tidy room. It was actually kind of freaky. The only complaint I had about the room was that the cell phone service was horrible in the rooms. I could barely make a call even by the window (At&T and T-Mobile). This is probably because the Trump is in a relatively undeveloped area. There is no casino, so the lobby is smoke and noise free. I did take a look at the conference rooms, gym and pool area. They looked nice. I did not try any of the restaurants nor the spa. The complimentary shuttles were amazing and helped to save a lot of money. I saw people with dogs in the hotel too. I think the Trump experience was a lot more personalized than the other big casino hotels. Also, it is right next to fashion show mall and there is a liquor store near buy. The staff were so friendly. They would joke with my fiends and I lot about how often we used the shuttle. LOL! There was also an association that came with stay at the Trump. Everyone automatically thought you had a lot of money, but we got an amazing deal in HOTWIRE. On my text trip to Las Vegas, I want to check out the Wynn or Encore because the are BOMB and the ventilation at the casino is actually good. Other than that, the TRUMP will be my hotel of choice every time I go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms- Great Hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: energyguru
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two day stay at the Trump. Check in was fine, although we arrived before the rooms were available, our luggage was handled by the Bell staff. Check in completed, we requested a higher floor if possible. We took a walk, enjoying the spring weather, returned and were treated to a awesome studio room on the 53rd floor with an amazing view of the strip. Our entire stay was as enjoyable as our view, with two small exceptions. Several of the lounge chairs around the pool had the fabric torn away from the edges, making the chairs unusable. I understand these things happen, but the chairs should be removed until repaired, in my opinion. You CAN hear the train at nights... Otherwise, the hotel was sparkling clean, NO smoking, and casinos are just a short walk away, or the shuttle to the Wynn is available. GREAT STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Las Vegas!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SamSanDiego01
Reviews.Content: I booked a room on Priceline.com while traveling to Vegas to visit a friend in the hospital after a horrible accident and it selected the Trump International Hotel. I arrived at the hotel after seeing my friend and was a little distracted and broken up. The receptionist asked if I was ok and I simply said, "Not well... I just visited one of my close friends in the hospital". The receptionist said that she hoped that I would feel better after I get some rest in the room. When I arrived to my room, I was upgraded to an amazing suite. I felt that the hotel really went out of it's way to make sure that I was ok during my stay! They also help ed me with figuring out where to go to pick up items for a care package for my friends parents and sister. They also helped me with finding something to use to put the items in for the care package. By far, this place displays *First Class Service! It is also a plus for people who do not like smoke (non-smoking lobby and rooms). I usually stay at Bellagiio when I go to Vegas for Leisure, but I'm going to start staying here instead since you don't have to deal with the Casino & Smoking. I will stay here on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Service was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: kimvoo
Reviews.Content: Went with BF recently and was definately one of my best stays in Vegas. Guest service was top notch; they were all extra friendly and helpful and definately made us feel like VIPs. They only downside to the TRUMP was it was valet parking (no self park) which i did not mind one bit and they were off the strip (but not by much). If you are looking for quiet rooms without the casinos and traffic, this is a must. Rooms were good sized, beds were AMAZING, bathrooms roomy and very clean. I loved the option of letting the cleaning crew when you were in or out of the room with a touch of a button. decor was very tastefull and inviting. room had a kitchenette and i loved the idea of creating an attache with them for your next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: BrendaH
Reviews.Content: We got back a few days ago from 4 nights at the Trump. We absolutely loved this hotel. The room was gorgeous, service was terrific, and we had a great time. We had a delicious dinner at DJT – they had a special where you could have a 3 course meal for $29 - the food and service were excellent, at a bargain price. For those who feel the location is too far off the strip, I think in the past, we’ve actually had to spend more time walking through the casino and across the enormous entry of strip hotels than it took for us to get from the Trump’s front door to the strip. The layout of the Trump is clean and simple – no annoying detours through a noisy casino; just down the elevator and out the door, which I find ideal. The door to the mall is right across the street from the Trump’s front door, and it was very pleasant to walk through the mall to get to the strip. Our only beef at the Trump was that the WiFi didn’t seem to work for us; however, the front desk dealt with the issue very much to our satisfaction. The Trump is a beautiful hotel with excellent service, and I’d stay there again any time.

Reviews.Title: “A Funny Thing Happened At The Trump LV”
Reviews.Author: madsm0m
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying that all of my complaints would be minor if they had happened in isolation and if our friends hadn't also had problems. AND I take full responsibility for not doing my usual control-freak research on TA. And, I brought home a story that will have me and my friends laughing for years (once we are able to remove certain disturbing images from our brains) ...And there were some positives: 1. Fantastic massage at the Spa 2. Really comfy beds. However: 1. We booked a "Strip View" room through Priceline, however when we checked in, we were informed we had a "City View" room. When we told the desk clerk we had paid for a Strip View, he said that Priceline doesn't book rooms correctly (or some nonsense) and that we didn't really "pay" for a Strip View. Uh, excuse me, but we DID pay extra for a Strip view. We just paid Priceline, not you. If you don’t like how Priceline sells your rooms, either fix it, or don’t do business with them. Not my problem. We got to the room and were disappointed with the so-called Strip View, but it is what it is (we had a great view of Nordstrom and Treasure Island and could see the pool if we pressed our faces up against the window). 2. Surprised to find there were no robes, only three towels (the kind you would expect to find at a Holiday Inn-and not a nice HI), and no bath mats (my husband slipped and fell on the marble floor getting out of the shower--law suit waiting to happen? I think so!). The next day (after being told we had to call IF we wanted our room cleaned…um…what??) we actually received nice big bath sheets, and bath mats. Then, while searching for a Spa menu (unsuccessfully), we read that the rooms were supposed to have robes. So we asked the concierge to send some up, she said she would, even asked if we also would like slippers (um, heck yeah!), but they never arrived. ON the upside, we did have a blender and a salad spinner. 3. Food & Beverage issues were too numerous to detail here and I really don’t want anyone to miss.... 4. THE HIGHLIGHT OF THIS REVIEW: And then there was the waitress who recommended we try the Spearmint Rhino club for breakfast. We thought, hey, we're in Vegas, why not go to a "gentleman's club" for breakfast--should be fun, right? And this waitress, who looked like a librarian (it’s always the little librarian types, isn’t it? The little minx!), said they had the best breakfast in town. Soooo I don't know what we were expecting (some sort of Cheetah Club/Waffle House hybrid?) but what we got was a low-rent strip club that was so dark we literally could not SEE the dancers, but what we COULD see was the skeezy guy next to us enjoying a Happy Ending with his lap dance. No joke. Hence the cloak of darkness I suppose. I guess you really CAN do anything in Vegas. And I'm supposed to EAT in this place? Ugh. So we hightailed it out of there and went to the Wynn for breakfast (which was fantastic). That’s 40 bucks and 20 minutes of my life I’ll never get back. **OH, message to the cute little under-age stripper who was trying to join our table...call your mother sweetie, or Facebook her, I’m sure she’s worried sick about you.** Anyway...point being, when I'm staying at a Five Star hotel, I do not expect to be sent to a low rent strip club for breakfast. If I want a little nudity with my hash browns I'd rather go to Waffle House and peruse a Playboy. This place gives a whole new meaning to "scattered smothered and covered"…BUT again, as I am always a Glass Half Full Girl, this experience generated a lifetime-worth of laughs for us and our friends. But still...yeesh... 5. Day three, we were back to the Holiday Inn towels. What happened to my nice big bath sheets? Those were really nice. And still no robes. My husband spotted IVANKA TRUMP walking through the lobby with her entourage. I wonder if SHE got a bathrobe? I doubt it, because apparently, according to the Hotel Manager, they had a big Magic Convention coming to the hotel in the near future and he admitted that all the robes were earmarked for them. Uh...What The....? He did graciously offer to upgrade our friends and family to a larger suite if they ever come to Vegas. Nice offer, but I would never recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Vegas to gamble, experience the nightlife, etc--it's just too removed from the action and there is no "action" at this hotel whatsoever (it's a non-gaming hotel which we stupidly didn't realize until after we booked non-refundably...yes I know that's not a word). I'm not even going to go into the security issue our friends had (he has also promised a TA post and I'm sure he'll address THAT goat rodeo). Next time, I'm paying more and staying at the Wynn or...well...ANYPLACE else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking lobby, expected more than a nice lobby with shabby rooms and bad service.”
Reviews.Author: pattindave
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trump International in Las Vegas for my Wedding and was beyond disappointment. We have 4 rooms for us and extended family. The rooms were broken down, literally. From the broken sink to the broken armoire and the lights that were burned out. There were so many thing wrong... they changed our room and then apologized by sending a bottle of wine and strawberries to the wrong room. We had several "managers" try to solve these issues and I believe they were mostly inexperienced and could not solve problems. I was so disappointed, I wrote a letter (4 pages) and sent it (twice) to the Trump Organization in New York as well as the Hotel in Las Vegas. No response. Very Bad experience. Surprised the "The Donald" puts his name on it. I do not think he would like to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Quiet hotel, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Whidbeykat
Reviews.Content: We are travelling from Washington to Oklahoma for a move and decided to stop in Las Vegas for a weekend. Service: This is a 5 star hotel. The service was top notch. I have never received better service from a hotel. They made us feel very welcome from the moment we pulled up to the valet. (Note, there is only valet parking. No self parking.) Location: The hotel is located across the street from Fashion Show Mall. However there are no crosswalks or anything to easily get there. There are shuttles that run to the Wynn hotel and Caesars Palace, however we never used them. The most convenient way to get around to the casinos was to take a cab. Or walk, but by the time we made it to the other end of the strip (Mandalay Bay) we were too exhausted to walk all the way back. Room: We booked through Orbitz for Strip View Suite. After checking in when we went to our room we found it was a Mountain View Room. The mountain view is not bad, just don't look down. That part of town is filled with gentlemen's establishments and erotic stores. After showing my reservation email to the front desk they moved us to a strip view room with no problem. However that room was missing a few of the amenities that were included, such as bottled water and bath mats. We also had booked a "Pet Resort" room which was supposed to include a bed for the dog, water bowl, and an extra bottle of water. After contacting housekeeping all of these items were promptly delivered to our room. Each room also shares a foyer with the neighboring room. There are doorbells and lights for the do not disturb. Cleanliness: Over all the hotel was immaculate. Our room however was another story. The shower head was dirty. And the corners of the shower had buildup. That is why I had to only give 4/5 for cleanliness. However again after contacting housekeeping they came up promptly to clean the shower. The rest of the room was already very clean, including the giant spa bathtub. Pets: We chose this hotel in particular because we didn't want to just treat ourselves, but our dogs too. The pet fee was $200, which covered our entire stay. Which is very reasonable if you are staying more than two nights in Las Vegas. Unlike other hotels the Trump hotel actually welcomes your dogs and allows them to walked through the lobby. Most other hotels I have stayed at have asked that dogs not ever be brought through the lobby. For a $20 fee you have have your dogs walked for you or you can take them out to the pet area yourself. The only downside to the pet area is the astroturf. Neither of my dogs would go to the bathroom on the "carpet." Luckily there was a grassy area next to the parking garage outside the hotel. Room Service: After driving so far to get there we ordered room service on the first night. The waiter was extremely friendly and polite. He came in a laid out a table cloth, set the table with silverware, and then served our dinner as if we were at a restaurant. The food was piping hot, but nothing spectacular.
