Overall: Best hotel stay I have ever had. And if you want to go to Vegas without being in the middle of the strip then this the hotel for you. This hotel does not have a casino and so it is ideal if you have kids travelling with you. Also, the entire property is smoke free, which is something very much desired after spending any amount of time in a casino.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: hp66SquamishBcCanada
Reviews.Content: We found a price online and called the hotel we were given the same price.When we arrived Morgan (awesome service) gave us an upgrade to the 50th floor,corner suite with a view of the strip.Beautiful room,the bed was sooo comfy as for the golfer who said it needs an upgrade obviously has been hit too many times in the head with an 9 iron.The bathroom with an oversized jacuzzi tub with a view of the strip was amazing.The best part is NO CASINO AND NO SMOKING.Mr trump I will stay in your hotel again,service was great.

Reviews.Title: “**EMPLOYEES, BROKE IN & STOLE $$$***”
Reviews.Author: muleyman69
Reviews.Content: Our manufacture recommended us to stay here since our meeting was held in this hotel. The first morning I didn't want to be disturbed, the next thing I know a "housekeeper" came in without saying a word! I told her to get out! That night we returned from our meeting to find ALL OUR CASH hidden in our bags, and MEDICATION was stolen!!! I called security, they brought up the woman that "wasn't given permission" to clean our room. She denied all of it...Lawsuit will be filed. DO NOT STAY HERE....DO NOT STAY HERE...DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Too fency, doesn't worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Kereni
Reviews.Content: It looks impressive, but it is not from the inside. There is nothing to do there, close to the mall but not more than that. Service was bad as we didn't have the spare bed for the bay when arrived at 10pm didn't have electricity to use the hob and it took them a long time to fix it everything there is too expensive for NO reason Didn't like it - only liked the beds and bath - high quality!

Reviews.Title: “opulent , grand, great location, and great price”
Reviews.Author: cp04mcg
Reviews.Content: where do i start on this one, one of the best hotels i have stayed in, and maybe the cheapest ! there is great competition in vegas , but the donald has surpassed all my expectations with this hotels - everything was top quality , but the price was so cheap, so would certainly go back again. very friendly staff, from the door staff to the reception, to the valet. the only hotel that near this one in quality is ashford castle

Reviews.Title: “Sheer perfection if you love perfection!!”
Reviews.Author: Blessedalwayz
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review sitting in my room two days before I check out because I can't wait to tell everyone how amazing this hotel is! I am actually a hotelier,so I'm ultra picky about perfection, but I must say this hotel blew my wife and I away! The service is on another level,from the bartenders Omar and Marvin, to MaryBeth who always refills ur coffee during breakfast! She is like a hawk,always watching your cup,and when it gets to half, here she is. We had the chef's apetizer platter at the bar...wow! Location is perfect,on the strip,but I love the fact that there is no casino,so it is actually SMOKE FREE!! The rooms are very tastefully furnished,with jacuzzi tubs large enough for two...the pool is outdoor,and as we are here in Feb,not too ideal as it is outdoors. I was also disappointed by the lack of robes, slippers and shower gel in the rooms,as well as in room safes. I think for a hotel of this class,we need safes in the rooms at the very least. They allow small pets but at a $200 fee! We left our 100 pound German Shepherd at home. Shopping is right across the street from the hotel...litterally! Quite pricey though! If you are a midnight owl like me, please indulge in the Trump Sundae at 2am...which we are enjoying right now...speaking of which,I gotta go! I can't wait to stay here really soon! We just found our new "spot"!

Reviews.Title: “11/10 Gold Star”
Reviews.Author: Deniseb64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Trump for a week mid January 2011. What a fantasic hotel. I would say the best I have stayed in the US and I have been travelling for some 40 years. Absolutely everything about Trump International is first class. From the minute we checked in we couldn't have asked for more. The hotel is beautiful. The staff are wonderful with special mention going to Ryan the bell captain and the waiters in DT's restaurant. The fixed price menu is a must. Thank you all for a memorable last trip to Vegas. I would love to think that I will return in the future but in the meantime urge anyone reading this review to book Trump any other hotel in Vegas will not come anywhere near. Oh and the fact that Trump is a non gambling hotel is a real bonus there are plenty of other places to gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: JoanieGray
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded without requesting it and were given an amazing suite on the 42nd floor Without a doubt the best hotel we have stayed in - and we've traveled a lot - stunning views of the mountains - every comfort of home and more - excellent service - very comfortable beds and fabulous bathroom with huge jacuzzi bath - plenty of wardrobe space with automatic lighting - fully fitted kitchen - flat screen TV's in every room. Spoiled us for other would be 5 star hotels now !!! Donald Trump has created the ultimate 5 star hotel. We will be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a makeover already”
Reviews.Author: Davidgolfer
Reviews.Content: Overpriced for a very average facility hotel Uncomfortable beds poor quality furniture and fittings. No parking Everything is an extra! We booked for a week stay but checked out after 2 days Over hyped hotels

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang For Your Buck”
Reviews.Author: SuperCool_MattDavid
Reviews.Content: We pricelined this at $75 a night - even with the $20 per night resort fee, the basic studio is still a killer deal. The location is not the best, but if you're healthy and can walk, who cares. The only gripe, aside from having to walk a couple blocks to get to the strip, was the $100 per night hold. We stayed 4 nights, so it was $400 in holds, plus $80 in resort fees ($20 x 4), plus $300 ($75 x 4) for our base fare. The $100 per night hold is a bad business move; and I doubt it does anything but aggravate travelers who get surprised by this (Generally people who travel on a budget and/or work for a living). Most of the guests are big-money travelers, but there were a few blue collar stiffs such as myself. Aside from that, honestly, we got a great deal for what we paid and will likely make Trump our de facto place to stay for all future Vegas Trips. It's essentially a 5 star at a 4 star price.

Reviews.Title: “Second time I have stayed there and it's never a let down! Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Jasmineo84
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a friend. I was a little hesitant in staying there as it wasn't on the strip. However I was pleasantly surprised about the location when I checked in. It is just across the road from Fashion Show Mall, which opens up onto the strip. It is also walking distance to the Wynn & Encore. If you don't like walking there is a shuttle to the Wynn & Encore and another to the Forum Shops @ Ceaser's Palce. The rooms at Trump in my opinion are the best quality for the price you pay. All of the rooms were built to be sold off as studios, so all have a kitchenettes. The bed's are kingsize and so plush, I always have a good night sleep here. Bathrooms are large and have a TV in the mirror, spa bath and large shower. I haven't eaten at DJT, but I have spent many nights at the bar before heading out and the staff are fantastic. Always helpful and happy to assist. The room service is great, it is 24 hours so if you arrive in early or late you can always get a meal. I have stayed at many places in Las Vegas, and value for money Trump always tops the list. The thing I like about it the best, is that it is non-smoking and doesn't have a casino. The last thing you want when you get in after a big night out in Vegas is to get lost in a Casino trying to find your room.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!!”
Reviews.Author: deansf76
Reviews.Content: The fact that this hotel doesn't have a casino shouldn't put you off staying here. The hotel is immaculacte and the service is out of this world!!!! The only down side is it's location but that still isn't enough to put a blemish against this wonderful hotel. After spending most of the day in other hotels and their attractions, it is a pleasure to come back to your hotel and not have the ringing of machines, coins or loud voices as you walk in. The restaurant has a modern menu with stunning food and the bar will have pretty much anything that you would like to drink. The pool area never looses any sun and has 2 outdoor jacuzzi pools. Plus a good size gym that will never leave you waiting for equipment to use. In all, for me anyway, this is the best hotel in Las Vegas bar none!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN VEGAS. PERIOD.”
Reviews.Author: kiki_kg
Reviews.Content: It's SOOO nice to have a hotel that makes if feel like you're coming HOME after being out all day. I love that there is no casino - you can have all the fun you want outside the hotel, but it's nice to come back somewhere you can truly relax at the end of the day. The pool is amazing. Never TOO busy. Nice shallow area to lounge. You have to pay for use of the cabanas, but they have a bunch of 'beds' available that have pillows and are very comfy. Fantastic service. Oh, and the adjacent fitness room is nice too - overlooks the pool and everything is new - and all the machines have personal TVs. The hotel is 10x more elegant than all the tacky hotels in vegas. The rooms are nicer that you'll find at Bellagio or Palazzo or anywhere else. It's RIGHT across the street from the mall. There are shuttles over to the Wynn - where you can walk wherever you want. Quite frankly, the hotels are all so huge in Vegas that you have to cab it anywhere during the day because walking in the heat just kills you. I stay at the Trump 2-3 times a year. Anytime I try something new I'm disappointed. The rooms are huge. The rates are great. The sheets and duvets give you the best sleep. The bathrooms are huge - the in-mirror TVs are nice. They have usable kitchens if you want to save some money and at least eat breakfast in the room... Honestly, I can't say enough about this hotel. The staff, the food, the rooms, EVERYTHING is better than you'll find anywhere else in Vegas - especially considering the price! I don't know how anybody can put a bad review up for this hotel. It costs the same to stay at Paris and other older hotels that can't even COMPARE!

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISSAPOINTED....THE NAME PRECEEDS ITSELF!"”
Reviews.Author: Bri_Rose
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trump this past weekend. This was my second trip to Vegas; my last stay was that the New York, New York, and I like that hotel so much better. The best things about the Trump International were its close proximity to the Fashion Show Mall and the fragrant lobby. Our room was just average, very small to be a “city view suite”. The sofa bed was the worst mattress I’ve every slept on. I would have been better off sleeping on a sleeping bag. The hotel management was not very accommodating with upgrading our room. They did however offer us a mattress topper. We had a rental car and the valet kept listing the care under the wrong name. We stayed on the 34th floor and rarely got a cell signal. The only way we got a good signal is by standing right in front of the window. The bellmen were very friendly but overall I was very disappointed with my stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place is fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: enerjoyce
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice. The building, amenities, service and comfort features are without equal. The single complaint is that the shuttle to other sites can make one wait longer than ideal. Any other issues I had with anything were resolved to my full satisfaction. The best feature of the facility is that it is completely non-smoking--- a rarity in Vegas. Unfortunately, it seems some guests must go ahead and smoke in the room, so we moved from one room, due to smell. The location is close to the airport, shopping, downtown and other strip hot spots.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmoreBella
Reviews.Content: What a great expierence! From checking in to the Awesome room...TV in the Bathroom... kitchenet...Zero Fridge Trump really pays attention to detail..the room was spacious very clean and a great view... Everyone is very friendly from front door staff to cleaning ladies... I don't think I can say one bad thing about it...I loved the fact that there was no gambling in the building...but there was a shuttle to the WYNN every 10 minuets Pool was spectcacular..warm water... Gym extraordinary,,,everything looked new and all machines were working Overall Awesome expierence!

Reviews.Title: “Legendary Bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Oldsurfer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trump for 2 nights in Jan 2011. I have been to Vegas 3 times before , but always there for work. Staying at the Trump gives you the escape from the rush, noise and chaos on the strip hotels. There is no casino so coming back to the hotel it is calm and no distractions to getting to your room - the noise of slot machines is absent and is a relief. The rooms are great, modern but not too glitzy. The bathroom was amazing, huge and the jacuzzi could fit half a football team in. The shower was very large as well but the water jets felt underpowered. I only ate breakfast the restaurant , but is was very good. The location may put some people off but it is still in easy walking distance to the strip and in normal hours you can cross the road and wlak right into Fashion Mall. For a good value hotel with good staff and amazing bathrooms i would book again

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service from the staff; location not ideal”
Reviews.Author: Rasmus H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trump for one night in December 2010. The first I noticed upon checking in is the amazing service you get from the staff. They are extremely pleasant and very good at making you feel welcome and trying to connect with you. Shortly after I got to my room, the front desk even called up just to check if everything was okay. Very nice touch. When I checked out, there were a couple of people in front of me in the line, so a manager came over, and personally took me to his adjacent office for the check out. He was very pleasant and took a great interest in asking about my stay in Vegas, where I was from, etc. The room itself was very large and had great amenities, including kitchen facilities and a huge bathroom. My room was on a high floor and there was a good although slightly distant view of the strip. You could also see the mountains and such around Vegas which was nice. I preferred a view closer to the strip though, such as the Bellagio. The location is definitely not ideal. It's in the Wynn-end of the Strip and not on the actual Strip itself. Although only a short walk, to get to the hotel you have to walk on a bit of a dodgy and dark side road which feels a little uncomfortable. To to be fair, the hotel offers a free shuttle between the hotel and the Wynn, and also another shuttle to the Forum Shops, although it is less frequent. Aside from the location which is not perfect (although not as bad as, say, The Palms), it is a great, modern hotel with great, spacious rooms and amazing service.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the value but a peaceful sleep was not in the cards.”
Reviews.Author: ladyandgent
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful in almost every way. We passed through Las Vegas on a road trip and stayed here for 4 nights. The rooms are large, the hotel looks clean, the location is close but not too close to the strip. This is an excellent hotel for business or pleasure, extended stays or short trips but here are a few draw backs. Positives: The room was exceptional! We had a kitchenette, a large sitting area, state of the art washroom, and an amazingly comfortable bed . The value for the location is amazing. We are not party people, drinkers or big gamblers so being slightly off the strip with no casino was a plus for us. Negatives: Staff could be described as cold at best. They were not very helpful (apart from the door man and valet) and really seemed like they had better things to do than answer questions or give directions. As I mentioned, you can't beat the value, but a peaceful sleep was not in the cards. Each morning during the stay we were woken up twice by a train which would sounds its whistle as it was going by, (this wasn't horrible as the bed was so fabulous we fell right back to sleep). The common spaces, (apart from the restaurant) lacked any form or character or style. We have already recommended this hotel to friends and will continue to (with the proper warnings, IE: train).

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Luiz_Ferreira
Reviews.Content: Me and My with got a standard room trough priceline for 2 nights. But we were offered an upgrade to a 1-bedroom suite facing the strip and, for U$20 a night, let’s take it! Here are our thoughts: - Nice lobby and Staff very friendly; - The pool is nice; - Elevators very fast; - Hotel very well kept and clean; - The room is awesome! Very big and beautiful. The views are amazing! - Very nice bathroom, with a Jacuzzi; - Yes, it’s not in the middle of the strip. But we had a car, and within minutes we were everywhere; - There's a really nice mall in front of the hotel; - Free valet parking (don't forget to tip!) We’d definitely go back! We enjoyed it more than Caesars. Actually, we found it to be more elegant than Caesars. Some might disagree, but this was our point of view. Some would complain that it doesn't have a casino and it is far to walk to the other casinos. But, though I like to play poker, we only wanted to stay in a nice and quiet hotel. And we got it!

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: jsdive
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel with an outstanding restaurant. It is a short walk from the Las Vegas strip, and a delightful oasis from the bustling crowds of the strip. The hotel staff were available and polite, but not overbearing. The room (4517) is beautifully appointed, and I loved the high tech gadgets the room had. Sadly, a few things broke in our room which keeps the hotel from being perfect. The switch controlling the bath-tub jacuzzi broke, but was quickly replaced. The towel rack was broken, and tile in the shower was cracked. Finally, the "housekeeping wanted" signal light was stuck, and we couldn't turn the darn thing off.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: JMS7-8
Reviews.Content: The hubby and I just returned from a 3-night stay at the Trump, and we loved it. We've stayed at many hotels in Las Vegas, and the Trump will be our home base from now on. We loved the no-casino and non-smoking environment. (Also, the hotel smells fantastic when you enter!) When they found we were celebrating our 10th anniversary, they upgraded our room and sent champagne. The staff was efficient and friendly. Check-in went smoothly. Trump will let you check out as late as 4PM if you arrange it with the front desk, and that's a big plus. The room was very clean, spacious, and had a nifty kitchenette with complimentary water, and really good coffee. Our room had a great view of the Strip, The bathroom was spotless and the whirlpool tub was easily big enough for two. We used the hotel shuttle to get back-and-forh to the Strip and found it very convenient for our purposes. Patrons who don't like to hoof it may find themselves using taxis alot, as the shuttle only goes to the Wynn and to Ceasar's Palace. We visited the hotel dining room once for breakfast, and the only negative was the oatmeal. They advertise it as "steel-cut oats," but it looked and tasted like Instant oatmeal. Overall, we LOVED the Trump, and even with their $20 resort fee, they offer lovely accommodations at a really reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: ammersDonegal
Reviews.Content: I had been a bit worried about having booked this hotel before going as people said in the forum that it was a bit far from the strip. It is if you want to spend a lot of time down by Tropicana or Mandalay bay. However there is no hotel on the strip that is close to everything. I found the location to be very good. The check in process was very easy, we checked in early & our room was ready for us which was fantastic. The room was spacious, well laid out & very comfortable. The view from out strip view room was fantastic. We could see the fountains at belagio and the Eifiel tower at Paris from our room. Amoung other things. The bathroom was very spacious too & very luxurious. The only fault with the room was that there was a kettle provided but no tea bags, we found some nearby however. All in all, it was a great stay & I would highly recommend Trump International.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! One my list of best hotel stays”
Reviews.Author: vpagew
Reviews.Content: My husband purchased our hotel on hotwire (5star) for $92/night. It was excited to find out it was for The Trump International. It was a suite but a perfect size for the two of us. Bathroom: The suite has a large jacuzzi tub, separate (toilet) next to the separate large shower. Both the shower and the toilet areas are separate by an opaque glass, so it's not 100% private but a nice touch. The television is built is built into the mirror in the bathroom which is fantastic. Room/Suite The bed was comfortable, and so were the pillows. The flat screen television can be adjusted. The kitchen was nice, it had a microwave, stove top burners, coffee pot and a mini refrigerator. The only downfall was that there was a nice tea kettle but no tea. There was Wolf Gang Puck coffee and creamers but no tea bags. We stopped at the whole foods about 5 minutes from there to get tea bags. Also, there were two telephones which we never used, desk, sofa and two nice chairs. Best of all was THE VIEW! We were on the 55th floor facing the train, but we could see majority of the city. (yes, we heard the loud horns the first night around 3am but after that we slept right through them). Also the bible in the drawer is gold. :) Service: The Trump employees were very nice. They asked us if we would like an upgrade for additional $50/night but we declined. The valet guys were fairly fast. The longest we waited for our car was 5 minutes on a busy Friday night. We expected longer from the other reviews we had read. The only downfall as for service is that room service will come into your room every day- wanting it or not. If you leave your "do not disturb" bottom on all day, expect to come back with multiple phone calls from housekeeping wanting to come into your room. Nice I guess but a bit annoying. Location It's not bad. It's off the strip which you can either take the free shuttle which will take you to either The Wynn or Caesars Palace. The Wynn really is close to the hotel- walking in about 5 minutes and Caesars is about 20minutes walking. You can walk through the Fashion Mall (Nordstorms) if it is too cold or too hot outside. Additional Thought You will be charged a $20 resort fee which will include 2 bottles of water, a newspaper (which we never saw), shuttle service and internet. There is a tax of $2 a day for this fee. Very strange but there is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel the is very close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: Sagees
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trump International on from January 10th through the 14th. I was there on business for a couple internet conventions including Affiliate Summit which was hosted at the Wynn. Location: Was splendid. I was about a seven m,inute walk from the Wynn and a about a 15 minute walk from the Pallazo. Those two are one the strip which makes the hotel close to everything, yet in a quite corner of its own. There are also curtsy shuttles that take you to the Cesars and the Wynn every hour. Price: Resort fee ????: First off, when you get to the hotel and check in, you will be informed that there is an extra $20 resort fee per night. I don't know if its just a Vegas way of screwing customers, but this was the Trump way of saying; have some internet and a newspaper every morning, you will be paying for it anyway :). Even if you have an Ipad and have all the internet you need, and have the NYC with you at anytime, have some of ours, we are not really giving you any choice here :). Breakfast: I had breakfast at the hotel my first morning. Its a decent buffet for $20. Including fresh orange juice and Starbucks coffee*. Well, i learned it was not exactly any Starbucks coffee. I enjoyed my breakfast and decided to conclude it with a Starbucks cappuccino. To my dismay, a cappuccino must not fit under the "Starbucks Coffee" definition. I was billed $8 for the coffee. Did the waiter mention anything about an extra charge, naaa, he just slapped it on there with a smile. not only was i surprised that the coffee was not included in the breakfast, the $8 prices tags sent shivers up my spine. That has to be the most expensive cup of coffee i ever drank. In NYC we complain about $3.50 for Starbucks. $8 is Ludicrous!!!! I paid $360 a night for the weekend nights which is very expensive, but it was one of the busiest weekends that Vegas has all year around since CES was taking place. I paid 100$ on the following Sunday after the convention was over which is a great value. Service: The employees of the hotel seemed to be very happy and helpful. They would always smile and greet you if passed in a hotel hallway. Im sure Trump management electrocutes them if they dont, just kidding. But it was actually a positive experience. Unfortunately, the smile and readiness to assist you did not come through when i needed it. I checked in on a Thursday afternoon. I immediately left the hotel for a couple evening meetings. When i returned later that even i was exhausted and wanted get an early night of sleep. I got in bed and realized that if i lay in the middle, i would roll to the right side as if the bed was tilted. I looked under the bed and tried to figure out if anything was causing the bed to be uneven. I was not able to find a quick fix and slept on the far left side of the bed till morning being too fatigued to call room service and start a process. I awoke in the morning and on my way to breakfast reported the problem concierge and was told the problem would be taken care of by the time i got back to the hotel later that day. To my surprise, i found nothing had been done when i returned to the hotel at around 7PM that evening. I called reception and expressed my disconcert that nothing had been done. They sent up a maintenance man to help out. The maintenance fellow was very nice, but did not know what was chasing the bed to displace. He called in another fellow who asked me what i wanted done. I was a bit confused since, i was not familiar with the bed construction and did not know what solution would alleviate the problem. I told him a new matters would probably fix the issue, or maybe its just the box spring i mentioned. after about 20 minutes of both of us caring the mattress of and on and then sitting on the two box springs, i realized one of the box springs was broken. I asked the second maintenance guy to replace the one box spring. He came back about 20 minutes later and the sinking mattress problem was solved. After the issue was solved, the employee that was assisting me assumed me that housekeeping would come by and make the bed after the sheets had been thrown all over the floor during our QA extravaganza. I told him that its fine, that i was going out for a couple hours and that as long that the they get new sheets and make the bed by 12:00 midnight, i will be happy. I came back to the room at around 2:00 am and nothing was done. I called reception again and explained the entire story again. They did send someone up about 20 minutes after my call to make the bed. All in all i got a good nights rest, but i did waist a good deal of time doing the hotels job, and i would expect a much high level of service for a hotel that charges $360 a night not including a $20 report fee and $8 for a cappuccino. Rooms: I think all the rooms are suits. I stayed on the 31 floor and had a very nice studio suit. The bathroom is very large and had a tv embedded in the mirror. The bathroom also had a nigh jet bath or Jacuzzi. There was a small fringe and mini chicken to cook up a small meal. The pillows were wonderful, with a wide section to choose from. I had a view towards the lower part of the strip which looked great at night.

Reviews.Title: “Short on expectations”
Reviews.Author: Istenya88
Reviews.Content: The good: No casino in the hotel, valet was friendly, bartenders were kind, rooms were big, huge bubbly bath tub for two. The bad: No hot water, and when we notified the hotel staff-the engineer called us back at 4:30 am (WTF?). Also, I booked through Priceline and spent more on the studio than if I booked with the hotel. We found no room service menu. My advice is to a) stay somewhere else and b) book either when you arrive in vegas or by phone.

Reviews.Title: “Spa at Trump and Valet”
Reviews.Author: lvtravelngirl
Reviews.Content: I did not stay in any of the rooms but I did use valet service for parking and I was a guest of the spa. A very lackluster spa, at best! Unlike an earlier reviewer, I found the valet service to be typical of Vegas- 10 to 15 minute wait for my car. It was mid day; I would expect a longer wait in the evening though. The valet was very friendly and asked if I needed directions or assistance upon exiting the area. The lobby area was very nice and clean. My disappointment is soley with the spa. The personnel were mostly friendly (the front desk staff were a bit stuffy and uppity). I absolutely LOVED my therapist Morgan and spa attendant, Christine- they were incredibly friendly and the only positive things going for the spa. The spa only has one small sauna and one small steam room and 4 shower stalls. The changing area/locker room is very small (10x10). The spa lacks a vanity area, as well as such amenities (hair dryer, etc). I also noticed that the towels are not restocked frequently- for example, there are ice towels just outside the sauna area; there were only two face cloths left when I exited the sauna and they were wet cloths, as the ice had melted. The co ed relaxation room is also very small and is only stocked with apples and cucumber water; there is more than enough reading material though. The amenities offered (and lack thereof) is not commensurate with the prices charged for services. I have frequented other spas on the Strip as well as at the off Strip/locals' casinos and this spa is by far the most disappointing and most lackluster of them all.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good - could not fault”
Reviews.Author: TravelTiger2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights around NYE. The check-in was smooth and professional. The room faced the strip and had a good view of the fireworks (41st floor). It was a good size room with a private small entrance shared with the neighbour. The tv in the bathroom mirror was a great touch and made the use of the spa more enjoyable. The bed and the pillows are very comfortable. The WIFI was very quick and easy to log on. The valet parking was fine and we never waited more than 5 minutes. Those that complain about the location are frankly, a little lazy. It's just across Fashion Show and only 5 minutes to the Venetian. Who's ever in a rush in Vegas?

Reviews.Title: “I REALLY FELT A VIP PERSON”
Reviews.Author: CarlosBernabe
Reviews.Content: Very well located in front of the Fashion mall with many couture stores. We had a VIP check in ( a special room for some guests) and the room…amazing, 3 LCD TVs, champagne, chocolates. The hotel has an amazing Spa, a huge swimming pool (with life guards) and in close to everything in town

Reviews.Title: “You're Fired!”
Reviews.Author: lytebrite
Reviews.Content: The Donald would not have put up with the lax housekeeping, the broken internet and the non-functional amenities at this, his Vegas statement hotel. The first room I got reeked of cigar smoke-this in a fully non-smoking hotel. OK, called downstairs and got another room. Moved there and started to get to work. At least I thought I did. The WiFi cxn is not working. I'm a tech guy here for a tech convention (CES) so I think I know when the wifi is not working. Spent the better half of an hour trying to get it working until the CSR says, "Most of the new check-ins are having problems." Really? I call down to the Front Desk and of course all of the other rooms are gone, OK. Well, at least I can relax and take advantage of their luxuriously large jacuzzi tub. WRONG. The switch for the jacuzzi doesn't work. I call down to tell them to tell Maintenance to fix it before I get back from the convention the next day. It wasn't. Hey, I can understand that you're busy, but if you tell me you're going to do something, I expect you'll be getting it done. The Donald would expect it. You're fired!

Reviews.Title: “the most incredible rooms at amazing prices - trump really does vegas”
Reviews.Author: philipellis
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for one night in between christmas and new year 2010. we were over nighting from our hotel in san diego. our party of three was myself and my two daughters in their early 20s. I chose the trump because a casino was a no-no for my 20 year old (she was actually ID'd and asked to leave the Bellagio casino) and the trump's proximity to the fashion mall made it a yes yes for the girls we caught a cab from the airport to the Hotel - 10 mins at most - and were disappointed to find that at 12.30 pm our rooms weren't ready - despite my pre-requesting by email an early check in. Nonetheless, we left our bags with a porter, and popped literally across the road to the Fashion Mall. It really is a fabulous mall, and we stopped to watch the catwalk show on the walkway and stage that arose from the concourse; you've got to see it to believe it but it was sensational - I guess that's why it's called the fashion show mall. we returned to the hotel at 3 pm to check in, and our rooms were ready. I'd used air miles to get these rooms, so they kinda cost nothing, so when the receptionist offered us upgrades for $50, I chose to upgrade the girls' room. nonetheless I was also upgraded free of charge to a strip view room. (although my view of the strip was in fact a view of the back of Treasure Island which sits at the bottom of the strip - if we were staying there longer or if I hadn't previously stayed at the Bellagio ON the strip I might have cared) we took the elevator up to the 39th floor, and reached my room first. each pair of rooms at the trump is separated from the corridor by another doorway and a small hallway. I have never seen this before and it meant there was no corridor noise audible in the bedrooms. brilliant. my room was sensational. a big comfy bed, a beautiful lounge, and a well equipped kitchen. the bathroom was great - a huge jacuzzi bath and separate shower and wc in it's own enclosure. it is the best room I have ever stayed in in any hotel........ until I saw the room the girls had been given a few doors down the corridor from my room was their suite; again a small hallway with their adjacent room, and then entry into a big lounge with an even fuller kitchen and a separate toilet and shower. then a good sized bedroom with a huge bathroom including a full size make up table, and, as in my room, a television built into the mirror spectacular, spacious, awesome, breathtaking - I don't have the words. this room really had to be seen to be believed, and if you can get it at a good rate, it is unbeatable. both rooms were very clean - maybe a little meagre with toiletries in the bathroom but no other criticism whatsoever. we went for a swim - the pool was warm but very shallow and we were the only lunatics there as it was so cold. the life guard said it is a law that governs the depth of pools where alcohol is served but this only only came half way to my chest - and I'm only 5'10 ish. the poolside chairs were comfy but the pool itself disappointing - a largish featureless rectangular pool. I wanted to be wowed by the pool and wasn't.I recall the pool at the bellagio and the other strip hotels were spectacular. c'est la vie. at night we went to see the O show at the bellagio. We queued for the buffet there before the show and made a mistake; the queue took over an hour and a half and though we got there at 7.30 we weren't seated til gone 9 and kinda had to hurry our food (which would have been sensational) to get to the show which started at 10 pm. a lesson learnt, and it was a shame that we were only in vegas for one night and we spent an hour and a half queuing- the girls didn't even see the fountains the O show was unbelievable - though very expensive and I couldn't find discounted tickets anywhere. I was initially disappointed to find we were sat on row 2 ( too close to the front I thought - we won't be able to take it in) but the show was awesome and we loved it. we were close enough to see the performer's faces and expressions and it was wonderful. If we ever go back again, I'd sit further back to see what we missed (if anything) but the show was great. On our return to the Trump, the concierge incredibly quickly checked us in for our flights and printed our boarding cards the next day, we got a cab to take us to the "Welcome to Las Vegas" sign and then along the strip to Ceaser's, where the girls were just as blown away by the shops as I had been 5 years ago. Vegas has changed a lot since then; it's much bigger and busier but still has the power to astound. We had arranged a late check out from the Trump, and returned mid afternoon to collect our cases and fly back to San Diego. For the rooms alone, I would stay here again in a heartbeat, but the Bellagio had something extra and the view of the fountains and the strip - it would be a hard choice.

Reviews.Title: “A Night In Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: oktotravelanytime
Reviews.Content: A very nice 4 Star hotel. Less that $100 this time of year (Dec 23) including all taxes and %15 "resort fee." Parking is free; just tip the valet. Check-in and staff very pleasant. Rooms large and beautifully furnished. Not much in the way of amenities. A few minor faults with the room--a light bulb out, some molding falling off the closet, a few stains here and there. Nicely located about 1 block off the strip. Quiet. No casino; no smoke. Handy kitchenette in room.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas for New Years at the Amazing Trump International”
Reviews.Author: Jennalee333
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Trump International for two nights around New Years. The hotel was great! We were able to upgrade our room into a super large and luxurious suite with a view of the Strip. The amenities in the room were immaculate right down to the tv in the mirror in the bathroom. I would highly recommend this suite to any guest, we found the upgrade price very reasonable and in retrospect a great value. The Trump does not have a casino so it is a little different than most Vegas hotels. You are able to walk through the lobby without all the noise, bright lights, and smoke. It really is a positive. Being just off the strip isn't really a problem. You are within a five minute walk to the fashion show mall and the Wynn. The Trump is not in the middle of the strip but there are numerous shuttles that run to Caesars so you can always take advantage of that. We highly recommend this hotel especially if you can book for a reduced rate compared to the more centrally located properties. And take the upgrade if you can, you won't regret it. Have a great trip and good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Ab Fab”
Reviews.Author: Amadusa
Reviews.Content: After the disappointment of our San Francisco Hotel the Trump was a tonic. We upgraded to a corner suite for about £17 each per night and it was fabulous. The bathroom alone was bigger than our previous hotel room. Although the Trump is off the main drag it is only about 5 minutes through the Fashion Show Mall (via Nordstrom). The room was so nice and the view so good I would have happily stayed in the room and lived off the room service menu. I think the lack of casino is a positive as it makes it a haven of tranquility after the frenetic activity of the strip. Strongly recommend this hotel for both quality, professionalism of staff and value - and a bit of bling (the lobby in particular). Rooms are tasteful and understated with excellent fittings. The beds are the most comfortable I've ever slept on in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room and great value!”
Reviews.Author: Engineer911
Reviews.Content: I lived in vegas for a few years but have visited as a tourist LOTS and I am very particular about rooms and service. I stayed here for about 12 nights straight on business in December and I was a little hesitant about not staying in a typical casino-hotel... Let's just say it was such a great decision to give Trump a chance! Basically Trump was amazing. My room was a 1 bedroom suite on the 46th floor with a perfect view of the strip facing south. I had a full living room and dining area with full kitchen that had top notch appliances like a sub-zero fridge and freezer. The living room had a huge wrap around sofa that made into a bed and had a flatscreen TV. The bedroom had a king bed with another flatscreen and a huge bathroom. The bathroom had a shower with two shower heads. It also had a big jacuzzi tub and had a tv inside the mirror in the vanity. Both rooms had floor to ceiling windows with an amazing view. It was like having my own penthouse apartment while in vegas and you have no idea how much money you will save by having a full kitchen in your room. They will even get you groceries if you ask. They charge a $20 a day resort fee but it includes bottled water daily, valet parking, and wireless Internet. The room is top notch. It is right across the street from Fashion Show mall which has awesome restaurants and shopping. Not having a casino downstairs also saves you a ton (at least it did for me!) If you get a good rate on the hotel then I highly recommend the Trump. Honestly the ONLY issue I had was that ATT cell service from my room was terrible. Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a deal....!”
Reviews.Author: CHChiswick
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, with all of the 5-Star bells & whistles you'd hope for at a great price...without the incessant tinkling of fruit machines & gambling paraphernalia - you can go up the road for all that if required. I will certainly go back - but I'll make sure to get a room on the side away from the train lines....those early morning sirens are b****y loud....!

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and luxury”
Reviews.Author: bajohnhoey
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I stayed here in November and I wasn't going to write a review until I saw a few negative comments on the hotel which I don't think are justified as the staff, service and the property itself are truly exceptional. We usually stay at Hilton/Conrad for the loyalty scheme but their hotels are not up to par in Vegas (IMHO).....we took a chance on Trump and it paid off. From the Doormen giving us a warm welcome to reception, to the staff at the pool, everyone seemed pleased that we were staying there. After a long flight from London it was very welcome. It is extremely convenient for the mall although the food at the pool bar was so good we didn't need the food court! To tell you how impressed I was, my Brother is getting married in September and my wedding gift is their honeymoon...I was going to send them to the Conrad Bali but now it's going to be Vegas, and the Trump. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC - YOU HAVE JUST GOT TO STAY HERE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bobbys_Mum
Reviews.Content: Stayed for New Year at the Trunp and did not know whether to expect being whistled out of bed all night by the dreaded train or having worn out shoes from the trek to the Strip! Happily none of these were apparent..... true we did hear the train twice but it is nowhere near as bad as some of he reviews had painted and we were on the 19th floor and could see the tracks! The walk to the Strip takes 5 mins - and the location of the Trump means you can escape from the craziness of the Strip and relax in your beautiful room. I say room but my hubby and I were lucky enough to be upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite which was totally breathtaking. Staff were lovely - the only gripe we had was the excessive wait for the Valet Parking. It seemed normal to have to wait 30 mins for your car which we found unacceptable for a 5 star hotel! A lot of hotel guests were parking on the wasteland at the side of the hotel - presumably to avoid the valet service. The Trump really needs its own secure self park garage. On the whole a fabukous experience and this hotel certainly "trumps" its rivals!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible View”
Reviews.Author: Sillymeow
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite at the Trump with a breathtaking view of the strip. The furnishings and bedding were incredibly comfortable, loved the dual showerheads and the spa tub. Especially loved the 4pm checkout!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a 5 star Mystery Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StellaStyle
Reviews.Content: We tried the 5 star Mystery Hotel via Bookit. as the rate was pretty good. For the price we pay , I don't have much complain except i can hear a lot of noise from the outside even when i'm checked in the 38th floor. there's also a long wait to check in and out of the hotel. the shuttle from the forum and the hotel was 20 mins late... considering it's quite close. The room was big. The bed was comfy. The bathroom was also big. The staff are friendly. The room was just cold when we walked in .. took a while to warm up. Overall- I would stay here again but i would probably ask to stay in a much higher floor ( hopefully that will block out the noise ) oh btw.. on top of what we paid for in bookit .. there was an additional resort fee plus taxes that came about $22 bucks extra which was a downer. i guess that's what you get for a complimentary wi fi and 2 water bottles?

Reviews.Title: “Not too close to the strip but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 32332Michelle
Reviews.Content: It's a walk from the strip but the mall is right across so that's a plus. The suite was very comfortable and spacious. Huge bathroom with tv on the mirror, seperate shower and bath tub. A little pricey but if you are looking for non-smoking and no casino it is nice.

Reviews.Title: “5 star all the way”
Reviews.Author: mollyg2000
Reviews.Content: Booked the trip with short notice and not knowing anything about the Trump, but was very pleased with the choice. (Dec.28 – 31st.) By the way if you look around the internet a little you can find some really good deals on this hotel. The hotel would not be for everyone, no casino and no smoking and very quiet, just what we were looking for. It’s not and I’ll repeat this, it’s not that far of a walk to get to all the casinos and noise that you want for a good time. Walk across the street through the Fashion Mall across the bridge to Treasure Island and you are on the strip. The room was fantastic from the kitchen to the bathroom and the beds were great. Room service was very fast and well prepared. We ate breakfast in the restraint one morning and it was very good also. We booked a street view and upgraded to a strip view ($25.00 more a night) and glad we did, beautiful view right down the strip (#5327). We would stay again; it is a 5 star for sure. Only negative was for the $20.00 hotel fee we were to get a newspaper along with internet and two bottles of water. Never received the newspaper, at the same time I did not go to the lobby to tell them. It was not a big deal for me but might be for some.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are good but service is very poor”
Reviews.Author: Spgman
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying at the Trump Towers during the Christmas Holiday. I could not believe Donald Trump is managing this hotel in this fashion. I booked the rooms through bookit.com and was made to believe that I was getting two double beds. When I got there I found out there were no double beds in the bedroom but there is a pull out sofa. That said, the pull out bed was one of my most uncomfortable beds I have ever slept on. The bed and everything else in the room was immaculate. My biggest issues: 1) Pull out bed is exceptionally uncomfortable and is unusable. 2) The hotel shuttle to the strip runs ever 30 minutes or 60 minutes depending of the time of day. The shuttle is fairly small, and if you don't get there early enough you have to wait for the next one. They should have multiple shuttles running if its busy. 3) My room was never cleaned. I called multiple times for a cleaning and over two days it was never cleaned. I'm not talking about a turn down service. I'm talking about your average cleaning. I called multiple times. 4) The resort charge is ridiculous at 19.95 a night Rooms are really nice and decor is excellent. My main issue was that the hotel is pretty unresponsive, and for what I paid, I could have stayed at the Aria and it was a little less than the Bellagio. Not worth it in my mind.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaN10
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a very good size and well equipped and this is probably worth the money because it's not expensive but when we booked a Trump hotel in Vegas we were expecting luxury. In 2006 we stayed in The Wynn and it was gorgeous. There is no casino but we didn't see that as an issue because you are not short of them and it's good to see the other hotels anyway. The big downside here is there is no self parking, it's valet all the way which means you have to keep everything in your room which you might need because you cannot get to your car unless you request it. A tip of between 15 to 18 dollars is expected each time you get your car. We like to drive around, sight see and shop but because you cannot just pop back you have to plan your day better. They also have an additional 19.95 dollar resort fee on top of the normal taxes. Nice hotel but too restricting on parking and not a fab view of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Newfiegirl75
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed in, we booked a one bedroom suite with an adjoining studio suite for our 3 teenages. This hotel has it all (except smoking and gaming...which is what we wanted) it is only a short 2 minute walk off the strip and across the street from the Fashion Show mall. The kids loved everything this hotel had to offer! The bathroom in the one bedroom suite was my favorite part of our room...and I truly miss it...lol. We are a family of 5 on a budget and this hotel is for sure a 5 star without the large price tag. If we go to Vegas again this hotel will be the top on our list!!! Thank you Trump for making our family vacation one to remember!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really a nice place”
Reviews.Author: bigbeagle
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that I am somewhat hard to please. We have stayed at a myriad of top-notch hotels worldwide and in Las Vegas, so I know what to expect. The Trump is a great hotel for the money. For being slightly off the strip with no casino, they seemed at capacity most of the nights we were there. To me, that alone says something about a hotel. The staff at the Trump is what makes the difference.....every person I encountered was bending over backwards to make sure we had everything we needed. Front desk, valet, pool attendant, shuttle drivers, engineering (who incidentally came up to the room to hook my son's new PS3 up for us), all exceptionally nice. The room was spectacular and we were given not one, but two free upgrades. Those are the kinds of things I don't forget. If I did have one complaint, it would be some of the flooring. In the room, my wife and kids kept stepping on carpet tacks which were somehow poking through. Also, the carpet in the hallways was not stretched very tight....(we were on the 49th floor). This made for a rippling effect but I am really having to stretch here to find someway for the hotel to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Book a Strip view for best value.”
Reviews.Author: CSailor71
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent New Year's at the Trump. The weather was cold and windy but we had a great time watching the dancing fountains and fireworks on the Strip thanks to our awesome view. The room was great for the price. We had a cleaning issue the first night but it was corrected. Definitely book a Strip view for the best value at this off strip property.

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend this hotel if you care about service”
Reviews.Author: DGJ047
Reviews.Content: This stay has been a 24hr continum of errors by the hotel. Check in was a nighmare with only half of the stations with attendants. Long wait... We had a large hair ball in our shower, which wasnt cleaned. Rooms are nice. Went to the pool while hotel was cleaning the windows causing s shower of water or cleaning product. Trying to speak to a manager seems near impossible along with other issues,ie roomed not cleaned by 4pm. Stay somewhere else if your looking for service.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a "5 star" hotel but it's not all roses...”
Reviews.Author: pnb987pb
Reviews.Content: Bottom line - this hotel is full of compromises. Advantages: 1. Five star hotel for four star price 2. Rooms are like condos. Very impressive and spacious with full kitchens. 3. Strip view is great 4. Bathrooms are very spacious and luxurious 5. Check-in staff was friendly and professional 6. Right across the street from the Fashion Mall - wife loved this Disadvantages: 1. Over 1/2 of the lights in our room were unplugged - pretty unprofessional 2. Picked up our vehicle from the valet (BTW it's valet parking only). When I turned the key it was BLARING on rap music. Very unprofessional. 3. The train is significant. It came by 2-3 times and it's loud. No joke. 4. Went down to the pool. It was a beautiful setting. However, the setting was tainted by the inoperative gym equipment stuffed in the corner and the multitude of pool chairs that were ripped and tattered. 5. I booked a "strip view" room on hotels.com and when we checked in she said it wasn't a strip view room. However, she was friendly and did us a "favor" by "upgrading" us to a strip view. Next time I will have my reservation confirmation in hand when I check in. 6. Hotel is bordered by the Fashion Mall on one-side and strip clubs on the other. I'm not talking about one strip club... there's about two blocks of them. It was less than romantic pulling up to the hotel for our five year anniversary and passing strip club after strip club. Sketchy neighborhood to say the least. This hotel will not remain nice for long unless the lack of attention to detail is addressed. Paul

Reviews.Title: “High class, Trump name says it all!”
Reviews.Author: luxurycars
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel in Vegas! It doesn't have a casino so there isn't a crowd of people hanging around and no cigarette smell. Parking is valet only, which is great, you don't have to hunt for your vehicle. The rooms are beautiful and everything is top of the line (appliances, bedding, shower, you name it!) It's location is just a bit off the Strip in Vegas, which is perfect, no hustle and bustle and crazy crowds, definitely our kind of place!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kober57
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trump from December 21 to 26/10. We had a beautiful room with a strip view on the 54th floor. From the time we arrived to the time we left everything was perfect.. We used the valet parking and did not have to wait more than 10 minutes to get our car. That is not very long considering the long line up as the hotel was very busy during our stay. The Fashion show mall is steps away from the hotel and is easy to get to. Despite what other reviews say, it is not a long walk to the strip. It is a 10 minute walk at the most and is well lit up. There are side walks across from the Trump that take you all the way to the strip. Housekeeping did a fantastic job. Our room was spotless every day. It was so nice to return to our room after being on the strip and not be overwhelmed with the smell of cigarette smoke It was a quiet and peaceful retreat. I would recommend this hotel to any one travelling to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A true off-Strip gem”
Reviews.Author: sander9t
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights. Booked thru Priceline and received complimentary upgrades to a Strip view studio on the 28th floor. Not the best view of the Strip (you need go higher), but we were pleased. The front receptionist was even very apologetic that she could not give us higher floor for a better view - I was impressed. The studio suite is very spacious with a kitchenette (microwave, hotplate, sink). The decor is modern and elegant. There were some Art books on the shelf. Both the bed and the couch were comfortable. The room was almost spotless except some little stains on the carpet. The bathroom is spacious with separate bath tub (with jets) and shower and was very clean. The mirror is small LCD TV embedded. We were so busy that we did not even check out the pool area. The resort fee was $20 per night plus tax and included high speed Internet, two water bottles per day, complimentary shuttle services to the Wynn and Caesar's Palace, and so on. Unlike most other guests, we actually prefer a hotel without a casino. The location is off-strip (5-10 minutes walking from the Wynn) but their shuttle services pretty much make up for it. The valet staff recommended flat-rate shuttle service in a limo back to the airport which was a good deal (hint: just ask). We had nice sleep and were very satisfied with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy hotel, however the location is off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: awesome_world2010
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Trump Hotel in Vegas was excellent... room was very clean, good sized, and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was large, and the jacuzzi plus the TV on the mirros was a plus. Our room (city view apartment) has a pool view, and a very small glimpse of The Strip. I would stay here again for the hotel room and if I stay long in Vegas, but if I'm coming back for a short stay I might look for hotels located on The Strip. PROS: good sized rooms, very nice bathroom, nice interior, comfy beds, located next to Fashion Mall, high speed internet wi-fi (included in resort fee), the hotel has no casino CONS: location because it's quite a walk to The Strip and back

Reviews.Title: “FANCY, AMAZING EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: ElcioBR
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing experience at this place. We stayed in a fantastic apartment and had some great time in the Spa area where we were attended. We just checked in we were sent to a VIP desk where we received special treatment. Our room was AMAZING, 03 LCD TVs, huge Jacuzzi. First line Spa products and so on. After some minutes we received some champagne with Belgian Chocolate as Welcome. It was a great surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, smoke-free, immaculate hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KingKong17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for Four nights 3 weeks ago. I was on a 3 Month holiday in the USA, travelling solo, and stayed in many hotels, ranging in budgets. The Trump hotel was One of my favourite vicinities. The whole hotel is absolutely spotless-from the Lobby, elevators, corridors to the rooms. The staff are professional and very, very helpful-I found them absolutely delightful and charming. They provided me with a room on the 59th floor, facing the strip. The view is fantastic. The room was very well equipped, with a fridge, microwave etc. Good quality toiletries as well. Best of all is the smoke free environment. The hotel is slightly off the strip, but you may park in any hotel on the strip for free if one does not feel like walking to the numerous attractions on the strip. The pool is beautiful, however their business centre does provide internet usage, but at a price! I would definitely return to this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable”
Reviews.Author: PiotrekL
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable but the hotel is uninviting. Abundance of glass and gold is in poor taste. The location is poor. It's a long walk to get to anything and the hotel doesn't offer much, They do provide a shuttle to Wynn but it wasn't running when we needed it. I also got harassed by a security guard who bowed to a hooker in front of me. It's so embarrassing that it's funny.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, but a bit of a walk from the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: wyn13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Trump Int'l Hotel in March 2010 right at the start of the spring break season. ROOMS Very spacious and immaculately clean. We had a kitchenette, microwave, minifridge, and a few dishes to use. I suppose you could cook there if you want, but we never tried it. They supply you with bottled water to use for free. That was a nice little perk. The bathroom was gigantic and had a whirlpool as well as a spacious shower and vanity. The bed was acceptably comfortable. There was also a little sitting room area near the window. CONCIERGE The people working at this hotel are very nice and are courteous and professional in helping you with whatever you need. Taxi stand is outside and there's never a long wait. One note: have your ID and room key with you when you come back late at night. They check before they let you into the elevator area. I guess they don't want parties or randoms. LOCATION This is the biggest downside to staying at the Trump Hotel, I think. It's at the end of the strip, but not actually on it. You have to walk a couple of blocks inward where there are no sidewalks and a few vacant lots. That's kind of weird. I think the recession might have stopped some planned development there, but nonetheless, it feels really weird when you're walking next to a deserted mall and vacant lot late at night. Also with the hotel being at one end of the Strip, you're not exactly in the middle of the nightlife action. It's a walk to any hotel. RANDOM NOTES -No casino in the Trump Hotel -Pretty good deal for the room that you get, but you have to be willing to walk a bit or pay a taxi if you want to go anywhere else. -Free valet parking, just tip the valet driver. Make sure you have a room key and ID with you when you pick your car up.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel away from the Las Vegas comotion”
Reviews.Author: michaeljames101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trump Hotel, on the 54th floor, facing the strip from Dec. 6 - 11, 2010. The hotel is beautiful and quite understated (in a good way ) for Las Vegas. The absence of smoke and a noisy casino were welcome as there is plenty of that elsewhere. All of the staff we encountered were impressively polite and professional. Having kitchen facilities in the room was great. This allowed us to eat healthier during our near week-long stay. We rented a car and loaded up on groceries at a nearby Vons (i.e., a Safeway grocery store). If you're without a vehicle, the hotel's attache services will do the grocery shopping for you. We ate most breakfasts and lunches in our room and dined out for dinners. It was great to bring back left-overs to snack on for later. The hotel is located across the street from the Fashion Show Mall which is one of the nicer ones in Vegas. We also found the hotel location to be great for accessing the major Vegas roads and freeways. With the GPS we brought from home, getting around the city and even to the Hoover Dam was trouble free. I have read several postings on tripadvisor about train noise. We did hear a train from time-to-time, however, we were never disturbed at night. And I am a light sleeper. It is most likely that this issue was mitigated by staying on a higher floor on the side of the hotel that faces the strip. You do pay a bit more for the strip view, but the views along with morning sun were worth it. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: micki2
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was lovely, however, the freight train which rumbles through 3 times per night between 10 pm and 7 am was most annoying. It appears the hotel was not sound proofed adequately as the noise was so loud it was as if the train was coming through the hotel itself. In addition, the housekeeping service was very unresponsive and did not do a good job of cleaning. The room was disheveled looking each day after they had supposedly "cleaned" the room. Since I did not travel with my laptop this trip, I used the computer in their business center 3 times during my stay. The first time was the only time it worked properly. The remaining 2 occasions it would not send out any email messages even though it didn't have a problem charging my credit card for the use of the computer. Very annoying!! Would I stay there again? Not likely! There are far too many other beautiful hotels without the noise of trains running all night, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A Luxurious Oasis to Come Home To”
Reviews.Author: happytravels445
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. Nice and luxurious, perfect for couples and business travelers! No casino but considering how many there are nearby I would consider this a positive. The hotel is completely non-smoking which is great. Has the best bathroom out of any five star I have stayed in. Best feature of this room is the tub which can easily fit two. The bed in our room was good (not the best I have ever slept on but certainly much nicer than the ones most people own at home) and the comforter/pillows are lush. Nice to have the option of a kitchenette - perfect for fixing your own breakfast! We dined in DJT which was an excellent value for the 3 course taster menu we had (only $30!). We didn't use the pool as it was a bit chilly, although it was opened and seems quite nice. The scent of the hotel is very pleasant and not too overpowering. Only those who are old, with young children or lazy should complain about the location. It is less than a 5 minute walk to the Wynn and only a 10-15 minute walk minutes from the Bellagio. For those who can't be on their feet that long there is a free frequent shuttle bus to both locations. The only negatives are a bit of train noise in the night (usually just once a night around 2am, didn’t bother us but might bother you if you’re a light sleeper) and the resort fee ($22 a night, worth it as this hotel is generally quite a bit cheaper than most other Vegas five stars). If you get a reasonable price then don't hesitate to stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Trigger0880
Reviews.Content: This trip was a surprise birthday present form my wife, after many many searches I settled for the Trump International which provided the split between quality and value. Upon arrival we were amazed at how wonderful the hotel looked and how friendly and smart the staff were. On check-in we were granted an upgrade to the one bedroom corner suite due to it being a special birthday for my wife. The room provided was HUGE, we could not have asked for any more. Having read the reviews from others I was a little concerned about the noise of the train, well to be honest it goes through once maybe twice a night and if that's all you have to grumble about then you should be ashamed of yourself. I hope that if anyone else books on the back of this then I hope you have just as much of a wonderful stay as what we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay. It was better than my expectations”
Reviews.Author: dist1ump
Reviews.Content: We got the room through priceline.at $100/night. We stayed 3 nights 12/3-6. After we got the rooms I checked the reviews and most were positive. So I was very pleased going in. It was a busy weekend in Vegas with NFR rodeo going on the Vegas marathon UFC event. Typical for Vegas, We requested an early check in (flight arriving at 7am). We were told they hotel would to there best to accommodate our request. So when we arrived in Vegas after getting our rental car we went to the Hoover dam. What an amazing place. Then we had breakfast at the HO Ho Hash House on Sahara. Its a must if you want the largest pancakes. So we checked in at 11. Told no problem a room would be available. The great thing we learned when we got to the hotel is that it is a non smoking hotel. Was also asked what newspaper would I like delivered to my room. NY times or La Times or the local paper. I opted for the local paper. We were given a room on the 18th floor of 64 floors. All rooms are suites. We got to the room and I can say was WOW. The room had a studio kitchen. A sub zero fridge and bosch appliances. Regular electric stove top and convection oven. There is plates glasses and pots if you wish to cook. Which we did. Had a beautiful breakfast. The suite has 2 bathrooms. The Master bath is HUGE. His & her sinks. Separate table for vanity area with the make up mirror. There was a 2 person jacuzzi. Separate shower stall with 2 shower heads on each side. A his/her or both at the same time. (hint hint). Separate toilet area with a phone. The mirror where the his/her sinks has a tv built into it. The other bathroom has a full shower stall and toilet in it. The suite had 2 flat screens. One in the living room and the other in the master bedroom. It also had in the master bedroom a docking station for ipod with the alarm clock or to charge your phone. One knock I had read about the hotel was the valet. I have to say it did not take long at anytime for us to get our car. It was always fast. The only surprise that I did not like was the $19.95 daily resort fee. It was explained to us that wifi internet was built into that fee so we accepted it since we carry our laptops with us. Not like we had a choice. I did get to check out the fitness center. It was packed when I went in there so I did not work out since there were no available treadmills. It was clean and state of the art. Overall we were very please with our stay at Trump and would stay there again when in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Room was not clean, cable TV kept breaking up, management did not respond in a timely way to these complaints”
Reviews.Author: Hhesse
Reviews.Content: Nicely laid out lobby Room was NOT cleaned (dirty toilet, stains on marble floor were easy to see, carpet had fresh stains ...brown...ewh...that someone had tried to clean but only made the carpet wet and made it feel dirty) Bed frames were scoffed and had dirt stains on them TV kept breaking up The rooms were not sound proofed and I could hear people coming and going into the next room (at early morning hours) Management was told about the concerns regarding the room cleanliness, and told me they would clean it the next day at 10am but that did not happen and only when I called AGAIN did they come up to clean the room. Very irritating, and made what could have been a pleasant stay, very uneasy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mossy18
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed at Trump hotel for 6 nights at the end of november.My friend had previously stayed at this hotel and had no hesitation in staying here again. The hotel lobby is gorgeous and had a lovely smell. There was no queue when we checked in and the lady who dealt with us was extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was very spacious and had a great view of the strip. The bathroom was huge,luxurious and stocked with lots of towels,shampoo,shower gel etc. The jacuzzi bath was fabulous,just what you need after walking for hours along the strip.We did hear the train occasionally as other people have mentioned,but it certainly wasn't loud enough to wake us up. After being in lots of other Vegas hotels,it was a joy to walk into this hotel and be in you room within 5 minutes. No casino's and shops etc to get through to get to your room. The door staff were all extremely friendly and went out of their way to get to know our names and helped us out with reccomondations for places to go. We also got a 4pm checkout(at no extra cost),and as we weren't flying home 'til 8.30 pm, this was a real bonus. It was only a few mins walk to the strip,and directly across from Fashion Show Mall which is great for shoppers like we were. I would have no hesitation in staying here again,good value for money,and no casino to walk through was heaven after casino overload everywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Glitzy”
Reviews.Author: L_Mist
Reviews.Content: This glitzy hotel is in a good location at the south of the strip opposite Wynn and Fashion show mall. This is a really good hotel to stay in as it is non-smoking and non-gaming, so it actually feels like a hotel rather than a casino. It was nice to get away from the craziness. We stayed in a 1 bed strip-view suite. The suite was spacious and of very good quality. The poolside is fun and plays good music. We ate at DJT for breakfast one morning, but unfortunately didn't find this to be the same standard as the hotel. Dinner may be a different story. We would absolutely recommend this hotel and hope to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms!”
Reviews.Author: travelcato
Reviews.Content: Great rooms.. get the jr. suite.. has 2 bathrooms, jacuzzi tub amazing views.. you dont realize how big the hotel is. great pool deck .. bit of an oasis. breakfast is awesome.. restaurant is a bit small though. No casino.. but i think you will be able to find one near ha!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel - but away from everything”
Reviews.Author: Andy71405
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a few days at the Trump Hotel. The hotel is very nice - but there is not much going on there. The hotel does not have a casino, which can be a positive and a negative. The restaurant where we had breakfast was fair. While we enjoyed the room, the hotel is a couple of blocks off the strip. And there did not seem to be much going on there. We spent a lot of time walking or taking a cab to get places. If you are looking for just a hotel room in Vegas, away from everything, the Trump could be a good place to stay. But if you want to be close to restaurants, casinos, or just people out being social, I would recommend you stay someplace else. While I enjoyed our stay and there is nothing wrong with the hotel, we will probably stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay at the Trump International in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DLShaddox
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trump just for one night but already wish I had stayed longer. It deserves the 5-star rating. The room was beautiful and spacious with marble floors, spa, kitchen, sitting room, desk etc. The views over Las Vegas were stunning. It is a bit isolated from other hotels and casinos but it was a nice change of pace after struggling with the crowds at the Mirage earlier in the week. It is a 5 minute walk to the Wynn. Hotel staff were courteous and helpful. Checkout is 11:00am at the Trump but they extended it until 4:00 for me at no extra charge. I will definitely stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “BRAVO!”
Reviews.Author: BernadetteOntario
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days early November...wonderful staff...beautiful hotel... great location....was especially grateful for the fact there was no casino in this hotel....a lot less transient traffic...being Canadian I have a soft spot for trains so very much ejoyed watching the trains come and go on their way into and out of the Rocky Mountains... an extrordinary site...my sincere thanks to all...

Reviews.Title: “Such a nice hotel for a bargain basement price”
Reviews.Author: ollie1982
Reviews.Content: As we were trying to avoid the casino's this became an obvious choise to stay (no casino on site). We stayed Friday through to Tuesday and were amazed at how cheap the room was (Sunday & Monday night less then $100AUD). The rooms were huge with a little kitchenette plenty of space to relax in. The only downfall for the room we stayed in was that we were on the 51st floor (city view) and had a rather loud freight train pass through horns blaring in the early hours each morning. The hotel is not on the strip but is just off the strip (less than a 5 min walk). Walking to the strip however does present a problem as they are building next door so there is no side walk. You can however cross the road and go through the fashion mall but this isnt open all hours of the night. If your going out for a night you may want to think about a taxi back to the hotel. The only thing that was a let down for the hotel itself was that the housekeepers came at 8am to clean the room, I didnt even relise that they were there until they had actually opened the door to the room!! I would have thought that at almost every hotel in the world 10am is the earliest you would expect to see anyone let alone a 5* hotel in Vegas. This hotel is excellent for anyone who needs to feel & be treated like royalty. Was very happy with the hotel and would stay again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “THE MOST RELAXING HOTEL IN VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: jabmike
Reviews.Content: We booked Trump because it was smoke free and close to Wynn. We had tickets for Garth Brooks. Also it is across from the mall which had an ABC store for beer and wine. We also ate at 3 restaurants at the mall. El Segundo,Strupburger and Maggianos. We were pleased with all 3. Trump was a short 5 minute stroll to Wynn and the shuttle was always available. The front desk, concierge and staff were very friendly and helpful. A shout out to Samuel who bartends in the morning. We had a studio suite on the 59th floor with a great view of the vegas strip. The bed was very comfortable and other than the train in the middle of the night, you could not hear anything from our neighbors. Wife and I are 50+ and wanted a relaxing stay which we had and a location that was convenient to shopping, casinos and food. I highly recommend Trump for anyone who wants to get away from the noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “Parking is horrible”
Reviews.Author: sfuji1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice and rooms are very large. Have stayed at other Trumps and the product is consistent. I am surprised the guy on this forum was robbed while asleep. Now, that is frightening because it seems near impossible, yet it happened? Parking is valet only and expect to wait a minimum of 10 minutes everytime you pick up your car. If you are in a rush to get to the airport, you better check out VERY early, especially if on a Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “worst service ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: MissisRain
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice, location could be better (the hotel is just outside the Strip), general atmosphere has absolutely no WOW-factor (unlike most of Vegas luxury hotels) and the service is terrible.
