One day there was a strong wind, which was after a while followed by stormy rain - but nobody from the pool staff bothered to take inside small objects from the pool area. After the rain was over for the next two hours all those towels, pillows and chairs were still floating in the pool... Another day there was a fire alarm in the building - so all guests were evacuated though emergency stairs. Guess what we saw when we left the building through the emrgency exit- in the lobby people were checking in, the restaurants were serving breakfast and the staff said they had no clue about the evacuation... And talking about theft in the hotel. Once I left a piece of jewelry in the pocket of a bathrobe - to find that bathrobe was replaced (and the jewelry was never found - surprise surprise). Stay away from this place - there are other hotels in Vegas which are truely great, cool and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of peace in Vegas's fun and gamble”
Reviews.Author: L0tus72
Reviews.Content: It was like returning home after a long day on the strip. So much peace and calm inside the hotel. There is no casino inside the hotel, which is a great plus point, if you have kids travelling with you. We were given a upgrade on the room that we booked :) and the room was really cozy. The room didnt have a strip view :( we had a view of circus circus and a stateway, but no cribbing coz it was a good upgrade. The bed were so good. I dropped on it and dozed off right away. The washroom was awesome and the bath tub with the jet was just amazing. It was great to massage away all the fatigue of walking all day on the strip. The kitchen was a life saver for us. My 3 yr old son would wake up hungry at 2 am(because of the time diff 12 hrs back home). The staff were really friendly and helpful. There is a shuttle to the strip every 15 mins and the hotel is just 5 min walk from the strip. The restaurant was also good in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room broken into; Over $6k in items stolen.”
Reviews.Author: Dwsanchez
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trump International for four nights, including Labor Day Weekend 2010 with my girlfriend. We were convinced to upgrade to the one bedroom suite upon check-in. Between the room and the spa, we spent over a $1,000 at the Trump, which I ordinarily would not have minded. After the third night of our stay, we awoke with hotel security at our door asking if we were missing any items from our room. A quick check of our room revealed over $6,000 worth of stolen items, including an expensive men’s Swiss watch, a digital camera, a few hundred dollars in cash and a silver money clip - all apparently taken while we were in our room sleeping. Next door neighbors also had some expensive items from their room missing. Spent half of the next day dealing with hotel security and speaking with Las Vegas Metro Police. Police Report No. LLV100905002547. Absolutely no attempt whatsoever by the hotel was made to remedy the situation before check-out. No discount on our stay, no immediate insurance claim, nothing. It has been over two months now since the incident, and Trump International has ceased all contact with us and no insurance claim or compensation has been made. I would have never expected such poor security and horrible treatment from a 5-star hotel. Now we will have to foot the cost of our stolen items and hire an attorney. I will NEVER stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: jcbVisalia
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It is non smoking and non gaming. When you enter it is like a breath of fresh air compared to the casinos in Vegas. The room was great, a studio was plenty of room for the two of us. Nice to have cooking ability and enough dishes and pots and pans for 2. Staff was extremely nice and helpful. Enjoyed the shuttle to Cesars which was helpful. Great shopping next door. The walk to the strip was easy and very doable. We look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “High Expectations”
Reviews.Author: dtFitz-Gerald
Reviews.Content: We are GOING to be staying at Trump next week based on the reviews on this site. I'm impressed with the fact the GM takes the time to read the reviews and address issues such as beds and housekeeping. Looks like some reviewers are pretty picky and expect that the problems mentioned could probably be handled very easily if approached properly. We're looking forward to our Sun-Thur stay and will report back as to whether it lives up to our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Your F I R E D!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jesse_1972_10
Reviews.Content: 24-hour concierge service - Very helpful with everything. At times they where very busy but always took the time to help you find location and service. Valet parking - always seemed to take over 15 min to get our car and that was at slow times. A number of times we said we would be back in 10 min because we wanted to drop off our shopping and they went and parked our car. Evening turndown service - Did not use and Was not offered to us Gourmet dining at DJT Restaurant and Bar (lobby level) - Did not use. H2(EAU) poolside bistro and bar - Closed at 6pm Sparkling swimming pool and sundeck with private cabanas - Closed at 6pm 24-hour In-Suite Dining - Did not use. World-class spa, salon and fitness center - Did not use 5,960 square feet of elegant, indoor meeting space - Did not use Business Center - They had one and they charged extra to use it because they said it was out side company that provided the service The house keeping service was awlful. They never cleand or freshen up our room. We left at 10am on Wed and returned on Thursday Morning at 6am. Our bed was stripped and left bare. Did not clean or replace any towels. Left the room in a worse mess then we did after we left. They just didn't care and I stopped tipping the house keepers. I will stay there again. Make sure you get the name of the persons that you request house keeping from. Also set up a video camra to see who and what they do in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views”
Reviews.Author: Thecavaliers
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of this hotel before we booked, we were a bit concerned. We can't understand why people need to complain about every single thing. I'm sure we could all criticise any hotel anywhere in the world. But the negative reviews we read prior to staying here are just a joke now after staying here ourselves. Stayed here in Nov 2010 for 6 nights. First impressions of Hotel was very impressive. Our room was fantastic after we upgraded from a city view to a strip view. We stayed on 58th floor with amazing views of the strip. I would say one of the best views in Las Vegas. Location is no problem and you can walk everywhere from here. Bonus with no casino and no smoking, which was one reason we chose this Hotel. We loved the kitchenette and the fact that you could make tea or coffee. Didn't dine in the restaurant or use the pool facilites, but will definitely use the pool area when we return in the warmer months. Staff were very professional and friendly. Check in and check out was very easy and no queues. We will definitely stay here again as our first choice and would recommend it to anyone wanting a quieter place in Las Vegas. Loved the whole experience!

Reviews.Title: “not the five star one would hope”
Reviews.Author: threepalstravelling
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trump in one of the rooms facing the strip - spotless room, lovely comfy bed but no little touches that would make you think you were staying in a five star hotel. The newspapers promised each morning - did not arrive, the tv in the bathroom - did not work, the shower in the bathroom is nothing to write home about. It is a lovely hotel with lovely friendly staff both on reception and in the restaurants, however it is not the five star you would hope for at all. We stayed there as a treat to ourselves and it was a bit of a let down. Looking for that five star treatment - do not stay at the Trump.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, elegant respite from the excesses of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Quiet_Traveler88
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Tuesday for a three night stay. We couldn't have been happier with our 19th floor room over-looking the strip. The staff accommodated our request to have two other rooms with our family members on the same floor, even though they were booked separately. The room was spacious, very comfortable, quiet and full of amenities. The bed was extremely comfortable and we enjoyed the spacious sitting area (sofa, two chairs and a desk chair, with coffee table) with a view of the city. The bathroom was sumptuous with a deep, whirlpool tub, big enough for two, his and hers sinks, walk in shower, and soft / warm robes. Really, this was one of the nicest rooms we've stayed in anywhere. The woodwork and art / appointments in the room gave it an apartment feel and while modern, it was still quite warm and inviting. Because Trump is at the far end of the strip, and has no casino, it felt much less hectic and even felt safer than the other resorts on the strip that we visited. While the resort was busy with guests, absent were the tourists and day-visitors of the other resorts. Pluses: The elevators were fast and you never had to wait for one. The clock radio had an Ipod docking port and sounded great. The closets hid our luggage and clothing nicely, maintaining that "just cleaned" hotel room look, and we loved the lights that came on in them when you opened the doors. The floor to ceiling windows gave great morning and night time lighting. The valet parking was very useful to everyone in our party. Housekeeping did an admirable job. Minuses: our room was a little cold at times. One of the window vents didn't close properly and let in cold air until we covered them with towels. The bathroom TV didn't work properly, and the Engineers promised by the bellhop never showed up during our three night stay (no big deal really, this TV I think is more of a novelty anyway). There was no moderate or snack level cafe or restaurant on the premises (although we were able to bring in Pizza from the fashion mall across the street with little fuss). The train noise other's have complained of was not a problem for us. We heard the train occasionally but actually enjoyed the sound when it passed by and it never woke us up. We LOVED the smoke free environment, and the staff was always friendly and available. We did not eat at the restaurant, did not use the pool (it was too cold this week), and did not take advantage of the spa facilities, although we gave all of them a look.

Reviews.Title: “The Trump is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: kspencer3795
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business, therefore, it was on a company card. However, if I ever go back to Las Vegas (which, I'm sure I will) This is definatly where I would stay, even if it is on my dime. The room was incredible, and it was very inexpensive. It was walking distance from the strip, but far enough away so I could actually get some rest and some work done. I really enjoyed the fact that there wasn't a casino in the Trump. It didn't keep me up all night! I would reccommend The Trump to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Trump - your fired!!”
Reviews.Author: sherpajon
Reviews.Content: What is the most important component of a hotel room,,,THE BED! The bed in our room was so bad you could see that the one side had a large depression in it even with the comforter on top. The other side was better but so soft your core area sunk leading to a very sole back by the morning. I did tell the front desk about it. They indicated that they would check into it. No change when we arrived back at the room that night. Rest of the room was fine. Except for the bathroom the rest of the room was a low 4 star. Noise from adjacent TRAINS is early and loud!!. Be aware of the shuttle operating times. It is hourly and stops early Sunday - Wed. STAY AT CEASARS FOR THE VEGAS EXP!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING DEAL!!!”
Reviews.Author: ASUgirl89
Reviews.Content: I went this past weekend for my 21st birthday and this was the PERFECT hotel to stay in. I loved it because I felt so elegeant and classy staying here. It definitely was NOT a party hotel, but that's what I liked about it because I wouldn't want to stay somewhere loud and crazy. The interior was beautiful, our room was HUGE and we had 5 girls stay in there comfortably. The whole time we were joking about how we were just going to move in because it was so nice. The bathroom was also AMAZING and huge!!! haha, every girls dream!! It was a $6 cab ride to the strip but we would walk home from the clubs and it only took about 10 minutes. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND STAYING HERE!!!! I will be staying here for ALL my future Vegas trips!!!

Reviews.Title: “Most luxurious hotel I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: eorlingas
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas a number of times, and this was the best hotel room I've stayed in. The rooms are luxurious. Unless you're the rich and famous, the bathrooms will blow you away in their size and quality. All the staff were friendly, the young guy at the desk who welcomed me near midnight on a Friday just made you feel welcome from the start, even being dressed pretty shabbily! The downside is that you can't walk to/from the Strip at night, as it is surrounded by an empty building site and shops that are not open all day. There is a shuttle to the Wynn, not sure how often it runs. Also the pool isn't say a Mandalay Bay type resort pool, more a traditional hotel pool. Everything else about my stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely sensational!”
Reviews.Author: maam41
Reviews.Content: An absolutely sensational hotel offering quality and style. Gorgeous surroundings. Best customer service in Vegas. Clean. Great for families. Fantastic restaurant with good quality food and beverages available. Great if you don't want the hustle and bustle of a Casino hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoChiLady
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel but terrible housekeeping. They checked two of our group into dirty rooms. Ask for a room away from the side of the building with the train. Horn blew aat 2 and 5am. If you want to gamble this is not the hotel for you. Too far off strip. Spa was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grams0524
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night @ the hotel and loved it. Within minutes of our arrival the doorbell rang with warm bathrobes being delivered. The room was emaculate, and the bathroom was top of the line. We ordered room service which arrived within 20 minutes and was delicious. We loved that the hotel did not smell of smoke and that we did not have to walk through a casino to get to our room. We will most certainly stay there again. Great job Donald....your staff was kind and you have paid attention to every detail. We were able to obtain the room and a rental car for the one night for $111.00 via expedia....great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy bed”
Reviews.Author: MCB11
Reviews.Content: Bed slept like it was way overdue to be replaced(one side caved in like an elephant slept in it) Location @ 1/2 mile from anything going on-had a free shuttle but would not go to hotel with monorail access which would have made it much easier to get around strip. Only plus is the staff was very very pleasant

Reviews.Title: “Only Smoke Free Hotel/but issues”
Reviews.Author: ruth345
Reviews.Content: Being the only smoke free hotel on the strip we decided to stay. Vegas is very smoker friendly. Also, my husband and I don't gamble so we appreciated the relaxed, peaceful atmosphere. It's a nice hotel with poor housekeeping. One day they did not even give us any toilet paper although I left the empty on the floor. The location is OK. It's off the strip by a good bit and you have to hike which would not be so bad except it's poorly lit and the sidewalks are not good. This is also too far to walk in high heels. To make up for this the Trump provides shuttles to the strip. They are handy and the drivers are nice, BUT, if you miss the shuttle, walking can be treacherous.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: DCSteveTraveler
Reviews.Content: Get a room that ends in 07 for best view and go high. One bedroom with full kitchen was amazing with huge bathroom, lg living room, and 2nd bathroom. Across street from mall and SHORT walk up street to strip with Wynn, Encore, Palazzo, and Treasure Island closest casinos. Shuttle to Wynn or Caesars Palace. Room service food quality was good and at reasonable price for 5 star hotel. Room was quiet except for obnoxious slamming doors and that train noise everyone has complained about. Massage at spa was very good but a tad pricey even after $50 discount. Overall spa was disappointment. It's disconnected from fitness center and pool (both free to all guests) Not much added value for spa patrons.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Choice”
Reviews.Author: GSAS
Reviews.Content: The Trump has no Casino and this is a bonus, it is also therefore non smoking, another bonus. It is close enough to walk though down to the strip (4 minutes) brings you to the strip opposite the entrance to the Wynn Hotel, it is north at this end of the strip about 10 min stroll to Treasure Island. Free Valet parking, good gym, clean quiet pool area - some furniture a little tired but thats being very picky! Juice bar next ye in the to the pool is excellent. Bellboys and valet staff were all very friendly and helpful. Room was very good for the money, junior suite on 59th floor with view down the strip, one of the best views in Vegas possibly. The room was spacious and well appointed evne with a useable fridge (i.e not mini bar stocked) and kitchenette. Comfortable sofa and chairs LCD TV buit in to bathroom mirror so you can enjoy cable while in the double whirlpool bath. Very staid for Vegas but a welcome calmness after a night on the strip! I will be using again.

Reviews.Title: “TRUMP HOTEL LAS VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: MICKOL
Reviews.Content: The trump hotel is at the begining of the strip,A little bit isolated from all the noise and has no casino. yet it's a wonderful hotel for those who came for pampering. The room is very spacious and has agreat view. I took the city view. you get a Jacuzzi in the bath room and plazma inside. the concierges servise is great. and it takes onle 5 minutes to getr to the strip's center. it worth the price!!!!!! Michal - Israel

Reviews.Title: “Trump lived up to the name!”
Reviews.Author: Widad2
Reviews.Content: Great 3 night stay! We had the corner unit on the 53 floor. The best views, huge 1 bedroom unit. Service was great! Room service was great as well as our server! She was great! Every staff member we talked to had nothing but kind things to say of Don and his family. We will be back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “They Made Our Stay Thoroughly Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: senoraflowers
Reviews.Content: I must compliment the staff at Trump. They understand the meaning of "customer service." Everyone was incredibly helpful, and I was very impressed by the valet who learned our names this first time he met us. I won't say that the stay was perfect. We did have a few issues with the first room that we were given. The whirlpool tub didn't work at all, and there is a train that passes by the hotel on a regular basis that kept my husband up most of the first night. But when I addressed these issues with a manager, we were immediately moved from the 18th floor to the 52nd floor; from a regular room to a corner suite. From that moment on, there weren't any problems at all. My husband and I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “Incredible value in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Traveloler
Reviews.Content: I paid $100 per night + $20 resort fee to stay at the Trump from a Sunday evening to a Friday afternoon in late October 2010, and was very pleased with my stay. Even with the resort fee, the Trump offers excellent value. The room I received was very nice and clean, and featured a jetted tub, a refrigerator and an oven. Service is very good and fairly prompt. This hotel has obviously been very well thought out, with features like 4 banks of elevators divided to serve separate series of floors to assure that you never have to wait more than a few seconds to catch one. The shower head was disappointing, but at less than $160 per night, this hotel is an incredible deal.

Reviews.Title: “PAMPERED”
Reviews.Author: rika13In
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a studio. The service was fantastic - the food was fantastic, the drinks were out of this world. The small bar the at the pool - food, service, bartenders and drinks GREAT. Going back to Vegas in November and are looking forward to our trip!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel , but no casino”
Reviews.Author: mickychan
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks luxurious. However, our room wasn't cleaned for days , so dirt all over the decorated cabinet. There are stove and half kitchen in the room , but the stove in our room didn't work while my mom's room did. Be aware for people like casino, there is no in this hotel . Only valet parking as well , if you don't want to pay parking , you may park in the shopping mall across the street , but your own risk . Overall , it was good trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but Service was Lacking”
Reviews.Author: Sneeker635
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Trump with my wife for our anniversary and I was very surprised by the poor service. The hotel itself along with the room were beautiful, and basically what I would have expected. When I arrived and looked over the room, I noticed there were no wine or champagne glasses. When the bellman brought up our luggage I asked if he could have some sent up along with a wine bottle cooler (metal bucket with ice). He said it would be brought right up. 30 minutes later someone brought up an empty plastic bucket, that's all. I asked for the ice along with the glasses again. 30 minutes later nothing. I called housekeeping and they said they would send it right up. another 30 minutes and still nothing. I then called the front desk and they said it would be right up. Still nothing after another 30 minutes. After talking to 4 different people from 4 different departments all promising but not delivering I was extremely disappointed. All I wanted to do was have some wine and champagne with my wife. I would expect better service from a hotel of this calibur. Overall the place is nice but they need to work on their customer service.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars?”
Reviews.Author: rattlers88
Reviews.Content: I'd give it a solid 4 stars, don't know about 5. We stayed on the 24th floor on the downtown (north) side - the hotel wanted an additional $25 a night to stay on the south side overlooking the main part of the strip. We stayed 4 nights and as others have mentioned there are no good night's sleep at the Trump. We were awakened multiple times all 4 nights by trains and sirens. On the plus side the rooms are very nice - very nice bathrooms as big as a bed room. Rooms include stoves and small refrigerators. The only other plus is there is the hotel is entirely smoke free and there is no casino. It's nice to come in after a long day in Vegas to a quiet hotel. Minuses included no self parking. We are the type of people that are in and out a lot and it would just be nice to at least have the option to self park the car to not have to deal with waiting multiple times for the valet. Of course they had to be tipped each time as well. I actually ended up parking at the mall lot across the street several times when we knew we were coming in for an hour or so. The hotel charges a $20/day resort fee to cover parking (mostly free in Vegas anyway), a newspaper (never did see one of these), and internet access (not worth $20 a day).

Reviews.Title: “Unbeliveable!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: harveyshairyteabags
Reviews.Content: I wasn't going to write a review until i read other reviews that gave the Trump a bad press. I really couldn;t believe what i was reading. People saying that it was too far to walk to the Strip! It must have taken us almost a whole 2 minutes to get to Treasure Island. The Strip is about 4 miles long so wherever you stay, you will be out of walking distance to some point on the Strip. The check in was very easy and staff friendly and helpful. It was especially nice as The Trump is a hotel and not a casino. I have stayed in casinos previously and found it a little onerous to navigate through the crowds especially when exhausted after a long day out and just want to get to your room. We had a mountain view suite on the 33rd floor which was huge for 2 and beautifully decorated and appointed. I have no complaints about any aspect of this hotel other than the noise of the train which i was told that Trump has been lobbying the train company to reduce the blast that they give on their horn when passing. I now feel that after staying here i have to go a long way to better it and will need to always book the best hotels to keep my lovely girlfriend in the style to which she has been accustomed!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with The Donald”
Reviews.Author: IowaBoy1
Reviews.Content: We got a very good rate at the Trump via Hotwire for two nights. We were very impressed with the Trump and really could find nothing to complain about. The is a bit of a walk to the Strip, but it's not that far and there is a free shuttle to the Strip and/or Caesar's Palace if you want it. Valet service was great and the desk staff accommodated my request for a Strip view room. We were on the 49th floor and it was fantastic! The room contained all the standard amenities, as well as some unusual ones - LCD TV built into the bathroom mirror was very cool. Elegantly decorated room, lots of space and seating options. Walk-in shower as well as whirlpool tub. We are non-gamblers, so we liked the ability to visit the Strip, get our fill of craziness, then retreat to our quiet oasis at the Trump. The hotel is also very easy to find - the tower, with the large "TRUMP" logo at the top, is visible from anywhere in the city. The Donald did a great job. Like many Vegas hotels, a daily resort fee is charged, which, among other things, provides you with valet service for your rental car and high speed wireless internet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Train”
Reviews.Author: mummy_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Trump 5 nights. Requested room change after first night because of train. New room still noisy. Bed squeaks, room very dusty. Housekeeping poor. Do not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “This is a hotel room to share with your significant other!”
Reviews.Author: Norske8
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago on a regular basis and I have never been able to stay at the Trump property there because the rates are crazy expensive. When I saw the very reasonable rates for the Trump in Las Vegas I jumped at the opportunity. I am extremely glad that I did. Everything about the room is elegant and classy and at $120 per night your folks in accounting will not have a heart attack. My only lament about the entire stay was that I was traveling solo. This truly is a room to share with that special person in your life...

Reviews.Title: “Trump, Las Vegas, over promises and undelivers”
Reviews.Author: francophileonthemove
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Trump International Hotel, Las Vegas for 4 nights last week. We had a fabulous suite on the 49th floor. It's not the hotel's fault but the north view is like looking over a huge industrial estate - endless grey, flat roofed factories. The receptionist at check-in was fabulous and very helpful however for the first 2 days our newspaper didn't arrive. The room looked great but lacked proper cleaning. The shower heads were encrusted with limescale, the dressing table in the bathroom was very badly damaged on top (this could have been avoided by placing a piece of glass on it in the first place - who puts a black painted table in a bathroom?!) and the room was always dusty. Each day we had to remind housekeeping to service the room in the late afternoon. There was only a coffee machine and no tea or fresh milk provided, despite our suite having a full kitchen. Our room was not quiet - despite being high up. Trains went by, helicopters went by and cars and sirens could be heard. We had breakfast just once. The service was ok but I ordered scrambled eggs. On arrival they looked like mushed up fried eggs so I sent them back only to be advised by the server that the chef would simply chop them up a bit and send them back to me! Extraordinary! Finally, the bar is like a barn. It's dreadful. The staff are keener on talking to their friends than serving customers - not good. Check out was excellent. In fact the only impressive and well trained staff seem to be those on the front desk. Trump has an awesome website. It looks great but don't be misled. They have fallen into the biggest marketing trap - over-promising and under-delivering.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: JuJu196579
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at the Trump in Las Vegas in September to celebrate our 20th anniversary. They upgraded our room because of our special day at no additional cost. Room was spectacular! The staff were very friendly and helpful. Loved the valet parking and felt very secure at this hotel. This is CLOSE to everything with a mall across the street etc. Loved the fact that there was NO casino. I was nervous at first about making that choice but it was the best decision ever....after all the craziness on the strip...really nice to come back to a clean, SMOKE free lobby. Elevators were fast .....no complaints whatsoever..recommending this to all my Canadian friends!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: rozwj
Reviews.Content: Our junior suite was immaculate, very tastefully decorated, overlooking the pool and facing the strip, which is just a short walk away. Two bathrooms - the master is hugh and even has a television in the bathroom mirror! Lots of closet and storage space, stainless steel appliances in the kitchen - although we didn't use them. Two sets of key-access doors to the room gives an extra sense of security. The staff was very warm, friendly and responsive. Restaurant is pretty pricey though.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were awesome and loved the Art Deco theme. Nice not to be in a casino.”
Reviews.Author: Leigh248
Reviews.Content: Got a reduced rate online for a high quality hotel. Easy to get around and nice not to stay in a casino. Rooms were great with nice bedding, lots of wood, big bathroom and other in room amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the madding crowd!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaHarmony
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful and elegant hotel, but the best part about it for me was the location. My girlfriend and I had come to LV to see Cher, and since neither of us gamble we wanted to be somewhat insulated from the "action". We also wanted to shop and the Fashion Show Mall was right across the street. Perfect! This hotel is non-smoking and has no casino, so it is relatively quiet. There was never any waiting for cabs, and about a 10 minute walk to the Wynn and the Encore and all the action. The rooms are great- everything first class. Micro, fridge, stove, and dishes which we never used. Who wants to cook when there are such amazing restaurants- Postrio, Bradley Ogden, Olives, Yellowtail etc. Large bathroom, two sinks, jetted tub, seperate shower, lots of mirrors. We got a good deal but we could have done better by checking their calendar- rooms are less expensive when no conventions are in town. The only complaint we had was with the service. When you call housekeeping, you get the main voice mail, wait wait, then an operator, wait wait, then finally housekeeping. Same for concierge etc. Why have a designated phone button that dumps you into the general mailbox??? We were on the 27th floor and when we ordered room service, the food was cold by the time it got to us. You have to call and request turndown service, but even though we called we only got it the last night. I think you have to call AND turn on your housekeeping light. the maid also forgot to clean the coffee pot and replenish the coffee and cream one morning. Other than those minor problems, we loved the hotel. Nice bar and friendly bartenders Chris and Marvin. There is a $20/day resort fee. We would definitely stay here again. Concierge Laura was very helpful and Cher was fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: PaulMunton
Reviews.Content: What a find! Fantastic new hotel - smoke free and no casino - Graet pool with gorgeous bikini clad waitresses - free hotel shuttle to and from Ceasers Palace - Hotel opposite The Fashion Mall - Staff so friendly and obliging - Best deal was ground floor rest -aurant offering incredible three course dinner for only $29.95. If we ever come back to Fantasyland this will be the place to stay! Obviously we visited the 'Strip' which wthout exception meant going thru smokey casinos just to arrive at reception!

Reviews.Title: “Too bad the service is so awful at such a nice, nonsmoking hotel.”
Reviews.Author: catsavers
Reviews.Content: I was excited to find this hotel as an alternative to the conference hotel, because I hate smoke and casinos. I got a great rate and the room was very nice. The lobby service was nice, including the bellmen, bartender, servers, and front desk. That is where the service stopped. They charge the resort fee automatically and it includes a newspaperm bottled water, etc.Did not get the newspaper delivered once without calling for it. My room was not serviced for two days because someone had pushed the tiny light that indicated I wanted privacy. I did not even know about the light. When I called down to get more water, I asked for 3 bottles instead of 2 for the aggravation, and they said they would have to charge me for the third. I asked them to also bring up a couple of new towels--they brought the water and no towels. I had specifically requested a room away from the noisy train--they gave me a room on the train side. It was very loud. There were two hangers in the room when I checked in. I had to call for more. There is no place to lock anything up in the room, although there is a closet with a lock, which they said is the "owner's closet." I can't imagine The Donald would be using that room or its closet. To be fair, they did take off that bloody resort fee. I actually hope I don't have to go back to Vegas, because there are not many options for hotels without casinos and smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: iceward
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trump for 2 nights during our honeymoon. Although we didn't use them very often, I found the staff to be polite and helpful. I was even upgraded free of charge. The room was lovely. Nice views over the strip, lovely large king size fluffy bed, comfy sofa, microwave, tea/coffee making, fridge, hob. The bathroom was amazing. I could nearly swim in the deep jacuzzi style bath and there was a separate shower and toilet and of course that TV in the mirror. Everything worked, was clean and we had no complaints. We used the pool area and wished we had used it more, plenty of sunbeds, towels provided and a nice sized pool. We also looked in at the gym and whilst we didn't use it, it was better equipped than the gym I pay to use back home. As others have mentioned the only down side would be that the hotel is slightly off the strip and you have to cross the busy and wide road outside the hotel in order to find a path to walk on as there isn't one on the hotel side. However, I suspect that is one reason why this hotel is cheaper than others in the category. It is also towards the seedier end of the strip and involves quite a walk to get to the MGM for example. All in all though, I would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “All that Glitters is Gold!”
Reviews.Author: looby73
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at The Trump, Las Vegas, first impressions as you walk into the lobby........................WOW, the smell is wonderful, everything glitters and sparkles! Extremely pleasant and polite concierage, We were offerred a choice of newspaper, and was fully aware of the resort fees before we booked, so this came as no surprise to us, and therefore did not spoil anything for us either. We were given a room on the 54th floor, and was informed by the concierage we had a fabulous view of the strip, was he not kidding! The room was Huge, the bathroom Huge, and i really like the fact the toilet is seperate to the other facilities in the bathroom. the bathtub was again HUGE, we could actually float in it! The bed was the best i have ever slept in, so comfortable. The view of the strip was outstanding, the location of the trump must have the best views of the strip! at night time it was spectacular, i could even see the bellagio fountains on an evening from my room. Now The Trump is slightly off the strip, but come on you guys that say it's too far, it really is not, it is literally a 10 minute (and i really wonder if it took us that long!) to the strip, we personally do not mind walking, and was quite nice to walk back, especially when you have eaten huge portions of food at buffets etc. in fact i weighed myself on our 3rd day there and had lost 2 pounds! (the scales are in the trump bathroom by the way!) The train, yes i heard it approx 4 times during our stay, really did not keep me awake or was a problem at all, and i'm pretty sure guests at other hotels on the strip must hear it as well. Don't let the train put you off staying here, it's really not that bad. We had just one relaxing day around the pool, topped the tan up and relaxed in the lovely warm jucuzzi. not too many round the pool when we stayed so we managed to get a comfortable round lounger to bathe on. Heaven! We will return to Las Vegas in the future, and the Trump will be top of our list to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great service good location issues with the room”
Reviews.Author: jfergi27
Reviews.Content: First of all the service was excellent. They were down to earth and were always eager to help. The location is walking distance from the wynn. They do offer shuttle service to the wynn and ceasers palace. The hotel itself was nice. The lobby was beautiful. Now for the bad part. The room was nice and the bathroom in itself was awesome. But if you have a room facing the railroad tracks prepare yourself for noise. First off while trying to take a nap I could hear helicopter after helicopter pass by. Next walls were thin and you can hear your neighbor of they move or bang on the wall. Next the room is located above fans below that emit a lot of noise. If someone is taking a shower next door you can hear the water running though the walls. Beautiful hotel but with thin walls and at times too noisy!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice service”
Reviews.Author: favourite_star
Reviews.Content: The Trump is a nice hotel. All the staff we encountered were extremely friendly, polite and helpful. It is not cheap, but is good value for Vegas compared to other hotels. It doesn't have a casino which leads to a pleasant relaxed atmosphere. The rooms are massive, pool was nice and spa had good availability (although pricey). Would recommend to a friend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet you say?? Would I stay there again?? An Emphatic NO!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller-7
Reviews.Content: Hello Folks, I am a seasoned traveller who would never choose Las Vegas as a destination in the first place, however, two other friends were going and I and my partner needed a fast sun break. Donald Trump and his bad comb over pale in comparison to this ridiculously made supposed 5 star hotel. First the noise levels are completely unacceptable in a hotel that looks rather nice. If you stay on the side not looking at the strip expect to be waken in the morning by a train that promptly blows it's horn starting at 5 am. and then continues every hour on the hour. Particularly appreciated after a long nite of gambling. What I could hear that on the 40th Floor in a 5 Star Hote?? Oh yes, my friend but it doesnt stop there. Donald Trumps architects must have been the cheapest or stupidest he could find. They have this idiotic configuration to the entry way where two suites share a foyer. Looks elegant upon arrival but the doors SLAM like a prison institution sending 6 point shockwaves through the entire suite. And the maids seem oblivious to the lack of Noise proofing as well considering how GD loud they yakked and how often they ran in and out of my neighbours suite slamming the doors with every breath. So if the train doesn't get you the doors will. Then the hotel graciously offered me a move to the other side of the building whereby you feast on a lovely view of the strip. But wait, don't get your hopes up yet. This side was NO BETTER than the other. I heard Sirens going all bloody night long. And of couse that infernal Door Slamming never stopped either. So, if you want fake luxury, a 5 stay hotel built like a Motel 6 ( oh I forgot to mention that this Hotels location is right next to the freeway, and yes, you can here the traffic ) Then by all means....check in to Mr. Trump's latest boondoggle. ( BTW...there was mold in the shower. Yes MOLD. ) Would I choose to stay here again. NO GD WAY MAN!! Even if The Donald changes his hair don't.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Trump”
Reviews.Author: harley1970
Reviews.Content: We split our stay in Vegas at The Trump and at The Venetian. I was concerned after reading all of the bad reviews but decided to give it a chance anyways. The Trump turned out to be much better than I had anticipated. For a family with children, the room definitely beat any other we could have booked. The kitchenette was perfect. It was well stocked and had everything we needed including plates, silverware, etc. The room was very comfortable and it was nice to have a couch and chairs. The bed was definitely one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The bathroom was glorious! For those who wrote that there were not linens, etc for the sofa sleeper, our room had ample extra bedding. I did not wait in line to check in, no problems whatsoever. I was really worried about the train. I heard it 3 times during 24 hours, twice during the day and once at night. We were on the 24th floor. I definitely am a light sleeper and hate hearing any lous noise (pools, bars, neighbors, etc) but did not have any problem at this hotel. I did not use the pool so I can not comment on that. Although not on the strip, the proximity to Fashion Show Mall could not be beat. Overall, the hotel was a pleasant surprise and I would definitely recommend it. It was actually much nicer than the Venetian, although we had a great stay there, too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Derby4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trump for 7 nights , found it to be an excellent hotel , with an amazing view of the strip-56th floor ! Room was very spacious, clean and very comfortable. Clean towels every day and service was excellent. . Booked this hotel as we wanted more of an appartment rather than a hotel . Pool was very nice , sunloungers were comfortable , food at pool bar was good although some bar prices were expensive although we found this at most hotel bars . Walk to the strip took about 5 minutes , only heard the train a couple of times . Stayed at The Wynn last time but Trump was nearly as good , not much atmosphere in the bar area maybe as there is no casino. Daily service charge was a bit steep but this is in most of the hotels in Vegas so you cant really get out of it . Staff were very helpful and polite . Windows needed cleaning !

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay, definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: missD07
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just off the strip and has no casino so it's not crowded and only residents walk in and out. We stayed in a suite which was amazing with fluffy bathrobes, a huge bed, kitchen, sofa and huge bathroom. The hotel pool was also really nice but got very busy so can sometimes to be hard to find a sun lounger. The staff are attentive and really helpful. They even helped us by calling our tour agent when we got stood up and called our airline on our behalf. Just be aware that you have to pay a daily fee for the facilities such as the shuttle bus, use of the leisure facilities etc. Lovely hotel, would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Truly deserves 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: myelyse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly famous in its own right-only negative was were unable to check in early. Pros: almost every employee appears to love their job and it shows in their performance. The rooms were great and were extremely over the top for the price. Even the smell of the hotel was enjoyable especially after returning from the other hotels/casinos-no smell of cigarette smoke and always calm environment but not stuffy. Tips: they do have shuttles to Cesars and the Wynn but bring your walking shoes as a 5 minute walk in Vegas is a little more than that; to cross streets sometimes requires returning to a crosswalk/catwalk and then down the stairs again-I understand the safety features for pedestrians and traffic but does cause a lengthier walk. Also the shuttles stop at 11pm and for a town that goes all night that adds to cost when every taxi ride is close to $20 dollars one way

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Harvey79
Reviews.Content: The Trump is an excellent hotel located close to the strip. Unlike most of the hotels on the strip, there is no casino. Thankfully, no smoking is allowed. The lobby is beautiful and the check-in personnel are very helpful and polite. Our room was large and very clean with a great view of the strip. We have stayed in many 4 and 5 diamond hotels along the strip; we like the Trump the best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but I feel deceived”
Reviews.Author: 333DDD
Reviews.Content: I always stay at nice hotels like this because, like with anything else, you get what you pay for. Unfortunately, this was my first trip to Las Vegas and I unwittingly walked into the Resort Fee trap. I thought I got such a good deal on my room, I told everyone how great it was. I just got billed for the resort fee, which I had no idea was coming. I feel that information on this fee was not adequately disclosed by the hotel or by the Web site through which I arranged my stay. I didn't use the spa, the pool, the valet, or room service. I didn't ask for extra towels or anything else. I just slept there. I did use the "complimentary shuttle" and the "free internet" to print my boarding pass. However, note the words "complientary" and "free." These words do not infer that you must pay for these services. It was a nice hotel, but I don't like this deceitful practice, and I won't stay there again. In the future, I will always ask if there is a resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “want to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: good2bad
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice 5 star hotel. Clean, quiet, no casino on the first floor like other hotel in las vagas, really kids friendly, there is a swimming pool on second floor, kids love playing in there, except it close so early, I don't know why, most of the swimming pool in the hotel in LV are close quite early. I would say this is one reason I don't like, since swim in the day is hot. We had a dinner downstairs, and tasty but a little pricy(5 stars, no complain).

Reviews.Title: “It is all in the Details”
Reviews.Author: capngrouch
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, but I see it declining fast. The hotel looks nice from the outside and the lobby area is very nice. The staff we encountered was very pleasant and accommodating. Walking to the strip takes only a few minutes. The sidewalk on the hotel side is closed halfway and you have to cross street, since Trump owns the property up to Las Vegas Blvd., it would be nice if they built a well-lit sidewalk up to the strip. You can always walk through the Fashion Show during open hours and exit through Nordstrom’s. Now to peel back the pretty wrapper, the carpet in the hallway of my floor is starting to show its age, the maid service needs better quality control. In the refrigerator, there was a half open bottle of water, when searching for ice machine, I open the door to stairwell and low and behold, empty bottles of beer, and plates, looks like they had been there a while. There were holes in the sheets and the next day the maid left a bottle of cleaning solution and towel on the cabinet. The showerhead had an excessive amount of lime scale around it and the maid did not clean around the soap dish where I had left the soap wrapper. To summarize, this is a nice hotel and for the price, it was great, but if the Trump wants to compete with some of the other hotels, they will need to start paying attention to details. I would recommend this hotel to folks who want a quiet place to stay while in Vegas and don't mind walking a bit to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Floridagirl551228
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Trump International was wonderful. We booked it on one of the "what you want to pay sites" and was not sure of what we were really getting. But it turned out better than we could have expected. The hotel was beauitful and very welcoming. We were given a upgraded room. It was a FULL suite, with a wonderful veiw. The hotel staff was very helpful. We also love the nice smell of the hotel. We would love to stay here again. Thank you Trump for making our stay so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay , would go again.”
Reviews.Author: JeffCymru
Reviews.Content: Be Aware of the resort fee charged in addition to your accomodation charge, this is not an insignificant amount. Super stay , really good hotel , plenty of facilities. One or two minor problems, although you pay for it, the check -in desk did not ask what newspaper we would like, at check-in, consequently we were unaware of the fact that we had paid for a newspaper as part of the additionl 'resort fee', and we therfore did not get the daily newspaper. Two there were a few niggling problems in the room, these were reported but not addressed. The main bug was, as an interntional hotel, we thought we might be able to get tea bags in our room instead off coffe, as my wife and I are preferred tea drinkers, but no luck. We were told the hotel did not stock tea bags, Probaly one of the most common beverages in the world?

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel but service standards compromised”
Reviews.Author: sanflower
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a little distance from the strip. If you return to hotel past 8.30pm, the shortcut link through Fashion Show Mall would be impossible b'cos Mall closes at 9pm (no entrance after 8.30pm). We had to make a big detour back. However it may be good for guests who want to stay away fr hustle n bustle. This 5-star hotel has 5-star amenities, classy decor, roomy suites (basic suite that we stayed in has a small kitchenette) but its housekeeping standards cannot be matched. Firstly there's a compulsory resort fee of USD 20 imposed per night for services such as internet access (so-called 'free' access comes with a price tag), shuttle to Wynn, $25 spa credit (can't use if you don't spend more than $150), a 10% discount at Trump Store, daily newspapers. We didn't get what was promised. There weren't daily newspapers delivered to us. I saw the papers tucked nicely outside our neighbour's room but not ours. I thought ours might have been picked up by others, but after our 3rd morning, papers still did not arrive. I don't feel that the fee was justified. Any 5-star resort hotel could have provided equivalent stuff, they could have easily build in such costs in their room rates, so why does Trump make guests pay for what they do not need, such as discount coupons, shoe shine services or printing of faxes? it's ridiculous, since some of these services are meant for business travelers. From day one of check in, we could only find facial bar soap for bathing because there was no other provisions (besides shampoo and conditioner). We thought this could be the norm, never did we realised that there's actually bathing bar soap for each room but we got ours only on our 3rd day! More horrifying was to find soapy water in the supposedly cleaned bath tub when we tried to fill it up for a soak. This means that the staff forgot to rinse the bath tub clean after applying cleaning agent! In the end, we had to rinse the tub thoroughly before using it. This was most unforgiving of a 5-star hotel service. In all our high hopes for an enjoyable stay at Trump International was marred by their sub-standard services. Otherwise, it would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mum0fmax
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay! The rooms are stylish and modern and the view is great! This hotel is great for the price and the spa is top notch! This is our second stay there and it won't be the last! Love it there!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Theaeriel
Reviews.Content: The staff were courteous. The moment we walked, we were surrounded by the fresh aroma of flowers. No hint of cigarette smoke what so ever. A rarity in Vegas. The room was open and clean. The rug was a bit damp like they just washed it which was a bit strange. There was a kitchenette in the room which was nice. The robes were sooo comfy. We both wanted to buy them. The actual bed and bedding were great except the pull out sofa bed was pretty uncomfortable with an awfully lumpy mattress. Our jets in the tub didn't work and they comp us a free upgrade. Also when our shuttle didn't arrive on time to the airport, the hotel just sent someone to drive us there so we didn't miss our flight. Superb service. PLus the fashion mall is right across the street and nordstorm cafe is a delicious gem. I love the location. Right at the edge of the strip away from the Vegas craziness but easily accessible when you want to to jump in.

Reviews.Title: “Right Hotel - Wrong Location”
Reviews.Author: ArnldZffl
Reviews.Content: This elegant, luxury hotel is definitely in the wrong place. By that, I mean it is too far from the strip at the back end of the mall, neighboring vacant lots, the railroad and strip clubs. I've overlooked this factor in my overall review because this was a comfortable and quiet hotel with no other complaints. I would recommend the Trump to a friend but with a caveat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cgrizwald
Reviews.Content: A Fabulous hotel with great staff, my wife and I have stayed twice at the Trump and will definitely return as we had our infant son with us the kitchen was great for preparing childs meals overall a great experiance again at the Trump thanks to all the staff for their efforts in ensuring a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we Expected”
Reviews.Author: wouldratherbegolfing
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at Trump International and found it wonderful. The rooms are great and the hotel is great. The bed was so comfortable, I have back issues but it did not bother me. We had to make a couple of calls to get wine glasses, but did get them eventually. The hotel is a good location, but not right in the thick of things. We liked the fact that there was no casino, we could escape that and the noise. The shuttle service to WIN and Caesar's Palace made all the difference and was convenient. The pool was lovely and we always had a lounger. The train every 3 or 4 hours (mentioned by another person) was a bit noisy, but after a couple of nights we didn't even hear it.

Reviews.Title: “5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: Sainthavi
Reviews.Content: Wonderful room, truly a 5 star experience, not too far from the strip. Wonderful staff. Only minus point is they have only valet parking which is great but not handy when u want to run down to the car to get something

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, luxury hotel just off the Strip, so a welcome, quiet oasis in the sea of frenetic activity that is LV.”
Reviews.Author: ChelmsfordPete
Reviews.Content: 500 square feet of luxury and even though we overlooked the city rather than the Strip, it was superb. All rooms were suites and the bathroom was gigantic. Cooking facilities and a 'fridge included together with more drawers and storage space than my wife could handle!!! It didn't cost much more than a regular, small, chain hotel room in the UK. It is off the Strip and distances can be deceiving - the Treausre Island hotel looked as though it was just behind the building over from the Trump but it turned out to be about 20 minutes walk away - fooled by the size of things. For us, it was perfect as there is no casino in the hotel and consequently, it was a 'normal' hotel with none of the noise and bustle associated with all the other hotels on the Strip. One slight annoyance - we pre-paid the hotel before arriving with UK travel organisation which stated that EVERYTHING was paid for and that the hotel should not charge us any more. On arrival, the Receptionist advised that we still had to pay the daily "Resort Fee" of $19.99 plus Tax. We knew about such fees - payable in all the hotels we considered - but this should have been included in the price we paid. The Receptionist advised that we would have to pay it and then claim it back from our booking agent on return to the UK. We did so and it has been refunded. It just set us off on the wrong foot. However, we did enjoy the hotel and would use it again. Our helicopter trip to the Grand Canyon was superb - not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Trump International Hotel is really good value”
Reviews.Author: Prodigy1977
Reviews.Content: The Trump was a very good value stay in Las Vegas, the quality of the rooms is as you would expect from a 4/5star establishment. The staff were really helpful and polite, the breakfast in the DJT Restaurant were really good, especially the skillet breakfast that I had every morning. The only thing to say on a negative front would be I did get woken up by the train going past the rear of the hotel once or twice at about eight in the morning, but this only meant that I had more time to enjoy this mad city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent new hotel, great rooms best in...”
Reviews.Author: John-Suffolk_England
Reviews.Content: Excellent new hotel, great rooms best in Vegas! If you want to stay in a classy quiet hotel then this is it! However it's location is a bit off the beaten track and it lacks facilities e.g. Resturants and of course gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Daylove
Reviews.Content: I really liked the room I got at the Trump. Room was very spacious with a big bath and a great view. The service was impeccable and the hotel location, not right on the strip, provide a shield to the noise and traffic of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: jencfearn
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Felt like real luxury :) Only slight negative - when we checked in we were informed of a $20 per night service charge that was not mentioned when we booked. We got a good deal on the room though, so the extra charge wasn't too upsetting. Great room, and quite nice that the hotel isn't a casino/"attraction". Great!

Reviews.Title: “The Trump TRUMPS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brueckelen_10
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about my Trump experience. The room was larger than expected. The bathroom was huge with a large walk in glassed shower and glassed toilet. TV in the huge mirror and sunken-jetted tub. The bed was conformable and the seating area was spacious. The stovetop and microwave were surprise bonuses, which allowed us to save some money on our meals by cooking our own. The location is close enough to the Strip to walk without discomfort. The Fashion Mall is right across the street. In addition, the lack of a casino works well for me since I do not gamble and prefer not to have the hustle and bustle of casino traffic when trying to enter and exit the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel , my only is only one”
Reviews.Author: indrawiguna76
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel , been the best hotel so far in our trip. the only complain is i was charge US$ 19.99 per night we book 3 room for three night , i was shock to be charge for thet amount ,. but overall is a very good stay, the room is very big and very comfortable. Realy a memorable stay it would be the best if we are not charge US$60 . any way i will still recomend this hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “About as Good as It Gets!!”
Reviews.Author: DDiva0903
Reviews.Content: The Trump is all you'd expect it to be! From the moment you arrive and the white gloved doorman opens the door for you, greeting you with a smile and 'Welcome to Trump', you know you're about to have a luxurious stay. My husband and I stayed at Trump for a week, combining business with pleasure. The suite was amazing, appointed with top of the line amenities. Th suite was spacious, bright and impeccably clean. We had a view of the Fashion Show Mall, Treasure Island, the Palazzo and the Wynn, which also allowed a wonderful view of most of LV. The night view was spectacular!! The Trump is situated just off the Strip and has no casino. That turned out to be wonderful!! They provide shuttle service to the Wynn and Caesar's Palace which gives you access to all that the Strip offers. We found it very relaxing to end our day in elegance, quiet and a smoke free environment. I'd have given Trump 5 stars except for inconsistent housekeeping service and the inconvenience of not having any vending machines available to the guests (sometimes you just want a candy bar). I would definitely stay there again and highly recommend Trump if gambling isn't the purpose of your trip to LV!!

Reviews.Title: “A "5-Star" Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: bsc13
Reviews.Content: From slippery/oily marble floors in the bathroom to a pile of someone else's dirty towels greeting us, first impressions were not favorable. Although housekeeping did take care of the problem, the indifference by the other hotel staff was surprising. The hotel's location is inconvenient if you are wanting to visit the casinos on the strip. In addition, no shuttle service to and from the airport is offered. For a fairly new hotel, it already looks worn, particularly the furnishings in our room. Although various amenities were offered, additional charges - above and beyond the 5-Star rates already imposed - applied to each of them. We always try to look for the positive, so here it is...the bed was comfortable and the view from the 58th floor was nice.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Factor - Wow!”
Reviews.Author: vickster1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights in mid September and were completely blown away by this hotel. Probably one of the best hotels we have stayed at (and that is saying something from 2 ex-hotel industry staff). We had a 1 bedroom suite overlooking the Fashion Show Mall and up towards Treasure Island which was just too luxurious for words! And the bed - we are now suffering with sleep deprivation since returning home as the bed was so comfortable. Big thanks go to housekeeping who did a great job servicing our room each day. I slept with earplugs so wasn't bothered by the train noise - hubby slept through without use of plugs. We found the staff to be pleasant, friendly, helpful and above all smiley at all times. Had a lovely chat with Frederic at the Bell Desk re: the moans about the "incredibly long walk" to the strip!!! It is actually quicker to get to the strip from the Trump then if you are staying at an on strip property - take in the time from your room to the front entrance via a smokey casino - say no more!! Speaking of which, it was so lovely to return to a hotel without a casino, lots of people and cigarette smoke! Only time we found the pool to be busy was on the Saturday - otherwise could always get a lounger and the CWs offered quick service. Used the gym a couple of times and we both commented that despite the size, it offered top of the range fitness equipment. I enjoyed a Trump Signature Massage in the Spa carried out by Wally - the best massage I've ever had. So good, I persuaded hubby to go for one too! We also made use of the shuttle a couple of times to the Caesars - suggestion: half hourly trips to Caesars instead of going to the Wynn. A couple of times we actually beat the shuttle by walking down to the Wynn! We only ever used the H2eau bar so can't comment on breakfast/dinner at DJT - but the food/drinks we had from H2eau were very good and service great - shout out to Andrew on the bar and his special Blue Drew cocktail! Will definitely be returning to the Trump in the not too distant future!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wished we could move in! :)”
Reviews.Author: HarleyCat10
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal to begin with, but then we were upgraded to a 1-bdrm suite at no additional cost when we checked in. Concierge also helped us get a limo for our wedding party at the last minute. Housekeeping staff was terrific, provided everything we asked for and beyond. We did hear the train that some other reviewers have mentioned, but it really didn't bother us. Dry cleaning arrived back in our room on time, and breakfasts from room service were delicious. We didn't have our pets with us, but it was great to see that the hotel was small-pet friendly. Location was slightly off the path for some of the other places we went during our stay, but the hotel provides a free shuttle to Caesar's which definitely helped, especially with that heat! Overall, our stay at the Trump for our wedding was awesome - we'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ksaid
Reviews.Content: We can't really complain ,beautiful room and helpful staff . Across the street from the mall and away from the madness of the strip but i definately recommend the Wynn for either breakfast or dinner a bit pricey but worth it. We will definately come back to the trump.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: EastLansingCouple
Reviews.Content: We chose the Trump for the smaller size and off-strip yet convenient location. Our room was beautiful, the bed was very comfortable, and the mini-kitchen was nice (although we did not use it). The pool was nice, even if the music was a bit loud. The staff did a nice job with getting everyone seated on a very full pool deck. There was a lack of attention to important details, however - the in-room coffee was terrible, there was a huge bathtub but no bubble bath, no extra toilet paper in the bathroom, the "resort" fee included certain items that we did not receive, and the hotel seemed understaffed. For the price, we'd stay there again. Location was perfect for us, and it had everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1kikkat
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this hotel . We stayed 12 nights and found everything perfect. Even though not right on the strip only a 10 minute walk to treasure island or the hotel transport takes you to caesars palace or the wynn. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, too bad it's so far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: Paulina9077
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. What you would expect from Donald Trump. The bathroom was my favorite. I got the smallest room and the bathroom is HUGE. Biggest bathroom I've ever seen in a hotel room. Then again I've never stayed at a fancy expensive hotel. Huge tub, huge shower, TV, everything gold plated. For the price I thought it was great. Felt like a queen. The room I got had a crappy view though. Maybe this is because the hotel itself is so far from the strip. One of my major complaints since there is no casino in it. It's just a hotel. You can walk to the strip I guess, but it's a pain when you are wearing heels. And the part you have to walk to get to the strip is kind of ugly. Nothing there just rubble. But we decided to walk anyway because the parking is valet only. Another complaint. Wish there was self-park because then you have to tip every time. Would I recommend this hotel, yes. Only because it is a hotel review. But I don't recommend it to singles or people trying to have a fun time in Vegas. I personally think it is too far from everything that is going on. If you are looking to have a relaxing and quiet time in Vegas though I definitely recommend this place. It's nice and the price is decent.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel slightly away from hustle and bustle of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LondonRob1961
Reviews.Content: We recently chose to stay at Trump International in Vegas as we got such a good deal and really liked it. It is one block away from the Strip, but within easy reach through the Fashion Show Mall. It is a first class hotel with large comfortable rooms and a decent size pool. However it is more like a normal 5 star hotel than a typical Las Vegas hotel so I wouldn't recommend to anyone who is visiting Vegas for the first time and wants the full-blown experience. But it is a great base to dip in and out of the madness of Vegas. NB there is a daily charge of US$19.95 on top of the room rate. But this gives you free wifi, use of the pool and gym etc.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeLOh
Reviews.Content: I recently extended a business trip by a few days in Las Vegas and decided to give the Trump International a try. What a great idea this turned out to be. The hotel is new, very clean and well maintained. The large suite style rooms are well furnished and elegantly designed. The staff at the hotel is unfailingly polite - it reminds me of the demeanor of a cruise ship staff in that everyone greets you with a smile and a kind word I only have a couple of minor points - and they did nothing to detract from my visit. The toilet paper holder is positioned so close to the commode that every time you sit down, your knee knocks the roll off the holder. Annoying, but hardly worth mentioning. The parking valets can get overwhelmed at times - I understand it is difficult to predict comings and goings, so just keep it in mind; if you are in a hurry, call ahead for your car. Lastly, the housekeeping staff was a bit forgetful at times. One day we found now washcloths, another no coffee for the coffeemaker, yet another no bottled water. Again, not problems, just minor inconveniences. Overall, an overwhelming endorsement of this fine hotel - the lack of smokers makes the beautifully floral scented lobby even more spectacular. the porte cochere with it's gleaming brass and gold makes you feel like you have arrived at a castle. Congratulations to the staff and thanks for a great respite! Mike L.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room in a smoke-free, casino-free hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheVirginian
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the Trump, with its pretty marble bathroom and elegant room. The bed had a feather bed, so it was very comfortable. The room had a kitchenette with a stove, microwave and fridge, allowing us to get food at the food court in the Mall across the street and have an inexpensive dinner and breakfast. Since we don't gamble or smoke, having neither at the Trump made it more attractive to us; there are plenty of casinos nearby if you do. They have big closets, so this might be a good place to stay if you planned a longer visit. Also, they provided robes, making it easy to have something to wear to the pool area, which we enjoyed. The fitness room looked nice, but we didn't use it. They have complimentary valet parking for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel! Comfortable & affordable. Great bed, pillows, bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: GGBVictoria
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel .... except for this charge of $20 for resort and spa hotel fee! When you are on a budget and are not expecting $20 more to the price of the hotel it was a surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Excellent”
Reviews.Author: marinasydney
Reviews.Content: The accommodation was great value. The room had the most comfortable bed I slept in whilst travelling around the USA for a month long trip from Australia. Very clean, they even had a TV in the mirror in the bathroom to top off the feeling of luxury!! Donald Trump sure knows how to do this well. It is close enough to the main part of the strip as far as I am concerned and directly opposite Fashion Show Mall. A shuttle bus runs frequently back and forth to Caesars Palace. However, we mainly walked to the main heart of the strip each time without any problems. This was the nicest hotel we stayed in the USA and I would highly recommend it. Cheers Marina

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Retreat.....”
Reviews.Author: ropier96
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trump Hotel this past weekend. I enjoyed the property and would stay there again! Customer Service: All the staff I encountered were professional, courteous, and approachable. That incuded: Ronnie (Valet), Addrienne (Front Desk), Lia and Michelle (Telephone) and all the housekeeping staff. Location: The hotel is off the strip which I liked. It's only a five minute stroll, if that. If the heat is too much cut across the street to the Fashion Show Mall and walk through it to the boulevard. Room: The room was nice. I booked a Studio City View - King room. The built in wall unit was exceptional. That's something you dont see much in a hotel room. Excellent value for the money. My only "gripe" was the freaking train(s)! Oh, I had to call the tech support to help with the internet connection on 2 occassions. Pool Area/ Gym: The pool was busy but not like a "MTV Spring Break" pool party. If your looking for a NON STOP pool party throw down. Then this hotel may not be for you. The gym was clean with ample modern equipment to get yo' workout on! Overall: Excellent value for the money. Nice Property and location for those who want to enjoy craziness that is LV but want to unplug from the strip when wanted....

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable.....”
Reviews.Author: seacliff908
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nites at Trump while on business. I originally had booked a studio suite online but when there was an issue with the room the front desk upgraded me without hesitation to a beautiful 1 bedroom / 2 bath suite. Everything without question is of high quality including the sub zero appliances & wonderful spa tub. Service is absolutely impeccable & the pool has a nice feel with comfortable seating where you can look up at the 24 kt gold plated windows of trump in additon to watching the fireworks from the neighboring TI. Nordstrom's & fashion show mall just a few steps away. The hotel is a quiet non gaming property located just off the strip which I enjoy while on business. The only negative would have to be the trains which were a bit loud & ran through the nite. Overall an exceptional experience & I will most certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Trump”
Reviews.Author: JBOH49
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights at the Trump, Las Vegas. We liked the idea of it being off the strip with no casino and we were very pleased with our decision. The staff and amenities were exceptional and our room (studio) was beautiful and spacious. We really enjoyed our stay at the Trump. My only complaint is the very small coffee pot and very few coffee packs in the room (and I might add - no free coffee in the lobby or at the pool.) Hey Donald...we need our coffee in the morning! LOL

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: tessajane
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Hotwire and was not made to fee inferior in any way. We agreed to pay a bit extra to upgrade to a suite, and had an amazing corner suite with 2 bathrooms, kitchen, sitting/dining room and bedroom. Everything wascomfortable and great and minor problems (no remote control) attended to rapidly. My husband found the staff a little obsequious, but I didn't. The fact that this hotel was off the strip was ideal for us! Lovely to be away from the crowds. Free Wi-Fi and valet parking a bonus

Reviews.Title: “close to shopping center, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ggi_Wilen
Reviews.Content: nice business building, large room concept, exec meeting room

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic room.”
Reviews.Author: pmyumjr
Reviews.Content: Having had to change our plans thanks to the Iclandic volcano. We decided to drive to vegas from LA. This meant we arrived a day earlier than we were scheduled to. Seeing as we had been messed about, we decided to treat oursleves and booked in at the trump for one night. Impressed isn't the word. The lobby is glorious and the rooms divine. A slight problem with the freight train horn in the morning but made up for by the lavish hotel room. We decided as we had a week ahead at the luxor and the hotel was so lovely to make the most of it after grabbing a bite to eat at the Mall across the road we come straight back opend a bottle of JD and put tunes on. We took full advantage of the whirlpool bath and ktichnette. Much recommended as a brake from or alternative to the casino hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: rianne25
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in this absolutely fantastic hotel. Was a bit scared because of some of the negative comments here but I loved the Trump. The hotel itself is beautiful and the employees are more than willing to help you with your every need. The room was huge, very clean and the best of all: a strip view which was amazing at night. It's indeed of the strip, but there is a shuttle that will bring you to the Wynn or to Caesars Palace, which is very convenient. You can walk to the strip, it's not that far, or just take a cab. And no there is no casino, but do your homework before coming to a hotel. And yes, there is a 20 dollar 'resort fee' but most of the hotels have a resort fee and again: do your homework before coming. But I have to agree on something: there is a train and ik makes a hell of a noise in the middle of the night. Woke me up 2 times. But I think there are other hotels, like the mirage that is also next to the train, that have this problem. Didn't use the spa or the restaurant because they were really expensive... I would recommend this hotel to everyone that seeks some rest after a crazy night in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “A waste of my money”
Reviews.Author: natasha015
Reviews.Content: Looked up all the reviews before we left and did not believe the bad ones! BELIEVE THEM! Service is terrible. Had to call repeatedly to housekeeping for soap, hangers, wash cloths, shampoo,etc. Television broke and they never fixed it. Don't count on the shuttle service - ended up taking a cab most of the time. Friendly service? Not! Food in the restaurants was mediocre and pricey. Pool was awful. Try Caesar's or Bellagio or anywhere else for that matter. Glass of wine $13.00. I am from New York so that was bad compared even New York. My anniversary and asked for a room with a view - received one over the parking lot. Ruined my trip and would never go back to Vegas or another Trump for that matter. Thought with the "Trump" name it would be great. Think again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option: Very nice place without the chaos of a casino hotel”
Reviews.Author: FMassuda
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an amazing 5-star option. One friend and I went to Vegas to party mostly and this hotel is strategically located close to the best clubs at Wynn, Encore, Palazzo and Venetian.
