A key differential of the Trump is that it is not a casino hotel so it is relaxing and calm, allowing you to clearly separate fun from relaxing times. The staff is very helpful and the concierge was amazing in hooking us up with deals in clubs and restaurants. The fact that the staff is used to dealing with calmer hotel guests makes the service very professional and efficient. No 30-min queues to check-in. The rooms are big with a bed and a sofa-bed, looking like more a business hotel room and not a stravaganza mix. This one has become my favorite place in Vegas. I had stayed in Palazzo, Wynn and Treasure Island before.

Reviews.Title: “Service was beyond what we had expected!”
Reviews.Author: Sandmann00
Reviews.Content: We never thought we would have this sort of service from any hotel. It felt like we were Royalty. Every request we had was taken care of immediately by a gentleman by the name of Jonathan at the front desk, even things we didn't know we could ask for were actually provided before even asking. We've never had such a wonderful experience with service. Next time we go back we will be staying here. Even though people might think it is very far from the strip, it is actually a short walk to the Wynn, and the staff is very helpful when it comes to getting around. It's like having a friend in Vegas, they helped us finding the one in a million limo rate to get us around, instead of us paying out of the nose for cabs etc... Unlike other hotels when you walk out to get a cab it seems like they might be getting some sort of kick back. This place will actually suggesting the best option for us. I think everyone should try and stay here to see what a difference it is. Rooms were nice and the bathroom is just enormous. I can't say enough great things about The Trump Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed here for a night whilst we were...”
Reviews.Author: rishi_parwani
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night whilst we were in Vegas. My first impression was how grand the hotel exterior was. It was so gold and fancy. The lobby was also very classy! This hotel felt very exclusive because there wasn't a casino. Good for families and makes the place less crowded. The room was AWESOME! Very luxurious! In my opinion, the bathroom was the best. The jacuzzi tub, the mini TV, it was so nice! The room was also very upscale, the mini kitchenette was also very useful. This is a great family hotel. Two thumbs up :)

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel room I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: LizWhitcher
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are from London England and we LOVE theTrump International Hotel Las Vegas. We discovered this place last year and we decided to go again for our honeymoon recently. Firstly, the building is covered in gold!!!- who does not love gold? Secondly it is literally opposite fashionshow mall which has live fashion shows on the hour every hour pm...in the middle of a shopping centre. Now some of your other hotels may have their own string of shops but Fashion show mall is so close to the Trump and yet it has 'normal highstreet shops'- this is a factor I love about the Trump and something I would consider a unique selling point eventhough the two are not officially linked. Once you have walked the length of fashion show mall you are on the strip...how easy- it shocks me that people complain the Trump is out the way as it's not, unless you are really lazy. If you are in a lazy mood however it will cost no more than 15 dollars (including a generous tip) to go to somewhere like the luxor (note Criss Angel show=excellent!!)....probably half of that if you were going to the stratosphere.. The thing is the Trump is exclusive and being on our honeymoon we loved that factor!! We didn't want to stay in a casino hotel where homeless people walk in and out. We wanted to relax and have room service up to the room when we wanted. Room service was fantastic btw. Security is excellent too. Again, it's lovely not to have unknown people entering the building. I felt safe there. The gym is state of the Art, the swimming pool is of a moderate size but it feels just right. The cocktails you can order are great- I must have had a few Banana pina coladas!! The staff are generally polite. The cleaners did not always clean the room. We stayed for 9 nights- they missed us twice and came really late another time (better late than never I guess)....it's not a huge issue as we are tidy people. I do think had I have called they would have come up- it did mean we missed out on the water we paid for in our resort fee though... but I am nit picking.....everything else literally was FANTASTIC.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and even better it's non smoking, we'll be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryBlue
Reviews.Content: Great experience from the moment our car was valet parked to the moment we left. It's a 4-5 min walk from the Wynn intersection, dark at night but nothing to be concerned about. Heard the train a few times, even though we were on the 29th floor, nothing to be concerned about ...... I see some have complained, if it's quiet and solitude you're looking for don't go to Las Vegas. Great rooms, comfortable bed, huge tub, what more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Great place for non smokers, non gamblers, families, shoppers.”
Reviews.Author: KNara
Reviews.Content: I chose the Trump because of a promotion I found on Travelzoo for $78/night. I was thrilled when I got there and found no smokers inside and no noisy glitzy gambling areas. What a quiet respite just a few minutes away from the excitement of the strip. The rooms are awesome - plasma in room and in bathroom mirror. Amazing bathroom, kitchenette area, sitting area, lots of space. Because of its location it was very quiet but we did hear the train noise once. If you pay the extra to have a room facing the strip, I guess you won't hear that. I also loved not having the frenzy of a casino. When you walk in there is the heavenly aroma of fresh flowers, nothing else. In fact the calmness of the place makes up for the fact that the spa facility is not impressive. My girlfriend was ecstatic that we could walk across to the fashion walk mall. It's a nice "regular" upscale mall with Nordstrom and the usual mall fixtures, plus a really neat fashion runway that elevates from the floor for a fashion show every hour. You won't find Versace or Gucci boutique here, but lots of good stuff at much better values. A big plus for me and my high maintenance girls who don't look at price tags. The only reason that I gave three stars for service was because my girlfriend went ballistic because it took housekeeping an hour to bring her a shower cap and the spa was unimpressive. Aside from that, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: melpas80
Reviews.Content: my husband and i were in the second part of our three part holiday and this remains the highlight of our trip. this hotel is amazing. i felt like a queen staying at this place with its beautiful reception and helpful staff. the amenities were outstanding, the bathroom enormous and the bed super comfortable. it probably helped that we had checked out of a two star in LA but we were blown away by the luxury this place offered. The only thing i have to criticise is the distance from the main drag. its not within walking distance but they do offer a fantastic shuttle service so really i cant complain. its not central to the main drag but its right behind the fashion mall and close to the venetian hotel and other things. its on the lower end of the main drag so you would stay here if you wanted less noise and a bit more time out.

Reviews.Title: “Trump was a disappointment in most areas for us”
Reviews.Author: travelingman045
Reviews.Content: 1. We left a gameboy Dsi in the hotel room and we called and you shipped it to us, thanks!!! but someone took out our memory card out.. had many photos and games on it.. not happy. 2. Our room was never cleaned one day... even had the lights on to get it cleaned.. then got a message at 4:10pm that we couldn't service our room due to a do not disturb light was on.. we did not have do not disturb light on .. it was the cleaning one (100% sure). 3. We ate at the restaurant in the lobby.. had some issues with bad service ... ordered fries.. never came and our waitress after 20 minutes never came by... so i said something to the manager... next i know the hostess helped the table next to us and on purpose kicked the back of my chair. Come on.. i say at a lot of hotels and never have any of the above issues in a long time. I left two messages for the manager at the hotel while onsite and NEVER got a call back. Room was nice.. Tub pump did not work for bubble action. I just expected better ... that's is all... I go to over 30 hotels a year... and truly this is the only one so far i was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “It's all in the details, Donald.”
Reviews.Author: elvisharon
Reviews.Content: I attended a trade show in Las Vegas and selected the Trump Hotel for location and the room rate. I had problems from the start with reservations as they sent the confirmation to the wrong email address. I spent over 20 minutes on the phone then trying to confirm my reservation. There is no casino in this hotel which was terrific for my situation. The room was spacious, with a fridge, sink, cooktop and microwave. The sole restaurant is ridiculously priced but the Fashion Mall is close by which gives you more options. The hotel is located off of the strip and by itself. The night before I left, after staying there 4 nights, I came to realize from reading a little card with my room key that there is a complimentary shuttle that would take you to the strip. I saw no other mention of this during my stay. This is the best kept secret as no one mentions this, not even the concierge. It would have been nice to have known this upon check-in. The hotel is clean and the room is nice but I did have some trouble with housekeeping. They ignored my "housekeeping" light that was on for at least 12 hours. I came back to the room to find they didn't make up my room. It took almost an hour on the phone with the hotel operator and housekeeping to get some towels. They did offer to make up my room but it was 1:30 AM and I just wanted some clean towels at that point. There are several little details that needed to be attended to that I was constantly calling housekeeping for: hangers, pen and paper, etc. It is also a little bothersome to hear the train which seems to be nearby. If you want to be in the midst of it all, well located on the strip, this is not the place to stay. In my case, I had a room rate of $89 which worked for me. Additionally, these Las Vegas resort fees that are not mentioned, yet added to your bill are just a way to increase the room rate. Access to the fitness center, "free" internet, water and coffee in the room, are not free...they are covered by this additional resort fee of $19.95 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay with small inconveniences”
Reviews.Author: melissann17
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent at the Trump...each staff member seemed to go out of their way to ensure our stay was superb at the Trump. Rooms are spacious and very clean. Rooms definitely make it a 5 star. Also, there is a convenient free shuttle service to/from the Wynn and Caesars palace, so you really don't need to pay for a cab. If you need wireless Although there are small things we didn't like (but this wouldn't affect us from staying there in the future, but you should be aware of. The pool is small...definitely not like the pool areas at Bellagio or Wynn. If you have a car, there is only valet at Trump and no self park so you have to wait about 10-20 mins for your car. One can see this as a plus or minus--for us it was fine, there is no smoking or gaming at Trump. We didn't get lost looking for our elevators stumbling into the hotel lobby which was good. And, since we are not smokers (anymore) we didn't mind the non-smoking policy at all. I would definitely recommend the Trump!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous place but not near strip”
Reviews.Author: hcmjkm
Reviews.Content: The hotel, and room, was fabulous - as clean and nice as can be, with every amenity. Huge room with a fabulous kitchenette which gives all other kitchenettes a bad name. No casino, which is delightful - but it is a long walk from the strip. I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Weekend at Trump was Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: tdob217
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from a long weekend in Las Vegas for my 55th birthday. A friend and I stayed at the Trump International Hotel on Fashion Show Drive for 4 nights. The hotel was awesome. The customer service was impeccable - Lonnie at the front desk was especially courteous and helpful - and the concierges were terrific. The rooms were spacious and clean. The beds were divine. The bathroom was superior and the public spaces were gorgeous. I had read in other reviews that the location was a bit off because it wasn't on the main strip, but we found it perfectly fine. The mall across the street (with a great and inexpensive food court) was a welcome surprise and the short walk to the strip was not a problem for us (altho' we did take advantage of the free Trump shuttle to the Wynn Hotel and Caesar's Palace shops many times to avoid walking in the hot sun). Overall it was a perfect weekend for us and a very memorable birthday for me! Thanks to all the wonderful staff at the Trump Hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to have a safe, relaxing, luxurious stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Scarlett74
Reviews.Content: Totally different to the other hotels we visited on the strip – no cigarette smoke, no slot machines, no gamblers. Yes, the hotel was a short walk away from the main attractions, but it was nice to get away from all of the noise at the end of a tiring day of sightseeing! We had a corner junior suite which had a view up the strip – it was awesome. The room was huge with its own kitchenette and the bathroom was massive with a window over the bath which also looked over the strip. The service was excellent and the staff very friendly. The pool was great, we stayed at the hotel in February and expected it to be cool outside. In fact we managed to fit a whole morning sunbathing by the pool on the very comfortable sun loungers – very unexpected, but fantastic! The only downside which is to be expected in this standard of hotel, was that food and drink in the hotel was very expensive compared to the other hotels, we paid in excess of $26 per person for breakfast one morning!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been perfect, apart from garbage incident!”
Reviews.Author: cityhotelsightseeing
Reviews.Content: The Trump Las Vegas is a beautiful hotel, but far from perfect. When you arrive the service is excellent- Welcome to Trump and Trump is mentioned a lot (Donald would be pleased). However Donald would not be pleased with the badly chipped inroom furniture. And he certainly wouldnt be pleased with the garbage that was left in the bin under the sink cupboard (I left it out so they would see it) but when I returned from a day out it reappeared on the desk chair. I called the front desk and they asked me if Id like someone to come up and collect it- I said not to worry as I was leaving the next morning anyway. However at 10.30am (30minutes before checkout) someone knocked on my door to collect it and I had the do not disturb sign on. Not really the type of service you would expect from one of The Leading Hotels of the World group. Ps. Location at top of strip near Fashion Show Mall is good, just a short walk to lots of casino s. Pps Resort fee s here is rubbish, included access to internet- but you had to pay for it in the business centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with one small problem”
Reviews.Author: NC_Rambler
Reviews.Content: The Trump is a great hotel! The rooms could not be more comfortable, and the staff was friendly and professional. Rooms included a plush bed, amazing bathroom with great products, comfortable sitting area, and well-stocked kitchen. The hotel is located very close to the Strip, an easy walk down the street or through the mall across the street, and the hotel offers frequent shuttles down to the strip (a one-minute drive), if you need it. The only problem was that we asked to be in a room next to a relative, and she was placed instead down the hall and around the corner. Otherwise, the Trump service was fantastic, from the helpful concierge to the speedy valet. We really enjoyed the spa, which cannot be beat! Also, we were happy to stay in a non-smoking and non-gaming hotel. While we enjoyed casinos at other locations such as the close-by Wynn, the Trump was a perfect retreat from the noise and smell. I would definitely stay again at the Trump upon returning to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “quiet hotel in vegas”
Reviews.Author: alamedass2005
Reviews.Content: nice stay in trump hotel, is not a casino resort, so is ideal for relax from the busy strip. the staff is very friendly, hig speed internet and a really nice room with view to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Valet All the Way”
Reviews.Author: fas933
Reviews.Content: Just off the Strip .....not a Hotel/Casino.....just the Hotel. It starts with a friendly efficient valet service and continues with a welcoming fragrance piped into the lobby. I've had friendlier desk people, they were efficient but not as welcoming as the fragrance at the door. Its four star all the way....the room was very nicely appointed......for the great deal I got I wouldn't stay anywhere else, when I go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “no disappointments, no regrets... a wonderful stay when in LV”
Reviews.Author: kevin098
Reviews.Content: Some may find it pricey, particularly with regard to fees and taxes, but the staff and amenities more than make up for it. Will be back for a week June 2011

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par with other Trump locations”
Reviews.Author: peking2010
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Trump New York and Trump Chicago (one of my favorite hotels in the US) so I chose Trump Las Vegas for a recent business trip -- it was a bad call. The property is not up to par with its sister properties. What I enjoy and require most at Trump are the amenities that come with a studio-type or suite room, the actual fridge, dishes, dishwasher, sink and cooktop -- these are perfect for entertaining guests or colleagues. In Las Vegas, you have 2 small plates and 2 glasses, that's it. I thought it was just an oversight, so I called down for additional glasses -- beer glasses, wine glasses, cocktail glasses, but they only brought up 2 additional water glasses that you would find in the bathroom. They also seem to skimp on the little details, robes and slippers, extra towels in the bathroom, etc. I'll go back to the Four Seasons in Las Vegas while on business and let our Travel department know the experience... even the Bellagio beats the Trump, hands down. Oh, I also sent my feedback to the Trump Attache, who is there solely to assist clients -- not even a response.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet undestated elegance all around -- simply exceptional !”
Reviews.Author: cliu
Reviews.Content: this is our first time staying at the trump las vegas and initially we hesitated because of the mixed reviews i had read on trip advisor so i thought i give it a try first hand. Well, trump absolutely did NOT disappoint ! we have stayed in many 5 star resorts around the world and trump is truly exceptional in the room decor which is very tastefully decorated and the service by housekeeping and front desk are fantastic. i presume some of the mixed reviews come from people who were expecting something else quite different. imho, if you are like me, in the 50s, wanting a property that exudes quiet elegance, upscale living, extensive fitness room, exceptionally efficient service, smoke-free environment, no casino, then trump las vegas is THE place for you. however, if you are in your early 20s and expecting rowdy atmosphere by the pool and loud partying with drinking and getting drunk and abnoxious then trump is NOT the place for you. we were lucky enough to get a corner premium corner suite on the 58th floor and the view is to die for ! at night, when i am in the bath tub, i can see all the neon lights right outside because the window beside the bathtub is huge. the full kitchen is great...sub zero fridge, wolf stove and oven, bosch dishwasher and microwave and dishes and pots were all brought up so quickly for us. in our unit is 2 full bathrooms and the handy kitchen where venetian has no kitchen and only 1 bathroom. the size of the master bathroom is huge ! it even has a plasma tv built into the mirror. i was anxious about the elevator accelerating and decelerating too strongly but it absolutely did NOT do that. i have vertigo and i had absolutely no problems with the elevators. they were efficient and not shaky at all. others have also complained about the location being far away from everything, but they have a complimentary shuttle that brings you to the strip every 15 mins and if you have your own car, the trump location was no probs at all. it is directly a hopscotch from the fashion show mall , nordstroms, and across the street from encore/wynn. we really liked the trump location. in conclusion, if you want to try out the trump but you have hesitations like i did, let me reassure you that you will not be sorry. trump is definitely a very upscale property that exudes grandiose and luxury with quiet elegance. we know we will be back to the trump on our next visit to vegas. we love our corner suite very much. thank you trump las vegas for offering us such excellent accomodations/amenities.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel stay ever. Affordable luxury. Will always stay here when in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: dnrinaz
Reviews.Content: After considering other hotels and reading different reviews, I was going to stay elsewhere as we were on a budget. I don't even remember how I ran across the Trump International Hotel Las Vegas but there was a special of $96 a night and we were staying 2 nights so we took it. I was so glad that we did. I spent about $25 more than the other 2 places that I was considering but after coming home, I realized that I made the right decision. I have to say first of all, we try to go the cheap route when coming to Vegas, staying at places like the travel-inn or travel lodge, super 8 and so-on, so the opportunity came about to have a little bit of luxury for not much more so we went for it. Let me start with things that I didn't like about this hotel (which isn't much) just to get them out of the way. Dislikes: There is a train that runs fairly close to the hotel that whistles very loudly at all hours of the night. (other reviews have stated that as well but you get used to it and pretty soon it doesn't bother you.) For security reasons, there are outer-doors that you have to use your key to open up and then your room door and the next door is inside of a foyer and it becomes very loud and slamming of door sounds when people are coming and going. That can get annoying when it is late at night and you are trying to sleep. There is a resort fee of $14 that you have to pay for each day you stay, and I think that if you use the pool, spa, and so-on, then yes, you should be charged, but if you don't use these services, you shouldn't be charged and should have a choice. So if those are the dislikes, then this hotel is still within the 5 star calibur for me. I stayed in room 5500 on the 55th floor in a studio with a strip view and these are the likes about my stay: As mentioned in other reveiws, there are certain ammenities that are here and not at other hotels that I stayed at: TV in the bathroom mirror, jaccuzzi bathtub, giant tv in the sitting area, king size bed (with the most comfortable mattresses and bed linins that were so crisp and clean, I never wanted to leave the bed), plenty of sitting area (with a couch and 3 chairs), the full kitchenette (complete with toaster, microwave, stove-burners, mini fridge, blender, utensils, and cookware), hair dryer, separate shower and toilet room, bathroom scale (just in case you want to weigh yourself while on vacation?), robes to use, iron and ironing board, lots of closet space and drawer space, free newspaper and the most amazing view of the strip looking towards treasure island all the way to Mandalay bay. The staff was incredably helpful and went out of their way to make sure that all our needs were met and were available for anything at anytime. They truly went above and beyond for us and I felt like I was an important guest. In other reviews I saw that people hated the fact that there were staff members waiting by the elevators and checking keys and I felt that it just helps to make sure only hotel guests get on the elevators and it wasn't a bother for us to get our keys out, as we needed to get them out to enter the room anyway. We ended up stuck at the excalibur hotel and didn't want to spend a fortune getting back to our hotel so we called the bell desk to ask what we could do that was cheap and they said, no problem, and sent a car to pick us up. No charge whatsoever. (We did tip the guy, but that was much cheaper and faster than any other means of transportation). That is what you call number one A+ service. It is across the street from the Encore and Wynn and next to the fashion show mall so not exactly on the strip but you have about a 2 minute walk (the width of 1/2 of the mall) to get to las vegas blvd. On some of the other reviews, people talked about how far it was from the strip and was not very convenient, I think that is because some people are lazy and probably should walk if they are going to complain about 120 seconds of walking. I think that the location is more towards the middle of the action, very centrally located. Overall, I was very pleased with the level of value, luxury, friendliness of staff, ease of checking in and out, comfort level of the rooms, and location of this hotel. I am telling all of my friends about my stay and will aways stay here while in Vegas and hopefully get the same room as I was completely satisfied with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: branci
Reviews.Content: Sooooo nice, we didn't want to go out. Bathroom is amazing, with hot tub next to the window and tv in the mirror. You have shuttle service to the strip. Full kitchen with appliances, great view, bed do comfortable... We are coming back soon!!! Thank you Trump Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a reasonable price excellent staff at spa!”
Reviews.Author: Ridethathorse
Reviews.Content: Hillary at the front desk remembered us, was kind enough to give a free upgrade to strip view. Room was very clean and comfortable. Loved the shower and tub. The train was a bit loud, take the good with the bad. Staff very helpful, very well run hotel. It was a short walk to the strip, take note early birds that the shuttle does not start running until 10am. If you trek across to the fashion show mall and it winds around to the strip, much more entertaining and cooler walk than up the road. Spa was excellent, Debbie is the greatest and super knowledgable. You want to book with her for sure. The spa is quite nice, however you need to go to the pool area to use a hot tub. There are no baths in the spa, but does have nice rain showers. Would definately stay again, my new favorite Vegas hotel! Many thanks to excellent staff for a relaxing and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “An experience like no other!”
Reviews.Author: Mommala
Reviews.Content: We are a modest family with modest means, this trip was for our 20th Anniversary, we splurged! The ammenities were awesome, more than I even dreamed. The room was so very luxurious, I wanted to pack it up and bring it home! The guest service was friendly and even better than that, the staff greeted you by name and offered extra assitstance without having to be asked ( like: do you need directions this morning?) We were fortunate enough to meet a very well known stars brother. We were going to sit by him while awaiting our car one morning, and like any southern gentelman, my husband asked the gentelman if he minded that we sit. That common courtesy struck-up a conversation and we were really blessed by his kind words to us that day. I have not mentioned his name out of respect for his privacy .... but kind sir, if you find this note about you and do not mind, I would definately tell the world who this kind soul is. Thank you Trump International for the time of my life!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: kryztyne
Reviews.Content: You will find better value for the money at this Hotel! It's immaculate, the pool is awesome, and the restaurant has really good food! The girls in the spa really know how to give a great massage! We aren't smokers, so it was nice to stay in a hotel without a casino and have clean air and quiet rooms. Our corner room had a view from both the master bedroom and the master bathroom of the strip and the mountains and was incredible! Imagine relaxing in your jacuzzi tub, drinking champagne, and looking out on the strip? Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: mispig
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it was non-smoking and non-gaming. After the bustle of Vegas, it was lovely to return to this serene place for the night. Room was large and lovely. Includes a fridge, stove, microwave, and dishes, which were convenient for snacks and drinks. We had the studio on the 30th floor with "train track" view. I did hear the train a few times, but it did not interfere with our sleep. Bathroom had the best tub! Both my husband and I fit in it with room to spare; it was huge! I was disappointed that it was not cleaned everyday and twice we had to wait 2 days before housekeeping cleaned it. Housekeeping was great at most everything else: changing the bed when requested, washing dishes, and supplying a humidifier on request too. We consulted the concierge almost everyday and the staff were very helpful and knowledgeable about the city. Walk to the strip was very short. We often cut through the Fashion Show Mall for the A/C! The Wynn/Encore, Venetian/Palazzo, and Treasure Island are all a quick walk, perhaps 10 minutes, tops. We'd definitely stay here again. Loved the atmosphere, location was adequate, and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in US!!”
Reviews.Author: mcoelho7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just amazing... from the facilities to the staff and services... It's 10/10. I travelled with my daughter and we had a great experience from start to end. No doubt I will stay there again next time I am in Vegas. The suite we stayed was very roomy...they also have the quickest internet I've experienced in the US!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW - A Great 5 star hotel - Service Plus!!!”
Reviews.Author: ThePearl14
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Las Vegas as we celebrated her retirement from 37 years of work with a 5 day - 4 night stay at the Trump International. We were impressed by all the positive reviews the Trump hotel received on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel was just fantastic- with its non smoking and no casino policy - it was the "cleanest and freshest" hotel on the strip. The service was truly 5 star - from the front desk to the doormen to the shuttle bus drivers - professional and friendly. The room we had was on the 49th floor with an amazing view of the strip. The room was extremely large with all the amenities of a 5 star hotel. The kitchen area with stove, microwave and sub-zero fridge was an added bonus. The room contained the largest bathroom(including a jacuzzi tub) I have ever seen in a hotel and even had a TV in the mirror. The bed and mattress was the most comfortable my wife and I have ever experienced in any hotel. The staff of the hotel really want to impress you with their service - everyone goes out of their way to ensure that you are comfortable and have everything you need for a great stay. The hotel is located directly across from the Fashion show mall and it is a 20 second walk across the street to the entrance to Nordstroms. For those of you that love to shop - you cannot get a better or closer hotel to great shopping. The shuttle service to the strip and to The Forum shops at Caesar's was a great way to get to the mid strip area. Overall - a great experience - great price for 5 star service and the cleanest and freshest hotel on the strip. If you want first class service - a non smoking and non casino environment - close to shopping - the best choice is the Trump International. E & J Kosty Surrey, B.C. Canada

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel! I recommend this place to anyone travelling to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: NewfieGirl83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. The rooms were very luxurious and clean. They were also really spacious. When we arrived at 7pm, there were no lines to wait in, and the reception area was not full of smoke (like other Vegas hotels). We were so happy we stayed here. And for those of you who are worried about the location (off the strip)...it is not nearly as bad as you might think. Just a minute away! Practically next door to Treasure Island.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjh44
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 4 nights at the Trump & have to say its one of the best hotels we have stayed in. Wonderful rooms with a full sofa & arm chairs, strip view but away from the crowds! Non smoking which was very pleasant & good pool area. Didn't sample the food so cant comment on that but can say we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, great base for a Las Vegas holiday”
Reviews.Author: Lucy_OBrien
Reviews.Content: Just come back from staying at the Trump Tower's in Las Vegas for a family reunion and have to say what a great hotel this was. Initially built as serviced apartments (and some rooms are owned exclusively) most of the building is now a hotel with kitchen's in every room. We upgraded on arrival to a 1 bedroom corner suite for $30 (USD) a night and boy it was worth it. The views overlooking the Strip from this side of the hotel were fab, especailly at night. The bed was huge and plush, the main bathroom is probably just as big as the bedroom and the living space is very generous and included a second bathroom, which is still a decent size. The kitchen is in general well equipped although it was lacking in pots and pans, although I'm sure if we had asked for some they would have been supplied. The hotel is not on the strip itself however it is only a 10 minute walk to it, or you can jump on one of the 2 free shuttle services supplied. One takes you to the corner or the Fashion Show Mall the other takes guests to Caesars Palace - be warned however the one to Caesars is very busy in the evening so get in the queue early so you get a seat! You can also cross over the road and walk through the Fashion Show Mall, if it is open, where there are a larger number of shops and a food court if you want something quick and easy. Trump towers doesn't feature a casino, but actually that was probably one of the nice things about it - calming after walking through all the other places and despite the fact that it was fairly full on the weekend it didn't feel like it was, unlike the other large hotels we visited. The staff are brilliant, the service impecable and rooms are great. One down side I would say is that there are not enough sun umbrellas by the pool, which are definately needed if you visit Vegas in July! Only thing to be aware of is that there is a resort fee of $20 per day, however this does include the valet parking (just need to tip the guys about $2 when you get your car) and the free internet. Apparently lots of US hotels are now imposing this kinda of daily fee, which although seems to be a pain the service is faultless and so we didn't mind paying it.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints. However...”
Reviews.Author: juststartedtraveling
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not house a casino or a 24 hr restaurant. It is a block away from The Strip and the hotel runs an unnecessary shuttle that ferries guests back and forth to it. Trump is at the far northern side of The Strip with nothing but Circus Circus directly north of it and Wynn/Encore Northeast of it. The Fashion Mall is directly across the street. Rooms have a full kitchen (sink, hot plate, microwave, fridge) and could pass for studio apartments. This is a great hotel if you are bringing children along.

Reviews.Title: “perfekt.....”
Reviews.Author: Norway03 Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: Thank you for a perfekt stay at Thrump Las Vegas, we had a 8 nigths stay whit you, and erery thing was as we wanted it.... tre rooms was really nice, and i loved the little store at the hotell, did some shopping there...... and most of all the lobby, no casino wonderfull, quite and so nice to look at, the most eksklusiv i have seen.... we travell from norway, so time to get there was very long, but every thing was better than expected.... we are looking forward to coming back this year.....

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: alwaysdreaming2k
Reviews.Content: i thought we were booking a five star hotel, but only feeling this is one star place. to start off, they never told you that there is a daily $20 resort fee to cover what a hotel suppose to offer (Pool, Fitness Center, Coffee and etc). And the hotel claim they will drop and pick up hotel guests off the Vegas strip and Ceasar Forum Shop. Well, the catch is, the drop off and pick up from Ceasar Forum shop is only every hour, not to mention finding the pick up spot from Ceasar forum shop is more complicated and impossible than anyone can imagine. I believe this is part of their scam in not making it accessible for hotel guests. What can I say, the hotel itself is nice, except it is located in the middle of nowhere, if you want to do anything, be ready to leave the hotel. Oh did I mention the television did not work in our room, we called the operator, it took them more than 30 minutes to get here. TRUMP NEVER AGAIN. Save your money go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, and theft problems, hotel security problems”
Reviews.Author: siarah21
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have ever written a review but I feel like people should know this stuff before they stay at any hotel! We were staying at the trump hotel and we had to change rooms initially do to sinks being clogged and no power. But wait it gets better. We had let in the late morning to get some food and left the room service bell on. We came back to hours later and the bed was made the service light was off. Nothing was clean in the rooms, no clean towels nothing, not even the bottle water we had to pay 20 dollars a day to have. Our stuff had been ransacked and gone through and 500.00 dollars of stuff, camera etc.. was taking from my bag. The maid pretty much came into our room stole our stuff and left. We reported it to security, but as of know I have not heard if this woman is still working there, or is going to have anything done about it. Scary to think Trump would hire someone like this. She didn't even do her job probably as just going room to room stealing stuff, since she wasn't cleaning. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, no one deserves to feel like this, or be violated, and have their stuff ransacked. The experience was disturbing to say the least. Do yourself a favor, stay at a luxury hotel that has better staff. The Venetian was amazing...and luxurious...on our last nothing even close to this horrific experience at the Trump hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke-free, gaming-free, crowd-free property is a big plus”
Reviews.Author: BriarClubCommish
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 6 nights at the Trump. A terrific clean room, 48th floor, with a perfect view of the Strip. We would not have changed a thing. Look, if you spend anytime reading hotel reviews on Trip Advisor you will realize that the Trump's smoke-free, gaming-free, crowd-free property is a big plus for some, and not for others. Our trip to Vegas was for sightseeing, shows and relaxing at the pool. The Trump was perfect for that. It was a pleasure NOT to have to walk through a crowded 100,000 square foot smoky casino to get to the hotel elevator. It was great to only wait a few minutes for the valet to get your car --- not 30 minutes like at the other high end casino-hotels. And it was so convenient to be able to walk across the street into the Fashion Show Mall. (Between 8am and 10pm, it is a quick, air conditioned shortcut to the Strip.) As for the resort fee, paying $20 PER DAY at the Trump was a better choice for us than buying needed amenities a la carte elsewhere. At the other hotels we considered, the charge was at least $25 PER PERSON PER DAY just for the fitness center. Then you had still to pay for Internet, etc. We used both at the Trump every day. FYI, Trump's Internet speed is awesome: over 20 Mbps download and upload speed! And not to be overlooked, dinner at the hotel's DJT restaurant might just have been the best one we had all week. Our kudos to the management team for a fine effort. And a special shout-out to Sergio and Ms. Kennedy in the Valet area for their 5 star service all week.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Rooms in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: FlyguyAustin
Reviews.Content: The Trump Hotel Las Vegas is a true 4 star hotel with doormen, nice lobby which is well staffed, and a friendly reception responsive to your needs. Standard rooms are large with sitting room, nice bed, and beautiful marble bathrooms with tub, and some of the nicest amenity sets I have seen (bath salts, good shampoo, toothbrushes). The hotel is entirely non-smoking, and there is no casino, so it is less chaotic than others. It ranks two telephones on the one-to four telephone scale. There are two flat panel TV’s, one behind the mirror in the bathroom (nice touch). Originally built as high-end codos, it was converted to a high end hotel after the real estate bust Each room has a small kitchen with blender, microwave, Wolfgang Puck coffee, and toaster. This is not a fantasy hotel, so do not pick this one if you are expecting pirate shows, topless Tuscan pools, and acrobats. The city side has no worthwhile view (closing one set of curtains can fix that). The hotel is one long block from the strip, down from the Wynn and across from Nordstrom’s in the urban shopping mall. The mall has a food court if you are suffering from sticker shock at most of the restaurants. There is no self-parking (valet only, but free), and the “free internet” comes as part of the “resort fee” which is assessed when you check in. There is a shuttle which runs one block to the strip (hardly seems worth it) and hourly, one that runs to the shops at Casers Palace. A cab ride from the airport is $15 (four can share), so that is really the best way to get there You will feel very grown up in these elegant rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A different kind of Vegas hotel... and that's not a bad thing!”
Reviews.Author: oopzydaze
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Trump Tower while celebrating my birthday in Vegas and it was just an absolutely perfect experience. We booked a Junior suite directly with the hotel and they even price matched the lower rate we found at a different website. We upgraded to a 1 Bedroom suite for an extra $50 when we got there. What I loved most about this place was the fact that the whole hotel was Non-smoking (due to no casino in the lobby). Honestly, breathing clean air in a Vegas hotel is a real luxury nowadays. All the staff were friendly, attentive and professional. And OMG, the room!! The 1 bedroom suite we got was HUGE!!. There was a living room (with a sofa bed), a kitchen, 2 bathrooms and a large king bed. The master bathroom could have easily been converted into another bedroom it was so big with a large bathtub, vanity and a TV embedded into the mirror! It was more than enough to accommodate 3 ladies getting ready at the same time for a night out. The bed and pillows were so comfortable and there was an Ipod dock on the nightstand. When we first got to the hotel, we immediately headed for the pool and settled ourselves in a lovely circle cabana where a hostess promptly took our drink orders. We couldn't have asked for anything better while we where there. Forget the Wynn, Venetian, Encore or Bellagio, stay at Trump International! You'll get the same luxury accommodation and service without the second-hand smoke and probably for a lower price!

Reviews.Title: “Think before you book”
Reviews.Author: GatineauBoubou
Reviews.Content: Just to say, I am not a complainer, however, what a disappointment after staying at the Wynn last year. The staff are not very friendly to begin with. You have a 20.00 U.S. fee per night to begin with, (not worth it, and a hold of 100.00 U.S. per night on you credit card). The washroom was definitely not clean, hair all over the floor, even after we complained and it was recleaned, dust everywhere, I really think that the occupancy rate must be very low. Close to the strip, however, the courtesy shuttle only goes to the corner of the Fashion Show Mall, and on the hour to the Ceasar Palace. If you are looking for te Las Vegas excitement, don't stay at the Trump. Overall, what a disappointment!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: wolfsong88
Reviews.Content: Where can I start with this hotel? Talk about extra fees. I booked with American Airlines so I could earn towards my air miles. I was quoted at $582 for 5 nights. It said this included taxes. When I got to Trump there was no self parking so we had no choice but to use the valet. When I got to the check in counter surprise it was an extra $450!!!! This was apparently for the valet parking fee, fitness center fee and just extra hotel fees. That's a lot of money - the fitness center was an extra $22 a day. You would think it would be included or you could be given a choice if you want to use the fitness center - I did not. The parking was $20 a day. My friend did a couple of room charges for a couple of cups of coffee and muffins a few mornings and the charge came to $114!!!! How much for coffee??? Then they took out for 2 rooms instead of one. It took a few days for the mistake to be corrected and me to get the money back on my card. It left me very concerned about my cash flow for those few days. When you get past all the money that you have to fork out it is a really nice hotel. The beds were very comfortable. The rooms were secure and a safety deposit box in the drawer. The kitchenette was very nice. It was very clean. I did take a bath in the jacuzzi tub. In fact I could have easily have stayed in just the bathroom the whole trip. The toilet is glass enclosed same with the spacious shower. There is a double sink and a tv screen is embedded in the mirror. It's a shame that this place had those extra fees to add because I really would have enjoyed myself more if I wasn't having to live on Walmart food to make up for the extra cost!

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: JesseLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: The price was actually good but the one bedroom suite fell short of feeling luxurious. There were no DVD/VCR's which the children look forward to. There was no writing desk, which is a big deal these days since most of us travel with our computers. It's too far to walk to a casino if you're hoping to do that. We also had several serious service problems but, since management apologized and gave us a decent refund, I won't complain about that, other than to say the mistakes were careless and very unprofessional. Having stayed in other Vegas hotels with similar suites that did not have the drawbacks the Trump suites do, I have to say I wouldn't stay here agaIn OR advise anyone else to. There are things to appreciate, like the huge elegant bathroom, the flat screen TV's and the well equipped kitchens, but The Donald should put in a casino next door. And chair/sofa arrangements in the lobby for weary travelers. And (definitely!) a place for pets to go since they are allowed here. -- By the way, we worried about the train, since others have complained about it keeping them awake, but we heard it only once and never from our room.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best kept secrets of the strip!”
Reviews.Author: utahpike2408
Reviews.Content: My wife had never been to Vegas and had been hinting to me for awhile to go. So for our anniversary I tried to find a hotel that would take care of us and would offer some R&R after long days out on the strip. I searched through many websites and decided on Trump based on its price, amenities and reputation. The Trump hotel definitely came through. The doormen, valets and bell hops pride themselves on opening up the doors and wishing you well on your day. And when you come back at night many even said "welcome home" while opening the front doors for you which was a nice touch. When we were checking in, we mentioned that it was our anniversary and my wife's first time to Vegas and they upgraded us to a strip view suite for free. It was a very nice touch and certainly helped make our trip memorable. The room was spacious, quiet and extra clean. The beds are most comfortable and certainly help you get the rest you need to take on Vegas day after day, night after night. The bathroom tub could hold four people if you wanted to - it's that big! The hotel includes wireless internet, access to the pool/work out facilities and bottled water as part of their resort fee. They even include shuttle service to and from the strip and Ceaser's Palace. The pool is small, but was perfect for spending the morning by reading and then a short dip to refresh. We also spent time at their spa and loved it tremendously. The only downside to the hotel is its location. It's a couple of minutes from the "strip" and on the opposite side of where we generally ended up each day (over by MGM). However, it was nice to come home each night, er morning, to a clean, smoke free, casino free hotel. We too heard the train go by a couple of the nights we were in the hotel, but it didn't seem to bother us in the slightest. I would definitely consider staying at this hotel again on the next trip back!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet luxury just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: lovz2ski
Reviews.Content: Had a conference at the Riviera, but the reviews of that were not so good. Decided to stay at the Trump, which was a good choice. I stayed in a studio suite for six nights. Pros: Clean rooms Very comfortable beds Far enough off the strip to get away from the noise $20/day resort fee includes valet parking and internet access Large whirlpool tub AND shower in studio room Decent hair dryer with concentrator attachment Conditioner AND shampoo (none of that conditioning shampoo junk) Courteous staff Free shuttle from the hotel to the Strip Free shuttle from the hotel to Caesar's Palace every hour Radio with ipod attachment Breakfast at the restaurant was tasty with good choices (greek yogurt, waffles, etc) if a bit pricey (~$10-14/entree). Nice chaise lounges by the pool Nice cardio equipment with ipod attachments Comfy robes Refrigerator, stove, sink, and microwave in room. Worked great for reheating leftovers from dinner. Free printing of boarding passes in the business center Cons: Had a problem with a sewer smell sometimes in the bathroom Sidewalk from the Strip not complete, so after the mall closes and the shuttle stops, have to walk back along the road unless you want to shell out for a cab Had a snag with the concierge when over the phone they said that they had reserved tickets to Mystere for us at Treasure Island, but when we got there, no such reservation existed. Thankfully there were seats left. The pool was kind of small and became quickly crowded Could hear the trains from my room, but they weren't frequent enough to really bother me or disrupt my sleep Overall, my experience here was great. The few cons were not huge and given the price, a great value. I would come back and stay at the Trump again.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten track but a great value”
Reviews.Author: Peripateticmensch
Reviews.Content: Staff and service were five star. Rooms are beautifully appointed. Pool are fun but could use some shade.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel”
Reviews.Author: leeabbey
Reviews.Content: Really great modern condo. I chose the Trump as I did not want a hotel with a casino as I like to get away from the constant noise. This hotel had only been built a couple of years and the rooms reflected this clean and new. Pool on the roof was also great. Its gold from the outside so cant be missed. The hotel is located at the edge of the strip but there is a Nordstrom that you can walk through to get to the main area and is air conditioned environment which beats walking in 100*. Only down side is a lot of people were using prostitutes and I think our neighbour was doing the same which felt a little seedy as heard a lot of noise throughout the night.. Will go back though as fantastic value..

Reviews.Title: “The Trump is the place to be in Las Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: Blackjack021
Reviews.Content: A group of friends and I stayed at Trump and we could not have been more pleased with our stay! Everything was fab... The hotel was beautiful and the rooms are definitely the best that Las Vegas has to offer for what we were willing to pay. ($109 per night). I could have easily paid twice that and still felt like I got a great deal! We were able to go out and do "the Vegas thing" and come back to this "oasis in the desert" via their free shuttle service. No smoke, no drunks and no one trying to hand us an escort for hire nudie trading card. Mr. Trump out-did himself with this great hotel not to mention the employees at Trump are very courteous and accommodating. If you want a great vacation in a great city....go to Vegas and stay at the best hotel in town!!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely done”
Reviews.Author: James_from_pdx
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio suite for 4 nights at the Trump hotel in Vegas. Everything was top of the line -the room, the lobby and fitness gym. The pool was small but not too crowded. The staff was really nice. There's nothing bad that we can say about our stay. We would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: hotstuff82
Reviews.Content: It took 1 hour to get our luggage after several phone calls to the bell desk. The valet person that greeted us upon arrival was rude and impatient. The tv in the bathroom did not work (not really important but still). The tv in the bedroom was fuzzy and then the cable went out (second day was working). The pillowcases were missing and had to call housekeeping several times. After an hour my husband flagged down a housekeeper in the hallway who was kind enough to replace them for us. The room smelled like cigarette smoke and it is a non-smoking hotel. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Anniversary Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: azteach3821
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended up at the Trump after a spin of the Priceline wheel. We could not have been more pleased. We stayed 2 nights in a standard room. They offered to upgrade us to a one br suite on check in, but we opted to stick with what we already had. I'm glad we did. The standard room ended up being quite large with a luxurious bath (whirlpool tub big enough for two), a sitting area with several pieces of furniture, the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on, a kitchen-type area with toaster,fridge, micro, coffemaker,etc., and a fabulous view. Another plus for us is that the entire property is non-smoking. If you've been to Vegas you know that hotels with casinos come with an accompanying smell of cigarette smoke. The Trump has no casino. For some, this might be a deal breaker, but there are plenty of places to gamble quite near by. One thing to keep in mind is that they don't have self-parking, it's valet only. You will pay a $20/day resort fee that includes many things including in and out valet. As we had just paid almost $50/day to park at our hotel in San Fran I didn't find this out of line. All in all, a wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Helpful Review yet, Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: DreaX
Reviews.Content: I booked the Trump Hotel after seeing a special on travelzoo.com for $93/night. This was my very first time in Vegas and the hotel was amazing! I called in to the hotel and asked if it was possible to check in earlier than the scheduled 3pm check in. They said it was fine and I was checked in at 1pm and it only took 2minutes. The room was absolutely beautiful modern and clean. The first thing you notice upon walking in, is the nice clean smell of coconut and jasmine. The hotel smells amazing compared to the smoked filled casino hotels. I stayed on the 31st floor and all the rooms at the hotel are up to date and modern and luxurious. The room had all needed utilities, a blow dryer, iron, coffee and coffee maker and a very good working cold mini fridge. The bed is very comfortable its neither soft or hard. The mattress is medium firm with a pillow top. The sofa can also be converted into a sofa bed making more room for more guests. If your going to Vegas to shop, this is a great hotel. The fashion show mall is right across the street a few steps away from Nordstorms, Neiman Marcus etc. The staff was so incredibly nice and always in a good mood and very helpful. The shuttle is said to run every 30mins to Ceasars Palace, however whenever I came down the shuttle was ready and available to ride. This hotel is also a great choice to people with pets, I saw about 5 dogs walking through the lobby arriving and leaving. Overall, this a GREAT pick. Do not think its far from the strip. Not AT ALL! it takes a 5min to walk to the Wynn and on to the strip. This hotel is beautiful and a very good choice. Happy traveling.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,”
Reviews.Author: SmithsLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: The Trump hotel is superb. Our 'basic' suite (2027) was huge, with floor to ceiling windows and a view of the pool, the city and a litle bit of the strip. . We were offered an upgrade for 50dollars per night extra, but are pleased we didn't upgrade because it really isnt necessary. All of the fittings in the room are top quality, and the tv in the bathroom is a great gimmick, all in all, excelent value, excellent hotel . I love the option of being able to self cater for breakfast etc.The our room had a kitchenette, with 2 halogen hobs, juicer,toaster, kettle,fridge, pots and pans plates and cutlery. The quality of the linens, and bathrobes are top notch, and I wish I had remembered to purchase a bathrobe to bring home with me, but alas I forgot. The hotel has no casino,so it it lovely and quiet compared to the razzamatazz of the casino/hotels. We used the complimentary transport a couple of times, but to be honest, the walk is not to far, and we quite enjoyed the people watching as we meandered along. The pool is on the 7th floor, althought you really can't tell, as it is surrounded by palm trees!! It is not especially deep, but it is very big, and never crowded , its lovely if you want to cool off and just enjoy the sunshine. We had a Trump club sandwich by the pool(very tasty). Oh and one last tip, if your tipple is beer, then ask about the 'icebuckets' of bottles, as they are cheaper than buying individuals. we only found out the last day of our stay, and wish some one had told us sooner.

Reviews.Title: “Magnific hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tatiasantos
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! Perfect! Beautiful room and HUGE bathroom! Our room was located on the 45th floor, so we got an amazing view of Vegas. The hotel is located right across the street from the Fashion Mall, where you can get cheaper tickets to the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Really like this hotel - great staff, no smoking, cool design”
Reviews.Author: LB8001
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveler to Vegas, so being able to avoid huge, loud, smoky casinos is a big plus for me. this was my first stay at the Trump, but it won't be the last. Extremely cool design - lobby is lovely and the room I was in was great - big, well-done bathroom, a/c that really works, comfy bed, plenty of room to spread out and eat, work, watch tv, etc. The bell staff was worth a special mention - they were all extra-pleasant, hard-working (running around for cars when it's 104 is noooo fun) and service-oriented. The location was, for me, another plus - not right on the strip but very close to my customer's office and, for shoppers, literally right across the street from the Fashion Show mall. I didn't use the spa but will probably try it eventually. Just a nicely-done hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find, Would Stay Here Again.”
Reviews.Author: maryellenpa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, and more importantly the rooms were GREAT! No gaming in the facility & there was only one choice for dining, but this did not make a difference to us. For business travel, this hotel can not be beat. Only a few minutes (a very short walk) off of the strip, so you are still close to great restaurants, shopping, etc.. The best part was the rooms. Very spacious. The entire property was extremelly clean & the bed was super comfortable. Sitting area & an unbeleivable bathroom. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Defined”
Reviews.Author: Ziplocked
Reviews.Content: We really were fortunate to get this hotel through Priceline bidding, and at 80.00 per night, it was an absolute steal! But it wasn't really 80.00, since upon check in, we were billed an additonal 20.00 for the 'free' services, whcih included a newspaper, internet and bottled water in the room. Still, for 100.00 night, we enjoyed everything that Trump is famous for, including the in mirror TV in the bathroom, the giant TV in the bedroom, microwave, sink and fridge if you somehow want to cook on vacation. The room had great AC, super quiet, a bed that said sleep and delivered! Hotel staff were very friendly and security after 10:00 pm was noticeable, as we were always asked to present our room card before getting access to the elevators. Very nice pool, exercise room and business center as well. Across the street is the Fashion Mall where you can go bankrupt in a hurry! Macy's, Bloomingdales, Neiman Marcus, Boss, you name it, its all there. This hotel does not have a casino and is quite far from the main action on the strip, so its about 7.00 by cab to get to the Ballagio. No complaints from the kids either, that's really the mark of a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best place for the money!!!”
Reviews.Author: longbui82
Reviews.Content: First off, I rarely write any reviews but was so impressed I wanted to share. The moment I pulled up to the valet, it was class A service throughout my stay. EVERYONE who worked there greeted us "good morning, evening, afternoon, etc" The rooms are great for only 99 a night on weekends, you cant beat it. small kitchenette, large jet tub, separate shower and toilet, tv in bedroom and bath. I just love the service, we need some extra plates and glass and received it quickly. The wake up call was on the min. The room service was great. The housekeeping made us felt we just checked in every single time. The only thing was the walk to get on the strip, but was not a big deal since you get the enjoy the mall. Even when we stayed out late and the mall was closed, we had to walk around, there was a trump shuttle waiting to take us back to the hotel for those who stayed out late. We stayed at many hotels, and this was by far the BEST service ever. The room and location for the money you can not beat.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely more Pro's than Con's to being just off the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Hyuntae88
Reviews.Content: The Trump stood out from the other LV hotels 1) because there's no attached casino and, therefore, no cigarette smoke to address, which was important for us since my wife is pregnant. Additionally, 2) it's relatively quiet, providing a nice oasis from the chaos of the strip. Don't get me wrong: part of the reason people go to Vegas is for the madness, right? But staying at the Trump allowed for both lively fun among the masses AND relative tranquility by the pool with only maybe 50 people with you. While it's just a short walk to the strip, it's a bit far from a lot of the main hotels tourists frequent, and the shuttle to Caesar's Palace's Forum shops did not run on the hour as stated (more haphazard than that). Taxi's to the center of the strip were $8-14 depending on traffic. The service was exceptional and always friendly, and the breakfast buffet, while a bit pricey at $54 for two, was of supreme quality. We have no regrets staying there, and you won't either.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful surprise and great value”
Reviews.Author: quicktraveler2010
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a six night stay at Trump...and I was pleasantly surprised. The whole ambience of the hotel is very regal and luxe. It looks and feels a little over the top upon first look, but improves on closer inspection. It was my first time in Vegas, and I am so glad I chose the Trump International. Even though it is not on the Strip, it is only a quick walk to the Wynn on a road that was relatively busy with cars and a sidewalk for pedestrians. We even took the more 'scenic' route through the Fashion Show Mall a few times, which was directly across the road from the hotel. My friend and I walked the distance quite frequently, even in the 110 degree heat and were never concerned for our safety. It really is a quick walk, and there is a free shuttle that takes you to Caesar's Palace which is considered the middle of the Strip. Although the shuttle does not run past 10pm, and given this is Vegas we found that we couldn't make much use of the free shuttle given we were staying out a little later than that. The staff seemed nice and helpful, although housekeeping was a little lax. Our room went unserviced for a day, and it was looking very likely we were going to go without housekeeping for a second day when we returned from the pool late in the afternoon to find the room still as it was. Luckily our housekeeper was in the next room, so we were able to catch her. When we told her that we would be leaving for a show in the next 30 minutes and perhaps she would prefer to come back then so we would not be in her way, she advised that her shift was ending at 5pm and could not come back. Whilst the bathroom was always immaculate after housekeeping, the bedroom was not. The side tables were quite dusty and one day we came back to find the ice bucket had not been emptied and was still full of water. On our last day, even though we had the 'do not disturb' light on, the housekeeper entered our room which we thought was a little inappropriate. The room was an excellent size, great comfy bed and a nice lounge area. Perhaps some more lighting would help as it was quite dark, and also some bedside light switches. We were on the 50th floor and heard the train every day...how could you not? The heavy doors of the rooms were also very loud, they slammed shut. You can also hear the helicopters quite frequently so perhaps noise levels could be controlled somehow? The view was not great, overlooking empty lots and the train tracks, although you could see out to Circus Circus and the dead part of the Strip. The kitchen and fridge were very useful, although we did not have enough cutlery or crockery. Given there were two people staying in the room, you would expect at least two of everything. We only had one spoon, one bowl, and on our last day for some reason ended up with one dinner plate. The complimentary internet was super fast - the fastest I have ever used, and was easy to connect to. Although there was no pen or writing paper in the room, which we found out when needing to write down some confirmation numbers. Room service was delicious, with generous portions and the best french fries I have ever tasted. Even though most hotels charge high prices for room service I don't think I have ever come across a delivery charge for room service. Isn't that why you pay an extra few dollars per item...given it is room service? So it was a little baffling to be billed $3 for delivery on top of the already ridiculous high price of room service, and then add tax and the compulsory 18% gratuity. Wow! We were also keen on using the spa, but keeled over in horror when we saw the price list. I was in dire need of a manicure, pedicure and massage, and a blow out would have been considered too. Upon seeing the prices, $60 for a manicure only?? Such robbery! You can get a mani/pedi combo for around $25-50 all around the US, not $60 for just one! The bathroom was amazing, nice and big with the best shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and soap. Oh and yeah, there is a TV built in the mirror which made us chuckle when we discovered it although we never used it...'only in Vegas'. We spent a lot of time by the pool which was decent although not deep enough for a proper swim and most guests tended to use it to lounge about in the water. We found the pool quite dirty on one of the days, which you would not expect from a 5-star hotel. The children were plentiful and perhaps a separate pool should be considered. The music was excellent, not too loud but just right to set you in the mood for the evening ahead. Some of the patrons were a little over the top and embarrassing to watch, but I suppose this is what Vegas is all about. A shout out to the 'cougars' who ridiculously pounced on every male over the age of 21 in the pool, you entertained us well. Overall, our experience was good although upon checking out we were a little annoyed when the porter helped us into the taxi by putting our two suitcases in the trunk and then walked off and left the trunk open - we wondered whether it was because we didn't tip? We had two medium sized suitcases that we could have easily wheeled over to the cab which was two to three steps away. We had also brought our suitcases down from the room and walked all through the lobby with them - and no one asked if we needed assistance or a cab. It was a shame, as that was the lasting impression we had of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ONLY place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jasehoek
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Trump from June 3rd through to June 6th. We were in town to celebrate our 30th birthdays and from start to finish, we had a wonderful experience. As mentioned in other reviews, you are treated like gold from the second you arrive to the second you leave. Check in was a breeze and we were upgraded from a studio suite to a one bedroom suite, with a great view of the Wynn and Encore. The orginial price of the upgrade was $50 a night, however, acting on adivice from Tripadvisor, we easily haggled the price down by half. The upgrade was well worth the extra money. The one bedroom suite was huge with a great kitchen and living room, a sperate bedroom and two bathrooms - one of which is beyond huge! This made getting ready for a night out on the town easy and the huge fridge was great for storing water and other drinks. We did have an issue on our first day with housekeeping. We left the room early, turned on the housekeeping light and headed out for shopping. When we returned to the room just after lunch there had been no cleaning done. We left again assuming they had just not gotten to us yet. When we returned again at about 7:00 to get ready of a night out, we still had not recieved any service. A quick call to the front desk and within minutes a housekeeping supervior arrived at the room. He personally made the bed and took note of everything that needed to be done. By the time we returned for the night, the room was spotless. Although the room should have been cleaned earlier and without us calling, it was nice that the problem was fixed quickley and efficently. All in all I would not hestitate to stay at Trump again. In fact, I am already planning a return trip! Yes there is a resort fee (this is no secret and they tell you about it at check in) - but there is at most Strip hotels. One look at the pool and all the other amenities and services offered and it is easily justifiable. The Strip is, at the most, a three minute walk. (The street is well lit and thier are sidewalks the entire way. I am not sure which route other reviewers were taking ??) We never once saw the need to take the shuttle and cabs were always waiting so there was never a wait. Plus, it is Vegas. If you are not prepared to walk, you have no business being there! Trump was great - in my opinion, the best place to stay in Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: tsprink
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Trump while attending my brother's wedding. The customer service was superb! The rooms are spacious, clean, and provided everything we needed for a long weekend - fridge, microwave, range, wet bar... the list goes on. The bathroom is fabulous with the jacuzzi tub. We felt like VIPs all four days! We also appreciated the fact that we were not staying in a casino hotel. When we returned "home" it was sooo peaceful. And I cannot leave out the EXCELLENT shops at the Fashion Show Mall directly across the street. Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, every member of the Staff does a wonderful job.”
Reviews.Author: caribdreamerNh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel from the moment we drove up to the entrance. The first people we encountered, of course, were the valets and bellmen. All of them were attentive and personable and immediately made us feel welcome. The front desk staff were helpful and great as well. This whole hotel is very beautiful and impeccably clean. The lobby always smelled nice, thanks to no casino or smoking indoors. The rooms are very modern, spacious, tastefully decorated, and the bathroom is gorgeous. Well done kitchenette, what a great feature. We thought the bed was one of the most comfortable we had ever slept in, and the linens are exceptional. These are the things that we look for in an upper star hotel. I really can't believe the bad reviews from May/June. It looks to me like they are obviously angry at the $19 resort fee and things just went downhill for them from there. (Making the busy staff search for imaginary, high ticket personal items that you "left behind in another room" , is just deviously nasty behavior.) I really wish that we had some time to use the pool and spa while we were there, they looked wonderful. We ate breakfast twice at the lobby restaurant, DJT, and it was very good. Understand ahead of time that: This hotel has an extra $19 a day resort fee, there is no self-parking, valet only, this hotel is not right on the strip, but free shuttles are available to get you there. We loved our experience there and definitely will stay at Trump again.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable non-gambling hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcp772000
Reviews.Content: Just amazing attention to detail and finishing touches. Very friendly staff. It is a 3 minutes walk to the strip, a quite intresting part of it (Venetian, Wynn, Fashion mall).

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: steleadav
Reviews.Content: We were in town for business, came a few days early to relax and stayed at Trump. It was the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in. It was peacefull, off the strip and no gambling made it perfect for relaxation. We were first timers in this property so were given a complimentary upgrade with a little sweet talk. Our only complaint was they charged us a $12 handling fee for an incoming FedEx, not nice considering we payed $82 to have the box shipped there and all they did was hold it a few hours prior to our arrival and we picked it up at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: mt321
Reviews.Content: This is without question the best hotel I have ever stayed in ... and I've stayed in 100's. Trump scores big in all the right places: Service, style, comfort, class ... this place has it all in spades. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, spacious and relax”
Reviews.Author: wennitiong
Reviews.Content: Awesome window view over Las Vegas Strip, room is big and clean, with attached electric mirror tv inside bathroom and the jacuzzi bath tub. High speed internet access and nice room decoration.

Reviews.Title: “Service is the star at the Trump”
Reviews.Author: lokiguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a trip scheduled up to St. George, UT for a conference (what a trip THAT was!) and decided to book a couple of nights at the Trump before and after. We read some great reviews, and got a good price online. From the moment we arrived, we felt at home. I travel extensively for work, and the amenities, feeling of security, and above all, the service available at all hours at this hotel are among the best I have ever experienced. Of course, its a bonus that there is no casino (my wife an I walked into the Wynn to check one out, and straight back out again). The first night there, we were pretty exhausted from travelling all day, so opted to take in the food at DJT. The meal was absolutely stunning - and service from John was fantastic. Then we sat in the bar (not really being "Vegas" types) and enjoyed some great cocktails. The room was great - facing Treasure Island. Great bed, sink and fridge, and the bathroom was truly stunning! Over the course of three nights, we got to know several of the service staff in the lounge and dining room. Kudo's to Tara, Alex, Olivia, Heather and the rest of the staff! We truly enjoyed ourselves. Even though we may not do "the strip", the proximity of the Trump to the Fashion Show mall was great. My wife and I did several runs back to the hotel to dump off bags. The feeling of security at the hotel is also worth mentioning - there is always a friendly nod from discrete security staff manning the access to the elevators upon coming back. The addition of a small "resort fee" looked after the internet access and parking - so we had no additional costs. The pool area was a bit loud, but what the heck - you're in Vegas, right? If ever we're back in Vegas we'll definitely be staying at the Trump!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: RubyTokyo
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we ever stayed. They charge you for every step you make in this hotel. Shuttle service surcharges $15/day/person(It only goes to Ceasar's Palace, not all the stops) .Valet parking only(no free- self parking)- $20/day. Porters bring up your luggages to your room, but he will talk to you with his hand in the pocket. - Please do not stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dump International Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Renee_GRRRR
Reviews.Content: First off, I have NEVER in my life written a hotel review that was this unfavorable. I understand that in the restaurant and hotel industry things happen, having said this what my guest and I experienced at the The Trump Hotel, I feel, needs to be relayed as to not further disappoint future guests expecting not only a five star hotel but five star service. Upon check in we were moved to an extremely noisy room right above an outdoor pool that was playing very, very loud music and crowded by an equally as loud crowd.
