I am 30 years old, not 60, and I felt as though I was at a frat party. We asked to move which they accommodated. The moved us to another room that was just as noisy. We called the front desk and were told that someone would be right up with not only our bagged but keys to another room that was promised to be much quieter. 45 minutes later, no bags, no keys, we are starving and decide to just go our selves to the new room and wait up there. When we get off the elevator and turned the corner a very upset bellboy shouted, "Well, there you guys are! I have been waiting here for over half an hour!". Well, please excuse us. Anyway, we get settled into our new room which is quite nice. We at this point are starting to regret not having gotten lunch prior to arrival and promptly decided on room service. No menu was to be found. We call the front desk and another 45 minutes later a menu arrives. We decide to go out. I realize I have left a $1000 pair of Chanel shoes in one of the previous rooms. We call the front desk and receive a very poor response. Somewhat like it was my fault I had left the shoes in the first place. To make a long story short with still getting the point across, we called about the shoes at around 4pm and did not have the shoes returned to us until after 10pm. This is after countless phone calls to the management, Orbitz, American Express, the hotel security and housekeeping. Finally a manager named Glenn went to one of the previous rooms and simply knocked on the door and asked the new guests if the shoes were in the room. They were and they were returned to me. Now, why and how housekeeping could have overlooked a pair of shoes sitting right on the first surface once you walk through the front door is beyond me but even more so, how the staff as a whole continuously promised both rooms had been thoroughly checked and there were no shoes was insulting. I felt as though I was being called a liar for about 6 hours. The amount of attitude we experienced was totally out of line. The whole experience was upsetting so we cut our trip short and checked out a night early. When we go to get our car from valet the car pulls up sans our luggage. Nearly half an hour later and frustration having become the default emotion being on the Trump property our bags were finally put in the car and we left. The Trump Hotel was one of the worst experiences I have ever had at a hotel. The crowd was definitely not a 5 star crowd. The staff was rude, belittling and and lacked any true care and/or concern for the discomfort we were going though in regards to the missing shoes. The food was poor, it was loud, crowded and all around not a luxury vibe whatsoever. We will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Trump”
Reviews.Author: rnelizabeth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trump before our wedding and absolutely loved it. We had a group of about 30 family and friends who also stayed with us and they all loved it as well. We loved that we got to have a nice calm, casino-free and smoke free hotel but still had the option of the hustle and bustle of "the strip" just a short walk away. The service was excellent and the rooms were just awesome. There is no other way to describe it. We had a corner one bedroom suite and the whole place was big but the master bathroom was HUGE and the best part was there was a view of straight down the strip from the jacuzzi tub. A lot of people complain about the Trump not technically being "on strip" and it being such a long walk to the trip. However, we found the walk to be very short and the Trump also offers 2 shuttles. One straight down the end of the street to the strip that runs every 15 mins and one that went to the Forum Shops at Caesars every hour I believe. So, with all these options I really don't see what all the fuss is about. Also, people complain about the unfinished construction sites outside the Trump's windows and how it makes for an ugly view. I personally found this to be a perk and barely paid attention to those unfinished sites because I was too busy checking out all the other sites that I could actually see because there weren't a ton of other buildings around. We had our wedding reception at the Trump and everything went off without a hitch and everyone there definitely went out of their way to make everything perfect. I couldn't have asked for better. We will definitely be staying at the Trump again when we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL experience”
Reviews.Author: vmapdx
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, and we booked here because it is not your typical Vegas hotel. I would, however, NEVER stay here again. Housekeeping was ridiculously inept. We checked in at 1pm, called for extra hangers, and left our room. We came back 4 hours later, at 5pm, no hangers. No big deal, we thought. The next day we left our room at 11am and returned at 3pm. Housekeeping never showed up, even though we left the call light on. We got ready and left at 6pm. We then called housekeeping and asked for our room to be made up. Needless to say, we returned at 1 am, and no housekeeping. The following day we left at 9am and returned at 5pm (at a convention all day). What do you know?? No housekeeping. So, basically, it took them over 2 days to make up our room from the time we checked in. I have stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels and never received this poor of service. If I were Donald Trump I would be mortified to have my name and my brand attached to such sub par service. We will never, ever return. Next year it's the Mandarin!

Reviews.Title: “Donald did a great job!”
Reviews.Author: pamr48
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful! It was our first trip to Las Vegas and we were very impressed with this place - from the second we pulled up to the door people were tripping over each other to open doors, help with luggage and get us checked in quickly. We were offered an upgrade to a corner suite - for $50 extra per night - no thanks! The next time I would definitely get a room with a better view - our room overlooked unfinished construction and railroad tracks. It didn't really matter tho because we weren't in our room much. One wall of the room was entirely built in with shelves, closets, kitchenette - the sink even had a garbage disposal and there was a 2-burner stove and microwave. It had a small refrigerator with no freezer, 2 plates, 2 forks, 2 knoves, 1 spoon, a couple of bowls and glasses and a coffee maker. It was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in! The bathroom was big and beautiful with a TV built into the mirror - nice touch Donald! The only tiny complaints I have are that there was no shower gel - bars of soap only, and only 2 hangers in each closet!! Really?? People get dressed up in Vegas and we need lots more hangers - Ivanka knows better - she must not have been consulted on that one! Really nice pool. The location was great - a few steps from the strip and across the street from a huge and wonderful mall. We ate at the bar the night we arrived - good drinks and delicious bar-type food. Had breakfast one day - just OK. Overall, it was a great hotel and I would highly recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value; Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: IrishFlair
Reviews.Content: The husband booked Trump through a online web site (Hotwire?) for a few nights for a very reasonable price. Reviews here made me think we'd enjoy the stay and that was the case from start to finish. The Towers are near but not on The Strip; however they are only a short 5 minute walk from the Strip and one that is not a huge deal to make. The nearby area is still undergoing some construction but I suspect that it will one day be in the thick of things. We walked during the day and returned in the late evening (11ish) on at least one night without any problems and feeling secure. The staff at Trump is top notch no matter what time of the day and we really appreciated the quiet sophistication of the Towers themselves. I personally enjoyed being able to live in a smoke-free environment from start to finish, something that is impossible when a casino is included in the mix. We had an option of upgrading our room for a small amount per day when we arrived though we declined it. Our studio bedroom faced away from the Strip looking down on the less savory Industrial Road which is exactly as you would imagine a road bearing such a name to look like. Even being on the 30-something floor we could clearly hear the trains that would go past but other than thinking "Is that a train?" we took little notice of them and would hardly call the two or maybe three we heard in three days much of a nuisance. Overall it was a great stay and one that we would repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Fantastic Time at TRUMP!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaDad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned last night from a 4 night stay at Trump Vegas. This was our first trip to Vegas so I really wanted it to be special. We have been to Jamaica, Mexico, St. Lucia, and many locations in the states but never Vegas so we were excited to finally go to Vegas. We had a great stay at the Trump. The room was clean, secure and spacious. The view was good and the room maintained a comfortable temperature at all times. The in the mirror television in the bathroom was a nice touch and the tub was huge. The location was not a problem. We were there to explore and see as much of the town as possible, therefore the location was fine. The fact that we had to leave the hotel to gamble and dine, forced us to see more of what Vegas has to offer. Mr. Trump was staying at his property while we were there, which added to the excitement of being in Vegas and staying at the Trump Tower. I would certainly go back! Great Stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware”
Reviews.Author: NigelMA
Reviews.Content: I booked through hotels.com and verified my reservation was refundable before making the reservation (I even called customer service to check). After booking I needed to change the date on the reservation. When I rebooked it online I didn't realize I had accidentally clicked on a room that was exactly the same as previously reserved except it was apparently non-refundable. Unfortunately I had to cancel the trip due to family illness. I cancelled through hotels.com using the cancellation link in the confirmation email. I was well inside the cancellation window (had I actually booked the correct room) but never received a refund. I called hotels.com customer service – they informed me I had a non-refundable room but they agreed to call the hotel. The hotel did offer a refund for me of two of the three nights but the hotel refused to credit the full payment even though it was cancelled more than three weeks before the stay. While I’m grateful for the two night credit, for a supposedly 5 star hotel I'm dismayed at their lack of understanding. 5 star hotels such as this need to think carefully about the impression they leave on customers when they exhibit such a lack of service. It turns out this was an extremely expensive accidental click. Even though this was clearly my error, I could never recommend staying at this hotel simply because they have demonstrated a lack of five star customer service. I’m also disappointed that Hotels.com lacks a warning that has to be confirmed before a non-refundable reservation can be made - this would avoid such easy mistakes happening. So if you are planning a stay here – buyer beware..

Reviews.Title: “Room better than the Venetian!!!...No joke!”
Reviews.Author: jscottk19
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 5 nights here at the Trump before moving over to the Venetian. We got the room for $100 a night from priceline. When we got there we were offered to upgrade to a Strip view for 25 bucks more or a one bedroom strip view for 50 more. After a little bargaining we got the one bedroom strip view for 30 a night...it was out 5th anaversary and we recently found out we are going to be parents...Well, the room was BEAUTIFUL, nicer and more spacious then the room we had at the Venetian for a little over half the price. The hotel was very clean, the room was huge, and the peopel very helpful. The resort fee is no $20 but I expected that. The resort fee included free wifi and free valet parking. Only draw back to the valet parking was having to wait but never more than 10 minutes. Yes, as previous reviews show the hotel is a short walk, 3 minutes, from the strip. Just cut through the mall to have a nive leisure walk. However the mall does close at 9pm. All in all a great stay and for the price you can not beat it! Great job to the Trump people for making it a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cape8101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trump for eight nights. I picked this hotel for the second week of our trip to get away from the casinos. It worked out very well to be able to get through a lobby without all the confusion. We had a corner upgraded room since we were staying there for such a long time. The room was fantastic with a full living room and a bedroom and a very large bathroom. However, we got the last large corner room since the hotel was filling up quickly due to a boxing match coming to town. The room that we got was on the infamous train side. I must say, "yes" you can hear the train and it runs very early in the morning during the week, starting around 4:30 AM. If you happen to wake up you willl hear it as it blows its horn three times as it gets close to the crossing. Since our room was so nice we didn't want to take a chance of losing it so we learned to ignore the horn since it was only a momentary inconvienence. Everything else went very well, the walk to the strip only took a few minutes and if you didn't want to walk then the shuttle was there for a quick ride. We ordered room service one night and the club sandwich was very big and we had extra for the next day. In our room we had one king bed which had seen better days. The bed was lumpy and they tried to cover up this fact with mattress pads which made the bed extra warm. Overall, I would certainly stay at the Trump again. It's nice to pull up at the front door and walk a short distance to the elevators up to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Who needs a casino when you can have the TRUMP instead!!”
Reviews.Author: mclark
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to Las Vegas several times a year for more than 30 years. I have stayed at many of the five star casino hotels including the new ones. So booking for the first time a "casino-less" 5 star hotel was going to be a first. But let me tell you, it won't be my last. The Trump Las Vegas was like being in an ocean side relaxing beach resort, but without the sand. After a people filled day at the convention center, it was pure Zen to return to a hotel and not have to walk right into the hustle and bustle of a casino. While there were other customers, everyone was relaxed and smiling. Plus the genuine friendly greetings starting with the doorman to the bellman to the front desk to the bar, made coming back in from a long day bright again. These folks have been well trained to truly understand the value of me - the customer. All of this so far without even mentioning the rooms! From the secure moment you walk in, you feel like home. Our view of the strip was even better to gaze at then turning on any of the three state of the art televisions we had. I was so happy when at our favorite restaurant on the strip I had left overs and could actually take them home and have for lunch the next day since we had a place to refrigerate and warm up. Not just any place, but a SUB ZERO refrigerator and a VIKING stove!! Being a shoe junkie I was delighted to see closet and drawer space that rivaled my own home. Really too many wonderful amenities to mention them all, but this review would not be complete without mentioning the FABULOUS bed. While the heavenly beds are supposed to be for the angels, I think this TRUMP bed was reserved for the big guy in heaven himself. Yes, I will return to Las Vegas and stay at the Trump. If I want to gamble they will cheerfully take you up the road and you can be entertained for a couple hours at a casino. But when you return after probably losing some money, you can walk back into the lap of luxury of your Trump room and feel like a Winner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience Here”
Reviews.Author: americanjim
Reviews.Content: 4-nite stay, May 08-12. Perfect setup for someone like me because this is a condo hotel, not a Vegas "casino resort". If you are looking for wannabe Guidos & pseudo Thuggers fist-bumping at the pool to impress the Hoochie-Mammas then stay somewhere else. The Trump is refined & sophisticated. You have all the Strip action available to you when you want to participate - but you are one step removed and don't have to deal with it unless you choose to. A couple of things not in other reviews: 1) There is a "bistro" food option at the hotel if you don't want the DJT fine dining option. It's called H2EAU and it's on the 7th floor next to the gym by the entrance to the pool. You can get casual food here all day long. 2) Housekeeping was thorough and effecient. I question other reviewers complaints - my room was made up daily while I was out and never a problem. 3) Ask for a high floor on the south side of the building. I was on the 54th floor looking right down the Strip. Awesome. Worth the $25 per night upgrade on my $99 Hotwire rate. 4) NEVER once did I hear the train - what are other reviewers talking about??? 5) My internet was included in the $19.95 "resort fee", not a seperate charge on top of the resort fee. 6) There is a store in the Fashion Show Mall across the street called ABC. You can get everything you need to stock your fridge here - pop, juice, cereal, snacks. 7) The walk thru the Fashion Show Mall to the Strip is easy and entertaining and takes 5 minutes tops. When the Mall is closed, don't walk, take a cab or the Trump shuttle which is convenient and reliable. I used the Trump as a base. I had activities planned (heli tour to Grand Canyon, the BC Zipline, golf, etc) during my days. Then I partied and gambled on the Strip at night. Trump was great to come home to and not have all the casino honky tonk and cig smoke right in your face when you were done with that scene and wanted to get real again. I would stay here again unless I was with a group who wanted to party all day and night - thats not what Trump is about.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and lovely hotel slightly disappointed by overall experience”
Reviews.Author: Jubbsi
Reviews.Content: We had a suite for 3 days at the end of a 2 week trip to the US. The room and hotel were certainly all we hoped for. The room was first class with a great view of the strip, complete with hot tub, kitchen area and flat screen TV in bathroom. In terms of the room I think you would struggle to find much better. On her last trip to Vegas my girlfriend had stayed in the Wynn and thought that the room in the Trump far superior. We ate in the restaurant on one occasion and took advantage of the $39 deal which was good value and the food of a superb quality. However, for an overall Vegas experience the Trump was a bit of a let down. The pool area is more like somewhere you would go for a swimming lesson rather than a 5* hotel in Vegas. Also when in Vegas after a late night I like to relax by the pool during the day. This was possible on the first couple of days however on the Friday and Saturday there was a dj playing overly loud music from about 11 am each day. So loud it also made listening to my ipod impossible, we tried to move to get away from it and complained but had no luck. The appeal of staying off the strip is that you have the choice when you want to relax and when you want to be amongst the hustle and bustle. During the end of the afternoon as people are starting to get ready for a night out I could understand loud music but not so early in the day. I am only 27 and going to the bars in the evening that would be playing this music and didnt appreciate it so not sure how some of the older guests appreciated it! At $14 a cocktail and seemingly no offers available its quite expensive to drink at the pool as well. The location was more inconvenient then I would have hoped for as there is nothing really about. There isnt much option for food at the hotel and its not convenient to go to the strip for food during the day as its quite a long round trip. In the end we walked a fair way to some shops towards Circus Circus and stocked up on essentials so we could make our own breakfast and lunch and then for more variety went to the Wynn in the evening for dinner. Overall, the hotel is very nice and anywhere else in the world I would give it 5 out of 5 but for a trip to place like Vegas lets itself down a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Lo Mejor”
Reviews.Author: mikemo
Reviews.Content: I doubt if we shall ever get back to Las Vegas, but I would think this the best for we seniors who are still quite active. We live at 6700 ft and walk lots. On 1 May, we stayed in 5205; on 6 and 7 May, we stayed in 3112. The higher floor was way better. Only a New Yorker would find a concierge rude! Perhaps only a concierge would find a New Yorker RUDE? Funny anecdote: we arrived at about 7:00 PM on Sat 1 May; had dinner at Maggiano's; went to bed early having arr from MEX, and at 22:10, we were awakening by security who threatened to crash down the door - for an unpaid bill! Having just arrived with a prepaid reservation, I thought they were bogus. Called security and told them I was a former USN SEAL LCDR and armed. They went way and called immediately to apologize - wrong room!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: vegasgirl_10
Reviews.Content: We booked on priceline and got the Trump, didn't really know what to expect but was so suprised! Beautiful hotel, the lobby smells amazing, smoke free which is a nice change from vegas hotels. Our room was on the 58th floor, great view for $90 a night! The pina colada's at the pool are awesome as well! The shuttle was very handy to ceasars, and even took it down the block a couple of times to the mall. The bathroom with jacuzzi tub was my fav. part of the room! Would go back in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful until unbelievably rude concierge”
Reviews.Author: dbfromny
Reviews.Content: I'm staying at the Trump Las Vegas right now and had a good experience all day until rude concierge almost ruined my mood. We thought it'd be fun to try a buffet since we are in Vegas so my husband asked her which one she recommends. She literally rolled her eyes at us and said "I'm not really in the business to recommend buffets." Lady, I'm not usually in the business of eating buffets either, I just had dinner at Jean Georges in new york last week for no special reason other than I felt like a good meal that night so yes I am a food snob but I thought buffet is what one should try in Vegas. I thought the staff here so far was very gracious until this encounter with someone who obviously doesn't understand her job description. Even if she didn't want to come right out to name a buffet there was much more gracious way to answer our question.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service & a Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: susieg19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this property online knowing nothing about it. It was absolutely wonderful. The room was gorgeous and very clean. It looked exactly like the pictures online. The service was wonderful. I don't think we encountered a single person who was not pleasent, helpful and friendly. There is no casino in this hotel which we quite enjoyed as it allowed us to escape the constant activity on the Strip while still being close enough to join the action whenever we felt like it. My only advice is if you don't like long walks, book a rental car or ask for a cab which the hotel is more than happy to arrange for you. They do provide a shuttle service available that goes to the Forum Shoppes.It runs hourly but that did not seem often enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Kabear
Reviews.Content: We were there from Wednesday, April 28 to Sunday, May 2. We were on the 45th floor, south view of strip, one bedroom suite for a steal. It was one of the nicest places we have ever stayed at. Two full bathrooms, one of which was a huge master bathroom, a plasma HD TV in bedroom and one in living room and small plasma HD Tv in the mirror in master bathroom, very comfortable bed, we asked for feather pillows and they were there , full kitchen. Newspaper delivery of two papers, a different one for each of us per our request. The place is top of line first class all the way, excellent responsive customer service, great location - directly across street from the Fashion Show Mall (I could see Nordstroms from our window), a short walk to Wynn and strip. Smoke free, no casino. Fast elevators, no wait. Fabulous large gym, great equipment including a rowing machine. They had a free shuttle running on the half hour roundtrips from hotel to Caesar's and even let us off at the Wynn. We had done a lot of walking and our feet really hurt so the free shuttle was a great convenience. Our room was very quiet, no noise. We'll be back again this year. Can't wait! We did not eat at the restaurant,we never eat where we stay. We could live here it was so nice and comfortable, great furniture and spacious. It was perfect and beyond our expectations. I would say it is just as nice as a Four Seasons at 25% of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Nice”
Reviews.Author: Alvee
Reviews.Content: I agree with the resort and internet fees - totally bunk. It was way too cool and windy to use the pool and paying $12 a day for internet - come on, why???? Nice room, great hot tub and amenities. We had a good stay for our first time in Vegas, but if we return, we'll look for something else.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Place!”
Reviews.Author: ScoobyBaby
Reviews.Content: WOW! My young family and I were not sure what to expect when we arrived (Having bid for our room on priceline). But we were not dissapointed! We were overwhelmed by the opulant foyer and the extremely attentive staff. We were given adjacent rooms which shared one main front door and had an inner lobby (absolutely perfect for larger families), the rooms/suites were incredible, huge open plan living bedroom, full high quality kitchen, complimentary water, top class coffee, giant fluffy bathrobes, enormous bed, ipod docking station etc etc and then the bathroom....Larger than some hotel rooms, the jacussi bath was big enough for at least 2, the seperate glass screened toilet complete with telephone allowed privacy, the shower cubicle larger than most UK bathrooms. The icing on the cake - The TV in the bathroom mirror! My children were in heaven! The restaurant (although we didnt try it) seemed to be very good value, the room service which we did try, was no more expensive than alot of Vegas restaurants, and was the perfect treat to end a very busy day! All aspects of service was to the highest standard. The location it must be said is not directly on the strip, for a family with young children this is a positive. It is quiet and away from the 24/7 smoke-filled, booze-fuelled party taking place in all the other casino hotels. The hotel provides a courtesy bus to take you to the strip - It will leave the hotel reception and drive you the 100 yards to the Strip whenever you feel your legs wont carry you! The hotel is located directly opposite the Fashion Show Mall- which can only be a plus point! You may be thinking, this is only to be expected from a 5 star hotel? Perhaps, but I was all the more surprised since I only paid £40 per night for the room! I defy you to be dissapointed in this hotel!!! It is a pleasure to have stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but there are much better places to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: EYtraveller
Reviews.Content: I just spent 3 nights at the Trump Las Vegas with my girlfriend. The only reason I booked this hotel was because it was $106 a night on Hotwire. Also, there is a $15 a night resort fee which pisses me off. I think resort fees are total BS. I did not have a bad stay here, but I never plan on staying here again. Anyone going to Las Vegas would be better off staying at the Four Seasons, the Hotel at Mandalay, Mandarin Oriental, Bellagio or the Wynn if they like 5-star accommodations. First, the location is at the north end of the strip set back from Las Vegas Blvd on Fashion Show Drive. This in itself is a problem, its a 5 minute walk up to the Wynn, but the hotel is out of the way. I have been to Las Vegas 37 times and I did not like the location. If you have a rental car ( which you should because you will spend a fortune on taxis staying here), it is easily accessible of of Spring Mtn Road on I-15. I-15 is the key to getting around Las Vegas quickly. Next, the hotel has free valet parking which is included in the resort fee. I personally like to self park. There is no self park option and I hate having to make sure I have a enough singles to tip valets. The service is friendly. The doorman and valets are polite along with the maids. One thing I did not like was when I called down from my room to have my car brought around I was told that " We do not do that". Frankly I dont care, this is a 5-star hotel, If I want my car brought around, it should be brought around. Also, I do not like being asked to upgrade my room 5 times. I said no thank you the first time......how about a strip view...how about a high floor etc etc it was annoying. THe pool was nice but was too windy. The fitness center is very good for a hotel. Plenty of cardio machines with TVs. There were no headsets however. It did have a water machine. Dumb bells go up to 50 lbs. Hotel has a nice, but very expensive spa as well. The room is quite large and spacious. The bathroom is excellent, very large tub ( easily fits 2) and a huge shower. However, the shower could use a rain head or another shower head. Its too big for just a normal shower head. There were plenty of towels, excellent water pressure and a bathroom tv. The bed was comfortable as well as the sheets. The room had a subzero refrigerator and small galley kitchen. There was also a sitting area. No laundry bag however and the electronic do not disturb sign was broken. One thing to note, there is a main door for two hotel rooms, an outter door and then your room door. This can be very loud at night if your neighbors sharing a main door are not courteous. Overall this is a nice hotel but definitely stay somewhere else in Las Vegas, Ive stayed at almost every hotel on the strip and every luxury property. You can do better than the TRUMP. Check AMEX fine hotels if you can, great deals there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you don't mind no casino and just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: tkay_pbay
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and loved the piano bar in the evening. I actually liked not having the casino right there..no smoke :) You can easily get to the strip by walking through the mall that is across the street from the Trump. The rooms were really nice. I heard the train a couple times but not bad..then again we were on the 19th floor. I didn't like that you had to pay for internet service $5.95 to print out your airline tickets from the business center!

Reviews.Title: “Damn Train”
Reviews.Author: jackslammer
Reviews.Content: Well some people mentioned the train and yes it does go by a few times in the middle of the night. We stayed on the 51st floor and the noise was very noticeable. The reason it sounds so loud is that the window vents don't close properly and there is no insulation to dampen the noise coming in, so yes the helicopters, cars and train come through like they are in your room. The location is a bit off the strip, but plenty of shuttles and the walk does you good after big meals. There is a very good mall across the street with lots of good stores, a food court for snacks, and is a great cut though to the strip as well. Staff are very good, courteous, helpful and fun. If they could fix their one problem (noise coming into the room), the Hotel would be a great deal it would be a four star at least, very clean through out.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE - should be rated 1 (ONE) STAR.”
Reviews.Author: mousylittlegirl
Reviews.Content: #1. location: 200 feet from rail road. woke me up 6 times during the night. switched room the next day to strip view, didn't help at all. #2. checked in, pillow still has lipstick and stains all over. #3. bathtub still has pubic hair in it #4. microwave was dirty, still has food all over. #5. TV has HDMI, but was disable, couldn't watch my DVD. Overall, I would never stay here again, even for FREE. BIG DISAPPOINTMENT. I probably had much more fun at CIRCUS CIRCUS, at least, there was a circus there.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: reallylovemyholidays
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in April. Had a suite with a great view at night , lots of space in the room and the bathroom was brilliant. We have never had a bathroom so large in any other hotel we've stopped in. Rooms were kept nice and clean. It was a pleasure not to have walk through a casino to get to your room and this was one of the attractions of the hotel. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. Everything was easy to get to on foot(being non-drivers, walking doesn't seem a chore) and we thought the hotel was ideally placed for the strip and the shopping. We did think the prices in the bar were expensive, but then aren't they always. There was a regular courtesy bus but we didn't think this took you far enough - for instance if you wanted to go to either ends of the strip and walk your way back down to the hotel. After our first experience of staying in a Trump Hotel we would highly recommend them and we shall certainly look to them being our first choice when we visit the USA again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet, luxurious experience”
Reviews.Author: bagwan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 7 nights at the Trump Intl Hotel in a studio suite. The suite was elegantly appointed and very comfortable. Large, spotless rooms and huge luxurious bathroom. We enjoyed time by the pool every day - great service - busy on weekend. Nice breakfasts, quite reasonably priced. Driven to the airport by hotel's vehicle and received courteous service from all hotel staff. No casino was a plus for us as common areas were smoke-free and quiet. Fashion Show Mall was just across the road which was convenient. Charge for internet seems outrageous in this day and age however overall, this was a relaxing experience and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Convenient & Smells so damn good!”
Reviews.Author: jlessner
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a quick escape to Las Vegas and thoroughly enjoyed my ONE-night stay with Trump. From start; the AMAZINGLY delicious and fresh scent through the entire hotel, friendly hotel staff, FABULOUS bathrooms with an exquisite jacuzzi tub, super plush bed, scrumptious and affordable room service, to the end. I only have a few minor complaints, the TV in my bathroom mirror did not work (the staff offered to fix it within the hour but I told them no worries), the 10 minute wait for the valet every time I got my car out and that damn train but it wasn't that big of a deal. Also, not quite sure why everyone complains about the location. It's seriously only like a 3-minute walk to Las Vegas Blvd which puts you right at the Wynn, Fashion Show Mall, Venetian & Treasure Island. And YES there ARE sidewalks! Next time I'm in Vegas I'd definitely check out the Trump again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonBBgirl
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my stay at the Trump Hotel which was extended due to the volcanic eruptions in Iceland for 1 week. This hotel is one of the best i have stayed in for value for money. We payed a very cheap rate compared to alot of places on and off the strip and this was money well spent and stretched. The room was large, bathroom was HUGE!! A jazuzzi tub with Jets, seperate toilet and large walk in shower. The only issue is the internet fee is ridiculous and also the resort fee as its not a resort. But apart from that i didnt experience any train noise for my weeks stay and the walk to the strip is less than 5 mins. The people that complained about that are extremely lazy!! Great Hotel, Great Value and Excellent Service!!!!

Reviews.Title: “5 star but......”
Reviews.Author: SHEAMUSToronto
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at this hotel starting April 20. Check in was fast ... no one else in line. Rooms very nice , huge bathrooms. Room was approximately 550 sq feet. Not much of a pool area especially compared to other most other Las Vegas hotels. One large rectangle pool. Mediocre bar area. Litlle walk to the strip either through the fashion mall ( 10 minute ) or a couple of side streets to the strip past vacant lots. Little diappointed with the cleaning of the rooms each day but no big deal. Overall very good deal as i went through priceline

Reviews.Title: “So so hotel with bad valet parking.”
Reviews.Author: yuchung5
Reviews.Content: Overall, it is an ok hotel. One major down side is the valet parking. Valet parking is the only option for this hotel. And it will take a long time if they are busy, like Sunday and Monday morning. As well as Friday and Saturday afternoon. From my point of view, the valet parking is a joke. There are also some small things needs to be take care to the room. The glass door for the toilet is opened to the wrong side. The auto light switch in the cabinet is also not working. The location is at the north side of the fashion mall. Not a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but not better than others in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: IdahoSunshine_Chaser
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four nights at the Trump. We have never stayed at this hotel before but really wanted a room with a kitchen. A room on the 50th floor, quickest elevators and no casino that you have to walk thru to get to. As others mentioned, train noise on this end of the strip is quite annoying but luckily not too often. I've slept in more comfy beds at Wynn, Venetian and Mandalay. The other two negatives are that one day housekeeping did not make it to our room even though we were gone for seven hours and staff seems generally snobby. When checking out I had a question/problem with my bill and the clerk did not want to hear it and did not act as though she cared at all. Valet was the best, very helpful and friendly. Room service was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return, without a second doubt!”
Reviews.Author: Playmate1987
Reviews.Content: I traveled here with my friend on the 08.04.2010 to celebrate my birthday in Las Vegas, I am so happy that we choose the Trump.....The hotel was out of this world and I cannot fault it in any way shape or form, the train noise that everyone seems to be talking about (They need to ask themselves, did I stay in the Trump or somewhere else?) was none exsistant. The decor was amazing as was the staff, We only ate once in the hotel and that was when we first arrived after a long flight, it was expensive however in a 5* hotel thats to be expected right? The resort fee was a slight let down as we had not known about it however it was well worth the money as the pool and the gym atmosphere was brilliant. The hotel also offred a free shuttle bus to the strip however to be honest we were perfectly fine getting a taxi so we didnt actually enquire about it however did see it a couple of times on our trip, We spent 6 nights at this hotel and LOVED it......The shopping mall is right across the road that has a full range of shops and restuarants to suit all needs if you want a lazy day and dont want to travel to the strip in all I will definatly be returning, If you want luxuary and 5* treatment without the smokey, noisey casino's this is the one for you. Las Vegas itself is a must so much to see and do, absolutly amazing.....Good job Mr Trump!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Las Vegas Trump”
Reviews.Author: KenFerguson13
Reviews.Content: bid on Priceline 5 star hotels in Las Vegas and ended up at the Trump and hated it. The room is nice but there's no casino, the pool is tiny and the location is off strip with no sidewalks so you need a taxi for most places you want to go, the tv channels are very basic and disappointing, the shower head was disgusting, the sink was dirty and they charged us double for internet service because my girl and I both have our own computers, $24.00 per day for internet. If you're going to use Priceline and your looking for a 5 star, don't include the north strip in your search because you'll likely end up here and it's definitely not worth the difference..

Reviews.Title: “A Great Alternative to Gaming Hotels”
Reviews.Author: SDWanderlust
Reviews.Content: Location: A little off the Strip. One can walk through the mall if it is open or can walk through the parking structure to get to the Strip. It’s about 10 minute walk. Common Areas: Lobby is large and vast. It is a bit cold and impersonal. Sofas and seating areas are off to the side. The whole arrangement is just off. Great flower arrangements in the lobby area. There is a pool and a fitness center but did not have a chance to use those. Room: Very spacious. It has a sofa bed, chairs, microwave, oven, toaster, and a fridge. There are real pots and pans for cooking. Queen size bed is not terribly comfortable like other higher end places like the Westin. Sheets smell fresh and clean. The bathroom is spacious, functional. The toilet does not flush well. Some of the bathroom fittings show their age and don’t work well as they suppose to be. Though this place is rather new but some of the furniture already show their age. Service: Checking in is easy and quick. It is a nice departure from other Casino hotels, where there might be long lines. It has all the accoutrements of a five-star hotel-valet, concierge, doorman etc. All seems adequate. It does seem to lack certain fineness of a hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Yifer
Reviews.Content: The Trump is a good alternative if you're looking for some peace and quiet in Vegas. There is no casino or attractions to draw in crowds and the staff was incredibly attentive and friendly. We stayed here for 3 nights in March with 2 adults and 2 young children. We had a room on the 58th floor with an amazing view right down the strip. The room was large enough for us all with room to spare (1 king plus pull out couch). The bathroom had a large soaker tub with separate shower. The hotel is slightly off the strip (10 min walking) but located next to the mall which is great if you need to grab something quick to eat or essentials. We ordered a sandwich and a salad while at the pool. Although a little pricey, both were sized to feed at least 2 and of good quality. The doorbell/room service system was broken upon our arrival but the engineering staff fixed that promptly after we called about it. My major complaint was that housekeeping seemed inattentive. One trash can under the sink was not emptied for the duration of our stay and the sheets used on the pullout couch were not refolded and were shoved behind the couch. On the plus side, the staff also gets bonus points for locating some clothing we left behind and getting it to us before our departure from Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL - WELL WORTH A VISIT”
Reviews.Author: sspclarke
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel, the entrance is beautful and no expense spared.... the room, although we had a view away from the strip and a train did go past every morning fairly early.... it was amazing.... I have stayed in the Burj Al Arab in Dubai so my standards are very high. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone!! The bathroom is lovely and even has a TV in the mirror!! The only slight niggle is walking from the strip to the hotel it is a very dark road and you do feel a little uncomfortable so get a taxi whenever possible. ENJOY

Reviews.Title: “Trump terrific”
Reviews.Author: JPWI
Reviews.Content: Here for conference (4 days) at Caesars Place, but wanted to try someplace we had never stayed before. Trump was terrific. Yes, had read all the reviews. Knew about, not being right on the strip, the train and the resort fee. This place is luxurious, relaxing and romantic. No smoke, no casino to be forced through. So glad we didn't stay at Caesars. The bed was heavenly, the whirlpool tub devine, the view spectacular. Had a studio, which comes with a kitchenette and sitting area with 2 sofas. We knew this and planned on healthful relaxing breakfast (oatmeal, fruit and nuts) in the room each morning, sitting on the sofa watching the view and sipping the Wolfgang Puck coffee (provided with coffee maker) was delicious (worth the resort fee alone) and just request more, no problem. At night used the provided cork screw and wine glasses, after a show and watched the view again. When checking in asked to have the resort fee waived, they politely declined. Asked for a room on the highest quite side, got a room on the 56th floor looking downtown. Was offered a room on a higher floor for an additional $20 per night which I did not accept. Never heard the train. There is a lot of walking. The walk to the strip can be fun if you have the time or a pain if you are in a hurry to dinner or a show. If in a hurry take a taxi, if not enjoy the stroll. When checking out I reported that the in mirror tv in the bathroom initially did not work and had to be fixed, because of this asked I if the resort fee could be waived and this time my request was granted. Know what you want and what you are getting. Yes, the walk can be a pain, but if you have the time it can be a nice time to walk hand in hand. Ask for a high floor on the quiet side to avoid the train noise. Ask for the resort fee to be waived and ask again if you can report anything was wrong. We knew the restaurants we wanted to eat out at in the evening so we planned on using the kitchenette for a healthly breakfast and the designer inroom coffee was a bonus. Comparing notes with my conference attendees who stayed at Caesars I had the better experience (and it was less expensive even if I would have had to pay the resort fee, which was waived in the end anyhow). The Trump was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: CYD_Family
Reviews.Content: In the past thirty years, since I was a wee little one, I've been to Las Vegas over 50 times. I can say that this particular stay was probably my worst. I still managed to have a good time, but no part of that was due to my stay at Trump. The basics... Pros: Hotel lobby is nice. Staff is friendly (even when not competent, they were all very friendly). Room was relatively clean and well appointed. Location is decent. Not on the Strip, but close enough. Easy to cut through Nordstrom's and the mall during business hours, otherwise a short walk. Cons: EVERYTHING ELSE. No really, everything else was horrible. Check-in at 3 pm? Not cool. We arrived tired after a drive from LA at a little before 11 am and were told a room wouldn't be available until 3. "Can you please check or call me sooner?" Nope, turns out they couldn't, or they wouldn't. It wasn't too much to ask either. Just call my cell when a room comes up, and I'll be back. The person who greeted me, who obviously wasn't paying attention or didn't care, actually suggested I wait in the restaurant. For over four hours. With a five year old. Really, lady? I kept checking in and finally got in at around 2:30. I have never, ever in the history of staying in Vegas not gotten a room within an hour of arriving, tops. And that's rare to even wait. Resort fee? Only "resort" with five stars that charges such a fee. If Bellagio doesn't charge a fee, neither should you, Trump. Other hotels? Venetian, Wynn, Ceasars, all have better facilities and don't charge on top of their regular room rates. A swimming pool and one restaurant does not make one a resort, my friend. We've stayed in resorts in other cities. Recently, in fact. The ones that charge such fees (justifiably so) include things like internet access. Unlike Trump, who charges $12 on top of the $17 resort fee. Pool? One of the biggest duds of all the Vegas pools I've experienced. Pool staff was friendly, but two drinks took twenty minutes to arrive and cost $20 (one wasn't even alcoholic). Train? Loud. Yeah, it's loud. Maybe it's not loud from certain parts of the hotel, but from our room, it was loud. Room? Relatively clean, but my poor kid went into a sneezing fit when he picked up the tv remote from the shelf below the crookedly mounted tv. Layer of dust that was thick. Had to call for maintenance twice. Once the jets in the tub didn't work (and the worker left a caulk gun, a spare tub sensor - they apparently go out often - in the room), and the second time because the TV in the bathroom wouldn't turn OFF. Valet? Probably the worst aspect of a crappy stay. When I first arrived, instead of informing me that check-in wasn't for hours, they happily took my car. I walked in with my bags and was told no check in, so I left the bags with the bell desk and went back outside. It would be nice if someone communicates with the valet stand so they can let people know that they may not be able to check in. And then I waited ten minutes for my car. Which, mercifully, was the shortest wait time at valet for my trip. The longest? Almost 30 minutes. No joke. In fact, the icing on the cake was when we were finally leaving (and happily leaving) and I commented to my better half at how happy I was to not deal with the valet anymore - a valet steps out of a car and says my last name. "Uh, that's me. That's not my car." You guessed it, another five minutes after the fifteen we were already waiting while he went searching for the correct car. I think in the two days we stayed at this hotel, I spent a cumulative hour and a half waiting in front of the hotel for the car. Minimum. They need to just allow self parking. I understand this valet service is part of that fantastical "resort fee", but is it really worthwhile when it's this much of a hassle? When the staff at the desk told me to go wait in the restaurant (four hours, with a child, natch), my gut screamed out, "Grab your bags and drive across the street to one of the hotels you've enjoyed in the past. Just do it. Eat the cost of this hotel stay, it's not that much. You won't regret it." I decided to go against my gut and give the hotel another chance. I should have gone with my gut. We go to Las Vegas every year for NAB and at least two other times for pleasure. No more Trump for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Smells Clean, But Not a Vegas Hotel Near the Strip”
Reviews.Author: mitchgold
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel online and it says steps from the strip. More like 1/2 mile down a dark road with no sidewalk access. After a long day of walking and shopping - it would be great to be able to get to your Hotel without worrying about being mugged or run over by a taxi cab. We thought TRUMP - well it has to be nice. Room is super nice - staff terrific - during business hours the mall is open across the street and great if you taxi everywhere. It would have been good if they had a smoke free casino also and when I got back in at 10pm to order room service no one answered and I am still waiting 25 minutes with no return call. Since this is NOT close to the strip you can not just walk anywhere to get anything....kind of is NOT STEPS AWAY FROM STRIP! Bellagio - in the middle of the strip is a much better choice or even Treasure Island although TI smells of smoke everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Donald, You're Fired!”
Reviews.Author: serviceisdead
Reviews.Content: *bathroom was dirty upon arrival * the resort fee covers a bunch of stuff that OTHER places have at no charge like um, the coffee maker and printing of boarding passes. * spa facial burnt my face! * they offer to upgrade your dirty room for a fee! * pool only capacity for 100 and it's on top of the parking garage...sucked.

Reviews.Title: “Trump has come up Trumps!”
Reviews.Author: z1bby
Reviews.Content: Great, great stay in March with hubby who attended a show at the LV Convention Centre. Well situated for his purposes - he walked to the show each day (20mins each way, flat, easy walk) and I dashed across the road to Nordstroms! No distance at all to the top of the strip, 5min walk tops. I won't repeat the endless reports on the grandness of the rooms, they are as the previous TA reports state, fabulous and comfy. Pillows get 5 stars! Didn't eat at the hotel, but sat and had pricey cocktails in the lounge one night and listened to the pianist. Can only recall hearing the infamous train once or twice oh, and the odd siren. Loved the double lounger's around the pool. And the bathroom has the best hairdryer ever! The only negative's for our stay was the fact that housekeeping hadn't checked the room prior to us arriving and we discovered unemptied trash cans, dirty robes on the floor of the wardrobe and food left in the fridge from the previous occupants but a call to housekeeping resulted in a very prompt response. Keep up the great rates and we will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Blues”
Reviews.Author: VaTourist_8
Reviews.Content: The room we had the first night had a broken makeup mirror and a broken sink stopper. We didn't say anything that night. The next morning, the toilet also backed up. I called downstairs, explained all the broken issues and said that the toilet fix was urgent. They said someone would be up within ten minutes. That never happened. Forty minutes later, I called again. This time someone came up quickly and fixed everything. However at this point, we were fed up and wanted to leave. I went downstairs to speak with the manager. The manager looked into our reservation and said because we prepaid through a travel agency, he could not cancel and refund the balance of our stay. He generously offered us a $100 food & beverage credit and an upgrade to a corner suite. The corner suite was spectacular with many views of the strip and of the desert all the way out to Red Rock Canyon. Unfortunately, all the lampshades were broken and two light bulbs were out. We mentioned the light bulbs. They were never replaced. Another annoying problem was that there were very, very few outlets in the suite. In order to both plug in my laptop and have a surface on which to place it, I had to unplug a phone and move the dining table and chairs. The first day, the wi-fi connection seemed spotty so I got an ethernet cable and used that. (Either costs $11.99 per day.) That seemed to help. However on the day before we left, when I tried to connect using the ethernet, I got a message that the Trump server was down. The same thing happened when I tried to use the wi-fi to connect. I called downstairs and was told the IT guy was not yet in. I was told I should call Cox, Trump's cable provider, to deal with it. The LAST thing I am going to do when traveling is to kill an hour or more dealing with the hotel's internet problems. People should also be aware that there is no self-park at the Trump. You must use the valet and when things got busy, there were long delays in getting the car. With cool temperatures and very cold, very high winds, that got uncomfortable. At least Trump provides free shuttle service to the Strip and to the shops at Caesar's Palace. Other annoyances: a glass of regular, white wine at the bar costs $15.00. A 20-ounce bottle of soda at the store, (there are no vending machines), costs $3.00. Thank goodness for the fridges in the rooms, because at those prices, people were stuffing them. By the way, if you have a Strip view, you WILL hear the train, night & day. On the positive side, the people are nice, the hotel is very clean, the hotel is smoke-free, the rooms are spacious and the beds are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.. but too far from strip”
Reviews.Author: kidzRNSeattle
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Trump for 5 nights on a recent get away to Las Vegas. I bid on line and got what I thought was a pretty good price. First impression was very positive. Welcoming doorman, lobby that smells like a spring meadow and easy check in. Lobby is HUGE and very beautiful. Was annoyed that there was a $15 resort fee... what resort.? It is a lovely hotel with a pool and spa. But Nothing like any resort I have been to. Also paid another $20 for room with a view of the strip. We were on the 52 floor and it was very quiet and the view was terrific. Hear the infamous train once, but we enjoyed it!! The room (basic studio) was very large and very nice. An incredibly comfortable king size bed and lots of closet space. There is a sitting area by the window that is the width of the room. There is a sofa, 2 chairs, coffee table and end table. Very nice to have this area since we were here for 5 days. The room has a kitchen area with a stove, small frig, sink and microwave. It was very handy! A long desk completed the room. There were some nice books and pieces of art decorating the shelves. Large flat screen TV was easily seen from anywhere in the room. I don't think you should have to pay for wi-fi in a 5 star hotel!! If you have 2 laptops you have a double charge of $11.95 per day. My favorite part of the suite was the bathoom. It is beautiful with marble vaniety with a double sink. A huge walk in shower was a treat. Toilet area was separated by glass and a door. The jetted tub area big enough to really lay down and soak. Was very deep and had many jets. There was a TV screen built into the mirror. I had never seen anything quite like it. You couldn't feel it, but the picture would come on the middle of the large mirror. Perfect for watching during a long bath. You really could live in this studio room and feel right at home. Wouldn't change a thing about the room. Housekeeping was a little lax for such a nice hotel.Didn't replace shower caps or lotion. Put newspaper by a full small trash can and they never picked them up for 5 days. Toothpaste on the bathroom mirror didn't get cleaned and there was a knife left on the floor.How can you vacumn a floor a miss a knife? I called one day at 5 pm because there was no hot water. An hour later I called again.FInally someone got back to me and told me the problem. and it was so resolved. Comunicate with guests and we will understand. Ingore us and we get cranky!! Pool area was nice with attentive staff. We didn't eat in the resturant but the BLT from room service and by the pool was the best I had every had. On the other hand room service tortolini was terrible.Very tough and no rolls or accompaniments . They hadn't put a current room service menu in our room so ordering dinner was quite an ordel. Had a body scub in the spa and it was great. The spa staff was super. You can spend all day there if you have a treatment. Wonderful products. I got a very good haircut in the salon. The biggest drawback for us was the location. It is 15 minute walk to the closet casino and a LOOOOONG way to the other end of the strip. We had to take cabs to the Rio to see a show and to the MGM. Because of traffic, it cost about $15 each way We took a cab one night to the Bellagio to see the Fontains and they weren't on because of high winds. It was always wonderful to come back to the elegant lobby. i wish I could get that fragrance for my house. Not like perfume, just delightfully fresh. I would recommend the hotel, but only of you are ready to walk A LOT (really) if you want to go to shows or casinos. It is a great hotel, but not enough extras to make it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay in Vegas - as long as you know the limitations ahead of time”
Reviews.Author: MarkGToledo
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at Trump Towers. The rooms (suites) were great, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and everything was luxurious and plush. However, this is a private condo building that didn't sell, so they are renting out the rooms to tourists. Because of this, do not go there expecting a Vegas-type of hotel. There is no lounge to relax in, only a single restaurant (which we did not eat at), and of course no casino. There's nowhere to go in the hotel if your spouse/family want to sleep and you don't. You are charged daily for Internet! This must be so they can afford to pay the doormen to rush to the doors to hold them open for you as you approach.... It is smoke-free and very quiet - no crowds roaming through to sight-see or to gamble. They now provide a free shuttle to take you the 1.5 blocks to the corner of the Fashion Show Mall and Las Vegas Blvd, so you do not have to worry about walking that last block or so alone and in the dark. All-in-all, a very nice place to stay and to come back to at the end of a long day of sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: alhanney
Reviews.Content: If you value your sleep, do yourself a favor and don't stay here. Our 3 night stay was interrupted every night by the unbelievably loud horns of the freight trains that run past this hotel day and night. On a good night you might be woken once, on a bad night it could be 3 or 4 times. I consider myself a fairly heavy sleeper but was woken every single time. If we were staying any longer in Las Vegas we would have had to switch hotels. On the plus side, the staff here are all very pleasant, the rooms are fairly nice (great jet tub), and the distance to the strip just a few minutes walk, either via the sidewalk or through Nordstrom's across the street at the Fashion Plaza mall. We have stayed in many different hotels in Las Vegas and decided to try the Trump for a change of scene. Unfortunately the train issue was a really big deal for us and we will unfortunately not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JetSetter71
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Trump Hotel in March 2010 for 4 Nights. Great Hotel, Great Rooms with huge bathrooms. Great location away from the noise of the strip. Had the best sleep ever. Bell staff where great, pity the front of house staff where a bit more friendlier and more knowledgeable. Only issue I could raise was that this must be the only Hotel in the world that does not supply Tea in the room as coffee was supplied. When asking for tea was advised that there would be the $5 room service fee plus cost of the Tea bags. Even asked if they could replace the coffee for tea this was not possible. Strange for a 5 star hotel to have no tea bags in a room..... Mr Trump i think you would be "Fired"

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: marecg31
Reviews.Content: this is truly a great hotel. i would consider myself a critical person, but i can hardly think of anything to criticize at this hotel. reception staff was friendly, quick and helpful. the lobby is welcoming and five-star material. the room is fantastic: HUGE luxury bathroom, spacious rooms with marvellous design, a funcional kitchen (which sometimes can be helpful in vegas) and a comfortable bed (a little soft for my taste, but hey...) maybe the only thing i could complain about is that they have only valet-parking available... oh, and of the ten days we spent there, they had elevator issues on three days. aside from that, great value ! keep up the good work, trump. and try not to go skyrocketing with the price :)

Reviews.Title: “If you're not a solo business traveller, stay away!”
Reviews.Author: cgycivil
Reviews.Content: I got stuck with the Trump through a Priceline submission. (Which itself was a total scam - after "naming my price," they ended up tacking on a pile of fees and taxes and charged more than 50% higher than I agreed to, with no recourse. The price I name should be the price, period! This isn't the Trump's problem, although they tacked on a "resort fee" the day-of, as well... but worth a mention, anyway.) I was staying at the Trump a couple nights with an extended family member. The hotel was very well appointed and what you'd expect for 5-stars, but when we got to the room we found only one bed. Apparently, the advertised two beds actually included a fold-out couch. When we phoned the front desk, they told us the only way to get two real beds was to upgrade to a penthouse suite at considerable additional cost. When housekeeping made up the sofa bed, it had a thin sheet with no quilt or comforter, and I had to sleep and shiver all night directly by an air conditioning vent. The sofa was quite uncomfortable and very small - at my height, my feet were hanging off the end! I imagine the Trump could respond with "buyer beware" and say that I should have known that this was a business suite, but it wasn't possible for me to know this since the hotel was sprung on me by Priceline. I noted above that the Priceline scam charges weren't the Trump's fault, but what is their fault is that they're associated with Priceline at all. I'd humbly suggest that the product they offer is not at all what most travel-site customers would expect to get, and they should really get off these sites and focus on marketing elsewhere so that unsuspecting users don't get stuck with this again. Again, a very nice place, but not at all what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Las Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: superfan13
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at the Trump during my 4 day trip to Las Vegas for a tradeshow last week. It was walking distance to the Sands Expo Center - either through the Fashion Show Mall or down the street. I really liked that there was no casino or smoking in the hotel - a nice change from the rest of Vegas. Check-in was easy and they had a room (4205) ready for me even though I arrived a few hours early. The room was fantastic, with a big comfortable bed, good size tv, fantastic bathroom, comfortable robes, nice view. I do wish they had a few more hangers in the closet. And the resort fee was kind of steep, but the bottled water came in handy prior to and after being outside in the dry desert air. I got a great rate ($100/night) on Priceline which made it worthwhile, but I would probably not stay there again because I enjoy the action at the Palazzo, Wynn, Encore and Bellagio a little more now that I steared clear of it this trip. It is an ideal choice however; just depends on what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: dippity81
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline. Got great rate, considering March Madness. Used the $20 bill trick and requested a high, strip-facing, one bedroom; worked flawlessly. Only spent one-night, but everything about stay was great. We're given early check-in; when requested late check-out was given till 4pm. The pool was a little small, but not overcrowded. Ate dinner @ the restaurant; was pricey for size of meals, but good quality food. Recommend the dirty martini's. People who complain about the walk are lazy; also plenty of cabs available. The absence of a casino was also a nice change; saved me from the late night drunken gambling. Definitely recommend & will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Trip”
Reviews.Author: Tucsontravel21
Reviews.Content: As former Las Vegas residents we have pretty high expectations when it comes to hotels. We chose the Trump for the location i.e. close to strip and shopping and easy freeway access to get to our off strip destination. In the plus column I would say that the lack of casino, divine bed and bath robes, roomy room, deluxe pool area and location were the highlights. On the minus side the resort fee, charge for internet, poor valet (you can't self park), and a 28 dollar charge to use the in house phone one time were draw backs. Also we were on the 55th floor and you can really hear the road noise which was a surprise. I would say avoid eating at the hotel as it is mucho dollars and you can eat cheaper across the street. However, overall it was lovely and we would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Lozza74
Reviews.Content: If you want casino action 24/7, the sond of slot machines at all hours of the day, the stench of cigarette smoke everywhere, drunks meandering around at 8am, then do NOT stay here...we don't want you! If you want luxurious accomodation 2 mins away from the Strip, friendly staff, peace and quiet, then this is the place for you. We have just returned from 6 nights at The Trump. I never return to the same hotel twice but I WILL be going back here again. my 6th time in Sin City and this is, hands down, the best hotel I've stayed in. I would think only the new Mandarin Oriental could possibly be better. The rooms are fantastic and well appointed with a nice little kitchenette and a lovely bathroom...the biggest jacuzzi tub I have ever been in! Staff couldn't do enough for you. The location is fine and NOT miles away from the Strip as some people like to make out. It is a 5mins walk away, there IS a sidewalk (albeit you have swap sides of the road) ...or you can get the shuttle bus which will take you down to the corner of the Fashion Mall. During shopping hours you can easily cut through Nordstrom. Yes there is a $16.80 resort fee per day, but surely you know this before you book? Only a few minor gripes...the entrance doors to the room are very heavy and slam quite loudly unless you are careful. The shower was a little bit inconsistent in terms of heat. Other than that it's all good! I have to say that the bed is probably THE most comfortable I have ever slept in. Thank you Donald for a great week away. Oh, and as for the famous train...I heard it once only....at 3pm when I was sat by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not next time...”
Reviews.Author: AusssieTraveller
Reviews.Content: Generally give fantastic reviews when I feel they're necessary. I'll make this one short and sweet. Pro: Only place close enough to strip to stay for under 21s. Con: If you are under 21, staff treat you like a 12 year old. Pro: New, clean, very OTT glamorous, great features in room. Con: Not much use to average guest in LV. Pro: Services available. Con: Have to pay for almost all of these services on top of not cheap base rate. Didn't bother with them. Pro: Late check out. Con: Left at 3am in morning on second night, had to pay for two full nights (which is fine) but was also charged the resort fee for both of these nights. Had discussed this with hotel staff upon check out. Agreed to waive fees, dismissed us very quickly and a month later, fees showed up on credit card statement. For people not accustomed to these extras fees, please note you are liable for them whether you use the pool, gym, etc. regardless. There's no real way around that. I understand a lot of this is Vegas but it was a frustrating way to end the trip. If we are going to be paying higher rates for accommodation and fees in Vegas regardless, next time we will go somewhere central, where the staff are not arrogant and treat you like 5 year olds. Disappointing way to end our trip, especially at a "5 star" hotel. Physically 5 star maybe, but service was barely a 2.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: shweta119
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in a five star hotel and it was wonderful. The service was great, the room was great and it was very relaxing. The best part was that the bathroom mirror had TV in it which was something I saw for the first time in my life. Apart from that, the bath tub had jacuzzi too.. Overall, great fun!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: daragh_10
Reviews.Content: Rooms are exceptional great value 4 money no casino but nice 2 escape from all de others

Reviews.Title: “No HOT showers!”
Reviews.Author: tiffy1991
Reviews.Content: So we started off fighting with the hotel about the $50 hotel credit that was advertised... which was not a hotel credit, but a spa credit that you had to spend $100 at the spa to use.... not a good start... then we had to move rooms our first night becasue the wind was blowing the closed window vents off....... upon further inspection we found that DUCT TAPE was being used to attempt to keep them sealed... the noise was soo bad from the wind blowing up the vents we had to move.... then not once, no matter what time of day or night was the water hot in the shower...... so bizarre.... dont get me wring a beautiful hotel but not issues I have ever had at other 4/5 star hotels EVER!

Reviews.Title: “Trump is extremely poor in guest service, and irresponsible. I would never refer anyone to this hotel, unless you want”
Reviews.Author: WangFamily
Reviews.Content: TRUMP is extremely poor in guest service, and irresponsible. I would never refer anyone to this hotel, unless you want to go through my experience. I booked the hotel from Expedia. Two night's fee is charged by Expedia (TOTAL $207.22). When we checked in on 12/27/2009, Trump charged an additional "RESORT FEE" for $15.00 + TAX per night. "RESORT FEE" includes "VALET PARKING" (TOTAL $33.60). NOTE: TRUMP has no SELF PARKING. they charge $15.00 plus tax per day as resort fee, it includes valet parking. That night we went out for dinner and got back to hotel around 8:30 PM. By 10:15 PM, TRUMP’S security manager Doug Deal called our room and requested to come to our room to explain something. He mentioned valet parking boy made a dent on our brand new car, (which was just bought a month ago) when parking our car. We asked to go to the parking lot to see the car immediately. Mr. Deal took us to P3 level where our car was parked (as TRUMP has no self parking), through an “employee only” elevator to see our car. We took pictures of our car. Mr. Deal gave a claim report with following information: ==================== REPORT# 122709 - 1287 security officer: DOUG DEAL TRUMP HOTEL 2000 FASHION SHOW DR. LAS VEGAS, NV 89109 PHONE: 702-982-0000 FAX: 702-476-7975 ==================== and mentioned the procedure of the claim should be: (1) contact insurance company (2) get the car repaired (3) claim to their office through the above info Mr. Deal mentioned several times that they felt sorry for what happened and ensured us they will be responsible for the accident. Finally, he said he can ask their hotel manager to talk to us if we are still upset. As Mr. Deal is very polite and makes sure TRUMP will pay for the car repair, and we think since it is Christmas holidays, we do not want to spend more time dealing with this unpleasant event. After we came back from the trip, we took our car to our insurance company, ALLSTATE, to report the accident and got an estimate for $998. We had our car fixed in January. Then ALLSTATE sent out the claim to TRUMP on 1/20. On 2/17, my insurance company ALLSTATE informed me that TRUMP refused to pay for the repair, since we gave our key to them, which means we are willing to let them operate our car, WE have to be obligated to pay for the repair. This is totally different from what their security manager, DOUG DEAL, told us!!! TRUMP is the hotel I will never stay again, also will never refer to anyone I know!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute luxury!!”
Reviews.Author: bully1beef
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel due its very reasonable room rate that we found on expedia. The fact that it was non smoking and non gaming was an attraction to us. The rooms are amazing with huge bathroom ( with tv in mirror). We were quite concerned about the noise of the train after reading reviews on here of people saying how loud it was , but I can honestly say apart from hearing it maybe twice whilst we were around the pool, we did not notice it and it certainly would not have woken me up!! The pool area is very nice, with cocktail service. We did not dine at the hotel, but when ever we asked for room service (for ice bucket etc) it was very quick. Also, it felt like we were the only people staying at the hotel , as we could not hear anyone else in the corridors or next rooms. It is a slight walk to the other main hotels on the strip( about 700 m), but this was not a problem to us. All in all we had a great time staying at the trump

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Change of Pace in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: WOW. I had a 3-day business trip to Las Vegas, and after much searching about on the web, etc., I decided to try the Trump. I'm glad I did -- this was a fabulous hotel and was such a refreshing change of pace from the usual Vegas hotels. The service was superb. I did not open the doors of the hotel during my entire visit -- not once. Every time I entered or exited the property a door man was opening the door. The front desk staff was wonderful and efficient at both check-in and check-out. Every time I called for something, the person who answered the phone was not only polite, but went the extra mile. For instance, I called for some extra coffee, and I was asked if I wanted regular cream or hazelnut cream. Such detail! One time I stepped out of my room with my ice bucket, and a staff member in the hallway happened to see me. He went and got the ice for me. Room service staff was similarly stellar. The room was incredible -- HUGE, with fantastic modern classic style and loads of luxury. The bed was awesome. There was a couch, two chairs, and coffee table. A full desk. 2 closets. Kitchenette with Wolf and Sub Zero appliances. Huge jacuzzi tub. Walk-in shower. TV built into the bathroom mirror. And THE NICEST towels and robe I've ever had at a hotel. This place is a real retreat, but I also got a ton of work done (and the high-speed internet worked really well). LOTS of the Vegas hotels have nice rooms, but this room stood out for its size AND for its real quality; this wasn't "fake" luxury meant to impress the Vegas weekenders. And the elegance, while ever-present, was far more understated than I anticipated knowing that The Donald was involved! The hotel's public spaces are also really well done. The fitness center was great (cold towels are even provided) -- large with lots of equipments and a full range of free weights and machines. The lobby is spacious. Everything is top-notch. Best of all, thanks to not hosting a casino, this place actually feels like a hotel lobby where you could have a conversation with a co-worker, do some work, etc. My only complaint (and a minor one): the valet retrieval could be a bit on the slow side. Overall, HIGHLY recommended, especially for people who want proximity to the strip (the hotel's a short walk from the Wynn, Treasure Island, Encore, etc., and a brief cab ride to all the others) without having to deal with the hassles of the casino strip properties. How refreshing to have the excitement of Vegas just steps away but to not have to walk through a casino to get to your room, deal with stumbling drunk people, be able to grab coffee in the morning without huge lines everywhere, etc. There are times where the strip properties work, but this is definitely my choice for a business hotel in Vegas. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot believe this is considered a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: saref
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived to Las Vegas for the first time after a 6 hour flight. We were exhausted and just wanted to sleep. It was 11 pm at night and as we arrived to the hotel the valet and doorman were very hospitable. The front desk however was extremely rude.
