They gave us a room and we carried our luggage there opened it up and low and behold..an extremely dirty room with towels and garbage everywhere, bed not made etc. We were extremely disappointed. Had to go all the way back down did not receive an apology from the man who made the mistake and the manager was no where to be found. Finally got another room, slept and woke up early to speak to the manager. The manager turned out to be a very snotty BLONDE (no offense to anyone but I do not see how you can hire a lady like this to run this damn hotel) came up and didn't bother to do anything about the night before. She blamed it on the system (typical). Since I was extremely dismayed I refused to eat there or spend anytime there for that matter. However, I did take a look at the pool area just to compare and contrast with the other five star hotels in the area. Honest to God I do not even understand why this is considered a five start hotel. I travel a lot, been to many five start resorts..this one DISGUSTING. For god sakes look at the bellagio, venetian, and aria and learn something. Thus, Location is crappy, the hotel is extremely small, room service especially house keeping was horrible. I would definitely never stay there again and I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Trump Las Vegas - Very nice but with some shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: DougsStuff
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel and I would recommended it for those who want to get away from the hype and noise of a typical Las Vegas hotel/casino. The rooms at the Trump are amazing. Very large, luxurious, well appointed and a great view (we had a Strip view room). The staff was really good and very helpful, especially the Concierge. Check-in was very fast, not crowded and easy. The person checking us in actually walked us to the elevators (nice touch). The lobby bar and lounge is a great place to people watch, have a cocktail and tapas. It is directly across the street from a beautiful Mall (Saks, Bloomingdales, Nordstroms, etc.). The location is off-strip, so it is about 2 blocks to get to the strip. They do have a free shuttle and free parking (but you must use the valet service). There is no casino. There is only one restaurant and compared to others nearby, it is OK. No mini-bar in the room. Full kitchen (stove, refrigerator, microwave and sink) , so if you want to stop at a convenience store and stock up, there is a place to put stuff. We had rented a car and it made getting around so much easier.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fabulous, location, rooms, view, service, staff”
Reviews.Author: BRONS4
Reviews.Content: Just off the strip, but a short walk to get to it, easy ! Staff really helpfull and eager to please. Beautiful rooms. Great security. Wouldnt hesitate staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “The train & wind noise did not disturb our Bachelorette Party plans!”
Reviews.Author: bajanative
Reviews.Content: A group of 12 girls traveled to Vegas in March for a bachelorette party. The hotel price was very reasonable- we paid $240 per night for a suite. The room had a kitchen with a full size refrigerator, dinning area, living room with fold-out sectional, large bedroom, large full bathroom & small full bathroom. We had 4 girls per room so having two bathrooms was very convenient. The room décor was nice, nothing too fancy. For the price we paid the value was great! I also liked the Fashion Show Mall being across the street from the hotel- Go to the Nordstrom’s Café for lunch. On the not so great side, the hotel is off the strip- they offer a free shuttle to the strip that runs on a regular basis. The hotel doesn’t have a casino!!!!! REALLY- I guess the tower was supposed to be condos, but with the real estate market crash it was converted to hotel. So, if you want to gamble you need to go elsewhere. It was very windy the weekend we were there, and the rooms did not muffle the noise or wind. I felt like I was in a wind tunnel while walking the hotel’s hallways. The train noise was also annoying!!! The windows are very thin and the noise goes through them like paper. The gym was OK, nothing to brag about! It had free weights, cardio machines and some nautilus machines. An adequate gym is very important to me, and this one did not cut it. I didn’t eat at the hotel restaurant, but I did order a fruit plate at the café next to the gym- not worth my money. And for some reason, the staff was not pleasant at the café. The hotel was not crowded; check in & out was smooth. There was no bar scene, or party atmosphere- the hotel was pretty mellow. The pool was not exciting or worth mentioning. Overall it was a good value for the money we paid. Would I stay in the property again? NO!

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay I have ever had in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: OpinionatedTourist
Reviews.Content: After years of staying in various Strip casinos with mixed results, I booked a room at the Trump Hotel for a recent birthday/anniversary trip with my partner. I found a sweet deal on TravelZoo for $99/night (on a weekend) plus $50 resort credit. We rented a car this time in Vegas because we wanted to see some of the sights outside of the city, and we foound the valet parking to be very courteous, quick and convenient. Upon check-in, the extremely friendly and professional gentleman at the front desk asked if we would like to upgrade from a city-view room to a strip-view. I told him it was not necessary, to which he replied, "Yes, the mountains are beautiful with the snow on them." (It had snowed the night before). He completed the check-in process, we went to our room, and to our pleasant surprise, we had a view of the strip! I should back up to say that the lobby smells wonderful! I wish I could buy scent they pump into the lobby. Also, it was very pleasant to stay in a hotel with no casino, and more importantly, no smoking. Don't get me wrong, we do like to gamble some and experience Vegas all that Vegas has to offer, but it was very nice to have a sanctuary to return to after a day/night of craziness. The room was tastefully decorated, the bed and linens were luxurious, and the location was convenient. It was just a short walk to the strip and all of the popular hotels and fantastic shopping were just a 10-15 minute walk away. And, if we were too lazy to walk, (or too drunk to drive) we could just hop in a cab and get anywhere for just a few bucks. The spa products in the bathroom were fabulous! The shampoo reminded me of scents from my childhood. The best way I can describe it is a pleasant mix of sage and sweet pea. I wish I had purchased the large bottle in the gift shop. We used our resort credit at DJT and purchased the Pre Fixe dinner. It was delicious, and the atmosphere was top-notch. The Frisse salad was fantastic! The last night of our trip, we were craving Indian food, and received a great recommendation from the concierge. She even showed us an ad in a travel guide for a free dinner at the restaurant. Finally, as a gay couple, the resort staff made us feel welcome, and we did not feel out of place in any way. It was the most pleasant stay I have ever had in Las Vegas and the Trump International will now be my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Accomodations, but poor security...”
Reviews.Author: alj2010
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Trump Hotel for a 3 night stay on a Travel Zoo promotion with 2 other girlfriends. We planned on celebrating 2 birthdays and also my bachelorette party. We were awed by the very spacious and smoke free lobby and rooms of the hotel...also, the plush robes and jacuzzi bathtub. We took advantage of the convenient shuttle service that seemed to be always available without ever having to wait. All was going extremely smoothly until the very last night of our stay. The night of the poor security incident we got back from our evening out at around 2:30am and crashed in the super comfy bed and sofa sleeper by 3am. About an hour later at around 4:30am I heard someone trying to use their key to gain entry into our room. They tried unsuccessfully several times and then finally gave up and left. I was wide awake by that point and a bit worried considering that person actually was able to gain access into the foyer area by using their key on the first door which leads to the 2 separate rooms. I laid in bed for about 5 minutes and then heard the person trying to use their key on the door again!!!! This time the key actually worked and the person was able to open the door!!!!! Thankfully, the hotel door guard was secured on the top of the door and the person was only able to open the door a couple of inches. I proceeded to ask them why they were trying to get into our room since only all 3 of our names were listed on the room reservation. They told me their name and their friend's name that "should" be in the room. Neither one of my friends, nor myself, recognized either one of the names provided and let this person know. Then this person asked me, "Are you sure?" I then told this person to leave and that I was going to call security. After arguing with me about whether or not their friend was in the room they FINALLY left. I decided to call the front desk first. The front desk attendant said they would call security for me and get the door lock reprogrammed and new keys reissued. Then a few minutes later security called our room to let me know there was a "mistake" and the security guard was on his way with new keys for our room. About an hour later we heard the security guard enter the foyer area and then saw them slip an envelope with new keys under the door!!! No one at Trump (security or front desk attendant) attempted to apologize for the inconvenience or even ask about what happened...none of the staff members at Trump seemed to even find this occurence to be out of the ordinary at all. While checking out a few hours later, I talked to the manager and explained how alarmed we were that obviously the front desk reissued a key to someone without verifying the names on our reservation or this person's identification! Of course, the front desk attendant and the manager did not see any record of this occurrence on our reservation file. I then went on to explain how we all lost sleep and felt extremely upset and fearful that just about anyone off the street could gain access into our room. The manager FINALLY apologized and issued us a $50 guest inconvenience credit. Cheap if you ask me... Just to let everyone know that may be reading this, from what I experienced, you don't even need to bother with making a reservation at the Trump Hotel in Las Vegas. You can simply go to the front desk, pick a room number and ask for a room key and you have a free place to stay! Seriously, I would not recommend staying at this hotel, unless you're planning on having a party in your hotel room and will just let anyone into your room for a good time!

Reviews.Title: “luxurious but missing a few elements”
Reviews.Author: KarenAV
Reviews.Content: Trump had great prices for a fabulous room, we chose it because it was non smoking and had no casino as we wanted to keep our 9 year old away from the continual seedy side of LV. We had our own bedroom that gave us the privacy we wanted on holidays and the room cannot be faulted, it was large and luxurious, my daghter loved the tV in the bathroom mirror. Our view was poor of a car park and building site so the offer of a corner suite turned out to be hollow. Our main disappointment was that there was only 1 restaurant and it was pricey although the food was good but after dinner we wanted to have a drink and listen to the piano player in the bar who was great but finished at 10pm even on weekends, one night he had a big crowd giving him generous tips to stay but he had another gig, when he left so did all the patrons who would have stayed and continued buying drinks. That was a big disappointment for us you would assume a vegas hotel would have entertainment that went later.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded All Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: missanthropy15
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a short weekend trip to Vegas where we were guests at the Trump Tower for two evenings. What an incredible delight it was to stay at this hotel. From the stunning decor to the lovely and helpful staff, this establishment exceeded all of our expectations. When we arrived at the Trump Tower, the valet was kind and talkative. He wanted to know where we were from and if we were in town for business or leisure. It was nice and made us feel like the staff were generally interested in us. The doorman was very sweet and offered to help us with our luggage. The lobby smells simply delightful! I'm not sure what it is, but the entire lobby smells like a spa. It's a lovely change from the smokiness that pervades most of the hotels in Vegas. The staff at the front desk was more than accommodating and upgraded us to a one bedroom suite. There are security guards at the elevators, which is a nice touch and something I think is a good idea for all hotels of this scale. The room was simply stunning. We had a full kitchen, a delightful living room and sitting area, a spacious bedroom with fantastic floor to ceiling windows and the bathroom was just spectacular. The bathroom has marble floors and counter tops, a private commode, a lovely deep spa tub sitting in a window with a breathtaking view of the strip and an enormous glass and marble shower. There is a small tv in the bathroom mirror as well, his and hers closets in the bedroom, an iphone/ipod docking station and large plasma tv's in both the living room and the bedroom. The views from the suite were magnificent! The room was clean and neat. The bedding was soft and comfortable. We did not want for anything! I have read some of the other reviews on this site and didn't think any of the commonly addressed issues were really a problem. You can hear a train occasionally from the hotel, but it isn't as loud as some seem to say it is. We barely noticed it at all. As far as the hotel being 'far' from anything, I have to say that I think some people just like to complain. The hotel is literally a stone's throw from Fashion Show mall and all you have to do is walk across the street to the double doors at Nordstrom to enjoy a nice stroll through the mall to get to the strip by day. At night, there is a paved road leading right to the strip that is about a block in length. I would hardly call a block a long walk, but for those in their Jimmy Choo's, the Trump offers a shuttle service from their door right down to the strip and as you are walking out of the hotel the doormen and valet's are constantly inviting guests who are walking to the strip to board the shuttle. Overall, this is one of the nicest hotels we've ever stayed at. We enjoyed every moment that we spent here and would not hesitate to return or to recommend this hotel to anyone! Kudos to all of the staff at the Trump Tower! Thank you so much for a lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome suites!”
Reviews.Author: travelkaykay
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Trump! Staff service: All their staff members are really courteous. They greet you right out of your car, all the way to the elevator lobby. Also, when I called front desk and hospitality, they had great telephone manners. We ordered room service at 4am (hungry after clubbing!) and the lady sending the food was also very nice. Prompt service and delicious food! (The caesar salad could be a bit fresher) Decor: The building is needlessly to say gorgeous. Lobby area very nice and quiet. I really like the quiet and elegant part, nice change from all the casino packed hotels on the strip. The room we stayed at was one bedroom suite. Gorgeous!! We had a corner room and both sides of the views were amazing! Cleanliness: Everything in the room was nice and neat. Very clean and amenities were fully stocked. Location: It's only a minute taxi ride to the Wynn. No it's not exactly on the strip but it's really closeby. We just couldn't believe the quality of the suite we had given how reasonably priced it was. Probably because they didn't have a casino and that it's not exactly on the strip. But I highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “relaxing haven within close walk to the main strip”
Reviews.Author: arobin
Reviews.Content: We found the Trump tower to be everything that we had hoped for...and maybe just a little more. First- I will address the cons that people have listed previously...namely trains and location. Trains- I will preface this by saying I am a light sleeper. The only time that I heard a train at all was when I was laying by the tranquil pool one afternoon. I slept soundly all night long EVERY night I was there. It is rare for me to sleep so well at a hotel just due to the fact that slight noises with plumping or hall noise will always disturb me. I was thrilled with the quiet that was provided in our suite. Location- no, not ON strip but it was an easy 20 minute stroll (through a pleasant and SAFE area) to the HEART of the strip- only 4-5 minutes to Las Vegas Blvd. Parking- valet got busy on weekends but it was still a very easy experience. RESORT FEE- yes, there will be an additional $15 fee tacked on to your bill EVEN if you book through an online site that usually is an "all fees included" site. Its just the way it is...that said, unlike other hotels, they do not then go on to charge each guest for use of the fitness center or pool etc. And now for the PROS- we loved that it was a non-smoking property and that there was NO CASINO in the hotel (some people may find these aspects cons, to us it was delightful). These aspects made it quieter and more refined than even the nicest strip hotels. SUITES- each room has a kitchenette- we were able to call the concierge to get any pots/pans that we needed. This way we were able to make breakfast every morning we wanted to as well as any other meal we wanted. Appliances are sub-zero/bosch (top line) as are the pans. The facts that housekeeping took care of pots/dishes really was the icing on the cake. Bathrooms- I could not have imagined how much I would enjoy having a TV in the mirror of the bathroom (so you can watch while getting ready OR while soaking in the huge jacuzzi tub). Concierge- very helpful...from suggesting a great shop for getting new boots to helping plan evening shows (I would suggest making use of the buy one get one offer Trump hotel has for the cirque show Mystere- not sure if this is an ongoing offer but we LOVED the show and using the trump offer got one ticket free!) Other perks- we did not know until too late BUT the hotel is very customer oriented and will go so far as stocking your kitchenette with certain foods so that it is simply there and awaiting you upon your arrival.

Reviews.Title: “The Donald knows his stuff...”
Reviews.Author: Travelicious55
Reviews.Content: Overall a great Hotel. Classy, well appointed, well run. Some wrote that the only downsides were that its not right on the strip and no Casino. To us those are absolute upsides! As non-smokers (and not really gamblers either) it was a pleasure to come into a facility that was non-smoking and did not have the REEK of american cigarettes and booze like so many other hotels on the strip. It was a refreshing escape from the loud obnoxiousness of LV Strip. We were only here for a few days diversion on our way through to LA. LV is not our kind of place in any case, and I would not choose this as a destination. Fake fake fake this is a town of smoke (yeah, literally...tons of smoke...) and mirrors. If you are into the debauchery of sin city and are an addict of any kind, (drinker, smoker, gambler, sex addict) then you will think you've gone to heaven. Ok, if we had to make one negative observation we would agree with the 'noise' factor and trains and thin windows/insulation. But overall a small price to pay for the rest of what was a very pleasurable experience. Nice beds, quality sheets, beautifully designed/appointed rooms with many nice amenities. Our room was on the 43rd floor had a view of the mountains and strip. The double doors from the hallway provides extra security and reduces ANY noise from the hallway area. Sub zero fridge a great amenity for cold bevies. Resort fee is charged everywhere in almost every hotel so that is not unusual. When we arrived we could not find the TV remote in the room so they eventually had someone sent up and they provided another remote - took about 25 minutes but finally arrived. The TV in the bathroom did not work, but really we did not miss it, after all we weren't here to watch TV. Stayed at some other hotels on the strip and although they all present well on the internet, the reality is far different. Most of the hotels (ie: NYNY amongst others) are sticky, dirty and by the time you walk to lobby reception (through the open smokey casino) you need a shower to get the smoke out of your clothes and hair. The Trump is luxury and having some great rates is by far the best value on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Trump- Noisy Does not Live up to the Trump Name”
Reviews.Author: robertw4771
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Trump hotel for a few days on business. I was unaware of the train issue until I woke up to the tremendous noise at 6AM the first night there. I was too busy to bother complaining. The view from the back of this hotel is really classic (lets just use he word seedy) If you like trains you can see the freight train roll out with 100 cars hitting the horns for several minutes in the wee hours. The second night I heard the first train at 3:45 AM. Ok let me discuss a few things. Resort Fee-Total Ripoff. I was told at the front desk it included internet. At checkout I was told it did not. I had nothing in writing telling me what it covered so there was nothing I could do. Cost me an extra $36.00 that I might not have used if I knew I had to pay. Free Vaket parking? I did not have a car but no hotel in vegas charges for parking. The gym was ok,with a number of problems with the touch screens on treadmills. My room had stained carpet and the hip tv in the bathroom not working. There was a tray of dirty dishes outside in the hall near my room for three days. That must be a record. I have a nice picture of that. Plenty of people housekeeping and other employees must have walked by it and did not bother picking it up. (probably the not my job stuff) Spoke to a few people on the way to the airport they had plenty of probems with bathtub problems etc. They train woke them up as well. Some employees friendly and others were pretty chilly. Due to the train noise this is just not worth the hassle. The walk to the strip is not great either. Its a little seedy and the only thing I can say is that it is not like walking a few bloacks to the vegas strip from most other areas. I would love to share a suite with trump for the night to see how he likes the place. I dont buy the nonsense about different management companies running rooms etc.

Reviews.Title: “We truly had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: missyfoo2127
Reviews.Content: Yes I have read the reviews on here about the hotel. And yes I was worried after I booked it. So much so that when my husband and I were on our way to the hotel from the airport and had to stop because the infamous train was crossing I said to him " Oh crap there it is! It's really true!" Well we checked in anyways. We were given a room on the 50th floor facing the Wynn. It was absolutely gorgeous. The room was very clean, bathroom was amazing! The bed was great too. I am being absolutely honest when I say that I DID NOT hear any noise from the train, helicopters etc. NOT AT ALL! I guess the location of your room definitely has something to do with it. We actually went to sleep around midnight since my husband had a cold and was not feeling well on two of the nights that we were there. We even got an extended complimentary checkout (6pm) because our flight did not leave until 9 and I had mentioned to the girl at the front desk that he was ill. She was really nice and told us to stay a few extra hours so we wouldn't be uncomfortable at the airport. I was truly amazed by that. Oh, one thing I would like to also address is the whole walk to the strip being unsafe. We cut through the mall (Nordstrom is directly across the street) during the day. At night we would take a cab back to the hotel. One night while at the Wynn, we did walk back to the hotel and I agree it is not safe because of the lack of sidewalk. However, the hotel has a shuttle that runs until midnight that will take you to the strip and pick you up so you can also go that route if you don't wan't to walk. All in all, we had a great stay and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “The noise and location 'Trumped' other promising features of this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ymmitg
Reviews.Content: The noise and location 'Trumped' other promising features of this hotel My wife and I have been to Vegas 4 times and have stayed at approximately 6-7 different hotels during those trips. This was by far the worst experience of them all. We arrived, checked in and told the front desk it was our anniversary and mentioned that we were worried about what we had read on Trip Advisor regarding the train and helicopter noise. They put us on the 50th floor away from the train track and they told us that although they do get complaints regarding the noise, it's not that bad and we'd be in the best possible place to avoid the noise. So far so good. We went to our room and were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room. As described by other posts here it was very nice inside and had a kitchen, 2 bathrooms, etc. Two issues with the room was that 1) the safe didn't work and 2) there were 5-10 sticky hand prints on the windows as the windows had obviously not been cleaned. So far, we were still happy. We certainly don't expect perfection, the safe and windows can be fixed / cleaned and overall the room seemed nice. I issue started when we went to bed. The constant stream of helicopter fly bys and trains passing were VERY loud. I am hearing impaired and the train even woke me up at 4am. Now, If you are a person who can get woken up by a train in the middle of the night and go back to sleep, this is not a problem but this is not the case for my wife (and others who post on Trip Advisor). We made our first call to the front desk and we were told that they had a quitter room, but they would have to charge us $40 more a night for it. We asked the front desk how often the train goes by and were told "We don't have a train schedule". We called again much later to see if there was anything else they could do (i.e. move us to a different room) and we were told that it wouldn't help, we had the best possible room for sound. So at this point we've called twice, we've basically be told that there is nothing that can be done. We had a mostly sleepless night and decided to see what our other options were elsewhere. We left the hotel at 6:30am and as described on a lot of the other reviews on this site, the walk to the strip when the mall is closed is dirty, dangerous, and down right crummy. There are no side walks between the hotel and the strip and all the surrounding area is under construction. Once we got to the strip, we checked out a few other locations and got the Palazzo for about the same money we were paying at the Trump. As a side comment - we stayed at the Palazzo and while sitting in our room a helicopter flew by our window and we heard nothing. I'm not an engineer, but my guess is that the Palzzo just bought better sound proof glass. When we checked out from the Trump, the manager said he was sorry and then offered up the upgraded room for free (the one that the previous two people said they had to charge us for). It was pretty annoying that we had to say we were checking out early for them to actually address the issue we had. Very inconsistent messaging. Overall, I think the hotel was ok inside, but I don't understand how The Trump management can expect to run a "5 Star" hotel in that terrible location with all the noise and poor accessibility to the Strip. I read a bunch of reviews on Trip Advisor before I went and I thought "whatever, these complaints about the train noise and locations are just outliers written by complainers", but I was very wrong. When we were checking out another couple asked us why we were leaving for another hotel and we mentioned the train noise. The lady in the couple agreed that she had heard the noise and that it woke her up several times, but being woken up a few times a night was ok them. So I guess it comes down to whether you are a light sleeper or not, but I honestly don't think that this is something you should have to think about when you are paying for a 5 Star hotel in Vegas. There are just too many hotels that do it better for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: OnthemoveChicago
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed 3 luxurious nights at the Trump. Great price for a 5 star hotel, adequate location, and gorgeous room. We were impressed by the size of the room (it was more like an apartment with a kitchen, huge bathroom with Jacuzzi tub and big marble shower). It’s a non-smoking facility and relatively quit. You are far from the main part of the strip but within walking distance to the Wynn and Encore. The decor is very classy, with crystal chandeliers and huge bouquets of flowers in the lobby and staff at all levels is expertly trained to make you feel special but not overwhelmed. The fitness center is very nice, which looks out onto the swanky pool area with outdoor beds and chaises. There is a staff member available to help with any question about the machines and or exercises you may have. The biggest negatives: Be prepared to hear train horns at all hours and there is no shuttle or transportation to the strip except cabs. Also, there is no real nightlife in this hotel or a casino if that is important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Exceed all expectations - WOW (No Casino)”
Reviews.Author: ribmate
Reviews.Content: Valet service, If you are offered the upgrade for $50 a nite it will be the best $50 you'll spend - it was one of the best stays in Las Vegas, only down side was its off the strip and no casino. Its across the street from the largest shopping mall & Capital Grill

Reviews.Title: “Lux”
Reviews.Author: KwabenaB
Reviews.Content: It is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. I love it

Reviews.Title: “One in a million”
Reviews.Author: KinteW
Reviews.Content: The Spa alone is enough to get you to come back for more.

Reviews.Title: “Simply GREAT and comfortable... LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: MunterDam
Reviews.Content: I truly loved the Trump in Las Vegas. When we first came in to the lobby we could smell lilies, see crystals and chandeliers everywhere. When we reached the desk the Trump staff offerd us an uppgrade for 50 dollar per night and we are SO HAPPY that we accepteded it. We lived on the 55 floor with a great Strip view, worth every penny! We had two bathrooms, a great kichen, 3 tv:s, and a jauzzi. Because you must pay a resort fee you can access a heated pool even in winter time, a workout place and free SPA at the TRUMP. There is no casino in the TRUMP witch was very relaxing for us. Just across the street there is the fashion show mall with great shops and if you want to eat breakfast just go over to Wynn they have THE BEST BREAKFAST IN VEGAS, 20dollars for one person but it is worth it! The resort fee in TRUMP does not include the Internet witch is the only bad thing about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice from the outside and lobby, rooms were disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TravelReviewer30
Reviews.Content: We decided to try this hotel as it was a 5* suite and seemed good value for the price. The service in this place was TERRIBLE, the staff on the front desk in particular were very unhelpful, miserable and did not listen to what we were saying. The photos on the website are not true to the actual suites, I think the photos are of the corner suites that they try and sell you an upgrade to when you check-in. The rooms were standard, smaller than we expected and very plain, boring decor, no character to the room whatsoever. The kitchenette was tiny but did the job for breakfast although there was nothing to really cook with, we called house-keeping for a frying pan which they did bring us eventually. The bathroom was nice. Location is off the strip which was fine during the day as you can cut through the fashion mall which was very nice. The mall closes at 10pm so it is worth getting a taxi back after that to the hotel as it quite a long walk from the strip and the street the hotel is located on is not very well lit. For a 5* suite I would recommend the Signature over the Trump any day. We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OMG what luxory!”
Reviews.Author: T0mmie
Reviews.Content: We were able to book a room using one of the internetsite that get you to pay a bit less (...) and were thrilled to be able to stay here. Our expectations were not as great as the hotel and the room itself. It turned out to be so fantastic! maybe if you stay in places like these often, you might find it average, but we're just folks that value a decent and cleamn motelroom good enough. Upon arrival, a valet let us get our things with no hurry (have seen that different) and upon checkin we were given an upgrade because we celebrated our 25th honeymoon here. Now, we got a suite with strip view! Were we stunned to see this room! A separate livingroom with a complete kitchen, separate toilet and on to the bedroom. THE best bed we had this whole trip (and there's no complaints there) A bathroom with a second toilet, a jacuzu, a double shower, a mirror with a flatscreen TV in it. Would you believe that! We tried it all! There were bathrobes and large flatscreens in the Livingroom AND the bedroom. The pool area was great and we enjoyed a couple of hours in the sun. There's a great view on Treasure Island an the Palazzo and the Wynn. The walk to the strip is a bit further as the hotel location is off strip. But we're used to some walking as we are European. We found the gift shop awfully expensive but that was to be expected. (thought to buy a bathrobe as we liked it, But for $150 our money found a wiser destination) The elevator is something else. We never travelled from ground floor to the 37th floor in 8 seconds flat! We didn't get a chance to actually use the fitness room but after a look inside it looked great. The staff at the pool was very friendly. Did not need any other staff so no ratings there. There's no casino in this hotel so the only people inside are the ones that actually stay there. This adds to the atmosphere of a quite place. Not quiet with no guests (it was was pretty full) but because everything is so spatious you get the feel of ease.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT place to regroup and relax”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel101
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and my second trip to Vegas. The first time we stayed at Planet Hollywood. After that trip, I had to come home and take a few days off of work just to "return to normal" Most hotels along the strip have very loud and sensory overload areas all through the hotel. This trip we found the Trump on line and decided to book because of the "no Casino" lobby. We found perfection! We love to gamble and enjoy the shows, and after we are done for the day, we need to recoup. The ONLY downside is that it is about a 20 minute walk to the main areas, or a 7.00 cab fee...I will say, worth every penny! The great thing is this is a Trump property, so you know quality will be in the details. The bathrobes and two person tub are simply a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value great if you don't want a casino or smoking!”
Reviews.Author: nicolefrancien
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel-upgraded into an amazing suite. Everything was perfect and I love not having to go through a casino and I think it is non-smoking everywhere. The $20 resort fee is a little steep for two tiny bottles of water and valet parking. The kitchens are very nice although I can't imagine using one. If you happen to be in Vegas with small kids this could be nice although not exactly family friendly just mellow. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Accommodation Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: daoshaug
Reviews.Content: The Trump Hotel is well situated close to "The Strip" and therefore close to all of the action. We spent five nights there. The hotel is relatively new being some two years old and the quality of the rooms, fixtures and fittings reflects this. We had a standard room which was spacious, well-appointed and complete with all of the facilities one could want. The staff were courteous, efficient but somewhat perfunctory. The big disappointment was the restaurant. We had breakfast there on one occassion and compared to breakfasts we had in the Wynn´s hotel across "The Strip", which were superb value for money, it was expensive for what we got and the service was lacklustre. Overall, it was great value for accommodation and would recommend on that basis.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, poor service”
Reviews.Author: dae15228
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Trump are very spacious and comfortable. Unfortunately the service was the worst we have experienced in a long time. The logistics problem with the Valet and lack of self parking is obviously problematic. The service at the pool/spa is inexcusable. And don't expect any apologies from management or taking responsibility for blatant ignorance. The $15 "resort fee" seems like a pretty good deal until you actually use any of the amenities. We ended up cancelling our plans to stay at the spa and making reservations elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but with a few minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: Midskier
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights this past weekend (Sat - Tues) for our 20th anniversary and under similar conditions would stay here again as well as recommend this hotel to others. We booked the standard suite with city view as we expected to only sleep here, however, stayed in 3821, 1 bedroom suite. This hotel was selected for us by priceline.com, we selected our criteria and named our price, Trump was the winner. I'd do it this way again and be fine if Trump was selected again. so here goes.... The not so good - in no particular order The basically unprotected 600' walk to Las Vegas Blvd. The up sell @ check in $50 more per night for next bigger room, same view. didn't appreciate it. After check in we recvd our keycards and went up to our room, gorgeous but obviously not ready , all the couch cushions and chair cushion were strewn about, very strange. a quick call to the front desk and 10 minutes later they arrived with new keycards for a corner room on the same floor. Still city view..... but again we just expected to sleep here, a few minor flaws with this room all item were reported to the front desk the following morning, 2 items corrected promptly, 2 items not corrected during our stay. 1. the toilet seat in the main bath was loose, corrected, no shampoo in the master shower, found out while taking a shower... housekeeping apologized and brought a tray of shampoo, conditioner, lotion, body wash, mouth wash. 2 items not corrected during our stay, the "in the mirror" TV did not work and the hot and cold reversed @ the sink near the shower in master bath, ever brush your teeth with hot water? (room 3821) train noise, I heard 1 train 2 of three nights, my wife heard -0-, I heard one police siren once,(WOW) like it's Trumps fault you hear a siren the valet @ times seemed overwhelmed, I guess the room or resort fee covered valet parking......... we flew in and took a taxi to the Hotel no car, perfect, we didn't need a car and the guests driving the cars seemed to be the problem, not knowing where to go or trying to maneuver as close to the front door as possible........why? The taxi drivers had plenty to say about the (guest) drivers most with cali plates Those minor annoyances out of the way on to the good: the room was spectacular, clean, fresh, great sleeping bed, great pillows we enjoyed using the fresh and heavy weight robes full size fridge for our 4 water bottles.......... full kitchen........wish we could have used it the pool area was fantastic the elevators are very fast the staff was extremely friendly and always smiling we were addressed by name several times lobby had a clean fresh smell we are non smokers and never ever detected any cigarette smoke no casino, no slot machine dinging (this is a plus to us) both bathrooms were very generous the master bathroom was huge, well appointed all our towels were clean bright white and fluffy auto light up closets were also a nice touch the heating and air conditioning were easy to set to a comfortable temp newspaper every morning doorman opened the front door for us each time with a big smile Trump can be easily seen from the south strip it lines right up with it ......... and that my friends is most likely why it's 600' off of LV Blvd Large and very comfortable room @ a very inviting price. We very much enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING ESTABLISMENT...read other reviews with a grain of salt!”
Reviews.Author: 112sunshine
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I were looking for a hotel to stay at during Valentines Day Weekend we decided on the Trump by just reading a few comments. However, having just come back it is absolutely ABSURD what some people complain about. Heres what I can say about some of the comments and my experience. The train: Give me a break! Really… people saying they lost sleep over it is ridiculous. I think I can remember hearing it about 2 times at most at night, and we were on the 24th floor. Didn't bother me at all. Beds: The beds were extremely comfortable, as it has a down feather mattress pad, and down feather pillows with comfy sheets. Bathroom: The spa tub with jets and separate shower were GREAT added ammenities, not to mention the tv in the bathroom mirror. Its also comical to read how people complain about build up on the shower head. I didn't have my magnifying glass to inspect mine but my shower was great with plenty of hot water! In regards to slippery floors….they do provide not 1 but TWO towels mats of sufficient size to put on the floor for when you step out of the shower, so you don’t slip. Pool: I was pleased to find that the pool was heated given the 60 degree weather. The service at the pool was also very good. They greet you as you walk in and guide you to a chair or what I would say is a love seat for two, and lay out your towels for you. Valet: So, yes this hotel does not have self parking but the complimentary valet was a great and convenient added bonus. My husband and I never had to wait more than 5 minutes to drop off our car, as the staff all worked very hard to meet everyones’ needs. At times when people were waiting to pick up their cars, management went out of their way to bring people water while they waited. I don’t think having to wait a few minutes is that big of a deal, or having to tip a few dollars is also that big of a deal. However, a suggestion I would have is just in case you are leaving during a high peak time (dinner reservations, or to catch a show) give yourself a few minutes extra to allow yourself time to get your car. Perhaps if traveling with a group the one who is ready first can go down a few minutes earlier to give the valet the ticket. In regards to walking to the mall, you just have to use caution when crossing the street like anywhere else. Resort fee: Yes, there is a resort fee of $15.00/day….but many of the hotels in Vegas also have a resort fee. With that said I think the Trump Hotel is a fabulous establishment, with incredible customer service, beautiful rooms and bathroom. I loved the fact that there is no casino and no smoking. This would be a great place for expectant mothers looking to go to Vegas without having to be around all of the smoke. Readers take everything with a grain of salt. I feel that too many people are a little too anxious to post any slight negative feedback they encounter. The Trump Hotel like any other hotel or establishment is not perfect, and things are bound to go wrong from time to time, but I don’t feel that people should hold those things against a truly great establishment. Hands down my husband and I will definitely be staying at this hotel upon our return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great property---a couple of problems”
Reviews.Author: ZZZ01
Reviews.Content: Rooms were huge, very private and comfortable. Good value and service for the money. The two problems were 1. Freight trains coming through day and night, the noise very annoying so close to the property and 2. Awkward access to and from the Strip. Sidewalks are either not fully paved or blocked with construction fences. Street is difficult to cross especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Trump Experience”
Reviews.Author: Norwegian45
Reviews.Content: Just spent Valentine weekend at the Trump in Las Vegas. Having read the many comments on tripadvisor regarding the railroad noise at night, upon check-in I requested a room facing the strip as high as possible. This request was granted without question. Our room was fantastic, hotel staff was great, outgoing seemed happy to serve. The negatives, I felt like I was ripped off just going to the lobby to buy two danish and two coffees for almost $20.00. I suggest they get a Starbucks in the hotel. The guests would be very happy. The location is really not that bad, just a few minutes off the strip, but until further development on the vacant Frontier casino property, getting to the strip is a little rough. Sidewalks on one side end prior to the strip, crossing the street is a little tough since there is no crosswalk. Crossing the street just to get to the Las Vegas shopping mall is hard, again no crosswalk. Overall a very nice place and no smoke odor to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Not to the level you would expect from Trump”
Reviews.Author: jeffsgirl5222
Reviews.Content: We spent our anniversary weekend at Trump in Las Vegas. I really did not expect that I would have to write this review. Upon entering the hotel, it smelled fresh and clean, unlike that of the Casino/Hotels.....but that experience was short-lived. As we entered our room, the stench of stale musty smoke odor was clearly noticable which was a surprise given the "Non-smoking" environment with fees of $250 to anyone who does smoke. The room smelled like an old Motel 6 room. Yuck!! And the worst part? I unpacked my clothes when I got home and they wreak even worse than I thought!! The showerhead was a cheap shower head with lime deposits on it. We didn't find the bed to be as comfortable as we have experienced in other hotels. And when we did get in bed, we would only be asleep a few hours when we would hear the train, every couple of hours. The doors to the shower and commode were difficult and a bit scary to maneuver...always had to make sure it didn't slam closed. The safe jammed and we had to have someone called up to release it so we could use our computer. Everytime we went out, our key cards would demagnatize which we would not find out until we got to our room, in which case we would have to go back to the lobby and have them re-keyed. The explanation was that their keys do that when you put them near other credit cards, cell phones, etc....Every hotel I have stayed in has these key cards and we have never had this problem before. I did address this with the manager the second night we were there and she blamed the key situation on us since we shouldn't put it near our credit cards, etc....and "it happens". Secondly she just suggested that they send someone up to ionize our room for us. She did give us our resort fees back which was a total of $30. I have been in the service industry for many years. If my customers were as unhappy as I was, I would have been tripping all over myself to fix their view of my establishment. I hardly think $30 is tripping over herself. I was very disappointed and will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “NOISY AND DIRTY!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: poa889
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff made me feel like I was lying. I booked a trip through Travelocity which included a $50 credit for the spa and a 4pm check out. However, I had to prove it in writing to the clerk. Secondly, the city view suite was awful. All I heard all night was the freight train going by. The showerhead had some filthy white stuff on it. Overall experience was awful.

Reviews.Title: “The Truth about the Trump”
Reviews.Author: gcameron
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Trump and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. There is no doubt that this hotel targets a certain clientele. Some of the issues people complain about are SO ridiculous. The Trump is an all suites hotel, very much the same as the Signature Suites. So yes folks, like the Signature, Trump does not have a minibar. Do you honestly enjoy paying three times the amount for your beer and gin? Instead, you have a refrigerator that you are free to stock with your own food and beverage. I did find the dishes and cooking utensils a bit lacking, but I am not looking to make any big meals. It was just fine for cheese and crackers we enjoyed. There is no casino at this hotel. Well, duh!! Trump does not advertise a casino, and given the Donald is trying to sell his gambling properties in Atlantic City, why would you assume he wanted a gambling property in Vegas. And here is a news flash for all gamblers: you may want to stay clear of Aria, Vdara, Veer, and the Mandarin Oriental, as they are all not gaming. Since about 2007, the major corporations that own the strip properties, have generated more revenues from their non-gambling activities than from gambling. Do some basic research people. The walk from Trump to the strip is scary?! Are you freaking kidding me?! I agree it is poorly lit for a night walk, but simply assuming vehicles do not see you will keep you safe. There is lots of cars and foot traffic. We never felt frightened. In the daytime, we crossed the street and entered the mall and made the "long" three minute walk to Las Vegas Blvd in air-conditioned comfort. It is no different than walking along Harmon Ave if you are staying at the Signature Suites. Come on folks, a short walk can only help after you have come from the buffet. Train noise. No doubt about it, you do hear trains. They just did not keep me from my sleep. Its not like there is a train every hour, maybe a couple overnight--or else I just slept through them. The staff is among the friendliest we have encountered in Vegas. And DJT (restaurant) is an outstanding value. The prix fixe menu is a three course for $29. People, stop complaining about having to tip the valet guy a couple of dollars for parking. Are you kidding me?! Have you ever stayed at a hotel in NYC or San Francisco and had to pay the daily parking rate? Everytime you drop the valet guy two bucks, pretend you won $30 that covered your parking. If you spend 14 hours a day at the tables on your trips to Vegas, this is NOT the hotel for you. You should be getting your room comped! If you are looking for a beautiful hotel that offers you a quiet retreat after a day on the strip, this IS the place for you. As long as the rates at the Trump stay reasonable, we will consider this a top choice for our vegas visits.

Reviews.Title: “amazing!”
Reviews.Author: SabineF2
Reviews.Content: this hotel is really worth every penny and you get treated like a VIP:)the rooms are very big and the bathroom is incredible!really loved it and gonna go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A vacation of luxury and comfort!!!”
Reviews.Author: mediumbob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent three nights at the Trump Tower and were more than satisfied with our experience. From the freindly, helpful staff (Janet- @ the Front Desk, Lamont- Great Doorman, Matt- The Entertaining Chauffeur and many others), they helped us feel comfortable and relaxed under Mr. Trumps roof. What a great escape from the stink of cigerettes and noise of the casinos. When arriving from a day or night of fun you are always greeted by a happy doorman, after your car was whisked away by the attentive valet parking stafft. The lobby is beautiful, tasteful and has a scent that is a cross between the mountains and a fresh sea breeze. Our room was large and well appointed with lit closets (2), plenty of storage, and high quality fixtures. It was a great place to entertain friends and family with the cooktop, microwave and refrigerator, of the best name brands. The bathroom facilities were outstanding, especially the deep, and powerful whirlpool tub! The decorater should be complimented for the use of materials and colors, very relaxing and upscale. A very comfortable bed and plenty of furniture complete a great home away from home I close by saying , if you are looking for a different way to do Las Vegas, with an opportunity to escape the crowds and smell of the casinos (I love 'em, But!!!) then try the Trump Tower for your next stay. Bonus, it is right across the street from the Fashion Show Mall where you can purchase anything you might need for your stay.( Including alcohol, cigars, and snacks!!!!) Have fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: bruin4life93
Reviews.Content: My wife and I made a special trip to Las Vegas for good times with friends and to take in a show. Upon arrival around midnight at the hotel, we asked if we would like to upgrade from a standard room to a roomier corner suite with view of the Strip. We don't usually opt for an upgrade of this type but decided to treat ourselves. We arrived at our "uprgrade" to find that the suite had never been serviced and was littered with trash, dirty towels, and used room service items. A quick call to the Front Desk brought a promise that someone would come up to quickly meet us with new key cards and move us to our new room. The minutes ticked by as we sat in this unkept room, and I finally called down to the Front Desk again. After 20 minutes (now 12:30 am!) the Front Desk Manager met us, apologized, and moved us to our new room. He offered to comp the first night's upgrade, which was honestly the least he could do in the circumstances. Having worked in travel industry for 15 years, I would have comped the entire upgrade given the situation. Of course, the new room didn't have the view we had been promised when paying for the upgrade and in fact was fully exposed to the horrific train noise you will read about in multiple reviews. This despite the fact that we were on the 47th Floor! NOTES: The shower in the master bath did not drain property and ensured that your feet enjoyed a dirty water and soap scum frappe during and well after your shower. The large glass doors used to enter the toliet and to a lesser extent the shower are not unwieldy, but downright dangerous. This is especially the case when you are trying to step up or down entering or leaving the shower with wet feet. Lawsuits waiting to happen...or perhaps already happened? There is no minibar in the units. The full kitchen is not well stocked with glassware and plates. The well-heated pool and fitness center were quite nice. We found the doormen, valets, housekeeping, and room service service staff around the property to be friendly and helpful. In the end, while we would like to give a lukewarm recommendation, there are just too many other solid establishments in Las Vegas for a traveller to roll the dice on the Trump.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again, there are better options.”
Reviews.Author: maxabeam
Reviews.Content: CONS: OK the $15 charge did not come to a surprise to me, many other hotels have the same charge. What surprised me is that it does NOT include internet. Internet is $12 a day (Per laptop). I have been in Las Vegas a few time before and I had NEVER paid for the internet. Other hotels included in the "service fee". This hotel is NOT on the strip, the walk is not that bad specially if you go through the mall, but at night time is quite unpleasant, if you are here just for a conference or a expo the hotel is fine, but if you are here for pleasure, stay somewhere else. There is no self parking, which means tips every time you want your car. I was at the 56th floor and I could still hear the trains..... want a better view? Costs more. PROS: The rooms were nice, had a small kitchen with microwave, stove, fridge all worked nice and were a nice surprise. The rooms were very nice, very clean, no stains anywhere. Like many other have said, the bathroom is amazing, TV on the mirror, huge bathtub, huge shower, very nice. The bed was nice very comfortable, And something I really like is the smoke free environment. Overall: The hotel it self is good, but the service fee without internet is a JOKE. Like others said LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like A King”
Reviews.Author: adywiltshire
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I enjoyed an absolutely wonderful bank holiday weekend experience here. From the initial contact with house front valet parking to the friendly doorman, to the efficient check in staff, we received 5* treatment. Welcoming friendly faces followed by a genuine how can I help, nothing would be too much trouble attitiude. I stayed on the 55th floor with a strip facing view. I was able to sit in my whirlpool bath and watch the LV neon light show begin, while watching the mirror inlayed TV. My room was expansive with fine attention to every detail in decoration. The room was immaculately clean with luxurious bedding. I've stayed in LV casino hotels before, but really enjoyed the fact we were sufficiently removed from the gambling draw to relax, but close enough to visit when the time came. As mentioned previously, the shopping mall opposite to the hotel is the best way to get on to the strip. I will definitely be returning this summer with my family to relive the experience again. Many thanks to all who made our stay a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: silverback1007
Reviews.Content: We stayed several nights for business. After upgrading our room after the first night, we were offered an upgrade and were misled as far as the cost of the upgrade. We questioned the cost of the upgrade as the TOTAL price and not IN ADDITION to the room rate at which we had already booked. We were assured that the upgrade total cost was $300/night ($350 on weekend). When we got our bill after the business trip, we found out we were charged $300 to $350/night EXTRA to the room rate we had already booked. As the saying goes, "Buyer beware -- and always double and triple check." Everything else with the property is above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel once you have arrived”
Reviews.Author: denbury
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night at the Trump in Las Vegas last week. I give it top marks in most departments except one over which it may not have full control but which has an impact on the hotel experience. The lobby is light, and spectacularly illuminated; staff were welcoming; the room was magnificent with hot drink making equipment and supplies; and the hotel restaurant very acceptable for breakfast. We particularly liked the small vestibule between each pair of rooms and the corridor. It made for very limited noise transmission from other guests. And on top of that the promotional rate we were given was very attractive. So what's the beef? Simply put, there is no proper pedestrian connection between the hotel and the Strip. On foot, guests are forced to walk around traffic barriers and on the access route to the hotel. Street lighting is also not adequate. The possibility of an automobile/pedestrian collision is higher than it should be for a facility of this quality.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet, elegant hotel a short cab ride from anything.”
Reviews.Author: lazicn
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a one bedroom suite at Trump Las Vegas during CES 2010. THE GOOD: - extremely short walk from hotel entrance to room, especially enjoyed not having to travese a casino first - outstanding service from the front desk, in-room dining, housekeeping and bell staff...I needed a screwdriver for some equipment that I brought to the room and a maintenance team member was in my room in two minutes - tastefully elegant room with a full kitchen - best bed I've ever slept on - amazing bathroom (itself as large as many hotel rooms I've stayed in); enjoyed the TV that was embedded within the mirror - never waited more than two minutes for a taxi..even at the height of CES - reasonable rate given the overall quality hotel and time of year THE BAD - train noise...I was on the 35th floor in the SW corner and was frequently disturbed - internet access was extremely and consistently slow throughout my stay - cellular coverage on AT&T and Sprint was next to nothing unless you were within 2ft of the window - no on-site food options other than expensive DJT and in-suite dining; Fashion Show Mall provided some options but nothing at the hotel itself - only in comparison to hother LV strip hotels, there was really nothing to do...but with taxis in abundant supply this shouldn't constrain your decision to stay here If you're coming to Vegas for a bachelor party or similar event...not sure this is the hotel for you. For a getaway vacation, business trip or a honeymoon I think this hotel offers excellent accomodations at a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monica983772
Reviews.Content: We got a really great deal for a suite at the Trump Hotel in Las Vegas. The suite was beautiful with a great view. The hotel is very elegant and modern. There are not many hotels without a casino in Las Vegas where you can get a little peace and quiet and at the same time be very close to the strip. If you are looking for such a hotel, this is a perfect choice. The hotel is only a 2 minute walk from the strip, and the Fashion mall is just across the street. Also the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Caprichick16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an oasis. I loved the location away from the hustle and bustle, Upon arrival we were greeted by the doorman, a nice touch, and whisked through check-in without any hitches. We upgraded to a corner suite on the 29th floor which was totally worth it. The views were amazing, on one side the Strip and on the other the mountains. The bathroom was totally luxurious and spotless, from the extra large jacuzzi tub to the glass stalled shower. My only gripe would be the internet charges. At $11.99 per 24hr period I think this is absurd, especially when the majority of hotels do not charge for this. My husband and I both had our laptops (work purposes) and for a 2 night stay we ended up paying around $50 for the internet as they charge PER LAPTOP!!!!! We had one dinner in the restaurant, DJT, and whilst I found my meal unsatisfactory, my husband actually enjoyed his. I chose chicken which was so dry it was reminiscent of wood. However, our hostess, Bethany, was quick to resolve the problem and indeed offered me an alternative entree without making me feel as if I was a problem. She was magnificent. Whilst chatting with her me and my husband found her to be efficient, courteous and brimming over with information about the Trump brand. Don't get me wrong she was not selling the brand, my husband was just asking general questions and she knew her stuff...... we were impressed, good for her! We loved our stay at the Trump, we visit Vegas at least twice a year for business/pleasure and we would definitely stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at an affordable price! Amazing value!”
Reviews.Author: T-Ruckus
Reviews.Content: Brought the wifey here for a surprise trip in August. She is very particular and likes to be pampered in a very clean and luxurious environment. This place was just right for what I was looking for. Property: No casino. It is what it is. If you want one, you can go to one. If you must have one in your hotel, well then, stay elsewhere. Didn't try any of the restaurants. Prices at the spa are obscene, even with our included spa credit, unfathomable. The gym was somewhat small, but decent...didn't use it. The pool was alright, rooftop style about half way up the building, but it was only about 4 feet at its deepest point. DJ kinda sucked, but it was def the club/party type scene with beautiful people getting good and toasty. Room: OMG, this is what it's about. You get a fridge, microwave, ipod dock, and best of all a hot tub! Fit both of us, I am big, she is not. The in mirror TV was alright, but hard to see from the tub. The bed was amazing comfy and the robes almost came home with us. They do this private entrance thing with a foyer for two adjacent rooms. It was pretty cool and probably reduced some hall noise. So clean, elegant, and perfect! Service: Well you pay $15/day for it, so I guess it was pretty good. We didn't have any problems, so I guess that is cool. There is only a valet option, so I guess it all balances out with the complimentary valet service. They did bring out free shots for the people at the pool though and it seemed like everyone got them except for us. They just kept skipping around us. Location: Well, its a bit off the strip. There is not much immediately by there. The Wynn is down the street as well as the mall with some decent looking restaurants. There are some liquor stores and pharmacies a few VERY long blocks away, but nothing too close. Although it was easy enough to just drive down to the casinos, park for free and walk around, it was kind of a pain to deal with traffic and parking every time we wanted to go somewhere and there is not much at the hotel itself. If you are drinking, you will have to take a lot of very expensive cabs around because there is not much to do there. Value: This place was perfect for us and really served our purposes. Considering its a 5 star, we got a ridiculous deal online for just about $79/night. When you factor in the $15/day though, it could be less of a good deal at times. The rooms were just too good to be true though. I absolutely would stay at this place again, especially if I could get it for less than $100/night before the resort fee. Definitely worth the driving for the luxury you receive in return.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury without the smoke and casino.”
Reviews.Author: peclipse
Reviews.Content: Luxury hotel located just off the strip, free of smoke and casino environment, making it a great get away from traditional Las Vegas activities. Front desk staff is friendly and will offer an up sale to a different view or larger room. Upon locating the room, you will see two room numbers located on a pad beside the door; this pad also has a light system for housekeeping and a doorbell for your room. Once you open the door you enter into a foyer with two more doors that go to the individual rooms. The standard room is a good size with a bed, desk and chair, and a seating area with a sofa, two chairs, coffee table, and side table with a lamp. The built wall unit includes a double closet; this is great if you are sharing the room with someone else. The kitchen area has a Sub-Zero undercounter refrigerator, a Wolf cook top with two heating elements, a sink, a built-in convection oven, coffee maker, toaster, and Le Creuset tea kettle. The floor the ceiling window offers a great view. The bathroom is roomy. The vanity sink area has double sinks along with storage areas for your personal items. The main mirror in the bathroom has a small television in it. The shower and toilet are behind a glass partition, each having their own door. The bathtub is jetted and large enough for two. No self parking is available, valet only. All the staff I encountered was friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you dont smoke and dont gamble”
Reviews.Author: Milepost2012
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Trump Hotel because we wanted to avoid the crowds and the hustle bustle of the casinos. It was nice to stay at a quiet hotel, smoke free premises, well located near the strip but not so close as to be disrupted by the noise and heavy traffic, just across the street from the Fashion Show Mall. You are in Vegas , easy distance from the casinos and shows yet having a peaceful haven to come to when you are tired. We got a room with a view of the city which was very nice. Staff at the hotel very attentive to our needs, the room was spacious and had a small kitchen which is nice if you want to prepare your own food for a change, specially breakfast. Bathroom is huge with two sinks! Bed and bed linen were fantastic too. In short, we have had a nice stay, all went well and we plan on coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: lotsobiztravel
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my husband for business, and had some fun too. Trump is NON SMOKING and has no casino. LOVED IT! It was nice to walk into a Vegas Hotel and have it not smell like smoke & have machines blaring everywhere. The room service was amazing and the room itself was absolutely perfect. The biggest bathtub I have ever seen. If you are traveling to Vegas and don't smoke and aren't crazy about gambling......and want a quiet hotel close to the strip, this is your place. It is right across the street from the mall too. We will def be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: chris2222
Reviews.Content: Absolutely awesome hotel. Everything was top notch. Excellent rooms (with a great double tub that easily fits 2), great service, nice restaurant, and very trendy pool area. If you are OK with staying in a hotel with no casino, I would recommend the Trump anyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Years Eve Stay”
Reviews.Author: harleybonz
Reviews.Content: This condo hotel should be in the top 10 of Las Vegas.We have been to Vegas about 7 times and this condo hotel is great.The room is nice and new and beautiful inside and out.The hotel staff will do what ever possible to make your stay nice.We were there for New Years Eve and it is in a great spot for that.It's a short easy and safe walk to the strip,right across from the Wynn.The mall is right there also which is nice.Vonns grocery is about 2 to 3 miles away which is nice because you have a kitchen.How many hotels will let you stay in your room if you have a late flight?We are going back.Get a strip view,it's probably more quiet,the mountain or city view has a train that passes close by and blows his whistle a couple of times,but it really didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “not worth it - there are much better choices”
Reviews.Author: marieatta_pman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice - although i dont know that it rates 5 stars like it recieved on priceline. I dont usually stay at that level of hotel so i am not sure about the usual standards. This is a mixed hotel/condo property and the rooms are all very large and have the kitchen in them. there was a nice restaraunt on site, but i did not eat there. The bad- location -location-location (for me anyway) it is quite removed from teh strip - almost a lie to call it a strip hotel. I had a great view of the porn shops and strip clubs on industrial blvd from my window. almost nothing else close by at night, but for daytime, right across from the fashion show mall. it was a bit of walk to nearest casino (wynne) and quite a walk to next nearest casino. If you want to be removed from the stip - this would be a good choice, but there are other choices out there that may be nicer or more affordable THe worst - the RESORT fee that is mandatory. i dont remeber exactly how much but it was over 10$. i personally did not use any of the services, but did walk through the spa and pool area - not impressive for the money, especially since you had to pay for it, i have seen much better for free at other locations. the only real plus to this location - they give exceptionally late checkout - 4 pm, great for those late flights.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: RichmondCA
Reviews.Content: We were at the Trump LV from Jan 2-4. We booked by naming our price on Priceline.com and ended up with this hotel. At first, I wasn't happy with what I got due to its "off-strip" location...but then, I knew when I use Priceline, you get what you get, so can't really complain. When we arrived at the hotel, the doormen greeted us -- nice touch, reminscent of the 5* service I have gotten in Asian luxury hotels. The lobby is beautiful, sparkling and smells really nice. I think they pump in some really nice scent through the lobby. Check-in was a breeze. I signed some form acknowledging the $15 resort fee. Priceline hadn't included this detail during the booking; but luckily, the TA reviews had clued me in to the $15. We got a city view room on the 53rd floor, as I had asked during check-in for a room where I could not really hear the train noise. Front desk informed me I'd have to upgrade (meaning, pay extra) to face strip view or give me a higher up floor. I took the latter, which didn't really eliminate the train noise but it was less loud (I heard it in the middle of the night, but my husband didn't). The room was beautiful and well furnished. The small kitchenette had top-end appliances (Wolff, Bosch) and small appliances (Cuisinart), and even the kettle was a Le Creuset. The bed was most comfy with a nice duvet. The bathroom was luxurious with a giant jacuzzi tub, huge shower stall, and lots of marble. Nice towels and a good supply of it. Housekeeping was good at clean-up. We had no issues. During the course of our stay, I have only a few complaints: 1. On our first morning, we had to have a cold shower. That was brutal. When we mentioned the cold shower morning at check-out, they acknowledged that they did have a problem that morning with the water and we weren't the only ones to complain. 2. The location. It is off the strip, though you can easily walk the long block to get to the strip, or go through Nordstrom's at the Fashion Show Mall (only during opening hours though). My husband and I didn't have a problem with the walk as we are healthy and typically walk a lot to wherever we like to go. But this may be a problem for those who have mobility issues. The location is also a problem if we wanted to get to the Bellagio or Caesars fast. That would've taken us about 30-45 min. 3. Not great dining choices at Trump LV. Only one restaurant that looked overly pricey and not quite casual enough. Wished there could be more choices. 4. The train noise for light sleepers (like me). Though my husband didn't hear it at all. I suggest a high floor, as high as you can get. 5. The daily resort fee. I don't like this hidden fee. Why don't the hotels build it into the nightly room rate? 6. The low-end bathroom soaps. I was surprised at the poor quality. It really dried out my skin, and made it red and itchy. And I don't even have sensitive skin. If you do have sensitive skin, make sure you bring your own soap. What we really liked: 1. The nice smelling lobby we came back to in the evenings. Coming from Canada where smoking is banned indoors and a required distance from the outside entrances, we found the smoking smell to be overwhelming in the casinos. It was nice to come back to a smoke-free zone. 2. The fitness room. Very nice atmosphere to work out in. Great equipment. 3. The service. Really friendly and attentive. 4. The 4pm late check-out, with no extra fees. Nice touch. 5. The beautiful room. It was in top condition, no worn out couches or carpet tears or poor quality linens/towels. It was all good. 6. The Wolfgang Puck coffee packs in the room. 7. The bed. We had some nice sleeps. 8. The security. There was guy who would check our room keys before we could hop onto an elevator to go to our room. I loved this place and would stay there again should the rate be as low again. You get a lot of luxury for what you are paying.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel if you don't need to Gamble”
Reviews.Author: Steve_NG_HK
Reviews.Content: No casinos - Great for those who don't need to Gamble and don't want to be annoyed by huge crowds in the lobby or elsewhere near the Hotel ! Great customer services offered in the Lobby area to assist you when needed. Suite offered is fully equipped with suitable kitchen wares and equipment for food reheat and snacks preparation. Nearest to the Fashion Show Mall for Shopping and simple Food intake.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fabulous, just the right size!”
Reviews.Author: msshortee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trump from December 31 through January 3. I was able to secure a great deal on the room through Priceline, and was extremely satisfied considering other lesser-quality hotels on the strip were charging double the amount of money for NYE in Las Vegas. Priceline makes no mention on their website about the $15 per day resort fee, but I already knew to expect it based on feedback here as well as the Trump website. Checking in was a breeze and we even got "Happy New Year" hats at the front desk. The entire staff was courteous during my stay, and the doormen were especially polite. Our room was on the 22nd floor offering a city view as opposed to the strip view...not too impressive but I was fine with it (the whole idea is to be on the strip, not watching it from your window). The room was immaculate and the bathroom was--as others have noted--absolutely amazing. I do wish, however, that the television in the bathroom had a guide, since the channels aren't the same as the television in the room. The bed was extremely comfortable and the kitchen was an excellent touch, though I must admit we did not use the appliances. All in all, the Trump is an amazing hotel, especially for those who want a quiet place to return to after those long Vegas nights. It is a bit of walking from the central strip (Bellagio, Caesars, etc) but it's a short cab ride and it was worth staying there as opposed to the Venetian which wanted $1400 for our trip dates.

Reviews.Title: “Trump - You're Fired!”
Reviews.Author: CoronaBoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in Dember 2009 and I would not stay at this hotel again for the following reasons: 1. No self parking. Valet parking only which is free but still need to tip everytime. 2. Mandatory $15/day resort fee! Are you kidding me? It was freezing (frost) cold and the hotel does not have a resort. If they call their little pool a resort then they are out of their mind. This was even more annoying as I had pre-paid for my hotel room in advance through 3rd party company and the charge was suprise. 3. THIS HOTEL IS NOT (LET ME REPEAT, IS NOT) on the Las Vagas Strip. You have to walk through a dark street (at night with no lights)with no sidewalk for a block and then you get to the Las Vagas BLVD. The walk is dangerous at night and you can get hit by cars and oncoming cabs. The hotel is located beside an empty construction land which is not at all pretty. 4. Additional charges for room with view of BLVD. 5. No rooms with 2 beds. I was given a room with a queen size and sofa bed. I would have had a better nights sleep at the a local motel. Upon opening the sofa bed, I found old shopping receipts in the bed indicating that the sofa bed had not been cleaned after the last guest left YUK. 6. This hotel has NO CASINO.
