In any event, once you added on the resort fee, the price was not outstanding. The front desk 'upgraded' us to a room with a view of the Strip. Our room was on the 51st floor. We had the impression that the hotel was largely unoccupied during our stay, and felt that the hotel must be losing money and trying to conserve a bit. As noted by another recent poster, the concierge was lacking. We called down to inquire about free roulette and craps lessons (they are at the Venetian at 11 for craps, followed by 12 for roulette). The concierge said she would call us back; she never did. The room itself is lovely. I was happy with the bed; my sleeping partner felt it was too soft. There was no option of queen beds in the rooms - each room has a king bed with a pull out sofa. The nicely-decorated rooms have a ton of storage space, two large closets (with two nice fluffy robes) in-drawer safe, ironing board w iron, lint brush, extra blanket, coffee maker (with only caf coffee - the nearest coffee shop is about a 10 minute walk), blender, microwave, fridge, range, kitchen sink, wine opener, utensils, dishes, etc. It would be a great place to make lunches/breakfasts, if only we could have found a grocery store in Las Vegas. :) Ice is available on every floor. The bathroom is very nice. Shampoo, conditioner, lotion, 2 bars soap, shower cap provided. No shower gel, no sewing kit. When I needed a sewing kit, housekeeping took about 45 minutes to bring it to the room. The shower is lovely and large. The toilet is in its own room. 2 sinks on the vanity, and lots of storage. Ample towels. I did peek into the business center. They charge for internet service - by 15 minute increments. And there is a charge to print documents, except your boarding pass. The pool area is lovely. We enjoyed the large double-lounge sofa chairs. The pool closed at 6p, however. We wondered whether this was part of a "conservation" effort to reduce costs. Other reviewers have noted an issue with the location of the hotel - about 5 minutes off the Strip. 5 minutes is a long walk on high heels. :) Yes, you can cross the street and cut through Nordstrom into the Fashion Mall and then figure your way out and over to Treasure Island, but it is certainly not a convenient location. If you want quiet, then you might enjoy the hotel. For us, it was not convenient. Also, when one of us wanted to rest or sleep, the other had to go back to the room - there was no option of remaining downstairs to game. Walking alone in the middle of the night past the empty lot does not feel secure. Moreover, there are not sidewalks on the entire walk to the Strip - at times you must walk in the road. We did not use room service, the restaurants, or the bar, so I can't comment. You might enjoy this hotel if you are looking for a lovely non-smoking hotel without a casino, with okay service, that is a short heavily-trafficked walk off the strip. For us, it didn't fit.

Reviews.Title: “Read before you stay here!”
Reviews.Author: SAYMBA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel twice a year to Vega and usually stay at the Wynn, Encore, Palazzo or Venetian. This time we decided to try out the Trump. While the hotel is very clean, modern and priced right the hotel's location is very poor. First the pros: Clean Nice rooms Food is decent Beautiful bathrooms Cons: Location Resort Fee Train NOISE starting at 3:30am I had read some of the reviews regarding the train noise so when I made the reservation I informed the agent of my concern and he assured me he would reserve a quiet room for us. If what we got was a quiet room I am afraid to know what a regular room is like. At 3:30am, 4:30, 5:30, 6:30 (you get the point) Sunday, Monday and Tuesday mornings the very LOUD train noise sounded like it was next door. We were on the 36 floor facing the Wynn hotel which is what they qualify as their quiet room. I went to the front desk and complained only to have the very nice lady explain to me that she couldn't do anything else because I was already in a quiet room. She went on to mention that this is a known problem and they are working with the city to see if they could get the train to stop blowing the horn when it passes literally on the side of their hotel. Now I knew why they were so accommodating and lowered the price to $89 when I made the reservation. While we were given a rate of $139 on Saturday and $89 on the other days once you add up all the dumb fees they tack on you are better off staying on the strip for $129 - $140 per night. They tag on a $15 resort fee to use their pool, spa and two 4oz waters they provide nightly. Now they tax you on the resort fee and the room rate (two different line items on your bill) just not worth it. One last thing to consider. The hotel is off the strip not a huge deal because the walk is not too far. However, at night the street that you must walk through to get to the hotel is very, very dark and the sidewalk is not paved so if you are not wearing sneakers you are in trouble. Most importantly, it is not a safe street. You have cabs, cars, and shuttles flying by especially at night and since no lighting exists you can easily get hit by a car. One night when we were walking back to the hotel we saw a couple nearly get hit by a shuttle. It was very scary because no one even saw the shuttle coming. They drive like maniacs on this street.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel- first class. Plus no gambling- what's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: Phins_Up_Quincy
Reviews.Content: A very elegant 5 star hotel, with absolute first class amenities and service. The rooms are quite beyond description, and the bed absolutely the most comfortable I've ever slept on. Everyone in our group just loved this place. Great location 1 block off the strip, a block away from Wynn's, and no gambling at all on the hotel property. Denny's is a two block walk for good food at a real decent price. All the other hotels route you through the casino to go anywhere in the place, we hate that. This is our automatic destination in Las Vegas from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Great value 5* hotel”
Reviews.Author: tony38
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trump from 4th to 16th and really enjoyed our stay.The hotel is only a couple of years old and very well maintained ,if a little gaudy. It is a non smoking hotel which we really liked,It does not have a Casino which will either be a plus or minus,for us this was a plus as the the hotel is always quiet and serene compared to other hotels in las vegas. The Hotel is located just off the strip,about a 5 min walk to the Wynn and Pallazzo Casinos and around 10 mins to Treasure Island.. The Hotel is located accross the road from the Fashion Show mall which has lots of shopping and dining options. The suites are large with beautiful bathrooms ,exceptioally comfortable beds and nice understated decor plus a kitchen and lots of storage/wardrobe space,and floor to ceiling windows giving great views of las vegas.We found the staff very helpful and efficient unlike some other posters on this site.Check in for us was also very quick at 8.00pm on a Sunday.The pool area is not large but still very nice with great beds, loungers .parasols etc. the pool itself is 4ft deep and not very large but adequate . The two restaurants and room service in the Hotel are really good if a little expensive as is the cost of drinks in the hotel. Be aware Trump charge a daily resort fee of $15+tax which is mandatory even if you do not use the facilities it covers(use of pool and fitness suite,valet car parking,2 bottles of water/day and a daily newspaper). There is a railway line nearby and Trains can be heard hooting at times , and could wake you up during the night/early morning. However we did not find this a particular problem Overall we thought this was a great value Hotel and worth its 5* rating.we paid $95/day average for a city View suite plus resort fee,and thought it well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the valet and internet reception”
Reviews.Author: jsarchibald
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying in this hotel, at least for half of it anyway. The check in was easy, and the rooms are spacious and well apppointed. The bathrooms are also quite large and finished very nicely. The bed was luxurious, and the sheets and pillows made me want to sleep for days. And the view is quite nice too. However, we could not get a WiFi signal at all, having to go to the Business Center to get one. And our phone could not get reception in the room either. What really annoyed us was that our car had the seat, mirror and radio settings changed, and a big hand print on the bonnet clearly showed where they had closed the hood (it was a brand new model that had only just been released). I would have expected more from a Trump hotel, it's not as if it was a Travelodge. And the resort charge is $15 a day, for valet, etc. And the internet was $11.99, I got it free at a Marriott, why not a Trump hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Trump International Hotel - A Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: ladyslippertraveller
Reviews.Content: Recently my family and I stayed at the Trump International Hotel and Tower in Las Vegas. It was a wonderful experience. The suites were fantastic with beautiful views of the city and The Strip. Trump Hotel does not have a casino which was a major plus for us and it is totally smoke free another huge advantage. The staff, especially Daniel at the Bellman's desk was so helpful. We were travelling with a five month old child and everything was provided including a lovely crib with all the bedding, extra towels and anything else we might need. It was like being at home with all the conveniences. Daniel was very accommodating and understood the needs of a young family. Walking into the hotel and not having to go through a casino filled with smoke was wonderful and the fact that the air was so fresh and clean added to our holiday. The hotel is only a few years old and it is lovely. I would highly recommend staying at the Trump. Shopping is only a few steps away with the Fashion Square Mall across the street. There is a free shuttle operating from the Trump to Treasure Island Hotel and Casino. Suites are well furnished and are also equipped with refrigerators and safes. The Trump is a short distance from the Strip so you do not have the traffic noise. I highly recommend staying here - a delightful hotel with delightful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: kindelm
Reviews.Content: We got a decent deal on Priceline for this hotel, for a recent three day trip to Vegas. However, watch out for extra charges! There is an additional $15 per room per day charge for valet parking (we didn't have a car) and use of the pool (didn't want to use it). The charge isn't optional however, so it's just a bit of a racket. The internet would have been an additional charge (didn't use it). Even though we got a good room rate, there weren't any affordable dining options here so we ended up going elsewhere as opposed to having $50 breakfasts. It would have been much more convenient to have a hotel with these kinds of facilities. The hotel is right directly on train tracks. At least on the "City View" side, you can vividly hear the train. We were on the 42nd floor. The trains woke us up 2-3 times per night. We live right on a busy 6-lane street at home, and yet the train was loud enough to wake even us up. To move to the other side of the hotel was going to be $25 per night extra (facing the strip instead of the city). In retrospect, it would have been worth it because of the train noise. The rooms are so nice - great bathroom with a TV embedded in the mirror, huge tub, huge shower, just great. Comfy cushy beds too. The concierge was super helpful, and got us great tickets to Penn & Teller. A few quick notes: - There isn't a casino at this hotel - It's a 10 minute walk off the strip - There is a mini kitchen in the rooms (fridge, stove top, microwave, sink) It was a nice hotel, but for the cost/inconvenience factors, we won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - No Casino”
Reviews.Author: TXScooby
Reviews.Content: Used Priceline to book a hotel on a quick business trip in Vegas. Went with 5-star for $85 and got the Trump. The hotel is really in a good location beside Fashion Show Mall. It is not actually on the strip but set back about a quarter mile. You can tell they had big plans to expand towards the strip but I guess the economy stopped that. It is hard to miss the white and gold tower from any where, so not hard to find. The lobby is very modern and elegant. Lots of gold that drives next the tacky edge but never goes over. I was there on a Wednesday night, so no crowded. Went right up to a desk clerk and was checked in quickly. Room on 50th floor facing north (downtown). They would have upgraded to a "strip" view if I would have paid another $25. No need. The room was great. These must have originally been marketed as condo rooms because the were large. This was a king room and the layout was one large room with bed, seating area and bathroom. The difference was that the room also had a large mini-fridge, sink and built-in cooking surface. Plates and silverware where provided. Very well appointed. The room was modern wood and metal. Very elegant. The bed was low to the ground and had lots of pillows and great linens. It had an ultrasoft mattress that was comfotable. The sitting area was large with a full couch and two comfortable sitting chairs around a full size cocktail table. The whole outside wall was floor-to-ceiling window that had a great view of the mountains. There was an ample desk with comfortable chair. The TV was a flat screen but it was small compared to what you would expect with the rest of the room. The bathroom was a real highlight. Large with seperate doored water closet, oversized jetted tub and huge walk-in shower. There were two large sinks in the vanity that was also huge. Everything was spotless. If you judge a good hotel room by its bathroom, this is one of the best I have seen. The toilet area and shower have textured smoked glass that is incredible. My only complaint is that the shower was so large, it could have easily taken another shower head either in the other wall or overhead along with a shower seat. It seemed a waste to have all that space without some extras. The location was great to get anywhere on the strip. I had not been to the Fashion Show Mall in years, but a quick walk across the street and there you were. Really nice and had a great dinner at the sushi restaurant at the front of the mall. Was there during happy hour (3-7pm) and everything was half-off. It was great. Note that the hotel does not have a casino. That is so unusual for any hotel in Vegas - especially one this nice. No long walks through the casino, loud noises, etc. If you like to gamble, you have to go across the street to the Wynn or on the other side of the mall to Treasure Island. I would stay here again. My wife would love it. If I took the boys it would be to boring.

Reviews.Title: “Poor location. . .Squeaky bed. . .Thin windows. . .But AWESOME bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGalinSoCal
Reviews.Content: Let's start off with the positive. The exterior of the hotel is nice and as you enter into the foyer you find yourself surrounded by excellence. Very beautiful and impressive. LOVE the fact that the place is a smoke-free environment, a major plus. As we walked into the room (37th floor) we were very impressed. Amazing modern decor, stainless-steel kitchen (love the SubZero, nice touch), beautiful bedroom (nice view of the Deja Vu Showgirls & Erotic Museum--lol), and the bathroom was the piece de resistance. The master bathroom has a shower for 2 and a hot-tub, not to mention a t.v. in the mirror of the his & his sink area -- SWEET! Now, the not so good points of Trump International. They have the audacity to charge each room a $16 a day fee for two 4 oz. waters in your room, use of the pool and gym. Seriously? Totally ridiculous. The pool area is very small, especially for Vegas--boring, small lap pool (4' was the deepest point). The girl at check-in looked like she might work across the street at the "gentlemen's club" (a ton of pancake make-up and turquoise contact lenses, not very professional) and had a snobby demeanor. While our room was lovely, as we walked in I noticed a few stains on the carpet near the entry-way and the velvet-like couch had lint on it. The bed was too soft and felt unstable. The frame was squeaky, every time we moved it made loud squeaky noises and felt a tad wobbly. Our friend's had the same complaint with their bed--I've had better beds at the Best Western, seriously. Also, the windows are so thin we could hear every siren all through the night. . . .so much for Trump providing only the "Best". A nice hotel, but not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 5 star.”
Reviews.Author: k_man0
Reviews.Content: Overall the property is very nice. Upgraded from a studio to a 1 bedroom suite at an additional $50.00 per night. The suite is twice the size of the studio. Suite was nicely furnished with a L shaped sectional that converts into a bed. My roommate slept in it, but I found it very uncomfortable. Very thin mattress, but my roommate seemed to enjoy it as he slept for 8 hours every day. Called housekeeping to make up the pull up at 2:00am and they were very accomodating. As I stated overall the hotel is fine, but there were a few small things that didn't get done. One day houskeeping didn't clean our room even though we had the indicator on. I woke up early and asked to have the wake up call cancelled, but it still rang. Found small pieces of broken plastic in the bathroom and in the carpet of the bedroom. Things like this I expect to be taken care of at a 5 star hotel. The train didn't wake me up, but i did notice it when I was awake. ?? Did not use any of the facilities of the hotel. Did order room service though. $5.00 service charge for delivery and addional 18% gratuity and taxes added to the bill. $17.00 trump burger turns into $27.27.

Reviews.Title: “simply PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: vale241
Reviews.Content: One of the most beautiful and luxurious hotel I have ever seen in all my life All was perfect: the hall full of perfume, the receptionists, the relaxing athmosphere, the marvellous room, the funny swimming pool, the gym... And the bed was so huge and comfortable! A lot of hotels in Las Vegas are kitsch: too many marms, too many gold things, too many lights and sounds... This hotel was simple but very elegant...quiet (because there is no casino inside the hotel) and charming Th only bad thing is the 15 $ fee for every day you stay (I prefer one total price, not the price plus 15 $) But the hotel was...absolutely a wonderful dream!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: AnsarMNewYork
Reviews.Content: Some notes from an enjoyable vacation during the last week of September.. The studio suite is much bigger than we had imagined, immaculate and with all the advertised amenities. Bathroom is really large with a jetted tub, separate shower and toilet areas and an extra large vanity (The TV embedded in the mirror is something new!). King size bed/extra soft pillows has to be among the best we ever slept on. Lot of closet space, extra large LCD TV, kitchenette with cooktop and some essentials. We were upgraded to a strip view on the higher floors for a small acceptable fee. And boy! they got some really fast elevators here. Being a non-smoking hotel with no casinos, it is a quiet retreat from the smoky and loud casino hotels on the strip. Good place to crash down after all that hard work making money at the casinos. There is a 15$ resort fee (per day), but we were aware of this fact and is charged by almost all hotels there. We also tried out the breakfast in room and food/service was pretty good, and pricing fairly reasonable. The stay gave us a feeling of royalty!Definitely staying here again on a return trip! The fashion show mall (pretty big one) is just across the road from Trump's exit. Can be used as a shortcut to Treasure Island casino and beyond for those preferring to walk. Having a rental car is better though, as casinos further down south of the strip like MGM and Mandalay are pretty far away. Car parking is free at all casinos, and that really helps roam around quickly. We had a day trip to Hoover dam and GrandCanyon planned, so a car was absolutely essential. Also we generally saw long queues for the bus. Tix4Tonight (for discount show tickets) is in front of the Mall on the Las Vegas Blvd side, we got discount tickets for Blue Man Group (50$) and Mac King Comedy/Magic (20$). Both highly recommended and a tad cheaper than other Cirque O Soliel shows. The lines begin forming at 9:30 and they open at 10AM. They have a coupon online which helps you get rid of the service charge. Stratosphere tower is further north of the Trump, hosting those extreme rides. We took the XScream, that shoots you down and dangles you from the edge of the 108th floor. One scary ride, just lasts about 2 minutes, but definitely worth taking. Sit in the front 2 seats if possible, as you will extend well beyond the rails before abruptly stopping giving you one hell of an experience of nothingness below! There are a few souvenier shops between Trump and Stratosphere, mostly near the Sahara. The easiest/fastest way back to the airport/car rental place. Take the Las Vegas Blvd, turn left on Sands ave (between Wynn and Venetian) drive upto Paradise Ave and then turn right. Its a straight road all the way from there on! Also a note for those who are from out of state and driving to Grand Canyon, Arizona has a photo enforcement policy, so drive 11 miles above the speed limit and there is a chance you may get snapped along the way. No points on the license I believe, but you do get a souvenir picture and approx 200$ fine :) Posted speed limit for most of the journey is 75, but it changes at certain sections.

Reviews.Title: “I would come back to Trump Tower Hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: The_Roosters
Reviews.Content: I spent a week end at the Trump Hotel with my husband a some friends. We had a nice large room at the 37th Floor. The bathroom too is great, but unfortunately the Jacuzzi didn't work. Then it's 5 minutes walk from the Strip and it has no casino inside, so thanks God it's not so noisy and smoke smelling like others hotel. The swimming pool is fine and it has a great pool service. If the Jacuzzi worked and the cleaning room didn't forgot to empty the garbage basket and to leave the laundry bag I would agree it's a luxury hotel, but unfortunately it's not for these mistakes.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but location could be better”
Reviews.Author: LJK22
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in. Rooms were incredible, and the hotel is fairly new so everything is in excellent condition. TV in the bathroom mirror was definitely a treat. The location is decent, within walking distance to a number of casinos on the Strip. To reach the Strip, you have to either walk by an abandoned lot, or try to cross the street with taxis whizzing by. It was a little bit dangerous, particularly at night. But once you get to the Strip, there is plenty nearby to keep you busy.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for family with baby”
Reviews.Author: maldeira
Reviews.Content: I'm traveling with a baby, so I'm avoiding a big hotel with casino in the lobby mainly because of the noise and smoke. Trump Hotel don't have a noisy smoky casino, so this is perfect. Plus the room have a fridge and a mini kitchen that works perfectly to prepare food for the baby. I also love the bathroom. Big, spacious, with a mirror TV and jacuzzi tub. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cronneberg
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel because of the large room, friendly service, nice workout facilities, and great pool lounge chairs.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment the most important part of sleeping is the bed.”
Reviews.Author: azurenoon
Reviews.Content: We thought we hit the mother load, until we arrived. There it started out with discrepencies at check in and finding out we are paying additional 16.80 per day for the pool and a 4oz. bottle of water per day. That included days that the pool was closed due to "wind". It was scary walking past a old parking toll booth on the sidewalk converted to a sleeping box filled with belongings of a homeless person, the sidewalk filled with broken glass, trash and old clothes and tire littering the sidewalk. Real trashing area after dark, not to forget the extra distance off the strip to only this hotel. We called housekeeping every day to ask for linens and water. Seems they can't get it all done unless you drive the completion. Trump really missed the most important piece that people expect at a five star, the bed. They told me the sofa was just like regular bed. They lied. I have owned a good sofa bed and slept on comfortably, but this was not even close. It even looked trashy covered in lint. The first night we asked for the bed to be made because they didn't provide the linens to make it up. We gave them 1 1/2 hours and they still needed another prompt to show up late. A sheet was placed on the mattress, yes no pad and no protection between you and the mattress. Yikes that was the worst quality day bed, mostly like a hammock except directly on the springs. The bed was so soft it also sagged, also no bed pad. The worst hotel quality you may yet to have experienced. They will tell you up on the 54th floor you won't hear the train every night and morning, but trust me you will hear it loud and clear unless you are deaf. Also this is a non smoking hotel but you can't get in or out of the hotel without going through the cloud of smokers positioned at the doors having a smoke fest. I would not for these reasons ever consider Trump a second time. They still have issues with the water temp. don't plan on a hot shower and you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: CDGWisconsin
Reviews.Content: It was a great place to stay. My room was beautiful. I appreciated not having a casino to walk through. I found the very short walk to "the strip" easy. You can pay for valet parking or you can park right across the street in the mall parking lot for free. I did not like the restricted pool hours or the daily $15 resort fee and having to pay for inroom internet service

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RockerGal
Reviews.Content: If you want to go to Vegas but you don't want to feel like a sardine in a can, pick Trump International. It is about 1 block off of the Strip across the street from Fashion Show Mall, Wynn Hotel and Encore Hotel. You'll experience a clean hotel with extremely friendly staff but with less "partying" and noise like some of the other Strip hotels. My husband and I would walk about 2 blocks to get to the Deuce buses to travel up and down the Strip when we wanted to see the sights. Rooms are large with marble bathrooms, jacuzzi tubs, shower stalls and floor to ceiling windows. But be prepared to spend a little money. Although I got a great room deal ($500 for a Sat-Wed stay), they do tack on a daily fee for use of the pool/spa/health club, a resort tax, and room service can be a bit expensive with the delivery charge and 20% gratuity that are automatically added on. You are better off just going downstairs to the restaurant to eat. Other than that, we had a really nice stay and would definitely pick another Trump hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Inconvient Location”
Reviews.Author: barbara61559
Reviews.Content: There were three of us using the room, so it was necessary for us to use the pull out bed. When it was opened, it had dirty linen on the mattress. Also, the bath tub was nasty. There was body hair in it, and it felt as if it had only been wiped out. I called Housekeeping and they came rather quickly to change sheets and clean tub. It would have been nice if there were pots and pans to use on the stove. Not sure, but it looked like an induction stove, and regular pots won't work on those. Room was beautiful, but didn't get the Luxury Hotel fee at all. All we got was a newspaper everyday, but I could have gotten it elsewhere far cheaper. It is a good long walk to get anywhere. Hotel did not have vending machines, so you need to bring snacks with you. Hotel was not worth the $142.00 per night we paid. It was nice, but didn't even have shuttle service. Treasure Island had a nice shuttle that was in use on weekends, for free. Next time, we stay in the middle of the strip so we don't have to walk, or take a taxi so far.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful suites, mellow pool scene”
Reviews.Author: estero2007
Reviews.Content: Trump, as always, has great attention to detail. The suites (w/kitchenette) are elegantly decorated, the master bathroom is massive and even has a mini tv built into the mirror. Great place to go with your significant other if you're looking for a high-end luxurious place to be mellow at...there is no casino, no real pool scene and the lobby bar is pretty basic...

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: ro2b51
Reviews.Content: For a Vegas hotel with all the amenities minus the casino, the Trump offers the best value and the best in comfort! We were impressed with the quiet, the comfort and the cleanliness. Great pool, great food, great service! The only thing we didn't care for was the mandatory extra fee upon checkin for use of the pool, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great hotel for 20-somethings...”
Reviews.Author: chowjjs
Reviews.Content: The Trump Hotel is definitely really nice, and clean, and we got an amazing deal through Perfect Escapes when we booked our room. The restaurant downstairs even has an affordable pre-fixe menu. But the lack of a bar/club/casino makes it a wash for 20-somethings. Fortunately, it's not a far walk from the strip and it's right across the street from Venetian and Palazzo, as well as all the shopping and restaurants around the corner. I would stay again if I wanted a more quiet trip, but if you're there to party or even see shows, you're better off staying at a hotel on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Eggs_09
Reviews.Content: Very nice! I had a wonderfull say at Trump. The room is huge, with everything they promised on the site! We went to Venetian later and stayed there just one night, and came back to Trump! If I go to Vegas again, certanly I will stay at Trump!

Reviews.Title: “The Trump Hotel Trumps the Others”
Reviews.Author: scottyhouston
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Expedia as a Fly/Hotel package deal back in May and stayed September 25-28, 2009. We booked a regular suite during our original reservations. However, upon arrival (and after flashing my military ID card) the young lady upgraded us to a one bedroom suite. Check-in was great. However, they didn't have our reservation in the system when we arrived which worried us. We were told that reservations coming in from Expedia weren't actually input right away. I said, "Uuh yeah but we've had these reservations for months so how would be have been assured of the room we pre-paid?" She said it happens all the time and no biggy. After a phone call it was taken care of with no problems. When we arrived in our apartment we just about went crazy! Absolutely BEAUTIFUL. The place was HUGE and in all honesty, two of us could have lived here indefinitely. haha! Huge living room, dining area, full kitchen with Sub-Zero appliances...real/beautiful oven, dishwasher, etc...all stainless. Granite counters, all utensils, plates, cups, glasses, etc. There was a full bathroom off the living room. Flat screen TV and a great sectional. Then you go into the huge bedroom with a California king bed/featherbed. Another flat screen, TONS of closets, storage and a safe. And now the best part...you walk into the master bathroom that is as big as the bedroom...HUGE walk-in 2 shower headed shower (room enough for like 6 people), a jacuzzi tub, a separate water closet, a desk/light (yes in the bathroom), double vanity with a TV built into the mirror...fabulous!!! The service was amazing, the room service (which we had several times) was great, and the bedding/linens were very high end. We loved it that The Trump does NOT have a casino so they concentrate solely on your hotel stay without the distraction of others coming into the hotel demanding service. We'll DEFINITELY stay here again when we come to Vegas. It's DIRECTLY across the street from The Fashion Mall (which is great) and a little off the main strip which we also liked a lot. I can't speak of this place highly enough...stay here, you'll LOVE it!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room, wish it was a little closer to the strip”
Reviews.Author: Examineticstech
Reviews.Content: I loved this room, it was probably the nicest hotel room I have ever stepped foot in. It had an amazing view of the strip, my room was on the the 55th floor. I stayed here because of a very good priceline deal, and my room really was worth every cent. It's only real drawback i found was that it was a bit off the strip, which lead to plenty of walking. It had one of the best beds I've had the chance to lay my back in, which is great for "recovering" in Vegas. The bathroom was spacious, with a walk in marble shower, and jacuzzi tub. The room was spotlessly clean in every way, and the bathrobes are a nice added bonus. The lobby was plentifully staffed at all times, and every dealing i had with them was pleasant. There is a "resort fee" that covers the pool, amenities, and parking, but it was not unreasonable. My stay was an overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly nice people - very sparkley!”
Reviews.Author: AmyBee22
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Trump for our anniversary & it was a great experience. We booked on Hotels.com and paid for everything up front but unknown to us was that they charge an extra $15/day for parking & some other stuff. It wasn't that big of a deal but it would have been nice to know ahead of time. The rooms were great - the people there are amazingly nice & helpful. The Spa was great - I booked a Classic Trump Massage for a birthday present to myself & enjoyed every moment of it. It is slightly off the strip but pretty close to the Wynn hotels & across the street from the Fashion Show mall. We actually enjoyed walking through the mall to get to the strip - it's air conditioned, for one! :) Also - the hotel does not allow smoking inside & does not have a casino. For us, that was great, but it may be a deal-breaker for others. The hotel is beautiful & just immaculate all the time. We enjoyed ourselves & will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Semchyshyn-Family
Reviews.Content: Very nice room; fridge, microwave, awsome views, they even had a real crib not a pack and play! Amazing bathroom!! A short walk to the strip. The hotel was very clean and staff was friendly, valet was a bit slow at times. Was very relaxing and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: LynOkc
Reviews.Content: Loved the rooms, services, very clean, peaceful, would love to visit again really soon, the train did'nt bug at all. All the staff was very nice, professional, we were there for five days, 18 Sept-23 Sept

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: investtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 1 bedroom suite, south strip view on a higher floor. Room has 2 full bathrooms. Main bathroom has extra large double showers and large jacuzzi tub. Extra large vanity area. marble flooring and walls, and TV in the mirror. Room has Floor to ceiling windows. Bed very comfortable, Room has full kitchen along with a large bar. Sitting area has large flat screen. I'd compare to a really nice vacation condo. Staff was super. We've traveled throughout the country and I'd have to say the staff is top notch.Service was great from check-in to the valet. If you want a nice hotel and don't want the smoke and noise of a casino this is it. After a day out it's nice coming back to a quiet property without having a long walk through a noisy smoky casino.Just drive up to the friendly valet and a short walk to the elevator and you're in your room. Shopping is super close. Nordstrom's entrance is immediately across the street from the front of the hotel. Fashion Show Mall has Neiman Marcus and the usual stores. Property is about a 2 block walk to the strip and add another block if you want to get the monorail to access other properties on the south strip. If you opt for the strip double decker bus, prepare to wait to get on and it's usually crowded. We opted to drive and use complimentary parking. Overall High Quality, excellent staff, great location and smoke free.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Suites, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: newhorizonsny
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a three day stay at the Trump Las Vegas. While the hotel suite is beautiful and well worth the 5 star rating, we could not believe the overall poor service we received. We chose to stay at the Trump after a two week trip to Alaska and we were looking to relax and recharge our batteries. We arrived with several bags, the valet did not assist us in unloading the car - there was no bell hop present and no door man so we basically had to handle all of our luggage without anyone even raising an eye to offer to call for assistance. During the check in process, the hotel clerk loudly announced that since we booked our reservation through priceline.com we would be receiving the lowest quality suite grade in their hotel. He was clearly grandstanding as we caught startled glances from the couple checking in besides us. This was completely unnecessary. The suites are great and contain every amenity possible, but it was hard for us to ignore the poor service we received. Even after our check in experience we tried to keep an open mind, but the staff had an air of arrogance with the exception of the valet staff (minus our initial check in). There was never a door man present (occasionally the valets would open the door if they were available). We have stayed at all the other 5 star hotels in Las Vegas and we received far superior treatment in each of them. Also, for those not very familiar with vegas - the Trump does not have a casino and is located slightly off the strip by the wynn hotel and the fashion mall so it is not as accessible as most of the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: threetotwo
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. We were on the 27th floor, did not hear a train, maybe that's if you're lower. It is all non-smoking so it smelled great. The pool is beautiful, rooms clean and the bed very comfortable. The only improvement I would recommend would be to finish off the sidewalk going to the strip or provide some sort of safer way to cross the street. The area really wasn't scary in a creepy way, just unfinished with vacant lot next to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cullen138
Reviews.Content: Bottom line - wonderful, spacious, gorgeous. I attended a conference in mid-March at Wynn's Encore hotel. I couldn't stay at the ostentatious and overpriced Encore, so I found a nearby hotel. I was about to pull the trigger on a room at Treasure Island, but saw that Trump was nearby and checked prices there. I was able to get a standard room for under $90 a night and jumped on it. Don't know if you can get that kind of deal of again, but my total bill was under $200 for two nights. A studio is going for around $250 a night right now. It was an amazing bargain. One of the things I really like about this hotel is that while it is luxurious, it isn't garish. Compared to a lot of other Vegas hotels, it is classy and clean. The basic room has a cooktop, small fridge and tons of closet space. The bathroom is gorgeous - decked out in marble with a deep, spa tub and huge shower. The bed is firm, perhaps overly so, and there is both a sofa and lounge chair. At $250 a night, I don't know that I'd stay here again. That's a bit too rich for my blood, but if I was going to Vegas and it was under $100 a night again, I'd stay in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “cool luxury”
Reviews.Author: tommytraveller
Reviews.Content: from the moment you walk in to the scented lobby, this is a calm oasis in a crazy city. the reception was friendly and efficient and no queue to check in. the room was beatifully modern. marble bathrooms, comfy beds and fabulous bedroom furniture.pool area was large enough and beds plentiful, though this was a quiet time.not only was this a superb find, opposite the fashion show mall and very close to the Wynn, but we got a great deal by bidding on Priceline. one delighted customer!

Reviews.Title: “Mini suites for mini sheckles”
Reviews.Author: whatIKnow
Reviews.Content: Extended family descended to Las Vegas for the 21rst birthday of our niece. While the other family members chose theme-parked mid-strip hotels the size of Texas, we checked into the Trump Towers and loved everything about the more intimate and understated hotel, especially the design of the one bedroom suites with a gynormous master bath including soaking tub and rainfall shower for two (or more, its Vegas Baby). Our college student slept (so she says) on the L-shaped couch that converted into a very large sofabed. She had her own full bath (thankfully) and 24 hour access to the subzero refrigerator in the small but efficient kitchen. We loved the pool and poolside cafe while our college student preferred a more "kids gone wild" atmosphere at one of the themed hotels. By daylight if we were not at the pool, we walked across the street and entered the Mall on Steroids through the Nordstrom entrance. Taking a 20 year old "impoverished" student to the Mall was my biggest gamble. This is a respite from the strip, casinos and all night clubs. If you prefer the casino, club and show environment - this hotel is not for you. We visited the strip hotels but were relieved to return to the quiet and relaxing Trump Hotel. During the present state of the economy we were able to book a one bedroom suite at very reasonable prices. Try going direct through the hotel before you try alternate booking sites. Remember you can always upgrade and negotiate once you check-in.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape May Court House, New Jersey
Reviews.Title: “Spa was wonderful. Didn't stay in hotel but might next visit”
Reviews.Author: Dr. Hong
Reviews.Content: This is just about the spa though hotel is smoke free! Beautiful inside and spa is lovely. Had a perfect facial. Amenities were very nice. Service impecable.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel - Would definately go back”
Reviews.Author: Psycho-sue
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband, and had a fantastic time! The room was comfortable and spacious, and fully equipped with the best of everything. The bed was dreamy. I did read some reviews about the Train being noisey as it passed by but to be honest, it wasn't a problem for us at all! And neither was the pool music. We were on the pool side of the hotel but on 45th Floor which may have helped. Overall, we had an amazing stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, shame about the loud train.”
Reviews.Author: AdaminDC
Reviews.Content: The hotel's failure to soundproof the windows against the loud train that runs near the hotel at night is a serious issue. To mitigate the noise, choose a room on the side facing the Strip, on a high floor. Apart from that issue, the Trump is a perfectly nice hotel. The rooms are spacious, attractive, functional and well maintained. Service is friendly and professional. There is no casino, which is a plus or minus depending on your point of view. Room service is prompt and the food is tasty. If they find a way to fix the noise issue, I would certainly recommend the hotel; otherwise probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, well off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: drillerdoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trump over Labor Day, booked through Priceline, had a great room on the 42nd floor. Large comfortable bed with a kitchenette (which went unused), HD TV, lounge area and a huge bathroom with a jacuzzi tub and TV. The room was very clean though there is maid service only once a day, the staff was friendly and attentive, they got us great seats for Zumanity the same day. There is only valet parking which can take some time during the busy parts of the day and the pool area is packed, so go early if you want a good spot. Though the Trump is right across from Nordstrom and the Fashion Show Mall, it is a pretty good walk to the Strip, the Wynn is probably the closest casino to the Trump. I had no problems with the reported train noise, though my girlfriend said she heard it a few times. Also at checkout, they comped the resort fee and the internet fee for me so that was a nice surprise.

Reviews.Title: “The Trump is an Excellent Hotel , Highly recommend for couples”
Reviews.Author: rtscent
Reviews.Content: I was granted my 3 day Labor getaway to the Trump by way of Priceline. At first I was a little disappointed by some of the horrible reviews , but I figured I would make the best of the situation and approach this hotel with a clean perspective. My boyfriend and I arrived at 12pm , and we were greeted by courteous valet and bell men who immediately took our luggage and showed us to the front desk where we waited patiently on a line. Upon check in , we were upgraded to a suite with a view of the strip. The hotel lobby was immaculate , clean , and there were no riff raff hanging out. We checked into our lovely suite and went to the pool. The pool was an ultimate pleasure! It was Labor Day weekend , there was a good energy about the place , we were able to get a poolside couch with no problem , and the pool was perfect for just lounging. There was a super cool DJ playing very sexy carribean music which was well suited for the pool's atmosphere. We ended up getting trashed by the pitcher of mojitos that we ordered poolside , which was nice. In regards to getting in and out of the hotel and out to the strip, there was no problem. If we wanted a cab , there was one waiting for us. If we wanted to drive our own car, valet brought it within minutes. I truly do not see what the issue was for some travelers. I am not being overly generous on this hotel either. I've stayed at 5 start hotels all over the world in Hong Kong , Bangkok , New York , & Singapore. I would've liked it if they had more restuarant selections and flexibility in the hours of operation. Overall , this is a great little spot for us to travel to and I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Ripp Off”
Reviews.Author: ShadiCalifornia
Reviews.Content: 1. They charge 15$ per room to use the swimming pool "THE RESORT" 2. They charge 13$ per minute, incoming and outgoing calls to California. I was charge 91$ for seven 5 seconds call. 3. My wife's foot got slammed by the swimming pool door, when she asked for a tylenol. They said no. (they didn't want to be held raliable) 4. Last but not least, with no Casino in the hotel, its just too quiet for a stay in Vegas. Its also a good 15 minute walk to get to the middle of the las vegas strip

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laen27
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively and have stayed in more hotels than I can ever recall. The Trump Las Vegas was a memorable experience in high end comfort. The room was fabulous and every detail in the hotel was high quality. We moved to another high end hotel (Venitian) and could not stop comparing the Trump as the level of quality which we preferred. The Trump is more focused on couple travel even though there were a few families. Overall experience was a 10 and I look forward to returning to this great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic... Bargain for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Kerjner
Reviews.Content: Good day Trippies, I'm currently staying at the Trump. I have not left yet so I am writting this review while my memories are fresh. The Trump far exceeded my expectations. We managed to get a room for $108 per night on priceline. I do think we could have done better but I really wanted this hotel and didn't want to spend days bidding to save a few bucks. The Trump certainly won't dissapoint at $108 a night. I have paid triple for bad rooms in Vegas. The rooms are ultra modern, clean and large. The beds are so amazing like being on clouds. You really won't want to get out of bed. We've used room service and eaten at the retaurant here. The food is outstanding but do keep in mind it is pricey.... But Vegas is that kind of town. Before I booked I read other reviews of the Trump on tripadvisor prior to booking this hotel. I did notice that people complained about nickle and diming. Although I'm not a fan of nickel and diming I think I you can keep in mind that you are getting a quality room with outstanding service for $108 bucks you do have to respect they have to make money somewhere. They do have a $15/day resort fee which is typical in hotels of this caliber. They do have free valet BUT parking fee is $14 per night. So expect around $30 misc fees per night. I thought the hotel is worth it. I would recommend a $25 studio suite upgrade of the strip. I'm in Room 5702 so 57th floor with direct view of the strip. Also the room is very quiet on the strip view side of the hotel. One thing I have to mention is that the bathrooms are incrdible at the Trump. Check out the pictures on mu review. The jet tubs are amazingly clean. There is also a flat panel tv built in to the mirror so you can watch tv while getting ready. Trump is also nice since there is no loud casino. I'm not a gambler so it's nice to come back somewhere quiet after being on the strip all day. Check out my pictures. I hope this helps you choose a place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “You either will love it or hate it: We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: YYZAC
Reviews.Content: The reviews are accurate, at least in terms of the facts on the hotel. That said, we loved our 4 day stay at the Trump hotel in late August, early September. We were also one who received this hotel on Priceline for $90/night. Also, were concerned about some of the comments from previous guests, all of which turned out to be factual. Still, we decided to give it our best shot and see what happens. First, the valet. I agonized over this, hating the fact that there was no self parking. For short hops, I did use the Fashion Show Mall's parking lot, across the street, yes, to avoid the $2-$5 valet tips. I wasn't just about the money, but more about the time it took to park and retrieve the car. When we knew we were in for the night, then we would valet park, which is included in the $15 resort fee. The resort fee of $15 per day included the parking, 2 bottles of water in the room each day, and use of the fitness facility (which nobody in our party used), was not unreasonable, although other Vegas hotels have free parking and free hotel pools and fitness facilities that are, by far, superior to the mini-size pool of the Trump hotel. The rooms and public facilties have to be the main selling point of this hotel. Beautiful, modern and fashionable in all respects. The bathroom with seperate shower and tub, two sinks, enclosed toilet area and, yes, TV in the mirror are, overall, very impressive. The room itself was large with a King bed, 2 seater couch and 2 easy chairs. The couch unfolds into a double bed, although with a matress far inferior to the one on the King size bed. The kitchenette has everything but a stove, and there is two of everything: mug, cups, cutlerly, plates, etc. Unlike another reviewer, there were pots and pans supplied in our room, including a blender and stove kettle. Our room, 4319, overlooked the "city". This meant we were not overlooking the strip, but had beautiful views of downtown Las Vegas, which looked beautiful at night, and the mountains, which looked beautiful all day. The elevators were, as another reviewer noted, the fastest I've ever and I seldom ever had to wait more than 30 seconds. The sidewalk issue. Despite what other reviewers promised there is NO complete sidewalk on EITHER side of the street all the way to Las Vegas Blvd. ("the strip") I have personally walked down both sides. The better sidewalk can be found opposite the hotel; however, when you get close to the end of the street the sidewalk veers into the Fashion Show Mall. To continue you must walk on the road, or across a rock planter, which is doable if careful. The sidewalk on the side of the Trump hotel is incomplete and, at times, passes broken bottles, strewn garbage and some sort of derilict gate house of sorts. Either way the walk would not be a pleasant one at night. My only suggestion is what other reviewers have stated: walk through the Fashion Show Mall, accessible from Nordstroms. Nordstroms is a less than 30 second walk across the street from the hotel, while the strip is 10 minutes through the mall. The only problem is when Nordstroms closes, there is no mall entry point from the Trump side of the mall, which makes access impossible. (we tried one early morning before the anchor stores: Nordstrom, etc. opened). Internet is $9.95 per day. Should be included in the resort fee. My son and his friends who were staying in 2320, complained that although they called room service to pick up their table, it was still in the hall 24 hours later, even though they were told it would be picked up within the hour. At times I wished this hotel had a casion, and at other times I was glad for the peace, quiet and lack of cigarette smoke (I forgot just how annoying this is in public places until I re-arrived at Vegas this year). The hotel is what it is: a residence that sub-lets owners rooms out as hotel suites. If one goes in with this in mind they won't be disappointed. If one is expecting a typical Vegas hotel/resort then there will be disappointment. Overall, it was a pleasant stay and I would return for the peace and quiet again. It was a nice chain, if only the management would read TripAdvisor, they could improve upon the few, minor, flaws.

Reviews.Title: “a very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: stewartdavro
Reviews.Content: rooms very spacious - luxurious bathrooms excellent view of the strip pool complex clean, excellent sun loungers

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience of our entire vacation; a total joke”
Reviews.Author: ElaineG29
Reviews.Content: This was so bad, we checked out early and went to the RitzCarlton Lake Las Vegas. It wasn't about the money; the hotel is totally poor. The rooms themselves are nice so it COULD be a multiple star hotel if they even tried. The "connecting" rooms weren't so my husband and I had to split up and each one of us stay with one of the kids... the rooms were so loud when the train came in the morning I woke up earlier than I do for work, and the Trump Kids was the biggest joke imagineable. There were not slippers. There was no kids attache. After calling the concierge about the Trump Kids which was on the reservation but totally ignored, she finally says the "kids pack" is at the front desk (I guess they don't deliver). It was just a $1 coloring book (yeah it said $1on it in big type) for one kid and NOTHING for the other. Anyone with kids knows THAT won't work. I called and she said "Yeah, well hmmm we don't really have anything suitable for a 10 year old" Super. My daughter will understand, I'm sure. That's not all they don't deliver. We ordered food. It never came. Ever. So I called the front desk after almost an hour and she said I'll check on that for you. She never called back. I never saw food. And the Spa. I don't know how it got in the Best Spa's book. There's nothing there. Every spa I went to on this vacation was better. No jacuzzi no cold plunge, no attendant, wow, nothing. Oh, and checking out, the front desk clerk charged us for an upgrade to strip view, which we didn't get so the clerk gets the manager. He was a total snob! When I was explaining how it wasn't a strip view, that my kids were actually viewing the Exotic Museum on the the back road behind the hotel, and that additionally food never arrived and... he interrupted me and said he wasn't here about that; just the concern we had over the room upgrade. Apparently he didn't actually want feedback. And yeah, on top of the resort fee, they want more money for wifi each day. Incredible. I was so glad to move to the Ritz. It was the most awesome experience of the trip. Granted it is about 17 miles from the strip but if you were staying at the Trump you probably aren't heavy into the gambling scene in the first place. The Ritz is also completely non smoking, the rooms and view are gorgeous, and the rates (at least for this time of the year) were comparable and the place is awesome. Kids Club is extrordinary. Their people treat you like... well... humans and oh, their spa? Awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5 star hotel without the hustle and bustle of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: CollegeTraveler00
Reviews.Content: If you are wanting to walk into the lobby of your hotel and hear slow machines and see tons of people, this hotel is not for you. If you want to be far enough from the strip where you don't hear the drunk rowdiness but want to be close enough to walk and enjoy a little fun this place is great! It is a great 5 star hotel. I have stayed in the Bellagio, Mandalay Bay, Luxor, Hilton and more and I loved this hotel the most! Sometimes it is a little overpriced. But if you get it at the right times you can get these rooms for fairly cheap. We had a room on the top level that was just the standard and it was beyond amazing! The shower is separate from the tub. The tub is great if you are wanting to have a little bath time with someone special! Also in the middle of the mirror, it turns into a tv! It has two sinks which is very useful! So watch the news while you brush your teeth or a movie while you take a bath! Also every standard room comes with a kitchen. There is a stove and sink and everything! It is great! Truly a gem on the strip that me and my boyfriend thoroughly enjoyed! Also... Free valet!

Reviews.Title: “TRUMP MISSED IT BY AN INCH”
Reviews.Author: annbot
Reviews.Content: If you want a touch of luxury and a bit different Vegas stay here. The hotel does not have a casino so you don't have an endless line of people trailing in and out of the property. I felt that it was a little bit my personal oasis away from the strip. The employees were the nicest I have ever experienced on the strip, from the room service attendant to the concierge and wait staff. The only person I wasn't impressed with was the gruff man at check-in, but he was still nice. This hotel had the fastest check-in I have ever experienced on the strip. And this was my 10th trip to Vegas. The rooms were awesome. I had a city view room, but the room was still amazing. The five piece bath was gorgeous. Large jet tub, 2 sinks, a hidden commode, large shower, as well as a TV imbedded into the mirror. My only beef here was that the beautiful floor would turn into an ice rink if you stepped on one drop of water so be very careful. They did have bath mats. The hair dryer sits in a bag on a shelf under the vanity. I even liked the makeup mirror. I felt that the flat screen TV could have been bigger, in the main room. The sitting area was so so comfortable. I was also expecting a more comfortable bed. Ours had a hump in it. It was a King though. The worst problem was that there was a train that would blow its whistle every few hours and a very tacky museum was beneath our window. You could also hear the highway. This hotel has limited eating facilities and is designed for your own cooking with a glass cooktop with two burners or a microwave. Room service is also available 24 hours. The restaurant is very good for breakfast but as expected expensive. You will not find the cheap buffet here. It is very easy to walk across the street to Fashion Show Mall for snacks and shopping and to reach the Treasure Island Hotel and Casino, or walk toward the east to experience the Encore and Wynn. We took taxi rides quite a bit and it averaged about $12 with tip. I seriously enjoyed getting away from the rat race of the strip and would stay here again. I did not check out the pool area, and there is quite a large pool and nice fitness facility. Room service was fast and the food was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel but if you're going to Vegas for the Vegas experience don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: eibbore
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice. The reason people go to Vegas is for the experience and the hotels are an integral part of this. For this reason I wouldn't stay here because it's a bit out of the way and it's not going to give you that experience. If money is a huge issue and you don't care about the Vegas experience, go for it. The rooms were really nice and it was fun to get a view of Nevada instead of the strip, it kind of brings you back to reality. The only unfortunate thing was that the fire alarm went off at around 8am, we had just arrived and had to walk down 49 flights of stairs for no reason, false alarm. I don't even want to imagine how the party people felt about that. But that's not the hotel's fault really.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A 5 STAR!!!”
Reviews.Author: cmberry
Reviews.Content: Donald Trump, where are you? What are you thinking? You are putting your name on this? I'm embarrassed for you. This is not a 5 star, not a 4 star, maybe a 3 star. Rio Hotel is better than this mismanaged disappointment. Even the official website for this hotel is horrible. I don't have the time to list every single *GASP* moment on my stay here. I hated it. Hated it, hated it. Rooms were ugly, loud, lobby uninteresting, boring, cheap, ridiclous resort fee for your ugly community style pool, wifi wasn't free (even nasty Motel 6 has free wifi), staff was apathetic and ridiculously min-wage snobby. Your wife probably wouldn't stay here. NO,no, no. I will do whatever I can to spread the word not to stay here. Edit Remove Send To A Friend Link to this Review

Reviews.Title: “Finally, a place in Vegas that we'll return to!”
Reviews.Author: tklsee
Reviews.Content: The Trump is the perfect choice for travellers that want to be close to the action on the Strip but who don't want to swim through hordes at the casino resorts just to check-in or return to your room for so r&r. The location was fabulous, within walking distance to the Wynn and right across the road from Nordstroms at the Fashion Mall (which my wife really appreciated!). The building itself - from the lobby through the elevators and common areas to our studio room - was immaculate and spotless (pool is an okay size but who really goes to Vegas to hang at the pool all day, right?). The service was uber-friendly and courteous. Security in the lobby discretely ensures the place is for paying guests only. The DJT restaurant in the lobby is quite good but we enjoyed our meals on the Strip better ... breakfast was overly pricey and not worth a second visit. The only real nit - the mandatory valet service took about 10-15 minutes everytime. It is included in the resort fee, which we thought was reasonable, and the valet staff are great, but self-parking if available would have been our choice. We finally figured out, though, that for shorter non-overnight stops at the hotel to change clothes, take a nap, etc., the trick is to park in the underground parking at Nordstroms and just walk 90 seconds across to the hotel - saved us a bunch of time. All in all, a great value (we picked 5-star at Priceline and paid only $120/night for our Strip view room).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: msgeb
Reviews.Content: If I could I would rate this vacation I would give it ten stars. The Trump was in the ideal spot. Steps away from the the strip yet far enough from the hustle and bustle and noise of Las Vegas Blvd. The hotel was first rate. The staff was as courteous and attentive as could be. We arrived at one thirty and check-in was only at three, not only did we get a room in five minutes or so but with a strip view free upgrade. The view from our room was the best Las Vegas can offer. The fashion mall is right across the street. Great pool, large rooms with everything you need. We will deffinately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Noise problems, light sleepers beware”
Reviews.Author: sonickatz
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that such a nice smelling "5star" hotel didn't think about their acoustical insulation. A freight train that blows their whistle at 2am and continuus on blowing every 20-30 min kept me up all night. We stayed on the 29th floor thinking that we are too high up to hear it despise reading about the freight train problems from other reviewers. The front desk did nothing but to tell me that the trains don't give them their schedule but I don't understand why a schedule would help. They also said the engineer is "working on it".

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Lking22
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, excellent customer service. A treat.

Reviews.Title: “quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: daisymiami
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for a real hotel in vegas this is your place, but if you are looking for a big casino or a theatre with big shows or a shopping galery, then this is not for you.in this place you don’t need walk thru the all casino to go to your room or make long lines to register or hear all kinds of noises in the nights. problem: a train crosses next to the hotel and every day at 6 a.m. you will listen to it. tip,if you choose this hotel, my recommendation to visit the strip: rent a car for all your stay.

Reviews.Title: “was expectiing the worst- pretty much got what i expected”
Reviews.Author: gll75523
Reviews.Content: my friends and I decided to do a quick weekend trip to vegas, and booked the Trump through Priceline for a very good rate. I had read all the reviews, and thought I could live with it. Well, we arrived at 3:30 (check in time was 3) only to wait in the check-in line for almost 40 minutes. W hen we arrived at the front, they told us they had no rooms that were clean and we would need to wait an hour. So we left our luggage with the bellman, and walked across to Nordstrom (the only good thing about this hotel). When we came back and finally got into our room it has a giant soaking wet spot on the carpet between the bathroom and bedroom. about 10 minutes later, the housekeeper opened our door without knocking and told us our room hadnt been cleaned still and we needed to leave. She said she would come right back and never did. SO GROSS!!! when our luggage was finally brought up, we realized my friend's camera was missing from her bag which was partially open. The bellman said they didnt have it, so we figured maybe it fell out in the car. The valet said they didnt have it, so my friends camera was stolen by someone, probably a hotel employee. After goig out that night we arrived back at the hotel just before 3am. at 6:30am the housekeeper decided to come back (but this time she rang the doorbell about 3 times) which was so itrritating because we were trying to get some sleep. We didnt even bother checking out because we figured the staff would probably keep coming into our room unannounced anyway and they would figure it out soon enough. Overall, this hotel has a 5star lobby(not including the check in process), but 2* everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet escape from the las vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: marie007Canada
Reviews.Content: Good price, good quality. Concierge was very helpful. Basic room was very nice, felt like a suite...The beds were fantastic! The bath even had jets! ohh man i wish i was back there right now....The lobby and corridor are nicely scented, however a little strong at times. The location is nice, not right in the action but close enough for all the attractions. Right across from fashion show mall made this very convenient. While some other reviews complain about the trains, we never really noticed anything or were bothered by them. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS SCAM LIKE THE PLAGUE!!!”
Reviews.Author: SOPHIE27AUSTINTX
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from Trump Int'l Las Vegas, and it's been THE worst experience of my life!!! First off, they lied to me at every turn when I reserved the two rooms--told me ANYTHING to get me to spend my money. When I got there, EVERYTHING was a lie. They added a $15-per-day fee to each room (resort fee) without telling me upfront. The hotel is located in an industrial area right next to train tracks...and TRAINS blow their ghastly horns all night every night--like HOURLY--sometimes four or five blasts at a time. Trump manager reluctantly moved us to the 42nd floor, and it was just as bad up there. There is no soundproofing in the hotel. The maid service is dreadful, and the bathrooms had bugs in them. One potty seat was broken, and I had to tip a maid to bring TP--it's SUPPOSED to be there already! The bed was so hard that I ended up sleeping on the couch an hour at a time in between train blasts!!! The facility itself looks posh, but it ends there. I was told to arrive early and they'd upgrade us to a Strip view room. Folks, there is NO strip view from the Trump Int'l except for maybe Circus Circus and one other crappy hotel down at that end of the strip. Trump is a couple blocks away from the strip so it's virtually impossible to see the lights of the Strip that everyone wants. A view of Circus Circus will cost you $50 additional. That's it. More lies from them. They sent me pictures of the rooms we'd have (two of them) and when we got there we were put in other rooms--nowhere close to the pictures they sent. When I called it to their attention, they said, "Oh that's a mistake but we'll 'upgrade' you for an additional $100/day." Isn't that called 'false advertising?" I could go on for days bashing them, but I just walked in the door back at home and it's 2:AM...the first thing I did was to come and tell all of you--business, condo buyers--EVERYONE!!! Do NOT get roped into the TRUMP INTERNATIONAL LAS VEGAS SCAM!!! IT IS NO BARGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “On the strip, but sorta not on the strip”
Reviews.Author: ann651
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a weekend in Vegas with the hubster. We used priceline to get a 5 star hotel on the strip and we got the Trump. We were kinda disappointed that we got the Trump since priceline says its on the strip, but it's really not on the strip. It's right off the strip across from Nordstrom at the Fashion Mall. Well, we got there after a long and arduous drive from SoCal on the 15 and a nice dinner at Mon Ami Gabi at Paris. When we first drove up, we were greeted by a valet with white gloves on. Okay, nice touch. Next, doors were held open for us as we entered the hotel. Okay, I can get used to this. We walked into a beautiful lobby and immediately went to the check in desk. We didn't wait too long and we got the courteous Peter to check us in. He asked us if we wanted to upgrade to a one bedroom suite from the studio unit we had reserved. We politely declined and he gave us our room key. Up the elevator we go and we get to our floor. When we got to the door of our room, it showed that there were 2 room numbers behind the door. We were confused, but we went and opened the door. Surprise surprise. There were 2 doors behind the first door and one of the doors led to our room. In we walked and much to our surprise, it was a one bedroom suite. Front desk Peter hooked us up with an unexpected upgrade. Thanks Peter! It had a full kitchen, full bathroom off the kitchen, bedroom with a humongous master bathroom. Seriously the bathroom was the size of a 2nd bedroom. There was an LCD in the living room and another LCD in the bedroom. Our suite had a view of the area behind the strip so we had a great view of Deja Vu (gentlemen's club) and the Love Boutique. In the distance, we could see Fremont Street and the 15 freeway. Overall, we really enjoyed the suite even though we didn't really use the kitchen. It was nice to know that we did have a full kitchen if we decided to eat in. I'd totally come back to enjoy the hotel. It was nice to be in a smoke-free hotel with no casino.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tammie_7
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Trump this past weekend, and it was an amazing experience! Our one bedroom room was upgraded to a suite for free. We had a FULL kitchen, two bathrooms, a king bed, queen sofa sleeper, and a massive master bath complete with a spa tub and dual head showers. The service was impeccable. The bell hop staff made us feel so special, and our service was quick. The absence of a casino can be frustrating if you are trying to gamble, but it is nice to not have to walk twenty minutes to get to your hotel room. The location is just off the strip, but a cab ride to the strip is only about $6; the hotel does have a house car! I would HIGHLY recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: lawhite90808
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a long weekend and were extremely disappointed in everything about our experience. The hot water was tempermental at best. We were both forced to take cold showers twice during the stay. House keeping was once a day which is not the norm for a five star hotel. The pool was not the level of other hotels in Vegas that are listed as 4 stars or even 3. When we called and complained to a Manager about the water, lack of cleaning and no towels, we were met with disinterest and apathy. The elevator bank for our section had only one elevator out of 4 working and when we rode down with 5 other couples we found out that none of their rooms had hot water either and that no one really cared when they called the front desk as well. We will NEVER stay there again and I will advise anyone and everyone not to as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with minor hiccups”
Reviews.Author: slapdonkey
Reviews.Content: Costs: Paid $120 per night on Priceline.com (Fantastic Rate) Named our price for 5 stars north strip and that is what we got. $30 upgrade to a suite with living room was ABSOLUTELY worth every penny. Resort fee not included in price $15. This really annoyed me and put me in a bad mood for about 30 minutes. They just need to include it in the price. The food at the pool was expensive ($15 for a burger) but the quality was great. The quality of the food makes you forget how much you just spent for it. Service: Service was great. Everyone was friendly and helpful and know what they were talking about. I felt bad for the front desk people that had to explain why they have to charge a $15 per night resort fee to have the privilege of using the pool and gym. Room: GREAT! you have a fridge, sink, glassware, oven etc. It is well appointed. My only criticism is that the Donald must be one tough cookie because the toilet paper felt cheaper than what you would use at a public high school in a bad area. All in all the Trump is a great hotel. If you can get a good rate and don't mind not having a casino in the lobby this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: golf_slc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolutely great value. I am amazed at the people who pay admit to geting a room for $70 on priceline and then say the hotel isn't up to their standards of a 5 star hotel. The fact is, you can always get this hotel under $130...and often under $100. For that price in most cities you are staying at the Courtyard or Holiday Inn. Instead we got a wonderful studio suite, great bed, wonderful view with huge windows, nice ammenities, robes, huge huge jet tub, flat screen tv, tv in bathroom mirror, fridge, stove.... the room was in perfect condition. So to compain about the rooms at these rates in my opinion is really of base, and likely coming from people who expect to get star treatment after geting a room on priceline for $50. Now the thing you could complain about is the location. It isn't great, but it is not terrible either. It is a 30 second walk from the hotel to Nordstroms and the mall. It is about a 7 minute walk to the Wynn. The other thing that makes the location bad in my opinion is that you have to valet, so you can't come and go as easily as you may want...but again it wasn't a huge problem by any means. Would I stay here again? Absolutely. In fact, on this trip we also stayed a the Renaissance Hotel and in a Celebrity Suite at the MGM. Both rooms were a major let down after being at the Trump. Finally, the hotel smells great! I wish I could get my house to smell like that.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic deal”
Reviews.Author: Roaming_Sean
Reviews.Content: My wife and I headed to Vegas to meet up with some family. The family had snagged rooms at the Encore, but we couldn't get a room for under $300 a night. So we looked around and saw the Trump was an easy walk and booked a room on Priceline at a bargain rate. The hotel is quiet and non-smoking - a very nice change for the usual Vegas casino hotels. We were offered a reasonable upgrade upon check-in, which we happily paid for. The one bedroom suite had a kitchen nicer than the one at home. We had views of the Strip and of downtown. The room had 2 bathrooms, including one that was the size of some hotel rooms I've stayed in. If you're looking for a crazy bar/pool scene, this isn't for you. But if you want to get away from the noise and crowds of the typical Vegas hotel, the Trump is perfect. And the bar entertainment was quirky and fun.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 10Sgal55
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day/3 night stay at the Trump Hotel. You have to admit, it's nice to walk into a hotel in Las Vegas that offers non-smoking, and no gambling. Our suite was beautiful, overlooking the strip. A short walk to the Wynn, where we saw "La Reve", afterwards, ate at Grand Lux Cafe at the Palazzo for a late dinner. Trump employees were extremely nice and helpful. Some may miss the 'hub-bub' of a casino resort hotel, but you have to appreciate the peace and solitude. We never heard a peep from the hallways. I loved the exercise room--state of the art treadmills with your own tv--just bring your own headset and you are set! The pool scene reminded me of the MGM or the Flamingo, lots of beautiful, young people, not many families, We only went to the pool once in 4 days. Not really a complaint, just not a family ambiance at the pool. One other minor complaint would be the beds, too soft for our liking, and a bit lumpy. Otherwise, a great choice!!. Also, we booked on the Trump website, got a 95.00 rate for each night.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great and very nice price”
Reviews.Author: jeff1224
Reviews.Content: A tremendous, beautiful hotel, large, very comfortable, luxury rooms, and the price was very affordable for this class oh hotels. And there is no casino in this hotel, which is an additional reason to choose this hotel in Vegas. Nice swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel unless you are a senior citizen”
Reviews.Author: neverdreamt
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I am a huge fan of "name your price" at priceline. I have rarely had an issue with the hotels that I have "won".
