However, on my most recent trip to Vegas, I "won" or should I say "lost" cause I ended up staying at the TRUMP in Vegas. I will start by stating that the rooms were nice and the lobby was pretty but boring. The hotel does not have a casino. They also charged me $15 + around $2 tax for two very small bottles of water, access to a swimming pool which was closed most of the time and "free (according to the attendent) valet parking". The fees were manditory and I could not check in without agreeing to pay. I was not happy, what was the point of naming my price if I was going to be forced to pay more to check in? That aside, I would also like to point out that the valet was very very slow, taking up to 20 minutes for the car to arrive. Also, the hotel was quiet but the trains outside were very loud. I was on the 40th floor with nothing between my room and the trains. yikes!

Reviews.Title: “We stayed a week and would return... when back in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: ernestoc94
Reviews.Content: Great price as result of Priceline....This is a quiet side of Vegas...LOVED IT! a little off the STRIP, but not too bad. Service not that great...but NOT bad as Vegas goes. No smoking is the advantage...when we wanted to hit the town we were minutes away from most anything by Taxi!!! - If you want to walk, cut throught the Mall and you will be please to come out infront of the Wynn/Venetian/Mirage part of the Stirp. - Bathrooms are a hit with us! - Like the slippers and robes! - Buy your own refreshments the fridge is usefull! - Room service good, over priced. remember this is VEGAS...get out of your room and explore...then come back to sleep and recover!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay except for trains”
Reviews.Author: smileyrst
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Trump. It is a very nice hotel. It is about two blocks off the strip on Fashion Show Road. An easy walk that takes you out to where the Wynn and Encore are. The hotel is quiet, there is no casino. These were big pluses for us as we didn't enjoy the throngs of people at the other hotels we visited on the strip. It was nice coming back to serenity. The staff was very friendly, even opening the front doors as u approach. Our room was even ready upon our check in at 11am. The maid was normally prompt and efficient. On 1occasion I had to call for water etc. twice, when none was not left in the room or delivered on first request. The room and hallways, pool etc were very nice and kept quite clean. The bathroom in our room was too die for!!! Service is available at the pool and was not intrusive. It was however, quite pricey, as may be expected ( .5L of water $6, pitcher of spiked lemonade $55). The only real problems we had were the trains and road noise that came into the room thru the window vents. The vents don't seal well and when it is windy they actually whistled! I thought it was an alarm at first?! We were on the 39th floor at @ 4am, 4:30am, & 5am the trains would pass by and blow the whistles repeatedly. I woke up every nite. The hotel does charge $15 a day service fee. It was supposed to be for the valet, water in room, daily paper and use of the pool and fitness center. There really isn't any other option to park but valet, so we didn't fuss about the charge. The pool is not in the lobby as it is in just about all the other hotels in Las Vegas. Which is nice. You don't have to parade thru a casino and gawking passersby on your way to of from either the pool or adjacent fitness center which is very nicely equipped. TIP: If Las Vegas Blvd. is packed, turn off on Russell Road to the south as you are coming from the airport, then take Dean Martin and Industrial all the way to the hotel on the backside. No problems with traffic then. It is kind of a service road. Overall we had a nice stay and I would return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view, huge room, everything we had hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: PH47
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel through Priceline.com for our honeymoon, and were looking forward to a non-smoking hotel that did not require us to walk through a casino to get to our room. The lobby was magnificent... gold everywhere, even the public drinking water fountains! It was refreshing to not have to battle long lines and big crowds. When we arrived, we were greeted by a very friendly girl at the front desk who promptly upgraded us when we mentioned we were newlyweds. We got the 58th floor with a spectacular Strip view! The room itself was huge and beautifully furnished: jacuzzi, two bathroom sinks, a TV built into the bathroom mirror, full set of kitchen appliances, the works. Location-wise, the hotel does feel like it is in the middle of nowhere especially when walking back at night, but it really isn't that far from a casino (Wynn/Encore) and during the daytime, being across the street from the Fashion Show Mall is really convenient. At night, we did hear the train passing but otherwise the room was quiet. We did not use the fitness centre, spa, or pool but they looked great. All in all, we had a great time and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room/Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: PhilK58
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly for a 5 star property, this hotel is very affordable. The lobby is gorgeous and we were very happy with the room. The beds were vultra comfortable! The bathroom was marble and the tub was big enough for two and had nice jets in it. The bathroom had an extra feature of a tv in the mirror. This was nice for hearing news and weather as we got ready in the morning. While billed as a suite, the room was not well equipped with pots and pans, but who wants to cook while in Vegas, anyway? A $15 resort fee is tacked onto the bill every day whether you use the pool and exercise room or not. Beware of the cocktail price at the pool-at $15 a pop, your tab can get huge in a hurry. My only real complaint is its location. While only a few hundred yards from the strip and the TI, the walk at night isa little scary with an unlit street and a spot where the sidewalk disappears in front of the Fashion Show Mall. Since there is no casino, the hotel is quiet at night-except for the train that runs by at about 5 in the morning. Also, thre is no self parking so you must use the valet service. Just phone them from your room before you're ready th head down and the wait will only be a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Read the Fine Print, oh wait... it's not even in the Fine Print”
Reviews.Author: thewok
Reviews.Content: Let's just say that I hope The Donald didn't approve of the hotel's policies before putting his name on the side of the hotel because simply put, if this is the quality of comfort associated with Trump knowingly, then I pray for his soul. 1. $15/night "resort fee" isn't mentioned when you book the room, what "resort fee"???... to use the gym and the pool, and to park your car?... isn't that included in a f**king hotel stay? 2. They run a train on you 50 times a day... literally... if that train whistle and rumble isn't enough to ruin your stay then maybe you'll actually enjoy the room. 3. $100/night hold on your debit/credit card... unless you're a coked up rockstar I doubt they need to do this... that's a $700 hold on your card (money you can't use) if you're staying a week. 4. $12 a day for internet... shouldn't that be included too? $12 a day is downright outrageous. Generally I'm not a picky person, but the insult to any guest's intelligence is offensive and I wouldn't stay here again, it's a shame, if they didn't screw you with all the hidden fees and "catches" it would be a nice room, albeit, noisy and not really close to anything else except the mall. With these crap fees and credit card holds it makes the price of the room jump close to $30 extra per night... why bother when you could get a "real" suite at another hotel?

Reviews.Title: “SO disappointed in the service and staff...”
Reviews.Author: TraqvelingLikeCrazy
Reviews.Content: I was totally looking forward to coming here and visiting. I got a great deal, the room was AMAZING, the spa staff was excellent but...since there will be a but for this review...5 out of 7 people that I came in contact with were HORRID! Checking in and out was a breeze and one of the bell hops was a gem but the 2 woman concierge that I asked help from couldn't be bothered. They were talking about their personal experiences that I don't think would be proper to discuss here. This quality of service it totally not what I would expect from the Trump name. Upon trying to checkout via my TV, since I was leaving extremely early and didn't want to bother them (I guess I forgot that's what they get paid for) the option wasn't working so I called down to the front desk to ask that they square away my bill and once again was greated by an extremely rude and condescending woman who told me I should use the TV option and didn't even let me explain that it wasn't working...maybe it wasn't just wasn't her night (oh right, she gets paid too). The last and worst experience was with the bell hop and his security buddy. They were so rude and mean to me when I asked to call a cab and where the ATM was located that I left in tears. Enough said...I'll NEVER return.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: jensenl
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to begin with how shocking this stay has been. I came to this hotel because it was highly recommended. BAD IDEA. Essentially, they have charged me over $600 for two nights stay at $99 each, as well as taking $300 CASH. They have no record of the charges to my account, and claim they wouldn't have charged my account, only done an authority - when I offered to show them my bank statement they changed their mind and agreed with me, then said it will take 5 business days to refund my account - by which time I will be back at home. Therefore - they're taking all of my spending money ((WITHOUT my authority)) and won't give it back until long after I leave the country. After the initial difficulties checking in, I offered to get an alternative credit card authority sent through. This seemed like like a fair solution - until the hotel screwed it up in multiple ways. Firstly, they sent the form asking for authority for my first night only - which, incidentally, they have already charged me for TWICE so it seems they want a 3-for-1 deal???; then the person who received it didn't print it out, and took the next day off which means that now, 48hrs later, even though they've received the authority and have charged me multiple times, they're asking for more money, denying they've charged anything to my card and refusing to use the credit card authority they've already received. All in all, worst hotel experience ever. Staff are not helpful at all. Hotel charges multiple times for single nights and takes money off cards they don't have authority to use, and mysteriously charge accounts and yet have no record of it. On top of this, the staff have been extremely patronizing. I get the feeling that this is because I am a young female traveling on my own, so ladies especially, DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Donald!”
Reviews.Author: markymarc73
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel, the rooms are amazing and the Kitchen is well equipped if you want to cook..... but...hey.... who wants to cook in Vegas??? Excellent service, new, modern and very good value for money. Also Its just across from Fashion Mall for all your shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at Trump”
Reviews.Author: button74
Reviews.Content: We started our vacation with a 2 nights stay at Trump. We had never stayed there before and were wondering how it would be compared to other hotels on the strip. Upon check in, we were offered upgrade to a much "better" room for additional $50 per night, which we accepted. When we entered the room, there was a terrible stale odor (we will remember it as THEtrump odor - very specific) - probably nobody had been in the room for a while. The bellman confirmed the problem so I called the front desk to request another room. They moved us to another "better" room which had similar odor (much less, though) and we decided to take it (tired of the flight and wasted too much time). The bathroom was nice, but there were a few things broken there. The "kitchen" did not have anything in it - no utensils, only 2 glasses (I guess they wanted to show some class with this :-)??? - but then why advertise as kitchen?). The next day we went out - by the way, there is *nothing* to do in this hotel, very boring - and spent the day in the normal hotels on the strip. When we came back, we found our room not cleaned even though we left the housekeeping light on! There was a message on the voicemail from housekeeping saying that they did not clean the room because we left do not disturb sign on the door! What a [--]! Are they blind of someyhing? I called the housekeeping and explained the situation - they apologized and said that they were sending someone to clean the room right away. Then we were waiting and waiting and waiting... 50 min. (in the mean time, the kids were tired and wanted to go to bed already). Eventually, after nodoby came, I called housekeeping again. The same stupid [--] picked up the phone and started apologizing, saying that somebody was on the way (obviously lying). We waited to 20 more min. and I called back asking for the manager. I was put on hold for 15 min. and eventually talked to someone who presented herself as "manager of housekeeping". She said she was going to find out what's going on and in the mean time send someone to clean the room. Eventually housekeeping lady came (after 30 more min) and was cleaning the room for ~2 hour!!! (very sloooowwww). Upon check out, after being asked who the stay was, I tried to explain the issues again and this time, I was told by the front desk lady not to worry too much and to enjoy the rest of the day :-) (obviously, they do not want to improve) - what a mess! Btw, On the way back, we stayed at Palazzo for much less where the service and hotel were both perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, decent location, but agree its noisy”
Reviews.Author: zracoon
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice, TV in the bathroom, very modern. My wife thought the bed was uncomfortable...lumpy...but I didn't think it was bad. I was surprised by how much traffic noise came through the windows, we were on the 54th floor. Not enough to wake us up, but noticable. The views of the strip were great though. I liked the location, within walking distance of the strip, really liked that it was across from the mall, we always cut through the A/C mall to get to the strip, also provided a lot of affordable food options. I've previously stayed at Mandalay Bay and Monte Carlo, definitely much nicer than Monte Carlo, but I'd say Mandalay Bay has a nicer feel. But the promotion they were running ($89/night with free strip view upgrade) was a really good value for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but some problems”
Reviews.Author: Sniper33
Reviews.Content: Built during the Second Gilded Age and now operating during the Great Recession, this hotel seems to be having a hard time hanging on. The public areas, restaurant, and rooms are beautiful. The bathroom was the nicest I've seen, and I've stayed at a lot of luxury hotels. The restaurant is offering an amazing $29 three-course meal special, and everyone seemed to be having it to the chagrin of the waiters who probably expected $100 tabs when they took their jobs. The air conditioning barely cooled the room -- I think so many units are empty with no a/c that the room simply couldn't cool down in 100* heat. The bed frame was broken. Some of the furniture was stained. Having valet parking and a quick check-in is well worth the $15 "resort fee."

Reviews.Title: “Some minor issues-all made perfect!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mahilo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked in and found that night that our TV's didn't work. We were given an upgrade and evrything about our room, service, and little extras was incredible. Thanks Gerald!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: hwatte73
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews on this resort and was quite nervous. But., when I arrived, I actually started to think that I was staying at a completely different hotel. I must say that I think people invent things to complain about it -- or simply they are just not capable of having a good time anywhere. Here were some of the complaints on this site: Staff being snotty -- absolutely not! I found the staff incredibly friendly and courteous. I did not come across one snotty or unfriendly staff. Everybody, from the front desk to the gym to the pool were all friendly Loud noise -- never heard that either. The hotel was very quiet. I never heard a peep in my room. I never heard a train or loud music. I never heard loud guest. I never heard anything. Dirty rooms. -- The rooms were clean. I will say that I cut myself on something in the carpet. My foot was bleeding and I called the front desk. They were up immediately and sent a doctor to my room. I did not need medical attention but they went above and beyond to take a care of situation that shouldn'th have happened. this was the only negatve experience of the trip Hotel being off the strip. Ok, I have read everything from the hotel is on a dark road, that it takes 15 minutes to walk on the strip, that there is no sidewalk, that you have to take a cab to the strip. ALL NOT TRUE! There is a sidewalk that runs from the hotel to the strip. It is fairly lit and was a 5 minute walk! I timed it. It took no time at all, and was an easy walk. The long way is through the mall, which is right across the street. If you want to stay on the strip, then don't stay at Trump. If you don't mind the 5 minute walk, its not a bad place to stay. Hotel itself. there is no casino. But, the TI is a 10 minute walk and we ended up gambling over there. The hotel was clean and the pool is nice. its not huge. Its medium sized, There is loud music buts its a fun environment. They have very friendly servers who are serving drinks. I enjoyed the pool very much. the rooms were great. The beds beyond comfortable! The bathrooms are huge and very nice. It was great to have a kitchen. I recommend running over to the mall -- store called ABC, and picking up some groceries. All and all its a nice hotel. I don't think its a 5 star hotel. If you get a good deal, its worth it. If you want a quiet, less roudy place to stay, Trump is it. You don't have the drunk 20 somethings falling down in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “I'm sure it will be lovely when they finish building a sidewalk to it - very dangerous”
Reviews.Author: Crouch_End
Reviews.Content: Service can't be rated because there simply isn't any. Rooms have kitchen with NO COOKING EQUIPMENT which makes the concept pretty pointless. We couldn't even geg a teaspoon to stir our complimentary coffee (they don't provide tea) and the tv didn't work. This is crap! the lobby is impressive , after that it looks like it was decorated by the sand man who designs motorway service stations. Give it a wide berth!

Reviews.Title: “We all LOVED The Trump”
Reviews.Author: GA_GYRL
Reviews.Content: This trip was to celebrate my 40th birthday - and enjoy it I did! There were 9 of us in 3 rooms, aged 1 to 71, and we were so pleased with our hotel choice. Pros - nice, clean room flat screen TV in the mirror the kitchens - and someone washing your dirty dishes each day the uncrowded pool (we walked by TI's pool and wow it was full) the strip view - we spent so much time looking out the window tub toys for the kids (had to ask twice) once you got the the hotel, very little walking Con - long walk to anything no where convenient to buy milk and groceries (closest we found was the ABC store in the mall) Great experience. Tip - if you have more than 4 people in your group, you may have trouble finding a cab that will take you. My bro and family paid $30 to get to the hotel from the airport. We paid $52 and booked a stretch limo for 6 of us. I'd figured that it would be cheaper than 2 cabs - and it was MUCH more fun. We even booked it to get back to the airport. Used a company I found on google - http://www.lasvegastransportation.com - and driver Troy was great fun both trips. My 2 and 4 year old had such fun in it too.

Reviews.Title: “Chump hotel...”
Reviews.Author: schmudu
Reviews.Content: Pros: +Amazing room +Huge bathroom +Great customer service +jacuzzi with jet +tv in bathroom +iPod radio Cons: -Extra $15 resort fee each day (plus tax) -$6 to use Internet for 15 min -No self parking -Far from strip (1/2 mile) -wi-fi is extra So this is the first time I've stayed in a five star hotel and maybe my experience is indicative of why I like the 3 or 4 star hotels. The rooms at the Trump hotel was amazing, the bed was soft yet firm, the bathroom was huge and the bathtub wig a jacuzzi was divine. However what I don't appreciate is when a hotel isn't up front about their fees. Be honest! So when you check in they will have you sign a form stating that you agree to pay $15 per day for a resort fee (tax is extra). The associated stated that this fee was to pay for the hotel amenities such as the gym, valet parking, pool and business center. By the way whether or not you use the facilities is irrelevant....you will pay $15. Fair enough, so I proceeded to the business center later that night to use the Internet t and print out some business forms when I discovered that there is an additonal charge of $6 for defy 15 minutes and another fee (about 80 cents per page). Another thing about this hotel is that it's a bit far from the strip. I don't know the exact distance but unless you walk through the mall that is located across the street you will either take a taxi or walk down a long sidewalk Overall a good hotel, but for the money I think are better deals out there and I despise businesses that aren't up front with the fees during the booking process.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but...”
Reviews.Author: Prof01
Reviews.Content: Overall, a good hotel for the money...assuming you do not pay the rack rate or anything close to it. We won an auction at SkyAuction.com for under $70 a night plus $49 for taxes and fees (exorbitant, esp. since it does not include the hidden $15 "resort fee" tacked onto each day's rate and the resort fee does NOT include the Internet fee). The hotel is really nice - lobby, restaurants, room - and we'd stay again...at a similar rate. Good - check-in, staff, room (new, pretty much a full kitchen, comfy bed, big bathroom), main restaurant (ask for a booth and draw the curtain for a private meal). Bad - noise from passing trains at all hours if you're on the "cheap"-non view of The Strip side of the hotel, 10-15 minute walk to The Strip (at Wynn) but the sidewalk is incomplete so go through the mall. It's a nice walk and there are restaurants there, but the mall might not be open when you want to walk through. Again, overall, we'd recommend the hotel but for less than the normal advertised rate.

Reviews.Title: “Please!! Do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: nicki0
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews too late! I had already "won" on priceline. I thought "how bad can a five star hotel be?" The answer is simple, THIS ISN'T A FIVE STAR HOTEL!!! Just because you put in a Sub-Zero fridge and give feather pillows doesn't make it five star. You will not sleep if you stay here. The window design is flawed so you here everything from outside, even on the 54th floor. The train comes by frequently and blows a LOUD horn. The air conditioning doesn't cool your room. I like the temperature at about 74 which isn't very cold and it couldn't do it. The staff is nice enough, but obviously overworked. They never turned down the beds, fixed the TV, made the sofa bed, or brought our "trump kids" ammenities. You can read about the plain, boring pool, small workout room and RIDICULOUS $15/NIGHT service charge in other reviews. Bottomline is, there are way better hotels offering way more for less money when you figure in the food, gaming and show credits offered at other hotels that you do not get here. BTW the food is bad too!! They gave us Sara lee cheescake, no joke!!

Reviews.Title: “Noise”
Reviews.Author: ShipItHolla
Reviews.Content: If you're room is strip view (also pool) and on floors 16 17 18 19 20 you should instantly refuse to stay in them in you plan to sleep past 9am. The pool music is so loud and crisp that it's the same as having a clock radio go off in your room every morning starting at 9am. I'm an extremely deep sleeper but i can't get past the bass from the r n b hits playing LOUD 15 metres below me. I stayed in suite 1727. I decided to give up trying to sleep through this and live with the inconvenience of packing all my clothes and all the food i got for the kitchen and move but at 9:30 no other rooms were available and i was told there was nothing that could be done until 2 hours time. The receptionist said she would ask if they could turn the music down around the pool but that never materialised. The rooms are nice, beds are nice, bathroom shower and hot tub are all very nice but i'm not saying much that i wouldn't be saying about the wynn or venetian or bellagio for the same price range. The rest of the hotel is underwhelming, the dinning the room service the pool. I would only recommend staying in this hotel if you make absolutely sure you will be higher than floor 20 and don't care for the strip view or if you plan to be awake before 9am every day and like not having a casino in your hotel. Otherwise stay Wynn/Venetian/Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place, incedible value”
Reviews.Author: morganhj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Trump Hotel Jun 23 - 28, the hotel was very nice, it was definitely in line with other 5 star hotels in Vegas. We were upgraded to a one bedroom unit with strip view that was the size of an average condo. The unit has a full kitchen fully stocked, separate bedroom and living room, two full bathroom and several flat screen TV's. I did not eat at the restaurant but did spend time at the pool, very nice. The walk to the strip is not bad, 5-10 minutes through the mall, valet service worked hard to make sure the cars were delivered quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed.”
Reviews.Author: Winstonsmom
Reviews.Content: The Trump is highly over rated. It was supposed to be elegant, but I found that, other than the lobby, to be rather average. There is no casino, which is ok, but then you would think that they would have other things to do. The pool looked like a Holiday Inn pool. Not spectacular on a Vegas scale. No real lounge area to speak of. The bar was ordinary. The food was very expensive ($16 burger) and so were the drinks ($8 cocktail). Charge of 18% gratuity plus $5 service charge for room service! Outrageous! Beware $15/day resort fee for use of pool and workout room, and "complimentary" coffee service. This hotel is not elegant and is a total ripoff. With so many other 5 star hotels in Vegas, don't choose the Trump!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but the Noise”
Reviews.Author: LastHoliday
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and the service was excellent, however the noise of the train in the morning woke us up and the noise of the guests going in and out of their rooms made it hard to sleep. I would suggest going on an off time where you will b e able to enjoy your stay much better.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has serious service problems”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryDiva
Reviews.Content: a fire alarm went early in the morning, the stairwell was hot and elderly people could not make it down. No one helped, told us it was a false alarm and when I got down I told security about the children and people with health problems stuck on the stairs - still no help - told the door man and front desk - still no help - no managment staff and the bar profiteered by charging the guests for drinks while we had to wait a long time to get back up the elevators. sent an email to Trump corportation about the problem and they ony sent an automated response. Profiteering and no emergency help - not even an appology

Reviews.Title: “Good option for the right price”
Reviews.Author: happy78
Reviews.Content: I loved the rooms at the Trump. The beds were great and the bathroom was amazing. The kitchenette would have come in handy if we were there for a longer trip. The pool was really nice. On the flipside the view from our room was lousy. The walk from the strip is miserable because there is no sidewalk. If there was a sidewalk it wouldn't have been that bad, but walking on the side of the road in heels at 3 in the morning in vegas isn't fun. There only appears to be one restaurant and a small bar. There is no casino. The hotel is beautiful but there aren't many ammenaties.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - bed of heaven”
Reviews.Author: carterbequest
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my honeymoon for one night as we were using Vegas as a stop-off rather than a destination. Nevertheless we wanted a good bed to sleep in and got a great deal on Priceline. The hotel says it is 'on the strip' but is actually located 200m off the strip but this isn't a problem and it is only 2 min walk to the Strip and the Wynn. The entrance, through Nordstrom in the Fashion Show Mall is straight across the road. As we booked through Priceline I guess we were in one of the poorer located rooms just above the swimming pool but it was INCREDIBLE. We've been lucky enough to stay at some amazing 5 star hotels around the world but this was right up there with the best. The room was massive with a huge bed, sofa, chairs and beautifully appointed kitchenette. The bathroom was palatial with a huge spa bath, walk in shower and every conceivable amenity - including TV in the mirror. The appointment of the room was immaculate as were the fittings in the rest of the hotel. We wandered around a few other hotels on the Strip - Wynn, Bellagio, Encore and while we didn't see the bedrooms in those the common rooms in the Trump oozed an opulence and class that the others could not match. I think this is down to the fact that it is a hotel and not a casino hotel - so there are not loads of other people trapsing through the corridors or people smoking in the lobby (it is a non- smoking hotel) and it meant you could feel apart from the madness of Vegas but still have it (literally) on your doorstep. Also being across the road from the Mall meant that we had access to great food in the restaurants or food court. Having seen Trump on TV we were expecting something pretty gaudy but were very suprised, yes it had plenty of gold but it wasn't over the top mock versace like the Wynn. In the class stakes Trump definitely outscored Steve Wynn - haircut aside of course. The piece de resistance in the room was the bed which was heavenly. Sadly my wife was ill when we stayed but this meant that she got to spend plenty of time in bed which she described as like 'sinking slowly into a warm fluffy cloud'. Bloomin good and I normally like quite hard beds. Staff were fab too although even the bell boy had had botox.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a Discount - if you get a discount”
Reviews.Author: merryd
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Trump for one night after three nights at Tuscany Hotel and Suites (highly recommend). I found a deal on travelzoo for the Trump and we got a standard king bed studio room. It certainly was pretty and luxurious. We used the fridge, microwave, etc and my sister said the tub was great with the jets. We had a view of the north strip. The sofa and chairs were an elegant touch. Registration people were very polite and friendly, pool waitresses pretty much ignored us. At the pool there were the beautiful rich people (who got good service) and then everyone else. There was medium loud hip hop/loungy music that created an adult, pool-party experience. Few children. The pool is beautiful though, the drinks way overpriced. We didn't eat anywhere in the hotel but chose to go to the very affordable food court at the Fashion Show Mall which is about a five minute walk (as is the Strip). I say stay at the Trump if you want to avoid casino madness and you can get an affordable room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Winegirl1950
Reviews.Content: My first (and probably last) time to LV, booked Trump through Priceline name your own price. For $ 105 a night, we were checked in immediately and upgraded to a one bedroom suite. The lobby was calm, had a wonderful soothing fragrance, staff was cordial and efficient. Our room was spotless: Full living room with sectional sofa, flat panel TV, dining table, full kitchen with high end appliances, fully equipped with dishes, utensils, everything we needed. Coffee in room. 2 full baths, another TV in bedroom, lots of storage and a safe. Master bath with luxury 2 person shower, spa tub, dressing table, double vanity and TV built into mirror. Everything worked flawlessly in our room. We had a "strip view," overlooking the pool (loud music there starting at 8 am.) No train noise like others have commented upon. Other than the dance music played at the pool which we could hear in our room early in the morning, we had no complaints at all. The premises were non-smoking and non-gambling, just like we wanted. This kept the lobby relatively quiet compared to the other hotels we walked through, with their mob scenes. We normally walked to the hotel, which was about 2 blocks off the strip near Wynn, or we walked across the street through the Fashion Show Mall Nordstrom entrance. We didn't find this to be a problem for us, since we were walking all day, checking out the hotels, the shopping and the restaurants. We loved coming back to the serenity of the Trump after all the craziness elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: MONTES
Reviews.Content: this is certainly an spectacular hotel. The views are incredible, you can either have main strip view or south las vegas Blvd view, both are very nice. The rooms are a incredible! our room had a living area with flat screen, an a kitchen with top o f the line aprliances and all you need to use it, a full bath in the living rm area, the bedroom has another flat screen, a huge shower, bath tub, a tv inside the mirror. just awesome. The only negative thing is the front desk stuff, they can be snobby.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: mkstar
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at the Trump hotel for 5 days in celebration of my mom's 70th birthday, I personally didn't care for the beds, they were aweful, soft and mushy, my mother was miserable the entire time because the bed offered no support to the back. I loved the huge soaking tubs and the little kitchens. But the entire time we were there, we were nickled and dimed to death. First of all, you have no control over your car, there are no other alternatives....VALET Parking only! So eeeeeverytime you need your car, you have to sit and wait while they drive the car to you and of course this means a "Tip" every time your car is taken away or brought to you. This is not the only reason I will never stay at this hotel, but it definately is high on the list. Also, here's a pretty slick thing we noticed that they do, the bellman who unloads your luggage on the cart, is completely different from the one who takes your luggage to your room, so you end up tipping twice. Clever huh? In the past, we've always stayed at the Venetian, but the reason I stayed at the Trump this time is because I'm the proud pet parent of two yorkies and a daschund and this was the only "affordable" hotel that accepts dogs....of course there's the famous Four Seasons, but unless you have $400 per night....ummmm!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay Price was right”
Reviews.Author: mexicolover67
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay. Right across from fashion show mall which was nice. No casino so that's fine too. Clean and quiet. Clean large rooms and really enjoyed the fridge and coffee maker. Still found ourselves gravitating back to the Wynn though. (Still one of my favs). Price was right but don't have a burning desire to stay here again when there are other great deals on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: KirstyinOxford
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Trump for 9 nights at the beginning of June. We were very impressed with the location - across from Fashion show mall and within walking distance of the strip. It's non-smoking and there is no casino area so very nice for returning back after a tiring day! The room was perfect - good size with a large (very comfy) bed, a well stocked kitchenette, couch + chairs, plenty of closet/drawer space and a great view of the strip. The bathroom was huge, with a whirlpool/jacuzzi style bath, two sinks and a tv in the mirror (cool!). The shower room was seperated by glass doors, as was the toilet. Cleanliness was 100%. The noise from other rooms and corridors was non-existant however you can hear the music from the pool which plays all day and the sound of the occasional passing train. It wasn't enough to cause annoyance or prevent sleep for us, but a light-sleeper might find the trains to be a problem. The gym and pool areas are kept to a high standard. However my only gripe is the constant music playing (often the same songs) quite loudly in the pool area. This makes it hard (almost impossible) to relax or read a book. The business centre is ok - quite small with 3 computers for which you can use the internet, it cost around $6 per 15 minutes and extra for printing which is a bit steep. In the fashion show mall food court you'll find it for $10 per 30 mins and there is a little soul food cafe off the strip (just north of encore) which has it for $5 for 30 mins. We ate at the DJT restaurant for breakfast one morning. It was nice food but the prices weren't on the menu. We were a little shocked when the bill came and it was over $60 for breakfast! It was good, but not THAT good. The staff and valet were very friendly and helpful. Occasionally there is a wait for your car at the valet, especially on weekends when it got really busy. However we never waited more than 10 minutes and they have comfy chairs to wait on. Checkin and checkout were quick and painless but be warned, las vegas hotels charge a $15 a night resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, Slightly Akward Position”
Reviews.Author: winstonmarvin
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous suites -definitely swing for the one bedroom rather than a studio. I enjoyed the fact that there was no casino in this hotel as I hate wheeling suitcases through other hotel lobbies trying to figure out where the check-in desk is. The pool is great, lots of seats and great food and drink service and the gym is also well done. The best meal we had in Vegas was at the hotel's restaurant -$29 for a three-course meal. Walking onto the strip is a hassle, there's no two ways about it. Walking through the mall is an option, but it doesn't shorten the trip much. If you don't mind the expense, grab a cab. Call for turn-down service as the chocolates provided are fantastic. Room service was fast and well-presented. If you want to get CRAZY in Vegas this isn't the hotel for you, but if you want a tranquil home base, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property!”
Reviews.Author: gokartmozart
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Trump for three nights, I highly recommend it. I had a studio room that was very large. It had a Sub-Zero fridge, Jacuzzi, flat screen TV, and everything else you could want. It is about a block off the Strip across from Nordstrom's in the Fashion Show Mall. Wynn and Encore are the two closest Casinos. Very clean, impeccable service, great value. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “You're Fired Mr. Trump For Having Such A Dirty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nmomma
Reviews.Content: Where should I start? I recently stayed at the Trump while attending a conference in Las Vegas. I chose the Trump because it was a non-smoking facility that was not on the strip. My sixteen month old baby and husband accompanied me on the trip. We checked in on Wednesday and checked out on Sunday. During our 4 nights at the Trump, we had to be moved three times. We checked in around midnight and by 6 a.m.,we were up because the hotel had decided to begin construction that early in the morning. A loud jack hammering sound woke my son up and he refused to go back to bed. We asked to be moved and we were moved to a new room. When we walked into our new room, it was filthy. There were crumbs on the counter, lint all over the chair, the furniture looked beaten up, and my toddler found leftover orange seeds embedded into the carpet. I was appalled and asked to be moved again. In between our second and third move, the fire alarm went off. Frightened out of my mind and sleep deprived, I grabbed my baby and began my journey down the stairs from the 56th floor. On the 28th floor, we were turned back and told that it was merely a test. We moved into a room on the 40th floor. This time, no bellman came to help us with our luggage and we dragged our things down ourselves. The room on the 40th floor was no better. My toddler found an old, moldy toothbrush under the nightstand and an old McDonald’s cup and straw that had been left by someone who had stayed in the room before. Exhausted from moving and not having slept enough, we decided that it wasn’t worth it to request another room. We spoke to the manager and the best he could do was waive the $11 internet fee and the $15 a night resort charge that we had not even known about when we first booked the hotel. This hotel is not a four star hotel. The housekeeping staff seems to be overworked or underpaid. The rooms are not clean. My son spilled cheerios on the carpet and for the four days we stayed in our third room, the cheerios remained there. Think about this before you book your stay at the Trump.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: saraig
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights last weekend. I Pricelined it for $100 a night (you can possibly find it for $89 a night now though). It is located one block off the strip. The walk isn't bad at all because the street is well-lit and it isn't ghetto or anything. The lobby is beautiful. Check in was speedy, however, beware of the $15 resort fee each night they tack on...for what? Not sure. we forgot all about it though when we got to the room... wow.. absolutely gorgeous! The room is BIG with one entire wall of built in cabinets, drawers, shelves and kitchen stuff. There was also a nice plasma TV. Something I appreciated is that there was ZERO noise from neighboring rooms and the hallway. Thats one thing i really HATE about some hotels and fortunately, this room was super quiet and private. THANK YOU TRUMPY! The bathroom is HUGE with a big shower, plenty of space for two.. with a big jacuzzi tub and a built in TV in the vanity mirror! Spotless space with plenty of towels. They only give you two soap bars, shampoo, conditioner, lotion and a shower cap. Nothing special. The bed was big and soft and super comfy. The kitchenette was well equipped with everything you'd need, except napkins! Anyhoo, the kitchen comes with pots, pans, silverware, plates, cups, mugs, wine glasses, salad spinner, pot holders, spatulas, place mats.. all sorts of stuff. One thing I noticed is that they forgot to take the used coffee filter thingy out of the coffee machine. Minor mistake, no biggie. They wash your dishes for you everyday. YEAH! LOVE IT! Also, they give you a few bottles of water every day which I appreciated. We were on kind-of-a budget so we took cereal from home and just bought milk from the Walgreens down the road. It helped to save a few bucks for breakie. We also brought our leftovers from the restaurants we went to so the fridge and microwave came in handy. Hey, times are tough! Gotta do, whatcha gotta do, right? We had a city view (39th floor). We heard the train passing by the first night but only because we were still awake around 2am. It wasn't that bad though. If you are a SUPER light sleeper, then just take ear plugs. Geez. Possibly my favorite part has to be the robes! Yes, robes. They were soft and comfy and just oh so nice! They sell them for $125 at the spa but I found them online somewhere for $75 each. We enjoyed the pool one of the days and it was nice. I enjoyed the nice pool chairs and the music. I noticed people waiting a bit for their cars at the valet. But they seemed to only wait 5-10 minutes. We just walked and took the DEUCE bus everywhere. It wasn't bad at all but we really like walking so it depends I guess. Also, something really nice was that they day we checked out, we went downstairs to leave our suitcases with the front desk because our plane didn't leave until 7pm and the front desk guy offered to extend our checkout until 4PM! At this point it was 11am and we had other things planned but we thought it was a nice gesture! Next time we'll take them up on it. I appreciated that it is a non-smoking hotel. And we don't gamble, so the lack of a casino actually made our stay more enjoyable. I HIGHLY recommend this place to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Food - Beware the $15 resort fee!!”
Reviews.Author: Aussie067
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trump Hotel & Tower in Las Vegas for 4 nights from the 23rd thru 27th May on the final leg of an around the world holiday. (This included the busy Memorial Day Weekend) After reading earlier reviews I contemplated changing Hotels but, all things considered, was glad I decided not to. From my perspective the Hotel is definitely 5 Star in terms of comfort & every one of the staff I encountered was extremely friendly and helpful. (Ryan in the bar is awesome and the food is great - try the gumbo on the Tapas menu!!!) The only complaint I had was the $15 per night resort fee. Thanks to Trip Advisor I was aware I might be 'hit up' for this and when asked to accept the $15 per night fee at check-in said I would not be using the resort. I was told it was mandatory but, after pointing out that it didn't appear on any of the booking paperwork, it was reluctantly waived as a ‘goodwill gesture’. (I was firmly advised I would need to pay it next time) Once back in Australia I did a 'dummy' booking on the Trump website and at no time does this $15 fee show up. At best I think this is misleading and can only assume that the reason for this & some of the other mixed reviews is due to Management cost cutting and / or trying to improve the ROI per guest in a tough economic environment. (NB: I would have been happy to pay the $15 per night if I was told about it when booking) During my stay I asked many other guests if they were aware of this fee and the only one who was had stayed at the Hotel previously.............all were upset about it. I would seriously suggest that Management consider making this charge clear at the time of booking, otherwise they are simply beginning every guest's stay on a negative note in what is otherwise a great Hotel. NB: The train didn’t bother me at all (South Strip View on the 51st Floor) and getting to and from the Strip is easy either along the road or through Nordstrom and the Mall. Would definitely stay again......But bring your paperwork!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Daimondo
Reviews.Content: The gleaming gold 64 storey Trump Tower stands out on the Las Vegas skyline and is impressive as you approach it. We had a corner suite on the 51st floor with spectacular views over the strip by day and by night. We had a large bathroom, a shower room, kitchen, lounge/diner and the large dedroom had floor to ceiling double aspect windows overlooking both ends of the Strip. The suite was well appointed, tastefully decorated and beautifully furnished. We couldn't have wished for a better place to stay on our honeymoon. The staff were helpful and curteous at all times and always greeted you with a smile. The Trump is a non casino hotel which was what we wanted and is only a few minutes walk from the Strip itself. I would have no hesitation whatsoever in recommending this place to anyone of any age and would definately stay there again on my next visit to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: chitowngirl45
Reviews.Content: This was truly a great porperty. We got a pretty good deal through Priceline, and even though there is no casino and the fact it is not "right on the strip" did not make one difference to us. The resort is easy walking distance to the Fashion Show Mall, Wynn, Encore, Palazzo & Venitian. If you want to go further south, it is a quick inexpensive cab ride. The room was great... very spacious, awesome bathroom, and nice decor. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Its somewhat nice but Ill neve stay there again”
Reviews.Author: VegasTripper33
Reviews.Content: So I decided to stay here memorial day weekend. When I get there the checkout took forever. They had plenty of people working up front but it was very slow and it didnt seem like they were trying to hurry things up. I get to my room finally and as I expected it is pretty nice. I am not the greatest reviewer so ill make it quick, The tv in my bathroom didnt work. The $15 a day charge is a joke. No other hotel charges this. I had to take a taxi everywhere I wanted to go and that adds up. Its better to stay at a hotel that is on the strip. It will come out to the same price and I believe you will get a nicer room (for example the wynn or venetian) I personally loved the bed. It is very soft so if you dont like that its not for you. My biggest problem with this hotel was the bathtub. I turned on the water and noticed these black spots on the tub. I look closer and its human hair. It was disgusting. I could not believe what I saw. The rest of the room seemed clean to me besides that. The staff was friendly and no complaints there There is no Casino, so again you have to take a taxi whenever you feel like playing. Its about $8 each way. The taxi line is horrible. You will be waiting a bit to get a taxi because not many show up and the trump employees are verrrrrry slow at moving them along. I ended up just walking into the street and picking one up that way. I didnt feel like waiitng 45 minutes for a taxi. The room service food is very average especially for what they charge. There is a $5 fee per meal and 18% gratuity is added. Would I stay here agian? NEVER! Ill be staying at the Wynn (I spent most my time there). Wynn is about $150 more for 2 nights VS the trump and I have never had any problems there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay for Vegas virgins!”
Reviews.Author: alley1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our first Vegas trip, May 21-25. I booked our trip on Price line and was a little dissappointed when I saw that we were staying at Trump due to the fact that there was no casino. After reading the reviews here I was even more worried, however the hotel is fantastic! Upon arrival we were upgraded to a strip view room on the 57th floor. The room was amazing, clean, giant jacuzzi tub, comfortable bed...what more could one want. Yes, one required a cab or a nice walk to reach the casinos on the strip, but my husband and I had no problem on either count. The staff was pleasant, check in went smoothly and the hotel was a nice, quiet oasis after long nights of gambling, drinking and whatnot. We did not eat at any of the restaurants or go to the pool as we had so many other activities we wanted to fit in. I would say that if you want to eat, shop, gamble and attend shows all in one location then this is definitely not the place for you. If you're looking for a beautiful, comfortable room to come back to after a long night then you can't beat Trump. We walked to Treasure Island, Wynn, The Venetian and The Palazzo- and I was in heels! A quick $10-$15 cab rides gets you almost anywhere else. Downtown was $24. Overall, we very much enjoyed our stay and would consider returning here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Forget it!”
Reviews.Author: DebraCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room for one night in Las Vegas. The room appeared beautiful when we entered. We quickly discovered the flaws. The toilet seat came off when we sat on it. The TV in the bathroom didn't work. The room had no black out shades (but it did have a track for them). There were not enough towels. There were no extra little products in the bathroom that one is used to in a 5 star hotel. 6 hours later, the engineer called to fix the TV but it was 10PM and we just settled down to sleep. No turn down service. It is a little bit sketchy walking to the strip from the hotel - there is no paved walkway all the way there and no lights. The pool has no umbrellas/no shade. There is a train that comes by frequently and you hear the noise loudly at the pool and in your room (we were on the 18th floor). Last year we stayed at the Wynn and were completely happy. Don't bother here.

Reviews.Title: “Unique no-casino, no-smoking hotel-- a haven from the strip”
Reviews.Author: pricelinejunkie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5/14-16. There is a $15 resort fee and $14 parking fee. Hotel is nice and quiet with clean air. My daughters thought they saw Clinton from "What Not to Wear" while we were there, and I wouldn't be surprised if the Trump is popular with celebrities as it has such an insulated, peaceful atmosphere as compared with the casino hotels. It is difficult to walk to the strip due to the lack of crosswalks and sidewalks in the area. From experience, I think the best way is to cross directly from the Trump porte cochere to Nordstrom's porte cochere (entering through the men's department), walk straight through (go around escalators) and you will see a mall map straight ahead. We would usually walk to Neiman Marcus and exit near the Tickets4Less storefront. Once outside, turn right and walk to LV Blvd, "the strip." There is a bus stop right in front of the mall for the double-decker "Deuce" buses. These are the tourists' best friends as they stop up and down the strip and even go downtown to Fremont. Fare is exact-change-only!! Prices are $3 one way, $7 for 24-hour unlimited pass, and $15 for 3-day unlimited pass. Tickets4less is a good source for show and meal tix, but check the best prices online before buying. One of their best values is a $2 coupon which gets you Harrah's Flavor's buffet for 1/2 price ($8 for lunch, $18? for supper which includes bottomless soda/milk/juice). They had snow crab legs when we went for supper but it was overcooked. We thought the lunch was fabulous though. We got stuck in the Trump's elevator during our trip, and the management was very apologetic and compensated us for our trouble. In the evening, it is imperative to return to Trump through the mall or take a taxi at night if you aren't fast on your feet or can't see well. Drivers speed down the street at night, and it is curvy and dark, without sidewalks or crosswalks.

Reviews.Title: “I would be more than happy to live at the Trump, everything superb.”
Reviews.Author: Penel0peE
Reviews.Content: This was the fifth hotel of our stay in April/May in the USA. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we felt welcome, well looked after, extremely comfortable and in fact we extended our stay by 3 days as we didn't think we could better it. Every member of staff did their best to make our stay perfect. The hotel is quiet, relaxing & a perfect distance from the strip. We would happily return anytime but feel that once the secret is out the cost will be too high.... shame. The pool is the nicest we have experienced & we were confident that everywhere was cleaned thoroughly. I have only one slight gripe, the loud music at the pool was not to my taste, I would have preferred it to be more relaxing so I could enjoy my book.

Reviews.Title: “Trump Las Vegas provides convenience and value for a price”
Reviews.Author: chicagohalsted
Reviews.Content: I just returned from four nights at Trump Las Vegas. I booked this hotel on Priceline for $115/ night. At this rate, I felt the hotel provided convenience and value. I would not stay here as a leisure traveler. The pool and restaurants are fair. However everything is spotless unlike many Las Vegas hotels. In a nutshell, he hotel is close to Wynn, facing Nordstrom's, new, clean and safe. I am not going to nit-pick it to death for $115 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Good to be Trumped”
Reviews.Author: Jackcatscal
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, very clean hotel. The room and its furnishings were extraordinary. On the downside, it's off the Strip and a cab ride from almost anything other than the Wynn. (A fact that I knew about and I certainly can't complain about.) Service was generally very good. Our TV wouldn't work the first night and a tech guy came up very quickly. (It was a disconnected cable). But a service request I put in about two other fairly minor issues wasn't fulfilled a day after I made the request. We didn't use the hotel restaurants. But the bartenders at the Lobby bar were very agreeable indeed. A minor grouse was that the hotel charged a $15 per day resort fee. We knew this in advance and aren't complaining. But the "free" water in the room had a sign saying it was courtesy of the Wynn. The resort fee, it was explained at check-in, was intended to cover items such as the coffee and water in the room. C'mon guys, kill the signs. I'd recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal if you can get a suite”
Reviews.Author: HappyBelly
Reviews.Content: We got a suite for $150 for a Sunday night. We were disappointed to learn about the extra $15 "resort " fee for the mandatory parking, but when we walked into our suite, we didn't worry about it. Our suite was great -- a little mini-kitchen with complimentary water (unlike other hotels which charge you), stove, mini-fridge, big comfy couch with a view of the Strip, nice soft bed, lots of full-length mirrors, a jacuzzi tub with separate shower area, dual sinks -- it was really luxurious. We weren't that impressed with the pool, but sipping wine in the jacuzzi bath more than made up for it (there were wine glasses in the kitchenette.) It was kindof cool to be in a hotel in Vegas without a casino -- not sure how the Donald makes $ on this hotel. Oh, if you're coming from the South, off the Spring Mountain exit, be warned that "Fashion Show Drive" = "Wynn Drive". I.e. you won't see the right street sign because it changes names on Las Vegas Blvd. Donald probably didn't want the address for Trump Tower to be on Wynn Drive, I'm guessing. But the streets aren't really labeled clearly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Trump”
Reviews.Author: DenverTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short visit to the Trump Hotel in Vegas. We had a great stay. The beds are comfortable, and the room is overall well equipped with a beautiful kitchen area (that we did not use). We did not eat in the hotel as there are so many wonderful options close by. I had a bloody mary at the pool bar and it was one of the best bloodies I’ve had in my life. The location is nice as it’s close to the Wynn and Treasure Island. I found the service to be delightful and am surprised at the reviews of poor service because I experienced nothing but good service and a helpful staff. The lobby smells amazing and it’s so nice to walk in there after spending time in smoky casinos (same lobby smell as Langham Place in Hong Kong for any of you that have been there before). I will definitely stay there again when I am in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPPOINTING--UNSAFE”
Reviews.Author: Travels09Florida
Reviews.Content: I guess that I should have checked Trip Advisor before booking our stay. Our family had 2 nights in Las Vegas before travelling to the Grand Canyon. Since we were travelling with 2 children (6 & 8), I chose Trump because it claimed to be a 5 star property that was located off the strip. The fact that it did not have a casino was one of the determining factor. I presumed, incorrectly, that the hotel would offer comfort and safety. NOT. My 6 year old found drugs (bags of cocaine) in our room! Presumaby this room was serviced before our arrival? NOT. Obviously, I was horrified. When I advised the hotel manager what had happened, his response was simply, "Thanks for reporting the issue. We will need you to complete a security report."..No concern, no apology! When we returned, I responded to an email survey with detailed information on the incident---NO FOLLOW UP. I wrote a letter to Trump Headquaters regarding--NO FOLLOW UP... Be warned, safety, service and customer satisfaction is of no concern to Trump properties.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, substandard service”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom0406
Reviews.Content: The Trump is a gorgeous hotel. The room was beautiful, and in fact was probably the best-looking hotel room I've ever had. The decor was sophisticated and luxurious. It really did seem five-star. My only complaint about the room was the bed -- it wasn't very comfortable. It was hard, and also a bit lopsided. (However, the linens were plush and comfortable.) My biggest complaint about the hotel was the service. When I asked for some very basic services, the staff gave me blank looks as though they had no idea what I was talking about. The woman at the reception desk seemed as though it was her first day on the job -- she stammered a lot and had to ask for someone's help to find me a room. Also, the housekeeping service wasn't very good -- they neglected to clean some things, and forgot to stock others. All in all, the staff seemed surly and unenthusiastic. I've stayed at four- and five-star hotels before, and have come to expect a certain level of service. The Trump fell far short. I would still recommend the hotel because of the lovely rooms.

Reviews.Title: “loved this non-gaming facility”
Reviews.Author: jos_9
Reviews.Content: We loved our suite! our room was big and spacious, clean and bright. We were over looking the pool (south) which did tend to get noisy as the day progressed, we could hear the music from the pool in our room - and after a late night it was awful waking up to 90's hits. that being said our room was top notch. The hotel is located about a block off the strip which we loved because it was not in the midst of all the LV craziness - we also loved that this was not a gaming facility for the same reason. We also loved that car service was complimentary, when available - which was great because i used it to get to the PremiumOutlets which is about 10-15 min away. We ordered room service which was well below LV food standards, in quality and taste, but they set it up in our room beautifully with table cloth & china. The wknd we were there was during the MissAmerica contest and we met DonaldTrump in the lobby! The spa was awesome I had a dermalucent facial which was divine and the spa facilities were fab.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean but poor value/service and wouldn't come back.”
Reviews.Author: azparrothead
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on a personal trip with my wife and the hotel is immaculate which was great but to be expected from a 5 star hotel. Problem was the service. The morning we woke up we noticed there was no regular coffee, only decaf. We called the front desk and was on hold for over 5 minutes. When we finally spoke to someone and asked for someone to bring up the coffee it took 40 minutes!! I actually thought they forgot and since we were about ready to leave, I didn't bother to call back. They don't have parking so you need to valet and we waited nearly 25 minutes for our car to arrive. Some other shortcomings include the toilet paper being equivalent to sand paper, the $15 resort fee and a $7 charge to use the internet not including a charge to print! You would think the resort fee would cover that. 5 star, $350+ night room and you are nickel and diming me for 5 minutes on the web to print out my boarding pass?? Sorry, can't recommend this hotel with that level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Best North End Strip Value in Las Vegas: GO GOLD!”
Reviews.Author: kinzCO
Reviews.Content: For those looking (or contemplating) what Vegas would be like to stay at a high-end hotel that doesn't have a casino-- Stay at the Trump. My wife and I were aprehensive at first, due to some bad reviews, but when we arrived we could not have been more impressed. The Trump has excellent, attentive (and attractive) staff members, huge suite-style rooms, High-end hotel chic finishes, unbelievable food selection, and a great pool scene. While it is not the resort for a group of 15 dudes looking to go clubbing, it is the perfect hotel to go with a small group of friends or a spouse. The Trump is also non-smoking which is a major plus. There is no casino-- before we left all I could think of was 'I wish it had a casino,' but after being out in Vegas all night when I walked back into the smoke-free, beautiful lobby, all I could think was 'I'm so glad there is no casino!' Food and drinks are a little pricey, but the 5-star hotel is all you would expect from the Donald. Close to the mall (adjacent to Nordstroms) and easy access to some great attractions. Great hotel and great value over other north end 5-star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: special_cay
Reviews.Content: The Trump Las Vegas is everything you'd expect it to be. We booked on Priceline and were able to get a fantastic price per night. We stayed for 4 nights and 5 days and didn't want to leave! The jacuzzi bathroom, the in-room kitchenette, and the amazing views were all incredible! Highly recommend this hotel, especially if you're looking for a quiet experience - as there is no casino in the Trump. The only word of caution is that it is not on the strip ... but close enough that you're basically right across the street from the Wynn and behind the Fashion Mall. Also, this hotel has virtually no food - so eating late or breakfast were a bit tricky unless you wanted to pay for room service. Overall, excellent - we will be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Truly a V.I.P. experience -- well worth it, if you can get a discount!”
Reviews.Author: freebiegrabber
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get a room here for ~$100/night (via Priceline); we probably wouldn't have been able to afford it otherwise. A neatly-groomed doorman greeted us and a friendly reception desk attendant checked us in. Another well-dressed staff member verified that we had a room key before we rode the elevator up. Our tastefully-decorated room was HUGE, complete with a single king-sized bed and a queen-sized pull-out couch. We had plenty of shelving and dresser drawers, a glass coffee table with a tic-tac-toe centerpiece, magazines and hardcover books. The 26th-floor view was amazing through the floor-to-ceiling window -- we could see snow-covered mountains in the distance. We had all the amenities: a huge LCD TV with remote and several cable channels, a mini-fridge, a coffee machine, two bathrobes, an iron, extra sheets, complimentary water bottles, newspapers delivered to our door, etc. The bathroom was a world unto itself: a huge glass partitioned shower with overhead shower head, another huge glass partitioned room with the toilet, a large spa bathtub, bright lighting (but not too bright), a cosmetic/vanity mirror, plenty of thick towels and soaps, a blowdryer, shampoo and conditioner, a plasma TV built into the mirror, dual sinks, etc. The doorman was even able to arrange for their courtesy shuttle to run us across the street to the Wynn. There were only a few CONS: some trash in the stairwell, a room service cart was left in the hallway for 1.5 days, no blanket could be found for the pull-out bed, and room service took ~30 minutes to deliver a "Trump" burger (albeit 3:30 AM) and "dental kit" (aka small toothbrush and toothpaste). Overall, excellent amenities and top-notch service!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cmfconsulting
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Las Vegas more than a dozen times and stayed in a number of hotels. This time around, we used Hot Wire to select our hotel and ended up staying at Trump Tower. After reading all the reviews on this site we were concerned that we had chosen poorly, but our stay there turned out pretty well. There were lots of positives. The rooms were very nice and very clean. Service was above average, particularly at the pool. We really liked the pool area and spent a quite a bit of time there. We chose a low floor nearest the strip and it was nice and quiet. Security was good with staff always in the lobby watching over everything. Elevators were plentiful and we never waited more than 10 seconds for one. For those into shopping, Fashion Square mall is right across the street. The ONLY negative was that the hotel is a long two blocks from the strip. I personally found the walk great, but my wife would have liked to be closer to the strip. And of course there's no casino in the hotel; a plus for us but maybe not for everyone. All in all, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Know before you go. I did, and I enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: tvchip
Reviews.Content: I used Priceline to book a 5-star hotel, and that's how I found the Trump. I appreciate the many reviews on TripAdvisor for this hotel. When I arrived, I knew what to expect. Yes, they charge a hidden $15/night "resort fee", and no, I didn't like it any more than the other reviewers here. Since there's not that much of a resort here (a very nice pool and workout facility, but that's it), I found the fee hard to justify. But even with the fee, I paid so little for this room that I still came out way ahead. Unlike some other reviewers here, I had no problems whatsoever with the service. The valet parking attendants were very prompt in getting my car parked and delivered. The bellman took extra time to point out the best running routes around the hotel, on and off the Strip. My regular guest room was oversized and very elegant. It was a joy to come home to this room after a long and busy day. It felt like I was coming home to a very nice house. I've been to Las Vegas 15 times, all for business. I've stayed in other 5-star hotels and some that weren't as nice. I'll be glad to stay at the Trump again, if I can get a deal like the one I got this time.

Reviews.Title: “Thieves”
Reviews.Author: TrumpSucks
Reviews.Content: Trump stole my money !!!!!! I prepaid for the room before I arrived. They froze out 300 dollars for the typical Hotel room insurance. When I checked out, the room was left in perfect condition. They billed me for 93 dollars and anounced that the remaining dollars previously held were credited back to my account. I waited for 30 days and it was never credited back to my travel Card. Daniel, the front desk manger, said that he did but he lied to us. This is awful in these tight economic times.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 stars but not too shabby. Too far away from the rest of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: FCTraveler044
Reviews.Content: I thought I'd try a LV hotel I hadn't tried before. I received a good deal on the Trump through Priceline. The rooms are quite nice--I was in a studio suite. The bathroom was one of the nicest I've seen in a hotel. There's not too much to choose from at the hotel as far as food goes and there is no casino so if you want action, it's a good 10-15 minute walk away. The pool area is nice but seems a bit small. I enjoyed my stay but don't think it's worth paying full price for. One side of the hotel faces a freeway so that can be a little noisy. Yes there is that $15/day resort fee and Internet access is $11.99/day but the WiFi works incredibly well.

Reviews.Title: “Wow this place was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentWorkTraveler
Reviews.Content: I pricelined my room and got a great deal. I was a little worried becuase of so-so reviews on here, but it way exceded my expectations. The room was AMAZING! Giant jacuzzi bath tub in an all marble huge bathroom, a tv in the mirror, huge shower. (only down side was not so great water pressure). Full kitchen with top of the line cooking supplies, super comfy bed. Staff was friendly. Pool was nice. Location was great. Near the Wynn and Encore. The only down side is that it's like a block and a half off the strip and they haven't put in a side walk to get you to the strip so you have to walk in traffic but it's well worth it to stay in a hotel this nice for that price. Great place to stay in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Overall very nice, but I probably won't be back”
Reviews.Author: lknight26
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trump 4/10-4/12. Overall my stay was nice. Won my room on priceline for $67a night, and received a free upgrade to the strip view room which was nice! We were basically here with family looking for a relaxing weekend with the kids. We aren’t gamblers so not having a casino was not issue. It was annoying though to pay a $15 resort fee. You get nothing more for this fee, so to me it’s just another way for the hotel to make some extra cash. Also, no self parking and valet parking is slow. They need to offer self parking because the wait time can get ridiculously irritating. While the rooms were very nice, the Wynn and Bellagio are still to me a step above the Trump. The Wynn (in particular) is just more luxurious. I visited the spa and it was VERY nice I must say. We didn’t get any treatments, just relaxed and took advantage of the steam room and sauna. The pool was lovely and relaxing and very top notch. The service throughout our stay was very good. Everyone we encountered was very helpful, so kudos to Trump! Also, loved that the hotel is non smoking. Overall this is a very nice hotel, just know that you’ll have to pay a $15 fee day (even though you get nothing extra), parking can be a bit slow and it’s valet only, and this hotel is not on the strip. Would I stay here again? Probably not. They need to get rid of the resort fee and offer valet parking before we return.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible. Never again.”
Reviews.Author: l_longhorn
Reviews.Content: We had problems from the start. For one, we were told we had a free upgrade but when we got there the upgrade was an extra nightly surcharge. The "upgrade" basically included an extra bathroom and a kitchenette. In addition, they charge you a mandatory $15/day fee that includes access to the fitness center (usually included in most hotels), complementary water and coffee in the rooms (also usually included), free 800-number dialing (wow, thanks), and access to the parking garage, among a few other silly things. They charge delivery for room service plus an extra mandatory gratuity (more than 20%) on top of it. And, to top it off, there was no hot water the next morning for showers. When we complained about these things, management basically couldn't have cared less. We told them we were going to write a bad review and they said "fine, do whatever you want." We checked out after only one night and had a fabulous time the rest of the trip at the Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: krissy5872
Reviews.Content: We were going to Vegas for our wedding, and having booked on Priceline, we didn't have a choice in which 5 star hotel we got. We were disappointed when we ended up with the Trump, having read some bad reviews on Tripadvisor. But we went with an open mind, and hoped for the best. I can only reiterate what most people are saying, the rooms are gorgeous, the lack of smoke was great....HOWEVER..the service is severely lacking for a 5 star hotel. From check in, to check out, we had bad experiences everywhere. Front desk rudeness, to the bell desk losing a package that was delivered to us, housekeeping leaving wet towels on our floor, to the concierge forgetting to book the shuttle to the airport for us...it was one thing after another. Needless to say, after 5 days here, we were happy to go home. Will not stay again, no matter what the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel but Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: C_D_M06
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. I loved the room, was huge, with a sitting area, whirpool tub, large bathroom, kitchenette. ... A beautiful hotel. However, it was very noisy. I stayed on the 33rd floor, almost at the top, and could hear ambulances and the train like they were right outside my window. The hotel is a 5 star but the location is a 1.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet, clean, and no smoking!”
Reviews.Author: WanderingDad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The rooms are very spacious and well-appointed. Make sure you stay on the side of the hotel that looks toward the strip. The rooms on the other side (facing the freeway, which we changed rooms because of) are exposed to loud train whistles all night long. The pool is just okay, but it is very quiet. This hotel has no casino but is in walking distance to Wynn and the other hotels in that area. The entire property is non-smoking, which we really liked.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute must!!!”
Reviews.Author: ginger18
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! The upgraded us to a one bedroom corner view. The rooms are beautiful and the bathroom is huge. We loved the bath tub (fits two perfectly), and it has a window overlooking Vegas. The pool isn't anything special, but it's a pool and it's a couple stories up so you only see the mountains and the top of nearby casinos. The mall is right across the street. It's an easy walk to the strip, and there isn't much back there so the street is never all that busy to cross. At first we were kind of bummed that there wasn't a casino. It is so nice to walk into a smoke free lobby and the elevators are right there, instead of walking through a casino. The staff was great to us. We cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: Saumarez
Reviews.Content: This is a non smoking, non gambling five star hotel. The great deal about this place is that it is meant to be the relaxing. The rooms was perfect. The pool is small (for Vegas) but so relaxing and clean. The lobby is impressive. The staff was nice. There are two small negative points : #1 : 15$ resort fee is more like a hidden fee. #2 an I think they are too much understaff to deal with Vegas busiest periods, so expect wait if it is the case. If not, it's not even an issue. Right now the prices are so low, it's not a deal, it's a steal !

Reviews.Title: “Would pay more for a bit of service”
Reviews.Author: einseattle
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a trip to Las Vegas with our kids. My dad lives there so we visit fairly often. The Trump Hotel rooms really are lovely. We had a one bedroom suite that had all we needed for a family of four. That's really all they have to offer, though. The service was not great. Housekeeping failed to come to our room the first full day there. They stopped by the next morning to ask us when we'd like the room cleaned. We gave them a time and returned to our room in the late afternoon to find they had not come. Since there is no casino, not much choice for restaurants (and when I wanted to eat something at 11 AM, neither was open) and the spa is insanely overpriced, we had to leave the hotel to do anything except go swimming. The pool is nice (but no frills). I left wishing we had stayed at THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay which also offers one bedroom suites. It would have cost us a bit more but I would have left much more satisfied.
