Better pool, better location, better customer service, more choices for eating, close proximity to a casino with the quiet lobby that's better for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious”
Reviews.Author: rvgonzo
Reviews.Content: They have mandatory valet that you have to pay tips for. The bathroom was a little dirty which is one of my biggest pet peeves, but the room was fairly nice. No casino so all other prices are ridiculously high. The hotel itself was ok nothing to write home about. There wasn't a tiny gift shop to buy things like tylenol or shampoo. It is across the street from the fashion mall in the back. We were supposed to stay two nights but decided to go elsewhere after being there for an hour. When we checked out we where so happy to get out of there that we didn't notice that they had over charged us for the nights stay. I called on March 6th to complain. I was told that he would "call right back"! I waited until the end of March and was transferred to someone in accounting and got a voice mail so I left a message. I had to call again the first of April and left another message. I had to call yet again and finally asked for a supervisor and had to leave another message. I told them I was going to write to the newspaper in my message. Boy she couldn't call me back quick enough. I got a call back within five minutes. It took them ten minutes to fix the problem and charge back my card. What an ordeal! This is only have the story. Just be aware that they "secure" your card $200 per person per night. So if there are three of you and you are staying two nights it will cost you a security of $1200. They don't say that anywhere on their website and were a little shocked to find this out when arriving. When we didn't have the full amount on our card and it was declined they sent the manager out to embarrass us saying pretty loudly "You don't have the money to stay here"? The staff was young and ill trained. We definitely will never stay at "The Donald" again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Valdez123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Trump. We got an excellent deal on Hotels.com so I was a little worried. The room was fantastic. It looks exactly like the web site. Service was flawless. Some other reviewers have complained that it is not on the strip and does not have a casino. Both are true. It was so nice coming back to a quiet, non smoke filled hotel after a day of playing in Sin City.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful establishment lacking major frills to be 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: TheGarys
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Trump in April... While I was happy to upgrade mid trip to the casino-less Trump, I was dissappointed by the lack of ambiance and distiction I was expecting from the property. I am big on customer service and already was miffed by the "mandatory" resort fee...like other reviewers I felt that if its mandatory then why not just add it to the price of the hotel room daily rate? But more than that the fee didn't cover anything other than free shoe shine and two mini bottles of water a day and parking (which is free EVERYHERE on the strip)....not incld were internet access, wifi, business center usuage etc. GO FIGURE. I found that ridiculous....also RIDICULOUS were the room service prices (eggs, 2 sausage links, toast and hashbrowns were 26 dollars + 18% grat + room service fee + tax) The building which puts you in the mind of a park avenue condo building, also lacked the charm of having a staff that made you feel warm and welcomed like you were arriving to yur home destination every time you walked in the door... they were drab, impersonal and made you feel like you were bothering them by askign a question. The security features of this hotel are fantastic however. I appreciated the security camped out front of the elevators that checked for room keys...I appreciated the seperated area where you could answer the door without giving access to your room. I appreciated the inability to get your car without verification of ownership. what I didnt like was that you cannot call down for your car, the hotel lobby while casion-less is devoid of ANY activity, it was so dead, there was not light music being played, there was no activity at the down stairs bar/lounge area where one would typically come in a potentially be enticed to have a glass of wine and relax and chat with guests before retring to your room. There was nothing....the place was so BLAH. The rooms however were SPECTACULAR. Very spacious, very comfy, very modern (the tv in the bathroom mirror was a treat) marble everywhere etc...what was missing... the freebies that we all coem to expect and enjoy that we find tucked away in our rooms....although the lender ROBE made up for it a bit...that robe was worth the $125 it cost to take it home!!!! Unfortunately the housekeeping staff was lack luster...they don't show up until after the afternoon??? Also there was a room down the hall where room service trays and garbage were elft out for a day and a half and no one came to pick it up...YUCK... Needless to say I expected much more from a 5 star Trump property...they still have much work to do in my opinion

Reviews.Title: “Awesome rooms, poor amenities.”
Reviews.Author: phxLOLA
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a one-bedroom suite. It was gorgeous, spacious, and cheap ($69 a night on Priceline). A full kitchen, dining area, living room, guest bathroom, master bedroom, and master bath (double shower heads, double sinks, huge Jacuzzi tub). So, we were satisfied with the room. We were on the 44th floor, facing north. We could see the train passing by, and yes, it was loud. It woke both my husband and I, as did police/ambulence sirens 3 times in one night. Though there was no noise at all between rooms/floors. The pool was OK. It was large, 2 hot tubs, really nice lounge furniture, but it was packed. The pool bar has a very limited menu. My biggest problem with the hotel was the lack of restaurants and entertainment. Waking up hung over on a Saturday morning all you want is a cheap, greasy meal like McDonalds (same goes for coming home at 2 am). But there is no fast food anywhere near. In fact, there is one very expensive restaurant and a lobby bar. That's it. It really wasn't that far from the strip. Equivalent to about 3 blocks to the Wynn. Directly across from Fashion Show Mall. I prefer the central strip and a casino however.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Peaceful, and Clean”
Reviews.Author: lilskjbaby
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very peaceful. Mainly because it is off the strip. Just across the street from the mall in case you forgot any important items. Walgreens is also w/in walking distance. Quite a walk from most hotels aside from the Wynn/Encore. You have to take cabs EVERYWHERE from this hotel. Staff was very helpful. A maid came up to clean our bathtub @ 3am and was very pleasant. I only saw about 10 other guests the whole time, but it might be because of the time of year we went. There is also a complimentary Escalade truck that will drive you around. It was overall a good experience. Aside from the bathroom not being spotless when we arived, and it being VERY quite, it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms; very poor service”
Reviews.Author: onechase
Reviews.Content: The Trump seems like a good idea-- very low rates ($85 gets you a room and an upgrade to a 1 bedroom suite) and the rooms are very nicely put together. The problem is that the upside ends there. The location is not good at all. To get to the strip, you need to either walk through the Fashion Show Mall, or on Fashion Show Blvd., which has no sidewalks because it's a construction site. There isn't nearly enough staff to run the place properly-- nobody to hail you a cab at the curb, nobody to open the doors when you enter, nobody to help you with your bags, and so forth. Any request from room service or housekeeping took more than an hour to fulfill, without fail. Very disappointed. I was definitely left with the impression that I didn't get a deal-- I got what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded room was wonderful bonus!”
Reviews.Author: PeterJerrod
Reviews.Content: We had a one-night stay at the Trump on April 4. We checked in around 8:00 pm and mentioned to the receptionist that it was our dad's first trip to Vegas. He upgraded our room to a one-bedroom premium suite overlooking the strip. We paid $100 a night for the room on Priceline. The room was listed on the hotel website for $350. What a deal! The room was gorgeous....the king size bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom (with walk-in shower -- two shower heads!) was bigger than our one-car garage back home. We loved the TV built into the mirror in the bathroom! Very comfortable living room area with dining room table and kitchenette. We had to call for linens for the sofa bed. After one half hour, they did not arrive, so we placed a second call to the front desk and we had our linens within 10 minutes. We took advantage of the well-appointed gym but it was a bit too cold for swimming in the Olympic style pool. We loved the fact that there is no casino at the hotel....this was a huge plus! It made the hotel seem so much more classy and comfortable. $15 resort fee includes valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious getaway, smoke-free Vegas”
Reviews.Author: KimmieS
Reviews.Content: Two girlfriends and I planned a weekend to Vegas, and I booked a studio suite at the Trump using Priceline for $88/night (plus tax and resort fees). I had read all the reviews on Trip Advisor before, so I called the hotel the night before our arrival to confirm our reservation and to request a room away from the train. The woman on the phone was delightful and happily agreed to accommodate my request. Check-in on Friday was a breeze--the front desk was fully staffed and we were waiting less than 5 minutes. The young man that checked us in was very friendly and when I asked him to confirm we were in a room far from the train, he said that he'd moved us to a better room and the train noise should be minimal. We were on the 50th floor with a view of the Stratosphere, and when we saw our room we were delighted that we had been upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite! The room was beautifully appointed, with 2 full bathrooms and a separate master bedroom. The master bathroom was absolutely huge! We enjoyed massages at the Trump spa, which were wonderful. The spa itself was smaller than expected, but nice. We asked for discounts on the massages and received $50 off coupons (the massages are $150 each for 60 minutes, so that saved a chunk). We did not use the gym or the pool, though the resort fee included use of both. Since we were a group of 3, two of us slept in the king size bed in the master bedroom and the third slept on the pull-out sofa. Housekeeping came and made up the pull out bed for us (upon request). The "real" bed was quite comfortable; my friend on the pull-out said it was just "okay." The first night, the train woke up my friend who is a very light sleeper. I had earplugs in, so I didn't hear it at all. The second night, the train woke up both the light sleeper and me (even with my earplugs), but we fell back to sleep shortly thereafter. We were on the 50th floor (there are 52 floors total), so just plan on hearing the train, especially if you are on a lower floor. We didn't hear any of our neighbors at all; in fact, we never saw anyone else on the 50th floor all weekend. Housekeeping came once daily; we left our room by around 10am each day and by the time we'd return (around 3 or 4pm), the room was made up. The housekeeping staff did a great job, too. We really liked the idea of pushing a button to indicate the room was ready to be made up or to not be disturbed instead of hanging a sign on the door like every other hotel out there. We knew about the resort fee, and given the deal I got on Priceline, I really didn't mind paying $15/day. They noted that it included use of the gym, pool, and in-room stocking of coffee/water, and some other things I can't remember. On Friday night, there was a great lounge singer in the lobby by the bar and we enjoyed listening to him while drinking raspberry lemon drop martinis (very good). The wait staff and bartenders were really friendly and came over to chat with us. As for getting to The Strip, you have a couple options. There are always cabs waiting in front of the hotel, so you can take a cab. If you want to walk, the fashion mall is directly across from the hotel entrance, however, there is no pedestrian crosswalk, and you must cross with care (there is a surprising number of cars that drive fast past the hotel, so watch out). If you walk through the mall, it can take awhile as it is a little confusing inside, so I'd give myself 15 or 20 minutes to find The Strip. Note that the mall closes at 9pm, so it's not a late-night option. If you decide to just walk down Fashion Show Drive straight from the hotel to The Strip, it takes about 5 minutes (not 20 minutes as some reviewers have said, unless they are really slow walkers). Also, there is not an erotic museum between the hotel and the strip, despite what you may have read in other reviews on here, and there aren't crazy people lingering along the walkway, so I wouldn't call it "dangerous." It is important to note that the sidewalk on the side of the hotel is not continuous, and as you get closer to the strip, you will have to walk on the side of the road, which is a little scary if the drivers aren't paying attention. In my opinion, it would behoove the hotel to finish paving the sidewalk all the way to Las Vegas Blvd. for the safety of its guests. If you don't want to walk or pay for a cab, the hotel offers a free shuttle to the Wynn between 4pm and midnight on Friday and Saturday nights. We didn't take advantage of it, but the doorman offered every time we walked out! On Saturday night, we walked down to The Mirage to see "LOVE" and it took us 30 minutes total, door to door. We are all in pretty good shape, but I don't think we were walking exceedingly fast (we were in heels!), so hopefully that gives you an idea of how far the Trump is from other hotels. All in all, the Trump is my new favorite hotel in Vegas. It was nice not to have my hair smelling like smoke all weekend, I didn't miss the "ding-ding-ding-ing" of slot machines in the lobby, and the staff went out of their way to make us happy. If the weather had been nicer, I would have loved to take advantage of the pool as it looked really relaxing. It was a great weekend and I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for anything more!”
Reviews.Author: dougers79
Reviews.Content: So this was another one of my late night hotwire bargain finds. Usually I am leary about what looks too good to be true...but I pressed the "I agree" button anyway. I am SOOOO glad I did. Just like you would expect from anything that carries the trump name on it...not one detail went unoticed. Everything is magnificent. Check in was a breeze. A long line...but that is to be expected in any hotel in Vegas. We got to our room and it was everything the web site said it was and then some. I do not usually go to Las Vegas for an amazing hotel room...I use it more or less as a closet...but after a long day in the casino's and walking around...you come back to a bathroom to be rivaled by any hotel and the most comfortable bed in the world. Here I am in Las Vegas and I almost didnt want to leave the room. The staff was simply amazing. Housekeeping, guest services, bellman...the guy who was cleaning the elevator...every one of them asked how we were doing and were EXTREMELY friendly. Genuine. My only complaint was there was no casino in the hotel but in the end that proabably did more good than bad. The location is a little off the strip but a quick 3 or 4 minute walk and you are on the strip...if its during mall hours...you can cross the street and go from the mall to the strip. It was a super enjoyable stay. Worth every penny weather you book through them or on another website. I know it is my new top choice of places to stay when I am in town!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: dbackroyal
Reviews.Content: For $89 per night plus $15 per night resort fee one still can't beat the luxury anywhere in Vegas for the price. Rooms were elegant beyond expectations wih a full kitchenette, a jacuzzi tub, and a room half again the size of any other in Vegas.. It was one block east of the strip and it was not a smoky casino downstairs. The Fashion Show mall is across the street south. It does not open until 10:00 so you are a captive to the hotel for Breakfast. You can have a buffet breakfast which is delicious but very expensive $62 with tax and tip) or you can but something ahead of time somewhere else and store in your kitchenette.The restraunt does serve excellent food and we splurged for breakfast and ate smaller meals during the day. I look for elegance and value and this hotel gave the best of both. The bed was really great for this 60 year old body. Try it, you'll like it!

Reviews.Title: “Gambling-free new hotel close to fashion mall”
Reviews.Author: jusaja
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel with nice decoration, a non-gambling oasis in Las Vegas. The rooms are large, clean and with necessary facilities. The view to the city is also suberb. The pool area is also nice ans the pool sizable. Fittness center is good but spa very expensive. The service is available but a bit cold atmosphere prevails. The near-by road is not so nice to walk, safe but in the middle of construction ground. Starbucks is 5 mins away in the fashion mall. Trins regularly pass the area by night and make a bit noise, noise may come also from neighbours slamming doors.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Rooms - Great Place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: HobokenTravel
Reviews.Content: Trump was a great place to stay. We paid $89/night for a Studio and were upgraded to a one-bedroom. I've stayed at 4 places over the years. MGM, Mandalay Bay, The Luxor and Trump. Trump was the best of those 4, by far. It's got a nice pool and isnt very loud. The only downside is that we couldnt get a signal for wireless internet or our cell phones which was a drag. Other than that issue, it was a really nice room with a really nice pool. So, if you are not a big casino and are willing to spend the $15 for Internet it is well worth it over the 3 aforementioned hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the jacuzzi!”
Reviews.Author: 777flower
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Would definitely come back if the price is good. Stayed here for a conference nearby. No casino and there is a security guy filtering out people who are not staying there at times. Full kitchen - pity had no time to use. This is a bit out of the way if you want the location to be central strip. Bad thing is the $15 resort fee. :-(

Reviews.Title: “I was floored by the beauty of this place-affordable price”
Reviews.Author: DallasLisa
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a layover in Vegas and decided to stay the night. We checked through Expedia and found a room at Trump for 89.00. We couldn't believe it considering it is a 5 star hotel and it was gorgeous! We were on the 27th floor, HUGE tub and walk in shower, tv in the bathroom mirror, plush robes, you name it. Because our luggage travelled ahead of us and we didnt't have toiletries, we asked the front desk to send us razors, toothbrushes, etc which the did promptly. It is just off the strip, but close enough to walk to (behind Treasure Island)

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience! Service was Outstanding in Every Department!”
Reviews.Author: DavidHitchcock33
Reviews.Content: I booked thru Priceline for March 27-29, hoping to get any other 5 Star Resort so I was disappointed to get Trump. It turned out to be perfect. We arrived early after driving in from Murrieta, CA. You exit Spring Mountain. Stay in the left lane of the off-ramp. After valeting, we waited in a short line to check in. I asked to be away from the train and have a pool view. She put us in unit 5728, on the 57th floor with a direct view high above the city with a perfect strip view. Amazingly, we could hear the train during the day, but never noticed it at night. We were able to see the Bellagio water show. Before the wife and I had a chance to finish bringing in our belongings, the kids were so excited about the jucuzzi tub. Be warned, just add alot less shampoo than you normally would for a bubble bath. With the jets on, it made a mountain of bubbles and the kids could hide in it. The unit was top-notch. The maid service was perfect. Everything was replenished, dishes washed, even the sofa bed was made up for us. Put the minifridge on the coldest level and your drinks will get cold fast and freeze. The pool area wasn't impressive, just functional. It was heated though and the kids still had alot of fun. Service there was also very nice. A life guard grabbed us towels and escorted us to a large, padded lounger that could fit several people. When the pool closed, they allowed us to keep the kids wrapped up in the pool towels up to the room instead of having to return the towels at the pool and have the kids go up cold. The kids ages are 6, 4 and almost 2. The hotel is non-smoking and we really appreciated breathing clean air. By the way, the lobby area smells great. Sounds weird, but you notice it. Walk into some Vegas hotels and you think you're gonna leave with lung cancer. About the walk to the strip. Are you kidding? Its 5 minutes max. Think about this. Stay at any of the mega resorts, and its a hike to the elavator from your room, then thru the casino before you get to the strip. Its probably about the same time. Most of us are gluttons while in Vegas and could use the walk to burn a few calories anyway. The location is great because you have the convenience of the mall across the street and 5 star resorts like Encore, Wynn, Palazzo, and Venetian very close by. Check-out was smooth, no hidden fees, just the expected resort fee. The valet wait wasn't long at all and we checked out on a Sunday. My brothers were at the Encore, checked out on a Monday, and waited for a half hour for their vehicle. After driving away, we realized we left some clothes hanging in the closet. We called the Trump, turned around, and the maid had already prepared it for security to bring down to us. It was truly a perfect overall experience. For Hotwire users, Hotwire has a separate 5 star condo central strip category and 5 star hotel category. The Trump is the 5 star condo. That may change when City Center and other projects finish. We'll be back, the value is great and the service even greater.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, nothing else”
Reviews.Author: wallyQ
Reviews.Content: - Very Nice and Spacious Studio Rooms - Modern Design and Comfortable - Comfortable Bed - Wonderful Big Bathroom - Nice Lobby - Good Breakfast, but not much selection - Bad, Slow Service at the Reception - Poor Location, Far walk to the strip. Around 20 mins Good stay, but I had a much more enjoyable stay at the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Stocks3019
Reviews.Content: My giest and I were upgraded from a studio to a 1 bedroom suite at check in. Our room had an amazing view, and the hotel possessed every amenity one could think. Hands down, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Daddy04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trump for one night in Vegas. We booked via Priceline.com, we bid $97 plus taxes/fees, the total was $111.43. The hotel rooms are fabulous! Let's start with the bathroom...very big! The mirror had a TV built in...first time I seen that. The bathtub was big enough for two people and the shower could easily hold 4 people! Bedroom/Sitting Room...the room was basically a studio with a nice LCD TV, King Bed with a Sofa pullout. There was also a kitchenette with a mini SubZero fridge, electric flat stove top, microwave and all the mini kitchen appliances and tools. The pool was very nice, kids enjoyed it. Finally, there is no casino in the hotel. Loved that...no smoke!

Reviews.Title: “The "Donald" outdid himself”
Reviews.Author: BobCNewJerseyUSA
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 day stay at the Trump International. For a "standard" room it was excellent. It was actually a studio with a stove, micro etc. The cost was only 89.00 but they did slip in a 15.00 resort fee! The room was very sizeable and the batroom was great. It is right off the strip up by the Wynn so it is very convenient. If I returned with my wife I would definetely stay there again. She would love it. If attending a convention I would probably stay closer to the convention center and pick a hotel that has a casino. Just a personal thing!

Reviews.Title: “things that you should know”
Reviews.Author: keninab
Reviews.Content: Four of us have just come back from one weeks holiday in this hotel, firstly we had a fantastic stay but we would like to let future travellers have the benefits of our stay. When you arrive at the airport you can catch a Hotel shuttle bus for 7$ each that drops off at all hotels. the strip is right next to the airport but the strip is very busy and it took about 35 minutes to get to our hotel. The Hotel is a little bit out but by no means to far, one main benefit was that it was quiet because there is no casino in the hotel. when we checked in they swiped our Visa and told us there was a $200 deposit which could be charged for any damage to the hotel property, also there was a daily $15 + tax resort charge, we asked what this was for and we were told it covered things like car parking, use of the Gym and swimming pool and incidentals used in the room, we said we were not happy to pay this charge but were told it was compulsary. The rooms was beautiful, very large and had everything we needed. you can even cook in the room if you want. being English we wanted some Tea, which was not in the room, when we rang Housekeeping we were told we would have to pay for the Tea bags and $5 for them to be sent to the room. we had several minor problems in the room but when we reported them they sent someone up quickly to put them right. All the staff were VERY friendly and could not do enough for us. Drinks are very expensive wherever you go in Vegas and vertually everywhere you go if you want to sit at a table and just have a drink you are told you have to sit at the bar unless you are having food, we though this was strange as there were many empty tables. when we came to check out we told the receptionist about our various problems and that we did not think we should pay the $15 a day resort charge, he had a word with the Manager and the charges were dropped. On the Strip going towards Downtown there were two great places for Breakfast, Peppermill which was the dearest and Denys they were exellent and you were seated quickly. We all had a fantastic stay, one week was not long enough for us, we never stopped but did not see everything. We caught a Taxi back to the airport, the driver was really friendly, the Taxi bill was $15 we were so pleased we gave him $20. When you read up before you go you get the impression you have to constantly give Tips, this is not true, we gave tips when we thought they had been earned. We cannot wait to go to Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Five Star...but good value on Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: Coolhandluke162
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel off of Hotwire when I had to go to Las Vegas last second. The price on hotwire was great ($100 a night) and it was a good value because of that, but by no means is this a five star hotel. Valet service took forever. It was a strange check in, just not the feel of a nice hotel that knows what is going on. We had all of our confirmation papers from Hotwire, but they could not find my reservation. It took about ten minutes, which was fine, but they acted like it was my fault. Their rooms were really nice when you walked in, but there were a lot of little things that were broken (marks against the wall, broken handle to the bathroom, stains in the rug). I was just in Vegas on a quick business trip, but I would not have like this hotel if I was on vacation. There was not an option to park your car other than valet, which you were charged for, there was a hotel/destination fee that was not included in the rate (which did not include use of internet or gym) and you had to pay to get into the pool...which I have not heard of before. Anyway, I would stay here again for the same rate, but would not pay rack rate for this hotel as a "5 star" property

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Hotel - 1st Class!”
Reviews.Author: JPSCheshire
Reviews.Content: Trump International Hotel is out of this world. We have stayed in some nice hotels, but this is probably the pick of them. Trump International is located off the strip, but travellers should not be deterred by this. If you cross the road at the front of the hotel, you can walk through Nordstrom in the mall facing and be on the strip in 5 minutes. If you are travelling from England and are unsure whether to stay here, then this is my suggestion. Stay if you want a smoke free environment and no casino - this is purely a 5 star hotel with no gambling facilities - if you want to gamble - this is LAS VEGAS - Casinos are everywhere! You will have a modern kitchenette in your room for cooking. If you enjoy the environment of a top class hotel, this is for you. Each room has a jacuzzi bath and TV installed into the bathroom mirror. Views from the higher floors are out of this world. If you want to be on the strip with a casino on the ground floor with people getting hammered 24/7 and the bustle of the gambling arena, then go for a lesser hotel on the strip. It may suit you more. Also, Trump charges a compulsory hidden $15 per night ameneities fee which bumps up your price which gives you access to the pool and spa...but when the sun is out, you tend to feel it as the sun reflects off the tower to the pool area. Also, you may read bad reviews on valet parking. It takes about 3-5 minutes for them to bring up your car. We are holidaying, why does it matter! It is not a problem. Like most strip hotels, the services offered in the hotel are expensive, but it is Vegas living after all. Overall, great friendly staff and a top class hotel which should be experienced. Our thoughts are that Donald Trump is a business man at his best. Looks like hotels will be built nearby and this hotel will continue to thrive over the next few years as more construction takes place in Vegas and will become amongst the hotspots of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Low point of trip”
Reviews.Author: apesen
Reviews.Content: It is by no means 5 stars. Sure it's one of the cheapest hotels for a 5 star hotel but I guarantee the service at the 4 star hotels would surpass this one by a long shot. First of all valet service took a lot of time even during early afternoon, we had to wait at least 15 minutes for our car. We could not even call down for our car earlier thus more wasted time. I asked for connecting rooms 2 months before my reservation, they said that would accomodate me and our 2 rooms ended up being on completely different floors. Our neighbors were loud college frat boys that had some keg party in their room. Seeing that it was past midnight and I had been stuck in traffic for six hours, I politely asked for a change in rooms which was not accomodated. They said I could make a noise complaint and that was it. I did order room service which was overpriced and I was given the wrong item. The server than proceeded to bring back the actual item that I ordered and expected a tip! HA. Laughable. The location was not too bad since it wasn't that far of a walk to the Wynn which is a much better hotel. My advice splurge for the Bellagio or the Wynn or even stay at the MGM grand. The stay will be much better there.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Edwin70
Reviews.Content: This is not a five star hotel and not worthy to belong to the leading hotels of the world group. The materials used in the hotel are expensive and it's clear that there is invested a lot of money in the hotel, but the way this hotel is managed makes it not a pleasant experiece. This is not what you expect from a 5-star hotel. Some notes: - The ventilation system does not work very well, because of this you hear a lot of noise from outside, for example a lot of cars from the freeway closeby, a train every hour and - I noticed a lot of things being broken: doors that do not close properly, handles that are loose, a toiletseat that is not fixed which caused me to nearly fall off the toilet, a broken lamp, broken tv in the bathroom, broken checkout computer-system, .. In a real 5-star hotel most of these would have been fixed. - The staff was not what you expect from a 5-star hotel. The bell-boy just dumps your bags right after the door, the concierge does not really help out and when we walked to our hotel-room we needed to show our hotel-key to a doorman that looked like a bouncer from a nightclub. The inside of the closet was really dirty and somebody just walked into the room at 9pm when the do not disturb light was on. You have to pay extra for everything you use. You have to pay a mandatory $15,- resort fee for things like water and newspaper, but that does not included internet (an extra charge) or use of pool (also an extra charge) or overnight parking (I believe a $15,- charge per night which is very expensive for vegas). We also stayed in at the Signature at MGM. They really look the same. Same size room, the same ammendities. But what a difference: the Signature is a pleasure to stay at. Trump although it looks great gives you an unpleasent feel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay off the strip”
Reviews.Author: syknyc
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I'm NOT a gambler. My main purpose for going to Vegas was to have a fun and relaxing weekend away. I just wanted to lounge by the pool, go to a fun club/lounge, and maybe see a show. With that said, The Trump was perfect for me. I personally liked not having a casino at the bottom of the hotel. I liked having less foot traffic in the lobby, which for me, made it more relaxing coming back from the strip. But, if gambling is your thing, The Trump is only a short walk to casinos. So in short- The lobby and rooms are very nice and clean. The pool was simple but adequate. There are plush lounge chairs with pool side service. The gym and spa (although i didn't use either) seemed sufficient. The Trump is very close to the Wynn (Tryst) and I saw Jersey boys at the Palazzo which was a very close walk. The only con is that if you want to be in the "center of all the action" - Its not on the strip. But for me.... it was perfect for a weekend get-a-way.

Reviews.Title: “Nice try but no 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: kilarney1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is polished and snazzy. However, it leaves A LOT to to be desired. Upon arrival, no bellhop greeted me or offered to help with bags. After check-in, I noticed that the previous guest had left her nightie hanging in my bathroom! The maid had completely overlooked it! Then, I went to use the small spa, which has no hot tub. After 20 minutes in the steam room, I was heated up and ready for a hot shower. Problem was, there was no hot water! The burners were down. I was told this has happened several times before. I caught a bad chill during the 15 minutes that I was standing in the 65 degree locker room trying each and every shower. No apology from the mindless female attendant and no manager on duty! Even though I was on a high floor, I could still hear the train whistle like it was in my room! Very loud. And each time the guests next to me shut their door, my windows and wall shook! These noises woke me up early each morning. Trump didn't bother sound proofing the windows, so you can hear a car horn 50 floors below! The restaurant is elegant and the service and food are very good, but the prices are very very high and the menu is limited. There is only one dining choice. The pool and fitness center are nice but pretty small by Vegas standards. I tried to reach the V.P. of the property, but the operator refused to put me through! They are instructed not to let guests through to him. I could not believe it! I also heard from several guests and employees that Trump has cut a lot of staff recently. Perhaps that is why the service is so lacking. Overall, it was nowhere near a 5 star experience. 4 star at best and that is pushing it. C'mon Trump! I thought you were known for top-notch properties. What happened?

Reviews.Title: “Smokefree & quiet”
Reviews.Author: customerNZ
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned by the ordinary reviews that preceded our trip, however from the courteous check-in through to the helpful bellhops & valet parking we found the Trump people really tried to make our stay a relaxing experience. We had no problem asking and getting a strip view high up away from any train noise and the room was everything you would expect from Donald including a fabulous huge spa bath we soaked in every night to sooth our aching muscles from all the walking we were doing, to the wonderfully comfortable king size beds that we had trouble getting out of every morning. The maid service was very good and we got everything we needed without having to ask. Overall we were very happy with our stay and would have no hesitation staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Five Star Hotel??”
Reviews.Author: cjnctraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Trump during a business trip to Las Vegas. I was disappointed with the location, because to do anything, you must go outside and walk to shopping, dining or a casino. The Trump has one restaurant and a poolside snack bar and has no casino. I am not a wimp about walking, but the location did get annoying as the trip progressed. The rooms were fine, nothing special. The pool area looks similar to one you would find in your local gym with more seating and probably a slightly larger pool. My biggest problem with the Trump was the service. If this is the service one expects in a five star hotel, then I will happily stay at the Red Roof Inn. After being out of my room from 8:00a.m. to 2:30 p.m. I returned to find my room uncleaned and a message waiting for me. Housekeeping said they could not clean my room because the do not disturb button was lit. I explained to them that no button at all was lit because it was broken. They offered to clean my room immediately. I said great, I would go to the gym for an hour. After my time at the gym, I was starving but found the poolside snack bar was closed for a private party. Since I was very hot and sweaty, a trip outside the hotel for food did not seem like a good idea. I decided to take a shower and head out in the world for food. I got back to my room and it was still not cleaned. I called and they started talking about the light again. I explained that it was broken once again and they agreed to clean immediately. After a half hour of waiting, still no housekeeping. I went to the pool to get clean towels and threw my dirty towels into the hallway. After my shower I called housekeeping again. Once again we had the discussion about the light. They brought my towels, picked up the old ones out of the hallway and offered to clean my room. I told them I had to get dressed and dry my hair first. To make a long story a little longer, when my husband and I returned to our room around 10:00 p.m. it had still had not been cleaned. I made a call to housekeeping and just begged for some coffee for the morning. We talked about the light again, and I told them to never mention the light to me again. They did show up with the coffee and offered to clean the room, but I declined. Housekeeping was actually not my biggest complaint! We started out on the wrong foot with the bell desk at the beginning of our trip. My husband asked them to bring up packages to our room that had been delivered for his business meeting. We went down to the desk the next morning and they retrieved our boxes from storage, handed them to us and never offered to deliver them to our room. We were on our way out, but trudged up to our room with several boxes unaided. On the morning of our departure we called the bell desk to pick up our luggage. We had a ton of it because this was a multi city trip. After fifteen minutes of waiting we carried the luggage downstairs ourselves. I went to the bell desk and asked them where they had been. The bell captain looked confused so I said never mind. I did then ask him to retrieve our golf clubs out of storage. He brought the golf clubs to the bell desk, and then three bell people stood by talking to each other while I wrestled all of our luggage outside. (my husband was in a long line checking out). I thought they liked to help people so they would get tips, but it must work differently at Trump. I was actually making quite a disturbance trying to muscle the hard shell golf carriers out the revolving door, but no one saw fit to lend a hand. I would be really upset with this hotel if we had not only paid $114.00 a night for the room. We paid an economy price for economy service. You can get a room now for $89.00, and that is close the rate of a super budget hotel. You won't be disappointed with the service! If you want a real five star experience without a casino, try the Four Seasons at the other end of the strip. It is the top floors of Mandalay Bay, so it is convenient and a truly beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, outstanding service, but beware of the resort fee”
Reviews.Author: jpk2003
Reviews.Content: We booked the Trump after the hotel picked up our bid on Priceline ($100/night for the weekend). We were hoping to get the Wynn or the Venetian, as we did on our last trip. So, initially, we were a little bummed, particularly after reading that the Trump had no Casino, charged a $15/night mandatory resort fee, and was a bit of a walk to the Strip. It turned out, though, that none of these things were a very big deal and we had an excellent stay at this property. The walk to the Wynn/Strip is a short, pleasant, 5-minute jaunt. Moreover, you can enter Nordstrom’s across the street and walk through the mall to the strip. We also found the Trump lobby to be pleasantly scented, which we much preferred to the ubiquitous cigarette smell that perpetually wafts through all Vegas casinos. The resort fee, on the other hand, is lame (if you have no choice but to pay, they should just include it in the price of the hotel rather than make their guests feel that the hotel is trying to cheat them out of a few bucks). However, it does come with some nice perks such as late check-out, a choice of a range of newspapers, 2 free small bottles of water per day, use of the pool and access to the fitness center. Concerning the paper, we did get the Sunday NY Times (eventually), which I would have had to search all over town for and buy for $5. On Monday, though, I received no paper. I’m sure a call to the front desk would have rectified this, but I still had the NY Times magazine from Sunday, so didn’t bother. We also made use of the late check-out (until 4pm), which is convenient if you have a later flight. We never tried the pool or the fitness center, but hear both are quite nice. The service at the trump is outstanding! Over the course of our stay, I requested extra clothing hangers, a down pillow, regular coffee (we only had de-cafe in our room) and a newspaper (on Sunday the times hadn’t yet been delivered at 7am, but they said they would run a copy up as soon as it arrived); all items were brought immediately and the operator, Jasmine, was very pleasant. In fact, everyone we spoke with at the hotel was very kind and accommodating. The only slight exception is the maid service. In addition to not providing regular coffee, they failed to refill our conditioner (which was empty). The studio suites at the Trump are among our favorites on the strip. We still slightly prefer the rooms at the Venetian (we like their living room area a bit more and prefer the extra flat screen to the half kitchen – it’s more esthetically pleasing if less functional). The Trump, though, has a far superior bathroom (a Jacuzzi tub and a cool TV built into the mirror) and the fridge in the kitchen/living room is a nice touch. The beds are very comfortable and, provided you get a suite facing the strip, the views are spectacular. We were in 2827 and had an incredible view of the Encore, the Wynn, the Palazzo, the Venetian, Treasure Island, and the Mirage. Strip view rooms are supposed to be an extra $40/night, but we politely requested an upgrade at check-in and they gave it to us. While it’s clearly a 5-star resort, I don’t think it’s worthy of a 5-star review given the resort fee, the coffee, conditioner and newspaper. These are obviously very small issues and I expect they won’t have much impact on most readers’ stay. For those that stay at the trump, I would like to pass on a few of additional recommendations. Esthetically, the Encore casino (about a 6-minute walk) is our favorite on the strip. Rather than the dark drabness of most casinos – which can make one feel a bit claustrophobic – the Encore is bright with high white ceilings; cool red chandeliers; and richly-colored, upholstered walls. My favorite poker rooms, though, are the Wynn and the Venetian. Both have top-notch dealers, complimentary drinks with many top-shelf liquors (if requested), and over a dozen flat screen TV’s, etc… We also liked Dal Toro for breakfast. It’s at the Palazzo, with outside seating and good eggs benedict – they use toasted sourdough and some parmesan cheese, which is a nice twist. We didn’t like the buffet at Beliggio, though. The food was just okay and the ambience is that of a Denny’s. It may be worth the $15 on weekdays, but not the $25ish on weekends. If you want to do a buffet, I recommend paying the extra few dollars and going to the Wynn. Happy Travels, Jason

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, helpful staff, wrong location.... a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: mic_sam
Reviews.Content: THe hotel is pretty much brand new. Take a strip view on an upper floor if you stay there. The hotel is very overpriced when it comes to food and general expenses, with an unfortunate useless resort fee. We didn't even get the bottles of water and coffees!!!! Anyway not a bit deal. In the past, I stayed at the Wynn, Bellagio, Monte carlo ( to avoid) and I don't think I will stay at the Trump again du to the location. The only good point is the fact that there's no casino in it. I recommend it for about 100$ a night. not more

Reviews.Title: “Not A True Suite”
Reviews.Author: tripdude99
Reviews.Content: Pros Fast Elevator Walk To Strip Not As Bad As I Read (Only 5 Min, Sidewalk On One Side The Whole Way) Hot Water Good For Us, But Other Person Had No Water Huge Bathroom Across From Mall (Closes At 9) Good Fitness Facility W Free Water Free Bottles Of Water Parking Was Fast (0 Min To Pick Up) & Easy, But We Were There During The Week & It Wasn't Busy Cons Not A True Suite-Only 1 Room And Not That Big No Free Upgrdes Even Though We Were There During An Unbusy Time Jerk At Front Desk Guy Came W Towels Before Housekeeping-Why? To Take Tip? Tv Remote Didn'T Work Well No Rooms W 2 Beds - Pullout Not Comfortable Ran Out Of Tp Even Though Hosuekeeping Had Come & We Left Tip-Must Ask For Everything Train Loud-Bring White Noise Tub Was Dirty Tips See Mac King At 3Pm - Harrah's - Excellent Mystere Is Aweful-Too Endrogenous Auto Collection At Imperial Palace Is Free-Search Web For Coupon

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel... overall great deal!”
Reviews.Author: amsters
Reviews.Content: I got our room off of Orbitz - an awesome deal of $139 per night with a strip view upgrade and a $50 food & beverage credit. My boyfriend and I went to Vegas for a post Vday celebration and had a FAB time in Trump (and Vegas). The room we got was HUGE and gorgeous. The bath tub was great (w/ a gorgeous view) and the TV embedded into the mirror was a fun feature. The clerk who checked us in happened to be the same guy that checked us out - he was very nice and professional. Overall, it was a great stay, great deal... even though you had to pay the $15 resort fee (which many hotels do this, not so much in Vegas, but many do) , it was one of my most pleasant stays.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel lacking quality service, and far from The Strip, with a wonderful spa.”
Reviews.Author: wasmnowh
Reviews.Content: There is no way for me to find fault with the look of this gorgeous hotel. The lobby, bar, and restaurant are over-the-top and well decorated. The rooms are spacious, and the bathrooms are massive and exquisite. It is just a lovely place to stay. The spa is relaxing and the service AT THE SPA is stellar. I had a wonderful, relaxing massage. My host was very polite. My facial made my skin glow. I did have a pedi, which was adequate enough. The extra little touches found at the spa seem to be missing from the salon. I had the breakfast buffet in the restaurant each morning, and the food was very good: omelettes to order, thick bacon, ripe fruit, and happy pancakes. The service was not even close to 5-star. There was a LINE to check in. Hire more desk staff, PLEASE. The waitress at the bar was awful - it took SO LONG to get each of our rounds it was laughable. Now, they staff was not rude at all. They spoke to us politely. They just weren't good at their jobs. There is a $15 resort fee. They really need to just add $15 to the price of the rooms, and stop lying to people about the fee. It's not like it's an optional fee, so in my mind it's just a way to force you to pay more for your room than you agreed to at reservation. It does not pay for anything. You have to pay $22 a day to use the facilities and you have to pay for parking. A half bottle of water does not cost $15. I never received a newspaper, which is another item they claim the "fee" pays for. I would be less upset about the "resort" fee if I wasn't treated like an idiot by being lied to about it's purpose. Let's also be honest about the fact that a 5-star hotel is supposed to include these things, not charge extra for them. Lastly, this hotel is far removed from the strip. I know that you have to take cabs everywhere in Vegas, but sometimes it's nice to look out and see the goings on - or step outside and walk the strip a bit. You certainly can't do that from The Trump. All in all, I would choose another hotel despite this one's beauty, because of the resort fee - service issues and the location would reaffirm my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, But....”
Reviews.Author: roccoz18
Reviews.Content: The Trump is an excellent choice in LV. It's luxurious and quiet (no casino) but close to all the action. Great views from all the rooms.The only problem is the freight train that passes by on the west side of the hotel. At exactly 4:45AM each day, I was awakened by the blast of a steam whistle from the train. Then, I waited for each of the cars to pass by (clickety-clack.) Then when I was back asleep, another train came by at 6:00AM. The train noise coupled with the traffic noise (I had a great view of the highways and the Erotic Heritage Museum) made for difficult sleeping. So, luxury does have some drawbacks. The Trump is a bargain, however, for the type of quality room you get; marble tiling & high-end furnishings. It is also the only hotel that charges for parking in LV, how cheap can you be? Get your room on the east side!

Reviews.Title: “You have to want to walk if you stay here”
Reviews.Author: koshershrimp
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful. Rooms are huge and well appointed- even have a mini kitchen. Bathrooms are immense. Views of the mountains are wonderful - however, the hotel is not on the strip. In order to get to the strip, you have to walk through the entire fashion mall or down streets with no sidewalks- I would not advise walking the street to the Trump at night. Going through the fashion mall is possible until 10 p.m. Cabs are expensive in Vegas and you will have to take a cab back to the Trump at night. We usually walked the 3 blocks to the Strip every morning and took "The Deuce'". The Deuce is the bus that goes up and down the strip all day and late into the night. Your best deal is buying the all day pass for $7 pp and you can use it as much as you want in 24 hours. If you're there more than 2 days, the 3 day pass is $15, and again, you can ride the strip from Fremont Street all the down to the Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “What a great trip!”
Reviews.Author: schatzibear
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotwire and got an awesome deal on it. When we got to the suite we were really impressed with the size of it. Suite has a kitchen area, dining area, good sized living area with a queen bed pull out, 2 bathrooms and a good sized bedroom! Service was also great. They let us have a late checkout of 5pm which is pretty much unheard of anywhere else! Only complaint is that it is a bit of a trek to get to the hotel from the main strip but it is beside the fashion show mall which was convenient in itself. All in all a great place to stay and we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for $89 plus $15 resort fee”
Reviews.Author: emannh
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 10 day stay at the Trump: Overall the hotel is clean and comfortable with rooms that are well designed. My business partner had a one bedroom suite which has a complete kitchen with Wolf Stove top, Sub Zero Fridge and Wolf oven. The room also has a table that seats 4 and an “L” shaped sectional. My studio had a kitchenette with a small Sub Zero and a two burner Wolf top and a comfortable seating area. The rooms connect via a common entrance which is nice so you can open up both rooms and still maintain your privacy. Some negative things people should be aware of before booking: 1. The hotel does not disclose a $15 per day “resort fee” 2. Internet access is $11.99 per day 3. Phone access via the hotel land line has a connection charge of $12 for the first minute, plus a huge per minute fee. The rates are not disclosed in the room. After a few words with management they did remove the near $100 charge. 4. Hotel staff does not obey the “do not disturb” sign, I was awoken several times. 5. In Suite Dining (room service) overprice and poor food quality and taste. 6. Only one restaurant and bar, no Casino 7. Not enough staff for check in/out 8. TRAIN which blows its horn 4-5 times per night, my room was facing Industrial Ave and the Love Boutique. Overall it is an incredible value for $89 per night plus the $15 resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Service Lacking”
Reviews.Author: sixpersonfamily
Reviews.Content: The one bedroom suite is great. The hotel is very clean and staff very courteous. Service was poor. We checked in and were the only ones checking in. When we checked in and they took our baggage, it took nearly an hour to get our baggage to our room. Even after calling, it still took 20 minutes. Ordered chocolate cake and cheesecake for dessert and it took 45 minutes. 1st day it took running the shower 20 minutes to get any hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Incredible! Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: trintrav
Reviews.Content: We booked on Priceline, and honestly, I was hoping for Venetian, and got the Trump. I was worried at first after reviewing the other comments but thought at 79.00 a night, how bad can it be? We checked in and the staff was friendly and very efficient. I've heard of the $20 trick, but thought Id skip it. The clerk asked me if the "studio suite" was acceptable to me, and I told him that we were there to celebrate my wife's birthday, and his reply was that he would "take good care of me". We were given a room on the 48th floor and when we got the the suite, we were amazed on how nice it was. It was a corner room, and had a bedroom, living room, and full kitchen with high end appliances. There was hi def tvs in the living room and bedroom, and even a tv in the incredibly huge bathroom. A nice deep whirlpool tub with huge windows overlooking the Strip. We had a 180 degree view of both the north and south strip. The suite was immaculate, and by far, the largest suite we have ever had the pleasure of staying in, and we are frequent travelers. The rest of the hotel was very nice with an incredible rose scent throughout the public areas. What a nice expenience. I didnt mind paying the 15.00 per day charge for valet parking, resort fee, etc, especially considering I knew of this in advance, and also considering the upgrade we received. We had a car, so we often used the valet. I would always call down, and my car was always ready by the time we got downstairs. Never heard the train...not even once This short two day stay was an incredible experience. I would gladly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in the Trump”
Reviews.Author: JDBROWNSUGA
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas with one of my girls to celebrate my 29th birthday! I’m a frequent traveler to Vegas and enjoy the excitement of the city. Even though I am not a gambler, I like the entertainment that casinos offer. The Trump Hotel doesn’t have a casino so there livelihood of the hotel is suffering. But the positive to that is not having to navigate your way through the casino to make it back to the room after a long night out. The lobby is attractive and smells wonderful. As others have stated, there is a $15/day resort fee for the use of the pool, workout facilities, etc. I did not use those amenities but still had to pay for them, which was ok by me but I would have preferred for this charge to be included in the cost of the room and not a surprise when I check in. The room, a one-bedroom suite was nice and cozy. The kitchenette was convenient and the bathroom was huge. I expected any room I got in Vegas to have a choice of one king or two queen/double beds but Trump’s one bedroom suites only come with one queen bed and a pullout sofa. Needless to say this was a little disappointing for me and my guest but since I got my room through Priceline, there was nothing we could do about it. Another disappointment was the noise of the train and its loud horn. It comes through around 1 am, 4 am, and throughout the day. Making your way to the strip is not as convenient as other properties. You can go through the Fashion Show Mall instead of walking down the partial sidewalk or take a taxi. A taxi ride to Caesar’s Palace (Forum Shops) is about $10. There is no self parking but you can easily park across the street in the Nordstrom’s, but unexpected for a 5 star hotel. The staff was ok for the most part. One evening my guest forgot her key to the room and the security would not let her up. They told her they always have someone to check the guests who use the elevators to ensure they are guests of the hotel. Strange, we were there Thur-Sun and that was the one and only time we saw anyone checking for room keys. The only onsite restaurant, DJ T, was ok. There are much better places on the strip to eat. Trying to get a taxi, don’t rely on the hotel staff. We were not ready for the maid service when they came Saturday to clean the room. You’re instructed put the housekeeping light on once maid service can come back. We did so at 1pm and left the room to go shopping. We returned at 5pm and the room was still not cleaned. At 6pm we called in a complaint and requested towels to be brought up. That never happened. We showered again and left the room at 8:30pm with the maid service indicator still on. We arrived back to the hotel @ 3:30am and our rooms keys would not work. We tried to use the phones in the hall to have staff come bring us new keys but the phones did not work so we had to go downstairs to get them. At this point I was very disappointed in the Trump and expressed my concerns to the manager. He offered to upgrade our room but we were checking out in a few hours so there was no point. The only other thing they offered was to waive the $15/day resort fee. The last disappointment I encountered was an e-mailed reservation confirmation for another night at the Trump Hotel and the charge for $99 plus tax! I was shocked since I paid for my stay Thur-Sun on Priceline. I called the hotel, spoke with management and they refunded my cc for the charge of the extra reservation. Needless to say, I will not be returning to the Trump Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing For Vegas Lover”
Reviews.Author: EpicureanFunTraveler
Reviews.Content: I often tell my friends to be cautious with reviews as most people only take time to review bad experiences and not good experiences. I have done both, but I travel for pleasure so much that I couldn't review all of my wonderful or marginal experiences. I am taking time to write this review to warm other travelers to Vegas of the disappointment they may experience staying at this inappropriately labeled 5 star hotel in a city with many more better choices. I suggest this hotel for business travelers who are habitual gamblers and must stay away from casino hotels. It is also good for couples or individuals who dislike Vegas and are forced to visit the city and wish to remain alienated from the cities energy. I travel to Vegas about 6 to 8 times a year. I am not a big gambler, but enjoy the energy of the city as well as the restaurants, shows and night life. I have stayed at most of the 4 and 5 star hotels up and down the strip and was anxious to experience the Trump. It was a total disappointment from the moment I walked through the door. When I arrived at 11pm the hotel was dead. There was no one at the bar, in the lobby and most importantly, there was no one to check me in. I walked around the corner behind the podium and announced myself in hopes someone would be in the back room. There was no one. I walked outside and asked the bellman if there was anyone working the front desk. Finally, after about 10 minutes (or more) someone showed up. I was check in and told about the $15 resort fee. I know this has been covered by other reviewers so any guest should be prepared. Resort fees, however, are a sore subject for me as I find them deceptive ways to make additional revenue without fully disclosing the charges to customers when booking a reservation. I can only hope one day that legislatures take note of this fraudulent charge and make all 'resort fees' illegal. I loath that I am charged a fee that covers parking a car when I arrived by taxi and that is not the norm for any other hotel in Vegas. The fee also covered things for which I never use like the newspaper (I use the Internet), coffee (no thanks), pool (it was empty and being repaired), and bottled water (I can pick this up at the mall for a fraction of the fee). Scam. More importantly, the hotel is not on the strip and currently inconvenient for walking to the strip except during daylight hours. If you are unfortunate to be caught staying at this hotel and are reading the review I suggest that you use the mall to transverse the walk to the strip. If you cross the street and turn left you can take the walk into the parking garage and then enter the mall from the doors on the left underground. Then, walk straight ahead and you can get to the strip. At night, forget it. Once the mall is closed walking back to the hotel appeared dangerous because of a lack of sidewalks and lighting. There are so many wonderful restaurants on the strip that I never did try lunch or dinner at the hotel. I did think it was important to give it a try for breakfast. What a disappointment. The day I was there I was the only one in the small part of the restaurant that is cordoned off for breakfast service. I felt like I was staying at an old hotel that had to create a place to serve guests breakfast. Then, the prices were a little high for my independent traveling budget. Okay, I am complaining about money twice in this posting and I am the first to dislike other postings that focus on cost and not the experience. If you have a beverage (coffee, tea or soda), orange juice, oatmeal and a bread you will pay more than $30. I know Vegas is expensive these days, but this place doesn't offer atmosphere or a unique dining experience. At least the nearby Wynn and Palazzo have places with style and excitement for breakfast. The hotel looks like a designers potpourri from a gaudy classless Greek lobby to a lifeless neoclassical elevator area to a modern dysfunctional hotel room. It appears to me that no one could agree on one cohesive look and feel for the property. The hotel room would be impressive in New York, but it is less impressive than competing hotel rooms at the Venetian, Palazzo, Wynn, The Hotel and others on the strip. On one trip to Vegas I sampled The Signature hotel which is a condominium complex connected to the MGM via a long, and I mean very long, covered walkway. The Trump isn't connected to anything. You are forced to rely on taxis, driving or walking to get to any activity besides watching the car valet or lone bartender organizing his bottles. I would guess that very few of the guests return to this hotel after their first stay. I talked with a couple of other people who were staying at the hotel and disappointed ruled. One can only feel sorry for the investors who purchased rooms at this property as an investment. At night, if you want turn down service you need to call housekeeping and put in your request. If you don't request the service it wont happen automatically. I find this to be the case with many hotels. I find it inconvenient to remember to make that call every evening before going out. Over the course of my stay I did think that the service people were friendly and tried to help. But, there is more to life in Vegas than just good service.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the great deal”
Reviews.Author: Chris_from_Stoon
Reviews.Content: As with a number of other reviewers, we got a deal on priceline at this place for $85 and were pretty excited about it. Clearly Trump is trying to lure guests to this remote and mostly empty hotel and then backloading the price with additional fees. The $15 'resort fee' = total scam. When asked what this was paying for, we were told "the water in your room, the coffee and access to the pool & fitness club". That's right, the water and the coffee, the same things that the super 8 provides for free. Fitness area was outstanding. Pool was closed! Could not get them to reduce the fee becuase the best of the 'resort' ammenities that we were paying for was not available. Also managed to charge me $14 for a 30 second call to Canada. Location: great access to the mall, reasonably good if you are considering going downtown, terrible for the strip. It's close to Wynn & Encore but so far from most strip resorts that you'll spend the money you saved on the room on taxis in no time. Service: excellent. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother staying here”
Reviews.Author: cmg27
Reviews.Content: $15 a day for valet parking, this is a joke. What other hotel in Vegas charges for parking? I think the $15 is a scam. If it really costs the hotel $15 for the services they claim to be providing, add it to the daily room rate. The valet service is horrible. We returned for an afternoon of shopping at the outlets and could not even pull in to the hotel entrance there were so many empty cars sitting on the drive. When I was finally able to pull in, I had to flag someone down to take my keys and give me a ticket. Going out Saturday night was worse. The cars were still backed up on the drive. It took 45 minutes for the valet to pull our car up, and he had a nerve to look at me for a tip. The service and attitude of the people at this hotel is horrible. I will never stay again. Oh wait, don't forget the train at 4 AM in the morning, or the horrible pillows. Stay away. The one positive, the bell captain was excellent. He went out of his way to answer questions and provide recommendations for places to go and eat in the areas we were going to be in around vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, but will stay elsewhere next time.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMH
Reviews.Content: A friend and I booked a "5 Star Hotel", for $79 per night, through HotWire. Unlike some, who have done the same, and expected the Venetian, Palazzo, etc., we figured it would be the Trump. We were correct. The hotel is nice. It is clean, and certainly stands out, with it's sparkling gold color, in the sun. The rooms are nice, and certainly not a typical hotel room. I don't think, however, that the hotel warrants 5 Star status. Upon check-in, you are hit with a $15 per day fee, which is called a "resort fee", and includes use of the pool, the fitness center, and receiving a newspaper (of which you have several choices), in your room, each day. I do not agree with this fee, especially since it is hidden until check-in. Most 5 Star hotels include such services, for no additional charge. I was disappointed at being charged this fee, after not receiving the newspaper during our first day, and finding that the pool was drained, and down for maintenance. How do you charge someone for "use of the pool", knowing that the pool is drained, and down for maintenance. The hotel is noisy, at night, due to the train, and I believe, also, the monorail, which is probably the "whistling" noise that some describe. The train and monorail run late at night, and early in the morning. If you are not a hard sleeper, it may cause you issues getting to sleep. The location of Trump, is not really on the strip, even though it is advertised, on HotWire, as being "central strip". It is a good 5-7 minute walk, to get to the strip. It also involved a walk down a side road, with no sidewalk, which can be dangerous, considering there is traffic, especially at night. Not safe for anybody, especially children. We had no problems with room service. Our room was cleaned both days, of our stay. The bar at the Trump has a very nice staff, and great drinks. Definately try it out. We did not try the restauraunt, but the menu is limited, and pricy. It also isn't a menu that would appeal to children, if you stay with children at the Trump. We had no problems with the staff, but our check-in, and check-out was a bit cold. We were not met with a very "welcoming", and "glad you stayed with us", type of attitude. More of a, "here are your keys, this is your room", now be on your way, at check-in, and a "here is your bill, now be on your way", at check-out. Considering the "5 Star" rating, you would expect to be greeted at check-in, as though you are appreciated a little more, as well as thanked at check-out. It wasn't as though we were treated rudely, but it just wasn't a warm, welcoming attitude, that you would expect at a 5 Star hotel. In the end, I can't say I wouldn't recommend the Trump, but I think you would have a better experience, and stay, in the heart of the strip, at other hotels - where you'll actually spend less money. The last time I was in Vegas, I stayed at the Monte Carlo, which was much cheaper (especially when considering no $15 "resort fee"), and very nice, as well. It was actually, "on the strip". The Trump is also a place of residence, as many of the condo's, and rooms are actually owned by people. I think this may play a part in not getting the full "hotel" experience that one might expect. It is also, because of it being a residential building, that it doesn't have a casino. I am not a gambler, and didn't mind this. Others may enjoy this as well. For the typical Vegas traveler, however, the Trump can seem a bit removed from the typical Vegas atmosphere. In the end, I guess it all depends on what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: george5
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. There is no casino, which for us a huge plus because it did not have that pervasive smell of smoke from cigarettes you smell in all the casinos and you could not hear the constant noise of slot machines upon entry. The entrance is very elegant with lovely a lovely aromatherapy smell emanating throughout. We felt extremely secure at this hotel. We heard a number of stories whilst in town of people having been robbed in their hotel rooms or drugged and ended up in their hotel rooms. The staff ask for proof you are staying at the hotel before allowing you up the elevators. The room was beautiful with every amenity you could wish for. We had a full kitchen, which we didn't need but it was wonderful to be able to put wine or beer in the fridge and have proper bowls to serve snacks in while we relaxed in the evening before seeing a show. The hotel is so close to everything you want to be near. The view from the room was spectacular. We did not have to be out all the time in order to enjoy the nightlife of the strip we could see it from the window. There is only one criticism I could possible mention and the Trump Organization could not be held accountable for it, but it is a shame that there is no proper pavement from the hotel during the short walk to Las Vegas Boulevard. When we return to Las Vegas we will definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Samandfred
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July...thought being Trump that we could expect a quality experience, but sadly, so far from the truth. It starts with the additional fees for parking - it is ONLY valet and they charge you about $17 extra, per day. Although the valet guys were nice enough, it was sometimes quite a wait. The pool hours are ever changing and are not accurately reflected in the hotels' information book (when asked about this - they said the book was outdated - which is hard to beleive since this hotel only opened 3 months prior to our arrival). One night when arriving back to the hotel, it appeared as though someone had used our toilet and clogged it!!!! This was reported and security came to check it out. The same night, our extra pillows were missing and it took OVER 2 hours to get the pillows, after a snarky reply from the front desk that we should check the cupboards (this was our 6th day here - we certainly knew where the extra pillows were). The day we were checking out, we had requested a LATE check out - security came banging on the door (ignoring the do not disturb sign) at about 9am to have us fill out a form about the toilet complaint!!! A bit later, now up and getting ready to leave - SOME RANDOM GUY WALKED INTO THE ROOM, apparently checking in, however I was in the bathroom changing at the time.......Hotel security and front desk staff said it must have been a mistake when they gave someone the key to our room before we had checked out!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Although some nice flash....this is all it is. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!!! Stay somewhere, where they know it vegas an treat you accordingly!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you can wait 45 min for your car from valet”
Reviews.Author: dpyang
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Trump Vegas during Christmas. Hotel doesn't have self parking, so you need to valet ($15 per day). No problem with that. But, you need to wait 45 minutes to get your car back. That is not okay. Not many bell men are available too; need to get my own luggage to my room. So much for a 5-star hotel. The morning we left, there were over 100 people waiting in the lobby to get their cars. So, be careful if you have a flight to catch. Better off park across street (Nordstrom) if you are going in and out. Can’t find any onsite management to discuss the issue.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, but still working on some service issues.”
Reviews.Author: MCHCA
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying we were completely thrilled with this hotel. I was not sure how I would feel about staying in Vegas in a hotel without a casino but thought I'd give it a try since the price was right and most hotels were booked (we were there for CES). Upon arriving we experienced the quiet sophistication of a high end hotel with out the loud slot machines, lights and cigarette smoke Vegas is known for. The check in was painless, the staff at the front desk was very polite. Going up to our room we were pleased to find we were on the 58th floor, facing the strip. This made for an absolute beautiful view at night as we could see clear from one end of the strip all the way down to Mandalay (the opposite end), it was truly a spectacular view. The room was very large, well appointed, a very comfortable bed, a couch, chairs, coffee table, desk, microwave, fridge, cooktop, blender, toaster, big closets, lots of drawers. All this and the room did not feel cramped at all. The bathroom was gorgeous, very big marble, flat screen in the mirror, enormous tub, beautiful shower. I also like the location of the hotel. It is set a bit back from the strip, yet is right across the street from Fashion Show Mall, and on the other side of the street is the Wynn, Palazzo, and Venetian. The Bellagio is a painless 1 mile walk (or 8 dollar cab ride). Anyway point being, we went to those hotels to gamble and then did not have to walk back through a casino to get to our room, or in the morning. Ok now to the service issues. Before arriving at The Trump I attempted to make use of the renowned "attache services." I was requesting they fill our fridge with beverages we wanted during our stay. I e-mailed and after a couple days heard back. I had a couple questions and she never responded back. I thought this was disappointing as it is touted as one of the highlights of the hotel. Annoying. Upon arriving to our room, our fridge had something spilled in it (yuck), and our water bottles which are supposed to be in each room (as part of the "resort fee") were not there. The gentlemen who brought our luggage checked these things and appeared very unhappy with the oversights, again he was very kind and assured us it would be taken care of, and it was. Our friends were also missing the water bottles out of their room, as well as a bathrobe. These may seem insignificant but for a hotel that really prides itself on its service, we a little surprised at the oversights. I did order room service and it came very quickly and was delicious but set my tray in the hallway to be picked up (around 3 in the afternoon) and when we left to check out the next morning it was still there. Overall the employees that we came in contact with were VERY nice and helpful, it were the ones you didn't see who seemed to not be doing their jobs. Perhaps it's a sign of the economy and they just don't have enough people on staff?

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Trump Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SR32
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate on a last minute website and were very pleased with our brief 3 night stay at the Trump in Las Vegas. We are not huge gamblers and were drawn to the fact the hotel would not be swarming with smoking gamblers. The hotel itself is pretty magical. Lots of glitter and glam. Courteous and polite hotel staff. Fantastic hotel finishes. Even better bed. Jacuzzi in the bathroom finished it off. Will definitely be returning. Only downside is its quite a long walk to get to the strip, but that wasn't really an issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good Spot”
Reviews.Author: Lanrac76
